module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ActivityResponse

-- | Provides information about an activity that was performed by a
--   campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newActivityResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ActivityResponse
ActivityResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ActivityResponse

-- | The current status of the activity. Possible values are: PENDING,
--   INITIALIZING, RUNNING, PAUSED, CANCELLED, and COMPLETED.
[$sel:state:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The actual start time, in ISO 8601 format, of the activity.
[$sel:start:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of time zones that were completed.
[$sel:timezonesCompletedCount:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The total number of unique time zones that are in the segment for the
--   campaign.
[$sel:timezonesTotalCount:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies whether the activity succeeded. Possible values are SUCCESS
--   and FAIL.
[$sel:result:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the campaign treatment that the activity
--   applies to. A treatment is a variation of a campaign that's used for
--   A/B testing of a campaign.
[$sel:treatmentId:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of endpoints that the campaign successfully delivered
--   messages to.
[$sel:successfulEndpointCount:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The actual time, in ISO 8601 format, when the activity was marked
--   CANCELLED or COMPLETED.
[$sel:end:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of endpoints that the campaign attempted to deliver
--   messages to.
[$sel:totalEndpointCount:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The scheduled start time, in ISO 8601 format, for the activity.
[$sel:scheduledStart:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the campaign that the activity applies to.
[$sel:campaignId:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the activity.
[$sel:id:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the campaign applies
--   to.
[$sel:applicationId:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ActivityResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:ActivityResponse'</a>, <a>activityResponse_state</a> -
--   The current status of the activity. Possible values are: PENDING,
--   INITIALIZING, RUNNING, PAUSED, CANCELLED, and COMPLETED.
--   
--   <a>$sel:start:ActivityResponse'</a>, <a>activityResponse_start</a> -
--   The actual start time, in ISO 8601 format, of the activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timezonesCompletedCount:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_timezonesCompletedCount</a> - The total number of
--   time zones that were completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timezonesTotalCount:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_timezonesTotalCount</a> - The total number of
--   unique time zones that are in the segment for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:result:ActivityResponse'</a>, <a>activityResponse_result</a> -
--   Specifies whether the activity succeeded. Possible values are SUCCESS
--   and FAIL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatmentId:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_treatmentId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   campaign treatment that the activity applies to. A treatment is a
--   variation of a campaign that's used for A/B testing of a campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:successfulEndpointCount:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_successfulEndpointCount</a> - The total number of
--   endpoints that the campaign successfully delivered messages to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:end:ActivityResponse'</a>, <a>activityResponse_end</a> - The
--   actual time, in ISO 8601 format, when the activity was marked
--   CANCELLED or COMPLETED.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalEndpointCount:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_totalEndpointCount</a> - The total number of
--   endpoints that the campaign attempted to deliver messages to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduledStart:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_scheduledStart</a> - The scheduled start time, in
--   ISO 8601 format, for the activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:campaignId:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_campaignId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   campaign that the activity applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ActivityResponse'</a>, <a>activityResponse_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application that the campaign applies to.
newActivityResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ActivityResponse

-- | The current status of the activity. Possible values are: PENDING,
--   INITIALIZING, RUNNING, PAUSED, CANCELLED, and COMPLETED.
activityResponse_state :: Lens' ActivityResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The actual start time, in ISO 8601 format, of the activity.
activityResponse_start :: Lens' ActivityResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of time zones that were completed.
activityResponse_timezonesCompletedCount :: Lens' ActivityResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The total number of unique time zones that are in the segment for the
--   campaign.
activityResponse_timezonesTotalCount :: Lens' ActivityResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies whether the activity succeeded. Possible values are SUCCESS
--   and FAIL.
activityResponse_result :: Lens' ActivityResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the campaign treatment that the activity
--   applies to. A treatment is a variation of a campaign that's used for
--   A/B testing of a campaign.
activityResponse_treatmentId :: Lens' ActivityResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of endpoints that the campaign successfully delivered
--   messages to.
activityResponse_successfulEndpointCount :: Lens' ActivityResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The actual time, in ISO 8601 format, when the activity was marked
--   CANCELLED or COMPLETED.
activityResponse_end :: Lens' ActivityResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of endpoints that the campaign attempted to deliver
--   messages to.
activityResponse_totalEndpointCount :: Lens' ActivityResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The scheduled start time, in ISO 8601 format, for the activity.
activityResponse_scheduledStart :: Lens' ActivityResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the campaign that the activity applies to.
activityResponse_campaignId :: Lens' ActivityResponse Text

-- | The unique identifier for the activity.
activityResponse_id :: Lens' ActivityResponse Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the campaign applies
--   to.
activityResponse_applicationId :: Lens' ActivityResponse Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ActivityResponse.ActivityResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ActivityResponse.ActivityResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ActivityResponse.ActivityResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ActivityResponse.ActivityResponse
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ActivityResponse.ActivityResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ActivityResponse.ActivityResponse
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ActivityResponse.ActivityResponse


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ActivitiesResponse

-- | Provides information about the activities that were performed by a
--   campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newActivitiesResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ActivitiesResponse
ActivitiesResponse' :: Maybe Text -> [ActivityResponse] -> ActivitiesResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
[$sel:nextToken:ActivitiesResponse'] :: ActivitiesResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of responses, one for each activity that was performed by the
--   campaign.
[$sel:item:ActivitiesResponse'] :: ActivitiesResponse -> [ActivityResponse]

-- | Create a value of <a>ActivitiesResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ActivitiesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activitiesResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use in a
--   subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated
--   response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:ActivitiesResponse'</a>, <a>activitiesResponse_item</a> -
--   An array of responses, one for each activity that was performed by the
--   campaign.
newActivitiesResponse :: ActivitiesResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
activitiesResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ActivitiesResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of responses, one for each activity that was performed by the
--   campaign.
activitiesResponse_item :: Lens' ActivitiesResponse [ActivityResponse]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ActivitiesResponse.ActivitiesResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ActivitiesResponse.ActivitiesResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ActivitiesResponse.ActivitiesResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ActivitiesResponse.ActivitiesResponse
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ActivitiesResponse.ActivitiesResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ActivitiesResponse.ActivitiesResponse
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ActivitiesResponse.ActivitiesResponse


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Alignment
newtype Alignment
Alignment' :: Text -> Alignment
[fromAlignment] :: Alignment -> Text
pattern Alignment_CENTER :: Alignment
pattern Alignment_LEFT :: Alignment
pattern Alignment_RIGHT :: Alignment
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Alignment.Alignment
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Alignment.Alignment
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Alignment.Alignment

instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Alignment.Alignment
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Alignment.Alignment

instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Alignment.Alignment

instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Alignment.Alignment
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Alignment.Alignment

instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Alignment.Alignment
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Alignment.Alignment
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Alignment.Alignment
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Alignment.Alignment
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Alignment.Alignment


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AndroidPushNotificationTemplate

-- | Specifies channel-specific content and settings for a message template
--   that can be used in push notifications that are sent through the ADM
--   (Amazon Device Messaging), Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push), or GCM (Firebase
--   Cloud Messaging, formerly Google Cloud Messaging) channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAndroidPushNotificationTemplate</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AndroidPushNotificationTemplate
AndroidPushNotificationTemplate' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AndroidPushNotificationTemplate

-- | The URL of the large icon image to display in the content view of a
--   push notification that's based on the message template.
[$sel:imageIconUrl:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'] :: AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for a push
--   notification that's based on the message template. If specified, this
--   value overrides all other content for the message template.
[$sel:rawContent:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'] :: AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL of the small icon image to display in the status bar and the
--   content view of a push notification that's based on the message
--   template.
[$sel:smallImageIconUrl:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'] :: AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The message body to use in a push notification that's based on the
--   message template.
[$sel:body:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'] :: AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message
--   template and the value of the Action property is URL.
[$sel:url:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'] :: AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The sound to play when a recipient receives a push notification that's
--   based on the message template. You can use the default stream or
--   specify the file name of a sound resource that's bundled in your app.
--   On an Android platform, the sound file must reside in /res/raw/.
[$sel:sound:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'] :: AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The action to occur if a recipient taps a push notification that's
--   based on the message template. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of
--   the Android platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:action:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'] :: AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Action

-- | The URL of an image to display in a push notification that's based on
--   the message template.
[$sel:imageUrl:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'] :: AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The title to use in a push notification that's based on the message
--   template. This title appears above the notification message on a
--   recipient's device.
[$sel:title:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'] :: AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AndroidPushNotificationTemplate</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageIconUrl:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>androidPushNotificationTemplate_imageIconUrl</a> - The URL of the
--   large icon image to display in the content view of a push notification
--   that's based on the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawContent:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>androidPushNotificationTemplate_rawContent</a> - The raw,
--   JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for a push notification
--   that's based on the message template. If specified, this value
--   overrides all other content for the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:smallImageIconUrl:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>androidPushNotificationTemplate_smallImageIconUrl</a> - The URL of
--   the small icon image to display in the status bar and the content view
--   of a push notification that's based on the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>androidPushNotificationTemplate_body</a> - The message body to use
--   in a push notification that's based on the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>androidPushNotificationTemplate_url</a> - The URL to open in a
--   recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps a push
--   notification that's based on the message template and the value of the
--   Action property is URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sound:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>androidPushNotificationTemplate_sound</a> - The sound to play when
--   a recipient receives a push notification that's based on the message
--   template. You can use the default stream or specify the file name of a
--   sound resource that's bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the
--   sound file must reside in /res/raw/.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>androidPushNotificationTemplate_action</a> - The action to occur if
--   a recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message
--   template. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of
--   the Android platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageUrl:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>androidPushNotificationTemplate_imageUrl</a> - The URL of an image
--   to display in a push notification that's based on the message
--   template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>androidPushNotificationTemplate_title</a> - The title to use in a
--   push notification that's based on the message template. This title
--   appears above the notification message on a recipient's device.
newAndroidPushNotificationTemplate :: AndroidPushNotificationTemplate

-- | The URL of the large icon image to display in the content view of a
--   push notification that's based on the message template.
androidPushNotificationTemplate_imageIconUrl :: Lens' AndroidPushNotificationTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for a push
--   notification that's based on the message template. If specified, this
--   value overrides all other content for the message template.
androidPushNotificationTemplate_rawContent :: Lens' AndroidPushNotificationTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL of the small icon image to display in the status bar and the
--   content view of a push notification that's based on the message
--   template.
androidPushNotificationTemplate_smallImageIconUrl :: Lens' AndroidPushNotificationTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The message body to use in a push notification that's based on the
--   message template.
androidPushNotificationTemplate_body :: Lens' AndroidPushNotificationTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message
--   template and the value of the Action property is URL.
androidPushNotificationTemplate_url :: Lens' AndroidPushNotificationTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The sound to play when a recipient receives a push notification that's
--   based on the message template. You can use the default stream or
--   specify the file name of a sound resource that's bundled in your app.
--   On an Android platform, the sound file must reside in /res/raw/.
androidPushNotificationTemplate_sound :: Lens' AndroidPushNotificationTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The action to occur if a recipient taps a push notification that's
--   based on the message template. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of
--   the Android platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
androidPushNotificationTemplate_action :: Lens' AndroidPushNotificationTemplate (Maybe Action)

-- | The URL of an image to display in a push notification that's based on
--   the message template.
androidPushNotificationTemplate_imageUrl :: Lens' AndroidPushNotificationTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The title to use in a push notification that's based on the message
--   template. This title appears above the notification message on a
--   recipient's device.
androidPushNotificationTemplate_title :: Lens' AndroidPushNotificationTemplate (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AndroidPushNotificationTemplate.AndroidPushNotificationTemplate
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AndroidPushNotificationTemplate.AndroidPushNotificationTemplate
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AndroidPushNotificationTemplate.AndroidPushNotificationTemplate
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AndroidPushNotificationTemplate.AndroidPushNotificationTemplate
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AndroidPushNotificationTemplate.AndroidPushNotificationTemplate
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AndroidPushNotificationTemplate.AndroidPushNotificationTemplate
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AndroidPushNotificationTemplate.AndroidPushNotificationTemplate
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AndroidPushNotificationTemplate.AndroidPushNotificationTemplate


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationResponse

-- | Provides information about an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newApplicationResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ApplicationResponse
ApplicationResponse' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ApplicationResponse

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags
--   that are associated with the application. Each tag consists of a
--   required tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:ApplicationResponse'] :: ApplicationResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is
--   displayed as the <b>Project ID</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
[$sel:id:ApplicationResponse'] :: ApplicationResponse -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application.
[$sel:arn:ApplicationResponse'] :: ApplicationResponse -> Text

-- | The display name of the application. This name is displayed as the
--   <b>Project name</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
[$sel:name:ApplicationResponse'] :: ApplicationResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ApplicationResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:ApplicationResponse'</a>, <a>applicationResponse_tags</a>
--   - A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags
--   that are associated with the application. Each tag consists of a
--   required tag key and an associated tag value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ApplicationResponse'</a>, <a>applicationResponse_id</a> -
--   The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is
--   displayed as the <b>Project ID</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:ApplicationResponse'</a>, <a>applicationResponse_arn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ApplicationResponse'</a>, <a>applicationResponse_name</a>
--   - The display name of the application. This name is displayed as the
--   <b>Project name</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
newApplicationResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ApplicationResponse

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags
--   that are associated with the application. Each tag consists of a
--   required tag key and an associated tag value.
applicationResponse_tags :: Lens' ApplicationResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is
--   displayed as the <b>Project ID</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
applicationResponse_id :: Lens' ApplicationResponse Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application.
applicationResponse_arn :: Lens' ApplicationResponse Text

-- | The display name of the application. This name is displayed as the
--   <b>Project name</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
applicationResponse_name :: Lens' ApplicationResponse Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationResponse.ApplicationResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationResponse.ApplicationResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationResponse.ApplicationResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationResponse.ApplicationResponse
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationResponse.ApplicationResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationResponse.ApplicationResponse
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationResponse.ApplicationResponse


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationsResponse

-- | Provides information about all of your applications.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newApplicationsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ApplicationsResponse
ApplicationsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [ApplicationResponse] -> ApplicationsResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
[$sel:nextToken:ApplicationsResponse'] :: ApplicationsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of responses, one for each application that was returned.
[$sel:item:ApplicationsResponse'] :: ApplicationsResponse -> Maybe [ApplicationResponse]

-- | Create a value of <a>ApplicationsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ApplicationsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>applicationsResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use in a
--   subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated
--   response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:ApplicationsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>applicationsResponse_item</a> - An array of responses, one for each
--   application that was returned.
newApplicationsResponse :: ApplicationsResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
applicationsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ApplicationsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of responses, one for each application that was returned.
applicationsResponse_item :: Lens' ApplicationsResponse (Maybe [ApplicationResponse])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationsResponse.ApplicationsResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationsResponse.ApplicationsResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationsResponse.ApplicationsResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationsResponse.ApplicationsResponse
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationsResponse.ApplicationsResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationsResponse.ApplicationsResponse
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationsResponse.ApplicationsResponse

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AttributeDimension

-- | Specifies attribute-based criteria for including or excluding
--   endpoints from a segment.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttributeDimension</a> smart constructor.
data AttributeDimension
AttributeDimension' :: Maybe AttributeType -> [Text] -> AttributeDimension

-- | The type of segment dimension to use. Valid values are:
--   
--   INCLUSIVE - endpoints that have attributes matching the values are
--   included in the segment.
--   
--   EXCLUSIVE - endpoints that have attributes matching the values are
--   excluded in the segment.
--   
--   CONTAINS - endpoints that have attributes' substrings match the values
--   are included in the segment.
--   
--   BEFORE - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes
--   before the value are included in the segment.
--   
--   AFTER - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes after
--   the value are included in the segment.
--   
--   ON - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT dates on the value
--   are included in the segment. Time is ignored in this comparison.
--   
--   BETWEEN - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes
--   between the values are included in the segment.
[$sel:attributeType:AttributeDimension'] :: AttributeDimension -> Maybe AttributeType

-- | The criteria values to use for the segment dimension. Depending on the
--   value of the AttributeType property, endpoints are included or
--   excluded from the segment if their attribute values match the criteria
--   values.
[$sel:values:AttributeDimension'] :: AttributeDimension -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>AttributeDimension</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeType:AttributeDimension'</a>,
--   <a>attributeDimension_attributeType</a> - The type of segment
--   dimension to use. Valid values are:
--   
--   INCLUSIVE - endpoints that have attributes matching the values are
--   included in the segment.
--   
--   EXCLUSIVE - endpoints that have attributes matching the values are
--   excluded in the segment.
--   
--   CONTAINS - endpoints that have attributes' substrings match the values
--   are included in the segment.
--   
--   BEFORE - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes
--   before the value are included in the segment.
--   
--   AFTER - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes after
--   the value are included in the segment.
--   
--   ON - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT dates on the value
--   are included in the segment. Time is ignored in this comparison.
--   
--   BETWEEN - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes
--   between the values are included in the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:AttributeDimension'</a>,
--   <a>attributeDimension_values</a> - The criteria values to use for the
--   segment dimension. Depending on the value of the AttributeType
--   property, endpoints are included or excluded from the segment if their
--   attribute values match the criteria values.
newAttributeDimension :: AttributeDimension

-- | The type of segment dimension to use. Valid values are:
--   
--   INCLUSIVE - endpoints that have attributes matching the values are
--   included in the segment.
--   
--   EXCLUSIVE - endpoints that have attributes matching the values are
--   excluded in the segment.
--   
--   CONTAINS - endpoints that have attributes' substrings match the values
--   are included in the segment.
--   
--   BEFORE - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes
--   before the value are included in the segment.
--   
--   AFTER - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes after
--   the value are included in the segment.
--   
--   ON - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT dates on the value
--   are included in the segment. Time is ignored in this comparison.
--   
--   BETWEEN - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes
--   between the values are included in the segment.
attributeDimension_attributeType :: Lens' AttributeDimension (Maybe AttributeType)

-- | The criteria values to use for the segment dimension. Depending on the
--   value of the AttributeType property, endpoints are included or
--   excluded from the segment if their attribute values match the criteria
--   values.
attributeDimension_values :: Lens' AttributeDimension [Text]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AttributeDimension.AttributeDimension
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AttributeDimension.AttributeDimension
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AttributeDimension.AttributeDimension
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AttributeDimension.AttributeDimension
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AttributeDimension.AttributeDimension
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AttributeDimension.AttributeDimension
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AttributeDimension.AttributeDimension
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AttributeDimension.AttributeDimension


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AttributesResource

-- | Provides information about the type and the names of attributes that
--   were removed from all the endpoints that are associated with an
--   application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttributesResource</a> smart constructor.
data AttributesResource
AttributesResource' :: Maybe [Text] -> Text -> Text -> AttributesResource

-- | An array that specifies the names of the attributes that were removed
--   from the endpoints.
[$sel:attributes:AttributesResource'] :: AttributesResource -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The type of attribute or attributes that were removed from the
--   endpoints. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>endpoint-custom-attributes - Custom attributes that describe
--   endpoints.</li>
--   <li>endpoint-metric-attributes - Custom metrics that your app reports
--   to Amazon Pinpoint for endpoints.</li>
--   <li>endpoint-user-attributes - Custom attributes that describe
--   users.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:attributeType:AttributesResource'] :: AttributesResource -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application.
[$sel:applicationId:AttributesResource'] :: AttributesResource -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AttributesResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:AttributesResource'</a>,
--   <a>attributesResource_attributes</a> - An array that specifies the
--   names of the attributes that were removed from the endpoints.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeType:AttributesResource'</a>,
--   <a>attributesResource_attributeType</a> - The type of attribute or
--   attributes that were removed from the endpoints. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>endpoint-custom-attributes - Custom attributes that describe
--   endpoints.</li>
--   <li>endpoint-metric-attributes - Custom metrics that your app reports
--   to Amazon Pinpoint for endpoints.</li>
--   <li>endpoint-user-attributes - Custom attributes that describe
--   users.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:AttributesResource'</a>,
--   <a>attributesResource_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the application.
newAttributesResource :: Text -> Text -> AttributesResource

-- | An array that specifies the names of the attributes that were removed
--   from the endpoints.
attributesResource_attributes :: Lens' AttributesResource (Maybe [Text])

-- | The type of attribute or attributes that were removed from the
--   endpoints. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>endpoint-custom-attributes - Custom attributes that describe
--   endpoints.</li>
--   <li>endpoint-metric-attributes - Custom metrics that your app reports
--   to Amazon Pinpoint for endpoints.</li>
--   <li>endpoint-user-attributes - Custom attributes that describe
--   users.</li>
--   </ul>
attributesResource_attributeType :: Lens' AttributesResource Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application.
attributesResource_applicationId :: Lens' AttributesResource Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AttributesResource.AttributesResource
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AttributesResource.AttributesResource
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AttributesResource.AttributesResource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AttributesResource.AttributesResource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AttributesResource.AttributesResource
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AttributesResource.AttributesResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AttributesResource.AttributesResource


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaiduChannelRequest

-- | Specifies the status and settings of the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push)
--   channel for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBaiduChannelRequest</a> smart constructor.
data BaiduChannelRequest
BaiduChannelRequest' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> Text -> BaiduChannelRequest

-- | Specifies whether to enable the Baidu channel for the application.
[$sel:enabled:BaiduChannelRequest'] :: BaiduChannelRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | The secret key that you received from the Baidu Cloud Push service to
--   communicate with the service.
[$sel:secretKey:BaiduChannelRequest'] :: BaiduChannelRequest -> Text

-- | The API key that you received from the Baidu Cloud Push service to
--   communicate with the service.
[$sel:apiKey:BaiduChannelRequest'] :: BaiduChannelRequest -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BaiduChannelRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:BaiduChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelRequest_enabled</a> - Specifies whether to enable the
--   Baidu channel for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretKey:BaiduChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelRequest_secretKey</a> - The secret key that you
--   received from the Baidu Cloud Push service to communicate with the
--   service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:apiKey:BaiduChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelRequest_apiKey</a> - The API key that you received from
--   the Baidu Cloud Push service to communicate with the service.
newBaiduChannelRequest :: Text -> Text -> BaiduChannelRequest

-- | Specifies whether to enable the Baidu channel for the application.
baiduChannelRequest_enabled :: Lens' BaiduChannelRequest (Maybe Bool)

-- | The secret key that you received from the Baidu Cloud Push service to
--   communicate with the service.
baiduChannelRequest_secretKey :: Lens' BaiduChannelRequest Text

-- | The API key that you received from the Baidu Cloud Push service to
--   communicate with the service.
baiduChannelRequest_apiKey :: Lens' BaiduChannelRequest Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaiduChannelRequest.BaiduChannelRequest
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaiduChannelRequest.BaiduChannelRequest
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaiduChannelRequest.BaiduChannelRequest
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaiduChannelRequest.BaiduChannelRequest
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaiduChannelRequest.BaiduChannelRequest

instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaiduChannelRequest.BaiduChannelRequest


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaiduChannelResponse

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of the Baidu (Baidu
--   Cloud Push) channel for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBaiduChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data BaiduChannelResponse
BaiduChannelResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> Text -> BaiduChannelResponse

-- | The date and time when the Baidu channel was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:BaiduChannelResponse'] :: BaiduChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the Baidu channel is enabled for the application.
[$sel:enabled:BaiduChannelResponse'] :: BaiduChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether the Baidu channel is archived.
[$sel:isArchived:BaiduChannelResponse'] :: BaiduChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the Baidu channel
--   applies to.
[$sel:applicationId:BaiduChannelResponse'] :: BaiduChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The current version of the Baidu channel.
[$sel:version:BaiduChannelResponse'] :: BaiduChannelResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the Baidu channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:id:BaiduChannelResponse'] :: BaiduChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time when the Baidu channel was enabled.
[$sel:creationDate:BaiduChannelResponse'] :: BaiduChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The user who last modified the Baidu channel.
[$sel:lastModifiedBy:BaiduChannelResponse'] :: BaiduChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:hasCredential:BaiduChannelResponse'] :: BaiduChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The API key that you received from the Baidu Cloud Push service to
--   communicate with the service.
[$sel:credential:BaiduChannelResponse'] :: BaiduChannelResponse -> Text

-- | The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For
--   the Baidu channel, this value is BAIDU.
[$sel:platform:BaiduChannelResponse'] :: BaiduChannelResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BaiduChannelResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date and time when
--   the Baidu channel was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_enabled</a> - Specifies whether the Baidu
--   channel is enabled for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isArchived:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_isArchived</a> - Specifies whether the Baidu
--   channel is archived.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the application that the Baidu channel applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_version</a> - The current version of the Baidu
--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>, <a>baiduChannelResponse_id</a> -
--   (Deprecated) An identifier for the Baidu channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_creationDate</a> - The date and time when the
--   Baidu channel was enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedBy:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_lastModifiedBy</a> - The user who last
--   modified the Baidu channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasCredential:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_hasCredential</a> - (Not used) This property
--   is retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:credential:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_credential</a> - The API key that you received
--   from the Baidu Cloud Push service to communicate with the service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_platform</a> - The type of messaging or
--   notification platform for the channel. For the Baidu channel, this
--   value is BAIDU.
newBaiduChannelResponse :: Text -> Text -> BaiduChannelResponse

-- | The date and time when the Baidu channel was last modified.
baiduChannelResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' BaiduChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the Baidu channel is enabled for the application.
baiduChannelResponse_enabled :: Lens' BaiduChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether the Baidu channel is archived.
baiduChannelResponse_isArchived :: Lens' BaiduChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the Baidu channel
--   applies to.
baiduChannelResponse_applicationId :: Lens' BaiduChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The current version of the Baidu channel.
baiduChannelResponse_version :: Lens' BaiduChannelResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the Baidu channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
baiduChannelResponse_id :: Lens' BaiduChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when the Baidu channel was enabled.
baiduChannelResponse_creationDate :: Lens' BaiduChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The user who last modified the Baidu channel.
baiduChannelResponse_lastModifiedBy :: Lens' BaiduChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
baiduChannelResponse_hasCredential :: Lens' BaiduChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The API key that you received from the Baidu Cloud Push service to
--   communicate with the service.
baiduChannelResponse_credential :: Lens' BaiduChannelResponse Text

-- | The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For
--   the Baidu channel, this value is BAIDU.
baiduChannelResponse_platform :: Lens' BaiduChannelResponse Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaiduChannelResponse.BaiduChannelResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaiduChannelResponse.BaiduChannelResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaiduChannelResponse.BaiduChannelResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaiduChannelResponse.BaiduChannelResponse
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaiduChannelResponse.BaiduChannelResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaiduChannelResponse.BaiduChannelResponse
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaiduChannelResponse.BaiduChannelResponse


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaiduMessage

-- | Specifies the settings for a one-time message that's sent directly to
--   an endpoint through the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push) channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBaiduMessage</a> smart constructor.
data BaiduMessage
BaiduMessage' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> BaiduMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the notification message. You
--   can override the default variables with individual address variables.
[$sel:substitutions:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification,
--   which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's
--   device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as
--   updating an app's configuration or supporting phone home
--   functionality.
[$sel:silentPush:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Bool

-- | The URL of the large icon image to display in the content view of the
--   push notification.
[$sel:imageIconUrl:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the
--   notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other
--   content for the message.
[$sel:rawContent:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The JSON data payload to use for the push notification, if the
--   notification is a silent push notification. This payload is added to
--   the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.
[$sel:data':BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The URL of the small icon image to display in the status bar and the
--   content view of the push notification.
[$sel:smallImageIconUrl:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The body of the notification message.
[$sel:body:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, that the Baidu Cloud Push service
--   should store the message if the recipient's device is offline. The
--   default value and maximum supported time is 604,800 seconds (7 days).
[$sel:timeToLive:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Int

-- | The URL to open in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action
--   property is URL.
[$sel:url:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The sound to play when the recipient receives the push notification.
--   You can use the default stream or specify the file name of a sound
--   resource that's bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound
--   file must reside in /res/raw/.
[$sel:sound:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The action to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of
--   the Android platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:action:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Action

-- | The URL of an image to display in the push notification.
[$sel:imageUrl:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The title to display above the notification message on the recipient's
--   device.
[$sel:title:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The icon image name of the asset saved in your app.
[$sel:iconReference:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BaiduMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:BaiduMessage'</a>,
--   <a>baiduMessage_substitutions</a> - The default message variables to
--   use in the notification message. You can override the default
--   variables with individual address variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:silentPush:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_silentPush</a> -
--   Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification,
--   which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's
--   device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as
--   updating an app's configuration or supporting phone home
--   functionality.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageIconUrl:BaiduMessage'</a>,
--   <a>baiduMessage_imageIconUrl</a> - The URL of the large icon image to
--   display in the content view of the push notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawContent:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_rawContent</a> -
--   The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the
--   notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other
--   content for the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_data</a> - The JSON
--   data payload to use for the push notification, if the notification is
--   a silent push notification. This payload is added to the
--   data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:smallImageIconUrl:BaiduMessage'</a>,
--   <a>baiduMessage_smallImageIconUrl</a> - The URL of the small icon
--   image to display in the status bar and the content view of the push
--   notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_body</a> - The body of
--   the notification message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeToLive:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_timeToLive</a> -
--   The amount of time, in seconds, that the Baidu Cloud Push service
--   should store the message if the recipient's device is offline. The
--   default value and maximum supported time is 604,800 seconds (7 days).
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_url</a> - The URL to
--   open in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps
--   the push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sound:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_sound</a> - The sound
--   to play when the recipient receives the push notification. You can use
--   the default stream or specify the file name of a sound resource that's
--   bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound file must
--   reside in /res/raw/.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_action</a> - The
--   action to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of
--   the Android platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageUrl:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_imageUrl</a> - The
--   URL of an image to display in the push notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_title</a> - The title
--   to display above the notification message on the recipient's device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iconReference:BaiduMessage'</a>,
--   <a>baiduMessage_iconReference</a> - The icon image name of the asset
--   saved in your app.
newBaiduMessage :: BaiduMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the notification message. You
--   can override the default variables with individual address variables.
baiduMessage_substitutions :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification,
--   which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's
--   device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as
--   updating an app's configuration or supporting phone home
--   functionality.
baiduMessage_silentPush :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Bool)

-- | The URL of the large icon image to display in the content view of the
--   push notification.
baiduMessage_imageIconUrl :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the
--   notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other
--   content for the message.
baiduMessage_rawContent :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The JSON data payload to use for the push notification, if the
--   notification is a silent push notification. This payload is added to
--   the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.
baiduMessage_data :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The URL of the small icon image to display in the status bar and the
--   content view of the push notification.
baiduMessage_smallImageIconUrl :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The body of the notification message.
baiduMessage_body :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, that the Baidu Cloud Push service
--   should store the message if the recipient's device is offline. The
--   default value and maximum supported time is 604,800 seconds (7 days).
baiduMessage_timeToLive :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Int)

-- | The URL to open in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action
--   property is URL.
baiduMessage_url :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The sound to play when the recipient receives the push notification.
--   You can use the default stream or specify the file name of a sound
--   resource that's bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound
--   file must reside in /res/raw/.
baiduMessage_sound :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The action to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of
--   the Android platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
baiduMessage_action :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Action)

-- | The URL of an image to display in the push notification.
baiduMessage_imageUrl :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The title to display above the notification message on the recipient's
--   device.
baiduMessage_title :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The icon image name of the asset saved in your app.
baiduMessage_iconReference :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaiduMessage.BaiduMessage
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaiduMessage.BaiduMessage
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaiduMessage.BaiduMessage
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaiduMessage.BaiduMessage
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaiduMessage.BaiduMessage
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaiduMessage.BaiduMessage
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaiduMessage.BaiduMessage

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignCustomMessage

-- | Specifies the contents of a message that's sent through a custom
--   channel to recipients of a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignCustomMessage</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignCustomMessage
CampaignCustomMessage' :: Maybe Text -> CampaignCustomMessage

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the message.
--   The maximum size is 5 KB.
[$sel:data':CampaignCustomMessage'] :: CampaignCustomMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignCustomMessage</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':CampaignCustomMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignCustomMessage_data</a> - The raw, JSON-formatted string to
--   use as the payload for the message. The maximum size is 5 KB.
newCampaignCustomMessage :: CampaignCustomMessage

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the message.
--   The maximum size is 5 KB.
campaignCustomMessage_data :: Lens' CampaignCustomMessage (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignCustomMessage.CampaignCustomMessage
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignCustomMessage.CampaignCustomMessage
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignCustomMessage.CampaignCustomMessage

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignEmailMessage

-- | Specifies the content and "From" address for an email message that's
--   sent to recipients of a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignEmailMessage</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignEmailMessage
CampaignEmailMessage' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CampaignEmailMessage

-- | The body of the email for recipients whose email clients don't render
--   HTML content.
[$sel:body:CampaignEmailMessage'] :: CampaignEmailMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The verified email address to send the email from. The default address
--   is the FromAddress specified for the email channel for the
--   application.
[$sel:fromAddress:CampaignEmailMessage'] :: CampaignEmailMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The body of the email, in HTML format, for recipients whose email
--   clients render HTML content.
[$sel:htmlBody:CampaignEmailMessage'] :: CampaignEmailMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The subject line, or title, of the email.
[$sel:title:CampaignEmailMessage'] :: CampaignEmailMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignEmailMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:CampaignEmailMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignEmailMessage_body</a> - The body of the email for
--   recipients whose email clients don't render HTML content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromAddress:CampaignEmailMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignEmailMessage_fromAddress</a> - The verified email address
--   to send the email from. The default address is the FromAddress
--   specified for the email channel for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:htmlBody:CampaignEmailMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignEmailMessage_htmlBody</a> - The body of the email, in HTML
--   format, for recipients whose email clients render HTML content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:CampaignEmailMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignEmailMessage_title</a> - The subject line, or title, of the
--   email.
newCampaignEmailMessage :: CampaignEmailMessage

-- | The body of the email for recipients whose email clients don't render
--   HTML content.
campaignEmailMessage_body :: Lens' CampaignEmailMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The verified email address to send the email from. The default address
--   is the FromAddress specified for the email channel for the
--   application.
campaignEmailMessage_fromAddress :: Lens' CampaignEmailMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The body of the email, in HTML format, for recipients whose email
--   clients render HTML content.
campaignEmailMessage_htmlBody :: Lens' CampaignEmailMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The subject line, or title, of the email.
campaignEmailMessage_title :: Lens' CampaignEmailMessage (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignEmailMessage.CampaignEmailMessage
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignEmailMessage.CampaignEmailMessage
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignEmailMessage.CampaignEmailMessage
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignEmailMessage.CampaignEmailMessage
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignEmailMessage.CampaignEmailMessage
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignEmailMessage.CampaignEmailMessage
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignEmailMessage.CampaignEmailMessage
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignEmailMessage.CampaignEmailMessage


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignLimits

-- | For a campaign, specifies limits on the messages that the campaign can
--   send. For an application, specifies the default limits for messages
--   that campaigns in the application can send.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignLimits</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignLimits
CampaignLimits' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> CampaignLimits

-- | The maximum number of messages that a campaign can send each second.
--   For an application, this value specifies the default limit for the
--   number of messages that campaigns can send each second. The minimum
--   value is 50. The maximum value is 20,000.
[$sel:messagesPerSecond:CampaignLimits'] :: CampaignLimits -> Maybe Int

-- | The maximum number of messages that a campaign can send to a single
--   endpoint during a 24-hour period. For an application, this value
--   specifies the default limit for the number of messages that campaigns
--   and journeys can send to a single endpoint during a 24-hour period.
--   The maximum value is 100.
[$sel:daily:CampaignLimits'] :: CampaignLimits -> Maybe Int

-- | The maximum number of messages that a campaign can send to a single
--   endpoint during the course of the campaign. If a campaign recurs, this
--   setting applies to all runs of the campaign. The maximum value is 100.
[$sel:total:CampaignLimits'] :: CampaignLimits -> Maybe Int

-- | The maximum total number of messages that the campaign can send per
--   user session.
[$sel:session:CampaignLimits'] :: CampaignLimits -> Maybe Int

-- | The maximum amount of time, in seconds, that a campaign can attempt to
--   deliver a message after the scheduled start time for the campaign. The
--   minimum value is 60 seconds.
[$sel:maximumDuration:CampaignLimits'] :: CampaignLimits -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignLimits</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:messagesPerSecond:CampaignLimits'</a>,
--   <a>campaignLimits_messagesPerSecond</a> - The maximum number of
--   messages that a campaign can send each second. For an application,
--   this value specifies the default limit for the number of messages that
--   campaigns can send each second. The minimum value is 50. The maximum
--   value is 20,000.
--   
--   <a>$sel:daily:CampaignLimits'</a>, <a>campaignLimits_daily</a> - The
--   maximum number of messages that a campaign can send to a single
--   endpoint during a 24-hour period. For an application, this value
--   specifies the default limit for the number of messages that campaigns
--   and journeys can send to a single endpoint during a 24-hour period.
--   The maximum value is 100.
--   
--   <a>$sel:total:CampaignLimits'</a>, <a>campaignLimits_total</a> - The
--   maximum number of messages that a campaign can send to a single
--   endpoint during the course of the campaign. If a campaign recurs, this
--   setting applies to all runs of the campaign. The maximum value is 100.
--   
--   <a>$sel:session:CampaignLimits'</a>, <a>campaignLimits_session</a> -
--   The maximum total number of messages that the campaign can send per
--   user session.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumDuration:CampaignLimits'</a>,
--   <a>campaignLimits_maximumDuration</a> - The maximum amount of time, in
--   seconds, that a campaign can attempt to deliver a message after the
--   scheduled start time for the campaign. The minimum value is 60
--   seconds.
newCampaignLimits :: CampaignLimits

-- | The maximum number of messages that a campaign can send each second.
--   For an application, this value specifies the default limit for the
--   number of messages that campaigns can send each second. The minimum
--   value is 50. The maximum value is 20,000.
campaignLimits_messagesPerSecond :: Lens' CampaignLimits (Maybe Int)

-- | The maximum number of messages that a campaign can send to a single
--   endpoint during a 24-hour period. For an application, this value
--   specifies the default limit for the number of messages that campaigns
--   and journeys can send to a single endpoint during a 24-hour period.
--   The maximum value is 100.
campaignLimits_daily :: Lens' CampaignLimits (Maybe Int)

-- | The maximum number of messages that a campaign can send to a single
--   endpoint during the course of the campaign. If a campaign recurs, this
--   setting applies to all runs of the campaign. The maximum value is 100.
campaignLimits_total :: Lens' CampaignLimits (Maybe Int)

-- | The maximum total number of messages that the campaign can send per
--   user session.
campaignLimits_session :: Lens' CampaignLimits (Maybe Int)

-- | The maximum amount of time, in seconds, that a campaign can attempt to
--   deliver a message after the scheduled start time for the campaign. The
--   minimum value is 60 seconds.
campaignLimits_maximumDuration :: Lens' CampaignLimits (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignLimits.CampaignLimits
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignLimits.CampaignLimits
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignLimits.CampaignLimits
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignLimits.CampaignLimits
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignLimits.CampaignLimits
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignLimits.CampaignLimits
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignLimits.CampaignLimits
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignLimits.CampaignLimits

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignState

-- | Provides information about the status of a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignState</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignState
CampaignState' :: Maybe CampaignStatus -> CampaignState

-- | The current status of the campaign, or the current status of a
--   treatment that belongs to an A/B test campaign.
--   
--   If a campaign uses A/B testing, the campaign has a status of COMPLETED
--   only if all campaign treatments have a status of COMPLETED. If you
--   delete the segment that's associated with a campaign, the campaign
--   fails and has a status of DELETED.
[$sel:campaignStatus:CampaignState'] :: CampaignState -> Maybe CampaignStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignState</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:campaignStatus:CampaignState'</a>,
--   <a>campaignState_campaignStatus</a> - The current status of the
--   campaign, or the current status of a treatment that belongs to an A/B
--   test campaign.
--   
--   If a campaign uses A/B testing, the campaign has a status of COMPLETED
--   only if all campaign treatments have a status of COMPLETED. If you
--   delete the segment that's associated with a campaign, the campaign
--   fails and has a status of DELETED.
newCampaignState :: CampaignState

-- | The current status of the campaign, or the current status of a
--   treatment that belongs to an A/B test campaign.
--   
--   If a campaign uses A/B testing, the campaign has a status of COMPLETED
--   only if all campaign treatments have a status of COMPLETED. If you
--   delete the segment that's associated with a campaign, the campaign
--   fails and has a status of DELETED.
campaignState_campaignStatus :: Lens' CampaignState (Maybe CampaignStatus)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignState.CampaignState
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignState.CampaignState
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignState.CampaignState
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignState.CampaignState
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignState.CampaignState
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignState.CampaignState
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignState.CampaignState


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ChannelResponse

-- | Provides information about the general settings and status of a
--   channel for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ChannelResponse
ChannelResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> ChannelResponse

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the channel was last
--   modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:ChannelResponse'] :: ChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the channel is enabled for the application.
[$sel:enabled:ChannelResponse'] :: ChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether the channel is archived.
[$sel:isArchived:ChannelResponse'] :: ChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The unique identifier for the application.
[$sel:applicationId:ChannelResponse'] :: ChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The current version of the channel.
[$sel:version:ChannelResponse'] :: ChannelResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the channel. This property is retained
--   only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:id:ChannelResponse'] :: ChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the channel was enabled.
[$sel:creationDate:ChannelResponse'] :: ChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The user who last modified the channel.
[$sel:lastModifiedBy:ChannelResponse'] :: ChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:hasCredential:ChannelResponse'] :: ChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>ChannelResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:ChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>channelResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date and time, in ISO
--   8601 format, when the channel was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:ChannelResponse'</a>, <a>channelResponse_enabled</a> -
--   Specifies whether the channel is enabled for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isArchived:ChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>channelResponse_isArchived</a> - Specifies whether the channel is
--   archived.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:ChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>channelResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:ChannelResponse'</a>, <a>channelResponse_version</a> -
--   The current version of the channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ChannelResponse'</a>, <a>channelResponse_id</a> -
--   (Deprecated) An identifier for the channel. This property is retained
--   only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:ChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>channelResponse_creationDate</a> - The date and time, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the channel was enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedBy:ChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>channelResponse_lastModifiedBy</a> - The user who last modified the
--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasCredential:ChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>channelResponse_hasCredential</a> - (Not used) This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
newChannelResponse :: ChannelResponse

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the channel was last
--   modified.
channelResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' ChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the channel is enabled for the application.
channelResponse_enabled :: Lens' ChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether the channel is archived.
channelResponse_isArchived :: Lens' ChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The unique identifier for the application.
channelResponse_applicationId :: Lens' ChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The current version of the channel.
channelResponse_version :: Lens' ChannelResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the channel. This property is retained
--   only for backward compatibility.
channelResponse_id :: Lens' ChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the channel was enabled.
channelResponse_creationDate :: Lens' ChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The user who last modified the channel.
channelResponse_lastModifiedBy :: Lens' ChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
channelResponse_hasCredential :: Lens' ChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ChannelResponse.ChannelResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ChannelResponse.ChannelResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ChannelResponse.ChannelResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ChannelResponse.ChannelResponse
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ChannelResponse.ChannelResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ChannelResponse.ChannelResponse
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ChannelResponse.ChannelResponse
