module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AddressConfiguration

-- | Specifies address-based configuration settings for a message that's
--   sent directly to an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAddressConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data AddressConfiguration
AddressConfiguration' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ChannelType -> AddressConfiguration

-- | A map of the message variables to merge with the variables specified
--   by properties of the DefaultMessage object. The variables specified in
--   this map take precedence over all other variables.
[$sel:substitutions:AddressConfiguration'] :: AddressConfiguration -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | The message title to use instead of the default message title. This
--   value overrides the default message title.
[$sel:titleOverride:AddressConfiguration'] :: AddressConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that maps custom attributes to attributes for the address
--   and is attached to the message. Attribute names are case sensitive.
--   
--   For a push notification, this payload is added to the data.pinpoint
--   object. For an email or text message, this payload is added to
--   email/SMS delivery receipt event attributes.
[$sel:context:AddressConfiguration'] :: AddressConfiguration -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the message.
--   If specified, this value overrides all other values for the message.
[$sel:rawContent:AddressConfiguration'] :: AddressConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The message body to use instead of the default message body. This
--   value overrides the default message body.
[$sel:bodyOverride:AddressConfiguration'] :: AddressConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The channel to use when sending the message.
[$sel:channelType:AddressConfiguration'] :: AddressConfiguration -> Maybe ChannelType

-- | Create a value of <a>AddressConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:AddressConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>addressConfiguration_substitutions</a> - A map of the message
--   variables to merge with the variables specified by properties of the
--   DefaultMessage object. The variables specified in this map take
--   precedence over all other variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:titleOverride:AddressConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>addressConfiguration_titleOverride</a> - The message title to use
--   instead of the default message title. This value overrides the default
--   message title.
--   
--   <a>$sel:context:AddressConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>addressConfiguration_context</a> - An object that maps custom
--   attributes to attributes for the address and is attached to the
--   message. Attribute names are case sensitive.
--   
--   For a push notification, this payload is added to the data.pinpoint
--   object. For an email or text message, this payload is added to
--   email/SMS delivery receipt event attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawContent:AddressConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>addressConfiguration_rawContent</a> - The raw, JSON-formatted
--   string to use as the payload for the message. If specified, this value
--   overrides all other values for the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bodyOverride:AddressConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>addressConfiguration_bodyOverride</a> - The message body to use
--   instead of the default message body. This value overrides the default
--   message body.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelType:AddressConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>addressConfiguration_channelType</a> - The channel to use when
--   sending the message.
newAddressConfiguration :: AddressConfiguration

-- | A map of the message variables to merge with the variables specified
--   by properties of the DefaultMessage object. The variables specified in
--   this map take precedence over all other variables.
addressConfiguration_substitutions :: Lens' AddressConfiguration (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | The message title to use instead of the default message title. This
--   value overrides the default message title.
addressConfiguration_titleOverride :: Lens' AddressConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that maps custom attributes to attributes for the address
--   and is attached to the message. Attribute names are case sensitive.
--   
--   For a push notification, this payload is added to the data.pinpoint
--   object. For an email or text message, this payload is added to
--   email/SMS delivery receipt event attributes.
addressConfiguration_context :: Lens' AddressConfiguration (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the message.
--   If specified, this value overrides all other values for the message.
addressConfiguration_rawContent :: Lens' AddressConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The message body to use instead of the default message body. This
--   value overrides the default message body.
addressConfiguration_bodyOverride :: Lens' AddressConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The channel to use when sending the message.
addressConfiguration_channelType :: Lens' AddressConfiguration (Maybe ChannelType)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AddressConfiguration.AddressConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AddressConfiguration.AddressConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AddressConfiguration.AddressConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AddressConfiguration.AddressConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AddressConfiguration.AddressConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AddressConfiguration.AddressConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.AddressConfiguration.AddressConfiguration


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ChannelsResponse

-- | Provides information about the general settings and status of all
--   channels for an application, including channels that aren't enabled
--   for the application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newChannelsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ChannelsResponse
ChannelsResponse' :: HashMap Text ChannelResponse -> ChannelsResponse

-- | A map that contains a multipart response for each channel. For each
--   item in this object, the ChannelType is the key and the Channel is the
--   value.
[$sel:channels:ChannelsResponse'] :: ChannelsResponse -> HashMap Text ChannelResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>ChannelsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:channels:ChannelsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>channelsResponse_channels</a> - A map that contains a multipart
--   response for each channel. For each item in this object, the
--   ChannelType is the key and the Channel is the value.
newChannelsResponse :: ChannelsResponse

-- | A map that contains a multipart response for each channel. For each
--   item in this object, the ChannelType is the key and the Channel is the
--   value.
channelsResponse_channels :: Lens' ChannelsResponse (HashMap Text ChannelResponse)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ChannelsResponse.ChannelsResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ChannelsResponse.ChannelsResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ChannelsResponse.ChannelsResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ChannelsResponse.ChannelsResponse
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ChannelsResponse.ChannelsResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ChannelsResponse.ChannelsResponse
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ChannelsResponse.ChannelsResponse

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CreateApplicationRequest

-- | Specifies the display name of an application and the tags to associate
--   with the application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateApplicationRequest</a> smart constructor.
data CreateApplicationRequest
CreateApplicationRequest' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> CreateApplicationRequest

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the application. Each tag consists of a required tag
--   key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:CreateApplicationRequest'] :: CreateApplicationRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The display name of the application. This name is displayed as the
--   <b>Project name</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
[$sel:name:CreateApplicationRequest'] :: CreateApplicationRequest -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateApplicationRequest</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateApplicationRequest'</a>,
--   <a>createApplicationRequest_tags</a> - A string-to-string map of
--   key-value pairs that defines the tags to associate with the
--   application. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated
--   tag value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateApplicationRequest'</a>,
--   <a>createApplicationRequest_name</a> - The display name of the
--   application. This name is displayed as the <b>Project name</b> on the
--   Amazon Pinpoint console.
newCreateApplicationRequest :: Text -> CreateApplicationRequest

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the application. Each tag consists of a required tag
--   key and an associated tag value.
createApplicationRequest_tags :: Lens' CreateApplicationRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The display name of the application. This name is displayed as the
--   <b>Project name</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
createApplicationRequest_name :: Lens' CreateApplicationRequest Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CreateApplicationRequest.CreateApplicationRequest
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CreateApplicationRequest.CreateApplicationRequest
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CreateApplicationRequest.CreateApplicationRequest
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CreateApplicationRequest.CreateApplicationRequest
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CreateApplicationRequest.CreateApplicationRequest
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CreateApplicationRequest.CreateApplicationRequest
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CreateApplicationRequest.CreateApplicationRequest


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CreateRecommenderConfiguration

-- | Specifies Amazon Pinpoint configuration settings for retrieving and
--   processing recommendation data from a recommender model.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateRecommenderConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateRecommenderConfiguration
CreateRecommenderConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Text -> Text -> CreateRecommenderConfiguration

-- | The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function to
--   invoke for additional processing of recommendation data that's
--   retrieved from the recommender model.
[$sel:recommendationTransformerUri:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: CreateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | A custom display name for the standard endpoint or user attribute
--   (RecommendationItems) that temporarily stores recommended items for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This value is required if the
--   configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda function
--   (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data.
--   
--   This name appears in the <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template
--   editor on the Amazon Pinpoint console. The name can contain up to 25
--   characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-). These restrictions don't apply to
--   attribute values.
[$sel:recommendationsDisplayName:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: CreateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of Amazon Pinpoint ID to associate with unique user IDs in
--   the recommender model. This value enables the model to use attribute
--   and event data that’s specific to a particular endpoint or user in an
--   Amazon Pinpoint application. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PINPOINT_ENDPOINT_ID - Associate each user in the model with a
--   particular endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based
--   on endpoint IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. This is the default value.</li>
--   <li>PINPOINT_USER_ID - Associate each user in the model with a
--   particular user and endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is
--   correlated based on user IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. If you specify this
--   value, an endpoint definition in Amazon Pinpoint has to specify both a
--   user ID (UserId) and an endpoint ID. Otherwise, messages won’t be sent
--   to the user's endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:recommendationProviderIdType:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: CreateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | A map of key-value pairs that defines 1-10 custom endpoint or user
--   attributes, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. Each of these attributes
--   temporarily stores a recommended item that's retrieved from the
--   recommender model and sent to an AWS Lambda function for additional
--   processing. Each attribute can be used as a message variable in a
--   message template.
--   
--   In the map, the key is the name of a custom attribute and the value is
--   a custom display name for that attribute. The display name appears in
--   the <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template editor on the Amazon
--   Pinpoint console. The following restrictions apply to these names:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>An attribute name must start with a letter or number and it can
--   contain up to 50 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Attribute names are case sensitive
--   and must be unique.</li>
--   <li>An attribute display name must start with a letter or number and
--   it can contain up to 25 characters. The characters can be letters,
--   numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This object is required if the configuration invokes an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to process recommendation
--   data. Otherwise, don't include this object in your request.
[$sel:attributes:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: CreateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | A custom name of the configuration for the recommender model. The name
--   must start with a letter or number and it can contain up to 128
--   characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-).
[$sel:name:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: CreateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | A custom description of the configuration for the recommender model.
--   The description can contain up to 128 characters. The characters can
--   be letters, numbers, spaces, or the following symbols: _ ; () , ‐.
[$sel:description:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: CreateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of recommended items to retrieve from the model for each
--   endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This number determines how many
--   recommended items are available for use in message variables. The
--   minimum value is 1. The maximum value is 5. The default value is 5.
--   
--   To use multiple recommended items and custom attributes with message
--   variables, you have to use an AWS Lambda function
--   (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data.
[$sel:recommendationsPerMessage:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: CreateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender model to retrieve
--   recommendation data from. This value must match the ARN of an Amazon
--   Personalize campaign.
[$sel:recommendationProviderUri:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: CreateRecommenderConfiguration -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to retrieve
--   recommendation data from the recommender model.
[$sel:recommendationProviderRoleArn:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: CreateRecommenderConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateRecommenderConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationTransformerUri:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationTransformerUri</a> -
--   The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function to
--   invoke for additional processing of recommendation data that's
--   retrieved from the recommender model.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationsDisplayName:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationsDisplayName</a> - A
--   custom display name for the standard endpoint or user attribute
--   (RecommendationItems) that temporarily stores recommended items for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This value is required if the
--   configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda function
--   (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data.
--   
--   This name appears in the <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template
--   editor on the Amazon Pinpoint console. The name can contain up to 25
--   characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-). These restrictions don't apply to
--   attribute values.
--

--   The type of Amazon Pinpoint ID to associate with unique user IDs in

--   and event data that’s specific to a particular endpoint or user in an

--   contain up to 50 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Attribute names are case sensitive
--   and must be unique.</li>
--   <li>An attribute display name must start with a letter or number and
--   it can contain up to 25 characters. The characters can be letters,
--   numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This object is required if the configuration invokes an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to process recommendation
--   data. Otherwise, don't include this object in your request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createRecommenderConfiguration_name</a> - A custom name of the
--   configuration for the recommender model. The name must start with a
--   letter or number and it can contain up to 128 characters. The
--   characters can be letters, numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or
--   hyphens (-).
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createRecommenderConfiguration_description</a> - A custom
--   description of the configuration for the recommender model. The
--   description can contain up to 128 characters. The characters can be
--   letters, numbers, spaces, or the following symbols: _ ; () , ‐.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationsPerMessage:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationsPerMessage</a> - The
--   number of recommended items to retrieve from the model for each
--   endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This number determines how many
--   recommended items are available for use in message variables. The
--   minimum value is 1. The maximum value is 5. The default value is 5.
--   
--   To use multiple recommended items and custom attributes with message
--   variables, you have to use an AWS Lambda function
--   (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationProviderUri:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationProviderUri</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender model to retrieve
--   recommendation data from. This value must match the ARN of an Amazon
--   Personalize campaign.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationProviderRoleArn:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationProviderRoleArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to retrieve
--   recommendation data from the recommender model.
newCreateRecommenderConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> CreateRecommenderConfiguration

-- | The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function to
--   invoke for additional processing of recommendation data that's
--   retrieved from the recommender model.
createRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationTransformerUri :: Lens' CreateRecommenderConfiguration (Maybe Text)

createRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationsDisplayName :: Lens' CreateRecommenderConfiguration (Maybe Text)

createRecommenderConfiguration_attributes :: Lens' CreateRecommenderConfiguration (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CreateTemplateMessageBody

-- | Provides information about a request to create a message template.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateTemplateMessageBody</a> smart constructor.
data CreateTemplateMessageBody
CreateTemplateMessageBody' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CreateTemplateMessageBody

-- | The unique identifier for the request to create the message template.
[$sel:requestID:CreateTemplateMessageBody'] :: CreateTemplateMessageBody -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the message template that was
--   created.
[$sel:arn:CreateTemplateMessageBody'] :: CreateTemplateMessageBody -> Maybe Text

-- | The message that's returned from the API for the request to create the
--   message template.
[$sel:message:CreateTemplateMessageBody'] :: CreateTemplateMessageBody -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateTemplateMessageBody</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestID:CreateTemplateMessageBody'</a>,
--   <a>createTemplateMessageBody_requestID</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the request to create the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:CreateTemplateMessageBody'</a>,
--   <a>createTemplateMessageBody_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the message template that was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:CreateTemplateMessageBody'</a>,
--   <a>createTemplateMessageBody_message</a> - The message that's returned
--   from the API for the request to create the message template.
newCreateTemplateMessageBody :: CreateTemplateMessageBody

-- | The unique identifier for the request to create the message template.
createTemplateMessageBody_requestID :: Lens' CreateTemplateMessageBody (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the message template that was
--   created.
createTemplateMessageBody_arn :: Lens' CreateTemplateMessageBody (Maybe Text)

--   message template.
createTemplateMessageBody_message :: Lens' CreateTemplateMessageBody (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DefaultButtonConfiguration

-- | Default button configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDefaultButtonConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data DefaultButtonConfiguration
DefaultButtonConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> ButtonAction -> Text -> DefaultButtonConfiguration

-- | Button destination.
[$sel:link:DefaultButtonConfiguration'] :: DefaultButtonConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The background color of the button.
[$sel:backgroundColor:DefaultButtonConfiguration'] :: DefaultButtonConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The border radius of the button.
[$sel:borderRadius:DefaultButtonConfiguration'] :: DefaultButtonConfiguration -> Maybe Int

-- | The text color of the button.
[$sel:textColor:DefaultButtonConfiguration'] :: DefaultButtonConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Action triggered by the button.
[$sel:buttonAction:DefaultButtonConfiguration'] :: DefaultButtonConfiguration -> ButtonAction

-- | Button text.
[$sel:text:DefaultButtonConfiguration'] :: DefaultButtonConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DefaultButtonConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:link:DefaultButtonConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>defaultButtonConfiguration_link</a> - Button destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backgroundColor:DefaultButtonConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>defaultButtonConfiguration_backgroundColor</a> - The background
--   color of the button.
--   
--   <a>$sel:borderRadius:DefaultButtonConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>defaultButtonConfiguration_borderRadius</a> - The border radius of
--   the button.
--   
--   <a>$sel:textColor:DefaultButtonConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>defaultButtonConfiguration_textColor</a> - The text color of the
--   button.
--   
--   <a>$sel:buttonAction:DefaultButtonConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>defaultButtonConfiguration_buttonAction</a> - Action triggered by
--   the button.
--   
--   <a>$sel:text:DefaultButtonConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>defaultButtonConfiguration_text</a> - Button text.
newDefaultButtonConfiguration :: ButtonAction -> Text -> DefaultButtonConfiguration

-- | Button destination.
defaultButtonConfiguration_link :: Lens' DefaultButtonConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The background color of the button.
defaultButtonConfiguration_backgroundColor :: Lens' DefaultButtonConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The border radius of the button.
defaultButtonConfiguration_borderRadius :: Lens' DefaultButtonConfiguration (Maybe Int)

-- | The text color of the button.
defaultButtonConfiguration_textColor :: Lens' DefaultButtonConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Action triggered by the button.
defaultButtonConfiguration_buttonAction :: Lens' DefaultButtonConfiguration ButtonAction

-- | Button text.
defaultButtonConfiguration_text :: Lens' DefaultButtonConfiguration Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DefaultButtonConfiguration.DefaultButtonConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DefaultButtonConfiguration.DefaultButtonConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DefaultButtonConfiguration.DefaultButtonConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DefaultButtonConfiguration.DefaultButtonConfiguration

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DefaultMessage

-- | Specifies the default message for all channels.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDefaultMessage</a> smart constructor.
data DefaultMessage
DefaultMessage' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> DefaultMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the message. You can override
--   these default variables with individual address variables.
[$sel:substitutions:DefaultMessage'] :: DefaultMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | The default body of the message.
[$sel:body:DefaultMessage'] :: DefaultMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DefaultMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:DefaultMessage'</a>,
--   <a>defaultMessage_substitutions</a> - The default message variables to
--   use in the message. You can override these default variables with
--   individual address variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:DefaultMessage'</a>, <a>defaultMessage_body</a> - The
--   default body of the message.
newDefaultMessage :: DefaultMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the message. You can override
--   these default variables with individual address variables.
defaultMessage_substitutions :: Lens' DefaultMessage (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | The default body of the message.
defaultMessage_body :: Lens' DefaultMessage (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DefaultMessage.DefaultMessage
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DefaultMessage.DefaultMessage
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DefaultMessage.DefaultMessage
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DefaultMessage.DefaultMessage
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DefaultMessage.DefaultMessage
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DefaultMessage.DefaultMessage
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DefaultMessage.DefaultMessage


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DefaultPushNotificationMessage

-- | Specifies the default settings and content for a push notification
--   that's sent directly to an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDefaultPushNotificationMessage</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DefaultPushNotificationMessage
DefaultPushNotificationMessage' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Text -> DefaultPushNotificationMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the notification message. You
--   can override the default variables with individual address variables.
[$sel:substitutions:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'] :: DefaultPushNotificationMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | Specifies whether the default notification is a silent push
--   notification, which is a push notification that doesn't display on a
--   recipient's device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases
--   such as updating an app's configuration or delivering messages to an
--   in-app notification center.
[$sel:silentPush:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'] :: DefaultPushNotificationMessage -> Maybe Bool

-- | The JSON data payload to use for the default push notification, if the
--   notification is a silent push notification. This payload is added to
--   the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.
[$sel:data':DefaultPushNotificationMessage'] :: DefaultPushNotificationMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The default body of the notification message.
[$sel:body:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'] :: DefaultPushNotificationMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The default URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action
--   property is URL.
[$sel:url:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'] :: DefaultPushNotificationMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The default action to occur if a recipient taps the push notification.
--   Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   the iOS and Android platforms.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:action:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'] :: DefaultPushNotificationMessage -> Maybe Action

-- | The default title to display above the notification message on a
--   recipient's device.
[$sel:title:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'] :: DefaultPushNotificationMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DefaultPushNotificationMessage</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationMessage_substitutions</a> - The default
--   message variables to use in the notification message. You can override
--   the default variables with individual address variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:silentPush:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationMessage_silentPush</a> - Specifies whether
--   the default notification is a silent push notification, which is a
--   push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's device. Silent
--   push notifications can be used for cases such as updating an app's
--   configuration or delivering messages to an in-app notification center.
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':DefaultPushNotificationMessage'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationMessage_data</a> - The JSON data payload to
--   use for the default push notification, if the notification is a silent
--   push notification. This payload is added to the data.pinpoint.jsonBody
--   object of the notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationMessage_body</a> - The default body of the
--   notification message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationMessage_url</a> - The default URL to open in
--   a recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push
--   notification and the value of the Action property is URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationMessage_action</a> - The default action to
--   occur if a recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   the iOS and Android platforms.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationMessage_title</a> - The default title to
--   display above the notification message on a recipient's device.
newDefaultPushNotificationMessage :: DefaultPushNotificationMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the notification message. You
--   can override the default variables with individual address variables.
defaultPushNotificationMessage_substitutions :: Lens' DefaultPushNotificationMessage (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | Specifies whether the default notification is a silent push
--   notification, which is a push notification that doesn't display on a
--   recipient's device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases
--   such as updating an app's configuration or delivering messages to an
--   in-app notification center.
defaultPushNotificationMessage_silentPush :: Lens' DefaultPushNotificationMessage (Maybe Bool)

-- | The JSON data payload to use for the default push notification, if the
--   notification is a silent push notification. This payload is added to
--   the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.
defaultPushNotificationMessage_data :: Lens' DefaultPushNotificationMessage (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The default body of the notification message.
defaultPushNotificationMessage_body :: Lens' DefaultPushNotificationMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The default URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action
--   property is URL.
defaultPushNotificationMessage_url :: Lens' DefaultPushNotificationMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The default action to occur if a recipient taps the push notification.
--   Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   the iOS and Android platforms.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
defaultPushNotificationMessage_action :: Lens' DefaultPushNotificationMessage (Maybe Action)

-- | The default title to display above the notification message on a
--   recipient's device.
defaultPushNotificationMessage_title :: Lens' DefaultPushNotificationMessage (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DefaultPushNotificationMessage.DefaultPushNotificationMessage
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DefaultPushNotificationMessage.DefaultPushNotificationMessage

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DefaultPushNotificationTemplate

-- | Specifies the default settings and content for a message template that
--   can be used in messages that are sent through a push notification
--   channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDefaultPushNotificationTemplate</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DefaultPushNotificationTemplate
DefaultPushNotificationTemplate' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Text -> DefaultPushNotificationTemplate

-- | The message body to use in push notifications that are based on the
--   message template.
[$sel:body:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'] :: DefaultPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message
--   template and the value of the Action property is URL.
[$sel:url:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'] :: DefaultPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The sound to play when a recipient receives a push notification that's
--   based on the message template. You can use the default stream or
--   specify the file name of a sound resource that's bundled in your app.
--   On an Android platform, the sound file must reside in /res/raw/.
--   
--   For an iOS platform, this value is the key for the name of a sound
--   file in your app's main bundle or the Library/Sounds folder in your
--   app's data container. If the sound file can't be found or you specify
--   default for the value, the system plays the default alert sound.
[$sel:sound:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'] :: DefaultPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The action to occur if a recipient taps a push notification that's
--   based on the message template. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   the iOS and Android platforms.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:action:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'] :: DefaultPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Action

-- | The title to use in push notifications that are based on the message
--   template. This title appears above the notification message on a
--   recipient's device.
[$sel:title:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'] :: DefaultPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DefaultPushNotificationTemplate</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationTemplate_body</a> - The message body to use
--   in push notifications that are based on the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationTemplate_url</a> - The URL to open in a
--   recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps a push
--   notification that's based on the message template and the value of the
--   Action property is URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sound:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationTemplate_sound</a> - The sound to play when
--   a recipient receives a push notification that's based on the message
--   template. You can use the default stream or specify the file name of a
--   sound resource that's bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the
--   sound file must reside in /res/raw/.
--   
--   For an iOS platform, this value is the key for the name of a sound
--   file in your app's main bundle or the Library/Sounds folder in your
--   app's data container. If the sound file can't be found or you specify
--   default for the value, the system plays the default alert sound.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationTemplate_action</a> - The action to occur if
--   a recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message
--   template. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   the iOS and Android platforms.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationTemplate_title</a> - The title to use in
--   push notifications that are based on the message template. This title
--   appears above the notification message on a recipient's device.
newDefaultPushNotificationTemplate :: DefaultPushNotificationTemplate

-- | The message body to use in push notifications that are based on the
--   message template.
defaultPushNotificationTemplate_body :: Lens' DefaultPushNotificationTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message
--   template and the value of the Action property is URL.
defaultPushNotificationTemplate_url :: Lens' DefaultPushNotificationTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The sound to play when a recipient receives a push notification that's
--   based on the message template. You can use the default stream or
--   specify the file name of a sound resource that's bundled in your app.
--   On an Android platform, the sound file must reside in /res/raw/.
--   
--   For an iOS platform, this value is the key for the name of a sound
--   file in your app's main bundle or the Library/Sounds folder in your
--   app's data container. If the sound file can't be found or you specify
--   default for the value, the system plays the default alert sound.
defaultPushNotificationTemplate_sound :: Lens' DefaultPushNotificationTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The action to occur if a recipient taps a push notification that's
--   based on the message template. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   the iOS and Android platforms.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
defaultPushNotificationTemplate_action :: Lens' DefaultPushNotificationTemplate (Maybe Action)

--   template. This title appears above the notification message on a
--   recipient's device.

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailChannelRequest

-- | Specifies the status and settings of the email channel for an
--   application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailChannelRequest</a> smart constructor.
data EmailChannelRequest
EmailChannelRequest' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> EmailChannelRequest

-- | Specifies whether to enable the email channel for the application.
[$sel:enabled:EmailChannelRequest'] :: EmailChannelRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | The <a>Amazon SES configuration set</a> that you want to apply to
--   messages that you send through the channel.
[$sel:configurationSet:EmailChannelRequest'] :: EmailChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that you
--   want Amazon Pinpoint to use when it submits email-related event data
--   for the channel.
[$sel:roleArn:EmailChannelRequest'] :: EmailChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The verified email address that you want to send email from when you
--   send email through the channel.
[$sel:fromAddress:EmailChannelRequest'] :: EmailChannelRequest -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the identity, verified with Amazon
--   Simple Email Service (Amazon SES), that you want to use when you send
--   email through the channel.
[$sel:identity:EmailChannelRequest'] :: EmailChannelRequest -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailChannelRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:EmailChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelRequest_enabled</a> - Specifies whether to enable the
--   email channel for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSet:EmailChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelRequest_configurationSet</a> - The <a>Amazon SES
--   configuration set</a> that you want to apply to messages that you send
--   through the channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:EmailChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelRequest_roleArn</a> - The ARN of the AWS Identity and
--   Access Management (IAM) role that you want Amazon Pinpoint to use when
--   it submits email-related event data for the channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromAddress:EmailChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelRequest_fromAddress</a> - The verified email address
--   that you want to send email from when you send email through the
--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identity:EmailChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelRequest_identity</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the identity, verified with Amazon Simple Email Service (Amazon
--   SES), that you want to use when you send email through the channel.
newEmailChannelRequest :: Text -> Text -> EmailChannelRequest

-- | Specifies whether to enable the email channel for the application.
emailChannelRequest_enabled :: Lens' EmailChannelRequest (Maybe Bool)

-- | The <a>Amazon SES configuration set</a> that you want to apply to
--   messages that you send through the channel.
emailChannelRequest_configurationSet :: Lens' EmailChannelRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that you
--   want Amazon Pinpoint to use when it submits email-related event data
--   for the channel.
emailChannelRequest_roleArn :: Lens' EmailChannelRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The verified email address that you want to send email from when you
--   send email through the channel.
emailChannelRequest_fromAddress :: Lens' EmailChannelRequest Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the identity, verified with Amazon
--   Simple Email Service (Amazon SES), that you want to use when you send
--   email through the channel.
emailChannelRequest_identity :: Lens' EmailChannelRequest Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailChannelRequest.EmailChannelRequest
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailChannelRequest.EmailChannelRequest
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailChannelRequest.EmailChannelRequest
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailChannelRequest.EmailChannelRequest
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailChannelRequest.EmailChannelRequest
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailChannelRequest.EmailChannelRequest
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailChannelRequest.EmailChannelRequest


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailChannelResponse

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of the email
--   channel for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data EmailChannelResponse
EmailChannelResponse' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Text -> EmailChannelResponse

-- | The maximum number of emails that can be sent through the channel each
--   second.
[$sel:messagesPerSecond:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the email channel was last
--   modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the email channel is enabled for the application.
[$sel:enabled:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The verified email address that email is sent from when you send email
--   through the channel.
[$sel:fromAddress:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the email channel is archived.
[$sel:isArchived:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the email channel
--   applies to.
[$sel:applicationId:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The current version of the email channel.
[$sel:version:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The <a>Amazon SES configuration set</a> that's applied to messages
--   that are sent through the channel.
[$sel:configurationSet:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the email channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:id:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the email channel was
--   enabled.
[$sel:creationDate:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The user who last modified the email channel.
[$sel:lastModifiedBy:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the identity, verified with Amazon
--   Simple Email Service (Amazon SES), that's used when you send email
--   through the channel.
[$sel:identity:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:hasCredential:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The ARN of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that
--   Amazon Pinpoint uses to submit email-related event data for the
--   channel.
[$sel:roleArn:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For
--   the email channel, this value is EMAIL.
[$sel:platform:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailChannelResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:messagesPerSecond:EmailChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelResponse_messagesPerSecond</a> - The maximum number of
--   emails that can be sent through the channel each second.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:EmailChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date and time, in
--   ISO 8601 format, when the email channel was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:EmailChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelResponse_enabled</a> - Specifies whether the email
--   channel is enabled for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromAddress:EmailChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelResponse_fromAddress</a> - The verified email address
--   that email is sent from when you send email through the channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isArchived:EmailChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelResponse_isArchived</a> - Specifies whether the email
--   channel is archived.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:EmailChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the application that the email channel applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:EmailChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelResponse_version</a> - The current version of the email
--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSet:EmailChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelResponse_configurationSet</a> - The <a>Amazon SES
--   configuration set</a> that's applied to messages that are sent through
--   the channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:EmailChannelResponse'</a>, <a>emailChannelResponse_id</a> -
--   (Deprecated) An identifier for the email channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:EmailChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelResponse_creationDate</a> - The date and time, in ISO
--   8601 format, when the email channel was enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedBy:EmailChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelResponse_lastModifiedBy</a> - The user who last
--   modified the email channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identity:EmailChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelResponse_identity</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the identity, verified with Amazon Simple Email Service (Amazon
--   SES), that's used when you send email through the channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasCredential:EmailChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelResponse_hasCredential</a> - (Not used) This property
--   is retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:EmailChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelResponse_roleArn</a> - The ARN of the AWS Identity and
--   Access Management (IAM) role that Amazon Pinpoint uses to submit
--   email-related event data for the channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:EmailChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelResponse_platform</a> - The type of messaging or
--   notification platform for the channel. For the email channel, this
--   value is EMAIL.
newEmailChannelResponse :: Text -> EmailChannelResponse

-- | The maximum number of emails that can be sent through the channel each
--   second.
emailChannelResponse_messagesPerSecond :: Lens' EmailChannelResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the email channel was last
--   modified.
emailChannelResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' EmailChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the email channel is enabled for the application.
emailChannelResponse_enabled :: Lens' EmailChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The verified email address that email is sent from when you send email
--   through the channel.
emailChannelResponse_fromAddress :: Lens' EmailChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the email channel is archived.
emailChannelResponse_isArchived :: Lens' EmailChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the email channel
--   applies to.
emailChannelResponse_applicationId :: Lens' EmailChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The current version of the email channel.
emailChannelResponse_version :: Lens' EmailChannelResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The <a>Amazon SES configuration set</a> that's applied to messages
--   that are sent through the channel.
emailChannelResponse_configurationSet :: Lens' EmailChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the email channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
emailChannelResponse_id :: Lens' EmailChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the email channel was
--   enabled.
emailChannelResponse_creationDate :: Lens' EmailChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The user who last modified the email channel.
emailChannelResponse_lastModifiedBy :: Lens' EmailChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the identity, verified with Amazon
--   Simple Email Service (Amazon SES), that's used when you send email
--   through the channel.
emailChannelResponse_identity :: Lens' EmailChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
emailChannelResponse_hasCredential :: Lens' EmailChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The ARN of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that
--   Amazon Pinpoint uses to submit email-related event data for the
--   channel.
emailChannelResponse_roleArn :: Lens' EmailChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailTemplateRequest

-- | Specifies the content and settings for a message template that can be
--   used in messages that are sent through the email channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailTemplateRequest</a> smart constructor.
data EmailTemplateRequest
EmailTemplateRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> EmailTemplateRequest

-- | The subject line, or title, to use in email messages that are based on
--   the message template.
[$sel:subject:EmailTemplateRequest'] :: EmailTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The message body, in plain text format, to use in email messages that
--   are based on the message template. We recommend using plain text
--   format for email clients that don't render HTML content and clients
--   that are connected to high-latency networks, such as mobile devices.
[$sel:textPart:EmailTemplateRequest'] :: EmailTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A custom description of the message template.
[$sel:templateDescription:EmailTemplateRequest'] :: EmailTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A JSON object that specifies the default values to use for message
--   variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value
--   pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The
--   corresponding value defines the default value for that variable. When
--   you create a message that's based on the template, you can override
--   these defaults with message-specific and address-specific variables
--   and values.
[$sel:defaultSubstitutions:EmailTemplateRequest'] :: EmailTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The message body, in HTML format, to use in email messages that are
--   based on the message template. We recommend using HTML format for
--   email clients that render HTML content. You can include links,
--   formatted text, and more in an HTML message.
[$sel:htmlPart:EmailTemplateRequest'] :: EmailTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the recommender model to use for the message
--   template. Amazon Pinpoint uses this value to determine how to retrieve
--   and process data from a recommender model when it sends messages that
--   use the template, if the template contains message variables for
--   recommendation data.
[$sel:recommenderId:EmailTemplateRequest'] :: EmailTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:EmailTemplateRequest'] :: EmailTemplateRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailTemplateRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:EmailTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateRequest_subject</a> - The subject line, or title, to
--   use in email messages that are based on the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:textPart:EmailTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateRequest_textPart</a> - The message body, in plain text
--   format, to use in email messages that are based on the message
--   template. We recommend using plain text format for email clients that
--   don't render HTML content and clients that are connected to
--   high-latency networks, such as mobile devices.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:EmailTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateRequest_templateDescription</a> - A custom description
--   of the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubstitutions:EmailTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateRequest_defaultSubstitutions</a> - A JSON object that
--   specifies the default values to use for message variables in the
--   message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key
--   defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding value
--   defines the default value for that variable. When you create a message
--   that's based on the template, you can override these defaults with
--   message-specific and address-specific variables and values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:htmlPart:EmailTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateRequest_htmlPart</a> - The message body, in HTML
--   format, to use in email messages that are based on the message
--   template. We recommend using HTML format for email clients that render
--   HTML content. You can include links, formatted text, and more in an
--   HTML message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommenderId:EmailTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateRequest_recommenderId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the recommender model to use for the message template. Amazon Pinpoint
--   uses this value to determine how to retrieve and process data from a
--   recommender model when it sends messages that use the template, if the
--   template contains message variables for recommendation data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:EmailTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateRequest_tags</a> - A string-to-string map of key-value
--   pairs that defines the tags to associate with the message template.
--   Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.
newEmailTemplateRequest :: EmailTemplateRequest

-- | The subject line, or title, to use in email messages that are based on
--   the message template.
emailTemplateRequest_subject :: Lens' EmailTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The message body, in plain text format, to use in email messages that
--   are based on the message template. We recommend using plain text
--   format for email clients that don't render HTML content and clients
--   that are connected to high-latency networks, such as mobile devices.
emailTemplateRequest_textPart :: Lens' EmailTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A custom description of the message template.
emailTemplateRequest_templateDescription :: Lens' EmailTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A JSON object that specifies the default values to use for message
--   variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value
--   pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The
--   corresponding value defines the default value for that variable. When
--   you create a message that's based on the template, you can override
--   these defaults with message-specific and address-specific variables
--   and values.
emailTemplateRequest_defaultSubstitutions :: Lens' EmailTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The message body, in HTML format, to use in email messages that are
--   based on the message template. We recommend using HTML format for
--   email clients that render HTML content. You can include links,
--   formatted text, and more in an HTML message.
emailTemplateRequest_htmlPart :: Lens' EmailTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the recommender model to use for the message
--   template. Amazon Pinpoint uses this value to determine how to retrieve
--   and process data from a recommender model when it sends messages that
--   use the template, if the template contains message variables for
--   recommendation data.
emailTemplateRequest_recommenderId :: Lens' EmailTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
emailTemplateRequest_tags :: Lens' EmailTemplateRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailTemplateRequest.EmailTemplateRequest
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailTemplateRequest.EmailTemplateRequest
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailTemplateRequest.EmailTemplateRequest
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailTemplateRequest.EmailTemplateRequest
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailTemplateRequest.EmailTemplateRequest
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailTemplateRequest.EmailTemplateRequest
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailTemplateRequest.EmailTemplateRequest


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EndpointDemographic

-- | Specifies demographic information about an endpoint, such as the
--   applicable time zone and platform.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointDemographic</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointDemographic
EndpointDemographic' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> EndpointDemographic

-- | The platform of the endpoint device, such as ios.
[$sel:platform:EndpointDemographic'] :: EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text

-- | The platform version of the endpoint device.
[$sel:platformVersion:EndpointDemographic'] :: EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text

-- | The locale of the endpoint, in the following format: the ISO 639-1
--   alpha-2 code, followed by an underscore (_), followed by an ISO 3166-1
--   alpha-2 value.
[$sel:locale:EndpointDemographic'] :: EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text

-- | The version of the app that's associated with the endpoint.
[$sel:appVersion:EndpointDemographic'] :: EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text

-- | The model name or number of the endpoint device, such as iPhone or
--   SM-G900F.
[$sel:model:EndpointDemographic'] :: EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text

-- | The manufacturer of the endpoint device, such as apple or samsung.
[$sel:make:EndpointDemographic'] :: EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text

-- | The model version of the endpoint device.
[$sel:modelVersion:EndpointDemographic'] :: EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text

-- | The time zone of the endpoint, specified as a tz database name value,
--   such as America/Los_Angeles.
[$sel:timezone:EndpointDemographic'] :: EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointDemographic</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:EndpointDemographic'</a>,
--   <a>endpointDemographic_platform</a> - The platform of the endpoint
--   device, such as ios.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platformVersion:EndpointDemographic'</a>,
--   <a>endpointDemographic_platformVersion</a> - The platform version of
--   the endpoint device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:locale:EndpointDemographic'</a>,
--   <a>endpointDemographic_locale</a> - The locale of the endpoint, in the
--   following format: the ISO 639-1 alpha-2 code, followed by an
--   underscore (_), followed by an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appVersion:EndpointDemographic'</a>,
--   <a>endpointDemographic_appVersion</a> - The version of the app that's
--   associated with the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:model:EndpointDemographic'</a>,
--   <a>endpointDemographic_model</a> - The model name or number of the
--   endpoint device, such as iPhone or SM-G900F.
--   
--   <a>$sel:make:EndpointDemographic'</a>, <a>endpointDemographic_make</a>
--   - The manufacturer of the endpoint device, such as apple or samsung.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modelVersion:EndpointDemographic'</a>,
--   <a>endpointDemographic_modelVersion</a> - The model version of the
--   endpoint device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timezone:EndpointDemographic'</a>,
--   <a>endpointDemographic_timezone</a> - The time zone of the endpoint,
--   specified as a tz database name value, such as America/Los_Angeles.
newEndpointDemographic :: EndpointDemographic

-- | The platform of the endpoint device, such as ios.
endpointDemographic_platform :: Lens' EndpointDemographic (Maybe Text)

-- | The platform version of the endpoint device.
endpointDemographic_platformVersion :: Lens' EndpointDemographic (Maybe Text)

-- | The locale of the endpoint, in the following format: the ISO 639-1
--   alpha-2 code, followed by an underscore (_), followed by an ISO 3166-1
--   alpha-2 value.
endpointDemographic_locale :: Lens' EndpointDemographic (Maybe Text)

-- | The version of the app that's associated with the endpoint.
endpointDemographic_appVersion :: Lens' EndpointDemographic (Maybe Text)

-- | The model name or number of the endpoint device, such as iPhone or
--   SM-G900F.
endpointDemographic_model :: Lens' EndpointDemographic (Maybe Text)

-- | The manufacturer of the endpoint device, such as apple or samsung.
endpointDemographic_make :: Lens' EndpointDemographic (Maybe Text)

-- | The model version of the endpoint device.
endpointDemographic_modelVersion :: Lens' EndpointDemographic (Maybe Text)

-- | The time zone of the endpoint, specified as a tz database name value,
--   such as America/Los_Angeles.
endpointDemographic_timezone :: Lens' EndpointDemographic (Maybe Text)

--   for an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointItemResponse</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointItemResponse

--   processing the endpoint data.
[$sel:message:EndpointItemResponse'] :: EndpointItemResponse -> Maybe Text

--   processing the endpoint data.
[$sel:statusCode:EndpointItemResponse'] :: EndpointItemResponse -> Maybe Int

--

--   <a>endpointItemResponse_statusCode</a> - The status code that's
--   returned in the response as a result of processing the endpoint data.

--   processing the endpoint data.

--   processing the endpoint data.
