module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ImportJobResponse

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of a job that
--   imports endpoint definitions from one or more files. The files can be
--   stored in an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket or
--   uploaded directly from a computer by using the Amazon Pinpoint
--   console.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newImportJobResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ImportJobResponse
ImportJobResponse' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> JobStatus -> Text -> Text -> ImportJobResource -> Text -> Text -> ImportJobResponse

-- | The number of pieces that were processed successfully (completed) by
--   the import job, as of the time of the request.
[$sel:completedPieces:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of pieces that weren't processed successfully (failed) by
--   the import job, as of the time of the request.
[$sel:failedPieces:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The total number of endpoint definitions that were processed by the
--   import job.
[$sel:totalProcessed:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | An array of entries, one for each of the first 100 entries that
--   weren't processed successfully (failed) by the import job, if any.
[$sel:failures:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The total number of pieces that must be processed to complete the
--   import job. Each piece consists of an approximately equal portion of
--   the endpoint definitions that are part of the import job.
[$sel:totalPieces:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the import job was completed.
[$sel:completionDate:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of endpoint definitions that weren't processed
--   successfully (failed) by the import job, typically because an error,
--   such as a syntax error, occurred.
[$sel:totalFailures:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The status of the import job. The job status is FAILED if Amazon
--   Pinpoint wasn't able to process one or more pieces in the job.
[$sel:jobStatus:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> JobStatus

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the import job was created.
[$sel:creationDate:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> Text

-- | The job type. This value is IMPORT for import jobs.
[$sel:type':ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> Text

-- | The resource settings that apply to the import job.
[$sel:definition:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> ImportJobResource

-- | The unique identifier for the import job.
[$sel:id:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application that's associated with the
--   import job.
[$sel:applicationId:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ImportJobResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:completedPieces:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_completedPieces</a> - The number of pieces that
--   were processed successfully (completed) by the import job, as of the
--   time of the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failedPieces:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_failedPieces</a> - The number of pieces that
--   weren't processed successfully (failed) by the import job, as of the
--   time of the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalProcessed:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_totalProcessed</a> - The total number of endpoint
--   definitions that were processed by the import job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failures:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_failures</a> - An array of entries, one for each
--   of the first 100 entries that weren't processed successfully (failed)
--   by the import job, if any.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalPieces:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_totalPieces</a> - The total number of pieces that
--   must be processed to complete the import job. Each piece consists of
--   an approximately equal portion of the endpoint definitions that are
--   part of the import job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionDate:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_completionDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the import job was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalFailures:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_totalFailures</a> - The total number of endpoint
--   definitions that weren't processed successfully (failed) by the import
--   job, typically because an error, such as a syntax error, occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobStatus:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_jobStatus</a> - The status of the import job. The
--   job status is FAILED if Amazon Pinpoint wasn't able to process one or
--   more pieces in the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601 format,
--   when the import job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ImportJobResponse'</a>, <a>importJobResponse_type</a> -
--   The job type. This value is IMPORT for import jobs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:definition:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_definition</a> - The resource settings that apply
--   to the import job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ImportJobResponse'</a>, <a>importJobResponse_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the import job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application that's associated with the import job.
newImportJobResponse :: JobStatus -> Text -> Text -> ImportJobResource -> Text -> Text -> ImportJobResponse

-- | The number of pieces that were processed successfully (completed) by
--   the import job, as of the time of the request.
importJobResponse_completedPieces :: Lens' ImportJobResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of pieces that weren't processed successfully (failed) by
--   the import job, as of the time of the request.
importJobResponse_failedPieces :: Lens' ImportJobResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The total number of endpoint definitions that were processed by the
--   import job.
importJobResponse_totalProcessed :: Lens' ImportJobResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | An array of entries, one for each of the first 100 entries that
--   weren't processed successfully (failed) by the import job, if any.
importJobResponse_failures :: Lens' ImportJobResponse (Maybe [Text])

-- | The total number of pieces that must be processed to complete the
--   import job. Each piece consists of an approximately equal portion of
--   the endpoint definitions that are part of the import job.
importJobResponse_totalPieces :: Lens' ImportJobResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the import job was completed.
importJobResponse_completionDate :: Lens' ImportJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of endpoint definitions that weren't processed
--   successfully (failed) by the import job, typically because an error,
--   such as a syntax error, occurred.
importJobResponse_totalFailures :: Lens' ImportJobResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The status of the import job. The job status is FAILED if Amazon
--   Pinpoint wasn't able to process one or more pieces in the job.
importJobResponse_jobStatus :: Lens' ImportJobResponse JobStatus

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the import job was created.
importJobResponse_creationDate :: Lens' ImportJobResponse Text

-- | The job type. This value is IMPORT for import jobs.
importJobResponse_type :: Lens' ImportJobResponse Text

-- | The resource settings that apply to the import job.
importJobResponse_definition :: Lens' ImportJobResponse ImportJobResource

-- | The unique identifier for the import job.
importJobResponse_id :: Lens' ImportJobResponse Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application that's associated with the
--   import job.
importJobResponse_applicationId :: Lens' ImportJobResponse Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ImportJobResponse.ImportJobResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ImportJobResponse.ImportJobResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ImportJobResponse.ImportJobResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ImportJobResponse.ImportJobResponse
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ImportJobResponse.ImportJobResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ImportJobResponse.ImportJobResponse
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ImportJobResponse.ImportJobResponse


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ImportJobsResponse

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of all the import
--   jobs that are associated with an application or segment. An import job
--   is a job that imports endpoint definitions from one or more files.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newImportJobsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ImportJobsResponse
ImportJobsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> [ImportJobResponse] -> ImportJobsResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
[$sel:nextToken:ImportJobsResponse'] :: ImportJobsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of responses, one for each import job that's associated with
--   the application (Import Jobs resource) or segment (Segment Import Jobs
--   resource).
[$sel:item:ImportJobsResponse'] :: ImportJobsResponse -> [ImportJobResponse]

-- | Create a value of <a>ImportJobsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ImportJobsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobsResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use in a
--   subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated
--   response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:ImportJobsResponse'</a>, <a>importJobsResponse_item</a> -
--   An array of responses, one for each import job that's associated with
--   the application (Import Jobs resource) or segment (Segment Import Jobs
--   resource).
newImportJobsResponse :: ImportJobsResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
importJobsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ImportJobsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of responses, one for each import job that's associated with
--   the application (Import Jobs resource) or segment (Segment Import Jobs
--   resource).
importJobsResponse_item :: Lens' ImportJobsResponse [ImportJobResponse]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ImportJobsResponse.ImportJobsResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ImportJobsResponse.ImportJobsResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ImportJobsResponse.ImportJobsResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ImportJobsResponse.ImportJobsResponse
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ImportJobsResponse.ImportJobsResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ImportJobsResponse.ImportJobsResponse
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ImportJobsResponse.ImportJobsResponse


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ExportJobResponse

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of a job that
--   exports endpoint definitions to a file. The file can be added directly
--   to an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket by using the
--   Amazon Pinpoint API or downloaded directly to a computer by using the
--   Amazon Pinpoint console.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExportJobResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ExportJobResponse
ExportJobResponse' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> JobStatus -> Text -> Text -> ExportJobResource -> Text -> Text -> ExportJobResponse

-- | The number of pieces that were processed successfully (completed) by
--   the export job, as of the time of the request.
[$sel:completedPieces:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of pieces that weren't processed successfully (failed) by
--   the export job, as of the time of the request.
[$sel:failedPieces:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The total number of endpoint definitions that were processed by the
--   export job.
[$sel:totalProcessed:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | An array of entries, one for each of the first 100 entries that
--   weren't processed successfully (failed) by the export job, if any.
[$sel:failures:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The total number of pieces that must be processed to complete the
--   export job. Each piece consists of an approximately equal portion of
--   the endpoint definitions that are part of the export job.
[$sel:totalPieces:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the export job was completed.
[$sel:completionDate:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of endpoint definitions that weren't processed
--   successfully (failed) by the export job, typically because an error,
--   such as a syntax error, occurred.
[$sel:totalFailures:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The status of the export job. The job status is FAILED if Amazon
--   Pinpoint wasn't able to process one or more pieces in the job.
[$sel:jobStatus:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> JobStatus

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the export job was created.
[$sel:creationDate:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> Text

-- | The job type. This value is EXPORT for export jobs.
[$sel:type':ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> Text

-- | The resource settings that apply to the export job.
[$sel:definition:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> ExportJobResource

-- | The unique identifier for the export job.
[$sel:id:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application that's associated with the
--   export job.
[$sel:applicationId:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ExportJobResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:completedPieces:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_completedPieces</a> - The number of pieces that
--   were processed successfully (completed) by the export job, as of the
--   time of the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failedPieces:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_failedPieces</a> - The number of pieces that
--   weren't processed successfully (failed) by the export job, as of the
--   time of the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalProcessed:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_totalProcessed</a> - The total number of endpoint
--   definitions that were processed by the export job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failures:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_failures</a> - An array of entries, one for each
--   of the first 100 entries that weren't processed successfully (failed)
--   by the export job, if any.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalPieces:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_totalPieces</a> - The total number of pieces that
--   must be processed to complete the export job. Each piece consists of
--   an approximately equal portion of the endpoint definitions that are
--   part of the export job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionDate:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_completionDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the export job was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalFailures:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_totalFailures</a> - The total number of endpoint
--   definitions that weren't processed successfully (failed) by the export
--   job, typically because an error, such as a syntax error, occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobStatus:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_jobStatus</a> - The status of the export job. The
--   job status is FAILED if Amazon Pinpoint wasn't able to process one or
--   more pieces in the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601 format,
--   when the export job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ExportJobResponse'</a>, <a>exportJobResponse_type</a> -
--   The job type. This value is EXPORT for export jobs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:definition:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_definition</a> - The resource settings that apply
--   to the export job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ExportJobResponse'</a>, <a>exportJobResponse_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the export job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application that's associated with the export job.
newExportJobResponse :: JobStatus -> Text -> Text -> ExportJobResource -> Text -> Text -> ExportJobResponse

-- | The number of pieces that were processed successfully (completed) by
--   the export job, as of the time of the request.
exportJobResponse_completedPieces :: Lens' ExportJobResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of pieces that weren't processed successfully (failed) by
--   the export job, as of the time of the request.
exportJobResponse_failedPieces :: Lens' ExportJobResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The total number of endpoint definitions that were processed by the
--   export job.
exportJobResponse_totalProcessed :: Lens' ExportJobResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | An array of entries, one for each of the first 100 entries that
--   weren't processed successfully (failed) by the export job, if any.
exportJobResponse_failures :: Lens' ExportJobResponse (Maybe [Text])

-- | The total number of pieces that must be processed to complete the
--   export job. Each piece consists of an approximately equal portion of
--   the endpoint definitions that are part of the export job.
exportJobResponse_totalPieces :: Lens' ExportJobResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the export job was completed.
exportJobResponse_completionDate :: Lens' ExportJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of endpoint definitions that weren't processed
--   successfully (failed) by the export job, typically because an error,
--   such as a syntax error, occurred.
exportJobResponse_totalFailures :: Lens' ExportJobResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The status of the export job. The job status is FAILED if Amazon
--   Pinpoint wasn't able to process one or more pieces in the job.
exportJobResponse_jobStatus :: Lens' ExportJobResponse JobStatus

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the export job was created.
exportJobResponse_creationDate :: Lens' ExportJobResponse Text

-- | The job type. This value is EXPORT for export jobs.
exportJobResponse_type :: Lens' ExportJobResponse Text

-- | The resource settings that apply to the export job.
exportJobResponse_definition :: Lens' ExportJobResponse ExportJobResource

-- | The unique identifier for the export job.
exportJobResponse_id :: Lens' ExportJobResponse Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application that's associated with the
--   export job.
exportJobResponse_applicationId :: Lens' ExportJobResponse Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ExportJobResponse.ExportJobResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ExportJobResponse.ExportJobResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ExportJobResponse.ExportJobResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ExportJobResponse.ExportJobResponse
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ExportJobResponse.ExportJobResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ExportJobResponse.ExportJobResponse
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ExportJobResponse.ExportJobResponse


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ExportJobsResponse

-- | Provides information about all the export jobs that are associated
--   with an application or segment. An export job is a job that exports
--   endpoint definitions to a file.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExportJobsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ExportJobsResponse
ExportJobsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> [ExportJobResponse] -> ExportJobsResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
[$sel:nextToken:ExportJobsResponse'] :: ExportJobsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of responses, one for each export job that's associated with
--   the application (Export Jobs resource) or segment (Segment Export Jobs
--   resource).
[$sel:item:ExportJobsResponse'] :: ExportJobsResponse -> [ExportJobResponse]

-- | Create a value of <a>ExportJobsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ExportJobsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobsResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use in a
--   subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated
--   response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:ExportJobsResponse'</a>, <a>exportJobsResponse_item</a> -
--   An array of responses, one for each export job that's associated with
--   the application (Export Jobs resource) or segment (Segment Export Jobs
--   resource).
newExportJobsResponse :: ExportJobsResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
exportJobsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ExportJobsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of responses, one for each export job that's associated with
--   the application (Export Jobs resource) or segment (Segment Export Jobs
--   resource).
exportJobsResponse_item :: Lens' ExportJobsResponse [ExportJobResponse]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ExportJobsResponse.ExportJobsResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ExportJobsResponse.ExportJobsResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ExportJobsResponse.ExportJobsResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ExportJobsResponse.ExportJobsResponse
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ExportJobsResponse.ExportJobsResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ExportJobsResponse.ExportJobsResponse
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ExportJobsResponse.ExportJobsResponse

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CustomMessageActivity

-- | The settings for a custom message activity. This type of activity
--   calls an AWS Lambda function or web hook that sends messages to
--   participants.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomMessageActivity</a> smart constructor.
data CustomMessageActivity
CustomMessageActivity' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [EndpointTypesElement] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe JourneyCustomMessage -> CustomMessageActivity

-- | The name of the custom message template to use for the message. If
--   specified, this value must match the name of an existing message
--   template.
[$sel:templateName:CustomMessageActivity'] :: CustomMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the message template to use
--   for the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier
--   for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and
--   version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions
--   resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
[$sel:templateVersion:CustomMessageActivity'] :: CustomMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The types of endpoints to send the custom message to. Each valid value
--   maps to a type of channel that you can associate with an endpoint by
--   using the ChannelType property of an endpoint.
[$sel:endpointTypes:CustomMessageActivity'] :: CustomMessageActivity -> Maybe [EndpointTypesElement]

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after Amazon
--   Pinpoint calls the AWS Lambda function or web hook.
[$sel:nextActivity:CustomMessageActivity'] :: CustomMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The destination to send the campaign or treatment to. This value can
--   be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Lambda function
--   to invoke to handle delivery of the campaign or treatment.</li>
--   <li>The URL for a web application or service that supports HTTPS and
--   can receive the message. The URL has to be a full URL, including the
--   HTTPS protocol.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:deliveryUri:CustomMessageActivity'] :: CustomMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the message data included in a custom channel message that's
--   sent to participants in a journey.
[$sel:messageConfig:CustomMessageActivity'] :: CustomMessageActivity -> Maybe JourneyCustomMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>CustomMessageActivity</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:CustomMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>customMessageActivity_templateName</a> - The name of the custom
--   message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must
--   match the name of an existing message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateVersion:CustomMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>customMessageActivity_templateVersion</a> - The unique identifier
--   for the version of the message template to use for the message. If
--   specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing
--   template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version
--   identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointTypes:CustomMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>customMessageActivity_endpointTypes</a> - The types of endpoints to
--   send the custom message to. Each valid value maps to a type of channel
--   that you can associate with an endpoint by using the ChannelType
--   property of an endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextActivity:CustomMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>customMessageActivity_nextActivity</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the next activity to perform, after Amazon Pinpoint calls the AWS
--   Lambda function or web hook.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryUri:CustomMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>customMessageActivity_deliveryUri</a> - The destination to send the
--   campaign or treatment to. This value can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Lambda function
--   to invoke to handle delivery of the campaign or treatment.</li>
--   <li>The URL for a web application or service that supports HTTPS and
--   can receive the message. The URL has to be a full URL, including the
--   HTTPS protocol.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfig:CustomMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>customMessageActivity_messageConfig</a> - Specifies the message
--   data included in a custom channel message that's sent to participants
--   in a journey.
newCustomMessageActivity :: CustomMessageActivity

-- | The name of the custom message template to use for the message. If
--   specified, this value must match the name of an existing message
--   template.
customMessageActivity_templateName :: Lens' CustomMessageActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the message template to use
--   for the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier
--   for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and
--   version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions
--   resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
customMessageActivity_templateVersion :: Lens' CustomMessageActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | The types of endpoints to send the custom message to. Each valid value
--   maps to a type of channel that you can associate with an endpoint by
--   using the ChannelType property of an endpoint.
customMessageActivity_endpointTypes :: Lens' CustomMessageActivity (Maybe [EndpointTypesElement])

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after Amazon
--   Pinpoint calls the AWS Lambda function or web hook.
customMessageActivity_nextActivity :: Lens' CustomMessageActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | The destination to send the campaign or treatment to. This value can
--   be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Lambda function
--   to invoke to handle delivery of the campaign or treatment.</li>
--   <li>The URL for a web application or service that supports HTTPS and
--   can receive the message. The URL has to be a full URL, including the
--   HTTPS protocol.</li>
--   </ul>
customMessageActivity_deliveryUri :: Lens' CustomMessageActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the message data included in a custom channel message that's
--   sent to participants in a journey.
customMessageActivity_messageConfig :: Lens' CustomMessageActivity (Maybe JourneyCustomMessage)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CustomMessageActivity.CustomMessageActivity
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CustomMessageActivity.CustomMessageActivity
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CustomMessageActivity.CustomMessageActivity
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CustomMessageActivity.CustomMessageActivity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CustomMessageActivity.CustomMessageActivity
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CustomMessageActivity.CustomMessageActivity
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CustomMessageActivity.CustomMessageActivity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CustomMessageActivity.CustomMessageActivity

--   specified for the email channel for the application.
newJourneyEmailMessage :: JourneyEmailMessage

-- | The verified email address to send the email message from. The default
--   address is the FromAddress specified for the email channel for the
--   application.

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailMessageActivity

-- | Specifies the settings for an email activity in a journey. This type
--   of activity sends an email message to participants.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailMessageActivity</a> smart constructor.
data EmailMessageActivity
EmailMessageActivity' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe JourneyEmailMessage -> EmailMessageActivity

-- | The name of the email message template to use for the message. If
--   specified, this value must match the name of an existing message
--   template.
[$sel:templateName:EmailMessageActivity'] :: EmailMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the email template to use for
--   the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an
--   existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version
--   identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
[$sel:templateVersion:EmailMessageActivity'] :: EmailMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after the
--   message is sent.
[$sel:nextActivity:EmailMessageActivity'] :: EmailMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the sender address for an email message that's sent to
--   participants in the journey.
[$sel:messageConfig:EmailMessageActivity'] :: EmailMessageActivity -> Maybe JourneyEmailMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailMessageActivity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must
--   match the name of an existing message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateVersion:EmailMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>emailMessageActivity_templateVersion</a> - The unique identifier
--   for the version of the email template to use for the message. If
--   specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing
--   template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version
--   identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextActivity:EmailMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>emailMessageActivity_nextActivity</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the next activity to perform, after the message is sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfig:EmailMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>emailMessageActivity_messageConfig</a> - Specifies the sender
--   address for an email message that's sent to participants in the
--   journey.

--   specified, this value must match the name of an existing message
--   template.

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the email template to use for
--   the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an
--   existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version
--   identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
emailMessageActivity_templateVersion :: Lens' EmailMessageActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after the
--   message is sent.
emailMessageActivity_nextActivity :: Lens' EmailMessageActivity (Maybe Text)

--   participants in the journey.

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse

-- | Provides the results of a query that retrieved the data for a standard
--   execution metric that applies to a journey activity, and provides
--   information about that query.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse
JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse' :: HashMap Text Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse

-- | A JSON object that contains the results of the query. The results vary
--   depending on the type of activity (ActivityType). For information
--   about the structure and contents of the results, see the <a>Amazon
--   Pinpoint Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:metrics:JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse'] :: JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse -> HashMap Text Text

-- | The unique identifier for the journey that the metric applies to.
[$sel:journeyId:JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse'] :: JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse -> Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when Amazon Pinpoint last
--   evaluated the execution status of the activity and updated the data
--   for the metric.
[$sel:lastEvaluatedTime:JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse'] :: JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the activity that the metric applies to.
[$sel:journeyActivityId:JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse'] :: JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse -> Text

-- | The type of activity that the metric applies to. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>CONDITIONAL_SPLIT - For a yes/no split activity, which is an
--   activity that sends participants down one of two paths in a
--   journey.</li>
--   <li>HOLDOUT - For a holdout activity, which is an activity that stops
--   a journey for a specified percentage of participants.</li>
--   <li>MESSAGE - For an email activity, which is an activity that sends
--   an email message to participants.</li>
--   <li>MULTI_CONDITIONAL_SPLIT - For a multivariate split activity, which
--   is an activity that sends participants down one of as many as five
--   paths in a journey.</li>
--   <li>RANDOM_SPLIT - For a random split activity, which is an activity
--   that sends specified percentages of participants down one of as many
--   as five paths in a journey.</li>
--   <li>WAIT - For a wait activity, which is an activity that waits for a
--   certain amount of time or until a specific date and time before moving
--   participants to the next activity in a journey.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:activityType:JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse'] :: JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the metric applies to.
[$sel:applicationId:JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse'] :: JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse_metrics</a> - A JSON object
--   that contains the results of the query. The results vary depending on

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyLimits

-- | Specifies limits on the messages that a journey can send and the
--   number of times participants can enter a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneyLimits</a> smart constructor.
data JourneyLimits
JourneyLimits' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> JourneyLimits

-- | The maximum number of messages that the journey can send each second.
[$sel:messagesPerSecond:JourneyLimits'] :: JourneyLimits -> Maybe Int

-- | The maximum number of times that a participant can enter the journey.
--   The maximum value is 100. To allow participants to enter the journey
--   an unlimited number of times, set this value to 0.
[$sel:endpointReentryCap:JourneyLimits'] :: JourneyLimits -> Maybe Int

-- | Minimum time that must pass before an endpoint can re-enter a given
--   journey. The duration should use an ISO 8601 format, such as PT1H.
[$sel:endpointReentryInterval:JourneyLimits'] :: JourneyLimits -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of messages that the journey can send to a single
--   participant during a 24-hour period. The maximum value is 100.
[$sel:dailyCap:JourneyLimits'] :: JourneyLimits -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneyLimits</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:messagesPerSecond:JourneyLimits'</a>,
--   <a>journeyLimits_messagesPerSecond</a> - The maximum number of
--   messages that the journey can send each second.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointReentryCap:JourneyLimits'</a>,
--   <a>journeyLimits_endpointReentryCap</a> - The maximum number of times
--   that a participant can enter the journey. The maximum value is 100. To
--   allow participants to enter the journey an unlimited number of times,
--   set this value to 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointReentryInterval:JourneyLimits'</a>,
--   <a>journeyLimits_endpointReentryInterval</a> - Minimum time that must
--   pass before an endpoint can re-enter a given journey. The duration
--   should use an ISO 8601 format, such as PT1H.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dailyCap:JourneyLimits'</a>, <a>journeyLimits_dailyCap</a> -
--   The maximum number of messages that the journey can send to a single
--   participant during a 24-hour period. The maximum value is 100.
newJourneyLimits :: JourneyLimits

-- | The maximum number of messages that the journey can send each second.
journeyLimits_messagesPerSecond :: Lens' JourneyLimits (Maybe Int)

-- | The maximum number of times that a participant can enter the journey.
--   The maximum value is 100. To allow participants to enter the journey
--   an unlimited number of times, set this value to 0.
journeyLimits_endpointReentryCap :: Lens' JourneyLimits (Maybe Int)

-- | Minimum time that must pass before an endpoint can re-enter a given
--   journey. The duration should use an ISO 8601 format, such as PT1H.
journeyLimits_endpointReentryInterval :: Lens' JourneyLimits (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of messages that the journey can send to a single
--   participant during a 24-hour period. The maximum value is 100.
journeyLimits_dailyCap :: Lens' JourneyLimits (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyLimits.JourneyLimits
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyLimits.JourneyLimits
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyLimits.JourneyLimits
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyLimits.JourneyLimits
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyLimits.JourneyLimits
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyLimits.JourneyLimits
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyLimits.JourneyLimits
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyLimits.JourneyLimits


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyPushMessage

-- | Specifies the message configuration for a push notification that's
--   sent to participants in a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneyPushMessage</a> smart constructor.
data JourneyPushMessage
JourneyPushMessage' :: Maybe Text -> JourneyPushMessage

-- | The number of seconds that the push notification service should keep
--   the message, if the service is unable to deliver the notification the
--   first time. This value is converted to an expiration value when it's
--   sent to a push-notification service. If this value is 0, the service
--   treats the notification as if it expires immediately and the service
--   doesn't store or try to deliver the notification again.
--   
--   This value doesn't apply to messages that are sent through the Amazon
--   Device Messaging (ADM) service.
[$sel:timeToLive:JourneyPushMessage'] :: JourneyPushMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneyPushMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeToLive:JourneyPushMessage'</a>,
--   <a>journeyPushMessage_timeToLive</a> - The number of seconds that the
--   push notification service should keep the message, if the service is
--   unable to deliver the notification the first time. This value is
--   converted to an expiration value when it's sent to a push-notification
--   service. If this value is 0, the service treats the notification as if
--   it expires immediately and the service doesn't store or try to deliver
--   the notification again.
--   
--   This value doesn't apply to messages that are sent through the Amazon
--   Device Messaging (ADM) service.
newJourneyPushMessage :: JourneyPushMessage

-- | The number of seconds that the push notification service should keep
--   the message, if the service is unable to deliver the notification the
--   first time. This value is converted to an expiration value when it's
--   sent to a push-notification service. If this value is 0, the service
--   treats the notification as if it expires immediately and the service
--   doesn't store or try to deliver the notification again.
--   
--   This value doesn't apply to messages that are sent through the Amazon
--   Device Messaging (ADM) service.
journeyPushMessage_timeToLive :: Lens' JourneyPushMessage (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyPushMessage.JourneyPushMessage
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyPushMessage.JourneyPushMessage
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyPushMessage.JourneyPushMessage
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyPushMessage.JourneyPushMessage
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyPushMessage.JourneyPushMessage
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyPushMessage.JourneyPushMessage
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyPushMessage.JourneyPushMessage
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyPushMessage.JourneyPushMessage


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneySchedule

-- | Specifies the schedule settings for a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneySchedule</a> smart constructor.
data JourneySchedule
JourneySchedule' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> JourneySchedule

-- | The scheduled time, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey began or will
--   begin.
[$sel:startTime:JourneySchedule'] :: JourneySchedule -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The scheduled time, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey ended or will
--   end.
[$sel:endTime:JourneySchedule'] :: JourneySchedule -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The starting UTC offset for the journey schedule, if the value of the
--   journey's LocalTime property is true. Valid values are: UTC, UTC+01,
--   UTC+02, UTC+03, UTC+03:30, UTC+04, UTC+04:30, UTC+05, UTC+05:30,
--   UTC+05:45, UTC+06, UTC+06:30, UTC+07, UTC+08, UTC+08:45, UTC+09,
--   UTC+09:30, UTC+10, UTC+10:30, UTC+11, UTC+12, UTC+12:45, UTC+13,
--   UTC+13:45, UTC-02, UTC-02:30, UTC-03, UTC-03:30, UTC-04, UTC-05,
--   UTC-06, UTC-07, UTC-08, UTC-09, UTC-09:30, UTC-10, and UTC-11.
[$sel:timezone:JourneySchedule'] :: JourneySchedule -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneySchedule</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:JourneySchedule'</a>,
--   <a>journeySchedule_startTime</a> - The scheduled time, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the journey began or will begin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:JourneySchedule'</a>, <a>journeySchedule_endTime</a> -
--   The scheduled time, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey ended or will
--   end.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timezone:JourneySchedule'</a>, <a>journeySchedule_timezone</a>
--   - The starting UTC offset for the journey schedule, if the value of
--   the journey's LocalTime property is true. Valid values are: UTC,
--   UTC+01, UTC+02, UTC+03, UTC+03:30, UTC+04, UTC+04:30, UTC+05,
--   UTC+05:30, UTC+05:45, UTC+06, UTC+06:30, UTC+07, UTC+08, UTC+08:45,
--   UTC+09, UTC+09:30, UTC+10, UTC+10:30, UTC+11, UTC+12, UTC+12:45,
--   UTC+13, UTC+13:45, UTC-02, UTC-02:30, UTC-03, UTC-03:30, UTC-04,
--   UTC-05, UTC-06, UTC-07, UTC-08, UTC-09, UTC-09:30, UTC-10, and UTC-11.
newJourneySchedule :: JourneySchedule

-- | The scheduled time, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey began or will
--   begin.
journeySchedule_startTime :: Lens' JourneySchedule (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The scheduled time, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey ended or will
--   end.
journeySchedule_endTime :: Lens' JourneySchedule (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The starting UTC offset for the journey schedule, if the value of the
--   journey's LocalTime property is true. Valid values are: UTC, UTC+01,
--   UTC+02, UTC+03, UTC+03:30, UTC+04, UTC+04:30, UTC+05, UTC+05:30,
--   UTC+05:45, UTC+06, UTC+06:30, UTC+07, UTC+08, UTC+08:45, UTC+09,
--   UTC+09:30, UTC+10, UTC+10:30, UTC+11, UTC+12, UTC+12:45, UTC+13,
--   UTC+13:45, UTC-02, UTC-02:30, UTC-03, UTC-03:30, UTC-04, UTC-05,
--   UTC-06, UTC-07, UTC-08, UTC-09, UTC-09:30, UTC-10, and UTC-11.
journeySchedule_timezone :: Lens' JourneySchedule (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneySchedule.JourneySchedule
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneySchedule.JourneySchedule
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneySchedule.JourneySchedule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneySchedule.JourneySchedule

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Message

-- | Specifies the content and settings for a push notification that's sent
--   to recipients of a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessage</a> smart constructor.
data Message
Message' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Message

-- | Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification,
--   which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's
--   device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as
--   updating an app's configuration, displaying messages in an in-app
--   message center, or supporting phone home functionality.
[$sel:silentPush:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Bool

-- | The URL of the image to display as the push-notification icon, such as
--   the icon for the app.
[$sel:imageIconUrl:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Text

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the
--   notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other
--   content for the message.
[$sel:rawContent:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Text

-- | The body of the notification message. The maximum number of characters
--   is 200.
[$sel:body:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of seconds that the push-notification service should keep
--   the message, if the service is unable to deliver the notification the
--   first time. This value is converted to an expiration value when it's
--   sent to a push-notification service. If this value is 0, the service
--   treats the notification as if it expires immediately and the service
--   doesn't store or try to deliver the notification again.
--   
--   This value doesn't apply to messages that are sent through the Amazon
--   Device Messaging (ADM) service.
[$sel:timeToLive:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Int

-- | The URL of the image to display as the small, push-notification icon,
--   such as a small version of the icon for the app.
[$sel:imageSmallIconUrl:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Text

-- | The JSON payload to use for a silent push notification.
[$sel:jsonBody:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action
--   property is URL.
[$sel:url:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Text

-- | The action to occur if a recipient taps the push notification. Valid
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   iOS and Android.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:action:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Action

-- | The URL of an image to display in the push notification.
[$sel:imageUrl:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL of the image or video to display in the push notification.
[$sel:mediaUrl:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Text

-- | The title to display above the notification message on a recipient's
--   device.
[$sel:title:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Message</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:silentPush:Message'</a>, <a>message_silentPush</a> - Specifies
--   whether the notification is a silent push notification, which is a
--   push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's device. Silent
--   push notifications can be used for cases such as updating an app's
--   configuration, displaying messages in an in-app message center, or
--   supporting phone home functionality.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageIconUrl:Message'</a>, <a>message_imageIconUrl</a> - The
--   URL of the image to display as the push-notification icon, such as the
--   icon for the app.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawContent:Message'</a>, <a>message_rawContent</a> - The raw,
--   JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the notification
--   message. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the
--   message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:Message'</a>, <a>message_body</a> - The body of the
--   notification message. The maximum number of characters is 200.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeToLive:Message'</a>, <a>message_timeToLive</a> - The
--   number of seconds that the push-notification service should keep the
--   message, if the service is unable to deliver the notification the
--   first time. This value is converted to an expiration value when it's
--   sent to a push-notification service. If this value is 0, the service
--   treats the notification as if it expires immediately and the service
--   doesn't store or try to deliver the notification again.
--   
--   This value doesn't apply to messages that are sent through the Amazon
--   Device Messaging (ADM) service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageSmallIconUrl:Message'</a>,
--   <a>message_imageSmallIconUrl</a> - The URL of the image to display as
--   the small, push-notification icon, such as a small version of the icon
--   for the app.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jsonBody:Message'</a>, <a>message_jsonBody</a> - The JSON
--   payload to use for a silent push notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:Message'</a>, <a>message_url</a> - The URL to open in a
--   recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push
--   notification and the value of the Action property is URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:Message'</a>, <a>message_action</a> - The action to
--   occur if a recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   iOS and Android.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageUrl:Message'</a>, <a>message_imageUrl</a> - The URL of an
--   image to display in the push notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaUrl:Message'</a>, <a>message_mediaUrl</a> - The URL of
--   the image or video to display in the push notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:Message'</a>, <a>message_title</a> - The title to
--   display above the notification message on a recipient's device.
newMessage :: Message

-- | Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification,
--   which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's
--   device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as
--   updating an app's configuration, displaying messages in an in-app
--   message center, or supporting phone home functionality.
message_silentPush :: Lens' Message (Maybe Bool)

-- | The URL of the image to display as the push-notification icon, such as
--   the icon for the app.
message_imageIconUrl :: Lens' Message (Maybe Text)

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the
--   notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other
--   content for the message.
message_rawContent :: Lens' Message (Maybe Text)

-- | The body of the notification message. The maximum number of characters
--   is 200.
message_body :: Lens' Message (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of seconds that the push-notification service should keep
--   the message, if the service is unable to deliver the notification the
--   first time. This value is converted to an expiration value when it's
--   sent to a push-notification service. If this value is 0, the service
--   treats the notification as if it expires immediately and the service
--   doesn't store or try to deliver the notification again.
--   
--   This value doesn't apply to messages that are sent through the Amazon
--   Device Messaging (ADM) service.
message_timeToLive :: Lens' Message (Maybe Int)

-- | The URL of the image to display as the small, push-notification icon,
--   such as a small version of the icon for the app.
message_imageSmallIconUrl :: Lens' Message (Maybe Text)

-- | The JSON payload to use for a silent push notification.
message_jsonBody :: Lens' Message (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action
--   property is URL.
message_url :: Lens' Message (Maybe Text)

-- | The action to occur if a recipient taps the push notification. Valid
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   iOS and Android.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
message_action :: Lens' Message (Maybe Action)

-- | The URL of an image to display in the push notification.
message_imageUrl :: Lens' Message (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL of the image or video to display in the push notification.
message_mediaUrl :: Lens' Message (Maybe Text)

--   device.
message_title :: Lens' Message (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageBody

-- | Provides information about an API request or response.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessageBody</a> smart constructor.
data MessageBody
MessageBody' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> MessageBody

-- | The unique identifier for the request or response.
[$sel:requestID:MessageBody'] :: MessageBody -> Maybe Text

-- | The message that's returned from the API.
[$sel:message:MessageBody'] :: MessageBody -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MessageBody</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>$sel:requestID:MessageBody'</a>, <a>messageBody_requestID</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the request or response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:MessageBody'</a>, <a>messageBody_message</a> - The
--   message that's returned from the API.
newMessageBody :: MessageBody

-- | The unique identifier for the request or response.
messageBody_requestID :: Lens' MessageBody (Maybe Text)

-- | The message that's returned from the API.
messageBody_message :: Lens' MessageBody (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageResult

-- | Provides information about the results of sending a message directly
--   to an endpoint address.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessageResult</a> smart constructor.
data MessageResult
MessageResult' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DeliveryStatus -> Int -> MessageResult

-- | The status message for delivering the message.
[$sel:statusMessage:MessageResult'] :: MessageResult -> Maybe Text

-- | For push notifications that are sent through the GCM channel,
--   specifies whether the endpoint's device registration token was updated
--   as part of delivering the message.
[$sel:updatedToken:MessageResult'] :: MessageResult -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the message that was sent.
[$sel:messageId:MessageResult'] :: MessageResult -> Maybe Text

-- | The delivery status of the message. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DUPLICATE - The endpoint address is a duplicate of another
--   endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message
--   again.</li>
--   <li>OPT_OUT - The user who's associated with the endpoint address has
--   opted out of receiving messages from you. Amazon Pinpoint won't
--   attempt to send the message again.</li>
--   <li>PERMANENT_FAILURE - An error occurred when delivering the message
--   to the endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the
--   message again.</li>
--   <li>SUCCESSFUL - The message was successfully delivered to the
--   endpoint address.</li>
--   <li>TEMPORARY_FAILURE - A temporary error occurred. Amazon Pinpoint
--   won't attempt to send the message again.</li>
--   <li>THROTTLED - Amazon Pinpoint throttled the operation to send the
--   message to the endpoint address.</li>
--   <li>TIMEOUT - The message couldn't be sent within the timeout
--   period.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN_FAILURE - An unknown error occurred.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:deliveryStatus:MessageResult'] :: MessageResult -> DeliveryStatus

-- | The downstream service status code for delivering the message.
[$sel:statusCode:MessageResult'] :: MessageResult -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>MessageResult</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusMessage:MessageResult'</a>,
--   <a>messageResult_statusMessage</a> - The status message for delivering
--   the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:updatedToken:MessageResult'</a>,
--   <a>messageResult_updatedToken</a> - For push notifications that are
--   sent through the GCM channel, specifies whether the endpoint's device
--   registration token was updated as part of delivering the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageId:MessageResult'</a>, <a>messageResult_messageId</a> -
--   The unique identifier for the message that was sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStatus:MessageResult'</a>,
--   <a>messageResult_deliveryStatus</a> - The delivery status of the
--   message. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DUPLICATE - The endpoint address is a duplicate of another
--   endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message
--   again.</li>
--   <li>OPT_OUT - The user who's associated with the endpoint address has
--   opted out of receiving messages from you. Amazon Pinpoint won't
--   attempt to send the message again.</li>
--   <li>PERMANENT_FAILURE - An error occurred when delivering the message
--   to the endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the
--   message again.</li>
--   <li>SUCCESSFUL - The message was successfully delivered to the
--   endpoint address.</li>
--   <li>TEMPORARY_FAILURE - A temporary error occurred. Amazon Pinpoint
--   won't attempt to send the message again.</li>
--   <li>THROTTLED - Amazon Pinpoint throttled the operation to send the
--   message to the endpoint address.</li>
--   <li>TIMEOUT - The message couldn't be sent within the timeout
--   period.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN_FAILURE - An unknown error occurred.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusCode:MessageResult'</a>, <a>messageResult_statusCode</a>
--   - The downstream service status code for delivering the message.
newMessageResult :: DeliveryStatus -> Int -> MessageResult

-- | The status message for delivering the message.
messageResult_statusMessage :: Lens' MessageResult (Maybe Text)

-- | For push notifications that are sent through the GCM channel,
--   specifies whether the endpoint's device registration token was updated
--   as part of delivering the message.
messageResult_updatedToken :: Lens' MessageResult (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the message that was sent.
messageResult_messageId :: Lens' MessageResult (Maybe Text)

-- | The delivery status of the message. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DUPLICATE - The endpoint address is a duplicate of another
--   endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message
--   again.</li>
--   <li>OPT_OUT - The user who's associated with the endpoint address has
--   opted out of receiving messages from you. Amazon Pinpoint won't
--   attempt to send the message again.</li>
--   <li>PERMANENT_FAILURE - An error occurred when delivering the message
--   to the endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the
--   message again.</li>
--   <li>SUCCESSFUL - The message was successfully delivered to the
--   endpoint address.</li>
--   <li>TEMPORARY_FAILURE - A temporary error occurred. Amazon Pinpoint
--   won't attempt to send the message again.</li>
--   <li>THROTTLED - Amazon Pinpoint throttled the operation to send the
--   message to the endpoint address.</li>
--   <li>TIMEOUT - The message couldn't be sent within the timeout
--   period.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN_FAILURE - An unknown error occurred.</li>
--   </ul>
messageResult_deliveryStatus :: Lens' MessageResult DeliveryStatus

-- | The downstream service status code for delivering the message.
messageResult_statusCode :: Lens' MessageResult Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageResult.MessageResult
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageResult.MessageResult
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageResult.MessageResult
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageResult.MessageResult
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageResult.MessageResult
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageResult.MessageResult
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageResult.MessageResult


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageResponse

-- | Provides information about the results of a request to send a message
--   to an endpoint address.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessageResponse</a> smart constructor.
data MessageResponse
MessageResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text MessageResult) -> Maybe (HashMap Text EndpointMessageResult) -> Text -> MessageResponse

-- | The identifier for the original request that the message was delivered
--   for.
[$sel:requestId:MessageResponse'] :: MessageResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A map that contains a multipart response for each address (email
--   address, phone number, or push notification token) that the message
--   was sent to. In the map, the address is the key and the result is the
--   value.
[$sel:result:MessageResponse'] :: MessageResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text MessageResult)

-- | A map that contains a multipart response for each address that the
--   message was sent to. In the map, the endpoint ID is the key and the
--   result is the value.
[$sel:endpointResult:MessageResponse'] :: MessageResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text EndpointMessageResult)

-- | The unique identifier for the application that was used to send the
--   message.
[$sel:applicationId:MessageResponse'] :: MessageResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MessageResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestId:MessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>messageResponse_requestId</a> - The identifier for the original
--   request that the message was delivered for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:result:MessageResponse'</a>, <a>messageResponse_result</a> - A
--   map that contains a multipart response for each address (email
--   address, phone number, or push notification token) that the message
--   was sent to. In the map, the address is the key and the result is the
--   value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointResult:MessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>messageResponse_endpointResult</a> - A map that contains a
--   multipart response for each address that the message was sent to. In
--   the map, the endpoint ID is the key and the result is the value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:MessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>messageResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application that was used to send the message.
newMessageResponse :: Text -> MessageResponse

-- | The identifier for the original request that the message was delivered
--   for.
messageResponse_requestId :: Lens' MessageResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A map that contains a multipart response for each address (email
--   address, phone number, or push notification token) that the message
--   was sent to. In the map, the address is the key and the result is the
--   value.
messageResponse_result :: Lens' MessageResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text MessageResult))

-- | A map that contains a multipart response for each address that the
--   message was sent to. In the map, the endpoint ID is the key and the
--   result is the value.
messageResponse_endpointResult :: Lens' MessageResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text EndpointMessageResult))

-- | The unique identifier for the application that was used to send the
--   message.
messageResponse_applicationId :: Lens' MessageResponse Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageResponse.MessageResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageResponse.MessageResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageResponse.MessageResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageResponse.MessageResponse
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageResponse.MessageResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageResponse.MessageResponse
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageResponse.MessageResponse


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageType
newtype MessageType
MessageType' :: Text -> MessageType
[fromMessageType] :: MessageType -> Text
pattern MessageType_PROMOTIONAL :: MessageType
pattern MessageType_TRANSACTIONAL :: MessageType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageType.MessageType

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageType.MessageType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageType.MessageType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageType.MessageType
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageType.MessageType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageType.MessageType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageType.MessageType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageType.MessageType
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageType.MessageType
