instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageType.MessageType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageType.MessageType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageType.MessageType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageType.MessageType


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneySMSMessage

-- | Specifies the sender ID and message type for an SMS message that's
--   sent to participants in a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneySMSMessage</a> smart constructor.
data JourneySMSMessage
JourneySMSMessage' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MessageType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> JourneySMSMessage

-- | The long code to send the SMS message from. This value should be one
--   of the dedicated long codes that's assigned to your AWS account.
--   Although it isn't required, we recommend that you specify the long
--   code using an E.164 format to ensure prompt and accurate delivery of
--   the message. For example, +12065550100.
[$sel:originationNumber:JourneySMSMessage'] :: JourneySMSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The template ID received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in
--   your country.
[$sel:templateId:JourneySMSMessage'] :: JourneySMSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The SMS message type. Valid values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages
--   that are critical or time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and
--   PROMOTIONAL (for messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive,
--   such as marketing messages).
[$sel:messageType:JourneySMSMessage'] :: JourneySMSMessage -> Maybe MessageType

-- | The sender ID to display as the sender of the message on a recipient's
--   device. Support for sender IDs varies by country or region. For more
--   information, see <a>Supported Countries and Regions</a> in the Amazon
--   Pinpoint User Guide.
[$sel:senderId:JourneySMSMessage'] :: JourneySMSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The entity ID or Principal Entity (PE) id received from the regulatory
--   body for sending SMS in your country.
[$sel:entityId:JourneySMSMessage'] :: JourneySMSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneySMSMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:originationNumber:JourneySMSMessage'</a>,
--   <a>journeySMSMessage_originationNumber</a> - The long code to send the
--   SMS message from. This value should be one of the dedicated long codes
--   that's assigned to your AWS account. Although it isn't required, we
--   recommend that you specify the long code using an E.164 format to
--   ensure prompt and accurate delivery of the message. For example,
--   +12065550100.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateId:JourneySMSMessage'</a>,
--   <a>journeySMSMessage_templateId</a> - The template ID received from
--   the regulatory body for sending SMS in your country.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageType:JourneySMSMessage'</a>,
--   <a>journeySMSMessage_messageType</a> - The SMS message type. Valid
--   values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages that are critical or
--   time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and PROMOTIONAL (for
--   messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive, such as marketing
--   messages).
--   
--   <a>$sel:senderId:JourneySMSMessage'</a>,
--   <a>journeySMSMessage_senderId</a> - The sender ID to display as the
--   sender of the message on a recipient's device. Support for sender IDs
--   varies by country or region. For more information, see <a>Supported
--   Countries and Regions</a> in the Amazon Pinpoint User Guide.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entityId:JourneySMSMessage'</a>,
--   <a>journeySMSMessage_entityId</a> - The entity ID or Principal Entity
--   (PE) id received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in your
--   country.
newJourneySMSMessage :: JourneySMSMessage

-- | The long code to send the SMS message from. This value should be one
--   of the dedicated long codes that's assigned to your AWS account.
--   Although it isn't required, we recommend that you specify the long
--   code using an E.164 format to ensure prompt and accurate delivery of
--   the message. For example, +12065550100.
journeySMSMessage_originationNumber :: Lens' JourneySMSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The template ID received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in
--   your country.
journeySMSMessage_templateId :: Lens' JourneySMSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The SMS message type. Valid values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages
--   that are critical or time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and
--   PROMOTIONAL (for messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive,
--   such as marketing messages).
journeySMSMessage_messageType :: Lens' JourneySMSMessage (Maybe MessageType)

-- | The sender ID to display as the sender of the message on a recipient's
--   device. Support for sender IDs varies by country or region. For more
--   information, see <a>Supported Countries and Regions</a> in the Amazon
--   Pinpoint User Guide.
journeySMSMessage_senderId :: Lens' JourneySMSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The entity ID or Principal Entity (PE) id received from the regulatory
--   body for sending SMS in your country.
journeySMSMessage_entityId :: Lens' JourneySMSMessage (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneySMSMessage.JourneySMSMessage
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneySMSMessage.JourneySMSMessage
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneySMSMessage.JourneySMSMessage
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneySMSMessage.JourneySMSMessage
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneySMSMessage.JourneySMSMessage
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneySMSMessage.JourneySMSMessage
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneySMSMessage.JourneySMSMessage
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneySMSMessage.JourneySMSMessage


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignSmsMessage

-- | Specifies the content and settings for an SMS message that's sent to
--   recipients of a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignSmsMessage</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignSmsMessage
CampaignSmsMessage' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MessageType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CampaignSmsMessage

-- | The long code to send the SMS message from. This value should be one
--   of the dedicated long codes that's assigned to your AWS account.
--   Although it isn't required, we recommend that you specify the long
--   code using an E.164 format to ensure prompt and accurate delivery of
--   the message. For example, +12065550100.
[$sel:originationNumber:CampaignSmsMessage'] :: CampaignSmsMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The template ID received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in
--   your country.
[$sel:templateId:CampaignSmsMessage'] :: CampaignSmsMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The body of the SMS message.
[$sel:body:CampaignSmsMessage'] :: CampaignSmsMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The SMS message type. Valid values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages
--   that are critical or time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and
--   PROMOTIONAL (for messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive,
--   such as marketing messages).
[$sel:messageType:CampaignSmsMessage'] :: CampaignSmsMessage -> Maybe MessageType

-- | The sender ID to display on recipients' devices when they receive the
--   SMS message.
[$sel:senderId:CampaignSmsMessage'] :: CampaignSmsMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The entity ID or Principal Entity (PE) id received from the regulatory
--   body for sending SMS in your country.
[$sel:entityId:CampaignSmsMessage'] :: CampaignSmsMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignSmsMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:originationNumber:CampaignSmsMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignSmsMessage_originationNumber</a> - The long code to send
--   the SMS message from. This value should be one of the dedicated long
--   codes that's assigned to your AWS account. Although it isn't required,
--   we recommend that you specify the long code using an E.164 format to
--   ensure prompt and accurate delivery of the message. For example,
--   +12065550100.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateId:CampaignSmsMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignSmsMessage_templateId</a> - The template ID received from
--   the regulatory body for sending SMS in your country.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:CampaignSmsMessage'</a>, <a>campaignSmsMessage_body</a> -
--   The body of the SMS message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageType:CampaignSmsMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignSmsMessage_messageType</a> - The SMS message type. Valid
--   values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages that are critical or
--   time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and PROMOTIONAL (for
--   messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive, such as marketing
--   messages).
--   
--   <a>$sel:senderId:CampaignSmsMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignSmsMessage_senderId</a> - The sender ID to display on
--   recipients' devices when they receive the SMS message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entityId:CampaignSmsMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignSmsMessage_entityId</a> - The entity ID or Principal Entity
--   (PE) id received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in your
--   country.
newCampaignSmsMessage :: CampaignSmsMessage

-- | The long code to send the SMS message from. This value should be one
--   of the dedicated long codes that's assigned to your AWS account.
--   Although it isn't required, we recommend that you specify the long
--   code using an E.164 format to ensure prompt and accurate delivery of
--   the message. For example, +12065550100.
campaignSmsMessage_originationNumber :: Lens' CampaignSmsMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The template ID received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in
--   your country.
campaignSmsMessage_templateId :: Lens' CampaignSmsMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The body of the SMS message.
campaignSmsMessage_body :: Lens' CampaignSmsMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The SMS message type. Valid values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages
--   that are critical or time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and
--   PROMOTIONAL (for messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive,
--   such as marketing messages).
campaignSmsMessage_messageType :: Lens' CampaignSmsMessage (Maybe MessageType)

-- | The sender ID to display on recipients' devices when they receive the
--   SMS message.
campaignSmsMessage_senderId :: Lens' CampaignSmsMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The entity ID or Principal Entity (PE) id received from the regulatory
--   body for sending SMS in your country.
campaignSmsMessage_entityId :: Lens' CampaignSmsMessage (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignSmsMessage.CampaignSmsMessage
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignSmsMessage.CampaignSmsMessage
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignSmsMessage.CampaignSmsMessage
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignSmsMessage.CampaignSmsMessage
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignSmsMessage.CampaignSmsMessage
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignSmsMessage.CampaignSmsMessage
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignSmsMessage.CampaignSmsMessage
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignSmsMessage.CampaignSmsMessage


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MetricDimension

-- | Specifies metric-based criteria for including or excluding endpoints
--   from a segment. These criteria derive from custom metrics that you
--   define for endpoints.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricDimension</a> smart constructor.
data MetricDimension
MetricDimension' :: Text -> Double -> MetricDimension

-- | The operator to use when comparing metric values. Valid values are:
--   GREATER_THAN, LESS_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL,
--   and EQUAL.
[$sel:comparisonOperator:MetricDimension'] :: MetricDimension -> Text

-- | The value to compare.
[$sel:value:MetricDimension'] :: MetricDimension -> Double

-- | Create a value of <a>MetricDimension</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparisonOperator:MetricDimension'</a>,
--   <a>metricDimension_comparisonOperator</a> - The operator to use when
--   comparing metric values. Valid values are: GREATER_THAN, LESS_THAN,
--   GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL, and EQUAL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:MetricDimension'</a>, <a>metricDimension_value</a> - The
--   value to compare.
newMetricDimension :: Text -> Double -> MetricDimension

-- | The operator to use when comparing metric values. Valid values are:
--   GREATER_THAN, LESS_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL,
--   and EQUAL.
metricDimension_comparisonOperator :: Lens' MetricDimension Text

-- | The value to compare.
metricDimension_value :: Lens' MetricDimension Double
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignHook

-- | Specifies settings for invoking an AWS Lambda function that customizes
--   a segment for a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignHook</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignHook
CampaignHook' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Mode -> Maybe Text -> CampaignHook

-- | The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function that
--   Amazon Pinpoint invokes to customize a segment for a campaign.
[$sel:lambdaFunctionName:CampaignHook'] :: CampaignHook -> Maybe Text

-- | The mode that Amazon Pinpoint uses to invoke the AWS Lambda function.
--   Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>FILTER - Invoke the function to customize the segment that's used
--   by a campaign.</li>
--   <li>DELIVERY - (Deprecated) Previously, invoked the function to send a
--   campaign through a custom channel. This functionality is not supported
--   anymore. To send a campaign through a custom channel, use the
--   CustomDeliveryConfiguration and CampaignCustomMessage objects of the
--   campaign.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:mode:CampaignHook'] :: CampaignHook -> Maybe Mode

-- | The web URL that Amazon Pinpoint calls to invoke the AWS Lambda
--   function over HTTPS.
[$sel:webUrl:CampaignHook'] :: CampaignHook -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignHook</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lambdaFunctionName:CampaignHook'</a>,
--   <a>campaignHook_lambdaFunctionName</a> - The name or Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function that Amazon Pinpoint invokes to
--   customize a segment for a campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mode:CampaignHook'</a>, <a>campaignHook_mode</a> - The mode
--   that Amazon Pinpoint uses to invoke the AWS Lambda function. Possible
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>FILTER - Invoke the function to customize the segment that's used
--   by a campaign.</li>
--   <li>DELIVERY - (Deprecated) Previously, invoked the function to send a
--   campaign through a custom channel. This functionality is not supported
--   anymore. To send a campaign through a custom channel, use the
--   CustomDeliveryConfiguration and CampaignCustomMessage objects of the
--   campaign.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:webUrl:CampaignHook'</a>, <a>campaignHook_webUrl</a> - The web
--   URL that Amazon Pinpoint calls to invoke the AWS Lambda function over
--   HTTPS.
newCampaignHook :: CampaignHook

-- | The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function that
--   Amazon Pinpoint invokes to customize a segment for a campaign.
campaignHook_lambdaFunctionName :: Lens' CampaignHook (Maybe Text)

-- | The mode that Amazon Pinpoint uses to invoke the AWS Lambda function.
--   Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>FILTER - Invoke the function to customize the segment that's used
--   by a campaign.</li>
--   <li>DELIVERY - (Deprecated) Previously, invoked the function to send a
--   campaign through a custom channel. This functionality is not supported
--   anymore. To send a campaign through a custom channel, use the
--   CustomDeliveryConfiguration and CampaignCustomMessage objects of the
--   campaign.</li>
--   </ul>
campaignHook_mode :: Lens' CampaignHook (Maybe Mode)

-- | The web URL that Amazon Pinpoint calls to invoke the AWS Lambda
--   function over HTTPS.
campaignHook_webUrl :: Lens' CampaignHook (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignHook.CampaignHook
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignHook.CampaignHook
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignHook.CampaignHook
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignHook.CampaignHook
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignHook.CampaignHook
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignHook.CampaignHook
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignHook.CampaignHook
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignHook.CampaignHook


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.NumberValidateRequest

-- | Specifies a phone number to validate and retrieve information about.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNumberValidateRequest</a> smart constructor.
data NumberValidateRequest
NumberValidateRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NumberValidateRequest

-- | The two-character code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, for the country
--   or region where the phone number was originally registered.
[$sel:isoCountryCode:NumberValidateRequest'] :: NumberValidateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The phone number to retrieve information about. The phone number that
--   you provide should include a valid numeric country code. Otherwise,
--   the operation might result in an error.
[$sel:phoneNumber:NumberValidateRequest'] :: NumberValidateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>NumberValidateRequest</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:isoCountryCode:NumberValidateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateRequest_isoCountryCode</a> - The two-character code,
--   in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, for the country or region where the
--   phone number was originally registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneNumber:NumberValidateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateRequest_phoneNumber</a> - The phone number to
--   retrieve information about. The phone number that you provide should
--   include a valid numeric country code. Otherwise, the operation might
--   result in an error.
newNumberValidateRequest :: NumberValidateRequest

-- | The two-character code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, for the country
--   or region where the phone number was originally registered.
numberValidateRequest_isoCountryCode :: Lens' NumberValidateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The phone number to retrieve information about. The phone number that
--   you provide should include a valid numeric country code. Otherwise,
--   the operation might result in an error.
numberValidateRequest_phoneNumber :: Lens' NumberValidateRequest (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.NumberValidateRequest.NumberValidateRequest
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.NumberValidateRequest.NumberValidateRequest
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.NumberValidateRequest.NumberValidateRequest
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.NumberValidateRequest.NumberValidateRequest
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.NumberValidateRequest.NumberValidateRequest
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.NumberValidateRequest.NumberValidateRequest
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.NumberValidateRequest.NumberValidateRequest


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.NumberValidateResponse

-- | Provides information about a phone number.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNumberValidateResponse</a> smart constructor.
data NumberValidateResponse
NumberValidateResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NumberValidateResponse

-- | The carrier or service provider that the phone number is currently
--   registered with. In some countries and regions, this value may be the
--   carrier or service provider that the phone number was originally
--   registered with.
[$sel:carrier:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the county where the phone number was originally
--   registered.
[$sel:county:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the country or region where the phone number was
--   originally registered.
[$sel:country:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The numeric code for the country or region where the phone number was
--   originally registered.
[$sel:countryCodeNumeric:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The postal or ZIP code for the location where the phone number was
--   originally registered.
[$sel:zipCode:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The phone number that was sent in the request body.
[$sel:originalPhoneNumber:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The phone type, represented by an integer. Valid values are: 0
--   (mobile), 1 (landline), 2 (VoIP), 3 (invalid), 4 (other), and 5
--   (prepaid).
[$sel:phoneTypeCode:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The description of the phone type. Valid values are: MOBILE, LANDLINE,
--   VOIP, INVALID, PREPAID, and OTHER.
[$sel:phoneType:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the city where the phone number was originally registered.
[$sel:city:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The two-character code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, for the country
--   or region where the phone number was originally registered.
[$sel:countryCodeIso2:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The time zone for the location where the phone number was originally
--   registered.
[$sel:timezone:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The two-character code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, that was sent in
--   the request body.
[$sel:originalCountryCodeIso2:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The cleansed phone number, in the format for the location where the
--   phone number was originally registered.
[$sel:cleansedPhoneNumberNational:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The cleansed phone number, in E.164 format, for the location where the
--   phone number was originally registered.
[$sel:cleansedPhoneNumberE164:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>NumberValidateResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:carrier:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_carrier</a> - The carrier or service
--   provider that the phone number is currently registered with. In some
--   countries and regions, this value may be the carrier or service
--   provider that the phone number was originally registered with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:county:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_county</a> - The name of the county where
--   the phone number was originally registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:country:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_country</a> - The name of the country or
--   region where the phone number was originally registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:countryCodeNumeric:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_countryCodeNumeric</a> - The numeric code
--   for the country or region where the phone number was originally
--   registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:zipCode:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_zipCode</a> - The postal or ZIP code for the
--   location where the phone number was originally registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:originalPhoneNumber:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_originalPhoneNumber</a> - The phone number
--   that was sent in the request body.
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneTypeCode:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_phoneTypeCode</a> - The phone type,
--   represented by an integer. Valid values are: 0 (mobile), 1 (landline),
--   2 (VoIP), 3 (invalid), 4 (other), and 5 (prepaid).
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneType:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_phoneType</a> - The description of the phone
--   type. Valid values are: MOBILE, LANDLINE, VOIP, INVALID, PREPAID, and
--   OTHER.
--   
--   <a>$sel:city:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_city</a> - The name of the city where the
--   phone number was originally registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:countryCodeIso2:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_countryCodeIso2</a> - The two-character
--   code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, for the country or region where
--   the phone number was originally registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timezone:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_timezone</a> - The time zone for the
--   location where the phone number was originally registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:originalCountryCodeIso2:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_originalCountryCodeIso2</a> - The
--   two-character code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, that was sent in the
--   request body.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cleansedPhoneNumberNational:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_cleansedPhoneNumberNational</a> - The
--   cleansed phone number, in the format for the location where the phone
--   number was originally registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cleansedPhoneNumberE164:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_cleansedPhoneNumberE164</a> - The cleansed
--   phone number, in E.164 format, for the location where the phone number
--   was originally registered.
newNumberValidateResponse :: NumberValidateResponse

-- | The carrier or service provider that the phone number is currently
--   registered with. In some countries and regions, this value may be the
--   carrier or service provider that the phone number was originally
--   registered with.
numberValidateResponse_carrier :: Lens' NumberValidateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the county where the phone number was originally
--   registered.
numberValidateResponse_county :: Lens' NumberValidateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the country or region where the phone number was
--   originally registered.
numberValidateResponse_country :: Lens' NumberValidateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The numeric code for the country or region where the phone number was
--   originally registered.
numberValidateResponse_countryCodeNumeric :: Lens' NumberValidateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The postal or ZIP code for the location where the phone number was
--   originally registered.
numberValidateResponse_zipCode :: Lens' NumberValidateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The phone number that was sent in the request body.
numberValidateResponse_originalPhoneNumber :: Lens' NumberValidateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The phone type, represented by an integer. Valid values are: 0
--   (mobile), 1 (landline), 2 (VoIP), 3 (invalid), 4 (other), and 5
--   (prepaid).
numberValidateResponse_phoneTypeCode :: Lens' NumberValidateResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The description of the phone type. Valid values are: MOBILE, LANDLINE,
--   VOIP, INVALID, PREPAID, and OTHER.
numberValidateResponse_phoneType :: Lens' NumberValidateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the city where the phone number was originally registered.
numberValidateResponse_city :: Lens' NumberValidateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The two-character code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, for the country
--   or region where the phone number was originally registered.
numberValidateResponse_countryCodeIso2 :: Lens' NumberValidateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The time zone for the location where the phone number was originally
--   registered.
numberValidateResponse_timezone :: Lens' NumberValidateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The two-character code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, that was sent in
--   the request body.
numberValidateResponse_originalCountryCodeIso2 :: Lens' NumberValidateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The cleansed phone number, in the format for the location where the
--   phone number was originally registered.
numberValidateResponse_cleansedPhoneNumberNational :: Lens' NumberValidateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The cleansed phone number, in E.164 format, for the location where the
--   phone number was originally registered.
numberValidateResponse_cleansedPhoneNumberE164 :: Lens' NumberValidateResponse (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.NumberValidateResponse.NumberValidateResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.NumberValidateResponse.NumberValidateResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.NumberValidateResponse.NumberValidateResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.NumberValidateResponse.NumberValidateResponse
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.NumberValidateResponse.NumberValidateResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.NumberValidateResponse.NumberValidateResponse
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.NumberValidateResponse.NumberValidateResponse

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppTemplateRequest

-- | InApp Template Request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInAppTemplateRequest</a> smart constructor.
data InAppTemplateRequest
InAppTemplateRequest' :: Maybe Layout -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InAppMessageContent] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> InAppTemplateRequest

-- | The layout of the message.
[$sel:layout:InAppTemplateRequest'] :: InAppTemplateRequest -> Maybe Layout

-- | The description of the template.
[$sel:templateDescription:InAppTemplateRequest'] :: InAppTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The content of the message, can include up to 5 modals. Each modal
--   must contain a message, a header, and background color. ImageUrl and
--   buttons are optional.
[$sel:content:InAppTemplateRequest'] :: InAppTemplateRequest -> Maybe [InAppMessageContent]

-- | Custom config to be sent to client.
[$sel:customConfig:InAppTemplateRequest'] :: InAppTemplateRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:InAppTemplateRequest'] :: InAppTemplateRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>InAppTemplateRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:layout:InAppTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateRequest_layout</a> - The layout of the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:InAppTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateRequest_templateDescription</a> - The description of
--   the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:InAppTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateRequest_content</a> - The content of the message, can
--   include up to 5 modals. Each modal must contain a message, a header,
--   and background color. ImageUrl and buttons are optional.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customConfig:InAppTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateRequest_customConfig</a> - Custom config to be sent to
--   client.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:InAppTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateRequest_tags</a> - A string-to-string map of key-value
--   pairs that defines the tags to associate with the message template.
--   Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.
newInAppTemplateRequest :: InAppTemplateRequest

-- | The layout of the message.
inAppTemplateRequest_layout :: Lens' InAppTemplateRequest (Maybe Layout)

-- | The description of the template.
inAppTemplateRequest_templateDescription :: Lens' InAppTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The content of the message, can include up to 5 modals. Each modal
--   must contain a message, a header, and background color. ImageUrl and
--   buttons are optional.
inAppTemplateRequest_content :: Lens' InAppTemplateRequest (Maybe [InAppMessageContent])

-- | Custom config to be sent to client.
inAppTemplateRequest_customConfig :: Lens' InAppTemplateRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
inAppTemplateRequest_tags :: Lens' InAppTemplateRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppTemplateRequest.InAppTemplateRequest
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppTemplateRequest.InAppTemplateRequest
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppTemplateRequest.InAppTemplateRequest
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppTemplateRequest.InAppTemplateRequest
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppTemplateRequest.InAppTemplateRequest
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppTemplateRequest.InAppTemplateRequest
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppTemplateRequest.InAppTemplateRequest

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageConfiguration

-- | Specifies the message configuration settings for a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessageConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data MessageConfiguration
MessageConfiguration' :: Maybe Message -> Maybe Message -> Maybe Message -> Maybe CampaignCustomMessage -> Maybe Message -> Maybe CampaignSmsMessage -> Maybe CampaignEmailMessage -> Maybe CampaignInAppMessage -> Maybe Message -> MessageConfiguration

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the APNs (Apple Push
--   Notification service) channel. If specified, this message overrides
--   the default message.
[$sel:aPNSMessage:MessageConfiguration'] :: MessageConfiguration -> Maybe Message

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the GCM channel, which
--   enables Amazon Pinpoint to send push notifications through the
--   Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM),
--   service. If specified, this message overrides the default message.
[$sel:gCMMessage:MessageConfiguration'] :: MessageConfiguration -> Maybe Message

-- | The default message that the campaign sends through all the channels
--   that are configured for the campaign.
[$sel:defaultMessage:MessageConfiguration'] :: MessageConfiguration -> Maybe Message

-- | The message that the campaign sends through a custom channel, as
--   specified by the delivery configuration (CustomDeliveryConfiguration)
--   settings for the campaign. If specified, this message overrides the
--   default message.
[$sel:customMessage:MessageConfiguration'] :: MessageConfiguration -> Maybe CampaignCustomMessage

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the ADM (Amazon Device
--   Messaging) channel. If specified, this message overrides the default
--   message.
[$sel:aDMMessage:MessageConfiguration'] :: MessageConfiguration -> Maybe Message

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the SMS channel. If
--   specified, this message overrides the default message.
[$sel:sMSMessage:MessageConfiguration'] :: MessageConfiguration -> Maybe CampaignSmsMessage

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the email channel. If
--   specified, this message overrides the default message.
[$sel:emailMessage:MessageConfiguration'] :: MessageConfiguration -> Maybe CampaignEmailMessage

-- | The in-app message configuration.
[$sel:inAppMessage:MessageConfiguration'] :: MessageConfiguration -> Maybe CampaignInAppMessage

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the Baidu (Baidu Cloud
--   Push) channel. If specified, this message overrides the default
--   message.
[$sel:baiduMessage:MessageConfiguration'] :: MessageConfiguration -> Maybe Message

-- | Create a value of <a>MessageConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:aPNSMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_aPNSMessage</a> - The message that the
--   campaign sends through the APNs (Apple Push Notification service)
--   channel. If specified, this message overrides the default message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gCMMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_gCMMessage</a> - The message that the campaign
--   sends through the GCM channel, which enables Amazon Pinpoint to send
--   push notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM),
--   formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service. If specified, this
--   message overrides the default message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_defaultMessage</a> - The default message that
--   the campaign sends through all the channels that are configured for
--   the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_customMessage</a> - The message that the
--   campaign sends through a custom channel, as specified by the delivery
--   configuration (CustomDeliveryConfiguration) settings for the campaign.
--   If specified, this message overrides the default message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:aDMMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_aDMMessage</a> - The message that the campaign
--   sends through the ADM (Amazon Device Messaging) channel. If specified,
--   this message overrides the default message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sMSMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_sMSMessage</a> - The message that the campaign
--   sends through the SMS channel. If specified, this message overrides
--   the default message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_emailMessage</a> - The message that the
--   campaign sends through the email channel. If specified, this message
--   overrides the default message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inAppMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_inAppMessage</a> - The in-app message
--   configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:baiduMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_baiduMessage</a> - The message that the
--   campaign sends through the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push) channel. If
--   specified, this message overrides the default message.
newMessageConfiguration :: MessageConfiguration

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the APNs (Apple Push
--   Notification service) channel. If specified, this message overrides
--   the default message.
messageConfiguration_aPNSMessage :: Lens' MessageConfiguration (Maybe Message)

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the GCM channel, which
--   enables Amazon Pinpoint to send push notifications through the
--   Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM),
--   service. If specified, this message overrides the default message.
messageConfiguration_gCMMessage :: Lens' MessageConfiguration (Maybe Message)

-- | The default message that the campaign sends through all the channels
--   that are configured for the campaign.
messageConfiguration_defaultMessage :: Lens' MessageConfiguration (Maybe Message)

-- | The message that the campaign sends through a custom channel, as
--   specified by the delivery configuration (CustomDeliveryConfiguration)
--   settings for the campaign. If specified, this message overrides the
--   default message.
messageConfiguration_customMessage :: Lens' MessageConfiguration (Maybe CampaignCustomMessage)

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the ADM (Amazon Device
--   Messaging) channel. If specified, this message overrides the default
--   message.
messageConfiguration_aDMMessage :: Lens' MessageConfiguration (Maybe Message)

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the SMS channel. If
--   specified, this message overrides the default message.
messageConfiguration_sMSMessage :: Lens' MessageConfiguration (Maybe CampaignSmsMessage)

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the email channel. If
--   specified, this message overrides the default message.
messageConfiguration_emailMessage :: Lens' MessageConfiguration (Maybe CampaignEmailMessage)

-- | The in-app message configuration.
messageConfiguration_inAppMessage :: Lens' MessageConfiguration (Maybe CampaignInAppMessage)

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the Baidu (Baidu Cloud
--   Push) channel. If specified, this message overrides the default
--   message.
messageConfiguration_baiduMessage :: Lens' MessageConfiguration (Maybe Message)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageConfiguration.MessageConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageConfiguration.MessageConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageConfiguration.MessageConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageConfiguration.MessageConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageConfiguration.MessageConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageConfiguration.MessageConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageConfiguration.MessageConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageConfiguration.MessageConfiguration


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.PublicEndpoint

-- | Specifies the properties and attributes of an endpoint that's
--   associated with an event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPublicEndpoint</a> smart constructor.
data PublicEndpoint
PublicEndpoint' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Double) -> Maybe EndpointLocation -> Maybe EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EndpointUser -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ChannelType -> PublicEndpoint

-- | A unique identifier that's generated each time the endpoint is
--   updated.
[$sel:requestId:PublicEndpoint'] :: PublicEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint
--   for the endpoint.
[$sel:metrics:PublicEndpoint'] :: PublicEndpoint -> Maybe (HashMap Text Double)

-- | The geographic information for the endpoint.
[$sel:location:PublicEndpoint'] :: PublicEndpoint -> Maybe EndpointLocation

-- | The demographic information for the endpoint, such as the time zone
--   and platform.
[$sel:demographic:PublicEndpoint'] :: PublicEndpoint -> Maybe EndpointDemographic

-- | The unique identifier for the recipient, such as a device token, email
--   address, or mobile phone number.
[$sel:address:PublicEndpoint'] :: PublicEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the endpoint was last
--   updated.
[$sel:effectiveDate:PublicEndpoint'] :: PublicEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more custom user attributes that your app reports to Amazon
--   Pinpoint for the user who's associated with the endpoint.
[$sel:user:PublicEndpoint'] :: PublicEndpoint -> Maybe EndpointUser

-- | One or more custom attributes that describe the endpoint by
--   associating a name with an array of values. You can use these
--   attributes as filter criteria when you create segments.
[$sel:attributes:PublicEndpoint'] :: PublicEndpoint -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | Specifies whether to send messages or push notifications to the
--   endpoint. Valid values are: ACTIVE, messages are sent to the endpoint;
--   and, INACTIVE, messages aren’t sent to the endpoint.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint automatically sets this value to ACTIVE when you
--   create an endpoint or update an existing endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint
--   automatically sets this value to INACTIVE if you update another
--   endpoint that has the same address specified by the Address property.
[$sel:endpointStatus:PublicEndpoint'] :: PublicEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the user who's associated with the endpoint has
--   opted out of receiving messages and push notifications from you.
--   Possible values are: ALL, the user has opted out and doesn't want to
--   receive any messages or push notifications; and, NONE, the user hasn't
--   opted out and wants to receive all messages and push notifications.
[$sel:optOut:PublicEndpoint'] :: PublicEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The channel that's used when sending messages or push notifications to
--   the endpoint.
[$sel:channelType:PublicEndpoint'] :: PublicEndpoint -> Maybe ChannelType

-- | Create a value of <a>PublicEndpoint</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestId:PublicEndpoint'</a>, <a>publicEndpoint_requestId</a>
--   - A unique identifier that's generated each time the endpoint is
--   updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:PublicEndpoint'</a>, <a>publicEndpoint_metrics</a> -
--   One or more custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint
--   for the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:PublicEndpoint'</a>, <a>publicEndpoint_location</a> -
--   The geographic information for the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:demographic:PublicEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>publicEndpoint_demographic</a> - The demographic information for
--   the endpoint, such as the time zone and platform.
--   
--   <a>$sel:address:PublicEndpoint'</a>, <a>publicEndpoint_address</a> -
--   The unique identifier for the recipient, such as a device token, email
--   address, or mobile phone number.
--   
--   <a>$sel:effectiveDate:PublicEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>publicEndpoint_effectiveDate</a> - The date and time, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the endpoint was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:user:PublicEndpoint'</a>, <a>publicEndpoint_user</a> - One or
--   more custom user attributes that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint
--   for the user who's associated with the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:PublicEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>publicEndpoint_attributes</a> - One or more custom attributes that
--   describe the endpoint by associating a name with an array of values.
--   You can use these attributes as filter criteria when you create
--   segments.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointStatus:PublicEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>publicEndpoint_endpointStatus</a> - Specifies whether to send
--   messages or push notifications to the endpoint. Valid values are:
--   ACTIVE, messages are sent to the endpoint; and, INACTIVE, messages
--   aren’t sent to the endpoint.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint automatically sets this value to ACTIVE when you
--   create an endpoint or update an existing endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint
--   automatically sets this value to INACTIVE if you update another
--   endpoint that has the same address specified by the Address property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:optOut:PublicEndpoint'</a>, <a>publicEndpoint_optOut</a> -
--   Specifies whether the user who's associated with the endpoint has
--   opted out of receiving messages and push notifications from you.
--   Possible values are: ALL, the user has opted out and doesn't want to
--   receive any messages or push notifications; and, NONE, the user hasn't
--   opted out and wants to receive all messages and push notifications.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelType:PublicEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>publicEndpoint_channelType</a> - The channel that's used when
--   sending messages or push notifications to the endpoint.
newPublicEndpoint :: PublicEndpoint

-- | A unique identifier that's generated each time the endpoint is
--   updated.
publicEndpoint_requestId :: Lens' PublicEndpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint
--   for the endpoint.
publicEndpoint_metrics :: Lens' PublicEndpoint (Maybe (HashMap Text Double))

-- | The geographic information for the endpoint.
publicEndpoint_location :: Lens' PublicEndpoint (Maybe EndpointLocation)

-- | The demographic information for the endpoint, such as the time zone
--   and platform.
publicEndpoint_demographic :: Lens' PublicEndpoint (Maybe EndpointDemographic)

-- | The unique identifier for the recipient, such as a device token, email
--   address, or mobile phone number.
publicEndpoint_address :: Lens' PublicEndpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the endpoint was last
--   updated.
publicEndpoint_effectiveDate :: Lens' PublicEndpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more custom user attributes that your app reports to Amazon
--   Pinpoint for the user who's associated with the endpoint.
publicEndpoint_user :: Lens' PublicEndpoint (Maybe EndpointUser)

-- | One or more custom attributes that describe the endpoint by
--   associating a name with an array of values. You can use these
--   attributes as filter criteria when you create segments.
publicEndpoint_attributes :: Lens' PublicEndpoint (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | Specifies whether to send messages or push notifications to the
--   endpoint. Valid values are: ACTIVE, messages are sent to the endpoint;
--   and, INACTIVE, messages aren’t sent to the endpoint.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint automatically sets this value to ACTIVE when you
--   create an endpoint or update an existing endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint
--   automatically sets this value to INACTIVE if you update another
--   endpoint that has the same address specified by the Address property.
publicEndpoint_endpointStatus :: Lens' PublicEndpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the user who's associated with the endpoint has
--   opted out of receiving messages and push notifications from you.
--   Possible values are: ALL, the user has opted out and doesn't want to
--   receive any messages or push notifications; and, NONE, the user hasn't
--   opted out and wants to receive all messages and push notifications.
publicEndpoint_optOut :: Lens' PublicEndpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The channel that's used when sending messages or push notifications to
--   the endpoint.
publicEndpoint_channelType :: Lens' PublicEndpoint (Maybe ChannelType)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.PublicEndpoint.PublicEndpoint
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.PublicEndpoint.PublicEndpoint
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.PublicEndpoint.PublicEndpoint
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.PublicEndpoint.PublicEndpoint
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.PublicEndpoint.PublicEndpoint
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.PublicEndpoint.PublicEndpoint
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.PublicEndpoint.PublicEndpoint


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.PushMessageActivity

-- | Specifies the settings for a push notification activity in a journey.
--   This type of activity sends a push notification to participants.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPushMessageActivity</a> smart constructor.
data PushMessageActivity
PushMessageActivity' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe JourneyPushMessage -> PushMessageActivity

-- | The name of the push notification template to use for the message. If
--   specified, this value must match the name of an existing message
--   template.
[$sel:templateName:PushMessageActivity'] :: PushMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the push notification
--   template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match
--   the identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of
--   versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template
--   Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
[$sel:templateVersion:PushMessageActivity'] :: PushMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after the
--   message is sent.
[$sel:nextActivity:PushMessageActivity'] :: PushMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the time to live (TTL) value for push notifications that are
--   sent to participants in a journey.
[$sel:messageConfig:PushMessageActivity'] :: PushMessageActivity -> Maybe JourneyPushMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>PushMessageActivity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:PushMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>pushMessageActivity_templateName</a> - The name of the push
--   notification template to use for the message. If specified, this value
--   must match the name of an existing message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateVersion:PushMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>pushMessageActivity_templateVersion</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the version of the push notification template to use for the message.
--   If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing
--   template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version
--   identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextActivity:PushMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>pushMessageActivity_nextActivity</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the next activity to perform, after the message is sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfig:PushMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>pushMessageActivity_messageConfig</a> - Specifies the time to live
--   (TTL) value for push notifications that are sent to participants in a
--   journey.
newPushMessageActivity :: PushMessageActivity

-- | The name of the push notification template to use for the message. If
--   specified, this value must match the name of an existing message
--   template.
pushMessageActivity_templateName :: Lens' PushMessageActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the push notification
--   template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match
--   the identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of
--   versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template
--   Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
pushMessageActivity_templateVersion :: Lens' PushMessageActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after the
--   message is sent.
pushMessageActivity_nextActivity :: Lens' PushMessageActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the time to live (TTL) value for push notifications that are
--   sent to participants in a journey.
pushMessageActivity_messageConfig :: Lens' PushMessageActivity (Maybe JourneyPushMessage)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.PushMessageActivity.PushMessageActivity
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.PushMessageActivity.PushMessageActivity
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.PushMessageActivity.PushMessageActivity
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.PushMessageActivity.PushMessageActivity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.PushMessageActivity.PushMessageActivity
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.PushMessageActivity.PushMessageActivity
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.PushMessageActivity.PushMessageActivity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.PushMessageActivity.PushMessageActivity


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.PushNotificationTemplateRequest

-- | Specifies the content and settings for a message template that can be
--   used in messages that are sent through a push notification channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPushNotificationTemplateRequest</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PushNotificationTemplateRequest
PushNotificationTemplateRequest' :: Maybe DefaultPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe APNSPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> PushNotificationTemplateRequest

-- | The default message template to use for push notification channels.
[$sel:default':PushNotificationTemplateRequest'] :: PushNotificationTemplateRequest -> Maybe DefaultPushNotificationTemplate

-- | A custom description of the message template.
[$sel:templateDescription:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'] :: PushNotificationTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The message template to use for the GCM channel, which is used to send
--   notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly
--   Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service. This message template overrides
--   the default template for push notification channels
--   (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
[$sel:gcm:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'] :: PushNotificationTemplateRequest -> Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate

-- | The message template to use for the APNs (Apple Push Notification
--   service) channel. This message template overrides the default template
--   for push notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
[$sel:apns:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'] :: PushNotificationTemplateRequest -> Maybe APNSPushNotificationTemplate

-- | A JSON object that specifies the default values to use for message
--   variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value
--   pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The
--   corresponding value defines the default value for that variable. When
--   you create a message that's based on the template, you can override
--   these defaults with message-specific and address-specific variables
--   and values.
[$sel:defaultSubstitutions:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'] :: PushNotificationTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The message template to use for the ADM (Amazon Device Messaging)
--   channel. This message template overrides the default template for push
--   notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
[$sel:adm:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'] :: PushNotificationTemplateRequest -> Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate

-- | The message template to use for the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push) channel.
--   This message template overrides the default template for push
--   notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
[$sel:baidu:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'] :: PushNotificationTemplateRequest -> Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate

-- | The unique identifier for the recommender model to use for the message
--   template. Amazon Pinpoint uses this value to determine how to retrieve
--   and process data from a recommender model when it sends messages that
--   use the template, if the template contains message variables for
--   recommendation data.
[$sel:recommenderId:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'] :: PushNotificationTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'] :: PushNotificationTemplateRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>PushNotificationTemplateRequest</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:default':PushNotificationTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>pushNotificationTemplateRequest_default</a> - The default message
--   template to use for push notification channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>pushNotificationTemplateRequest_templateDescription</a> - A custom
--   description of the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gcm:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>pushNotificationTemplateRequest_gcm</a> - The message template to
--   use for the GCM channel, which is used to send notifications through
--   the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly Google Cloud Messaging
--   (GCM), service. This message template overrides the default template
--   for push notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
--   
--   <a>$sel:apns:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>pushNotificationTemplateRequest_apns</a> - The message template to
--   use for the APNs (Apple Push Notification service) channel. This
--   message template overrides the default template for push notification
--   channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubstitutions:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>pushNotificationTemplateRequest_defaultSubstitutions</a> - A JSON
--   object that specifies the default values to use for message variables
--   in the message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each
--   key defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding
--   value defines the default value for that variable. When you create a
--   message that's based on the template, you can override these defaults
--   with message-specific and address-specific variables and values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:adm:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>pushNotificationTemplateRequest_adm</a> - The message template to
--   use for the ADM (Amazon Device Messaging) channel. This message
--   template overrides the default template for push notification channels
--   (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
--   
--   <a>$sel:baidu:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>pushNotificationTemplateRequest_baidu</a> - The message template to
--   use for the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push) channel. This message template
--   overrides the default template for push notification channels
--   (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommenderId:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>pushNotificationTemplateRequest_recommenderId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the recommender model to use for the message template.
--   Amazon Pinpoint uses this value to determine how to retrieve and
--   process data from a recommender model when it sends messages that use
--   the template, if the template contains message variables for
--   recommendation data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>pushNotificationTemplateRequest_tags</a> - A string-to-string map
--   of key-value pairs that defines the tags to associate with the message
--   template. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated
--   tag value.
newPushNotificationTemplateRequest :: PushNotificationTemplateRequest

-- | The default message template to use for push notification channels.
pushNotificationTemplateRequest_default :: Lens' PushNotificationTemplateRequest (Maybe DefaultPushNotificationTemplate)

-- | A custom description of the message template.
pushNotificationTemplateRequest_templateDescription :: Lens' PushNotificationTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The message template to use for the GCM channel, which is used to send
--   notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly
--   Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service. This message template overrides
--   the default template for push notification channels
--   (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
pushNotificationTemplateRequest_gcm :: Lens' PushNotificationTemplateRequest (Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate)

-- | The message template to use for the APNs (Apple Push Notification
--   service) channel. This message template overrides the default template
--   for push notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
pushNotificationTemplateRequest_apns :: Lens' PushNotificationTemplateRequest (Maybe APNSPushNotificationTemplate)

-- | A JSON object that specifies the default values to use for message
--   variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value
--   pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The
--   corresponding value defines the default value for that variable. When
--   you create a message that's based on the template, you can override
--   these defaults with message-specific and address-specific variables
--   and values.
pushNotificationTemplateRequest_defaultSubstitutions :: Lens' PushNotificationTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The message template to use for the ADM (Amazon Device Messaging)
--   channel. This message template overrides the default template for push
--   notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
pushNotificationTemplateRequest_adm :: Lens' PushNotificationTemplateRequest (Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate)

-- | The message template to use for the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push) channel.
--   This message template overrides the default template for push
--   notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
pushNotificationTemplateRequest_baidu :: Lens' PushNotificationTemplateRequest (Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate)

-- | The unique identifier for the recommender model to use for the message
--   template. Amazon Pinpoint uses this value to determine how to retrieve
--   and process data from a recommender model when it sends messages that
--   use the template, if the template contains message variables for
--   recommendation data.
pushNotificationTemplateRequest_recommenderId :: Lens' PushNotificationTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
pushNotificationTemplateRequest_tags :: Lens' PushNotificationTemplateRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.PushNotificationTemplateRequest.PushNotificationTemplateRequest
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.PushNotificationTemplateRequest.PushNotificationTemplateRequest
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.PushNotificationTemplateRequest.PushNotificationTemplateRequest
