instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.PushNotificationTemplateRequest.PushNotificationTemplateRequest


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.QuietTime

-- | Specifies the start and end times that define a time range when
--   messages aren't sent to endpoints.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newQuietTime</a> smart constructor.
data QuietTime
QuietTime' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> QuietTime

-- | The specific time when quiet time begins. This value has to use
--   24-hour notation and be in HH:MM format, where HH is the hour (with a
--   leading zero, if applicable) and MM is the minutes. For example, use
--   02:30 to represent 2:30 AM, or 14:30 to represent 2:30 PM.
[$sel:start:QuietTime'] :: QuietTime -> Maybe Text

-- | The specific time when quiet time ends. This value has to use 24-hour
--   notation and be in HH:MM format, where HH is the hour (with a leading
--   zero, if applicable) and MM is the minutes. For example, use 02:30 to
--   represent 2:30 AM, or 14:30 to represent 2:30 PM.
[$sel:end:QuietTime'] :: QuietTime -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>QuietTime</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:start:QuietTime'</a>, <a>quietTime_start</a> - The specific
--   time when quiet time begins. This value has to use 24-hour notation
--   and be in HH:MM format, where HH is the hour (with a leading zero, if
--   applicable) and MM is the minutes. For example, use 02:30 to represent
--   2:30 AM, or 14:30 to represent 2:30 PM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:end:QuietTime'</a>, <a>quietTime_end</a> - The specific time
--   when quiet time ends. This value has to use 24-hour notation and be in
--   HH:MM format, where HH is the hour (with a leading zero, if
--   applicable) and MM is the minutes. For example, use 02:30 to represent
--   2:30 AM, or 14:30 to represent 2:30 PM.
newQuietTime :: QuietTime

-- | The specific time when quiet time begins. This value has to use
--   24-hour notation and be in HH:MM format, where HH is the hour (with a
--   leading zero, if applicable) and MM is the minutes. For example, use
--   02:30 to represent 2:30 AM, or 14:30 to represent 2:30 PM.
quietTime_start :: Lens' QuietTime (Maybe Text)

-- | The specific time when quiet time ends. This value has to use 24-hour
--   notation and be in HH:MM format, where HH is the hour (with a leading
--   zero, if applicable) and MM is the minutes. For example, use 02:30 to
--   represent 2:30 AM, or 14:30 to represent 2:30 PM.
quietTime_end :: Lens' QuietTime (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.QuietTime.QuietTime
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.QuietTime.QuietTime
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.QuietTime.QuietTime
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.QuietTime.QuietTime
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.QuietTime.QuietTime
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.QuietTime.QuietTime
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.QuietTime.QuietTime
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.QuietTime.QuietTime


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationSettingsResource

-- | Provides information about an application, including the default
--   settings for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newApplicationSettingsResource</a> smart constructor.
data ApplicationSettingsResource
ApplicationSettingsResource' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe CampaignLimits -> Maybe QuietTime -> Maybe CampaignHook -> Text -> ApplicationSettingsResource

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the application's settings
--   were last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:ApplicationSettingsResource'] :: ApplicationSettingsResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The default sending limits for campaigns in the application.
[$sel:limits:ApplicationSettingsResource'] :: ApplicationSettingsResource -> Maybe CampaignLimits

-- | The default quiet time for campaigns in the application. Quiet time is
--   a specific time range when messages aren't sent to endpoints, if all
--   the following conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set
--   to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the endpoint will
--   receive messages from a campaign or journey, even if quiet time is
--   enabled.
[$sel:quietTime:ApplicationSettingsResource'] :: ApplicationSettingsResource -> Maybe QuietTime

-- | The settings for the AWS Lambda function to invoke by default as a
--   code hook for campaigns in the application. You can use this hook to
--   customize segments that are used by campaigns in the application.
[$sel:campaignHook:ApplicationSettingsResource'] :: ApplicationSettingsResource -> Maybe CampaignHook

-- | The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is
--   displayed as the <b>Project ID</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
[$sel:applicationId:ApplicationSettingsResource'] :: ApplicationSettingsResource -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ApplicationSettingsResource</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:ApplicationSettingsResource'</a>,
--   <a>applicationSettingsResource_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date and
--   time, in ISO 8601 format, when the application's settings were last
--   modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limits:ApplicationSettingsResource'</a>,
--   <a>applicationSettingsResource_limits</a> - The default sending limits
--   for campaigns in the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quietTime:ApplicationSettingsResource'</a>,
--   <a>applicationSettingsResource_quietTime</a> - The default quiet time
--   for campaigns in the application. Quiet time is a specific time range
--   when messages aren't sent to endpoints, if all the following
--   conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set
--   to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the endpoint will
--   receive messages from a campaign or journey, even if quiet time is
--   enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:campaignHook:ApplicationSettingsResource'</a>,
--   <a>applicationSettingsResource_campaignHook</a> - The settings for the
--   AWS Lambda function to invoke by default as a code hook for campaigns
--   in the application. You can use this hook to customize segments that
--   are used by campaigns in the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:ApplicationSettingsResource'</a>,
--   <a>applicationSettingsResource_applicationId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the application. This identifier is displayed as the
--   <b>Project ID</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
newApplicationSettingsResource :: Text -> ApplicationSettingsResource

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the application's settings
--   were last modified.
applicationSettingsResource_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' ApplicationSettingsResource (Maybe Text)

-- | The default sending limits for campaigns in the application.
applicationSettingsResource_limits :: Lens' ApplicationSettingsResource (Maybe CampaignLimits)

-- | The default quiet time for campaigns in the application. Quiet time is
--   a specific time range when messages aren't sent to endpoints, if all
--   the following conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set
--   to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the endpoint will
--   receive messages from a campaign or journey, even if quiet time is
--   enabled.
applicationSettingsResource_quietTime :: Lens' ApplicationSettingsResource (Maybe QuietTime)

-- | The settings for the AWS Lambda function to invoke by default as a
--   code hook for campaigns in the application. You can use this hook to
--   customize segments that are used by campaigns in the application.
applicationSettingsResource_campaignHook :: Lens' ApplicationSettingsResource (Maybe CampaignHook)

-- | The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is
--   displayed as the <b>Project ID</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
applicationSettingsResource_applicationId :: Lens' ApplicationSettingsResource Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationSettingsResource.ApplicationSettingsResource
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationSettingsResource.ApplicationSettingsResource
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationSettingsResource.ApplicationSettingsResource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationSettingsResource.ApplicationSettingsResource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationSettingsResource.ApplicationSettingsResource
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationSettingsResource.ApplicationSettingsResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ApplicationSettingsResource.ApplicationSettingsResource


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RandomSplitEntry

-- | Specifies the settings for a path in a random split activity in a
--   journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRandomSplitEntry</a> smart constructor.
data RandomSplitEntry
RandomSplitEntry' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> RandomSplitEntry

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after
--   completing the activity for the path.
[$sel:nextActivity:RandomSplitEntry'] :: RandomSplitEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The percentage of participants to send down the activity path.
--   
--   To determine which participants are sent down each path, Amazon
--   Pinpoint applies a probability-based algorithm to the percentages that
--   you specify for the paths. Therefore, the actual percentage of
--   participants who are sent down a path may not be equal to the
--   percentage that you specify.
[$sel:percentage:RandomSplitEntry'] :: RandomSplitEntry -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>RandomSplitEntry</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextActivity:RandomSplitEntry'</a>,
--   <a>randomSplitEntry_nextActivity</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   next activity to perform, after completing the activity for the path.
--   
--   <a>$sel:percentage:RandomSplitEntry'</a>,
--   <a>randomSplitEntry_percentage</a> - The percentage of participants to
--   send down the activity path.
--   
--   To determine which participants are sent down each path, Amazon
--   Pinpoint applies a probability-based algorithm to the percentages that
--   you specify for the paths. Therefore, the actual percentage of
--   participants who are sent down a path may not be equal to the
--   percentage that you specify.
newRandomSplitEntry :: RandomSplitEntry

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after
--   completing the activity for the path.
randomSplitEntry_nextActivity :: Lens' RandomSplitEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The percentage of participants to send down the activity path.
--   
--   To determine which participants are sent down each path, Amazon
--   Pinpoint applies a probability-based algorithm to the percentages that
--   you specify for the paths. Therefore, the actual percentage of
--   participants who are sent down a path may not be equal to the
--   percentage that you specify.
randomSplitEntry_percentage :: Lens' RandomSplitEntry (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RandomSplitEntry.RandomSplitEntry
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RandomSplitEntry.RandomSplitEntry
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RandomSplitEntry.RandomSplitEntry
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RandomSplitEntry.RandomSplitEntry
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RandomSplitEntry.RandomSplitEntry
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RandomSplitEntry.RandomSplitEntry
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RandomSplitEntry.RandomSplitEntry
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RandomSplitEntry.RandomSplitEntry


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RandomSplitActivity

-- | Specifies the settings for a random split activity in a journey. This
--   type of activity randomly sends specified percentages of participants
--   down one of as many as five paths in a journey, based on conditions
--   that you specify.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRandomSplitActivity</a> smart constructor.
data RandomSplitActivity
RandomSplitActivity' :: Maybe [RandomSplitEntry] -> RandomSplitActivity

-- | The paths for the activity, including the percentage of participants
--   to enter each path and the activity to perform for each path.
[$sel:branches:RandomSplitActivity'] :: RandomSplitActivity -> Maybe [RandomSplitEntry]

-- | Create a value of <a>RandomSplitActivity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:branches:RandomSplitActivity'</a>,
--   <a>randomSplitActivity_branches</a> - The paths for the activity,
--   including the percentage of participants to enter each path and the
--   activity to perform for each path.
newRandomSplitActivity :: RandomSplitActivity

-- | The paths for the activity, including the percentage of participants
--   to enter each path and the activity to perform for each path.
randomSplitActivity_branches :: Lens' RandomSplitActivity (Maybe [RandomSplitEntry])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RandomSplitActivity.RandomSplitActivity
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RandomSplitActivity.RandomSplitActivity
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RandomSplitActivity.RandomSplitActivity
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RandomSplitActivity.RandomSplitActivity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RandomSplitActivity.RandomSplitActivity
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RandomSplitActivity.RandomSplitActivity
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RandomSplitActivity.RandomSplitActivity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RandomSplitActivity.RandomSplitActivity


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RawEmail

-- | Specifies the contents of an email message, represented as a raw MIME
--   message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRawEmail</a> smart constructor.
data RawEmail
RawEmail' :: Maybe Base64 -> RawEmail

-- | The email message, represented as a raw MIME message. The entire
--   message must be base64 encoded.
[$sel:data':RawEmail'] :: RawEmail -> Maybe Base64

-- | Create a value of <a>RawEmail</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':RawEmail'</a>, <a>rawEmail_data</a> - The email message,
--   represented as a raw MIME message. The entire message must be base64
--   encoded.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes
--   and decodes Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will encode to
--   Base64 representation during -- serialisation, and decode from Base64
--   representation during deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts
--   and returns only raw unencoded data.
newRawEmail :: RawEmail

-- | The email message, represented as a raw MIME message. The entire
--   message must be base64 encoded.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt>
--   automatically encodes and decodes Base64 data. -- The underlying
--   isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation during --
--   serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw
--   unencoded data.
rawEmail_data :: Lens' RawEmail (Maybe ByteString)

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RecencyDimension

-- | Specifies criteria for including or excluding endpoints from a segment
--   based on how recently an endpoint was active.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecencyDimension</a> smart constructor.
data RecencyDimension
RecencyDimension' :: Duration -> RecencyType -> RecencyDimension

-- | The duration to use when determining whether an endpoint is active or
--   inactive.
[$sel:duration:RecencyDimension'] :: RecencyDimension -> Duration

-- | The type of recency dimension to use for the segment. Valid values
--   are: ACTIVE, endpoints that were active within the specified duration
--   are included in the segment; and, INACTIVE, endpoints that weren't
--   active within the specified duration are included in the segment.
[$sel:recencyType:RecencyDimension'] :: RecencyDimension -> RecencyType

-- | Create a value of <a>RecencyDimension</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:duration:RecencyDimension'</a>,
--   <a>recencyDimension_duration</a> - The duration to use when
--   determining whether an endpoint is active or inactive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recencyType:RecencyDimension'</a>,
--   <a>recencyDimension_recencyType</a> - The type of recency dimension to
--   use for the segment. Valid values are: ACTIVE, endpoints that were
--   active within the specified duration are included in the segment; and,
--   INACTIVE, endpoints that weren't active within the specified duration
--   are included in the segment.
newRecencyDimension :: Duration -> RecencyType -> RecencyDimension

-- | The duration to use when determining whether an endpoint is active or
--   inactive.
recencyDimension_duration :: Lens' RecencyDimension Duration

-- | The type of recency dimension to use for the segment. Valid values
--   are: ACTIVE, endpoints that were active within the specified duration
--   are included in the segment; and, INACTIVE, endpoints that weren't
--   active within the specified duration are included in the segment.
recencyDimension_recencyType :: Lens' RecencyDimension RecencyType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RecencyDimension.RecencyDimension
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RecencyDimension.RecencyDimension
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RecencyDimension.RecencyDimension
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RecencyDimension.RecencyDimension
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RecencyDimension.RecencyDimension
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RecencyDimension.RecencyDimension
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RecencyDimension.RecencyDimension
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RecencyDimension.RecencyDimension


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RecommenderConfigurationResponse

-- | Provides information about Amazon Pinpoint configuration settings for
--   retrieving and processing data from a recommender model.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecommenderConfigurationResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data RecommenderConfigurationResponse
RecommenderConfigurationResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> RecommenderConfigurationResponse

-- | The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function that
--   Amazon Pinpoint invokes to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data that it retrieves from the recommender model.
[$sel:recommendationTransformerUri:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The custom display name for the standard endpoint or user attribute
--   (RecommendationItems) that temporarily stores recommended items for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This name appears in the
--   <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template editor on the Amazon Pinpoint
--   console.
--   
--   This value is null if the configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional
--   processing of recommendation data.
[$sel:recommendationsDisplayName:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of Amazon Pinpoint ID that's associated with unique user IDs
--   in the recommender model. This value enables the model to use
--   attribute and event data that’s specific to a particular endpoint or
--   user in an Amazon Pinpoint application. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PINPOINT_ENDPOINT_ID - Each user in the model is associated with a
--   particular endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based
--   on endpoint IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. This is the default value.</li>
--   <li>PINPOINT_USER_ID - Each user in the model is associated with a
--   particular user and endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is
--   correlated based on user IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. If this value is
--   specified, an endpoint definition in Amazon Pinpoint has to specify
--   both a user ID (UserId) and an endpoint ID. Otherwise, messages won’t
--   be sent to the user's endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:recommendationProviderIdType:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A map that defines 1-10 custom endpoint or user attributes, depending
--   on the value for the RecommendationProviderIdType property. Each of
--   these attributes temporarily stores a recommended item that's
--   retrieved from the recommender model and sent to an AWS Lambda
--   function for additional processing. Each attribute can be used as a
--   message variable in a message template.
--   
--   This value is null if the configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional
--   processing of recommendation data.
[$sel:attributes:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The custom name of the configuration for the recommender model.
[$sel:name:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The custom description of the configuration for the recommender model.
[$sel:description:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of recommended items that are retrieved from the model for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This number determines how many
--   recommended items are available for use in message variables.
[$sel:recommendationsPerMessage:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender model that Amazon
--   Pinpoint retrieves the recommendation data from. This value is the ARN
--   of an Amazon Personalize campaign.
[$sel:recommendationProviderUri:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Text

-- | The date, in extended ISO 8601 format, when the configuration for the
--   recommender model was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Text

-- | The date, in extended ISO 8601 format, when the configuration was
--   created for the recommender model.
[$sel:creationDate:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to retrieve
--   recommendation data from the recommender model.
[$sel:recommendationProviderRoleArn:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the recommender model configuration.
[$sel:id:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RecommenderConfigurationResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationTransformerUri:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationTransformerUri</a> -
--   The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function that
--   Amazon Pinpoint invokes to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data that it retrieves from the recommender model.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationsDisplayName:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationsDisplayName</a> -
--   The custom display name for the standard endpoint or user attribute
--   (RecommendationItems) that temporarily stores recommended items for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This name appears in the
--   <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template editor on the Amazon Pinpoint
--   console.
--   
--   This value is null if the configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional
--   processing of recommendation data.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationProviderIdType:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationProviderIdType</a> -
--   The type of Amazon Pinpoint ID that's associated with unique user IDs
--   in the recommender model. This value enables the model to use
--   attribute and event data that’s specific to a particular endpoint or
--   user in an Amazon Pinpoint application. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PINPOINT_ENDPOINT_ID - Each user in the model is associated with a
--   particular endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based
--   on endpoint IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. This is the default value.</li>
--   <li>PINPOINT_USER_ID - Each user in the model is associated with a
--   particular user and endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is
--   correlated based on user IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. If this value is
--   specified, an endpoint definition in Amazon Pinpoint has to specify
--   both a user ID (UserId) and an endpoint ID. Otherwise, messages won’t
--   be sent to the user's endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_attributes</a> - A map that
--   defines 1-10 custom endpoint or user attributes, depending on the
--   value for the RecommendationProviderIdType property. Each of these
--   attributes temporarily stores a recommended item that's retrieved from
--   the recommender model and sent to an AWS Lambda function for
--   additional processing. Each attribute can be used as a message
--   variable in a message template.
--   
--   This value is null if the configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional
--   processing of recommendation data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_name</a> - The custom name of the
--   configuration for the recommender model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_description</a> - The custom
--   description of the configuration for the recommender model.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationsPerMessage:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationsPerMessage</a> -
--   The number of recommended items that are retrieved from the model for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This number determines how many
--   recommended items are available for use in message variables.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationProviderUri:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationProviderUri</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender model that Amazon
--   Pinpoint retrieves the recommendation data from. This value is the ARN
--   of an Amazon Personalize campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date,
--   in extended ISO 8601 format, when the configuration for the
--   recommender model was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in
--   extended ISO 8601 format, when the configuration was created for the
--   recommender model.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationProviderRoleArn:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationProviderRoleArn</a>
--   - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to retrieve
--   recommendation data from the recommender model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_id</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the recommender model configuration.
newRecommenderConfigurationResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> RecommenderConfigurationResponse

-- | The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function that
--   Amazon Pinpoint invokes to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data that it retrieves from the recommender model.
recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationTransformerUri :: Lens' RecommenderConfigurationResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The custom display name for the standard endpoint or user attribute
--   (RecommendationItems) that temporarily stores recommended items for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This name appears in the
--   <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template editor on the Amazon Pinpoint
--   console.
--   
--   This value is null if the configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional
--   processing of recommendation data.
recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationsDisplayName :: Lens' RecommenderConfigurationResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of Amazon Pinpoint ID that's associated with unique user IDs
--   in the recommender model. This value enables the model to use
--   attribute and event data that’s specific to a particular endpoint or
--   user in an Amazon Pinpoint application. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PINPOINT_ENDPOINT_ID - Each user in the model is associated with a
--   particular endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based
--   on endpoint IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. This is the default value.</li>
--   <li>PINPOINT_USER_ID - Each user in the model is associated with a
--   particular user and endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is
--   correlated based on user IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. If this value is
--   specified, an endpoint definition in Amazon Pinpoint has to specify
--   both a user ID (UserId) and an endpoint ID. Otherwise, messages won’t
--   be sent to the user's endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationProviderIdType :: Lens' RecommenderConfigurationResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A map that defines 1-10 custom endpoint or user attributes, depending
--   on the value for the RecommendationProviderIdType property. Each of
--   these attributes temporarily stores a recommended item that's
--   retrieved from the recommender model and sent to an AWS Lambda
--   function for additional processing. Each attribute can be used as a
--   message variable in a message template.
--   
--   This value is null if the configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional
--   processing of recommendation data.
recommenderConfigurationResponse_attributes :: Lens' RecommenderConfigurationResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The custom name of the configuration for the recommender model.
recommenderConfigurationResponse_name :: Lens' RecommenderConfigurationResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The custom description of the configuration for the recommender model.
recommenderConfigurationResponse_description :: Lens' RecommenderConfigurationResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of recommended items that are retrieved from the model for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This number determines how many
--   recommended items are available for use in message variables.
recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationsPerMessage :: Lens' RecommenderConfigurationResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender model that Amazon
--   Pinpoint retrieves the recommendation data from. This value is the ARN
--   of an Amazon Personalize campaign.
recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationProviderUri :: Lens' RecommenderConfigurationResponse Text

-- | The date, in extended ISO 8601 format, when the configuration for the
--   recommender model was last modified.
recommenderConfigurationResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' RecommenderConfigurationResponse Text

-- | The date, in extended ISO 8601 format, when the configuration was
--   created for the recommender model.
recommenderConfigurationResponse_creationDate :: Lens' RecommenderConfigurationResponse Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to retrieve
--   recommendation data from the recommender model.
recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationProviderRoleArn :: Lens' RecommenderConfigurationResponse Text

-- | The unique identifier for the recommender model configuration.
recommenderConfigurationResponse_id :: Lens' RecommenderConfigurationResponse Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RecommenderConfigurationResponse.RecommenderConfigurationResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RecommenderConfigurationResponse.RecommenderConfigurationResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RecommenderConfigurationResponse.RecommenderConfigurationResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RecommenderConfigurationResponse.RecommenderConfigurationResponse
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RecommenderConfigurationResponse.RecommenderConfigurationResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RecommenderConfigurationResponse.RecommenderConfigurationResponse
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.RecommenderConfigurationResponse.RecommenderConfigurationResponse


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse

-- | Provides information about all the recommender model configurations
--   that are associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse
ListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> [RecommenderConfigurationResponse] -> ListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
[$sel:nextToken:ListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse'] :: ListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of responses, one for each recommender model configuration
--   that's associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account.

--   all optional fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   use in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a
--   paginated response. This value is null if there are no additional
--   pages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:ListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listRecommenderConfigurationsResponse_item</a> - An array of
--   responses, one for each recommender model configuration that's
--   associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account.
newListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse :: ListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
listRecommenderConfigurationsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of responses, one for each recommender model configuration
--   that's associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account.
listRecommenderConfigurationsResponse_item :: Lens' ListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse [RecommenderConfigurationResponse]

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ResultRowValue

-- | Provides a single value and metadata about that value as part of an
--   array of query results for a standard metric that applies to an
--   application, campaign, or journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResultRowValue</a> smart constructor.
data ResultRowValue
ResultRowValue' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ResultRowValue

-- | The data type of the value specified by the Value property.
[$sel:type':ResultRowValue'] :: ResultRowValue -> Text

-- | In a Values object, the value for the metric that the query retrieved
--   data for. In a GroupedBys object, the value for the field that was
--   used to group data in a result set that contains multiple results
--   (Values objects).
[$sel:value:ResultRowValue'] :: ResultRowValue -> Text

-- | The friendly name of the metric whose value is specified by the Value
--   property.
[$sel:key:ResultRowValue'] :: ResultRowValue -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ResultRowValue</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ResultRowValue'</a>, <a>resultRowValue_type</a> - The
--   data type of the value specified by the Value property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:ResultRowValue'</a>, <a>resultRowValue_value</a> - In a
--   Values object, the value for the metric that the query retrieved data
--   for. In a GroupedBys object, the value for the field that was used to
--   group data in a result set that contains multiple results (Values
--   objects).
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:ResultRowValue'</a>, <a>resultRowValue_key</a> - The
--   friendly name of the metric whose value is specified by the Value
--   property.
newResultRowValue :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ResultRowValue

-- | The data type of the value specified by the Value property.
resultRowValue_type :: Lens' ResultRowValue Text

-- | In a Values object, the value for the metric that the query retrieved
--   data for. In a GroupedBys object, the value for the field that was
--   used to group data in a result set that contains multiple results
--   (Values objects).
resultRowValue_value :: Lens' ResultRowValue Text

-- | The friendly name of the metric whose value is specified by the Value
--   property.
resultRowValue_key :: Lens' ResultRowValue Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ResultRowValue.ResultRowValue
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ResultRowValue.ResultRowValue
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ResultRowValue.ResultRowValue
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ResultRowValue.ResultRowValue
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ResultRowValue.ResultRowValue
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ResultRowValue.ResultRowValue
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ResultRowValue.ResultRowValue


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ResultRow

-- | Provides the results of a query that retrieved the data for a standard
--   metric that applies to an application, campaign, or journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResultRow</a> smart constructor.
data ResultRow
ResultRow' :: [ResultRowValue] -> [ResultRowValue] -> ResultRow

-- | An array of objects that defines the field and field values that were
--   used to group data in a result set that contains multiple results.
--   This value is null if the data in a result set isn’t grouped.
[$sel:groupedBys:ResultRow'] :: ResultRow -> [ResultRowValue]

-- | An array of objects that provides pre-aggregated values for a standard
--   metric that applies to an application, campaign, or journey.
[$sel:values:ResultRow'] :: ResultRow -> [ResultRowValue]

-- | Create a value of <a>ResultRow</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupedBys:ResultRow'</a>, <a>resultRow_groupedBys</a> - An
--   array of objects that defines the field and field values that were
--   used to group data in a result set that contains multiple results.
--   This value is null if the data in a result set isn’t grouped.
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:ResultRow'</a>, <a>resultRow_values</a> - An array of
--   objects that provides pre-aggregated values for a standard metric that
--   applies to an application, campaign, or journey.
newResultRow :: ResultRow

-- | An array of objects that defines the field and field values that were
--   used to group data in a result set that contains multiple results.
--   This value is null if the data in a result set isn’t grouped.
resultRow_groupedBys :: Lens' ResultRow [ResultRowValue]

-- | An array of objects that provides pre-aggregated values for a standard
--   metric that applies to an application, campaign, or journey.
resultRow_values :: Lens' ResultRow [ResultRowValue]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ResultRow.ResultRow
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ResultRow.ResultRow
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ResultRow.ResultRow
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ResultRow.ResultRow
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ResultRow.ResultRow
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ResultRow.ResultRow
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ResultRow.ResultRow


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaseKpiResult

--   metric that applies to an application, campaign, or journey.

data BaseKpiResult

--   application, campaign, or journey.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   of objects that provides the results of a query that retrieved the
--   data for a standard metric that applies to an application, campaign,
--   or journey.
newBaseKpiResult :: BaseKpiResult

-- | An array of objects that provides the results of a query that
--   retrieved the data for a standard metric that applies to an
--   application, campaign, or journey.
baseKpiResult_rows :: Lens' BaseKpiResult [ResultRow]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaseKpiResult.BaseKpiResult
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.BaseKpiResult.BaseKpiResult

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse

-- | Provides the results of a query that retrieved the data for a standard
--   engagement metric that applies to a journey, and provides information
--   about that query.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneyDateRangeKpiResponse</a> smart constructor.
data JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse
JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse' :: Maybe Text -> BaseKpiResult -> Text -> Text -> POSIX -> POSIX -> Text -> JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null for the Journey
--   Engagement Metrics resource because the resource returns all results
--   in a single page.
[$sel:nextToken:JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of objects that contains the results of the query. Each
--   object contains the value for the metric and metadata about that
--   value.
[$sel:kpiResult:JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse -> BaseKpiResult

-- | The name of the metric, also referred to as a /key performance
--   indicator (KPI)/, that the data was retrieved for. This value
--   describes the associated metric and consists of two or more terms,
--   which are comprised of lowercase alphanumeric characters, separated by
--   a hyphen. For a list of possible values, see the <a>Amazon Pinpoint
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:kpiName:JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the journey that the metric applies to.
[$sel:journeyId:JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse -> Text

-- | The last date and time of the date range that was used to filter the
--   query results, in extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is
--   inclusive.
[$sel:endTime:JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse -> POSIX

-- | The first date and time of the date range that was used to filter the
--   query results, in extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is
--   inclusive.
[$sel:startTime:JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse -> POSIX

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the metric applies to.
[$sel:applicationId:JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyDateRangeKpiResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use in a
--   subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated
--   response. This value is null for the Journey Engagement Metrics
--   resource because the resource returns all results in a single page.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kpiResult:JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyDateRangeKpiResponse_kpiResult</a> - An array of objects
--   that contains the results of the query. Each object contains the value
--   for the metric and metadata about that value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kpiName:JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyDateRangeKpiResponse_kpiName</a> - The name of the metric,
--   also referred to as a /key performance indicator (KPI)/, that the data
--   was retrieved for. This value describes the associated metric and
--   consists of two or more terms, which are comprised of lowercase
--   alphanumeric characters, separated by a hyphen. For a list of possible
--   values, see the <a>Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:journeyId:JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyDateRangeKpiResponse_journeyId</a> - The unique identifier
--   for the journey that the metric applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyDateRangeKpiResponse_endTime</a> - The last date and time of
--   the date range that was used to filter the query results, in extended
--   ISO 8601 format. The date range is inclusive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyDateRangeKpiResponse_startTime</a> - The first date and time
--   of the date range that was used to filter the query results, in
--   extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is inclusive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyDateRangeKpiResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the application that the metric applies to.
newJourneyDateRangeKpiResponse :: BaseKpiResult -> Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> Text -> JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null for the Journey
--   Engagement Metrics resource because the resource returns all results
--   in a single page.
journeyDateRangeKpiResponse_nextToken :: Lens' JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of objects that contains the results of the query. Each
--   object contains the value for the metric and metadata about that
--   value.
journeyDateRangeKpiResponse_kpiResult :: Lens' JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse BaseKpiResult

-- | The name of the metric, also referred to as a /key performance
--   indicator (KPI)/, that the data was retrieved for. This value
--   describes the associated metric and consists of two or more terms,
--   which are comprised of lowercase alphanumeric characters, separated by
--   a hyphen. For a list of possible values, see the <a>Amazon Pinpoint
--   Developer Guide</a>.
journeyDateRangeKpiResponse_kpiName :: Lens' JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse Text

-- | The unique identifier for the journey that the metric applies to.
journeyDateRangeKpiResponse_journeyId :: Lens' JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse Text

-- | The last date and time of the date range that was used to filter the
--   query results, in extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is
--   inclusive.
journeyDateRangeKpiResponse_endTime :: Lens' JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse UTCTime

--   query results, in extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is
--   inclusive.

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse

-- | Provides the results of a query that retrieved the data for a standard
--   metric that applies to a campaign, and provides information about that
--   query.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignDateRangeKpiResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse
CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse' :: Maybe Text -> BaseKpiResult -> Text -> POSIX -> Text -> POSIX -> Text -> CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null for the Campaign
--   Metrics resource because the resource returns all results in a single
--   page.
[$sel:nextToken:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of objects that contains the results of the query. Each
--   object contains the value for the metric and metadata about that
--   value.
[$sel:kpiResult:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse -> BaseKpiResult

-- | The name of the metric, also referred to as a /key performance
--   indicator (KPI)/, that the data was retrieved for. This value
--   describes the associated metric and consists of two or more terms,
--   which are comprised of lowercase alphanumeric characters, separated by
--   a hyphen. For a list of possible values, see the <a>Amazon Pinpoint
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:kpiName:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse -> Text

-- | The last date and time of the date range that was used to filter the
--   query results, in extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is
--   inclusive.
[$sel:endTime:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse -> POSIX

-- | The unique identifier for the campaign that the metric applies to.
[$sel:campaignId:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse -> Text

-- | The first date and time of the date range that was used to filter the
--   query results, in extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is
--   inclusive.
[$sel:startTime:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse -> POSIX

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the metric applies to.
[$sel:applicationId:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse -> Text

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSChannelRequest

-- | Specifies the status and settings of the SMS channel for an
--   application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSMSChannelRequest</a> smart constructor.
data SMSChannelRequest
SMSChannelRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> SMSChannelRequest

-- | The registered short code that you want to use when you send messages
--   through the SMS channel.
[$sel:shortCode:SMSChannelRequest'] :: SMSChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether to enable the SMS channel for the application.
[$sel:enabled:SMSChannelRequest'] :: SMSChannelRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | The identity that you want to display on recipients' devices when they
--   receive messages from the SMS channel.
[$sel:senderId:SMSChannelRequest'] :: SMSChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SMSChannelRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:shortCode:SMSChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelRequest_shortCode</a> - The registered short code that
--   you want to use when you send messages through the SMS channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:SMSChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelRequest_enabled</a> - Specifies whether to enable the SMS
--   channel for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:senderId:SMSChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelRequest_senderId</a> - The identity that you want to
--   display on recipients' devices when they receive messages from the SMS
--   channel.
newSMSChannelRequest :: SMSChannelRequest

-- | The registered short code that you want to use when you send messages
--   through the SMS channel.
sMSChannelRequest_shortCode :: Lens' SMSChannelRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether to enable the SMS channel for the application.
sMSChannelRequest_enabled :: Lens' SMSChannelRequest (Maybe Bool)

-- | The identity that you want to display on recipients' devices when they
--   receive messages from the SMS channel.
sMSChannelRequest_senderId :: Lens' SMSChannelRequest (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSChannelRequest.SMSChannelRequest
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSChannelRequest.SMSChannelRequest
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSChannelRequest.SMSChannelRequest
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSChannelRequest.SMSChannelRequest
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSChannelRequest.SMSChannelRequest

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSChannelResponse

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of the SMS channel
--   for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSMSChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SMSChannelResponse
SMSChannelResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> SMSChannelResponse

-- | The registered short code to use when you send messages through the
--   SMS channel.
[$sel:shortCode:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the SMS channel was last
--   modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the SMS channel is enabled for the application.
[$sel:enabled:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The identity that displays on recipients' devices when they receive
--   messages from the SMS channel.
[$sel:senderId:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of transactional messages that you can send through
--   the SMS channel each second.
[$sel:transactionalMessagesPerSecond:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The maximum number of promotional messages that you can send through
--   the SMS channel each second.
[$sel:promotionalMessagesPerSecond:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies whether the SMS channel is archived.
[$sel:isArchived:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the SMS channel applies
--   to.
[$sel:applicationId:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The current version of the SMS channel.
[$sel:version:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the SMS channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:id:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the SMS channel was
--   enabled.
[$sel:creationDate:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The user who last modified the SMS channel.
[$sel:lastModifiedBy:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:hasCredential:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For
--   the SMS channel, this value is SMS.
[$sel:platform:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SMSChannelResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:shortCode:SMSChannelResponse'</a>,

--   when you send messages through the SMS channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:SMSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date and time, in ISO
--   8601 format, when the SMS channel was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:SMSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_enabled</a> - Specifies whether the SMS channel
--   is enabled for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:senderId:SMSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_senderId</a> - The identity that displays on
--   recipients' devices when they receive messages from the SMS channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transactionalMessagesPerSecond:SMSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_transactionalMessagesPerSecond</a> - The maximum
--   number of transactional messages that you can send through the SMS
--   channel each second.
--   
--   <a>$sel:promotionalMessagesPerSecond:SMSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_promotionalMessagesPerSecond</a> - The maximum
--   number of promotional messages that you can send through the SMS
--   channel each second.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isArchived:SMSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_isArchived</a> - Specifies whether the SMS
--   channel is archived.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:SMSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the application that the SMS channel applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:SMSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_version</a> - The current version of the SMS
--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:SMSChannelResponse'</a>, <a>sMSChannelResponse_id</a> -
--   (Deprecated) An identifier for the SMS channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:SMSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_creationDate</a> - The date and time, in ISO
--   8601 format, when the SMS channel was enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedBy:SMSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_lastModifiedBy</a> - The user who last modified
--   the SMS channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasCredential:SMSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_hasCredential</a> - (Not used) This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:SMSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_platform</a> - The type of messaging or
--   notification platform for the channel. For the SMS channel, this value
--   is SMS.
newSMSChannelResponse :: Text -> SMSChannelResponse

-- | The registered short code to use when you send messages through the
--   SMS channel.
sMSChannelResponse_shortCode :: Lens' SMSChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the SMS channel was last
--   modified.

--   messages from the SMS channel.

--   the SMS channel each second.

-- | The maximum number of promotional messages that you can send through
--   the SMS channel each second.

-- | Specifies whether the SMS channel is archived.
sMSChannelResponse_isArchived :: Lens' SMSChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

--   to.
sMSChannelResponse_applicationId :: Lens' SMSChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The current version of the SMS channel.
