module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSMessage

-- | Specifies the default settings for a one-time SMS message that's sent
--   directly to an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSMSMessage</a> smart constructor.
data SMSMessage
SMSMessage' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MessageType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> SMSMessage

-- | The message variables to use in the SMS message. You can override the
--   default variables with individual address variables.
[$sel:substitutions:SMSMessage'] :: SMSMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | The number to send the SMS message from. This value should be one of
--   the dedicated long or short codes that's assigned to your AWS account.
--   If you don't specify a long or short code, Amazon Pinpoint assigns a
--   random long code to the SMS message and sends the message from that
--   code.
[$sel:originationNumber:SMSMessage'] :: SMSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The template ID received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in
--   your country.
[$sel:templateId:SMSMessage'] :: SMSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The body of the SMS message.
[$sel:body:SMSMessage'] :: SMSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The SMS message type. Valid values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages
--   that are critical or time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and
--   PROMOTIONAL (for messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive,
--   such as marketing messages).
[$sel:messageType:SMSMessage'] :: SMSMessage -> Maybe MessageType

-- | The sender ID to display as the sender of the message on a recipient's
--   device. Support for sender IDs varies by country or region.
[$sel:senderId:SMSMessage'] :: SMSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | This field is reserved for future use.
[$sel:mediaUrl:SMSMessage'] :: SMSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The entity ID or Principal Entity (PE) id received from the regulatory
--   body for sending SMS in your country.
[$sel:entityId:SMSMessage'] :: SMSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The SMS program name that you provided to AWS Support when you
--   requested your dedicated number.
[$sel:keyword:SMSMessage'] :: SMSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SMSMessage</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_substitutions</a>
--   - The message variables to use in the SMS message. You can override
--   the default variables with individual address variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:originationNumber:SMSMessage'</a>,
--   <a>sMSMessage_originationNumber</a> - The number to send the SMS
--   message from. This value should be one of the dedicated long or short
--   codes that's assigned to your AWS account. If you don't specify a long
--   or short code, Amazon Pinpoint assigns a random long code to the SMS
--   message and sends the message from that code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateId:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_templateId</a> - The
--   template ID received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in your
--   country.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_body</a> - The body of the
--   SMS message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageType:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_messageType</a> -
--   The SMS message type. Valid values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages
--   that are critical or time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and
--   PROMOTIONAL (for messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive,
--   such as marketing messages).
--   
--   <a>$sel:senderId:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_senderId</a> - The
--   sender ID to display as the sender of the message on a recipient's
--   device. Support for sender IDs varies by country or region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaUrl:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_mediaUrl</a> - This
--   field is reserved for future use.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entityId:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_entityId</a> - The
--   entity ID or Principal Entity (PE) id received from the regulatory
--   body for sending SMS in your country.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyword:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_keyword</a> - The SMS
--   program name that you provided to AWS Support when you requested your
--   dedicated number.
newSMSMessage :: SMSMessage

-- | The message variables to use in the SMS message. You can override the
--   default variables with individual address variables.
sMSMessage_substitutions :: Lens' SMSMessage (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | The number to send the SMS message from. This value should be one of
--   the dedicated long or short codes that's assigned to your AWS account.
--   If you don't specify a long or short code, Amazon Pinpoint assigns a
--   random long code to the SMS message and sends the message from that
--   code.
sMSMessage_originationNumber :: Lens' SMSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The template ID received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in
--   your country.
sMSMessage_templateId :: Lens' SMSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The body of the SMS message.
sMSMessage_body :: Lens' SMSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The SMS message type. Valid values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages
--   that are critical or time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and
--   PROMOTIONAL (for messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive,
--   such as marketing messages).
sMSMessage_messageType :: Lens' SMSMessage (Maybe MessageType)

-- | The sender ID to display as the sender of the message on a recipient's
--   device. Support for sender IDs varies by country or region.
sMSMessage_senderId :: Lens' SMSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | This field is reserved for future use.
sMSMessage_mediaUrl :: Lens' SMSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The entity ID or Principal Entity (PE) id received from the regulatory
--   body for sending SMS in your country.
sMSMessage_entityId :: Lens' SMSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The SMS program name that you provided to AWS Support when you
--   requested your dedicated number.
sMSMessage_keyword :: Lens' SMSMessage (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSMessage.SMSMessage
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSMessage.SMSMessage
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSMessage.SMSMessage
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSMessage.SMSMessage
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSMessage.SMSMessage
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSMessage.SMSMessage
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSMessage.SMSMessage


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSMessageActivity

-- | Specifies the settings for an SMS activity in a journey. This type of
--   activity sends a text message to participants.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSMSMessageActivity</a> smart constructor.
data SMSMessageActivity
SMSMessageActivity' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe JourneySMSMessage -> SMSMessageActivity

-- | The name of the SMS message template to use for the message. If
--   specified, this value must match the name of an existing message
--   template.
[$sel:templateName:SMSMessageActivity'] :: SMSMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the SMS template to use for
--   the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an
--   existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version
--   identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
[$sel:templateVersion:SMSMessageActivity'] :: SMSMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after the
--   message is sent.
[$sel:nextActivity:SMSMessageActivity'] :: SMSMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the sender ID and message type for an SMS message that's
--   sent to participants in a journey.
[$sel:messageConfig:SMSMessageActivity'] :: SMSMessageActivity -> Maybe JourneySMSMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>SMSMessageActivity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:SMSMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>sMSMessageActivity_templateName</a> - The name of the SMS message
--   template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match
--   the name of an existing message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateVersion:SMSMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>sMSMessageActivity_templateVersion</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the version of the SMS template to use for the message. If specified,
--   this value must match the identifier for an existing template version.
--   To retrieve a list of versions and version identifiers for a template,
--   use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextActivity:SMSMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>sMSMessageActivity_nextActivity</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   next activity to perform, after the message is sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfig:SMSMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>sMSMessageActivity_messageConfig</a> - Specifies the sender ID and
--   message type for an SMS message that's sent to participants in a
--   journey.
newSMSMessageActivity :: SMSMessageActivity

-- | The name of the SMS message template to use for the message. If
--   specified, this value must match the name of an existing message
--   template.
sMSMessageActivity_templateName :: Lens' SMSMessageActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the SMS template to use for
--   the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an
--   existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version
--   identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
sMSMessageActivity_templateVersion :: Lens' SMSMessageActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after the
--   message is sent.
sMSMessageActivity_nextActivity :: Lens' SMSMessageActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the sender ID and message type for an SMS message that's
--   sent to participants in a journey.
sMSMessageActivity_messageConfig :: Lens' SMSMessageActivity (Maybe JourneySMSMessage)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSMessageActivity.SMSMessageActivity
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSMessageActivity.SMSMessageActivity
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSMessageActivity.SMSMessageActivity
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSMessageActivity.SMSMessageActivity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSMessageActivity.SMSMessageActivity
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSMessageActivity.SMSMessageActivity
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSMessageActivity.SMSMessageActivity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSMessageActivity.SMSMessageActivity


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSTemplateRequest

-- | Specifies the content and settings for a message template that can be
--   used in text messages that are sent through the SMS channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSMSTemplateRequest</a> smart constructor.
data SMSTemplateRequest
SMSTemplateRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> SMSTemplateRequest

-- | The message body to use in text messages that are based on the message
--   template.
[$sel:body:SMSTemplateRequest'] :: SMSTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A custom description of the message template.
[$sel:templateDescription:SMSTemplateRequest'] :: SMSTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A JSON object that specifies the default values to use for message
--   variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value
--   pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The
--   corresponding value defines the default value for that variable. When
--   you create a message that's based on the template, you can override
--   these defaults with message-specific and address-specific variables
--   and values.
[$sel:defaultSubstitutions:SMSTemplateRequest'] :: SMSTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the recommender model to use for the message
--   template. Amazon Pinpoint uses this value to determine how to retrieve
--   and process data from a recommender model when it sends messages that
--   use the template, if the template contains message variables for
--   recommendation data.
[$sel:recommenderId:SMSTemplateRequest'] :: SMSTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:SMSTemplateRequest'] :: SMSTemplateRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>SMSTemplateRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:SMSTemplateRequest'</a>, <a>sMSTemplateRequest_body</a> -
--   The message body to use in text messages that are based on the message
--   template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:SMSTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sMSTemplateRequest_templateDescription</a> - A custom description
--   of the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubstitutions:SMSTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sMSTemplateRequest_defaultSubstitutions</a> - A JSON object that
--   specifies the default values to use for message variables in the
--   message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key
--   defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding value
--   defines the default value for that variable. When you create a message
--   that's based on the template, you can override these defaults with
--   message-specific and address-specific variables and values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommenderId:SMSTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sMSTemplateRequest_recommenderId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the recommender model to use for the message template. Amazon Pinpoint
--   uses this value to determine how to retrieve and process data from a
--   recommender model when it sends messages that use the template, if the
--   template contains message variables for recommendation data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:SMSTemplateRequest'</a>, <a>sMSTemplateRequest_tags</a> -
--   A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
newSMSTemplateRequest :: SMSTemplateRequest

-- | The message body to use in text messages that are based on the message
--   template.
sMSTemplateRequest_body :: Lens' SMSTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A custom description of the message template.
sMSTemplateRequest_templateDescription :: Lens' SMSTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A JSON object that specifies the default values to use for message
--   variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value
--   pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The
--   corresponding value defines the default value for that variable. When
--   you create a message that's based on the template, you can override
--   these defaults with message-specific and address-specific variables
--   and values.
sMSTemplateRequest_defaultSubstitutions :: Lens' SMSTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the recommender model to use for the message
--   template. Amazon Pinpoint uses this value to determine how to retrieve
--   and process data from a recommender model when it sends messages that
--   use the template, if the template contains message variables for
--   recommendation data.
sMSTemplateRequest_recommenderId :: Lens' SMSTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
sMSTemplateRequest_tags :: Lens' SMSTemplateRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSTemplateRequest.SMSTemplateRequest
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSTemplateRequest.SMSTemplateRequest
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSTemplateRequest.SMSTemplateRequest
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSTemplateRequest.SMSTemplateRequest
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSTemplateRequest.SMSTemplateRequest
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSTemplateRequest.SMSTemplateRequest
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSTemplateRequest.SMSTemplateRequest

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentImportResource

-- | Provides information about the import job that created a segment. An
--   import job is a job that creates a user segment by importing endpoint
--   definitions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSegmentImportResource</a> smart constructor.
data SegmentImportResource
SegmentImportResource' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Int) -> DefinitionFormat -> Text -> Int -> Text -> Text -> SegmentImportResource

-- | The number of channel types in the endpoint definitions that were
--   imported to create the segment.
[$sel:channelCounts:SegmentImportResource'] :: SegmentImportResource -> Maybe (HashMap Text Int)

-- | The format of the files that were imported to create the segment.
--   Valid values are: CSV, for comma-separated values format; and, JSON,
--   for newline-delimited JSON format.
[$sel:format:SegmentImportResource'] :: SegmentImportResource -> DefinitionFormat

-- | The URL of the Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket that
--   the endpoint definitions were imported from to create the segment.
[$sel:s3Url:SegmentImportResource'] :: SegmentImportResource -> Text

-- | The number of endpoint definitions that were imported successfully to
--   create the segment.
[$sel:size:SegmentImportResource'] :: SegmentImportResource -> Int

-- | (Deprecated) Your AWS account ID, which you assigned to an external ID
--   key in an IAM trust policy. Amazon Pinpoint previously used this value
--   to assume an IAM role when importing endpoint definitions, but we
--   removed this requirement. We don't recommend use of external IDs for
--   IAM roles that are assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.
[$sel:externalId:SegmentImportResource'] :: SegmentImportResource -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorized Amazon Pinpoint to access the
--   Amazon S3 location to import endpoint definitions from.
[$sel:roleArn:SegmentImportResource'] :: SegmentImportResource -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SegmentImportResource</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelCounts:SegmentImportResource'</a>,
--   <a>segmentImportResource_channelCounts</a> - The number of channel
--   types in the endpoint definitions that were imported to create the
--   segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:format:SegmentImportResource'</a>,
--   <a>segmentImportResource_format</a> - The format of the files that
--   were imported to create the segment. Valid values are: CSV, for
--   comma-separated values format; and, JSON, for newline-delimited JSON
--   format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Url:SegmentImportResource'</a>,
--   <a>segmentImportResource_s3Url</a> - The URL of the Amazon Simple
--   Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket that the endpoint definitions were
--   imported from to create the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:size:SegmentImportResource'</a>,
--   <a>segmentImportResource_size</a> - The number of endpoint definitions
--   that were imported successfully to create the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:externalId:SegmentImportResource'</a>,
--   <a>segmentImportResource_externalId</a> - (Deprecated) Your AWS
--   account ID, which you assigned to an external ID key in an IAM trust
--   policy. Amazon Pinpoint previously used this value to assume an IAM
--   role when importing endpoint definitions, but we removed this
--   requirement. We don't recommend use of external IDs for IAM roles that
--   are assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:SegmentImportResource'</a>,
--   <a>segmentImportResource_roleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorized
--   Amazon Pinpoint to access the Amazon S3 location to import endpoint
--   definitions from.
newSegmentImportResource :: DefinitionFormat -> Text -> Int -> Text -> Text -> SegmentImportResource

-- | The number of channel types in the endpoint definitions that were
--   imported to create the segment.
segmentImportResource_channelCounts :: Lens' SegmentImportResource (Maybe (HashMap Text Int))

-- | The format of the files that were imported to create the segment.
--   Valid values are: CSV, for comma-separated values format; and, JSON,
--   for newline-delimited JSON format.
segmentImportResource_format :: Lens' SegmentImportResource DefinitionFormat

-- | The URL of the Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket that
--   the endpoint definitions were imported from to create the segment.
segmentImportResource_s3Url :: Lens' SegmentImportResource Text

-- | The number of endpoint definitions that were imported successfully to
--   create the segment.
segmentImportResource_size :: Lens' SegmentImportResource Int

-- | (Deprecated) Your AWS account ID, which you assigned to an external ID
--   key in an IAM trust policy. Amazon Pinpoint previously used this value
--   to assume an IAM role when importing endpoint definitions, but we
--   removed this requirement. We don't recommend use of external IDs for
--   IAM roles that are assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.
segmentImportResource_externalId :: Lens' SegmentImportResource Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorized Amazon Pinpoint to access the
--   Amazon S3 location to import endpoint definitions from.
segmentImportResource_roleArn :: Lens' SegmentImportResource Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentImportResource.SegmentImportResource
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentImportResource.SegmentImportResource
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentImportResource.SegmentImportResource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentImportResource.SegmentImportResource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentImportResource.SegmentImportResource
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentImportResource.SegmentImportResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentImportResource.SegmentImportResource

instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentType.SegmentType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentType.SegmentType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentType.SegmentType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentType.SegmentType


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SendUsersMessageResponse

-- | Provides information about which users and endpoints a message was
--   sent to.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSendUsersMessageResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SendUsersMessageResponse
SendUsersMessageResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text (HashMap Text EndpointMessageResult)) -> Text -> SendUsersMessageResponse

-- | The unique identifier that was assigned to the message request.
[$sel:requestId:SendUsersMessageResponse'] :: SendUsersMessageResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that indicates which endpoints the message was sent to, for
--   each user. The object lists user IDs and, for each user ID, provides
--   the endpoint IDs that the message was sent to. For each endpoint ID,
--   it provides an EndpointMessageResult object.
[$sel:result:SendUsersMessageResponse'] :: SendUsersMessageResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text (HashMap Text EndpointMessageResult))

-- | The unique identifier for the application that was used to send the
--   message.
[$sel:applicationId:SendUsersMessageResponse'] :: SendUsersMessageResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SendUsersMessageResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestId:SendUsersMessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sendUsersMessageResponse_requestId</a> - The unique identifier that
--   was assigned to the message request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:result:SendUsersMessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sendUsersMessageResponse_result</a> - An object that indicates
--   which endpoints the message was sent to, for each user. The object
--   lists user IDs and, for each user ID, provides the endpoint IDs that
--   the message was sent to. For each endpoint ID, it provides an
--   EndpointMessageResult object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:SendUsersMessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sendUsersMessageResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier
--   for the application that was used to send the message.
newSendUsersMessageResponse :: Text -> SendUsersMessageResponse

-- | The unique identifier that was assigned to the message request.
sendUsersMessageResponse_requestId :: Lens' SendUsersMessageResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that indicates which endpoints the message was sent to, for
--   each user. The object lists user IDs and, for each user ID, provides
--   the endpoint IDs that the message was sent to. For each endpoint ID,
--   it provides an EndpointMessageResult object.
sendUsersMessageResponse_result :: Lens' SendUsersMessageResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text (HashMap Text EndpointMessageResult)))

-- | The unique identifier for the application that was used to send the
--   message.
sendUsersMessageResponse_applicationId :: Lens' SendUsersMessageResponse Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SendUsersMessageResponse.SendUsersMessageResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SendUsersMessageResponse.SendUsersMessageResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SendUsersMessageResponse.SendUsersMessageResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SendUsersMessageResponse.SendUsersMessageResponse
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SendUsersMessageResponse.SendUsersMessageResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SendUsersMessageResponse.SendUsersMessageResponse
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SendUsersMessageResponse.SendUsersMessageResponse


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Session

-- | Provides information about a session.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSession</a> smart constructor.
data Session
Session' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Text -> Text -> Session

-- | The date and time when the session ended.
[$sel:stopTimestamp:Session'] :: Session -> Maybe Text

-- | The duration of the session, in milliseconds.
[$sel:duration:Session'] :: Session -> Maybe Int

-- | The date and time when the session began.
[$sel:startTimestamp:Session'] :: Session -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the session.
[$sel:id:Session'] :: Session -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Session</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stopTimestamp:Session'</a>, <a>session_stopTimestamp</a> - The
--   date and time when the session ended.
--   
--   <a>$sel:duration:Session'</a>, <a>session_duration</a> - The duration
--   of the session, in milliseconds.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTimestamp:Session'</a>, <a>session_startTimestamp</a> -
--   The date and time when the session began.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Session'</a>, <a>session_id</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the session.
newSession :: Text -> Text -> Session

-- | The date and time when the session ended.
session_stopTimestamp :: Lens' Session (Maybe Text)

-- | The duration of the session, in milliseconds.
session_duration :: Lens' Session (Maybe Int)

-- | The date and time when the session began.
session_startTimestamp :: Lens' Session Text

-- | The unique identifier for the session.
session_id :: Lens' Session Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Session.Session
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Session.Session
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Session.Session
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Session.Session
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Session.Session
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Session.Session
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Session.Session


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Event

-- | Specifies information about an event that reports data to Amazon
--   Pinpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEvent</a> smart constructor.
data Event
Event' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Double) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Session -> Text -> Text -> Event

-- | The version of the SDK that's running on the client device.
[$sel:clientSdkVersion:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more custom metrics that are associated with the event.
[$sel:metrics:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe (HashMap Text Double)

-- | The version number of the app that's recording the event.
[$sel:appVersionCode:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | The title of the app that's recording the event.
[$sel:appTitle:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | The package name of the app that's recording the event.
[$sel:appPackageName:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more custom attributes that are associated with the event.
[$sel:attributes:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The name of the SDK that's being used to record the event.
[$sel:sdkName:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the session in which the event occurred.
[$sel:session:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Session

-- | The name of the event.
[$sel:eventType:Event'] :: Event -> Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the event occurred.
[$sel:timestamp:Event'] :: Event -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Event</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientSdkVersion:Event'</a>, <a>event_clientSdkVersion</a> -
--   The version of the SDK that's running on the client device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:Event'</a>, <a>event_metrics</a> - One or more custom
--   metrics that are associated with the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appVersionCode:Event'</a>, <a>event_appVersionCode</a> - The
--   version number of the app that's recording the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appTitle:Event'</a>, <a>event_appTitle</a> - The title of the
--   app that's recording the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appPackageName:Event'</a>, <a>event_appPackageName</a> - The
--   package name of the app that's recording the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:Event'</a>, <a>event_attributes</a> - One or more
--   custom attributes that are associated with the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sdkName:Event'</a>, <a>event_sdkName</a> - The name of the SDK
--   that's being used to record the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:session:Event'</a>, <a>event_session</a> - Information about
--   the session in which the event occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventType:Event'</a>, <a>event_eventType</a> - The name of the
--   event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestamp:Event'</a>, <a>event_timestamp</a> - The date and
--   time, in ISO 8601 format, when the event occurred.
newEvent :: Text -> Text -> Event

-- | The version of the SDK that's running on the client device.
event_clientSdkVersion :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more custom metrics that are associated with the event.
event_metrics :: Lens' Event (Maybe (HashMap Text Double))

-- | The version number of the app that's recording the event.
event_appVersionCode :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | The title of the app that's recording the event.
event_appTitle :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | The package name of the app that's recording the event.
event_appPackageName :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more custom attributes that are associated with the event.
event_attributes :: Lens' Event (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The name of the SDK that's being used to record the event.
event_sdkName :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the session in which the event occurred.
event_session :: Lens' Event (Maybe Session)

-- | The name of the event.
event_eventType :: Lens' Event Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the event occurred.
event_timestamp :: Lens' Event Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Event.Event
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Event.Event
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Event.Event
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Event.Event
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Event.Event
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Event.Event
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Event.Event


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventsBatch

-- | Specifies a batch of endpoints and events to process.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventsBatch</a> smart constructor.
data EventsBatch
EventsBatch' :: PublicEndpoint -> HashMap Text Event -> EventsBatch

-- | A set of properties and attributes that are associated with the
--   endpoint.
[$sel:endpoint:EventsBatch'] :: EventsBatch -> PublicEndpoint

-- | A set of properties that are associated with the event.
[$sel:events:EventsBatch'] :: EventsBatch -> HashMap Text Event

-- | Create a value of <a>EventsBatch</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpoint:EventsBatch'</a>, <a>eventsBatch_endpoint</a> - A set
--   of properties and attributes that are associated with the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:events:EventsBatch'</a>, <a>eventsBatch_events</a> - A set of
--   properties that are associated with the event.
newEventsBatch :: PublicEndpoint -> EventsBatch

-- | A set of properties and attributes that are associated with the
--   endpoint.
eventsBatch_endpoint :: Lens' EventsBatch PublicEndpoint

-- | A set of properties that are associated with the event.
eventsBatch_events :: Lens' EventsBatch (HashMap Text Event)

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventsRequest

-- | Specifies a batch of events to process.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventsRequest</a> smart constructor.
data EventsRequest
EventsRequest' :: HashMap Text EventsBatch -> EventsRequest

-- | The batch of events to process. For each item in a batch, the endpoint
--   ID acts as a key that has an EventsBatch object as its value.
[$sel:batchItem:EventsRequest'] :: EventsRequest -> HashMap Text EventsBatch

-- | Create a value of <a>EventsRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:batchItem:EventsRequest'</a>, <a>eventsRequest_batchItem</a> -
--   The batch of events to process. For each item in a batch, the endpoint
--   ID acts as a key that has an EventsBatch object as its value.
newEventsRequest :: EventsRequest

-- | The batch of events to process. For each item in a batch, the endpoint
--   ID acts as a key that has an EventsBatch object as its value.
eventsRequest_batchItem :: Lens' EventsRequest (HashMap Text EventsBatch)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventsRequest.EventsRequest
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventsRequest.EventsRequest
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventsRequest.EventsRequest
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventsRequest.EventsRequest
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventsRequest.EventsRequest
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventsRequest.EventsRequest
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventsRequest.EventsRequest


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SetDimension

-- | Specifies the dimension type and values for a segment dimension.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSetDimension</a> smart constructor.
data SetDimension
SetDimension' :: Maybe DimensionType -> [Text] -> SetDimension

-- | The type of segment dimension to use. Valid values are: INCLUSIVE,
--   endpoints that match the criteria are included in the segment; and,
--   EXCLUSIVE, endpoints that match the criteria are excluded from the
--   segment.
[$sel:dimensionType:SetDimension'] :: SetDimension -> Maybe DimensionType

-- | The criteria values to use for the segment dimension. Depending on the
--   value of the DimensionType property, endpoints are included or
--   excluded from the segment if their values match the criteria values.
[$sel:values:SetDimension'] :: SetDimension -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>SetDimension</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionType:SetDimension'</a>,
--   <a>setDimension_dimensionType</a> - The type of segment dimension to
--   use. Valid values are: INCLUSIVE, endpoints that match the criteria
--   are included in the segment; and, EXCLUSIVE, endpoints that match the
--   criteria are excluded from the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:SetDimension'</a>, <a>setDimension_values</a> - The
--   criteria values to use for the segment dimension. Depending on the
--   value of the DimensionType property, endpoints are included or
--   excluded from the segment if their values match the criteria values.
newSetDimension :: SetDimension

-- | The type of segment dimension to use. Valid values are: INCLUSIVE,
--   endpoints that match the criteria are included in the segment; and,
--   EXCLUSIVE, endpoints that match the criteria are excluded from the
--   segment.
setDimension_dimensionType :: Lens' SetDimension (Maybe DimensionType)

-- | The criteria values to use for the segment dimension. Depending on the
--   value of the DimensionType property, endpoints are included or
--   excluded from the segment if their values match the criteria values.
setDimension_values :: Lens' SetDimension [Text]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SetDimension.SetDimension
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SetDimension.SetDimension
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SetDimension.SetDimension
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SetDimension.SetDimension
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SetDimension.SetDimension
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SetDimension.SetDimension
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SetDimension.SetDimension
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SetDimension.SetDimension

data SegmentLocation

--   - The GPS location and range for the segment.

--   segment.

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentDemographics

-- | Specifies demographic-based dimension settings for including or
--   excluding endpoints from a segment. These settings derive from
--   characteristics of endpoint devices, such as platform, make, and
--   model.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSegmentDemographics</a> smart constructor.
data SegmentDemographics
SegmentDemographics' :: Maybe SetDimension -> Maybe SetDimension -> Maybe SetDimension -> Maybe SetDimension -> Maybe SetDimension -> Maybe SetDimension -> SegmentDemographics

-- | The device platform criteria for the segment.
[$sel:platform:SegmentDemographics'] :: SegmentDemographics -> Maybe SetDimension

-- | The app version criteria for the segment.
[$sel:appVersion:SegmentDemographics'] :: SegmentDemographics -> Maybe SetDimension

-- | The channel criteria for the segment.
[$sel:channel:SegmentDemographics'] :: SegmentDemographics -> Maybe SetDimension

-- | The device model criteria for the segment.
[$sel:model:SegmentDemographics'] :: SegmentDemographics -> Maybe SetDimension

-- | The device make criteria for the segment.
[$sel:make:SegmentDemographics'] :: SegmentDemographics -> Maybe SetDimension

-- | The device type criteria for the segment.
[$sel:deviceType:SegmentDemographics'] :: SegmentDemographics -> Maybe SetDimension

-- | Create a value of <a>SegmentDemographics</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:SegmentDemographics'</a>,
--   <a>segmentDemographics_platform</a> - The device platform criteria for
--   the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appVersion:SegmentDemographics'</a>,
--   <a>segmentDemographics_appVersion</a> - The app version criteria for
--   the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channel:SegmentDemographics'</a>,
--   <a>segmentDemographics_channel</a> - The channel criteria for the
--   segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:model:SegmentDemographics'</a>,
--   <a>segmentDemographics_model</a> - The device model criteria for the
--   segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:make:SegmentDemographics'</a>, <a>segmentDemographics_make</a>
--   - The device make criteria for the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceType:SegmentDemographics'</a>,
--   <a>segmentDemographics_deviceType</a> - The device type criteria for
--   the segment.
newSegmentDemographics :: SegmentDemographics

-- | The device platform criteria for the segment.
segmentDemographics_platform :: Lens' SegmentDemographics (Maybe SetDimension)

-- | The app version criteria for the segment.
segmentDemographics_appVersion :: Lens' SegmentDemographics (Maybe SetDimension)

-- | The channel criteria for the segment.
segmentDemographics_channel :: Lens' SegmentDemographics (Maybe SetDimension)

-- | The device model criteria for the segment.
segmentDemographics_model :: Lens' SegmentDemographics (Maybe SetDimension)

-- | The device make criteria for the segment.
segmentDemographics_make :: Lens' SegmentDemographics (Maybe SetDimension)

-- | The device type criteria for the segment.
segmentDemographics_deviceType :: Lens' SegmentDemographics (Maybe SetDimension)

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentDemographics.SegmentDemographics
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentDemographics.SegmentDemographics
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentDemographics.SegmentDemographics
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentDemographics.SegmentDemographics

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentDimensions

-- | Specifies the dimension settings for a segment.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSegmentDimensions</a> smart constructor.
data SegmentDimensions
SegmentDimensions' :: Maybe (HashMap Text MetricDimension) -> Maybe SegmentLocation -> Maybe SegmentDemographics -> Maybe (HashMap Text AttributeDimension) -> Maybe SegmentBehaviors -> Maybe (HashMap Text AttributeDimension) -> SegmentDimensions

-- | One or more custom metrics to use as criteria for the segment.
[$sel:metrics:SegmentDimensions'] :: SegmentDimensions -> Maybe (HashMap Text MetricDimension)

-- | The location-based criteria, such as region or GPS coordinates, for
--   the segment.
[$sel:location:SegmentDimensions'] :: SegmentDimensions -> Maybe SegmentLocation

-- | The demographic-based criteria, such as device platform, for the
--   segment.
[$sel:demographic:SegmentDimensions'] :: SegmentDimensions -> Maybe SegmentDemographics

-- | One or more custom user attributes to use as criteria for the segment.
[$sel:userAttributes:SegmentDimensions'] :: SegmentDimensions -> Maybe (HashMap Text AttributeDimension)

-- | The behavior-based criteria, such as how recently users have used your
--   app, for the segment.
[$sel:behavior:SegmentDimensions'] :: SegmentDimensions -> Maybe SegmentBehaviors

-- | One or more custom attributes to use as criteria for the segment.
[$sel:attributes:SegmentDimensions'] :: SegmentDimensions -> Maybe (HashMap Text AttributeDimension)

-- | Create a value of <a>SegmentDimensions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:SegmentDimensions'</a>,
--   <a>segmentDimensions_metrics</a> - One or more custom metrics to use
--   as criteria for the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:SegmentDimensions'</a>,
--   <a>segmentDimensions_location</a> - The location-based criteria, such
--   as region or GPS coordinates, for the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:demographic:SegmentDimensions'</a>,
--   <a>segmentDimensions_demographic</a> - The demographic-based criteria,
--   such as device platform, for the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userAttributes:SegmentDimensions'</a>,
--   <a>segmentDimensions_userAttributes</a> - One or more custom user
--   attributes to use as criteria for the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:behavior:SegmentDimensions'</a>,
--   <a>segmentDimensions_behavior</a> - The behavior-based criteria, such
--   as how recently users have used your app, for the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:SegmentDimensions'</a>,
--   <a>segmentDimensions_attributes</a> - One or more custom attributes to
--   use as criteria for the segment.
newSegmentDimensions :: SegmentDimensions

-- | One or more custom metrics to use as criteria for the segment.
segmentDimensions_metrics :: Lens' SegmentDimensions (Maybe (HashMap Text MetricDimension))

-- | The location-based criteria, such as region or GPS coordinates, for
--   the segment.
segmentDimensions_location :: Lens' SegmentDimensions (Maybe SegmentLocation)

-- | The demographic-based criteria, such as device platform, for the
--   segment.
segmentDimensions_demographic :: Lens' SegmentDimensions (Maybe SegmentDemographics)

-- | One or more custom user attributes to use as criteria for the segment.
segmentDimensions_userAttributes :: Lens' SegmentDimensions (Maybe (HashMap Text AttributeDimension))

-- | The behavior-based criteria, such as how recently users have used your
--   app, for the segment.
segmentDimensions_behavior :: Lens' SegmentDimensions (Maybe SegmentBehaviors)

-- | One or more custom attributes to use as criteria for the segment.
segmentDimensions_attributes :: Lens' SegmentDimensions (Maybe (HashMap Text AttributeDimension))
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentDimensions.SegmentDimensions
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentDimensions.SegmentDimensions
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentDimensions.SegmentDimensions
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentDimensions.SegmentDimensions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentDimensions.SegmentDimensions
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentDimensions.SegmentDimensions
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentDimensions.SegmentDimensions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentDimensions.SegmentDimensions


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventDimensions

-- | Specifies the dimensions for an event filter that determines when a
--   campaign is sent or a journey activity is performed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventDimensions</a> smart constructor.
data EventDimensions
EventDimensions' :: Maybe (HashMap Text MetricDimension) -> Maybe SetDimension -> Maybe (HashMap Text AttributeDimension) -> EventDimensions

-- | One or more custom metrics that your application reports to Amazon
--   Pinpoint. You can use these metrics as selection criteria when you
--   create an event filter.
[$sel:metrics:EventDimensions'] :: EventDimensions -> Maybe (HashMap Text MetricDimension)

-- | The name of the event that causes the campaign to be sent or the
--   journey activity to be performed. This can be a standard event that
--   Amazon Pinpoint generates, such as _email.delivered. For campaigns,
--   this can also be a custom event that's specific to your application.
--   For information about standard events, see <a>Streaming Amazon
--   Pinpoint Events</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:eventType:EventDimensions'] :: EventDimensions -> Maybe SetDimension

-- | One or more custom attributes that your application reports to Amazon
--   Pinpoint. You can use these attributes as selection criteria when you
--   create an event filter.
[$sel:attributes:EventDimensions'] :: EventDimensions -> Maybe (HashMap Text AttributeDimension)

-- | Create a value of <a>EventDimensions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:EventDimensions'</a>, <a>eventDimensions_metrics</a> -
--   One or more custom metrics that your application reports to Amazon
--   Pinpoint. You can use these metrics as selection criteria when you
--   create an event filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventType:EventDimensions'</a>,
--   <a>eventDimensions_eventType</a> - The name of the event that causes
--   the campaign to be sent or the journey activity to be performed. This
--   can be a standard event that Amazon Pinpoint generates, such as
--   _email.delivered. For campaigns, this can also be a custom event
--   that's specific to your application. For information about standard
--   events, see <a>Streaming Amazon Pinpoint Events</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Pinpoint Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:EventDimensions'</a>,
--   <a>eventDimensions_attributes</a> - One or more custom attributes that
--   your application reports to Amazon Pinpoint. You can use these
--   attributes as selection criteria when you create an event filter.
newEventDimensions :: EventDimensions

-- | One or more custom metrics that your application reports to Amazon
--   Pinpoint. You can use these metrics as selection criteria when you
--   create an event filter.
eventDimensions_metrics :: Lens' EventDimensions (Maybe (HashMap Text MetricDimension))

-- | The name of the event that causes the campaign to be sent or the
--   journey activity to be performed. This can be a standard event that
--   Amazon Pinpoint generates, such as _email.delivered. For campaigns,
--   this can also be a custom event that's specific to your application.
--   For information about standard events, see <a>Streaming Amazon
--   Pinpoint Events</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide</i>.
eventDimensions_eventType :: Lens' EventDimensions (Maybe SetDimension)

-- | One or more custom attributes that your application reports to Amazon
--   Pinpoint. You can use these attributes as selection criteria when you
--   create an event filter.
eventDimensions_attributes :: Lens' EventDimensions (Maybe (HashMap Text AttributeDimension))
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventDimensions.EventDimensions
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventDimensions.EventDimensions
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventDimensions.EventDimensions
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventDimensions.EventDimensions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventDimensions.EventDimensions
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventDimensions.EventDimensions
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventDimensions.EventDimensions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventDimensions.EventDimensions


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventFilter

-- | Specifies the settings for an event that causes a campaign to be sent
--   or a journey activity to be performed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventFilter</a> smart constructor.
data EventFilter
EventFilter' :: FilterType -> EventDimensions -> EventFilter

-- | The type of event that causes the campaign to be sent or the journey
--   activity to be performed. Valid values are: SYSTEM, sends the campaign
--   or performs the activity when a system event occurs; and, ENDPOINT,
--   sends the campaign or performs the activity when an endpoint event
--   (Events resource) occurs.
[$sel:filterType:EventFilter'] :: EventFilter -> FilterType

-- | The dimensions for the event filter to use for the campaign or the
--   journey activity.
[$sel:dimensions:EventFilter'] :: EventFilter -> EventDimensions

-- | Create a value of <a>EventFilter</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filterType:EventFilter'</a>, <a>eventFilter_filterType</a> -
--   The type of event that causes the campaign to be sent or the journey
--   activity to be performed. Valid values are: SYSTEM, sends the campaign
--   or performs the activity when a system event occurs; and, ENDPOINT,
--   sends the campaign or performs the activity when an endpoint event
--   (Events resource) occurs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:EventFilter'</a>, <a>eventFilter_dimensions</a> -
--   The dimensions for the event filter to use for the campaign or the
--   journey activity.
newEventFilter :: FilterType -> EventDimensions -> EventFilter

-- | The type of event that causes the campaign to be sent or the journey
--   activity to be performed. Valid values are: SYSTEM, sends the campaign
--   or performs the activity when a system event occurs; and, ENDPOINT,
--   sends the campaign or performs the activity when an endpoint event
--   (Events resource) occurs.
eventFilter_filterType :: Lens' EventFilter FilterType

-- | The dimensions for the event filter to use for the campaign or the
--   journey activity.
eventFilter_dimensions :: Lens' EventFilter EventDimensions
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventFilter.EventFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventFilter.EventFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventFilter.EventFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventFilter.EventFilter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventFilter.EventFilter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventFilter.EventFilter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventFilter.EventFilter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventFilter.EventFilter

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EventCondition

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventCondition</a> smart constructor.

--   events meet the condition.

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignEventFilter

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignEventFilter</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignEventFilter

--   endpoint event (Events resource) occurs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:CampaignEventFilter'</a>,
--   <a>campaignEventFilter_dimensions</a> - The dimension settings of the
--   event filter for the campaign.

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Schedule

-- | Specifies the schedule settings for a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSchedule</a> smart constructor.
data Schedule
Schedule' :: Maybe Frequency -> Maybe QuietTime -> Maybe CampaignEventFilter -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Schedule

-- | Specifies how often the campaign is sent or whether the campaign is
--   sent in response to a specific event.
[$sel:frequency:Schedule'] :: Schedule -> Maybe Frequency

-- | The default quiet time for the campaign. Quiet time is a specific time
--   range when a campaign doesn't send messages to endpoints, if all the
--   following conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set
--   to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   campaign.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   campaign.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the endpoint will
--   receive messages from the campaign, even if quiet time is enabled.
[$sel:quietTime:Schedule'] :: Schedule -> Maybe QuietTime

-- | The type of event that causes the campaign to be sent, if the value of
--   the Frequency property is EVENT.
[$sel:eventFilter:Schedule'] :: Schedule -> Maybe CampaignEventFilter

-- | Specifies whether the start and end times for the campaign schedule
--   use each recipient's local time. To base the schedule on each
--   recipient's local time, set this value to true.
[$sel:isLocalTime:Schedule'] :: Schedule -> Maybe Bool

-- | The scheduled time, in ISO 8601 format, when the campaign ended or
--   will end.
[$sel:endTime:Schedule'] :: Schedule -> Maybe Text

-- | The starting UTC offset for the campaign schedule, if the value of the
--   IsLocalTime property is true. Valid values are: UTC, UTC+01, UTC+02,
--   UTC+03, UTC+03:30, UTC+04, UTC+04:30, UTC+05, UTC+05:30, UTC+05:45,
--   UTC+06, UTC+06:30, UTC+07, UTC+08, UTC+09, UTC+09:30, UTC+10,
--   UTC+10:30, UTC+11, UTC+12, UTC+13, UTC-02, UTC-03, UTC-04, UTC-05,
--   UTC-06, UTC-07, UTC-08, UTC-09, UTC-10, and UTC-11.
[$sel:timezone:Schedule'] :: Schedule -> Maybe Text

-- | The scheduled time when the campaign began or will begin. Valid values
--   are: IMMEDIATE, to start the campaign immediately; or, a specific time
--   in ISO 8601 format.
[$sel:startTime:Schedule'] :: Schedule -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Schedule</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:frequency:Schedule'</a>, <a>schedule_frequency</a> - Specifies
--   how often the campaign is sent or whether the campaign is sent in
--   response to a specific event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quietTime:Schedule'</a>, <a>schedule_quietTime</a> - The
--   default quiet time for the campaign. Quiet time is a specific time
--   range when a campaign doesn't send messages to endpoints, if all the
--   following conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set
--   to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   campaign.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   campaign.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the endpoint will
--   receive messages from the campaign, even if quiet time is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventFilter:Schedule'</a>, <a>schedule_eventFilter</a> - The
--   type of event that causes the campaign to be sent, if the value of the
--   Frequency property is EVENT.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isLocalTime:Schedule'</a>, <a>schedule_isLocalTime</a> -
--   Specifies whether the start and end times for the campaign schedule
--   use each recipient's local time. To base the schedule on each
--   recipient's local time, set this value to true.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:Schedule'</a>, <a>schedule_endTime</a> - The scheduled
--   time, in ISO 8601 format, when the campaign ended or will end.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timezone:Schedule'</a>, <a>schedule_timezone</a> - The
--   starting UTC offset for the campaign schedule, if the value of the
--   IsLocalTime property is true. Valid values are: UTC, UTC+01, UTC+02,
--   UTC+03, UTC+03:30, UTC+04, UTC+04:30, UTC+05, UTC+05:30, UTC+05:45,
--   UTC+06, UTC+06:30, UTC+07, UTC+08, UTC+09, UTC+09:30, UTC+10,
--   UTC+10:30, UTC+11, UTC+12, UTC+13, UTC-02, UTC-03, UTC-04, UTC-05,
--   UTC-06, UTC-07, UTC-08, UTC-09, UTC-10, and UTC-11.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:Schedule'</a>, <a>schedule_startTime</a> - The
--   scheduled time when the campaign began or will begin. Valid values
--   are: IMMEDIATE, to start the campaign immediately; or, a specific time
--   in ISO 8601 format.
newSchedule :: Text -> Schedule

-- | Specifies how often the campaign is sent or whether the campaign is
--   sent in response to a specific event.
schedule_frequency :: Lens' Schedule (Maybe Frequency)

-- | The default quiet time for the campaign. Quiet time is a specific time
--   range when a campaign doesn't send messages to endpoints, if all the
--   following conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set
--   to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   campaign.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   campaign.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the endpoint will
--   receive messages from the campaign, even if quiet time is enabled.
schedule_quietTime :: Lens' Schedule (Maybe QuietTime)

-- | The type of event that causes the campaign to be sent, if the value of
--   the Frequency property is EVENT.
schedule_eventFilter :: Lens' Schedule (Maybe CampaignEventFilter)

-- | Specifies whether the start and end times for the campaign schedule
--   use each recipient's local time. To base the schedule on each
--   recipient's local time, set this value to true.
schedule_isLocalTime :: Lens' Schedule (Maybe Bool)

-- | The scheduled time, in ISO 8601 format, when the campaign ended or
--   will end.
schedule_endTime :: Lens' Schedule (Maybe Text)

-- | The starting UTC offset for the campaign schedule, if the value of the
--   IsLocalTime property is true. Valid values are: UTC, UTC+01, UTC+02,
--   UTC+03, UTC+03:30, UTC+04, UTC+04:30, UTC+05, UTC+05:30, UTC+05:45,
--   UTC+06, UTC+06:30, UTC+07, UTC+08, UTC+09, UTC+09:30, UTC+10,
--   UTC+10:30, UTC+11, UTC+12, UTC+13, UTC-02, UTC-03, UTC-04, UTC-05,
--   UTC-06, UTC-07, UTC-08, UTC-09, UTC-10, and UTC-11.
schedule_timezone :: Lens' Schedule (Maybe Text)

-- | The scheduled time when the campaign began or will begin. Valid values
--   are: IMMEDIATE, to start the campaign immediately; or, a specific time
--   in ISO 8601 format.
schedule_startTime :: Lens' Schedule Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Schedule.Schedule
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Schedule.Schedule
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Schedule.Schedule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Schedule.Schedule
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Schedule.Schedule
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Schedule.Schedule
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Schedule.Schedule
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Schedule.Schedule


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppCampaignSchedule

-- | Schedule of the campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInAppCampaignSchedule</a> smart constructor.
data InAppCampaignSchedule
InAppCampaignSchedule' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe QuietTime -> Maybe CampaignEventFilter -> InAppCampaignSchedule

-- | The scheduled time after which the in-app message should not be shown.
--   Timestamp is in ISO 8601 format.
[$sel:endDate:InAppCampaignSchedule'] :: InAppCampaignSchedule -> Maybe Text

-- | Time during which the in-app message should not be shown to the user.
[$sel:quietTime:InAppCampaignSchedule'] :: InAppCampaignSchedule -> Maybe QuietTime

-- | The event filter the SDK has to use to show the in-app message in the
--   application.
[$sel:eventFilter:InAppCampaignSchedule'] :: InAppCampaignSchedule -> Maybe CampaignEventFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>InAppCampaignSchedule</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endDate:InAppCampaignSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>inAppCampaignSchedule_endDate</a> - The scheduled time after which
--   the in-app message should not be shown. Timestamp is in ISO 8601
--   format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quietTime:InAppCampaignSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>inAppCampaignSchedule_quietTime</a> - Time during which the in-app
--   message should not be shown to the user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventFilter:InAppCampaignSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>inAppCampaignSchedule_eventFilter</a> - The event filter the SDK
--   has to use to show the in-app message in the application.
newInAppCampaignSchedule :: InAppCampaignSchedule

-- | The scheduled time after which the in-app message should not be shown.
--   Timestamp is in ISO 8601 format.
inAppCampaignSchedule_endDate :: Lens' InAppCampaignSchedule (Maybe Text)

-- | Time during which the in-app message should not be shown to the user.
inAppCampaignSchedule_quietTime :: Lens' InAppCampaignSchedule (Maybe QuietTime)

-- | The event filter the SDK has to use to show the in-app message in the
--   application.
inAppCampaignSchedule_eventFilter :: Lens' InAppCampaignSchedule (Maybe CampaignEventFilter)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppCampaignSchedule.InAppCampaignSchedule
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppCampaignSchedule.InAppCampaignSchedule
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppCampaignSchedule.InAppCampaignSchedule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppCampaignSchedule.InAppCampaignSchedule
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppCampaignSchedule.InAppCampaignSchedule
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppCampaignSchedule.InAppCampaignSchedule
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppCampaignSchedule.InAppCampaignSchedule


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppMessageCampaign

-- | Targeted in-app message campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInAppMessageCampaign</a> smart constructor.
data InAppMessageCampaign
InAppMessageCampaign' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe InAppCampaignSchedule -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InAppMessage -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> InAppMessageCampaign

-- | Session cap which controls the number of times an in-app message can
--   be shown to the endpoint during an application session.
[$sel:sessionCap:InAppMessageCampaign'] :: InAppMessageCampaign -> Maybe Int

-- | Priority of the in-app message.
[$sel:priority:InAppMessageCampaign'] :: InAppMessageCampaign -> Maybe Int

-- | Schedule of the campaign.
[$sel:schedule:InAppMessageCampaign'] :: InAppMessageCampaign -> Maybe InAppCampaignSchedule

-- | Campaign id of the corresponding campaign.
[$sel:campaignId:InAppMessageCampaign'] :: InAppMessageCampaign -> Maybe Text

-- | Treatment id of the campaign.
[$sel:treatmentId:InAppMessageCampaign'] :: InAppMessageCampaign -> Maybe Text

-- | In-app message content with all fields required for rendering an
--   in-app message.
[$sel:inAppMessage:InAppMessageCampaign'] :: InAppMessageCampaign -> Maybe InAppMessage

-- | Total cap which controls the number of times an in-app message can be
--   shown to the endpoint.
[$sel:totalCap:InAppMessageCampaign'] :: InAppMessageCampaign -> Maybe Int

-- | Daily cap which controls the number of times any in-app messages can
--   be shown to the endpoint during a day.
[$sel:dailyCap:InAppMessageCampaign'] :: InAppMessageCampaign -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>InAppMessageCampaign</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sessionCap:InAppMessageCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>inAppMessageCampaign_sessionCap</a> - Session cap which controls
--   the number of times an in-app message can be shown to the endpoint
--   during an application session.
--   
--   <a>$sel:priority:InAppMessageCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>inAppMessageCampaign_priority</a> - Priority of the in-app message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schedule:InAppMessageCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>inAppMessageCampaign_schedule</a> - Schedule of the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:campaignId:InAppMessageCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>inAppMessageCampaign_campaignId</a> - Campaign id of the
--   corresponding campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatmentId:InAppMessageCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>inAppMessageCampaign_treatmentId</a> - Treatment id of the
--   campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inAppMessage:InAppMessageCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>inAppMessageCampaign_inAppMessage</a> - In-app message content with
--   all fields required for rendering an in-app message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalCap:InAppMessageCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>inAppMessageCampaign_totalCap</a> - Total cap which controls the
--   number of times an in-app message can be shown to the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dailyCap:InAppMessageCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>inAppMessageCampaign_dailyCap</a> - Daily cap which controls the
--   number of times any in-app messages can be shown to the endpoint
--   during a day.
newInAppMessageCampaign :: InAppMessageCampaign

-- | Session cap which controls the number of times an in-app message can
--   be shown to the endpoint during an application session.
inAppMessageCampaign_sessionCap :: Lens' InAppMessageCampaign (Maybe Int)

-- | Priority of the in-app message.
inAppMessageCampaign_priority :: Lens' InAppMessageCampaign (Maybe Int)

-- | Schedule of the campaign.
inAppMessageCampaign_schedule :: Lens' InAppMessageCampaign (Maybe InAppCampaignSchedule)

-- | Campaign id of the corresponding campaign.
inAppMessageCampaign_campaignId :: Lens' InAppMessageCampaign (Maybe Text)

-- | Treatment id of the campaign.
inAppMessageCampaign_treatmentId :: Lens' InAppMessageCampaign (Maybe Text)

-- | In-app message content with all fields required for rendering an
--   in-app message.
inAppMessageCampaign_inAppMessage :: Lens' InAppMessageCampaign (Maybe InAppMessage)

-- | Total cap which controls the number of times an in-app message can be
--   shown to the endpoint.
inAppMessageCampaign_totalCap :: Lens' InAppMessageCampaign (Maybe Int)

-- | Daily cap which controls the number of times any in-app messages can
--   be shown to the endpoint during a day.
inAppMessageCampaign_dailyCap :: Lens' InAppMessageCampaign (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppMessageCampaign.InAppMessageCampaign
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppMessageCampaign.InAppMessageCampaign
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppMessageCampaign.InAppMessageCampaign
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppMessageCampaign.InAppMessageCampaign
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppMessageCampaign.InAppMessageCampaign
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppMessageCampaign.InAppMessageCampaign
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppMessageCampaign.InAppMessageCampaign

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SimpleCondition

-- | Specifies a condition to evaluate for an activity in a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSimpleCondition</a> smart constructor.
data SimpleCondition
SimpleCondition' :: Maybe SegmentDimensions -> Maybe EventCondition -> Maybe SegmentCondition -> SimpleCondition

-- | The dimension settings for the segment that's associated with the
--   activity.
[$sel:segmentDimensions:SimpleCondition'] :: SimpleCondition -> Maybe SegmentDimensions

-- | The dimension settings for the event that's associated with the
--   activity.
[$sel:eventCondition:SimpleCondition'] :: SimpleCondition -> Maybe EventCondition

-- | The segment that's associated with the activity.
[$sel:segmentCondition:SimpleCondition'] :: SimpleCondition -> Maybe SegmentCondition

-- | Create a value of <a>SimpleCondition</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentDimensions:SimpleCondition'</a>,
--   <a>simpleCondition_segmentDimensions</a> - The dimension settings for
--   the segment that's associated with the activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventCondition:SimpleCondition'</a>,
--   <a>simpleCondition_eventCondition</a> - The dimension settings for the
--   event that's associated with the activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentCondition:SimpleCondition'</a>,
--   <a>simpleCondition_segmentCondition</a> - The segment that's
--   associated with the activity.
newSimpleCondition :: SimpleCondition

-- | The dimension settings for the segment that's associated with the
--   activity.
simpleCondition_segmentDimensions :: Lens' SimpleCondition (Maybe SegmentDimensions)

-- | The dimension settings for the event that's associated with the
--   activity.
simpleCondition_eventCondition :: Lens' SimpleCondition (Maybe EventCondition)

-- | The segment that's associated with the activity.
simpleCondition_segmentCondition :: Lens' SimpleCondition (Maybe SegmentCondition)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SimpleCondition.SimpleCondition
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SimpleCondition.SimpleCondition
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SimpleCondition.SimpleCondition
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SimpleCondition.SimpleCondition
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SimpleCondition.SimpleCondition
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SimpleCondition.SimpleCondition

instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SimpleCondition.SimpleCondition


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MultiConditionalBranch

-- | Specifies a condition to evaluate for an activity path in a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMultiConditionalBranch</a> smart constructor.
data MultiConditionalBranch
MultiConditionalBranch' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe SimpleCondition -> MultiConditionalBranch

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after
--   completing the activity for the path.
[$sel:nextActivity:MultiConditionalBranch'] :: MultiConditionalBranch -> Maybe Text

-- | The condition to evaluate for the activity path.
[$sel:condition:MultiConditionalBranch'] :: MultiConditionalBranch -> Maybe SimpleCondition

-- | Create a value of <a>MultiConditionalBranch</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextActivity:MultiConditionalBranch'</a>,
--   <a>multiConditionalBranch_nextActivity</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the next activity to perform, after completing the activity for the
--   path.
--   
--   <a>$sel:condition:MultiConditionalBranch'</a>,
--   <a>multiConditionalBranch_condition</a> - The condition to evaluate
--   for the activity path.
newMultiConditionalBranch :: MultiConditionalBranch

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after
--   completing the activity for the path.
multiConditionalBranch_nextActivity :: Lens' MultiConditionalBranch (Maybe Text)

-- | The condition to evaluate for the activity path.
