module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Condition

-- | Specifies the conditions to evaluate for an activity in a journey, and
--   how to evaluate those conditions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCondition</a> smart constructor.
data Condition
Condition' :: Maybe Operator -> Maybe [SimpleCondition] -> Condition

-- | Specifies how to handle multiple conditions for the activity. For
--   example, if you specify two conditions for an activity, whether both
--   or only one of the conditions must be met for the activity to be
--   performed.
[$sel:operator:Condition'] :: Condition -> Maybe Operator

-- | The conditions to evaluate for the activity.
[$sel:conditions:Condition'] :: Condition -> Maybe [SimpleCondition]

-- | Create a value of <a>Condition</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:operator:Condition'</a>, <a>condition_operator</a> - Specifies
--   how to handle multiple conditions for the activity. For example, if
--   you specify two conditions for an activity, whether both or only one
--   of the conditions must be met for the activity to be performed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:conditions:Condition'</a>, <a>condition_conditions</a> - The
--   conditions to evaluate for the activity.
newCondition :: Condition

-- | Specifies how to handle multiple conditions for the activity. For
--   example, if you specify two conditions for an activity, whether both
--   or only one of the conditions must be met for the activity to be
--   performed.
condition_operator :: Lens' Condition (Maybe Operator)

-- | The conditions to evaluate for the activity.
condition_conditions :: Lens' Condition (Maybe [SimpleCondition])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Condition.Condition
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Condition.Condition
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Condition.Condition
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Condition.Condition
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Condition.Condition
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Condition.Condition
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Condition.Condition
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Condition.Condition


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SimpleEmailPart

--   textual email data and the applicable character set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSimpleEmailPart</a> smart constructor.
data SimpleEmailPart
SimpleEmailPart' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> SimpleEmailPart

[$sel:data':SimpleEmailPart'] :: SimpleEmailPart -> Maybe Text

-- | The applicable character set for the message content.
[$sel:charset:SimpleEmailPart'] :: SimpleEmailPart -> Maybe Text

--   omitted.

--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':SimpleEmailPart'</a>, <a>simpleEmailPart_data</a> - The
--   textual data of the message content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:charset:SimpleEmailPart'</a>, <a>simpleEmailPart_charset</a> -
--   The applicable character set for the message content.

-- | The applicable character set for the message content.

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SimpleEmail

-- | Specifies the contents of an email message, composed of a subject, a
--   text part, and an HTML part.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSimpleEmail</a> smart constructor.
data SimpleEmail
SimpleEmail' :: Maybe SimpleEmailPart -> Maybe SimpleEmailPart -> Maybe SimpleEmailPart -> SimpleEmail

-- | The subject line, or title, of the email.
[$sel:subject:SimpleEmail'] :: SimpleEmail -> Maybe SimpleEmailPart

-- | The body of the email message, in plain text format. We recommend
--   using plain text format for email clients that don't render HTML
--   content and clients that are connected to high-latency networks, such
--   as mobile devices.
[$sel:textPart:SimpleEmail'] :: SimpleEmail -> Maybe SimpleEmailPart

-- | The body of the email message, in HTML format. We recommend using HTML
--   format for email clients that render HTML content. You can include
--   links, formatted text, and more in an HTML message.
[$sel:htmlPart:SimpleEmail'] :: SimpleEmail -> Maybe SimpleEmailPart

-- | Create a value of <a>SimpleEmail</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:SimpleEmail'</a>, <a>simpleEmail_subject</a> - The
--   subject line, or title, of the email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:textPart:SimpleEmail'</a>, <a>simpleEmail_textPart</a> - The
--   body of the email message, in plain text format. We recommend using
--   plain text format for email clients that don't render HTML content and
--   clients that are connected to high-latency networks, such as mobile
--   devices.
--   
--   <a>$sel:htmlPart:SimpleEmail'</a>, <a>simpleEmail_htmlPart</a> - The
--   body of the email message, in HTML format. We recommend using HTML
--   format for email clients that render HTML content. You can include
--   links, formatted text, and more in an HTML message.
newSimpleEmail :: SimpleEmail

-- | The subject line, or title, of the email.
simpleEmail_subject :: Lens' SimpleEmail (Maybe SimpleEmailPart)

-- | The body of the email message, in plain text format. We recommend
--   using plain text format for email clients that don't render HTML
--   content and clients that are connected to high-latency networks, such
--   as mobile devices.
simpleEmail_textPart :: Lens' SimpleEmail (Maybe SimpleEmailPart)

-- | The body of the email message, in HTML format. We recommend using HTML
--   format for email clients that render HTML content. You can include
--   links, formatted text, and more in an HTML message.
simpleEmail_htmlPart :: Lens' SimpleEmail (Maybe SimpleEmailPart)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SimpleEmail.SimpleEmail
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SimpleEmail.SimpleEmail
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SimpleEmail.SimpleEmail
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SimpleEmail.SimpleEmail
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SimpleEmail.SimpleEmail
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SimpleEmail.SimpleEmail
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SimpleEmail.SimpleEmail


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailMessage

-- | Specifies the default settings and content for a one-time email
--   message that's sent directly to an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailMessage</a> smart constructor.
data EmailMessage
EmailMessage' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RawEmail -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SimpleEmail -> Maybe [Text] -> EmailMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the email message. You can
--   override the default variables with individual address variables.
[$sel:substitutions:EmailMessage'] :: EmailMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | The body of the email message.
[$sel:body:EmailMessage'] :: EmailMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The verified email address to send the email message from. The default
--   value is the FromAddress specified for the email channel.
[$sel:fromAddress:EmailMessage'] :: EmailMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The email message, represented as a raw MIME message.
[$sel:rawEmail:EmailMessage'] :: EmailMessage -> Maybe RawEmail

-- | The email address to forward bounces and complaints to, if feedback
--   forwarding is enabled.
[$sel:feedbackForwardingAddress:EmailMessage'] :: EmailMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The email message, composed of a subject, a text part, and an HTML
--   part.
[$sel:simpleEmail:EmailMessage'] :: EmailMessage -> Maybe SimpleEmail

-- | The reply-to email address(es) for the email message. If a recipient
--   replies to the email, each reply-to address receives the reply.
[$sel:replyToAddresses:EmailMessage'] :: EmailMessage -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:EmailMessage'</a>,
--   <a>emailMessage_substitutions</a> - The default message variables to
--   use in the email message. You can override the default variables with
--   individual address variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:EmailMessage'</a>, <a>emailMessage_body</a> - The body of
--   the email message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromAddress:EmailMessage'</a>, <a>emailMessage_fromAddress</a>
--   - The verified email address to send the email message from. The
--   default value is the FromAddress specified for the email channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawEmail:EmailMessage'</a>, <a>emailMessage_rawEmail</a> - The
--   email message, represented as a raw MIME message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:feedbackForwardingAddress:EmailMessage'</a>,
--   <a>emailMessage_feedbackForwardingAddress</a> - The email address to
--   forward bounces and complaints to, if feedback forwarding is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:simpleEmail:EmailMessage'</a>, <a>emailMessage_simpleEmail</a>
--   - The email message, composed of a subject, a text part, and an HTML
--   part.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replyToAddresses:EmailMessage'</a>,
--   <a>emailMessage_replyToAddresses</a> - The reply-to email address(es)
--   for the email message. If a recipient replies to the email, each
--   reply-to address receives the reply.
newEmailMessage :: EmailMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the email message. You can
--   override the default variables with individual address variables.
emailMessage_substitutions :: Lens' EmailMessage (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | The body of the email message.
emailMessage_body :: Lens' EmailMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The verified email address to send the email message from. The default
--   value is the FromAddress specified for the email channel.
emailMessage_fromAddress :: Lens' EmailMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The email message, represented as a raw MIME message.
emailMessage_rawEmail :: Lens' EmailMessage (Maybe RawEmail)

-- | The email address to forward bounces and complaints to, if feedback
--   forwarding is enabled.
emailMessage_feedbackForwardingAddress :: Lens' EmailMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The email message, composed of a subject, a text part, and an HTML
--   part.
emailMessage_simpleEmail :: Lens' EmailMessage (Maybe SimpleEmail)

-- | The reply-to email address(es) for the email message. If a recipient
--   replies to the email, each reply-to address receives the reply.
emailMessage_replyToAddresses :: Lens' EmailMessage (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailMessage.EmailMessage
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailMessage.EmailMessage
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailMessage.EmailMessage
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailMessage.EmailMessage
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailMessage.EmailMessage
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailMessage.EmailMessage
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailMessage.EmailMessage

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.StartCondition

-- | Specifies the conditions for the first activity in a journey. This
--   activity and its conditions determine which users are participants in
--   a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStartCondition</a> smart constructor.
data StartCondition
StartCondition' :: Maybe SegmentCondition -> Maybe EventStartCondition -> Maybe Text -> StartCondition

-- | The segment that's associated with the first activity in the journey.
--   This segment determines which users are participants in the journey.
[$sel:segmentStartCondition:StartCondition'] :: StartCondition -> Maybe SegmentCondition
[$sel:eventStartCondition:StartCondition'] :: StartCondition -> Maybe EventStartCondition

-- | The custom description of the condition.
[$sel:description:StartCondition'] :: StartCondition -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StartCondition</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentStartCondition:StartCondition'</a>,
--   <a>startCondition_segmentStartCondition</a> - The segment that's
--   associated with the first activity in the journey. This segment
--   determines which users are participants in the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventStartCondition:StartCondition'</a>,
--   <a>startCondition_eventStartCondition</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:StartCondition'</a>,
--   <a>startCondition_description</a> - The custom description of the
--   condition.
newStartCondition :: StartCondition

-- | The segment that's associated with the first activity in the journey.
--   This segment determines which users are participants in the journey.
startCondition_segmentStartCondition :: Lens' StartCondition (Maybe SegmentCondition)

-- | Undocumented member.
startCondition_eventStartCondition :: Lens' StartCondition (Maybe EventStartCondition)

-- | The custom description of the condition.
startCondition_description :: Lens' StartCondition (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.StartCondition.StartCondition
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.StartCondition.StartCondition
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.StartCondition.StartCondition
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.StartCondition.StartCondition
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.StartCondition.StartCondition
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.StartCondition.StartCondition
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.StartCondition.StartCondition
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.StartCondition.StartCondition

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyStateRequest

-- | Changes the status of a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneyStateRequest</a> smart constructor.
data JourneyStateRequest
JourneyStateRequest' :: Maybe State -> JourneyStateRequest

-- | The status of the journey. Currently, Supported values are ACTIVE,
--   PAUSED, and CANCELLED
--   
--   If you cancel a journey, Amazon Pinpoint continues to perform
--   activities that are currently in progress, until those activities are
--   complete. Amazon Pinpoint also continues to collect and aggregate
--   analytics data for those activities, until they are complete, and any
--   activities that were complete when you cancelled the journey.
--   
--   After you cancel a journey, you can't add, change, or remove any
--   activities from the journey. In addition, Amazon Pinpoint stops
--   evaluating the journey and doesn't perform any activities that haven't
--   started.
--   
--   When the journey is paused, Amazon Pinpoint continues to perform
--   activities that are currently in progress, until those activities are
--   complete. Endpoints will stop entering journeys when the journey is
--   paused and will resume entering the journey after the journey is
--   resumed. For wait activities, wait time is paused when the journey is
--   paused. Currently, PAUSED only supports journeys with a segment
--   refresh interval.
[$sel:state:JourneyStateRequest'] :: JourneyStateRequest -> Maybe State

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneyStateRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:JourneyStateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>journeyStateRequest_state</a> - The status of the journey.
--   Currently, Supported values are ACTIVE, PAUSED, and CANCELLED
--   
--   If you cancel a journey, Amazon Pinpoint continues to perform
--   activities that are currently in progress, until those activities are
--   complete. Amazon Pinpoint also continues to collect and aggregate
--   analytics data for those activities, until they are complete, and any
--   activities that were complete when you cancelled the journey.
--   
--   After you cancel a journey, you can't add, change, or remove any
--   activities from the journey. In addition, Amazon Pinpoint stops
--   evaluating the journey and doesn't perform any activities that haven't
--   started.
--   
--   When the journey is paused, Amazon Pinpoint continues to perform
--   activities that are currently in progress, until those activities are
--   complete. Endpoints will stop entering journeys when the journey is
--   paused and will resume entering the journey after the journey is
--   resumed. For wait activities, wait time is paused when the journey is
--   paused. Currently, PAUSED only supports journeys with a segment
--   refresh interval.
newJourneyStateRequest :: JourneyStateRequest

-- | The status of the journey. Currently, Supported values are ACTIVE,
--   PAUSED, and CANCELLED
--   
--   If you cancel a journey, Amazon Pinpoint continues to perform
--   activities that are currently in progress, until those activities are
--   complete. Amazon Pinpoint also continues to collect and aggregate
--   analytics data for those activities, until they are complete, and any
--   activities that were complete when you cancelled the journey.
--   
--   After you cancel a journey, you can't add, change, or remove any
--   activities from the journey. In addition, Amazon Pinpoint stops
--   evaluating the journey and doesn't perform any activities that haven't
--   started.
--   
--   When the journey is paused, Amazon Pinpoint continues to perform
--   activities that are currently in progress, until those activities are
--   complete. Endpoints will stop entering journeys when the journey is
--   paused and will resume entering the journey after the journey is
--   resumed. For wait activities, wait time is paused when the journey is
--   paused. Currently, PAUSED only supports journeys with a segment
--   refresh interval.
journeyStateRequest_state :: Lens' JourneyStateRequest (Maybe State)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyStateRequest.JourneyStateRequest
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyStateRequest.JourneyStateRequest
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyStateRequest.JourneyStateRequest
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyStateRequest.JourneyStateRequest
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyStateRequest.JourneyStateRequest
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyStateRequest.JourneyStateRequest
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyStateRequest.JourneyStateRequest


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TagsModel

-- | Specifies the tags (keys and values) for an application, campaign,
--   message template, or segment.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTagsModel</a> smart constructor.
data TagsModel
TagsModel' :: HashMap Text Text -> TagsModel

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags for an
--   application, campaign, message template, or segment. Each of these
--   resources can have a maximum of 50 tags.
--   
--   Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.
--   The maximum length of a tag key is 128 characters. The maximum length
--   of a tag value is 256 characters.
[$sel:tags:TagsModel'] :: TagsModel -> HashMap Text Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TagsModel</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:TagsModel'</a>, <a>tagsModel_tags</a> - A
--   string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags for an
--   application, campaign, message template, or segment. Each of these
--   resources can have a maximum of 50 tags.
--   
--   Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.
--   The maximum length of a tag key is 128 characters. The maximum length
--   of a tag value is 256 characters.
newTagsModel :: TagsModel

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags for an
--   application, campaign, message template, or segment. Each of these
--   resources can have a maximum of 50 tags.
--   
--   Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.
--   The maximum length of a tag key is 128 characters. The maximum length
--   of a tag value is 256 characters.
tagsModel_tags :: Lens' TagsModel (HashMap Text Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TagsModel.TagsModel
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TagsModel.TagsModel
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TagsModel.TagsModel
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TagsModel.TagsModel
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TagsModel.TagsModel
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TagsModel.TagsModel
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TagsModel.TagsModel
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TagsModel.TagsModel


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Template

-- | Specifies the name and version of the message template to use for the
--   message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemplate</a> smart constructor.
data Template
Template' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Template

-- | The name of the message template to use for the message. If specified,
--   this value must match the name of an existing message template.
[$sel:name:Template'] :: Template -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the message template to use
--   for the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier
--   for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and
--   version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions
--   resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
[$sel:version:Template'] :: Template -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Template</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Template'</a>, <a>template_name</a> - The name of the
--   message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must
--   match the name of an existing message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:Template'</a>, <a>template_version</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the version of the message template to use for the
--   message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an
--   existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version
--   identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
newTemplate :: Template

-- | The name of the message template to use for the message. If specified,
--   this value must match the name of an existing message template.
template_name :: Lens' Template (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the message template to use
--   for the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier
--   for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and
--   version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions
--   resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
template_version :: Lens' Template (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Template.Template
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Template.Template
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Template.Template
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Template.Template
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Template.Template
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Template.Template
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Template.Template
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Template.Template


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TemplateActiveVersionRequest

-- | Specifies which version of a message template to use as the active
--   version of the template.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemplateActiveVersionRequest</a> smart constructor.
data TemplateActiveVersionRequest
TemplateActiveVersionRequest' :: Maybe Text -> TemplateActiveVersionRequest

-- | The version of the message template to use as the active version of
--   the template. Valid values are: latest, for the most recent version of
--   the template; or, the unique identifier for any existing version of
--   the template. If you specify an identifier, the value must match the
--   identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of
--   versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template
--   Versions resource.
[$sel:version:TemplateActiveVersionRequest'] :: TemplateActiveVersionRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TemplateActiveVersionRequest</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:TemplateActiveVersionRequest'</a>,
--   <a>templateActiveVersionRequest_version</a> - The version of the
--   message template to use as the active version of the template. Valid
--   values are: latest, for the most recent version of the template; or,
--   the unique identifier for any existing version of the template. If you
--   specify an identifier, the value must match the identifier for an
--   existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version
--   identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
newTemplateActiveVersionRequest :: TemplateActiveVersionRequest

-- | The version of the message template to use as the active version of
--   the template. Valid values are: latest, for the most recent version of
--   the template; or, the unique identifier for any existing version of
--   the template. If you specify an identifier, the value must match the
--   identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of
--   versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template
--   Versions resource.
templateActiveVersionRequest_version :: Lens' TemplateActiveVersionRequest (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TemplateConfiguration

-- | Specifies the message template to use for the message, for each type
--   of channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemplateConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data TemplateConfiguration
TemplateConfiguration' :: Maybe Template -> Maybe Template -> Maybe Template -> Maybe Template -> TemplateConfiguration

-- | The SMS template to use for the message.
[$sel:sMSTemplate:TemplateConfiguration'] :: TemplateConfiguration -> Maybe Template

-- | The voice template to use for the message. This object isn't supported
--   for campaigns.
[$sel:voiceTemplate:TemplateConfiguration'] :: TemplateConfiguration -> Maybe Template

-- | The push notification template to use for the message.
[$sel:pushTemplate:TemplateConfiguration'] :: TemplateConfiguration -> Maybe Template

-- | The email template to use for the message.
[$sel:emailTemplate:TemplateConfiguration'] :: TemplateConfiguration -> Maybe Template

--   fields omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:voiceTemplate:TemplateConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>templateConfiguration_voiceTemplate</a> - The voice template to use
--   for the message. This object isn't supported for campaigns.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pushTemplate:TemplateConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>templateConfiguration_pushTemplate</a> - The push notification
--   template to use for the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailTemplate:TemplateConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>templateConfiguration_emailTemplate</a> - The email template to use
--   for the message.
newTemplateConfiguration :: TemplateConfiguration

-- | The SMS template to use for the message.
templateConfiguration_sMSTemplate :: Lens' TemplateConfiguration (Maybe Template)

-- | The voice template to use for the message. This object isn't supported
--   for campaigns.
templateConfiguration_voiceTemplate :: Lens' TemplateConfiguration (Maybe Template)

-- | The push notification template to use for the message.
templateConfiguration_pushTemplate :: Lens' TemplateConfiguration (Maybe Template)

-- | The email template to use for the message.
templateConfiguration_emailTemplate :: Lens' TemplateConfiguration (Maybe Template)

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TemplateResponse

-- | Provides information about a message template that's associated with
--   your Amazon Pinpoint account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemplateResponse</a> smart constructor.
data TemplateResponse
TemplateResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> TemplateResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the message template. This value
--   isn't included in a TemplateResponse object. To retrieve the ARN of a
--   template, use the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate,
--   or GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that
--   you want to retrieve the ARN for.
[$sel:arn:TemplateResponse'] :: TemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The custom description of the message template. This value isn't
--   included in a TemplateResponse object. To retrieve the description of
--   a template, use the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate,
--   or GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that
--   you want to retrieve the description for.
[$sel:templateDescription:TemplateResponse'] :: TemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for
--   message variables in the message template. This object isn't included
--   in a TemplateResponse object. To retrieve this object for a template,
--   use the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate, or
--   GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that you
--   want to retrieve the object for.
[$sel:defaultSubstitutions:TemplateResponse'] :: TemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the
--   message template.
[$sel:version:TemplateResponse'] :: TemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags that are associated
--   with the message template. This object isn't included in a
--   TemplateResponse object. To retrieve this object for a template, use
--   the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate, or
--   GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that you
--   want to retrieve the object for.
[$sel:tags:TemplateResponse'] :: TemplateResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was last
--   modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:TemplateResponse'] :: TemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was created.
[$sel:creationDate:TemplateResponse'] :: TemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The name of the message template.
[$sel:templateName:TemplateResponse'] :: TemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The type of channel that the message template is designed for.
--   Possible values are: EMAIL, PUSH, SMS, and VOICE.
[$sel:templateType:TemplateResponse'] :: TemplateResponse -> TemplateType

-- | Create a value of <a>TemplateResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:TemplateResponse'</a>, <a>templateResponse_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the message template. This value isn't
--   included in a TemplateResponse object. To retrieve the ARN of a
--   template, use the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate,
--   or GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that
--   you want to retrieve the ARN for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:TemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateResponse_templateDescription</a> - The custom description
--   of the message template. This value isn't included in a
--   TemplateResponse object. To retrieve the description of a template,
--   use the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate, or
--   GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that you
--   want to retrieve the description for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubstitutions:TemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateResponse_defaultSubstitutions</a> - The JSON object that
--   specifies the default values that are used for message variables in
--   the message template. This object isn't included in a TemplateResponse
--   object. To retrieve this object for a template, use the
--   GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate, or GetVoiceTemplate
--   operation, depending on the type of template that you want to retrieve
--   the object for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:TemplateResponse'</a>, <a>templateResponse_version</a>
--   - The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the
--   message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:TemplateResponse'</a>, <a>templateResponse_tags</a> - A
--   map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags that are associated
--   with the message template. This object isn't included in a
--   TemplateResponse object. To retrieve this object for a template, use
--   the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate, or
--   GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that you
--   want to retrieve the object for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:TemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the message template was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:TemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601 format,
--   when the message template was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:TemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateResponse_templateName</a> - The name of the message
--   template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateType:TemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateResponse_templateType</a> - The type of channel that the
--   message template is designed for. Possible values are: EMAIL, PUSH,
--   SMS, and VOICE.
newTemplateResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> TemplateResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the message template. This value
--   isn't included in a TemplateResponse object. To retrieve the ARN of a
--   template, use the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate,
--   or GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that
--   you want to retrieve the ARN for.
templateResponse_arn :: Lens' TemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The custom description of the message template. This value isn't
--   included in a TemplateResponse object. To retrieve the description of
--   a template, use the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate,
--   or GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that
--   you want to retrieve the description for.
templateResponse_templateDescription :: Lens' TemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for
--   message variables in the message template. This object isn't included
--   in a TemplateResponse object. To retrieve this object for a template,
--   use the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate, or
--   GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that you
--   want to retrieve the object for.
templateResponse_defaultSubstitutions :: Lens' TemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the
--   message template.
templateResponse_version :: Lens' TemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags that are associated
--   with the message template. This object isn't included in a
--   TemplateResponse object. To retrieve this object for a template, use
--   the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate, or
--   GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that you
--   want to retrieve the object for.
templateResponse_tags :: Lens' TemplateResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was last
--   modified.
templateResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' TemplateResponse Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was created.
templateResponse_creationDate :: Lens' TemplateResponse Text

-- | The name of the message template.
templateResponse_templateName :: Lens' TemplateResponse Text

-- | The type of channel that the message template is designed for.
--   Possible values are: EMAIL, PUSH, SMS, and VOICE.
templateResponse_templateType :: Lens' TemplateResponse TemplateType

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TemplateResponse.TemplateResponse

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SMSTemplateResponse

-- | Provides information about the content and settings for a message
--   template that can be used in text messages that are sent through the
--   SMS channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSMSTemplateResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SMSTemplateResponse
SMSTemplateResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> SMSTemplateResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the message template.
[$sel:arn:SMSTemplateResponse'] :: SMSTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The message body that's used in text messages that are based on the
--   message template.
[$sel:body:SMSTemplateResponse'] :: SMSTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The custom description of the message template.
[$sel:templateDescription:SMSTemplateResponse'] :: SMSTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for
--   message variables in the message template. This object is a set of
--   key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template.
--   The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable.
[$sel:defaultSubstitutions:SMSTemplateResponse'] :: SMSTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the
--   message template, or the version of the template that you specified by
--   using the version parameter in your request.
[$sel:version:SMSTemplateResponse'] :: SMSTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the recommender model that's used by the
--   message template.
[$sel:recommenderId:SMSTemplateResponse'] :: SMSTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags
--   that are associated with the message template. Each tag consists of a
--   required tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:SMSTemplateResponse'] :: SMSTemplateResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was last
--   modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:SMSTemplateResponse'] :: SMSTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was created.
[$sel:creationDate:SMSTemplateResponse'] :: SMSTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The name of the message template.
[$sel:templateName:SMSTemplateResponse'] :: SMSTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The type of channel that the message template is designed for. For an
--   SMS template, this value is SMS.
[$sel:templateType:SMSTemplateResponse'] :: SMSTemplateResponse -> TemplateType

-- | Create a value of <a>SMSTemplateResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   SMS.

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.PushNotificationTemplateResponse

-- | Provides information about the content and settings for a message
--   template that can be used in messages that are sent through a push
--   notification channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPushNotificationTemplateResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PushNotificationTemplateResponse
PushNotificationTemplateResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe DefaultPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe APNSPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> Text -> PushNotificationTemplateResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the message template.
[$sel:arn:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The default message template that's used for push notification
--   channels.
[$sel:default':PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Maybe DefaultPushNotificationTemplate

-- | The custom description of the message template.
[$sel:templateDescription:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The message template that's used for the GCM channel, which is used to
--   send notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM),
--   formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service. This message template
--   overrides the default template for push notification channels
--   (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
[$sel:gcm:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate

-- | The message template that's used for the APNs (Apple Push Notification
--   service) channel. This message template overrides the default template
--   for push notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
[$sel:apns:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Maybe APNSPushNotificationTemplate

-- | The JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for
--   message variables in the message template. This object is a set of
--   key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template.
--   The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable.
[$sel:defaultSubstitutions:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the
--   message template, or the version of the template that you specified by
--   using the version parameter in your request.
[$sel:version:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The message template that's used for the ADM (Amazon Device Messaging)
--   channel. This message template overrides the default template for push
--   notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
[$sel:adm:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate

-- | The message template that's used for the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push)
--   channel. This message template overrides the default template for push
--   notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
[$sel:baidu:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate

-- | The unique identifier for the recommender model that's used by the
--   message template.
[$sel:recommenderId:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags
--   that are associated with the message template. Each tag consists of a
--   required tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was last
--   modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was created.
[$sel:creationDate:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The type of channel that the message template is designed for. For a
--   push notification template, this value is PUSH.
[$sel:templateType:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> TemplateType

-- | The name of the message template.
[$sel:templateName:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Text

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppTemplateResponse

-- | In-App Template Response.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInAppTemplateResponse</a> smart constructor.
data InAppTemplateResponse
InAppTemplateResponse' :: Maybe Layout -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InAppMessageContent] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> InAppTemplateResponse

-- | The layout of the message.
[$sel:layout:InAppTemplateResponse'] :: InAppTemplateResponse -> Maybe Layout

-- | The resource arn of the template.
[$sel:arn:InAppTemplateResponse'] :: InAppTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the template.
[$sel:templateDescription:InAppTemplateResponse'] :: InAppTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The content of the message, can include up to 5 modals. Each modal
--   must contain a message, a header, and background color. ImageUrl and
--   buttons are optional.
[$sel:content:InAppTemplateResponse'] :: InAppTemplateResponse -> Maybe [InAppMessageContent]

-- | Custom config to be sent to client.
[$sel:customConfig:InAppTemplateResponse'] :: InAppTemplateResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The version id of the template.
[$sel:version:InAppTemplateResponse'] :: InAppTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:InAppTemplateResponse'] :: InAppTemplateResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The last modified date of the template.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:InAppTemplateResponse'] :: InAppTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The creation date of the template.
[$sel:creationDate:InAppTemplateResponse'] :: InAppTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The name of the template.
[$sel:templateName:InAppTemplateResponse'] :: InAppTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The type of the template.
[$sel:templateType:InAppTemplateResponse'] :: InAppTemplateResponse -> TemplateType

-- | Create a value of <a>InAppTemplateResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:layout:InAppTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateResponse_layout</a> - The layout of the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:InAppTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateResponse_arn</a> - The resource arn of the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:InAppTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateResponse_templateDescription</a> - The description of
--   the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:InAppTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateResponse_content</a> - The content of the message, can
--   include up to 5 modals. Each modal must contain a message, a header,
--   and background color. ImageUrl and buttons are optional.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customConfig:InAppTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateResponse_customConfig</a> - Custom config to be sent
--   to client.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:InAppTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateResponse_version</a> - The version id of the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:InAppTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateResponse_tags</a> - A string-to-string map of
--   key-value pairs that defines the tags to associate with the message
--   template. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated
--   tag value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:InAppTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The last modified date
--   of the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:InAppTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateResponse_creationDate</a> - The creation date of the
--   template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:InAppTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateResponse_templateName</a> - The name of the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateType:InAppTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateResponse_templateType</a> - The type of the template.
newInAppTemplateResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> InAppTemplateResponse

-- | The layout of the message.
inAppTemplateResponse_layout :: Lens' InAppTemplateResponse (Maybe Layout)

-- | The resource arn of the template.
inAppTemplateResponse_arn :: Lens' InAppTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the template.
inAppTemplateResponse_templateDescription :: Lens' InAppTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The content of the message, can include up to 5 modals. Each modal
--   must contain a message, a header, and background color. ImageUrl and
--   buttons are optional.
inAppTemplateResponse_content :: Lens' InAppTemplateResponse (Maybe [InAppMessageContent])

-- | Custom config to be sent to client.
inAppTemplateResponse_customConfig :: Lens' InAppTemplateResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The version id of the template.
inAppTemplateResponse_version :: Lens' InAppTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
inAppTemplateResponse_tags :: Lens' InAppTemplateResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The last modified date of the template.
inAppTemplateResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' InAppTemplateResponse Text

-- | The creation date of the template.
inAppTemplateResponse_creationDate :: Lens' InAppTemplateResponse Text

-- | The name of the template.
inAppTemplateResponse_templateName :: Lens' InAppTemplateResponse Text

-- | The type of the template.
inAppTemplateResponse_templateType :: Lens' InAppTemplateResponse TemplateType

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.InAppTemplateResponse.InAppTemplateResponse

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.EmailTemplateResponse

-- | Provides information about the content and settings for a message
--   template that can be used in messages that are sent through the email
--   channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailTemplateResponse</a> smart constructor.
data EmailTemplateResponse
EmailTemplateResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> EmailTemplateResponse

-- | The subject line, or title, that's used in email messages that are
--   based on the message template.
[$sel:subject:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The message body, in plain text format, that's used in email messages
--   that are based on the message template.
[$sel:textPart:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the message template.
[$sel:arn:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The custom description of the message template.
[$sel:templateDescription:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for
--   message variables in the message template. This object is a set of
--   key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template.
--   The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable.
[$sel:defaultSubstitutions:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the
--   message template, or the version of the template that you specified by
--   using the version parameter in your request.
[$sel:version:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The message body, in HTML format, that's used in email messages that
--   are based on the message template.
[$sel:htmlPart:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the recommender model that's used by the
--   message template.
[$sel:recommenderId:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags
--   that are associated with the message template. Each tag consists of a
--   required tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was last
--   modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was created.
[$sel:creationDate:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The name of the message template.
[$sel:templateName:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The type of channel that the message template is designed for. For an
--   email template, this value is EMAIL.
[$sel:templateType:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> TemplateType

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailTemplateResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:EmailTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateResponse_subject</a> - The subject line, or title,
--   that's used in email messages that are based on the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:textPart:EmailTemplateResponse'</a>,

--   value is EMAIL.

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TemplateVersionResponse

-- | Provides information about a specific version of a message template.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemplateVersionResponse</a> smart constructor.
data TemplateVersionResponse
TemplateVersionResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateVersionResponse

-- | The custom description of the version of the message template.
[$sel:templateDescription:TemplateVersionResponse'] :: TemplateVersionResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for
--   message variables in the version of the message template. This object
--   is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in
--   the template. The corresponding value defines the default value for
--   that variable.
[$sel:defaultSubstitutions:TemplateVersionResponse'] :: TemplateVersionResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the message template. This
--   value is an integer that Amazon Pinpoint automatically increments and
--   assigns to each new version of a template.
[$sel:version:TemplateVersionResponse'] :: TemplateVersionResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the version of the message template
--   was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:TemplateVersionResponse'] :: TemplateVersionResponse -> Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the version of the message template
--   was created.
[$sel:creationDate:TemplateVersionResponse'] :: TemplateVersionResponse -> Text

-- | The name of the message template.
[$sel:templateName:TemplateVersionResponse'] :: TemplateVersionResponse -> Text

-- | The type of channel that the message template is designed for.
--   Possible values are: EMAIL, PUSH, SMS, and VOICE.
[$sel:templateType:TemplateVersionResponse'] :: TemplateVersionResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TemplateVersionResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:TemplateVersionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateVersionResponse_templateDescription</a> - The custom
--   description of the version of the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubstitutions:TemplateVersionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateVersionResponse_defaultSubstitutions</a> - A JSON object
--   that specifies the default values that are used for message variables
--   in the version of the message template. This object is a set of
--   key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template.
--   The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:TemplateVersionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateVersionResponse_version</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   version of the message template. This value is an integer that Amazon
--   Pinpoint automatically increments and assigns to each new version of a
--   template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:TemplateVersionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateVersionResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date, in ISO
--   8601 format, when the version of the message template was last
--   modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:TemplateVersionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateVersionResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the version of the message template was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:TemplateVersionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateVersionResponse_templateName</a> - The name of the message
--   template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateType:TemplateVersionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateVersionResponse_templateType</a> - The type of channel that
--   the message template is designed for. Possible values are: EMAIL,
--   PUSH, SMS, and VOICE.
newTemplateVersionResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateVersionResponse

-- | The custom description of the version of the message template.
templateVersionResponse_templateDescription :: Lens' TemplateVersionResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for
--   message variables in the version of the message template. This object
--   is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in
--   the template. The corresponding value defines the default value for
--   that variable.
templateVersionResponse_defaultSubstitutions :: Lens' TemplateVersionResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the message template. This
--   value is an integer that Amazon Pinpoint automatically increments and
--   assigns to each new version of a template.
templateVersionResponse_version :: Lens' TemplateVersionResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the version of the message template
--   was last modified.
templateVersionResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' TemplateVersionResponse Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the version of the message template
--   was created.
templateVersionResponse_creationDate :: Lens' TemplateVersionResponse Text

-- | The name of the message template.
templateVersionResponse_templateName :: Lens' TemplateVersionResponse Text

-- | The type of channel that the message template is designed for.
--   Possible values are: EMAIL, PUSH, SMS, and VOICE.
templateVersionResponse_templateType :: Lens' TemplateVersionResponse Text

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TemplateVersionsResponse

-- | Provides information about all the versions of a specific message
--   template.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemplateVersionsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data TemplateVersionsResponse
TemplateVersionsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> [TemplateVersionResponse] -> TemplateVersionsResponse

-- | The unique identifier for the request to retrieve information about
--   all the versions of the message template.
[$sel:requestID:TemplateVersionsResponse'] :: TemplateVersionsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
[$sel:nextToken:TemplateVersionsResponse'] :: TemplateVersionsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The message that's returned from the API for the request to retrieve
--   information about all the versions of the message template.
[$sel:message:TemplateVersionsResponse'] :: TemplateVersionsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of responses, one for each version of the message template.
[$sel:item:TemplateVersionsResponse'] :: TemplateVersionsResponse -> [TemplateVersionResponse]

--   fields omitted.

--   message template.

--   <a>$sel:nextToken:TemplateVersionsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateVersionsResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use in a
--   subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated
--   response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:TemplateVersionsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateVersionsResponse_message</a> - The message that's returned
--   from the API for the request to retrieve information about all the
--   versions of the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:TemplateVersionsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateVersionsResponse_item</a> - An array of responses, one for
--   each version of the message template.
newTemplateVersionsResponse :: TemplateVersionsResponse

--   all the versions of the message template.

--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.

--   information about all the versions of the message template.

templateVersionsResponse_item :: Lens' TemplateVersionsResponse [TemplateVersionResponse]

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TemplatesResponse

-- | Provides information about all the message templates that are
--   associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemplatesResponse</a> smart constructor.
data TemplatesResponse
TemplatesResponse' :: Maybe Text -> [TemplateResponse] -> TemplatesResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
[$sel:nextToken:TemplatesResponse'] :: TemplatesResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of responses, one for each message template that's associated
--   with your Amazon Pinpoint account and meets any filter criteria that
--   you specified in the request.
[$sel:item:TemplatesResponse'] :: TemplatesResponse -> [TemplateResponse]

-- | Create a value of <a>TemplatesResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:TemplatesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templatesResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use in a subsequent
--   request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This
--   value is null if there are no additional pages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:TemplatesResponse'</a>, <a>templatesResponse_item</a> -
--   An array of responses, one for each message template that's associated
--   with your Amazon Pinpoint account and meets any filter criteria that
--   you specified in the request.
newTemplatesResponse :: TemplatesResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
templatesResponse_nextToken :: Lens' TemplatesResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of responses, one for each message template that's associated
--   with your Amazon Pinpoint account and meets any filter criteria that
--   you specified in the request.
templatesResponse_item :: Lens' TemplatesResponse [TemplateResponse]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TemplatesResponse.TemplatesResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TemplatesResponse.TemplatesResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TemplatesResponse.TemplatesResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TemplatesResponse.TemplatesResponse
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TemplatesResponse.TemplatesResponse
