instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TemplatesResponse.TemplatesResponse


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TreatmentResource

-- | Specifies the settings for a campaign treatment. A <i>treatment</i> is
--   a variation of a campaign that's used for A/B testing of a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTreatmentResource</a> smart constructor.
data TreatmentResource
TreatmentResource' :: Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration -> Maybe CampaignState -> Maybe Schedule -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MessageConfiguration -> Text -> Int -> TreatmentResource

-- | The delivery configuration settings for sending the treatment through
--   a custom channel. This object is required if the MessageConfiguration
--   object for the treatment specifies a CustomMessage object.
[$sel:customDeliveryConfiguration:TreatmentResource'] :: TreatmentResource -> Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration

-- | The current status of the treatment.
[$sel:state:TreatmentResource'] :: TreatmentResource -> Maybe CampaignState

-- | The schedule settings for the treatment.
[$sel:schedule:TreatmentResource'] :: TreatmentResource -> Maybe Schedule

-- | The message template to use for the treatment.
[$sel:templateConfiguration:TreatmentResource'] :: TreatmentResource -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration

-- | The custom name of the treatment.
[$sel:treatmentName:TreatmentResource'] :: TreatmentResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The custom description of the treatment.
[$sel:treatmentDescription:TreatmentResource'] :: TreatmentResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The message configuration settings for the treatment.
[$sel:messageConfiguration:TreatmentResource'] :: TreatmentResource -> Maybe MessageConfiguration

-- | The unique identifier for the treatment.
[$sel:id:TreatmentResource'] :: TreatmentResource -> Text

-- | The allocated percentage of users (segment members) that the treatment
--   is sent to.
[$sel:sizePercent:TreatmentResource'] :: TreatmentResource -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>TreatmentResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:customDeliveryConfiguration:TreatmentResource'</a>,
--   <a>treatmentResource_customDeliveryConfiguration</a> - The delivery
--   configuration settings for sending the treatment through a custom
--   channel. This object is required if the MessageConfiguration object
--   for the treatment specifies a CustomMessage object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:TreatmentResource'</a>, <a>treatmentResource_state</a> -
--   The current status of the treatment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schedule:TreatmentResource'</a>,
--   <a>treatmentResource_schedule</a> - The schedule settings for the
--   treatment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateConfiguration:TreatmentResource'</a>,
--   <a>treatmentResource_templateConfiguration</a> - The message template
--   to use for the treatment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatmentName:TreatmentResource'</a>,
--   <a>treatmentResource_treatmentName</a> - The custom name of the
--   treatment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatmentDescription:TreatmentResource'</a>,
--   <a>treatmentResource_treatmentDescription</a> - The custom description
--   of the treatment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfiguration:TreatmentResource'</a>,
--   <a>treatmentResource_messageConfiguration</a> - The message
--   configuration settings for the treatment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:TreatmentResource'</a>, <a>treatmentResource_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the treatment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizePercent:TreatmentResource'</a>,
--   <a>treatmentResource_sizePercent</a> - The allocated percentage of
--   users (segment members) that the treatment is sent to.
newTreatmentResource :: Text -> Int -> TreatmentResource

-- | The delivery configuration settings for sending the treatment through
--   a custom channel. This object is required if the MessageConfiguration
--   object for the treatment specifies a CustomMessage object.
treatmentResource_customDeliveryConfiguration :: Lens' TreatmentResource (Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration)

-- | The current status of the treatment.
treatmentResource_state :: Lens' TreatmentResource (Maybe CampaignState)

-- | The schedule settings for the treatment.
treatmentResource_schedule :: Lens' TreatmentResource (Maybe Schedule)

-- | The message template to use for the treatment.
treatmentResource_templateConfiguration :: Lens' TreatmentResource (Maybe TemplateConfiguration)

-- | The custom name of the treatment.
treatmentResource_treatmentName :: Lens' TreatmentResource (Maybe Text)

-- | The custom description of the treatment.
treatmentResource_treatmentDescription :: Lens' TreatmentResource (Maybe Text)

-- | The message configuration settings for the treatment.
treatmentResource_messageConfiguration :: Lens' TreatmentResource (Maybe MessageConfiguration)

-- | The unique identifier for the treatment.
treatmentResource_id :: Lens' TreatmentResource Text

-- | The allocated percentage of users (segment members) that the treatment
--   is sent to.
treatmentResource_sizePercent :: Lens' TreatmentResource Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TreatmentResource.TreatmentResource
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TreatmentResource.TreatmentResource
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TreatmentResource.TreatmentResource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TreatmentResource.TreatmentResource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TreatmentResource.TreatmentResource
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TreatmentResource.TreatmentResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.TreatmentResource.TreatmentResource


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignResponse

-- | Provides information about the status, configuration, and other
--   settings for a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignResponse
CampaignResponse' :: Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration -> Maybe CampaignState -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Schedule -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration -> Maybe CampaignHook -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CampaignLimits -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe CampaignState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MessageConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [TreatmentResource] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CampaignResponse

-- | The delivery configuration settings for sending the campaign through a
--   custom channel.
[$sel:customDeliveryConfiguration:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration

-- | The current status of the campaign.
[$sel:state:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe CampaignState

-- | Defines the priority of the campaign, used to decide the order of
--   messages displayed to user if there are multiple messages scheduled to
--   be displayed at the same moment.
[$sel:priority:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The schedule settings for the campaign.
[$sel:schedule:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe Schedule

-- | The message template that’s used for the campaign.
[$sel:templateConfiguration:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration

-- | The settings for the AWS Lambda function to use as a code hook for the
--   campaign. You can use this hook to customize the segment that's used
--   by the campaign.
[$sel:hook:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe CampaignHook

-- | The custom name of the default treatment for the campaign, if the
--   campaign has multiple treatments. A <i>treatment</i> is a variation of
--   a campaign that's used for A/B testing.
[$sel:treatmentName:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The messaging limits for the campaign.
[$sel:limits:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe CampaignLimits

-- | Specifies whether the campaign is paused. A paused campaign doesn't
--   run unless you resume it by changing this value to false.
[$sel:isPaused:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The current status of the campaign's default treatment. This value
--   exists only for campaigns that have more than one treatment.
[$sel:defaultState:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe CampaignState

-- | The name of the campaign.
[$sel:name:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The version number of the campaign.
[$sel:version:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The allocated percentage of users (segment members) who shouldn't
--   receive messages from the campaign.
[$sel:holdoutPercent:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The custom description of the default treatment for the campaign.
[$sel:treatmentDescription:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The message configuration settings for the campaign.
[$sel:messageConfiguration:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe MessageConfiguration

-- | The custom description of the campaign.
[$sel:description:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of responses, one for each treatment that you defined for the
--   campaign, in addition to the default treatment.
[$sel:additionalTreatments:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe [TreatmentResource]

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags
--   that are associated with the campaign. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the campaign was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the campaign was created.
[$sel:creationDate:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the segment that's associated with the
--   campaign.
[$sel:segmentId:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Text

-- | The version number of the segment that's associated with the campaign.
[$sel:segmentVersion:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Int

-- | The unique identifier for the campaign.
[$sel:id:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the campaign.
[$sel:arn:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the campaign applies
--   to.
[$sel:applicationId:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:customDeliveryConfiguration:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_customDeliveryConfiguration</a> - The delivery
--   configuration settings for sending the campaign through a custom
--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_state</a> -
--   The current status of the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:priority:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_priority</a> - Defines the priority of the
--   campaign, used to decide the order of messages displayed to user if
--   there are multiple messages scheduled to be displayed at the same
--   moment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schedule:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_schedule</a> - The schedule settings for the
--   campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateConfiguration:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_templateConfiguration</a> - The message template
--   that’s used for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hook:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_hook</a> - The
--   settings for the AWS Lambda function to use as a code hook for the
--   campaign. You can use this hook to customize the segment that's used
--   by the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatmentName:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_treatmentName</a> - The custom name of the default
--   treatment for the campaign, if the campaign has multiple treatments. A
--   <i>treatment</i> is a variation of a campaign that's used for A/B
--   testing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limits:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_limits</a> -
--   The messaging limits for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isPaused:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_isPaused</a> - Specifies whether the campaign is
--   paused. A paused campaign doesn't run unless you resume it by changing
--   this value to false.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultState:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_defaultState</a> - The current status of the
--   campaign's default treatment. This value exists only for campaigns
--   that have more than one treatment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_name</a> - The
--   name of the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_version</a>
--   - The version number of the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:holdoutPercent:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_holdoutPercent</a> - The allocated percentage of
--   users (segment members) who shouldn't receive messages from the
--   campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatmentDescription:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_treatmentDescription</a> - The custom description
--   of the default treatment for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfiguration:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_messageConfiguration</a> - The message
--   configuration settings for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_description</a> - The custom description of the
--   campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalTreatments:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_additionalTreatments</a> - An array of responses,
--   one for each treatment that you defined for the campaign, in addition
--   to the default treatment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_tags</a> - A
--   string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags that
--   are associated with the campaign. Each tag consists of a required tag
--   key and an associated tag value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the campaign was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601 format,
--   when the campaign was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentId:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_segmentId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   segment that's associated with the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentVersion:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_segmentVersion</a> - The version number of the
--   segment that's associated with the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application that the campaign applies to.
newCampaignResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CampaignResponse

-- | The delivery configuration settings for sending the campaign through a
--   custom channel.
campaignResponse_customDeliveryConfiguration :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration)

-- | The current status of the campaign.
campaignResponse_state :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe CampaignState)

-- | Defines the priority of the campaign, used to decide the order of
--   messages displayed to user if there are multiple messages scheduled to
--   be displayed at the same moment.
campaignResponse_priority :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The schedule settings for the campaign.
campaignResponse_schedule :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe Schedule)

-- | The message template that’s used for the campaign.
campaignResponse_templateConfiguration :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe TemplateConfiguration)

-- | The settings for the AWS Lambda function to use as a code hook for the
--   campaign. You can use this hook to customize the segment that's used
--   by the campaign.
campaignResponse_hook :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe CampaignHook)

-- | The custom name of the default treatment for the campaign, if the
--   campaign has multiple treatments. A <i>treatment</i> is a variation of
--   a campaign that's used for A/B testing.
campaignResponse_treatmentName :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The messaging limits for the campaign.
campaignResponse_limits :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe CampaignLimits)

-- | The version number of the campaign.
campaignResponse_version :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe Int)

--   receive messages from the campaign.
campaignResponse_holdoutPercent :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe Int)

--   tag key and an associated tag value.

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignsResponse

-- | Provides information about the configuration and other settings for
--   all the campaigns that are associated with an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignsResponse
CampaignsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> [CampaignResponse] -> CampaignsResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
[$sel:nextToken:CampaignsResponse'] :: CampaignsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of responses, one for each campaign that's associated with
--   the application.
[$sel:item:CampaignsResponse'] :: CampaignsResponse -> [CampaignResponse]

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:CampaignsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignsResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use in a subsequent
--   request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This
--   value is null if there are no additional pages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:CampaignsResponse'</a>, <a>campaignsResponse_item</a> -
--   An array of responses, one for each campaign that's associated with
--   the application.
newCampaignsResponse :: CampaignsResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
campaignsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' CampaignsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of responses, one for each campaign that's associated with
--   the application.
campaignsResponse_item :: Lens' CampaignsResponse [CampaignResponse]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignsResponse.CampaignsResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignsResponse.CampaignsResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignsResponse.CampaignsResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignsResponse.CampaignsResponse
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.CampaignsResponse.CampaignsResponse

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentGroup

-- | Specifies the base segments and dimensions for a segment, and the
--   relationships between these base segments and dimensions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSegmentGroup</a> smart constructor.
data SegmentGroup
SegmentGroup' :: Maybe [SegmentReference] -> Maybe SourceType -> Maybe Type -> Maybe [SegmentDimensions] -> SegmentGroup

-- | The base segment to build the segment on. A base segment, also
--   referred to as a <i>source segment</i>, defines the initial population
--   of endpoints for a segment. When you add dimensions to a segment,
--   Amazon Pinpoint filters the base segment by using the dimensions that
--   you specify.
--   
--   You can specify more than one dimensional segment or only one imported
--   segment. If you specify an imported segment, the Amazon Pinpoint
--   console displays a segment size estimate that indicates the size of
--   the imported segment without any filters applied to it.
[$sel:sourceSegments:SegmentGroup'] :: SegmentGroup -> Maybe [SegmentReference]

-- | Specifies how to handle multiple base segments for the segment. For
--   example, if you specify three base segments for the segment, whether
--   the resulting segment is based on all, any, or none of the base
--   segments.
[$sel:sourceType:SegmentGroup'] :: SegmentGroup -> Maybe SourceType

-- | Specifies how to handle multiple dimensions for the segment. For
--   example, if you specify three dimensions for the segment, whether the
--   resulting segment includes endpoints that match all, any, or none of
--   the dimensions.
[$sel:type':SegmentGroup'] :: SegmentGroup -> Maybe Type

-- | An array that defines the dimensions for the segment.
[$sel:dimensions:SegmentGroup'] :: SegmentGroup -> Maybe [SegmentDimensions]

-- | Create a value of <a>SegmentGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceSegments:SegmentGroup'</a>,
--   <a>segmentGroup_sourceSegments</a> - The base segment to build the
--   segment on. A base segment, also referred to as a <i>source
--   segment</i>, defines the initial population of endpoints for a
--   segment. When you add dimensions to a segment, Amazon Pinpoint filters
--   the base segment by using the dimensions that you specify.
--   
--   You can specify more than one dimensional segment or only one imported
--   segment. If you specify an imported segment, the Amazon Pinpoint
--   console displays a segment size estimate that indicates the size of
--   the imported segment without any filters applied to it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceType:SegmentGroup'</a>, <a>segmentGroup_sourceType</a> -
--   Specifies how to handle multiple base segments for the segment. For
--   example, if you specify three base segments for the segment, whether
--   the resulting segment is based on all, any, or none of the base
--   segments.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':SegmentGroup'</a>, <a>segmentGroup_type</a> - Specifies
--   how to handle multiple dimensions for the segment. For example, if you
--   specify three dimensions for the segment, whether the resulting
--   segment includes endpoints that match all, any, or none of the
--   dimensions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:SegmentGroup'</a>, <a>segmentGroup_dimensions</a> -
--   An array that defines the dimensions for the segment.
newSegmentGroup :: SegmentGroup

-- | The base segment to build the segment on. A base segment, also
--   referred to as a <i>source segment</i>, defines the initial population
--   of endpoints for a segment. When you add dimensions to a segment,
--   Amazon Pinpoint filters the base segment by using the dimensions that
--   you specify.
--   
--   You can specify more than one dimensional segment or only one imported
--   segment. If you specify an imported segment, the Amazon Pinpoint
--   console displays a segment size estimate that indicates the size of
--   the imported segment without any filters applied to it.
segmentGroup_sourceSegments :: Lens' SegmentGroup (Maybe [SegmentReference])

-- | Specifies how to handle multiple base segments for the segment. For
--   example, if you specify three base segments for the segment, whether
--   the resulting segment is based on all, any, or none of the base
--   segments.
segmentGroup_sourceType :: Lens' SegmentGroup (Maybe SourceType)

-- | Specifies how to handle multiple dimensions for the segment. For
--   example, if you specify three dimensions for the segment, whether the
--   resulting segment includes endpoints that match all, any, or none of
--   the dimensions.
segmentGroup_type :: Lens' SegmentGroup (Maybe Type)

-- | An array that defines the dimensions for the segment.
segmentGroup_dimensions :: Lens' SegmentGroup (Maybe [SegmentDimensions])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentGroup.SegmentGroup
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentGroup.SegmentGroup
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentGroup.SegmentGroup
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentGroup.SegmentGroup
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentGroup.SegmentGroup
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentGroup.SegmentGroup
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentGroup.SegmentGroup
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentGroup.SegmentGroup


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentGroupList

-- | Specifies the settings that define the relationships between segment
--   groups for a segment.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSegmentGroupList</a> smart constructor.
data SegmentGroupList
SegmentGroupList' :: Maybe Include -> Maybe [SegmentGroup] -> SegmentGroupList

-- | Specifies how to handle multiple segment groups for the segment. For
--   example, if the segment includes three segment groups, whether the
--   resulting segment includes endpoints that match all, any, or none of
--   the segment groups.
[$sel:include:SegmentGroupList'] :: SegmentGroupList -> Maybe Include

-- | An array that defines the set of segment criteria to evaluate when
--   handling segment groups for the segment.
[$sel:groups:SegmentGroupList'] :: SegmentGroupList -> Maybe [SegmentGroup]

-- | Create a value of <a>SegmentGroupList</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:include:SegmentGroupList'</a>, <a>segmentGroupList_include</a>
--   - Specifies how to handle multiple segment groups for the segment. For
--   example, if the segment includes three segment groups, whether the
--   resulting segment includes endpoints that match all, any, or none of
--   the segment groups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groups:SegmentGroupList'</a>, <a>segmentGroupList_groups</a> -
--   An array that defines the set of segment criteria to evaluate when
--   handling segment groups for the segment.
newSegmentGroupList :: SegmentGroupList

-- | Specifies how to handle multiple segment groups for the segment. For
--   example, if the segment includes three segment groups, whether the
--   resulting segment includes endpoints that match all, any, or none of
--   the segment groups.
segmentGroupList_include :: Lens' SegmentGroupList (Maybe Include)

-- | An array that defines the set of segment criteria to evaluate when
--   handling segment groups for the segment.
segmentGroupList_groups :: Lens' SegmentGroupList (Maybe [SegmentGroup])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentGroupList.SegmentGroupList
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentGroupList.SegmentGroupList
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentGroupList.SegmentGroupList
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentGroupList.SegmentGroupList
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentGroupList.SegmentGroupList
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentGroupList.SegmentGroupList
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentGroupList.SegmentGroupList
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentGroupList.SegmentGroupList


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentResponse

-- | Provides information about the configuration, dimension, and other
--   settings for a segment.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSegmentResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SegmentResponse
SegmentResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe SegmentGroupList -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe SegmentImportResource -> Maybe SegmentDimensions -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> SegmentType -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> SegmentResponse

-- | The date and time when the segment was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of one or more segment groups that apply to the segment. Each
--   segment group consists of zero or more base segments and the
--   dimensions that are applied to those base segments.
[$sel:segmentGroups:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> Maybe SegmentGroupList

-- | The name of the segment.
[$sel:name:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The version number of the segment.
[$sel:version:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The settings for the import job that's associated with the segment.
[$sel:importDefinition:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> Maybe SegmentImportResource

-- | The dimension settings for the segment.
[$sel:dimensions:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> Maybe SegmentDimensions

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags
--   that are associated with the segment. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The segment type. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DIMENSIONAL - A dynamic segment, which is a segment that uses
--   selection criteria that you specify and is based on endpoint data
--   that's reported by your app. Dynamic segments can change over
--   time.</li>
--   <li>IMPORT - A static segment, which is a segment that uses selection
--   criteria that you specify and is based on endpoint definitions that
--   you import from a file. Imported segments are static; they don't
--   change over time.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:segmentType:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> SegmentType

-- | The date and time when the segment was created.
[$sel:creationDate:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the segment.
[$sel:id:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the segment.
[$sel:arn:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the segment is
--   associated with.
[$sel:applicationId:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SegmentResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:SegmentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>segmentResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date and time when the
--   segment was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentGroups:SegmentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>segmentResponse_segmentGroups</a> - A list of one or more segment
--   groups that apply to the segment. Each segment group consists of zero
--   or more base segments and the dimensions that are applied to those
--   base segments.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:SegmentResponse'</a>, <a>segmentResponse_name</a> - The
--   name of the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:SegmentResponse'</a>, <a>segmentResponse_version</a> -
--   The version number of the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:importDefinition:SegmentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>segmentResponse_importDefinition</a> - The settings for the import
--   job that's associated with the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:SegmentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>segmentResponse_dimensions</a> - The dimension settings for the
--   segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:SegmentResponse'</a>, <a>segmentResponse_tags</a> - A
--   string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags that
--   are associated with the segment. Each tag consists of a required tag
--   key and an associated tag value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentType:SegmentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>segmentResponse_segmentType</a> - The segment type. Valid values
--   are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DIMENSIONAL - A dynamic segment, which is a segment that uses
--   selection criteria that you specify and is based on endpoint data
--   that's reported by your app. Dynamic segments can change over
--   time.</li>
--   <li>IMPORT - A static segment, which is a segment that uses selection
--   criteria that you specify and is based on endpoint definitions that
--   you import from a file. Imported segments are static; they don't
--   change over time.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:SegmentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>segmentResponse_creationDate</a> - The date and time when the
--   segment was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:SegmentResponse'</a>, <a>segmentResponse_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:SegmentResponse'</a>, <a>segmentResponse_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:SegmentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>segmentResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application that the segment is associated with.
newSegmentResponse :: SegmentType -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> SegmentResponse

-- | The date and time when the segment was last modified.
segmentResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' SegmentResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of one or more segment groups that apply to the segment. Each
--   segment group consists of zero or more base segments and the
--   dimensions that are applied to those base segments.
segmentResponse_segmentGroups :: Lens' SegmentResponse (Maybe SegmentGroupList)

-- | The name of the segment.
segmentResponse_name :: Lens' SegmentResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The version number of the segment.
segmentResponse_version :: Lens' SegmentResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The settings for the import job that's associated with the segment.
segmentResponse_importDefinition :: Lens' SegmentResponse (Maybe SegmentImportResource)

-- | The dimension settings for the segment.
segmentResponse_dimensions :: Lens' SegmentResponse (Maybe SegmentDimensions)

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags
--   that are associated with the segment. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
segmentResponse_tags :: Lens' SegmentResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The segment type. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DIMENSIONAL - A dynamic segment, which is a segment that uses
--   selection criteria that you specify and is based on endpoint data
--   that's reported by your app. Dynamic segments can change over
--   time.</li>
--   <li>IMPORT - A static segment, which is a segment that uses selection
--   criteria that you specify and is based on endpoint definitions that
--   you import from a file. Imported segments are static; they don't
--   change over time.</li>
--   </ul>
segmentResponse_segmentType :: Lens' SegmentResponse SegmentType

-- | The date and time when the segment was created.
segmentResponse_creationDate :: Lens' SegmentResponse Text

-- | The unique identifier for the segment.
segmentResponse_id :: Lens' SegmentResponse Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the segment.
segmentResponse_arn :: Lens' SegmentResponse Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the segment is
--   associated with.
segmentResponse_applicationId :: Lens' SegmentResponse Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentResponse.SegmentResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentResponse.SegmentResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentResponse.SegmentResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentResponse.SegmentResponse
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentResponse.SegmentResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentResponse.SegmentResponse

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentsResponse

-- | Provides information about all the segments that are associated with
--   an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSegmentsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SegmentsResponse
SegmentsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> [SegmentResponse] -> SegmentsResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
[$sel:nextToken:SegmentsResponse'] :: SegmentsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of responses, one for each segment that's associated with the
--   application (Segments resource) or each version of a segment that's
--   associated with the application (Segment Versions resource).
[$sel:item:SegmentsResponse'] :: SegmentsResponse -> [SegmentResponse]

-- | Create a value of <a>SegmentsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:SegmentsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>segmentsResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use in a subsequent
--   request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This
--   value is null if there are no additional pages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:SegmentsResponse'</a>, <a>segmentsResponse_item</a> - An
--   array of responses, one for each segment that's associated with the
--   application (Segments resource) or each version of a segment that's
--   associated with the application (Segment Versions resource).
newSegmentsResponse :: SegmentsResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
segmentsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' SegmentsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of responses, one for each segment that's associated with the
--   application (Segments resource) or each version of a segment that's
--   associated with the application (Segment Versions resource).
segmentsResponse_item :: Lens' SegmentsResponse [SegmentResponse]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentsResponse.SegmentsResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentsResponse.SegmentsResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentsResponse.SegmentsResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentsResponse.SegmentsResponse
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SegmentsResponse.SegmentsResponse

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.UpdateAttributesRequest

-- | Specifies one or more attributes to remove from all the endpoints that
--   are associated with an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateAttributesRequest</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateAttributesRequest
UpdateAttributesRequest' :: Maybe [Text] -> UpdateAttributesRequest

-- | An array of the attributes to remove from all the endpoints that are
--   associated with the application. The array can specify the complete,
--   exact name of each attribute to remove or it can specify a glob
--   pattern that an attribute name must match in order for the attribute
--   to be removed.
[$sel:blacklist:UpdateAttributesRequest'] :: UpdateAttributesRequest -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateAttributesRequest</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:blacklist:UpdateAttributesRequest'</a>,
--   <a>updateAttributesRequest_blacklist</a> - An array of the attributes
--   to remove from all the endpoints that are associated with the
--   application. The array can specify the complete, exact name of each
--   attribute to remove or it can specify a glob pattern that an attribute
--   name must match in order for the attribute to be removed.
newUpdateAttributesRequest :: UpdateAttributesRequest

-- | An array of the attributes to remove from all the endpoints that are
--   associated with the application. The array can specify the complete,
--   exact name of each attribute to remove or it can specify a glob
--   pattern that an attribute name must match in order for the attribute
--   to be removed.
updateAttributesRequest_blacklist :: Lens' UpdateAttributesRequest (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.UpdateAttributesRequest.UpdateAttributesRequest
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.UpdateAttributesRequest.UpdateAttributesRequest

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.UpdateAttributesRequest.UpdateAttributesRequest
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.UpdateAttributesRequest.UpdateAttributesRequest
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.UpdateAttributesRequest.UpdateAttributesRequest
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.UpdateAttributesRequest.UpdateAttributesRequest


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.UpdateRecommenderConfiguration

-- | Specifies Amazon Pinpoint configuration settings for retrieving and
--   processing recommendation data from a recommender model.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateRecommenderConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateRecommenderConfiguration
UpdateRecommenderConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Text -> Text -> UpdateRecommenderConfiguration

-- | The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function to
--   invoke for additional processing of recommendation data that's
--   retrieved from the recommender model.
[$sel:recommendationTransformerUri:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: UpdateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | A custom display name for the standard endpoint or user attribute
--   (RecommendationItems) that temporarily stores recommended items for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This value is required if the
--   configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda function
--   (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data.
--   
--   This name appears in the <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template
--   editor on the Amazon Pinpoint console. The name can contain up to 25
--   characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-). These restrictions don't apply to
--   attribute values.
[$sel:recommendationsDisplayName:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: UpdateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of Amazon Pinpoint ID to associate with unique user IDs in
--   the recommender model. This value enables the model to use attribute
--   and event data that’s specific to a particular endpoint or user in an
--   Amazon Pinpoint application. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PINPOINT_ENDPOINT_ID - Associate each user in the model with a
--   particular endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based
--   on endpoint IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. This is the default value.</li>
--   <li>PINPOINT_USER_ID - Associate each user in the model with a
--   particular user and endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is
--   correlated based on user IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. If you specify this
--   value, an endpoint definition in Amazon Pinpoint has to specify both a
--   user ID (UserId) and an endpoint ID. Otherwise, messages won’t be sent
--   to the user's endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:recommendationProviderIdType:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: UpdateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | A map of key-value pairs that defines 1-10 custom endpoint or user
--   attributes, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. Each of these attributes
--   temporarily stores a recommended item that's retrieved from the
--   recommender model and sent to an AWS Lambda function for additional
--   processing. Each attribute can be used as a message variable in a
--   message template.
--   
--   In the map, the key is the name of a custom attribute and the value is
--   a custom display name for that attribute. The display name appears in
--   the <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template editor on the Amazon
--   Pinpoint console. The following restrictions apply to these names:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>An attribute name must start with a letter or number and it can
--   contain up to 50 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Attribute names are case sensitive
--   and must be unique.</li>
--   <li>An attribute display name must start with a letter or number and
--   it can contain up to 25 characters. The characters can be letters,
--   numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This object is required if the configuration invokes an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to process recommendation
--   data. Otherwise, don't include this object in your request.
[$sel:attributes:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: UpdateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | A custom name of the configuration for the recommender model. The name
--   must start with a letter or number and it can contain up to 128
--   characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-).
[$sel:name:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: UpdateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | A custom description of the configuration for the recommender model.
--   The description can contain up to 128 characters. The characters can
--   be letters, numbers, spaces, or the following symbols: _ ; () , ‐.
[$sel:description:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: UpdateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of recommended items to retrieve from the model for each
--   endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This number determines how many
--   recommended items are available for use in message variables. The
--   minimum value is 1. The maximum value is 5. The default value is 5.
--   
--   To use multiple recommended items and custom attributes with message
--   variables, you have to use an AWS Lambda function
--   (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data.
[$sel:recommendationsPerMessage:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: UpdateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender model to retrieve
--   recommendation data from. This value must match the ARN of an Amazon
--   Personalize campaign.
[$sel:recommendationProviderUri:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: UpdateRecommenderConfiguration -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to retrieve
--   recommendation data from the recommender model.
[$sel:recommendationProviderRoleArn:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: UpdateRecommenderConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateRecommenderConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationTransformerUri:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationTransformerUri</a> -
--   The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function to
--   invoke for additional processing of recommendation data that's
--   retrieved from the recommender model.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationsDisplayName:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationsDisplayName</a> - A
--   custom display name for the standard endpoint or user attribute
--   (RecommendationItems) that temporarily stores recommended items for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This value is required if the
--   configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda function
--   (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data.
--   
--   This name appears in the <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template
--   editor on the Amazon Pinpoint console. The name can contain up to 25
--   characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-). These restrictions don't apply to
--   attribute values.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationProviderIdType:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationProviderIdType</a> -
--   The type of Amazon Pinpoint ID to associate with unique user IDs in
--   the recommender model. This value enables the model to use attribute
--   and event data that’s specific to a particular endpoint or user in an
--   Amazon Pinpoint application. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PINPOINT_ENDPOINT_ID - Associate each user in the model with a
--   particular endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based
--   on endpoint IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. This is the default value.</li>
--   <li>PINPOINT_USER_ID - Associate each user in the model with a
--   particular user and endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is
--   correlated based on user IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. If you specify this
--   value, an endpoint definition in Amazon Pinpoint has to specify both a
--   user ID (UserId) and an endpoint ID. Otherwise, messages won’t be sent
--   to the user's endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_attributes</a> - A map of key-value
--   pairs that defines 1-10 custom endpoint or user attributes, depending
--   on the value for the RecommendationProviderIdType property. Each of
--   these attributes temporarily stores a recommended item that's
--   retrieved from the recommender model and sent to an AWS Lambda
--   function for additional processing. Each attribute can be used as a
--   message variable in a message template.
--   
--   In the map, the key is the name of a custom attribute and the value is
--   a custom display name for that attribute. The display name appears in
--   the <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template editor on the Amazon
--   Pinpoint console. The following restrictions apply to these names:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>An attribute name must start with a letter or number and it can
--   contain up to 50 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Attribute names are case sensitive
--   and must be unique.</li>
--   <li>An attribute display name must start with a letter or number and
--   it can contain up to 25 characters. The characters can be letters,
--   numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This object is required if the configuration invokes an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to process recommendation
--   data. Otherwise, don't include this object in your request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_name</a> - A custom name of the
--   configuration for the recommender model. The name must start with a
--   letter or number and it can contain up to 128 characters. The
--   characters can be letters, numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or
--   hyphens (-).
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_description</a> - A custom
--   description of the configuration for the recommender model. The
--   description can contain up to 128 characters. The characters can be
--   letters, numbers, spaces, or the following symbols: _ ; () , ‐.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationsPerMessage:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationsPerMessage</a> - The
--   number of recommended items to retrieve from the model for each
--   endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This number determines how many
--   recommended items are available for use in message variables. The
--   minimum value is 1. The maximum value is 5. The default value is 5.
--   
--   To use multiple recommended items and custom attributes with message
--   variables, you have to use an AWS Lambda function
--   (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationProviderUri:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationProviderUri</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender model to retrieve
--   recommendation data from. This value must match the ARN of an Amazon
--   Personalize campaign.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationProviderRoleArn:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationProviderRoleArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to retrieve
--   recommendation data from the recommender model.
newUpdateRecommenderConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> UpdateRecommenderConfiguration

-- | The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function to
--   invoke for additional processing of recommendation data that's
--   retrieved from the recommender model.
updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationTransformerUri :: Lens' UpdateRecommenderConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | A custom display name for the standard endpoint or user attribute
--   (RecommendationItems) that temporarily stores recommended items for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This value is required if the
--   configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda function
--   (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data.
--   
--   This name appears in the <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template
--   editor on the Amazon Pinpoint console. The name can contain up to 25
--   characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-). These restrictions don't apply to
--   attribute values.
updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationsDisplayName :: Lens' UpdateRecommenderConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of Amazon Pinpoint ID to associate with unique user IDs in
--   the recommender model. This value enables the model to use attribute
--   and event data that’s specific to a particular endpoint or user in an
--   Amazon Pinpoint application. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PINPOINT_ENDPOINT_ID - Associate each user in the model with a
--   particular endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based
--   on endpoint IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. This is the default value.</li>
--   <li>PINPOINT_USER_ID - Associate each user in the model with a
--   particular user and endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is
--   correlated based on user IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. If you specify this
--   value, an endpoint definition in Amazon Pinpoint has to specify both a
--   user ID (UserId) and an endpoint ID. Otherwise, messages won’t be sent
--   to the user's endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationProviderIdType :: Lens' UpdateRecommenderConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | A map of key-value pairs that defines 1-10 custom endpoint or user
--   attributes, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. Each of these attributes
--   temporarily stores a recommended item that's retrieved from the
--   recommender model and sent to an AWS Lambda function for additional
--   processing. Each attribute can be used as a message variable in a
--   message template.
--   
--   In the map, the key is the name of a custom attribute and the value is
--   a custom display name for that attribute. The display name appears in
--   the <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template editor on the Amazon
--   Pinpoint console. The following restrictions apply to these names:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>An attribute name must start with a letter or number and it can
--   contain up to 50 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Attribute names are case sensitive
--   and must be unique.</li>
--   <li>An attribute display name must start with a letter or number and
--   it can contain up to 25 characters. The characters can be letters,
--   numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This object is required if the configuration invokes an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to process recommendation
--   data. Otherwise, don't include this object in your request.
updateRecommenderConfiguration_attributes :: Lens' UpdateRecommenderConfiguration (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | A custom name of the configuration for the recommender model. The name
--   must start with a letter or number and it can contain up to 128
--   characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-).
updateRecommenderConfiguration_name :: Lens' UpdateRecommenderConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | A custom description of the configuration for the recommender model.
--   The description can contain up to 128 characters. The characters can
--   be letters, numbers, spaces, or the following symbols: _ ; () , ‐.
updateRecommenderConfiguration_description :: Lens' UpdateRecommenderConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of recommended items to retrieve from the model for each
--   endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This number determines how many
--   recommended items are available for use in message variables. The
--   minimum value is 1. The maximum value is 5. The default value is 5.
--   
--   To use multiple recommended items and custom attributes with message
--   variables, you have to use an AWS Lambda function
--   (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data.
updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationsPerMessage :: Lens' UpdateRecommenderConfiguration (Maybe Int)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender model to retrieve
--   recommendation data from. This value must match the ARN of an Amazon
--   Personalize campaign.
updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationProviderUri :: Lens' UpdateRecommenderConfiguration Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to retrieve
--   recommendation data from the recommender model.
updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationProviderRoleArn :: Lens' UpdateRecommenderConfiguration Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.UpdateRecommenderConfiguration.UpdateRecommenderConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.UpdateRecommenderConfiguration.UpdateRecommenderConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.UpdateRecommenderConfiguration.UpdateRecommenderConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.UpdateRecommenderConfiguration.UpdateRecommenderConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.UpdateRecommenderConfiguration.UpdateRecommenderConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.UpdateRecommenderConfiguration.UpdateRecommenderConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.UpdateRecommenderConfiguration.UpdateRecommenderConfiguration

--   application.

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.VoiceChannelResponse

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of the voice
--   channel for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVoiceChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data VoiceChannelResponse
VoiceChannelResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> VoiceChannelResponse

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the voice channel was last
--   modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:VoiceChannelResponse'] :: VoiceChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the voice channel is enabled for the application.
[$sel:enabled:VoiceChannelResponse'] :: VoiceChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether the voice channel is archived.
[$sel:isArchived:VoiceChannelResponse'] :: VoiceChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the voice channel
--   applies to.
[$sel:applicationId:VoiceChannelResponse'] :: VoiceChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The current version of the voice channel.
[$sel:version:VoiceChannelResponse'] :: VoiceChannelResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the voice channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:id:VoiceChannelResponse'] :: VoiceChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the voice channel was
--   enabled.
[$sel:creationDate:VoiceChannelResponse'] :: VoiceChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The user who last modified the voice channel.
[$sel:lastModifiedBy:VoiceChannelResponse'] :: VoiceChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:hasCredential:VoiceChannelResponse'] :: VoiceChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For
--   the voice channel, this value is VOICE.
[$sel:platform:VoiceChannelResponse'] :: VoiceChannelResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>VoiceChannelResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:VoiceChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceChannelResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date and time, in
--   ISO 8601 format, when the voice channel was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:VoiceChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceChannelResponse_enabled</a> - Specifies whether the voice
--   channel is enabled for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isArchived:VoiceChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceChannelResponse_isArchived</a> - Specifies whether the voice
--   channel is archived.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:VoiceChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceChannelResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the application that the voice channel applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:VoiceChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceChannelResponse_version</a> - The current version of the voice
--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:VoiceChannelResponse'</a>, <a>voiceChannelResponse_id</a> -
--   (Deprecated) An identifier for the voice channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:VoiceChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceChannelResponse_creationDate</a> - The date and time, in ISO
--   8601 format, when the voice channel was enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedBy:VoiceChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceChannelResponse_lastModifiedBy</a> - The user who last
--   modified the voice channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasCredential:VoiceChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceChannelResponse_hasCredential</a> - (Not used) This property
--   is retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:VoiceChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceChannelResponse_platform</a> - The type of messaging or
--   notification platform for the channel. For the voice channel, this
--   value is VOICE.
newVoiceChannelResponse :: Text -> VoiceChannelResponse

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the voice channel was last
--   modified.
voiceChannelResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' VoiceChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

voiceChannelResponse_enabled :: Lens' VoiceChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether the voice channel is archived.
voiceChannelResponse_isArchived :: Lens' VoiceChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the voice channel
--   applies to.
voiceChannelResponse_applicationId :: Lens' VoiceChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The current version of the voice channel.
voiceChannelResponse_version :: Lens' VoiceChannelResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the voice channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
voiceChannelResponse_id :: Lens' VoiceChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the voice channel was
--   enabled.
voiceChannelResponse_creationDate :: Lens' VoiceChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The user who last modified the voice channel.
voiceChannelResponse_lastModifiedBy :: Lens' VoiceChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
voiceChannelResponse_hasCredential :: Lens' VoiceChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

--   the voice channel, this value is VOICE.
voiceChannelResponse_platform :: Lens' VoiceChannelResponse Text
