module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.VoiceMessage

-- | Specifies the settings for a one-time voice message that's sent
--   directly to an endpoint through the voice channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVoiceMessage</a> smart constructor.
data VoiceMessage
VoiceMessage' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> VoiceMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the voice message. You can
--   override the default variables with individual address variables.
[$sel:substitutions:VoiceMessage'] :: VoiceMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | The code for the language to use when synthesizing the text of the
--   message script. For a list of supported languages and the code for
--   each one, see the <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:languageCode:VoiceMessage'] :: VoiceMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The long code to send the voice message from. This value should be one
--   of the dedicated long codes that's assigned to your AWS account.
--   Although it isn't required, we recommend that you specify the long
--   code in E.164 format, for example +12065550100, to ensure prompt and
--   accurate delivery of the message.
[$sel:originationNumber:VoiceMessage'] :: VoiceMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The text of the script to use for the voice message.
[$sel:body:VoiceMessage'] :: VoiceMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the voice to use when delivering the message. For a list
--   of supported voices, see the <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:voiceId:VoiceMessage'] :: VoiceMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>VoiceMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:VoiceMessage'</a>,
--   <a>voiceMessage_substitutions</a> - The default message variables to
--   use in the voice message. You can override the default variables with
--   individual address variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:VoiceMessage'</a>,
--   <a>voiceMessage_languageCode</a> - The code for the language to use
--   when synthesizing the text of the message script. For a list of
--   supported languages and the code for each one, see the <a>Amazon Polly
--   Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:originationNumber:VoiceMessage'</a>,
--   <a>voiceMessage_originationNumber</a> - The long code to send the
--   voice message from. This value should be one of the dedicated long
--   codes that's assigned to your AWS account. Although it isn't required,
--   we recommend that you specify the long code in E.164 format, for
--   example +12065550100, to ensure prompt and accurate delivery of the
--   message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:VoiceMessage'</a>, <a>voiceMessage_body</a> - The text of
--   the script to use for the voice message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:voiceId:VoiceMessage'</a>, <a>voiceMessage_voiceId</a> - The
--   name of the voice to use when delivering the message. For a list of
--   supported voices, see the <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
newVoiceMessage :: VoiceMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the voice message. You can
--   override the default variables with individual address variables.
voiceMessage_substitutions :: Lens' VoiceMessage (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | The code for the language to use when synthesizing the text of the
--   message script. For a list of supported languages and the code for
--   each one, see the <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
voiceMessage_languageCode :: Lens' VoiceMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The long code to send the voice message from. This value should be one
--   of the dedicated long codes that's assigned to your AWS account.
--   Although it isn't required, we recommend that you specify the long
--   code in E.164 format, for example +12065550100, to ensure prompt and
--   accurate delivery of the message.
voiceMessage_originationNumber :: Lens' VoiceMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The text of the script to use for the voice message.
voiceMessage_body :: Lens' VoiceMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the voice to use when delivering the message. For a list
--   of supported voices, see the <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
voiceMessage_voiceId :: Lens' VoiceMessage (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.VoiceMessage.VoiceMessage
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.VoiceMessage.VoiceMessage
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.VoiceMessage.VoiceMessage
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.VoiceMessage.VoiceMessage
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.VoiceMessage.VoiceMessage
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.VoiceMessage.VoiceMessage
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.VoiceMessage.VoiceMessage


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DirectMessageConfiguration

-- | Specifies the settings and content for the default message and any
--   default messages that you tailored for specific channels.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDirectMessageConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data DirectMessageConfiguration
DirectMessageConfiguration' :: Maybe APNSMessage -> Maybe GCMMessage -> Maybe DefaultMessage -> Maybe ADMMessage -> Maybe SMSMessage -> Maybe EmailMessage -> Maybe VoiceMessage -> Maybe BaiduMessage -> Maybe DefaultPushNotificationMessage -> DirectMessageConfiguration

-- | The default push notification message for the APNs (Apple Push
--   Notification service) channel. This message overrides the default push
--   notification message (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
[$sel:aPNSMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'] :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> Maybe APNSMessage

-- | The default push notification message for the GCM channel, which is
--   used to send notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM),
--   formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service. This message overrides
--   the default push notification message
--   (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
[$sel:gCMMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'] :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> Maybe GCMMessage

-- | The default message for all channels.
[$sel:defaultMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'] :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> Maybe DefaultMessage

-- | The default push notification message for the ADM (Amazon Device
--   Messaging) channel. This message overrides the default push
--   notification message (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
[$sel:aDMMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'] :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> Maybe ADMMessage

-- | The default message for the SMS channel. This message overrides the
--   default message (DefaultMessage).
[$sel:sMSMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'] :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> Maybe SMSMessage

-- | The default message for the email channel. This message overrides the
--   default message (DefaultMessage).
[$sel:emailMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'] :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> Maybe EmailMessage

-- | The default message for the voice channel. This message overrides the
--   default message (DefaultMessage).
[$sel:voiceMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'] :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> Maybe VoiceMessage

-- | The default push notification message for the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push)
--   channel. This message overrides the default push notification message
--   (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
[$sel:baiduMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'] :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> Maybe BaiduMessage

-- | The default push notification message for all push notification
--   channels.
[$sel:defaultPushNotificationMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'] :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> Maybe DefaultPushNotificationMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>DirectMessageConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:aPNSMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_aPNSMessage</a> - The default push
--   notification message for the APNs (Apple Push Notification service)
--   channel. This message overrides the default push notification message
--   (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
--   
--   <a>$sel:gCMMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_gCMMessage</a> - The default push
--   notification message for the GCM channel, which is used to send
--   notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly
--   Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service. This message overrides the
--   default push notification message (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_defaultMessage</a> - The default message
--   for all channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:aDMMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_aDMMessage</a> - The default push
--   notification message for the ADM (Amazon Device Messaging) channel.
--   This message overrides the default push notification message
--   (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
--   
--   <a>$sel:sMSMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_sMSMessage</a> - The default message for
--   the SMS channel. This message overrides the default message
--   (DefaultMessage).
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_emailMessage</a> - The default message
--   for the email channel. This message overrides the default message
--   (DefaultMessage).
--   
--   <a>$sel:voiceMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_voiceMessage</a> - The default message
--   for the voice channel. This message overrides the default message
--   (DefaultMessage).
--   
--   <a>$sel:baiduMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_baiduMessage</a> - The default push
--   notification message for the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push) channel. This
--   message overrides the default push notification message
--   (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultPushNotificationMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_defaultPushNotificationMessage</a> - The
--   default push notification message for all push notification channels.
newDirectMessageConfiguration :: DirectMessageConfiguration

-- | The default push notification message for the APNs (Apple Push
--   Notification service) channel. This message overrides the default push
--   notification message (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
directMessageConfiguration_aPNSMessage :: Lens' DirectMessageConfiguration (Maybe APNSMessage)

-- | The default push notification message for the GCM channel, which is
--   used to send notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM),
--   formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service. This message overrides
--   the default push notification message
--   (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
directMessageConfiguration_gCMMessage :: Lens' DirectMessageConfiguration (Maybe GCMMessage)

-- | The default message for all channels.
directMessageConfiguration_defaultMessage :: Lens' DirectMessageConfiguration (Maybe DefaultMessage)

-- | The default push notification message for the ADM (Amazon Device
--   Messaging) channel. This message overrides the default push
--   notification message (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
directMessageConfiguration_aDMMessage :: Lens' DirectMessageConfiguration (Maybe ADMMessage)

-- | The default message for the SMS channel. This message overrides the
--   default message (DefaultMessage).
directMessageConfiguration_sMSMessage :: Lens' DirectMessageConfiguration (Maybe SMSMessage)

-- | The default message for the email channel. This message overrides the
--   default message (DefaultMessage).
directMessageConfiguration_emailMessage :: Lens' DirectMessageConfiguration (Maybe EmailMessage)

-- | The default message for the voice channel. This message overrides the
--   default message (DefaultMessage).
directMessageConfiguration_voiceMessage :: Lens' DirectMessageConfiguration (Maybe VoiceMessage)

-- | The default push notification message for the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push)
--   channel. This message overrides the default push notification message
--   (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
directMessageConfiguration_baiduMessage :: Lens' DirectMessageConfiguration (Maybe BaiduMessage)

-- | The default push notification message for all push notification
--   channels.
directMessageConfiguration_defaultPushNotificationMessage :: Lens' DirectMessageConfiguration (Maybe DefaultPushNotificationMessage)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DirectMessageConfiguration.DirectMessageConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DirectMessageConfiguration.DirectMessageConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DirectMessageConfiguration.DirectMessageConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DirectMessageConfiguration.DirectMessageConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DirectMessageConfiguration.DirectMessageConfiguration

instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.DirectMessageConfiguration.DirectMessageConfiguration


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SendUsersMessageRequest

-- | Specifies the configuration and other settings for a message to send
--   to all the endpoints that are associated with a list of users.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSendUsersMessageRequest</a> smart constructor.
data SendUsersMessageRequest
SendUsersMessageRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration -> DirectMessageConfiguration -> HashMap Text EndpointSendConfiguration -> SendUsersMessageRequest

-- | The unique identifier for tracing the message. This identifier is
--   visible to message recipients.
[$sel:traceId:SendUsersMessageRequest'] :: SendUsersMessageRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A map of custom attribute-value pairs. For a push notification, Amazon
--   Pinpoint adds these attributes to the data.pinpoint object in the body
--   of the notification payload. Amazon Pinpoint also provides these
--   attributes in the events that it generates for users-messages
--   deliveries.
[$sel:context:SendUsersMessageRequest'] :: SendUsersMessageRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The message template to use for the message.
[$sel:templateConfiguration:SendUsersMessageRequest'] :: SendUsersMessageRequest -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration

-- | The settings and content for the default message and any default
--   messages that you defined for specific channels.
[$sel:messageConfiguration:SendUsersMessageRequest'] :: SendUsersMessageRequest -> DirectMessageConfiguration

-- | A map that associates user IDs with <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a>
--   objects. You can use an <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> object to
--   tailor the message for a user by specifying settings such as content
--   overrides and message variables.
[$sel:users:SendUsersMessageRequest'] :: SendUsersMessageRequest -> HashMap Text EndpointSendConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>SendUsersMessageRequest</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:traceId:SendUsersMessageRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sendUsersMessageRequest_traceId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   tracing the message. This identifier is visible to message recipients.
--   
--   <a>$sel:context:SendUsersMessageRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sendUsersMessageRequest_context</a> - A map of custom
--   attribute-value pairs. For a push notification, Amazon Pinpoint adds
--   these attributes to the data.pinpoint object in the body of the
--   notification payload. Amazon Pinpoint also provides these attributes
--   in the events that it generates for users-messages deliveries.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateConfiguration:SendUsersMessageRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sendUsersMessageRequest_templateConfiguration</a> - The message
--   template to use for the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfiguration:SendUsersMessageRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sendUsersMessageRequest_messageConfiguration</a> - The settings and
--   content for the default message and any default messages that you
--   defined for specific channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:users:SendUsersMessageRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sendUsersMessageRequest_users</a> - A map that associates user IDs
--   with <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> objects. You can use an
--   <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> object to tailor the message for a
--   user by specifying settings such as content overrides and message
--   variables.
newSendUsersMessageRequest :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> SendUsersMessageRequest

-- | The unique identifier for tracing the message. This identifier is
--   visible to message recipients.
sendUsersMessageRequest_traceId :: Lens' SendUsersMessageRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A map of custom attribute-value pairs. For a push notification, Amazon
--   Pinpoint adds these attributes to the data.pinpoint object in the body
--   of the notification payload. Amazon Pinpoint also provides these
--   attributes in the events that it generates for users-messages
--   deliveries.
sendUsersMessageRequest_context :: Lens' SendUsersMessageRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The message template to use for the message.
sendUsersMessageRequest_templateConfiguration :: Lens' SendUsersMessageRequest (Maybe TemplateConfiguration)

-- | The settings and content for the default message and any default
--   messages that you defined for specific channels.
sendUsersMessageRequest_messageConfiguration :: Lens' SendUsersMessageRequest DirectMessageConfiguration

-- | A map that associates user IDs with <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a>
--   objects. You can use an <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> object to
--   tailor the message for a user by specifying settings such as content
--   overrides and message variables.
sendUsersMessageRequest_users :: Lens' SendUsersMessageRequest (HashMap Text EndpointSendConfiguration)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SendUsersMessageRequest.SendUsersMessageRequest
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SendUsersMessageRequest.SendUsersMessageRequest
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SendUsersMessageRequest.SendUsersMessageRequest
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SendUsersMessageRequest.SendUsersMessageRequest
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SendUsersMessageRequest.SendUsersMessageRequest
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SendUsersMessageRequest.SendUsersMessageRequest
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.SendUsersMessageRequest.SendUsersMessageRequest


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageRequest

-- | Specifies the configuration and other settings for a message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessageRequest</a> smart constructor.
data MessageRequest
MessageRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text AddressConfiguration) -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration -> Maybe (HashMap Text EndpointSendConfiguration) -> DirectMessageConfiguration -> MessageRequest

-- | The unique identifier for tracing the message. This identifier is
--   visible to message recipients.
[$sel:traceId:MessageRequest'] :: MessageRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A map of custom attributes to attach to the message. For a push
--   notification, this payload is added to the data.pinpoint object. For
--   an email or text message, this payload is added to email/SMS delivery
--   receipt event attributes.
[$sel:context:MessageRequest'] :: MessageRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | A map of key-value pairs, where each key is an address and each value
--   is an <a>AddressConfiguration</a> object. An address can be a push
--   notification token, a phone number, or an email address. You can use
--   an <a>AddressConfiguration</a> object to tailor the message for an
--   address by specifying settings such as content overrides and message
--   variables.
[$sel:addresses:MessageRequest'] :: MessageRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text AddressConfiguration)

-- | The message template to use for the message.
[$sel:templateConfiguration:MessageRequest'] :: MessageRequest -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration

-- | A map of key-value pairs, where each key is an endpoint ID and each
--   value is an <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> object. You can use an
--   <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> object to tailor the message for an
--   endpoint by specifying settings such as content overrides and message
--   variables.
[$sel:endpoints:MessageRequest'] :: MessageRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text EndpointSendConfiguration)

-- | The settings and content for the default message and any default
--   messages that you defined for specific channels.
[$sel:messageConfiguration:MessageRequest'] :: MessageRequest -> DirectMessageConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>MessageRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:traceId:MessageRequest'</a>, <a>messageRequest_traceId</a> -
--   The unique identifier for tracing the message. This identifier is
--   visible to message recipients.
--   
--   <a>$sel:context:MessageRequest'</a>, <a>messageRequest_context</a> - A
--   map of custom attributes to attach to the message. For a push
--   notification, this payload is added to the data.pinpoint object. For
--   an email or text message, this payload is added to email/SMS delivery
--   receipt event attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:addresses:MessageRequest'</a>, <a>messageRequest_addresses</a>
--   - A map of key-value pairs, where each key is an address and each
--   value is an <a>AddressConfiguration</a> object. An address can be a
--   push notification token, a phone number, or an email address. You can
--   use an <a>AddressConfiguration</a> object to tailor the message for an
--   address by specifying settings such as content overrides and message
--   variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateConfiguration:MessageRequest'</a>,
--   <a>messageRequest_templateConfiguration</a> - The message template to
--   use for the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpoints:MessageRequest'</a>, <a>messageRequest_endpoints</a>
--   - A map of key-value pairs, where each key is an endpoint ID and each
--   value is an <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> object. You can use an
--   <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> object to tailor the message for an
--   endpoint by specifying settings such as content overrides and message
--   variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfiguration:MessageRequest'</a>,
--   <a>messageRequest_messageConfiguration</a> - The settings and content
--   for the default message and any default messages that you defined for
--   specific channels.
newMessageRequest :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> MessageRequest

-- | The unique identifier for tracing the message. This identifier is
--   visible to message recipients.
messageRequest_traceId :: Lens' MessageRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A map of custom attributes to attach to the message. For a push
--   notification, this payload is added to the data.pinpoint object. For
--   an email or text message, this payload is added to email/SMS delivery
--   receipt event attributes.
messageRequest_context :: Lens' MessageRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | A map of key-value pairs, where each key is an address and each value
--   is an <a>AddressConfiguration</a> object. An address can be a push
--   notification token, a phone number, or an email address. You can use
--   an <a>AddressConfiguration</a> object to tailor the message for an
--   address by specifying settings such as content overrides and message
--   variables.
messageRequest_addresses :: Lens' MessageRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text AddressConfiguration))

-- | The message template to use for the message.
messageRequest_templateConfiguration :: Lens' MessageRequest (Maybe TemplateConfiguration)

-- | A map of key-value pairs, where each key is an endpoint ID and each
--   value is an <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> object. You can use an
--   <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> object to tailor the message for an
--   endpoint by specifying settings such as content overrides and message
--   variables.
messageRequest_endpoints :: Lens' MessageRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text EndpointSendConfiguration))

-- | The settings and content for the default message and any default
--   messages that you defined for specific channels.
messageRequest_messageConfiguration :: Lens' MessageRequest DirectMessageConfiguration
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageRequest.MessageRequest
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageRequest.MessageRequest
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageRequest.MessageRequest
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageRequest.MessageRequest
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageRequest.MessageRequest
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageRequest.MessageRequest
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MessageRequest.MessageRequest


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.VoiceTemplateRequest

-- | Specifies the content and settings for a message template that can be
--   used in messages that are sent through the voice channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVoiceTemplateRequest</a> smart constructor.
data VoiceTemplateRequest
VoiceTemplateRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> VoiceTemplateRequest

-- | The code for the language to use when synthesizing the text of the
--   script in messages that are based on the message template. For a list
--   of supported languages and the code for each one, see the <a>Amazon
--   Polly Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:languageCode:VoiceTemplateRequest'] :: VoiceTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The text of the script to use in messages that are based on the
--   message template, in plain text format.
[$sel:body:VoiceTemplateRequest'] :: VoiceTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A custom description of the message template.
[$sel:templateDescription:VoiceTemplateRequest'] :: VoiceTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A JSON object that specifies the default values to use for message
--   variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value
--   pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The
--   corresponding value defines the default value for that variable. When
--   you create a message that's based on the template, you can override
--   these defaults with message-specific and address-specific variables
--   and values.
[$sel:defaultSubstitutions:VoiceTemplateRequest'] :: VoiceTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the voice to use when delivering messages that are based
--   on the message template. For a list of supported voices, see the
--   <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:voiceId:VoiceTemplateRequest'] :: VoiceTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:VoiceTemplateRequest'] :: VoiceTemplateRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>VoiceTemplateRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:VoiceTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateRequest_languageCode</a> - The code for the language
--   to use when synthesizing the text of the script in messages that are
--   based on the message template. For a list of supported languages and
--   the code for each one, see the <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:VoiceTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateRequest_body</a> - The text of the script to use in
--   messages that are based on the message template, in plain text format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:VoiceTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateRequest_templateDescription</a> - A custom description
--   of the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubstitutions:VoiceTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateRequest_defaultSubstitutions</a> - A JSON object that
--   specifies the default values to use for message variables in the
--   message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key
--   defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding value
--   defines the default value for that variable. When you create a message
--   that's based on the template, you can override these defaults with
--   message-specific and address-specific variables and values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:voiceId:VoiceTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateRequest_voiceId</a> - The name of the voice to use
--   when delivering messages that are based on the message template. For a
--   list of supported voices, see the <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:VoiceTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateRequest_tags</a> - A string-to-string map of key-value
--   pairs that defines the tags to associate with the message template.
--   Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.
newVoiceTemplateRequest :: VoiceTemplateRequest

-- | The code for the language to use when synthesizing the text of the
--   script in messages that are based on the message template. For a list
--   of supported languages and the code for each one, see the <a>Amazon
--   Polly Developer Guide</a>.
voiceTemplateRequest_languageCode :: Lens' VoiceTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The text of the script to use in messages that are based on the
--   message template, in plain text format.
voiceTemplateRequest_body :: Lens' VoiceTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A custom description of the message template.
voiceTemplateRequest_templateDescription :: Lens' VoiceTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A JSON object that specifies the default values to use for message
--   variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value
--   pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The
--   corresponding value defines the default value for that variable. When
--   you create a message that's based on the template, you can override
--   these defaults with message-specific and address-specific variables
--   and values.
voiceTemplateRequest_defaultSubstitutions :: Lens' VoiceTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the voice to use when delivering messages that are based
--   on the message template. For a list of supported voices, see the
--   <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
voiceTemplateRequest_voiceId :: Lens' VoiceTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
voiceTemplateRequest_tags :: Lens' VoiceTemplateRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.VoiceTemplateRequest.VoiceTemplateRequest
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.VoiceTemplateRequest.VoiceTemplateRequest
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.VoiceTemplateRequest.VoiceTemplateRequest
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.VoiceTemplateRequest.VoiceTemplateRequest
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.VoiceTemplateRequest.VoiceTemplateRequest

instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.VoiceTemplateRequest.VoiceTemplateRequest


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.VoiceTemplateResponse

-- | Provides information about the content and settings for a message
--   template that can be used in messages that are sent through the voice
--   channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVoiceTemplateResponse</a> smart constructor.
data VoiceTemplateResponse
VoiceTemplateResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> VoiceTemplateResponse

-- | The code for the language that's used when synthesizing the text of
--   the script in messages that are based on the message template. For a
--   list of supported languages and the code for each one, see the
--   <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:languageCode:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the message template.
[$sel:arn:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The text of the script that's used in messages that are based on the
--   message template, in plain text format.
[$sel:body:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The custom description of the message template.
[$sel:templateDescription:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for
--   message variables in the message template. This object is a set of
--   key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template.
--   The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable.
[$sel:defaultSubstitutions:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the
--   message template, or the version of the template that you specified by
--   using the version parameter in your request.
[$sel:version:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the voice that's used when delivering messages that are
--   based on the message template. For a list of supported voices, see the
--   <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:voiceId:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags
--   that are associated with the message template. Each tag consists of a
--   required tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was last
--   modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was created.
[$sel:creationDate:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The name of the message template.
[$sel:templateName:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The type of channel that the message template is designed for. For a
--   voice template, this value is VOICE.
[$sel:templateType:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> TemplateType

-- | Create a value of <a>VoiceTemplateResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_languageCode</a> - The code for the language
--   that's used when synthesizing the text of the script in messages that
--   are based on the message template. For a list of supported languages
--   and the code for each one, see the <a>Amazon Polly Developer
--   Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_body</a> - The text of the script that's used
--   in messages that are based on the message template, in plain text
--   format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_templateDescription</a> - The custom
--   description of the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubstitutions:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_defaultSubstitutions</a> - The JSON object
--   that specifies the default values that are used for message variables
--   in the message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each
--   key defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding
--   value defines the default value for that variable.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_version</a> - The unique identifier, as an
--   integer, for the active version of the message template, or the
--   version of the template that you specified by using the version
--   parameter in your request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:voiceId:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_voiceId</a> - The name of the voice that's
--   used when delivering messages that are based on the message template.
--   For a list of supported voices, see the <a>Amazon Polly Developer
--   Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_tags</a> - A string-to-string map of
--   key-value pairs that identifies the tags that are associated with the
--   message template. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an
--   associated tag value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the message template was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the message template was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_templateName</a> - The name of the message
--   template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateType:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_templateType</a> - The type of channel that
--   the message template is designed for. For a voice template, this value
--   is VOICE.
newVoiceTemplateResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> VoiceTemplateResponse

-- | The code for the language that's used when synthesizing the text of
--   the script in messages that are based on the message template. For a
--   list of supported languages and the code for each one, see the
--   <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
voiceTemplateResponse_languageCode :: Lens' VoiceTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the message template.
voiceTemplateResponse_arn :: Lens' VoiceTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The text of the script that's used in messages that are based on the
--   message template, in plain text format.
voiceTemplateResponse_body :: Lens' VoiceTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The custom description of the message template.
voiceTemplateResponse_templateDescription :: Lens' VoiceTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for
--   message variables in the message template. This object is a set of
--   key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template.
--   The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable.
voiceTemplateResponse_defaultSubstitutions :: Lens' VoiceTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the
--   message template, or the version of the template that you specified by
--   using the version parameter in your request.
voiceTemplateResponse_version :: Lens' VoiceTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the voice that's used when delivering messages that are
--   based on the message template. For a list of supported voices, see the
--   <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
voiceTemplateResponse_voiceId :: Lens' VoiceTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

--   that are associated with the message template. Each tag consists of a
--   required tag key and an associated tag value.
voiceTemplateResponse_tags :: Lens' VoiceTemplateResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was last
--   modified.
voiceTemplateResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' VoiceTemplateResponse Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was created.
voiceTemplateResponse_creationDate :: Lens' VoiceTemplateResponse Text

-- | The name of the message template.
voiceTemplateResponse_templateName :: Lens' VoiceTemplateResponse Text

--   voice template, this value is VOICE.
voiceTemplateResponse_templateType :: Lens' VoiceTemplateResponse TemplateType
