module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WaitTime

-- | Specifies a duration or a date and time that indicates when Amazon
--   Pinpoint determines whether an activity's conditions have been met or
--   an activity moves participants to the next activity in a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWaitTime</a> smart constructor.
data WaitTime
WaitTime' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> WaitTime

-- | The amount of time to wait, as a duration in ISO 8601 format, before
--   determining whether the activity's conditions have been met or moving
--   participants to the next activity in the journey.
[$sel:waitFor:WaitTime'] :: WaitTime -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when Amazon Pinpoint determines
--   whether the activity's conditions have been met or the activity moves
--   participants to the next activity in the journey.
[$sel:waitUntil:WaitTime'] :: WaitTime -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>WaitTime</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:waitFor:WaitTime'</a>, <a>waitTime_waitFor</a> - The amount of
--   time to wait, as a duration in ISO 8601 format, before determining
--   whether the activity's conditions have been met or moving participants
--   to the next activity in the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:waitUntil:WaitTime'</a>, <a>waitTime_waitUntil</a> - The date
--   and time, in ISO 8601 format, when Amazon Pinpoint determines whether
--   the activity's conditions have been met or the activity moves
--   participants to the next activity in the journey.
newWaitTime :: WaitTime

-- | The amount of time to wait, as a duration in ISO 8601 format, before
--   determining whether the activity's conditions have been met or moving
--   participants to the next activity in the journey.
waitTime_waitFor :: Lens' WaitTime (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when Amazon Pinpoint determines
--   whether the activity's conditions have been met or the activity moves
--   participants to the next activity in the journey.
waitTime_waitUntil :: Lens' WaitTime (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WaitTime.WaitTime
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WaitTime.WaitTime
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WaitTime.WaitTime
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WaitTime.WaitTime
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WaitTime.WaitTime
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WaitTime.WaitTime
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WaitTime.WaitTime
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WaitTime.WaitTime


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WaitActivity

-- | Specifies the settings for a wait activity in a journey. This type of
--   activity waits for a certain amount of time or until a specific date
--   and time before moving participants to the next activity in a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWaitActivity</a> smart constructor.
data WaitActivity
WaitActivity' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe WaitTime -> WaitActivity

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after
--   performing the wait activity.
[$sel:nextActivity:WaitActivity'] :: WaitActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The amount of time to wait or the date and time when the activity
--   moves participants to the next activity in the journey.
[$sel:waitTime:WaitActivity'] :: WaitActivity -> Maybe WaitTime

-- | Create a value of <a>WaitActivity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextActivity:WaitActivity'</a>,
--   <a>waitActivity_nextActivity</a> - The unique identifier for the next
--   activity to perform, after performing the wait activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:waitTime:WaitActivity'</a>, <a>waitActivity_waitTime</a> - The
--   amount of time to wait or the date and time when the activity moves
--   participants to the next activity in the journey.
newWaitActivity :: WaitActivity

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after
--   performing the wait activity.
waitActivity_nextActivity :: Lens' WaitActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | The amount of time to wait or the date and time when the activity
--   moves participants to the next activity in the journey.
waitActivity_waitTime :: Lens' WaitActivity (Maybe WaitTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WaitActivity.WaitActivity
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WaitActivity.WaitActivity
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WaitActivity.WaitActivity
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WaitActivity.WaitActivity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WaitActivity.WaitActivity
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WaitActivity.WaitActivity
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WaitActivity.WaitActivity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WaitActivity.WaitActivity


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MultiConditionalSplitActivity

-- | Specifies the settings for a multivariate split activity in a journey.
--   This type of activity sends participants down one of as many as five
--   paths (including a default <i>Else</i> path) in a journey, based on
--   conditions that you specify.
--   
--   To create multivariate split activities that send participants down
--   different paths based on push notification events (such as Open or
--   Received events), your mobile app has to specify the User ID and
--   Endpoint ID values. For more information, see <a>Integrating Amazon
--   Pinpoint with your application</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint Developer
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMultiConditionalSplitActivity</a> smart constructor.
data MultiConditionalSplitActivity
MultiConditionalSplitActivity' :: Maybe [MultiConditionalBranch] -> Maybe WaitTime -> Maybe Text -> MultiConditionalSplitActivity

-- | The paths for the activity, including the conditions for entering each
--   path and the activity to perform for each path.
[$sel:branches:MultiConditionalSplitActivity'] :: MultiConditionalSplitActivity -> Maybe [MultiConditionalBranch]

-- | The amount of time to wait or the date and time when Amazon Pinpoint
--   determines whether the conditions are met.
[$sel:evaluationWaitTime:MultiConditionalSplitActivity'] :: MultiConditionalSplitActivity -> Maybe WaitTime

-- | The unique identifier for the activity to perform for participants who
--   don't meet any of the conditions specified for other paths in the
--   activity.
[$sel:defaultActivity:MultiConditionalSplitActivity'] :: MultiConditionalSplitActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MultiConditionalSplitActivity</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:branches:MultiConditionalSplitActivity'</a>,
--   <a>multiConditionalSplitActivity_branches</a> - The paths for the
--   activity, including the conditions for entering each path and the
--   activity to perform for each path.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evaluationWaitTime:MultiConditionalSplitActivity'</a>,
--   <a>multiConditionalSplitActivity_evaluationWaitTime</a> - The amount
--   of time to wait or the date and time when Amazon Pinpoint determines
--   whether the conditions are met.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultActivity:MultiConditionalSplitActivity'</a>,
--   <a>multiConditionalSplitActivity_defaultActivity</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the activity to perform for participants who don't meet
--   any of the conditions specified for other paths in the activity.
newMultiConditionalSplitActivity :: MultiConditionalSplitActivity

-- | The paths for the activity, including the conditions for entering each
--   path and the activity to perform for each path.
multiConditionalSplitActivity_branches :: Lens' MultiConditionalSplitActivity (Maybe [MultiConditionalBranch])

-- | The amount of time to wait or the date and time when Amazon Pinpoint
--   determines whether the conditions are met.
multiConditionalSplitActivity_evaluationWaitTime :: Lens' MultiConditionalSplitActivity (Maybe WaitTime)

-- | The unique identifier for the activity to perform for participants who
--   don't meet any of the conditions specified for other paths in the
--   activity.
multiConditionalSplitActivity_defaultActivity :: Lens' MultiConditionalSplitActivity (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MultiConditionalSplitActivity.MultiConditionalSplitActivity
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MultiConditionalSplitActivity.MultiConditionalSplitActivity
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MultiConditionalSplitActivity.MultiConditionalSplitActivity
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MultiConditionalSplitActivity.MultiConditionalSplitActivity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MultiConditionalSplitActivity.MultiConditionalSplitActivity
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MultiConditionalSplitActivity.MultiConditionalSplitActivity
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MultiConditionalSplitActivity.MultiConditionalSplitActivity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.MultiConditionalSplitActivity.MultiConditionalSplitActivity


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ConditionalSplitActivity

-- | Specifies the settings for a yes/no split activity in a journey. This
--   type of activity sends participants down one of two paths in a
--   journey, based on conditions that you specify.
--   
--   To create yes/no split activities that send participants down
--   different paths based on push notification events (such as Open or
--   Received events), your mobile app has to specify the User ID and
--   Endpoint ID values. For more information, see <a>Integrating Amazon
--   Pinpoint with your application</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint Developer
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newConditionalSplitActivity</a> smart constructor.
data ConditionalSplitActivity
ConditionalSplitActivity' :: Maybe WaitTime -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Condition -> ConditionalSplitActivity

-- | The amount of time to wait before determining whether the conditions
--   are met, or the date and time when Amazon Pinpoint determines whether
--   the conditions are met.
[$sel:evaluationWaitTime:ConditionalSplitActivity'] :: ConditionalSplitActivity -> Maybe WaitTime

-- | The unique identifier for the activity to perform if the conditions
--   are met.
[$sel:trueActivity:ConditionalSplitActivity'] :: ConditionalSplitActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the activity to perform if the conditions
--   aren't met.
[$sel:falseActivity:ConditionalSplitActivity'] :: ConditionalSplitActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The conditions that define the paths for the activity, and the
--   relationship between the conditions.
[$sel:condition:ConditionalSplitActivity'] :: ConditionalSplitActivity -> Maybe Condition

-- | Create a value of <a>ConditionalSplitActivity</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:evaluationWaitTime:ConditionalSplitActivity'</a>,
--   <a>conditionalSplitActivity_evaluationWaitTime</a> - The amount of
--   time to wait before determining whether the conditions are met, or the
--   date and time when Amazon Pinpoint determines whether the conditions
--   are met.
--   
--   <a>$sel:trueActivity:ConditionalSplitActivity'</a>,
--   <a>conditionalSplitActivity_trueActivity</a> - The unique identifier
--   for the activity to perform if the conditions are met.
--   
--   <a>$sel:falseActivity:ConditionalSplitActivity'</a>,
--   <a>conditionalSplitActivity_falseActivity</a> - The unique identifier
--   for the activity to perform if the conditions aren't met.
--   
--   <a>$sel:condition:ConditionalSplitActivity'</a>,
--   <a>conditionalSplitActivity_condition</a> - The conditions that define
--   the paths for the activity, and the relationship between the
--   conditions.
newConditionalSplitActivity :: ConditionalSplitActivity

-- | The amount of time to wait before determining whether the conditions
--   are met, or the date and time when Amazon Pinpoint determines whether
--   the conditions are met.
conditionalSplitActivity_evaluationWaitTime :: Lens' ConditionalSplitActivity (Maybe WaitTime)

-- | The unique identifier for the activity to perform if the conditions
--   are met.
conditionalSplitActivity_trueActivity :: Lens' ConditionalSplitActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the activity to perform if the conditions
--   aren't met.
conditionalSplitActivity_falseActivity :: Lens' ConditionalSplitActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | The conditions that define the paths for the activity, and the
--   relationship between the conditions.
conditionalSplitActivity_condition :: Lens' ConditionalSplitActivity (Maybe Condition)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ConditionalSplitActivity.ConditionalSplitActivity
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ConditionalSplitActivity.ConditionalSplitActivity
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ConditionalSplitActivity.ConditionalSplitActivity
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ConditionalSplitActivity.ConditionalSplitActivity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ConditionalSplitActivity.ConditionalSplitActivity
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ConditionalSplitActivity.ConditionalSplitActivity
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ConditionalSplitActivity.ConditionalSplitActivity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.ConditionalSplitActivity.ConditionalSplitActivity


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Activity

-- | Specifies the configuration and other settings for an activity in a
--   journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newActivity</a> smart constructor.
data Activity
Activity' :: Maybe ConditionalSplitActivity -> Maybe EmailMessageActivity -> Maybe MultiConditionalSplitActivity -> Maybe ContactCenterActivity -> Maybe CustomMessageActivity -> Maybe WaitActivity -> Maybe RandomSplitActivity -> Maybe HoldoutActivity -> Maybe SMSMessageActivity -> Maybe PushMessageActivity -> Maybe Text -> Activity

-- | The settings for a yes/no split activity. This type of activity sends
--   participants down one of two paths in a journey, based on conditions
--   that you specify.
[$sel:conditionalSplit:Activity'] :: Activity -> Maybe ConditionalSplitActivity

-- | The settings for an email activity. This type of activity sends an
--   email message to participants.
[$sel:email:Activity'] :: Activity -> Maybe EmailMessageActivity

-- | The settings for a multivariate split activity. This type of activity
--   sends participants down one of as many as five paths (including a
--   default <i>Else</i> path) in a journey, based on conditions that you
--   specify.
[$sel:multiCondition:Activity'] :: Activity -> Maybe MultiConditionalSplitActivity

-- | The settings for a connect activity. This type of activity initiates a
--   contact center call to participants.
[$sel:contactCenter:Activity'] :: Activity -> Maybe ContactCenterActivity

-- | The settings for a custom message activity. This type of activity
--   calls an AWS Lambda function or web hook that sends messages to
--   participants.
[$sel:custom:Activity'] :: Activity -> Maybe CustomMessageActivity

-- | The settings for a wait activity. This type of activity waits for a
--   certain amount of time or until a specific date and time before moving
--   participants to the next activity in a journey.
[$sel:wait:Activity'] :: Activity -> Maybe WaitActivity

-- | The settings for a random split activity. This type of activity
--   randomly sends specified percentages of participants down one of as
--   many as five paths in a journey, based on conditions that you specify.
[$sel:randomSplit:Activity'] :: Activity -> Maybe RandomSplitActivity

-- | The settings for a holdout activity. This type of activity stops a
--   journey for a specified percentage of participants.
[$sel:holdout:Activity'] :: Activity -> Maybe HoldoutActivity

-- | The settings for an SMS activity. This type of activity sends a text
--   message to participants.
[$sel:sms:Activity'] :: Activity -> Maybe SMSMessageActivity

-- | The settings for a push notification activity. This type of activity
--   sends a push notification to participants.
[$sel:push:Activity'] :: Activity -> Maybe PushMessageActivity

-- | The custom description of the activity.
[$sel:description:Activity'] :: Activity -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Activity</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:conditionalSplit:Activity'</a>,
--   <a>activity_conditionalSplit</a> - The settings for a yes/no split
--   activity. This type of activity sends participants down one of two
--   paths in a journey, based on conditions that you specify.
--   
--   <a>$sel:email:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_email</a> - The settings for
--   an email activity. This type of activity sends an email message to
--   participants.
--   
--   <a>$sel:multiCondition:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_multiCondition</a> -
--   The settings for a multivariate split activity. This type of activity
--   sends participants down one of as many as five paths (including a
--   default <i>Else</i> path) in a journey, based on conditions that you
--   specify.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactCenter:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_contactCenter</a> -
--   The settings for a connect activity. This type of activity initiates a
--   contact center call to participants.
--   
--   <a>$sel:custom:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_custom</a> - The settings
--   for a custom message activity. This type of activity calls an AWS
--   Lambda function or web hook that sends messages to participants.
--   
--   <a>$sel:wait:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_wait</a> - The settings for a
--   wait activity. This type of activity waits for a certain amount of
--   time or until a specific date and time before moving participants to
--   the next activity in a journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:randomSplit:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_randomSplit</a> - The
--   settings for a random split activity. This type of activity randomly
--   sends specified percentages of participants down one of as many as
--   five paths in a journey, based on conditions that you specify.
--   
--   <a>$sel:holdout:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_holdout</a> - The settings
--   for a holdout activity. This type of activity stops a journey for a
--   specified percentage of participants.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sms:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_sms</a> - The settings for an
--   SMS activity. This type of activity sends a text message to
--   participants.
--   
--   <a>$sel:push:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_push</a> - The settings for a
--   push notification activity. This type of activity sends a push
--   notification to participants.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_description</a> - The
--   custom description of the activity.
newActivity :: Activity

-- | The settings for a yes/no split activity. This type of activity sends
--   participants down one of two paths in a journey, based on conditions
--   that you specify.
activity_conditionalSplit :: Lens' Activity (Maybe ConditionalSplitActivity)

-- | The settings for an email activity. This type of activity sends an
--   email message to participants.
activity_email :: Lens' Activity (Maybe EmailMessageActivity)

-- | The settings for a multivariate split activity. This type of activity
--   sends participants down one of as many as five paths (including a
--   default <i>Else</i> path) in a journey, based on conditions that you
--   specify.
activity_multiCondition :: Lens' Activity (Maybe MultiConditionalSplitActivity)

-- | The settings for a connect activity. This type of activity initiates a
--   contact center call to participants.
activity_contactCenter :: Lens' Activity (Maybe ContactCenterActivity)

-- | The settings for a custom message activity. This type of activity
--   calls an AWS Lambda function or web hook that sends messages to
--   participants.
activity_custom :: Lens' Activity (Maybe CustomMessageActivity)

-- | The settings for a wait activity. This type of activity waits for a
--   certain amount of time or until a specific date and time before moving
--   participants to the next activity in a journey.
activity_wait :: Lens' Activity (Maybe WaitActivity)

-- | The settings for a random split activity. This type of activity
--   randomly sends specified percentages of participants down one of as
--   many as five paths in a journey, based on conditions that you specify.
activity_randomSplit :: Lens' Activity (Maybe RandomSplitActivity)

-- | The settings for a holdout activity. This type of activity stops a
--   journey for a specified percentage of participants.
activity_holdout :: Lens' Activity (Maybe HoldoutActivity)

-- | The settings for an SMS activity. This type of activity sends a text
--   message to participants.
activity_sms :: Lens' Activity (Maybe SMSMessageActivity)

-- | The settings for a push notification activity. This type of activity
--   sends a push notification to participants.
activity_push :: Lens' Activity (Maybe PushMessageActivity)

-- | The custom description of the activity.
activity_description :: Lens' Activity (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Activity.Activity
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Activity.Activity
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Activity.Activity
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Activity.Activity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Activity.Activity
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Activity.Activity
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Activity.Activity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.Activity.Activity


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyResponse

-- | Provides information about the status, configuration, and other
--   settings for a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneyResponse</a> smart constructor.
data JourneyResponse
JourneyResponse' :: Maybe State -> Maybe Text -> Maybe JourneySchedule -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe (HashMap Text Activity) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe JourneyLimits -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe QuietTime -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StartCondition -> Maybe JourneyChannelSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> JourneyResponse

-- | The current status of the journey. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DRAFT - The journey is being developed and hasn't been published
--   yet.</li>
--   <li>ACTIVE - The journey has been developed and published. Depending
--   on the journey's schedule, the journey may currently be running or
--   scheduled to start running at a later time. If a journey's status is
--   ACTIVE, you can't add, change, or remove activities from it.</li>
--   <li>COMPLETED - The journey has been published and has finished
--   running. All participants have entered the journey and no participants
--   are waiting to complete the journey or any activities in the
--   journey.</li>
--   <li>CANCELLED - The journey has been stopped. If a journey's status is
--   CANCELLED, you can't add, change, or remove activities or segment
--   settings from the journey.</li>
--   <li>CLOSED - The journey has been published and has started running.
--   It may have also passed its scheduled end time, or passed its
--   scheduled start time and a refresh frequency hasn't been specified for
--   it. If a journey's status is CLOSED, you can't add participants to it,
--   and no existing participants can enter the journey for the first time.
--   However, any existing participants who are currently waiting to start
--   an activity may continue the journey.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:state:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe State

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The schedule settings for the journey.
[$sel:schedule:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe JourneySchedule

-- | Specifies whether the journey's scheduled start and end times use each
--   participant's local time. If this value is true, the schedule uses
--   each participant's local time.
[$sel:localTime:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | A map that contains a set of Activity objects, one object for each
--   activity in the journey. For each Activity object, the key is the
--   unique identifier (string) for an activity and the value is the
--   settings for the activity.
[$sel:activities:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Activity)

-- | Specifies whether a journey should be refreshed on segment update.
[$sel:refreshOnSegmentUpdate:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The messaging and entry limits for the journey.
[$sel:limits:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe JourneyLimits

-- | Specifies whether endpoints in quiet hours should enter a wait till
--   the end of their quiet hours.
[$sel:waitForQuietTime:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The quiet time settings for the journey. Quiet time is a specific time
--   range when a journey doesn't send messages to participants, if all the
--   following conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint for the
--   participant is set to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the participant's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   journey.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the participant's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   journey.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the participant will
--   receive messages from the journey, even if quiet time is enabled.
[$sel:quietTime:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe QuietTime

-- | The unique identifier for the first activity in the journey.
[$sel:startActivity:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey was created.
[$sel:creationDate:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The segment that defines which users are participants in the journey.
[$sel:startCondition:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe StartCondition

-- | The channel-specific configurations for the journey.
[$sel:journeyChannelSettings:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe JourneyChannelSettings

-- | The frequency with which Amazon Pinpoint evaluates segment and event
--   data for the journey, as a duration in ISO 8601 format.
[$sel:refreshFrequency:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | This object is not used or supported.
[$sel:tags:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The name of the journey.
[$sel:name:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the journey.
[$sel:id:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the journey applies to.
[$sel:applicationId:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneyResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:JourneyResponse'</a>, <a>journeyResponse_state</a> - The
--   current status of the journey. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DRAFT - The journey is being developed and hasn't been published
--   yet.</li>
--   <li>ACTIVE - The journey has been developed and published. Depending
--   on the journey's schedule, the journey may currently be running or
--   scheduled to start running at a later time. If a journey's status is
--   ACTIVE, you can't add, change, or remove activities from it.</li>
--   <li>COMPLETED - The journey has been published and has finished
--   running. All participants have entered the journey and no participants
--   are waiting to complete the journey or any activities in the
--   journey.</li>
--   <li>CANCELLED - The journey has been stopped. If a journey's status is
--   CANCELLED, you can't add, change, or remove activities or segment
--   settings from the journey.</li>
--   <li>CLOSED - The journey has been published and has started running.
--   It may have also passed its scheduled end time, or passed its
--   scheduled start time and a refresh frequency hasn't been specified for
--   it. If a journey's status is CLOSED, you can't add participants to it,
--   and no existing participants can enter the journey for the first time.
--   However, any existing participants who are currently waiting to start
--   an activity may continue the journey.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the journey was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schedule:JourneyResponse'</a>, <a>journeyResponse_schedule</a>
--   - The schedule settings for the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:localTime:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_localTime</a> - Specifies whether the journey's
--   scheduled start and end times use each participant's local time. If
--   this value is true, the schedule uses each participant's local time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activities:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_activities</a> - A map that contains a set of
--   Activity objects, one object for each activity in the journey. For
--   each Activity object, the key is the unique identifier (string) for an
--   activity and the value is the settings for the activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:refreshOnSegmentUpdate:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_refreshOnSegmentUpdate</a> - Specifies whether a
--   journey should be refreshed on segment update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limits:JourneyResponse'</a>, <a>journeyResponse_limits</a> -
--   The messaging and entry limits for the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:waitForQuietTime:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_waitForQuietTime</a> - Specifies whether endpoints
--   in quiet hours should enter a wait till the end of their quiet hours.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quietTime:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_quietTime</a> - The quiet time settings for the
--   journey. Quiet time is a specific time range when a journey doesn't
--   send messages to participants, if all the following conditions are
--   met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint for the
--   participant is set to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the participant's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   journey.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the participant's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   journey.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the participant will
--   receive messages from the journey, even if quiet time is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startActivity:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_startActivity</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   first activity in the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601 format,
--   when the journey was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startCondition:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_startCondition</a> - The segment that defines which
--   users are participants in the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:journeyChannelSettings:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_journeyChannelSettings</a> - The channel-specific
--   configurations for the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:refreshFrequency:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_refreshFrequency</a> - The frequency with which
--   Amazon Pinpoint evaluates segment and event data for the journey, as a
--   duration in ISO 8601 format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:JourneyResponse'</a>, <a>journeyResponse_tags</a> - This
--   object is not used or supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:JourneyResponse'</a>, <a>journeyResponse_name</a> - The
--   name of the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:JourneyResponse'</a>, <a>journeyResponse_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application that the journey applies to.
newJourneyResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> JourneyResponse

-- | The current status of the journey. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DRAFT - The journey is being developed and hasn't been published
--   yet.</li>
--   <li>ACTIVE - The journey has been developed and published. Depending
--   on the journey's schedule, the journey may currently be running or
--   scheduled to start running at a later time. If a journey's status is
--   ACTIVE, you can't add, change, or remove activities from it.</li>
--   <li>COMPLETED - The journey has been published and has finished
--   running. All participants have entered the journey and no participants
--   are waiting to complete the journey or any activities in the
--   journey.</li>
--   <li>CANCELLED - The journey has been stopped. If a journey's status is
--   CANCELLED, you can't add, change, or remove activities or segment
--   settings from the journey.</li>
--   <li>CLOSED - The journey has been published and has started running.
--   It may have also passed its scheduled end time, or passed its
--   scheduled start time and a refresh frequency hasn't been specified for
--   it. If a journey's status is CLOSED, you can't add participants to it,
--   and no existing participants can enter the journey for the first time.
--   However, any existing participants who are currently waiting to start
--   an activity may continue the journey.</li>
--   </ul>
journeyResponse_state :: Lens' JourneyResponse (Maybe State)

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey was last modified.
journeyResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' JourneyResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The schedule settings for the journey.
journeyResponse_schedule :: Lens' JourneyResponse (Maybe JourneySchedule)

-- | Specifies whether the journey's scheduled start and end times use each
--   participant's local time. If this value is true, the schedule uses
--   each participant's local time.
journeyResponse_localTime :: Lens' JourneyResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | A map that contains a set of Activity objects, one object for each
--   activity in the journey. For each Activity object, the key is the
--   unique identifier (string) for an activity and the value is the
--   settings for the activity.
journeyResponse_activities :: Lens' JourneyResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Activity))

-- | Specifies whether a journey should be refreshed on segment update.
journeyResponse_refreshOnSegmentUpdate :: Lens' JourneyResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The messaging and entry limits for the journey.
journeyResponse_limits :: Lens' JourneyResponse (Maybe JourneyLimits)

-- | Specifies whether endpoints in quiet hours should enter a wait till
--   the end of their quiet hours.
journeyResponse_waitForQuietTime :: Lens' JourneyResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The quiet time settings for the journey. Quiet time is a specific time
--   range when a journey doesn't send messages to participants, if all the
--   following conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint for the
--   participant is set to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the participant's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   journey.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the participant's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   journey.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the participant will
--   receive messages from the journey, even if quiet time is enabled.
journeyResponse_quietTime :: Lens' JourneyResponse (Maybe QuietTime)

-- | The unique identifier for the first activity in the journey.
journeyResponse_startActivity :: Lens' JourneyResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey was created.
journeyResponse_creationDate :: Lens' JourneyResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The segment that defines which users are participants in the journey.
journeyResponse_startCondition :: Lens' JourneyResponse (Maybe StartCondition)

-- | The channel-specific configurations for the journey.
journeyResponse_journeyChannelSettings :: Lens' JourneyResponse (Maybe JourneyChannelSettings)

-- | The frequency with which Amazon Pinpoint evaluates segment and event
--   data for the journey, as a duration in ISO 8601 format.
journeyResponse_refreshFrequency :: Lens' JourneyResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | This object is not used or supported.
journeyResponse_tags :: Lens' JourneyResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The name of the journey.
journeyResponse_name :: Lens' JourneyResponse Text

-- | The unique identifier for the journey.
journeyResponse_id :: Lens' JourneyResponse Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the journey applies to.
journeyResponse_applicationId :: Lens' JourneyResponse Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyResponse.JourneyResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyResponse.JourneyResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyResponse.JourneyResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyResponse.JourneyResponse
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyResponse.JourneyResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyResponse.JourneyResponse
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneyResponse.JourneyResponse


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneysResponse

-- | Provides information about the status, configuration, and other
--   settings for all the journeys that are associated with an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneysResponse</a> smart constructor.
data JourneysResponse
JourneysResponse' :: Maybe Text -> [JourneyResponse] -> JourneysResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
[$sel:nextToken:JourneysResponse'] :: JourneysResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of responses, one for each journey that's associated with the
--   application.
[$sel:item:JourneysResponse'] :: JourneysResponse -> [JourneyResponse]

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneysResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:JourneysResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeysResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use in a subsequent
--   request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This
--   value is null if there are no additional pages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:JourneysResponse'</a>, <a>journeysResponse_item</a> - An
--   array of responses, one for each journey that's associated with the
--   application.
newJourneysResponse :: JourneysResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
journeysResponse_nextToken :: Lens' JourneysResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of responses, one for each journey that's associated with the
--   application.
journeysResponse_item :: Lens' JourneysResponse [JourneyResponse]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneysResponse.JourneysResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneysResponse.JourneysResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneysResponse.JourneysResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneysResponse.JourneysResponse
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneysResponse.JourneysResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneysResponse.JourneysResponse
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.JourneysResponse.JourneysResponse


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WriteApplicationSettingsRequest

-- | Specifies the default settings for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWriteApplicationSettingsRequest</a> smart
--   constructor.
data WriteApplicationSettingsRequest
WriteApplicationSettingsRequest' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe CampaignLimits -> Maybe QuietTime -> Maybe CampaignHook -> WriteApplicationSettingsRequest
[$sel:eventTaggingEnabled:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'] :: WriteApplicationSettingsRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether to enable application-related alarms in Amazon
--   CloudWatch.
[$sel:cloudWatchMetricsEnabled:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'] :: WriteApplicationSettingsRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | The default sending limits for campaigns in the application. To
--   override these limits and define custom limits for a specific campaign
--   or journey, use the Campaign resource or the Journey resource,
--   respectively.
[$sel:limits:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'] :: WriteApplicationSettingsRequest -> Maybe CampaignLimits

-- | The default quiet time for campaigns in the application. Quiet time is
--   a specific time range when messages aren't sent to endpoints, if all
--   the following conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set
--   to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the endpoint will
--   receive messages from a campaign or journey, even if quiet time is
--   enabled.
--   
--   To override the default quiet time settings for a specific campaign or
--   journey, use the Campaign resource or the Journey resource to define a
--   custom quiet time for the campaign or journey.
[$sel:quietTime:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'] :: WriteApplicationSettingsRequest -> Maybe QuietTime

-- | The settings for the AWS Lambda function to invoke by default as a
--   code hook for campaigns in the application. You can use this hook to
--   customize segments that are used by campaigns in the application.
--   
--   To override these settings and define custom settings for a specific
--   campaign, use the CampaignHook object of the Campaign resource.
[$sel:campaignHook:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'] :: WriteApplicationSettingsRequest -> Maybe CampaignHook

-- | Create a value of <a>WriteApplicationSettingsRequest</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTaggingEnabled:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeApplicationSettingsRequest_eventTaggingEnabled</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchMetricsEnabled:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeApplicationSettingsRequest_cloudWatchMetricsEnabled</a> -
--   Specifies whether to enable application-related alarms in Amazon
--   CloudWatch.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limits:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeApplicationSettingsRequest_limits</a> - The default sending
--   limits for campaigns in the application. To override these limits and
--   define custom limits for a specific campaign or journey, use the
--   Campaign resource or the Journey resource, respectively.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quietTime:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeApplicationSettingsRequest_quietTime</a> - The default quiet
--   time for campaigns in the application. Quiet time is a specific time
--   range when messages aren't sent to endpoints, if all the following
--   conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set
--   to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the endpoint will
--   receive messages from a campaign or journey, even if quiet time is
--   enabled.
--   
--   To override the default quiet time settings for a specific campaign or
--   journey, use the Campaign resource or the Journey resource to define a
--   custom quiet time for the campaign or journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:campaignHook:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeApplicationSettingsRequest_campaignHook</a> - The settings for
--   the AWS Lambda function to invoke by default as a code hook for
--   campaigns in the application. You can use this hook to customize
--   segments that are used by campaigns in the application.
--   
--   To override these settings and define custom settings for a specific
--   campaign, use the CampaignHook object of the Campaign resource.
newWriteApplicationSettingsRequest :: WriteApplicationSettingsRequest

-- | Undocumented member.
writeApplicationSettingsRequest_eventTaggingEnabled :: Lens' WriteApplicationSettingsRequest (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether to enable application-related alarms in Amazon
--   CloudWatch.
writeApplicationSettingsRequest_cloudWatchMetricsEnabled :: Lens' WriteApplicationSettingsRequest (Maybe Bool)

-- | The default sending limits for campaigns in the application. To
--   override these limits and define custom limits for a specific campaign
--   or journey, use the Campaign resource or the Journey resource,
--   respectively.
writeApplicationSettingsRequest_limits :: Lens' WriteApplicationSettingsRequest (Maybe CampaignLimits)

-- | The default quiet time for campaigns in the application. Quiet time is
--   a specific time range when messages aren't sent to endpoints, if all
--   the following conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set
--   to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the endpoint will
--   receive messages from a campaign or journey, even if quiet time is
--   enabled.
--   
--   To override the default quiet time settings for a specific campaign or
--   journey, use the Campaign resource or the Journey resource to define a
--   custom quiet time for the campaign or journey.
writeApplicationSettingsRequest_quietTime :: Lens' WriteApplicationSettingsRequest (Maybe QuietTime)

-- | The settings for the AWS Lambda function to invoke by default as a
--   code hook for campaigns in the application. You can use this hook to
--   customize segments that are used by campaigns in the application.
--   
--   To override these settings and define custom settings for a specific
--   campaign, use the CampaignHook object of the Campaign resource.
writeApplicationSettingsRequest_campaignHook :: Lens' WriteApplicationSettingsRequest (Maybe CampaignHook)

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WriteEventStream

-- | Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an event stream to publish
--   events to and the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role to use
--   when publishing those events.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWriteEventStream</a> smart constructor.
data WriteEventStream
WriteEventStream' :: Text -> Text -> WriteEventStream

-- | The AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorizes
--   Amazon Pinpoint to publish event data to the stream in your AWS
--   account.
[$sel:roleArn:WriteEventStream'] :: WriteEventStream -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis data stream or
--   Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream that you want to publish
--   event data to.
--   
--   For a Kinesis data stream, the ARN format is:
--   arn:aws:kinesis:region:account-id:stream/stream_name
--   
--   For a Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream, the ARN format is:
--   arn:aws:firehose:region:account-id:deliverystream/stream_name
[$sel:destinationStreamArn:WriteEventStream'] :: WriteEventStream -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>WriteEventStream</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:WriteEventStream'</a>, <a>writeEventStream_roleArn</a>
--   - The AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorizes
--   Amazon Pinpoint to publish event data to the stream in your AWS
--   account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationStreamArn:WriteEventStream'</a>,
--   <a>writeEventStream_destinationStreamArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis data stream or Amazon Kinesis Data
--   Firehose delivery stream that you want to publish event data to.
--   
--   For a Kinesis data stream, the ARN format is:
--   arn:aws:kinesis:region:account-id:stream/stream_name
--   
--   For a Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream, the ARN format is:
--   arn:aws:firehose:region:account-id:deliverystream/stream_name
newWriteEventStream :: Text -> Text -> WriteEventStream

-- | The AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorizes
--   Amazon Pinpoint to publish event data to the stream in your AWS
--   account.
writeEventStream_roleArn :: Lens' WriteEventStream Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis data stream or
--   Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream that you want to publish
--   event data to.
--   
--   For a Kinesis data stream, the ARN format is:
--   arn:aws:kinesis:region:account-id:stream/stream_name
--   
--   For a Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream, the ARN format is:
--   arn:aws:firehose:region:account-id:deliverystream/stream_name
writeEventStream_destinationStreamArn :: Lens' WriteEventStream Text

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WriteJourneyRequest

-- | Specifies the configuration and other settings for a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWriteJourneyRequest</a> smart constructor.
data WriteJourneyRequest
WriteJourneyRequest' :: Maybe State -> Maybe Text -> Maybe JourneySchedule -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe (HashMap Text Activity) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe JourneyLimits -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe QuietTime -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StartCondition -> Maybe Text -> Text -> WriteJourneyRequest

-- | The status of the journey. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DRAFT - Saves the journey and doesn't publish it.</li>
--   <li>ACTIVE - Saves and publishes the journey. Depending on the
--   journey's schedule, the journey starts running immediately or at the
--   scheduled start time. If a journey's status is ACTIVE, you can't add,
--   change, or remove activities from it.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   PAUSED, CANCELLED, COMPLETED, and CLOSED states are not supported in
--   requests to create or update a journey. To cancel, pause, or resume a
--   journey, use the Journey State resource.
[$sel:state:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe State

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The schedule settings for the journey.
[$sel:schedule:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe JourneySchedule

-- | Specifies whether the journey's scheduled start and end times use each
--   participant's local time. To base the schedule on each participant's
--   local time, set this value to true.
[$sel:localTime:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | A map that contains a set of Activity objects, one object for each
--   activity in the journey. For each Activity object, the key is the
--   unique identifier (string) for an activity and the value is the
--   settings for the activity. An activity identifier can contain a
--   maximum of 100 characters. The characters must be alphanumeric
--   characters.
[$sel:activities:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Activity)

-- | Specifies whether a journey should be refreshed on segment update.
[$sel:refreshOnSegmentUpdate:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | The messaging and entry limits for the journey.
[$sel:limits:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe JourneyLimits

-- | Specifies whether endpoints in quiet hours should enter a wait till
--   the end of their quiet hours.
[$sel:waitForQuietTime:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | The quiet time settings for the journey. Quiet time is a specific time
--   range when a journey doesn't send messages to participants, if all the
--   following conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint for the
--   participant is set to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the participant's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   journey.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the participant's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   journey.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the participant will
--   receive messages from the journey, even if quiet time is enabled.
[$sel:quietTime:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe QuietTime

-- | The unique identifier for the first activity in the journey. The
--   identifier for this activity can contain a maximum of 128 characters.
--   The characters must be alphanumeric characters.
[$sel:startActivity:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey was created.
[$sel:creationDate:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The segment that defines which users are participants in the journey.
[$sel:startCondition:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe StartCondition

-- | The frequency with which Amazon Pinpoint evaluates segment and event
--   data for the journey, as a duration in ISO 8601 format.
[$sel:refreshFrequency:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the journey. A journey name can contain a maximum of 150
--   characters. The characters can be alphanumeric characters or symbols,
--   such as underscores (_) or hyphens (-). A journey name can't contain
--   any spaces.
[$sel:name:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>WriteJourneyRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_state</a> - The status of the journey. Valid
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DRAFT - Saves the journey and doesn't publish it.</li>
--   <li>ACTIVE - Saves and publishes the journey. Depending on the
--   journey's schedule, the journey starts running immediately or at the
--   scheduled start time. If a journey's status is ACTIVE, you can't add,
--   change, or remove activities from it.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   PAUSED, CANCELLED, COMPLETED, and CLOSED states are not supported in
--   requests to create or update a journey. To cancel, pause, or resume a
--   journey, use the Journey State resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the journey was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schedule:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_schedule</a> - The schedule settings for the
--   journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:localTime:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_localTime</a> - Specifies whether the journey's
--   scheduled start and end times use each participant's local time. To
--   base the schedule on each participant's local time, set this value to
--   true.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activities:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_activities</a> - A map that contains a set of
--   Activity objects, one object for each activity in the journey. For
--   each Activity object, the key is the unique identifier (string) for an
--   activity and the value is the settings for the activity. An activity
--   identifier can contain a maximum of 100 characters. The characters
--   must be alphanumeric characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:refreshOnSegmentUpdate:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_refreshOnSegmentUpdate</a> - Specifies whether
--   a journey should be refreshed on segment update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limits:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_limits</a> - The messaging and entry limits for
--   the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:waitForQuietTime:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_waitForQuietTime</a> - Specifies whether
--   endpoints in quiet hours should enter a wait till the end of their
--   quiet hours.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quietTime:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_quietTime</a> - The quiet time settings for the
--   journey. Quiet time is a specific time range when a journey doesn't
--   send messages to participants, if all the following conditions are
--   met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint for the
--   participant is set to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the participant's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   journey.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the participant's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   journey.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the participant will
--   receive messages from the journey, even if quiet time is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startActivity:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_startActivity</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the first activity in the journey. The identifier for this activity
--   can contain a maximum of 128 characters. The characters must be
--   alphanumeric characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_creationDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the journey was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startCondition:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_startCondition</a> - The segment that defines
--   which users are participants in the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:refreshFrequency:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_refreshFrequency</a> - The frequency with which
--   Amazon Pinpoint evaluates segment and event data for the journey, as a
--   duration in ISO 8601 format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>, <a>writeJourneyRequest_name</a>
--   - The name of the journey. A journey name can contain a maximum of 150
--   characters. The characters can be alphanumeric characters or symbols,
--   such as underscores (_) or hyphens (-). A journey name can't contain
--   any spaces.
newWriteJourneyRequest :: Text -> WriteJourneyRequest

-- | The status of the journey. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DRAFT - Saves the journey and doesn't publish it.</li>
--   <li>ACTIVE - Saves and publishes the journey. Depending on the
--   journey's schedule, the journey starts running immediately or at the
--   scheduled start time. If a journey's status is ACTIVE, you can't add,
--   change, or remove activities from it.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   PAUSED, CANCELLED, COMPLETED, and CLOSED states are not supported in
--   requests to create or update a journey. To cancel, pause, or resume a
--   journey, use the Journey State resource.
writeJourneyRequest_state :: Lens' WriteJourneyRequest (Maybe State)

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey was last modified.
writeJourneyRequest_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' WriteJourneyRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The schedule settings for the journey.
writeJourneyRequest_schedule :: Lens' WriteJourneyRequest (Maybe JourneySchedule)

-- | Specifies whether the journey's scheduled start and end times use each
--   participant's local time. To base the schedule on each participant's
--   local time, set this value to true.
writeJourneyRequest_localTime :: Lens' WriteJourneyRequest (Maybe Bool)

-- | A map that contains a set of Activity objects, one object for each
--   activity in the journey. For each Activity object, the key is the
--   unique identifier (string) for an activity and the value is the
--   settings for the activity. An activity identifier can contain a
--   maximum of 100 characters. The characters must be alphanumeric
--   characters.
writeJourneyRequest_activities :: Lens' WriteJourneyRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text Activity))

-- | Specifies whether a journey should be refreshed on segment update.
writeJourneyRequest_refreshOnSegmentUpdate :: Lens' WriteJourneyRequest (Maybe Bool)

-- | The messaging and entry limits for the journey.
writeJourneyRequest_limits :: Lens' WriteJourneyRequest (Maybe JourneyLimits)

-- | Specifies whether endpoints in quiet hours should enter a wait till
--   the end of their quiet hours.
writeJourneyRequest_waitForQuietTime :: Lens' WriteJourneyRequest (Maybe Bool)

-- | The quiet time settings for the journey. Quiet time is a specific time
--   range when a journey doesn't send messages to participants, if all the
--   following conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint for the
--   participant is set to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the participant's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   journey.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the participant's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   journey.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the participant will
--   receive messages from the journey, even if quiet time is enabled.
writeJourneyRequest_quietTime :: Lens' WriteJourneyRequest (Maybe QuietTime)

-- | The unique identifier for the first activity in the journey. The
--   identifier for this activity can contain a maximum of 128 characters.
--   The characters must be alphanumeric characters.
writeJourneyRequest_startActivity :: Lens' WriteJourneyRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey was created.
writeJourneyRequest_creationDate :: Lens' WriteJourneyRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The segment that defines which users are participants in the journey.
writeJourneyRequest_startCondition :: Lens' WriteJourneyRequest (Maybe StartCondition)

-- | The frequency with which Amazon Pinpoint evaluates segment and event
--   data for the journey, as a duration in ISO 8601 format.
writeJourneyRequest_refreshFrequency :: Lens' WriteJourneyRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the journey. A journey name can contain a maximum of 150
--   characters. The characters can be alphanumeric characters or symbols,
--   such as underscores (_) or hyphens (-). A journey name can't contain
--   any spaces.
writeJourneyRequest_name :: Lens' WriteJourneyRequest Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WriteJourneyRequest.WriteJourneyRequest
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WriteJourneyRequest.WriteJourneyRequest
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WriteJourneyRequest.WriteJourneyRequest
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WriteJourneyRequest.WriteJourneyRequest
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WriteJourneyRequest.WriteJourneyRequest
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WriteJourneyRequest.WriteJourneyRequest
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WriteJourneyRequest.WriteJourneyRequest


module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WriteSegmentRequest

-- | Specifies the configuration, dimension, and other settings for a
--   segment. A WriteSegmentRequest object can include a Dimensions object
--   or a SegmentGroups object, but not both.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWriteSegmentRequest</a> smart constructor.
data WriteSegmentRequest
WriteSegmentRequest' :: Maybe SegmentGroupList -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SegmentDimensions -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> WriteSegmentRequest

-- | The segment group to use and the dimensions to apply to the group's
--   base segments in order to build the segment. A segment group can
--   consist of zero or more base segments. Your request can include only
--   one segment group.
[$sel:segmentGroups:WriteSegmentRequest'] :: WriteSegmentRequest -> Maybe SegmentGroupList

-- | The name of the segment.
[$sel:name:WriteSegmentRequest'] :: WriteSegmentRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The criteria that define the dimensions for the segment.
[$sel:dimensions:WriteSegmentRequest'] :: WriteSegmentRequest -> Maybe SegmentDimensions

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the segment. Each tag consists of a required tag key
--   and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:WriteSegmentRequest'] :: WriteSegmentRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>WriteSegmentRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentGroups:WriteSegmentRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeSegmentRequest_segmentGroups</a> - The segment group to use
--   and the dimensions to apply to the group's base segments in order to
--   build the segment. A segment group can consist of zero or more base
--   segments. Your request can include only one segment group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:WriteSegmentRequest'</a>, <a>writeSegmentRequest_name</a>
--   - The name of the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:WriteSegmentRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeSegmentRequest_dimensions</a> - The criteria that define the
--   dimensions for the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:WriteSegmentRequest'</a>, <a>writeSegmentRequest_tags</a>
--   - A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the segment. Each tag consists of a required tag key
--   and an associated tag value.
newWriteSegmentRequest :: WriteSegmentRequest

-- | The segment group to use and the dimensions to apply to the group's
--   base segments in order to build the segment. A segment group can
--   consist of zero or more base segments. Your request can include only
--   one segment group.
writeSegmentRequest_segmentGroups :: Lens' WriteSegmentRequest (Maybe SegmentGroupList)

-- | The name of the segment.
writeSegmentRequest_name :: Lens' WriteSegmentRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The criteria that define the dimensions for the segment.
writeSegmentRequest_dimensions :: Lens' WriteSegmentRequest (Maybe SegmentDimensions)

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the segment. Each tag consists of a required tag key
--   and an associated tag value.
writeSegmentRequest_tags :: Lens' WriteSegmentRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WriteSegmentRequest.WriteSegmentRequest
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WriteSegmentRequest.WriteSegmentRequest
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WriteSegmentRequest.WriteSegmentRequest

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WriteTreatmentResource

-- | Specifies the settings for a campaign treatment. A <i>treatment</i> is
--   a variation of a campaign that's used for A/B testing of a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWriteTreatmentResource</a> smart constructor.
data WriteTreatmentResource
WriteTreatmentResource' :: Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration -> Maybe Schedule -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MessageConfiguration -> Int -> WriteTreatmentResource

-- | The delivery configuration settings for sending the treatment through
--   a custom channel. This object is required if the MessageConfiguration
--   object for the treatment specifies a CustomMessage object.
[$sel:customDeliveryConfiguration:WriteTreatmentResource'] :: WriteTreatmentResource -> Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration

-- | The schedule settings for the treatment.
[$sel:schedule:WriteTreatmentResource'] :: WriteTreatmentResource -> Maybe Schedule

-- | The message template to use for the treatment.
[$sel:templateConfiguration:WriteTreatmentResource'] :: WriteTreatmentResource -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration

-- | A custom name for the treatment.
[$sel:treatmentName:WriteTreatmentResource'] :: WriteTreatmentResource -> Maybe Text

-- | A custom description of the treatment.
[$sel:treatmentDescription:WriteTreatmentResource'] :: WriteTreatmentResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The message configuration settings for the treatment.
[$sel:messageConfiguration:WriteTreatmentResource'] :: WriteTreatmentResource -> Maybe MessageConfiguration

-- | The allocated percentage of users (segment members) to send the
--   treatment to.
[$sel:sizePercent:WriteTreatmentResource'] :: WriteTreatmentResource -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>WriteTreatmentResource</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:customDeliveryConfiguration:WriteTreatmentResource'</a>,
--   <a>writeTreatmentResource_customDeliveryConfiguration</a> - The
--   delivery configuration settings for sending the treatment through a
--   custom channel. This object is required if the MessageConfiguration
--   object for the treatment specifies a CustomMessage object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schedule:WriteTreatmentResource'</a>,
--   <a>writeTreatmentResource_schedule</a> - The schedule settings for the
--   treatment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateConfiguration:WriteTreatmentResource'</a>,
--   <a>writeTreatmentResource_templateConfiguration</a> - The message
--   template to use for the treatment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatmentName:WriteTreatmentResource'</a>,
--   <a>writeTreatmentResource_treatmentName</a> - A custom name for the
--   treatment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatmentDescription:WriteTreatmentResource'</a>,
--   <a>writeTreatmentResource_treatmentDescription</a> - A custom
--   description of the treatment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfiguration:WriteTreatmentResource'</a>,
--   <a>writeTreatmentResource_messageConfiguration</a> - The message
--   configuration settings for the treatment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizePercent:WriteTreatmentResource'</a>,
--   <a>writeTreatmentResource_sizePercent</a> - The allocated percentage
--   of users (segment members) to send the treatment to.
newWriteTreatmentResource :: Int -> WriteTreatmentResource

-- | The delivery configuration settings for sending the treatment through
--   a custom channel. This object is required if the MessageConfiguration
--   object for the treatment specifies a CustomMessage object.
writeTreatmentResource_customDeliveryConfiguration :: Lens' WriteTreatmentResource (Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration)

-- | The schedule settings for the treatment.
writeTreatmentResource_schedule :: Lens' WriteTreatmentResource (Maybe Schedule)

-- | The message template to use for the treatment.
writeTreatmentResource_templateConfiguration :: Lens' WriteTreatmentResource (Maybe TemplateConfiguration)

-- | A custom name for the treatment.
writeTreatmentResource_treatmentName :: Lens' WriteTreatmentResource (Maybe Text)

-- | A custom description of the treatment.
writeTreatmentResource_treatmentDescription :: Lens' WriteTreatmentResource (Maybe Text)

-- | The message configuration settings for the treatment.
writeTreatmentResource_messageConfiguration :: Lens' WriteTreatmentResource (Maybe MessageConfiguration)

-- | The allocated percentage of users (segment members) to send the
--   treatment to.
writeTreatmentResource_sizePercent :: Lens' WriteTreatmentResource Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WriteTreatmentResource.WriteTreatmentResource
