module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WriteCampaignRequest

-- | Specifies the configuration and other settings for a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWriteCampaignRequest</a> smart constructor.
data WriteCampaignRequest
WriteCampaignRequest' :: Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Schedule -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration -> Maybe CampaignHook -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CampaignLimits -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MessageConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [WriteTreatmentResource] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Int -> WriteCampaignRequest

-- | The delivery configuration settings for sending the campaign through a
--   custom channel. This object is required if the MessageConfiguration
--   object for the campaign specifies a CustomMessage object.
[$sel:customDeliveryConfiguration:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration

-- | Defines the priority of the campaign, used to decide the order of
--   messages displayed to user if there are multiple messages scheduled to
--   be displayed at the same moment.
[$sel:priority:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe Int

-- | The schedule settings for the campaign.
[$sel:schedule:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe Schedule

-- | The message template to use for the campaign.
[$sel:templateConfiguration:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration

-- | The settings for the AWS Lambda function to invoke as a code hook for
--   the campaign. You can use this hook to customize the segment that's
--   used by the campaign.
[$sel:hook:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe CampaignHook

-- | A custom name of the default treatment for the campaign, if the
--   campaign has multiple treatments. A <i>treatment</i> is a variation of
--   a campaign that's used for A/B testing.
[$sel:treatmentName:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The messaging limits for the campaign.
[$sel:limits:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe CampaignLimits

-- | Specifies whether to pause the campaign. A paused campaign doesn't run
--   unless you resume it by changing this value to false.
[$sel:isPaused:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | A custom name for the campaign.
[$sel:name:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The allocated percentage of users (segment members) who shouldn't
--   receive messages from the campaign.
[$sel:holdoutPercent:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe Int

-- | A custom description of the default treatment for the campaign.
[$sel:treatmentDescription:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The message configuration settings for the campaign.
[$sel:messageConfiguration:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe MessageConfiguration

-- | A custom description of the campaign.
[$sel:description:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the segment to associate with the campaign.
[$sel:segmentId:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of requests that defines additional treatments for the
--   campaign, in addition to the default treatment for the campaign.
[$sel:additionalTreatments:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe [WriteTreatmentResource]

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the campaign. Each tag consists of a required tag key
--   and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The version of the segment to associate with the campaign.
[$sel:segmentVersion:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>WriteCampaignRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:customDeliveryConfiguration:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_customDeliveryConfiguration</a> - The delivery
--   configuration settings for sending the campaign through a custom
--   channel. This object is required if the MessageConfiguration object
--   for the campaign specifies a CustomMessage object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:priority:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_priority</a> - Defines the priority of the
--   campaign, used to decide the order of messages displayed to user if
--   there are multiple messages scheduled to be displayed at the same
--   moment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schedule:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_schedule</a> - The schedule settings for the
--   campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateConfiguration:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_templateConfiguration</a> - The message
--   template to use for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hook:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_hook</a> - The settings for the AWS Lambda
--   function to invoke as a code hook for the campaign. You can use this
--   hook to customize the segment that's used by the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatmentName:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_treatmentName</a> - A custom name of the
--   default treatment for the campaign, if the campaign has multiple
--   treatments. A <i>treatment</i> is a variation of a campaign that's
--   used for A/B testing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limits:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_limits</a> - The messaging limits for the
--   campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isPaused:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_isPaused</a> - Specifies whether to pause the
--   campaign. A paused campaign doesn't run unless you resume it by
--   changing this value to false.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_name</a> - A custom name for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:holdoutPercent:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_holdoutPercent</a> - The allocated percentage
--   of users (segment members) who shouldn't receive messages from the
--   campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatmentDescription:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_treatmentDescription</a> - A custom
--   description of the default treatment for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfiguration:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_messageConfiguration</a> - The message
--   configuration settings for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_description</a> - A custom description of the
--   campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentId:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_segmentId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   segment to associate with the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalTreatments:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_additionalTreatments</a> - An array of
--   requests that defines additional treatments for the campaign, in
--   addition to the default treatment for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_tags</a> - A string-to-string map of key-value
--   pairs that defines the tags to associate with the campaign. Each tag
--   consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentVersion:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_segmentVersion</a> - The version of the
--   segment to associate with the campaign.
newWriteCampaignRequest :: WriteCampaignRequest

-- | The delivery configuration settings for sending the campaign through a
--   custom channel. This object is required if the MessageConfiguration
--   object for the campaign specifies a CustomMessage object.
writeCampaignRequest_customDeliveryConfiguration :: Lens' WriteCampaignRequest (Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration)

-- | Defines the priority of the campaign, used to decide the order of
--   messages displayed to user if there are multiple messages scheduled to
--   be displayed at the same moment.
writeCampaignRequest_priority :: Lens' WriteCampaignRequest (Maybe Int)

-- | The schedule settings for the campaign.
writeCampaignRequest_schedule :: Lens' WriteCampaignRequest (Maybe Schedule)

-- | The message template to use for the campaign.
writeCampaignRequest_templateConfiguration :: Lens' WriteCampaignRequest (Maybe TemplateConfiguration)

-- | The settings for the AWS Lambda function to invoke as a code hook for
--   the campaign. You can use this hook to customize the segment that's
--   used by the campaign.
writeCampaignRequest_hook :: Lens' WriteCampaignRequest (Maybe CampaignHook)

-- | A custom name of the default treatment for the campaign, if the
--   campaign has multiple treatments. A <i>treatment</i> is a variation of
--   a campaign that's used for A/B testing.
writeCampaignRequest_treatmentName :: Lens' WriteCampaignRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The messaging limits for the campaign.
writeCampaignRequest_limits :: Lens' WriteCampaignRequest (Maybe CampaignLimits)

-- | Specifies whether to pause the campaign. A paused campaign doesn't run
--   unless you resume it by changing this value to false.
writeCampaignRequest_isPaused :: Lens' WriteCampaignRequest (Maybe Bool)

-- | A custom name for the campaign.
writeCampaignRequest_name :: Lens' WriteCampaignRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The allocated percentage of users (segment members) who shouldn't
--   receive messages from the campaign.
writeCampaignRequest_holdoutPercent :: Lens' WriteCampaignRequest (Maybe Int)

-- | A custom description of the default treatment for the campaign.
writeCampaignRequest_treatmentDescription :: Lens' WriteCampaignRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The message configuration settings for the campaign.
writeCampaignRequest_messageConfiguration :: Lens' WriteCampaignRequest (Maybe MessageConfiguration)

-- | A custom description of the campaign.
writeCampaignRequest_description :: Lens' WriteCampaignRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the segment to associate with the campaign.
writeCampaignRequest_segmentId :: Lens' WriteCampaignRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of requests that defines additional treatments for the
--   campaign, in addition to the default treatment for the campaign.
writeCampaignRequest_additionalTreatments :: Lens' WriteCampaignRequest (Maybe [WriteTreatmentResource])

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the campaign. Each tag consists of a required tag key
--   and an associated tag value.
writeCampaignRequest_tags :: Lens' WriteCampaignRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The version of the segment to associate with the campaign.
writeCampaignRequest_segmentVersion :: Lens' WriteCampaignRequest (Maybe Int)

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types.WriteCampaignRequest.WriteCampaignRequest

module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.Types

-- | API version <tt>2016-12-01</tt> of the Amazon Pinpoint SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | Provides information about an API request or response.
_PayloadTooLargeException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Provides information about an API request or response.
_ConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Provides information about an API request or response.
_ForbiddenException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Provides information about an API request or response.
_NotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Provides information about an API request or response.
_TooManyRequestsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Provides information about an API request or response.
_InternalServerErrorException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Provides information about an API request or response.
_MethodNotAllowedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Provides information about an API request or response.
_BadRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError
newtype Action
Action' :: Text -> Action
[fromAction] :: Action -> Text
pattern Action_DEEP_LINK :: Action
pattern Action_OPEN_APP :: Action
pattern Action_URL :: Action
newtype Alignment
Alignment' :: Text -> Alignment
[fromAlignment] :: Alignment -> Text
pattern Alignment_CENTER :: Alignment
pattern Alignment_LEFT :: Alignment
pattern Alignment_RIGHT :: Alignment
newtype AttributeType
AttributeType' :: Text -> AttributeType
[fromAttributeType] :: AttributeType -> Text
pattern AttributeType_AFTER :: AttributeType
pattern AttributeType_BEFORE :: AttributeType

-- | Specifies the status and settings of the ADM (Amazon Device Messaging)
--   channel for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newADMChannelRequest</a> smart constructor.
data ADMChannelRequest
ADMChannelRequest' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> Text -> ADMChannelRequest

-- | Specifies whether to enable the ADM channel for the application.
[$sel:enabled:ADMChannelRequest'] :: ADMChannelRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Client Secret that you received from Amazon to send messages by
--   using ADM.
[$sel:clientSecret:ADMChannelRequest'] :: ADMChannelRequest -> Text

-- | The Client ID that you received from Amazon to send messages by using
--   ADM.
[$sel:clientId:ADMChannelRequest'] :: ADMChannelRequest -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ADMChannelRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:ADMChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>aDMChannelRequest_enabled</a> - Specifies whether to enable the ADM
--   channel for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientSecret:ADMChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>aDMChannelRequest_clientSecret</a> - The Client Secret that you
--   received from Amazon to send messages by using ADM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientId:ADMChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>aDMChannelRequest_clientId</a> - The Client ID that you received
--   from Amazon to send messages by using ADM.
newADMChannelRequest :: Text -> Text -> ADMChannelRequest

-- | Specifies whether to enable the ADM channel for the application.
aDMChannelRequest_enabled :: Lens' ADMChannelRequest (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Client Secret that you received from Amazon to send messages by
--   using ADM.
aDMChannelRequest_clientSecret :: Lens' ADMChannelRequest Text

-- | The Client ID that you received from Amazon to send messages by using
--   ADM.
aDMChannelRequest_clientId :: Lens' ADMChannelRequest Text

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of the ADM (Amazon
--   Device Messaging) channel for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newADMChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ADMChannelResponse
ADMChannelResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> ADMChannelResponse

-- | The date and time when the ADM channel was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:ADMChannelResponse'] :: ADMChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the ADM channel is enabled for the application.
[$sel:enabled:ADMChannelResponse'] :: ADMChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether the ADM channel is archived.
[$sel:isArchived:ADMChannelResponse'] :: ADMChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the ADM channel applies
--   to.
[$sel:applicationId:ADMChannelResponse'] :: ADMChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The current version of the ADM channel.
[$sel:version:ADMChannelResponse'] :: ADMChannelResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the ADM channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:id:ADMChannelResponse'] :: ADMChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time when the ADM channel was enabled.
[$sel:creationDate:ADMChannelResponse'] :: ADMChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The user who last modified the ADM channel.
[$sel:lastModifiedBy:ADMChannelResponse'] :: ADMChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:hasCredential:ADMChannelResponse'] :: ADMChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For
--   the ADM channel, this value is ADM.
[$sel:platform:ADMChannelResponse'] :: ADMChannelResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ADMChannelResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:ADMChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aDMChannelResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date and time when
--   the ADM channel was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:ADMChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aDMChannelResponse_enabled</a> - Specifies whether the ADM channel
--   is enabled for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isArchived:ADMChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aDMChannelResponse_isArchived</a> - Specifies whether the ADM
--   channel is archived.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:ADMChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aDMChannelResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the application that the ADM channel applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:ADMChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aDMChannelResponse_version</a> - The current version of the ADM
--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ADMChannelResponse'</a>, <a>aDMChannelResponse_id</a> -
--   (Deprecated) An identifier for the ADM channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:ADMChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aDMChannelResponse_creationDate</a> - The date and time when the
--   ADM channel was enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedBy:ADMChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aDMChannelResponse_lastModifiedBy</a> - The user who last modified
--   the ADM channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasCredential:ADMChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aDMChannelResponse_hasCredential</a> - (Not used) This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:ADMChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aDMChannelResponse_platform</a> - The type of messaging or
--   notification platform for the channel. For the ADM channel, this value
--   is ADM.
newADMChannelResponse :: Text -> ADMChannelResponse

-- | The date and time when the ADM channel was last modified.
aDMChannelResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' ADMChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the ADM channel is enabled for the application.
aDMChannelResponse_enabled :: Lens' ADMChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether the ADM channel is archived.
aDMChannelResponse_isArchived :: Lens' ADMChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the ADM channel applies
--   to.
aDMChannelResponse_applicationId :: Lens' ADMChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The current version of the ADM channel.
aDMChannelResponse_version :: Lens' ADMChannelResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the ADM channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
aDMChannelResponse_id :: Lens' ADMChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when the ADM channel was enabled.
aDMChannelResponse_creationDate :: Lens' ADMChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The user who last modified the ADM channel.
aDMChannelResponse_lastModifiedBy :: Lens' ADMChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
aDMChannelResponse_hasCredential :: Lens' ADMChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For
--   the ADM channel, this value is ADM.
aDMChannelResponse_platform :: Lens' ADMChannelResponse Text

-- | Specifies the settings for a one-time message that's sent directly to
--   an endpoint through the ADM (Amazon Device Messaging) channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newADMMessage</a> smart constructor.
data ADMMessage
ADMMessage' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ADMMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the notification message. You
--   can override the default variables with individual address variables.
[$sel:substitutions:ADMMessage'] :: ADMMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, that ADM should store the message if
--   the recipient's device is offline. Amazon Pinpoint specifies this
--   value in the expiresAfter parameter when it sends the notification
--   message to ADM.
[$sel:expiresAfter:ADMMessage'] :: ADMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The base64-encoded, MD5 checksum of the value specified by the Data
--   property. ADM uses the MD5 value to verify the integrity of the data.
[$sel:md5:ADMMessage'] :: ADMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification,
--   which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's
--   device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as
--   updating an app's configuration or supporting phone home
--   functionality.
[$sel:silentPush:ADMMessage'] :: ADMMessage -> Maybe Bool

-- | The URL of the large icon image to display in the content view of the
--   push notification.
[$sel:imageIconUrl:ADMMessage'] :: ADMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the
--   notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other
--   content for the message.
[$sel:rawContent:ADMMessage'] :: ADMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The JSON data payload to use for the push notification, if the
--   notification is a silent push notification. This payload is added to
--   the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.
[$sel:data':ADMMessage'] :: ADMMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The URL of the small icon image to display in the status bar and the
--   content view of the push notification.
[$sel:smallImageIconUrl:ADMMessage'] :: ADMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The body of the notification message.
[$sel:body:ADMMessage'] :: ADMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL to open in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action
--   property is URL.
[$sel:url:ADMMessage'] :: ADMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The sound to play when the recipient receives the push notification.
--   You can use the default stream or specify the file name of a sound
--   resource that's bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound
--   file must reside in /res/raw/.
[$sel:sound:ADMMessage'] :: ADMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The action to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of
--   the Android platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:action:ADMMessage'] :: ADMMessage -> Maybe Action

-- | The URL of an image to display in the push notification.
[$sel:imageUrl:ADMMessage'] :: ADMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | An arbitrary string that indicates that multiple messages are
--   logically the same and that Amazon Device Messaging (ADM) can drop
--   previously enqueued messages in favor of this message.
[$sel:consolidationKey:ADMMessage'] :: ADMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The title to display above the notification message on the recipient's
--   device.
[$sel:title:ADMMessage'] :: ADMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The icon image name of the asset saved in your app.
[$sel:iconReference:ADMMessage'] :: ADMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ADMMessage</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:ADMMessage'</a>, <a>aDMMessage_substitutions</a>
--   - The default message variables to use in the notification message.
--   You can override the default variables with individual address
--   variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expiresAfter:ADMMessage'</a>, <a>aDMMessage_expiresAfter</a> -
--   The amount of time, in seconds, that ADM should store the message if
--   the recipient's device is offline. Amazon Pinpoint specifies this
--   value in the expiresAfter parameter when it sends the notification
--   message to ADM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:md5:ADMMessage'</a>, <a>aDMMessage_md5</a> - The
--   base64-encoded, MD5 checksum of the value specified by the Data
--   property. ADM uses the MD5 value to verify the integrity of the data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:silentPush:ADMMessage'</a>, <a>aDMMessage_silentPush</a> -
--   Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification,
--   which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's
--   device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as
--   updating an app's configuration or supporting phone home
--   functionality.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageIconUrl:ADMMessage'</a>, <a>aDMMessage_imageIconUrl</a> -
--   The URL of the large icon image to display in the content view of the
--   push notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawContent:ADMMessage'</a>, <a>aDMMessage_rawContent</a> - The
--   raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the notification
--   message. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the
--   message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':ADMMessage'</a>, <a>aDMMessage_data</a> - The JSON data
--   payload to use for the push notification, if the notification is a
--   silent push notification. This payload is added to the
--   data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:smallImageIconUrl:ADMMessage'</a>,
--   <a>aDMMessage_smallImageIconUrl</a> - The URL of the small icon image
--   to display in the status bar and the content view of the push
--   notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:ADMMessage'</a>, <a>aDMMessage_body</a> - The body of the
--   notification message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:ADMMessage'</a>, <a>aDMMessage_url</a> - The URL to open
--   in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the
--   push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sound:ADMMessage'</a>, <a>aDMMessage_sound</a> - The sound to
--   play when the recipient receives the push notification. You can use
--   the default stream or specify the file name of a sound resource that's
--   bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound file must
--   reside in /res/raw/.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:ADMMessage'</a>, <a>aDMMessage_action</a> - The action
--   to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid values
--   are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of
--   the Android platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageUrl:ADMMessage'</a>, <a>aDMMessage_imageUrl</a> - The URL
--   of an image to display in the push notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:consolidationKey:ADMMessage'</a>,
--   <a>aDMMessage_consolidationKey</a> - An arbitrary string that
--   indicates that multiple messages are logically the same and that
--   Amazon Device Messaging (ADM) can drop previously enqueued messages in
--   favor of this message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:ADMMessage'</a>, <a>aDMMessage_title</a> - The title to
--   display above the notification message on the recipient's device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iconReference:ADMMessage'</a>, <a>aDMMessage_iconReference</a>
--   - The icon image name of the asset saved in your app.
newADMMessage :: ADMMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the notification message. You
--   can override the default variables with individual address variables.
aDMMessage_substitutions :: Lens' ADMMessage (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, that ADM should store the message if
--   the recipient's device is offline. Amazon Pinpoint specifies this
--   value in the expiresAfter parameter when it sends the notification
--   message to ADM.
aDMMessage_expiresAfter :: Lens' ADMMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The base64-encoded, MD5 checksum of the value specified by the Data
--   property. ADM uses the MD5 value to verify the integrity of the data.
aDMMessage_md5 :: Lens' ADMMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification,
--   which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's
--   device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as
--   updating an app's configuration or supporting phone home
--   functionality.
aDMMessage_silentPush :: Lens' ADMMessage (Maybe Bool)

-- | The URL of the large icon image to display in the content view of the
--   push notification.
aDMMessage_imageIconUrl :: Lens' ADMMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the
--   notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other
--   content for the message.
aDMMessage_rawContent :: Lens' ADMMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The JSON data payload to use for the push notification, if the
--   notification is a silent push notification. This payload is added to
--   the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.
aDMMessage_data :: Lens' ADMMessage (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The URL of the small icon image to display in the status bar and the
--   content view of the push notification.
aDMMessage_smallImageIconUrl :: Lens' ADMMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The body of the notification message.
aDMMessage_body :: Lens' ADMMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL to open in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action
--   property is URL.
aDMMessage_url :: Lens' ADMMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The sound to play when the recipient receives the push notification.
--   You can use the default stream or specify the file name of a sound
--   resource that's bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound
--   file must reside in /res/raw/.
aDMMessage_sound :: Lens' ADMMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The action to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of
--   the Android platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
aDMMessage_action :: Lens' ADMMessage (Maybe Action)

-- | The URL of an image to display in the push notification.
aDMMessage_imageUrl :: Lens' ADMMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | An arbitrary string that indicates that multiple messages are
--   logically the same and that Amazon Device Messaging (ADM) can drop
--   previously enqueued messages in favor of this message.
aDMMessage_consolidationKey :: Lens' ADMMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The title to display above the notification message on the recipient's
--   device.
aDMMessage_title :: Lens' ADMMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The icon image name of the asset saved in your app.
aDMMessage_iconReference :: Lens' ADMMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the status and settings of the APNs (Apple Push Notification
--   service) channel for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAPNSChannelRequest</a> smart constructor.
data APNSChannelRequest
APNSChannelRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> APNSChannelRequest

-- | The authentication key to use for APNs tokens.
[$sel:tokenKey:APNSChannelRequest'] :: APNSChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The private key for the APNs client certificate that you want Amazon
--   Pinpoint to use to communicate with APNs.
[$sel:privateKey:APNSChannelRequest'] :: APNSChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether to enable the APNs channel for the application.
[$sel:enabled:APNSChannelRequest'] :: APNSChannelRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | The identifier that's assigned to your Apple developer account team.
--   This identifier is used for APNs tokens.
[$sel:teamId:APNSChannelRequest'] :: APNSChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The bundle identifier that's assigned to your iOS app. This identifier
--   is used for APNs tokens.
[$sel:bundleId:APNSChannelRequest'] :: APNSChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The default authentication method that you want Amazon Pinpoint to use
--   when authenticating with APNs, key or certificate.
[$sel:defaultAuthenticationMethod:APNSChannelRequest'] :: APNSChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The APNs client certificate that you received from Apple, if you want
--   Amazon Pinpoint to communicate with APNs by using an APNs certificate.
[$sel:certificate:APNSChannelRequest'] :: APNSChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The key identifier that's assigned to your APNs signing key, if you
--   want Amazon Pinpoint to communicate with APNs by using APNs tokens.
[$sel:tokenKeyId:APNSChannelRequest'] :: APNSChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>APNSChannelRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tokenKey:APNSChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSChannelRequest_tokenKey</a> - The authentication key to use for
--   APNs tokens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:privateKey:APNSChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSChannelRequest_privateKey</a> - The private key for the APNs
--   client certificate that you want Amazon Pinpoint to use to communicate
--   with APNs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:APNSChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSChannelRequest_enabled</a> - Specifies whether to enable the
--   APNs channel for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:teamId:APNSChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSChannelRequest_teamId</a> - The identifier that's assigned to
--   your Apple developer account team. This identifier is used for APNs
--   tokens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bundleId:APNSChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSChannelRequest_bundleId</a> - The bundle identifier that's
--   assigned to your iOS app. This identifier is used for APNs tokens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultAuthenticationMethod:APNSChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSChannelRequest_defaultAuthenticationMethod</a> - The default
--   authentication method that you want Amazon Pinpoint to use when
--   authenticating with APNs, key or certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificate:APNSChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSChannelRequest_certificate</a> - The APNs client certificate
--   that you received from Apple, if you want Amazon Pinpoint to
--   communicate with APNs by using an APNs certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tokenKeyId:APNSChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSChannelRequest_tokenKeyId</a> - The key identifier that's
--   assigned to your APNs signing key, if you want Amazon Pinpoint to
--   communicate with APNs by using APNs tokens.
newAPNSChannelRequest :: APNSChannelRequest

-- | The authentication key to use for APNs tokens.
aPNSChannelRequest_tokenKey :: Lens' APNSChannelRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The private key for the APNs client certificate that you want Amazon
--   Pinpoint to use to communicate with APNs.
aPNSChannelRequest_privateKey :: Lens' APNSChannelRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether to enable the APNs channel for the application.
aPNSChannelRequest_enabled :: Lens' APNSChannelRequest (Maybe Bool)

-- | The identifier that's assigned to your Apple developer account team.
--   This identifier is used for APNs tokens.
aPNSChannelRequest_teamId :: Lens' APNSChannelRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The bundle identifier that's assigned to your iOS app. This identifier
--   is used for APNs tokens.
aPNSChannelRequest_bundleId :: Lens' APNSChannelRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The default authentication method that you want Amazon Pinpoint to use
--   when authenticating with APNs, key or certificate.
aPNSChannelRequest_defaultAuthenticationMethod :: Lens' APNSChannelRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The APNs client certificate that you received from Apple, if you want
--   Amazon Pinpoint to communicate with APNs by using an APNs certificate.
aPNSChannelRequest_certificate :: Lens' APNSChannelRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The key identifier that's assigned to your APNs signing key, if you
--   want Amazon Pinpoint to communicate with APNs by using APNs tokens.
aPNSChannelRequest_tokenKeyId :: Lens' APNSChannelRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of the APNs (Apple
--   Push Notification service) channel for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAPNSChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data APNSChannelResponse
APNSChannelResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> APNSChannelResponse

-- | The date and time when the APNs channel was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:APNSChannelResponse'] :: APNSChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the APNs channel is enabled for the application.
[$sel:enabled:APNSChannelResponse'] :: APNSChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether the APNs channel is configured to communicate with
--   APNs by using APNs tokens. To provide an authentication key for APNs
--   tokens, set the TokenKey property of the channel.
[$sel:hasTokenKey:APNSChannelResponse'] :: APNSChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The default authentication method that Amazon Pinpoint uses to
--   authenticate with APNs for this channel, key or certificate.
[$sel:defaultAuthenticationMethod:APNSChannelResponse'] :: APNSChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the APNs channel is archived.
[$sel:isArchived:APNSChannelResponse'] :: APNSChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the APNs channel
--   applies to.
[$sel:applicationId:APNSChannelResponse'] :: APNSChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The current version of the APNs channel.
[$sel:version:APNSChannelResponse'] :: APNSChannelResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the APNs channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:id:APNSChannelResponse'] :: APNSChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time when the APNs channel was enabled.
[$sel:creationDate:APNSChannelResponse'] :: APNSChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The user who last modified the APNs channel.
[$sel:lastModifiedBy:APNSChannelResponse'] :: APNSChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:hasCredential:APNSChannelResponse'] :: APNSChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For
--   the APNs channel, this value is APNS.
[$sel:platform:APNSChannelResponse'] :: APNSChannelResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>APNSChannelResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:APNSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSChannelResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date and time when
--   the APNs channel was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:APNSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSChannelResponse_enabled</a> - Specifies whether the APNs
--   channel is enabled for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasTokenKey:APNSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSChannelResponse_hasTokenKey</a> - Specifies whether the APNs
--   channel is configured to communicate with APNs by using APNs tokens.
--   To provide an authentication key for APNs tokens, set the TokenKey
--   property of the channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultAuthenticationMethod:APNSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSChannelResponse_defaultAuthenticationMethod</a> - The default
--   authentication method that Amazon Pinpoint uses to authenticate with
--   APNs for this channel, key or certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isArchived:APNSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSChannelResponse_isArchived</a> - Specifies whether the APNs
--   channel is archived.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:APNSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSChannelResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the application that the APNs channel applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:APNSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSChannelResponse_version</a> - The current version of the APNs
--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:APNSChannelResponse'</a>, <a>aPNSChannelResponse_id</a> -
--   (Deprecated) An identifier for the APNs channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:APNSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSChannelResponse_creationDate</a> - The date and time when the
--   APNs channel was enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedBy:APNSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSChannelResponse_lastModifiedBy</a> - The user who last modified
--   the APNs channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasCredential:APNSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSChannelResponse_hasCredential</a> - (Not used) This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:APNSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSChannelResponse_platform</a> - The type of messaging or
--   notification platform for the channel. For the APNs channel, this
--   value is APNS.
newAPNSChannelResponse :: Text -> APNSChannelResponse

-- | The date and time when the APNs channel was last modified.
aPNSChannelResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' APNSChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the APNs channel is enabled for the application.
aPNSChannelResponse_enabled :: Lens' APNSChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether the APNs channel is configured to communicate with
--   APNs by using APNs tokens. To provide an authentication key for APNs
--   tokens, set the TokenKey property of the channel.
aPNSChannelResponse_hasTokenKey :: Lens' APNSChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The default authentication method that Amazon Pinpoint uses to
--   authenticate with APNs for this channel, key or certificate.
aPNSChannelResponse_defaultAuthenticationMethod :: Lens' APNSChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the APNs channel is archived.
aPNSChannelResponse_isArchived :: Lens' APNSChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the APNs channel
--   applies to.
aPNSChannelResponse_applicationId :: Lens' APNSChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The current version of the APNs channel.
aPNSChannelResponse_version :: Lens' APNSChannelResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the APNs channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
aPNSChannelResponse_id :: Lens' APNSChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when the APNs channel was enabled.
aPNSChannelResponse_creationDate :: Lens' APNSChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The user who last modified the APNs channel.
aPNSChannelResponse_lastModifiedBy :: Lens' APNSChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
aPNSChannelResponse_hasCredential :: Lens' APNSChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For
--   the APNs channel, this value is APNS.
aPNSChannelResponse_platform :: Lens' APNSChannelResponse Text

-- | Specifies the settings for a one-time message that's sent directly to
--   an endpoint through the APNs (Apple Push Notification service)
--   channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAPNSMessage</a> smart constructor.
data APNSMessage
APNSMessage' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> APNSMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the notification message. You
--   can override these default variables with individual address
--   variables.
[$sel:substitutions:APNSMessage'] :: APNSMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification. A
--   silent (or background) push notification isn't displayed on
--   recipients' devices. You can use silent push notifications to make
--   small updates to your app, or to display messages in an in-app message
--   center.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint uses this property to determine the correct value for
--   the apns-push-type request header when it sends the notification
--   message to APNs. If you specify a value of true for this property,
--   Amazon Pinpoint sets the value for the apns-push-type header field to
--   background.
--   
--   If you specify the raw content of an APNs push notification, the
--   message payload has to include the content-available key. For silent
--   (background) notifications, set the value of content-available to 1.
--   Additionally, the message payload for a silent notification can't
--   include the alert, badge, or sound keys. For more information, see
--   <a>Generating a Remote Notification</a> and <a>Pushing Background
--   Updates to Your App</a> on the Apple Developer website.
--   
--   Apple has indicated that they will throttle "excessive" background
--   notifications based on current traffic volumes. To prevent your
--   notifications being throttled, Apple recommends that you send no more
--   than 3 silent push notifications to each recipient per hour.
[$sel:silentPush:APNSMessage'] :: APNSMessage -> Maybe Bool

-- | The type of push notification to send. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>alert - For a standard notification that's displayed on
--   recipients' devices and prompts a recipient to interact with the
--   notification.</li>
--   <li>background - For a silent notification that delivers content in
--   the background and isn't displayed on recipients' devices.</li>
--   <li>complication - For a notification that contains update information
--   for an app’s complication timeline.</li>
--   <li>fileprovider - For a notification that signals changes to a File
--   Provider extension.</li>
--   <li>mdm - For a notification that tells managed devices to contact the
--   MDM server.</li>
--   <li>voip - For a notification that provides information about an
--   incoming VoIP call.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-push-type request
--   header when it sends the notification message to APNs. If you don't
--   specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint sets the value to
--   alert or background automatically, based on the value that you specify
--   for the SilentPush or RawContent property of the message.
--   
--   For more information about the apns-push-type request header, see
--   <a>Sending Notification Requests to APNs</a> on the Apple Developer
--   website.
[$sel:aPNSPushType:APNSMessage'] :: APNSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | para&gt;5 - Low priority, the notification might be delayed, delivered
--   as part of a group, or throttled.
--   
--   /listitem&gt;
--   
--   10 - High priority, the notification is sent immediately. This is the
--   default value. A high priority notification should trigger an alert,
--   play a sound, or badge your app's icon on the recipient's device.
--   
--   /para&gt;
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-priority request
--   header when it sends the notification message to APNs.
--   
--   The equivalent values for Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly
--   Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), are normal, for 5, and high, for 10. If
--   you specify an FCM value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint accepts
--   and converts the value to the corresponding APNs value.
[$sel:priority:APNSMessage'] :: APNSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the
--   notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other
--   content for the message.
--   
--   If you specify the raw content of an APNs push notification, the
--   message payload has to include the content-available key. The value of
--   the content-available key has to be an integer, and can only be 0 or
--   1. If you're sending a standard notification, set the value of
--   content-available to 0. If you're sending a silent (background)
--   notification, set the value of content-available to 1. Additionally,
--   silent notification payloads can't include the alert, badge, or sound
--   keys. For more information, see <a>Generating a Remote
--   Notification</a> and <a>Pushing Background Updates to Your App</a> on
--   the Apple Developer website.
[$sel:rawContent:APNSMessage'] :: APNSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The JSON payload to use for a silent push notification. This payload
--   is added to the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.
[$sel:data':APNSMessage'] :: APNSMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The body of the notification message.
[$sel:body:APNSMessage'] :: APNSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The key that indicates the notification type for the push
--   notification. This key is a value that's defined by the identifier
--   property of one of your app's registered categories.
[$sel:category:APNSMessage'] :: APNSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, that APNs should store and attempt to
--   deliver the push notification, if the service is unable to deliver the
--   notification the first time. If this value is 0, APNs treats the
--   notification as if it expires immediately and the service doesn't
--   store or try to deliver the notification again.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-expiration request
--   header when it sends the notification message to APNs.
[$sel:timeToLive:APNSMessage'] :: APNSMessage -> Maybe Int

-- | The URL to open in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action
--   property is URL.
[$sel:url:APNSMessage'] :: APNSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The key for the sound to play when the recipient receives the push
--   notification. The value for this key is the name of a sound file in
--   your app's main bundle or the Library/Sounds folder in your app's data
--   container. If the sound file can't be found or you specify default for
--   the value, the system plays the default alert sound.
[$sel:sound:APNSMessage'] :: APNSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The action to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   the iOS platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:action:APNSMessage'] :: APNSMessage -> Maybe Action

-- | The URL of an image or video to display in the push notification.
[$sel:mediaUrl:APNSMessage'] :: APNSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The authentication method that you want Amazon Pinpoint to use when
--   authenticating with APNs, CERTIFICATE or TOKEN.
[$sel:preferredAuthenticationMethod:APNSMessage'] :: APNSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The key that indicates whether and how to modify the badge of your
--   app's icon when the recipient receives the push notification. If this
--   key isn't included in the dictionary, the badge doesn't change. To
--   remove the badge, set this value to 0.
[$sel:badge:APNSMessage'] :: APNSMessage -> Maybe Int

-- | The title to display above the notification message on the recipient's
--   device.
[$sel:title:APNSMessage'] :: APNSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The key that represents your app-specific identifier for grouping
--   notifications. If you provide a Notification Content app extension,
--   you can use this value to group your notifications together.
[$sel:threadId:APNSMessage'] :: APNSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | An arbitrary identifier that, if assigned to multiple messages, APNs
--   uses to coalesce the messages into a single push notification instead
--   of delivering each message individually. This value can't exceed 64
--   bytes.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-collapse-id request
--   header when it sends the notification message to APNs.
[$sel:collapseId:APNSMessage'] :: APNSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>APNSMessage</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:APNSMessage'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSMessage_substitutions</a> - The default message variables to
--   use in the notification message. You can override these default
--   variables with individual address variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:silentPush:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_silentPush</a> -
--   Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification. A
--   silent (or background) push notification isn't displayed on
--   recipients' devices. You can use silent push notifications to make
--   small updates to your app, or to display messages in an in-app message
--   center.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint uses this property to determine the correct value for
--   the apns-push-type request header when it sends the notification
--   message to APNs. If you specify a value of true for this property,
--   Amazon Pinpoint sets the value for the apns-push-type header field to
--   background.
--   
--   If you specify the raw content of an APNs push notification, the
--   message payload has to include the content-available key. For silent
--   (background) notifications, set the value of content-available to 1.
--   Additionally, the message payload for a silent notification can't
--   include the alert, badge, or sound keys. For more information, see
--   <a>Generating a Remote Notification</a> and <a>Pushing Background
--   Updates to Your App</a> on the Apple Developer website.
--   
--   Apple has indicated that they will throttle "excessive" background
--   notifications based on current traffic volumes. To prevent your
--   notifications being throttled, Apple recommends that you send no more
--   than 3 silent push notifications to each recipient per hour.
--   
--   <a>$sel:aPNSPushType:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_aPNSPushType</a>
--   - The type of push notification to send. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>alert - For a standard notification that's displayed on
--   recipients' devices and prompts a recipient to interact with the
--   notification.</li>
--   <li>background - For a silent notification that delivers content in
--   the background and isn't displayed on recipients' devices.</li>
--   <li>complication - For a notification that contains update information
--   for an app’s complication timeline.</li>
--   <li>fileprovider - For a notification that signals changes to a File
--   Provider extension.</li>
--   <li>mdm - For a notification that tells managed devices to contact the
--   MDM server.</li>
--   <li>voip - For a notification that provides information about an
--   incoming VoIP call.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-push-type request
--   header when it sends the notification message to APNs. If you don't
--   specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint sets the value to
--   alert or background automatically, based on the value that you specify
--   for the SilentPush or RawContent property of the message.
--   
--   For more information about the apns-push-type request header, see
--   <a>Sending Notification Requests to APNs</a> on the Apple Developer
--   website.
--   
--   <a>$sel:priority:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_priority</a> -
--   para&gt;5 - Low priority, the notification might be delayed, delivered
--   as part of a group, or throttled.
--   
--   /listitem&gt;
--   
--   10 - High priority, the notification is sent immediately. This is the
--   default value. A high priority notification should trigger an alert,
--   play a sound, or badge your app's icon on the recipient's device.
--   
--   /para&gt;
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-priority request
--   header when it sends the notification message to APNs.
--   
--   The equivalent values for Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly
--   Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), are normal, for 5, and high, for 10. If
--   you specify an FCM value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint accepts
--   and converts the value to the corresponding APNs value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawContent:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_rawContent</a> -
--   The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the
--   notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other
--   content for the message.
--   
--   If you specify the raw content of an APNs push notification, the
--   message payload has to include the content-available key. The value of
--   the content-available key has to be an integer, and can only be 0 or
--   1. If you're sending a standard notification, set the value of
--   content-available to 0. If you're sending a silent (background)
--   notification, set the value of content-available to 1. Additionally,
--   silent notification payloads can't include the alert, badge, or sound
--   keys. For more information, see <a>Generating a Remote
--   Notification</a> and <a>Pushing Background Updates to Your App</a> on
--   the Apple Developer website.
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_data</a> - The JSON
--   payload to use for a silent push notification. This payload is added
--   to the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_body</a> - The body of
--   the notification message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:category:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_category</a> - The
--   key that indicates the notification type for the push notification.
--   This key is a value that's defined by the identifier property of one
--   of your app's registered categories.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeToLive:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_timeToLive</a> -
--   The amount of time, in seconds, that APNs should store and attempt to
--   deliver the push notification, if the service is unable to deliver the
--   notification the first time. If this value is 0, APNs treats the
--   notification as if it expires immediately and the service doesn't
--   store or try to deliver the notification again.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-expiration request
--   header when it sends the notification message to APNs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_url</a> - The URL to open
--   in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the
--   push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sound:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_sound</a> - The key for
--   the sound to play when the recipient receives the push notification.
--   The value for this key is the name of a sound file in your app's main
--   bundle or the Library/Sounds folder in your app's data container. If
--   the sound file can't be found or you specify default for the value,
--   the system plays the default alert sound.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_action</a> - The
--   action to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   the iOS platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaUrl:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_mediaUrl</a> - The
--   URL of an image or video to display in the push notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:preferredAuthenticationMethod:APNSMessage'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSMessage_preferredAuthenticationMethod</a> - The authentication
--   method that you want Amazon Pinpoint to use when authenticating with
--   APNs, CERTIFICATE or TOKEN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:badge:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_badge</a> - The key
--   that indicates whether and how to modify the badge of your app's icon
--   when the recipient receives the push notification. If this key isn't
--   included in the dictionary, the badge doesn't change. To remove the
--   badge, set this value to 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_title</a> - The title
--   to display above the notification message on the recipient's device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:threadId:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_threadId</a> - The
--   key that represents your app-specific identifier for grouping
--   notifications. If you provide a Notification Content app extension,
--   you can use this value to group your notifications together.
--   
--   <a>$sel:collapseId:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_collapseId</a> -
--   An arbitrary identifier that, if assigned to multiple messages, APNs
--   uses to coalesce the messages into a single push notification instead
--   of delivering each message individually. This value can't exceed 64
--   bytes.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-collapse-id request
--   header when it sends the notification message to APNs.
newAPNSMessage :: APNSMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the notification message. You
--   can override these default variables with individual address
--   variables.
aPNSMessage_substitutions :: Lens' APNSMessage (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification. A
--   silent (or background) push notification isn't displayed on
--   recipients' devices. You can use silent push notifications to make
--   small updates to your app, or to display messages in an in-app message
--   center.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint uses this property to determine the correct value for
--   the apns-push-type request header when it sends the notification
--   message to APNs. If you specify a value of true for this property,
--   Amazon Pinpoint sets the value for the apns-push-type header field to
--   background.
--   
--   If you specify the raw content of an APNs push notification, the
--   message payload has to include the content-available key. For silent
--   (background) notifications, set the value of content-available to 1.
--   Additionally, the message payload for a silent notification can't
--   include the alert, badge, or sound keys. For more information, see
--   <a>Generating a Remote Notification</a> and <a>Pushing Background
--   Updates to Your App</a> on the Apple Developer website.
--   
--   Apple has indicated that they will throttle "excessive" background
--   notifications based on current traffic volumes. To prevent your
--   notifications being throttled, Apple recommends that you send no more
--   than 3 silent push notifications to each recipient per hour.
aPNSMessage_silentPush :: Lens' APNSMessage (Maybe Bool)

-- | The type of push notification to send. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>alert - For a standard notification that's displayed on
--   recipients' devices and prompts a recipient to interact with the
--   notification.</li>
--   <li>background - For a silent notification that delivers content in
--   the background and isn't displayed on recipients' devices.</li>
--   <li>complication - For a notification that contains update information
--   for an app’s complication timeline.</li>
--   <li>fileprovider - For a notification that signals changes to a File
--   Provider extension.</li>
--   <li>mdm - For a notification that tells managed devices to contact the
--   MDM server.</li>
--   <li>voip - For a notification that provides information about an
--   incoming VoIP call.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-push-type request
--   header when it sends the notification message to APNs. If you don't
--   specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint sets the value to
--   alert or background automatically, based on the value that you specify
--   for the SilentPush or RawContent property of the message.
--   
--   For more information about the apns-push-type request header, see
--   <a>Sending Notification Requests to APNs</a> on the Apple Developer
--   website.
aPNSMessage_aPNSPushType :: Lens' APNSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | para&gt;5 - Low priority, the notification might be delayed, delivered
--   as part of a group, or throttled.
--   
--   /listitem&gt;
--   
--   10 - High priority, the notification is sent immediately. This is the
--   default value. A high priority notification should trigger an alert,
--   play a sound, or badge your app's icon on the recipient's device.
--   
--   /para&gt;
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-priority request
--   header when it sends the notification message to APNs.
--   
--   The equivalent values for Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly
--   Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), are normal, for 5, and high, for 10. If
--   you specify an FCM value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint accepts
--   and converts the value to the corresponding APNs value.
aPNSMessage_priority :: Lens' APNSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the
--   notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other
--   content for the message.
--   
--   If you specify the raw content of an APNs push notification, the
--   message payload has to include the content-available key. The value of
--   the content-available key has to be an integer, and can only be 0 or
--   1. If you're sending a standard notification, set the value of
--   content-available to 0. If you're sending a silent (background)
--   notification, set the value of content-available to 1. Additionally,
--   silent notification payloads can't include the alert, badge, or sound
--   keys. For more information, see <a>Generating a Remote
--   Notification</a> and <a>Pushing Background Updates to Your App</a> on
--   the Apple Developer website.
aPNSMessage_rawContent :: Lens' APNSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The JSON payload to use for a silent push notification. This payload
--   is added to the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.
aPNSMessage_data :: Lens' APNSMessage (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The body of the notification message.
aPNSMessage_body :: Lens' APNSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The key that indicates the notification type for the push
--   notification. This key is a value that's defined by the identifier
--   property of one of your app's registered categories.
aPNSMessage_category :: Lens' APNSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, that APNs should store and attempt to
--   deliver the push notification, if the service is unable to deliver the
--   notification the first time. If this value is 0, APNs treats the
--   notification as if it expires immediately and the service doesn't
--   store or try to deliver the notification again.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-expiration request
--   header when it sends the notification message to APNs.
aPNSMessage_timeToLive :: Lens' APNSMessage (Maybe Int)

-- | The URL to open in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action
--   property is URL.
aPNSMessage_url :: Lens' APNSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The key for the sound to play when the recipient receives the push
--   notification. The value for this key is the name of a sound file in
--   your app's main bundle or the Library/Sounds folder in your app's data
--   container. If the sound file can't be found or you specify default for
--   the value, the system plays the default alert sound.
aPNSMessage_sound :: Lens' APNSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The action to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   the iOS platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
aPNSMessage_action :: Lens' APNSMessage (Maybe Action)

-- | The URL of an image or video to display in the push notification.
aPNSMessage_mediaUrl :: Lens' APNSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The authentication method that you want Amazon Pinpoint to use when
--   authenticating with APNs, CERTIFICATE or TOKEN.
aPNSMessage_preferredAuthenticationMethod :: Lens' APNSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The key that indicates whether and how to modify the badge of your
--   app's icon when the recipient receives the push notification. If this
--   key isn't included in the dictionary, the badge doesn't change. To
--   remove the badge, set this value to 0.
aPNSMessage_badge :: Lens' APNSMessage (Maybe Int)

-- | The title to display above the notification message on the recipient's
--   device.
aPNSMessage_title :: Lens' APNSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The key that represents your app-specific identifier for grouping
--   notifications. If you provide a Notification Content app extension,
--   you can use this value to group your notifications together.
aPNSMessage_threadId :: Lens' APNSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | An arbitrary identifier that, if assigned to multiple messages, APNs
--   uses to coalesce the messages into a single push notification instead
--   of delivering each message individually. This value can't exceed 64
--   bytes.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-collapse-id request
--   header when it sends the notification message to APNs.
aPNSMessage_collapseId :: Lens' APNSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies channel-specific content and settings for a message template
--   that can be used in push notifications that are sent through the APNs
--   (Apple Push Notification service) channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAPNSPushNotificationTemplate</a> smart constructor.
data APNSPushNotificationTemplate
APNSPushNotificationTemplate' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> APNSPushNotificationTemplate

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for push
--   notifications that are based on the message template. If specified,
--   this value overrides all other content for the message template.
[$sel:rawContent:APNSPushNotificationTemplate'] :: APNSPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The message body to use in push notifications that are based on the
--   message template.
[$sel:body:APNSPushNotificationTemplate'] :: APNSPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL to open in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message
--   template and the value of the Action property is URL.
[$sel:url:APNSPushNotificationTemplate'] :: APNSPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The key for the sound to play when the recipient receives a push
--   notification that's based on the message template. The value for this
--   key is the name of a sound file in your app's main bundle or the
--   Library/Sounds folder in your app's data container. If the sound file
--   can't be found or you specify default for the value, the system plays
--   the default alert sound.
[$sel:sound:APNSPushNotificationTemplate'] :: APNSPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The action to occur if a recipient taps a push notification that's
--   based on the message template. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   the iOS platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:action:APNSPushNotificationTemplate'] :: APNSPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Action

-- | The URL of an image or video to display in push notifications that are
--   based on the message template.
[$sel:mediaUrl:APNSPushNotificationTemplate'] :: APNSPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The title to use in push notifications that are based on the message
--   template. This title appears above the notification message on a
--   recipient's device.
[$sel:title:APNSPushNotificationTemplate'] :: APNSPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>APNSPushNotificationTemplate</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   that are based on the message template. If specified, this value
--   overrides all other content for the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:APNSPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,

--   push notifications that are based on the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:APNSPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,

--   Action property is URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sound:APNSPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSPushNotificationTemplate_sound</a> - The key for the sound to
--   play when the recipient receives a push notification that's based on
--   the message template. The value for this key is the name of a sound
--   file in your app's main bundle or the Library/Sounds folder in your

--   default for the value, the system plays the default alert sound.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:APNSPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSPushNotificationTemplate_action</a> - The action to occur if a
--   recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message
--   template. Valid values are:

--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>

--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of

--   template.

--   notifications that are based on the message template. This title
--   appears above the notification message on a recipient's device.
newAPNSPushNotificationTemplate :: APNSPushNotificationTemplate

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for push
--   notifications that are based on the message template. If specified,
--   this value overrides all other content for the message template.
aPNSPushNotificationTemplate_rawContent :: Lens' APNSPushNotificationTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The message body to use in push notifications that are based on the
--   message template.
aPNSPushNotificationTemplate_body :: Lens' APNSPushNotificationTemplate (Maybe Text)

--   recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message
--   template and the value of the Action property is URL.
aPNSPushNotificationTemplate_url :: Lens' APNSPushNotificationTemplate (Maybe Text)

--   notification that's based on the message template. The value for this
--   key is the name of a sound file in your app's main bundle or the
--   Library/Sounds folder in your app's data container. If the sound file
--   can't be found or you specify default for the value, the system plays
--   the default alert sound.
aPNSPushNotificationTemplate_sound :: Lens' APNSPushNotificationTemplate (Maybe Text)
