aPNSPushNotificationTemplate_title :: Lens' APNSPushNotificationTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the status and settings of the APNs (Apple Push Notification
--   service) sandbox channel for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAPNSSandboxChannelRequest</a> smart constructor.
data APNSSandboxChannelRequest
APNSSandboxChannelRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> APNSSandboxChannelRequest

-- | The authentication key to use for APNs tokens.
[$sel:tokenKey:APNSSandboxChannelRequest'] :: APNSSandboxChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The private key for the APNs client certificate that you want Amazon
--   Pinpoint to use to communicate with the APNs sandbox environment.
[$sel:privateKey:APNSSandboxChannelRequest'] :: APNSSandboxChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether to enable the APNs sandbox channel for the
--   application.
[$sel:enabled:APNSSandboxChannelRequest'] :: APNSSandboxChannelRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | The identifier that's assigned to your Apple developer account team.
--   This identifier is used for APNs tokens.
[$sel:teamId:APNSSandboxChannelRequest'] :: APNSSandboxChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The bundle identifier that's assigned to your iOS app. This identifier
--   is used for APNs tokens.
[$sel:bundleId:APNSSandboxChannelRequest'] :: APNSSandboxChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The default authentication method that you want Amazon Pinpoint to use
--   when authenticating with the APNs sandbox environment, key or
--   certificate.
[$sel:defaultAuthenticationMethod:APNSSandboxChannelRequest'] :: APNSSandboxChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The APNs client certificate that you received from Apple, if you want
--   Amazon Pinpoint to communicate with the APNs sandbox environment by
--   using an APNs certificate.
[$sel:certificate:APNSSandboxChannelRequest'] :: APNSSandboxChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The key identifier that's assigned to your APNs signing key, if you
--   want Amazon Pinpoint to communicate with the APNs sandbox environment
--   by using APNs tokens.
[$sel:tokenKeyId:APNSSandboxChannelRequest'] :: APNSSandboxChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>APNSSandboxChannelRequest</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tokenKey:APNSSandboxChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelRequest_tokenKey</a> - The authentication key to
--   use for APNs tokens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:privateKey:APNSSandboxChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelRequest_privateKey</a> - The private key for the
--   APNs client certificate that you want Amazon Pinpoint to use to
--   communicate with the APNs sandbox environment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:APNSSandboxChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelRequest_enabled</a> - Specifies whether to enable
--   the APNs sandbox channel for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:teamId:APNSSandboxChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelRequest_teamId</a> - The identifier that's
--   assigned to your Apple developer account team. This identifier is used
--   for APNs tokens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bundleId:APNSSandboxChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelRequest_bundleId</a> - The bundle identifier
--   that's assigned to your iOS app. This identifier is used for APNs
--   tokens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultAuthenticationMethod:APNSSandboxChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelRequest_defaultAuthenticationMethod</a> - The
--   default authentication method that you want Amazon Pinpoint to use
--   when authenticating with the APNs sandbox environment, key or
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificate:APNSSandboxChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelRequest_certificate</a> - The APNs client
--   certificate that you received from Apple, if you want Amazon Pinpoint
--   to communicate with the APNs sandbox environment by using an APNs
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tokenKeyId:APNSSandboxChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelRequest_tokenKeyId</a> - The key identifier
--   that's assigned to your APNs signing key, if you want Amazon Pinpoint
--   to communicate with the APNs sandbox environment by using APNs tokens.
newAPNSSandboxChannelRequest :: APNSSandboxChannelRequest

-- | The authentication key to use for APNs tokens.
aPNSSandboxChannelRequest_tokenKey :: Lens' APNSSandboxChannelRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The private key for the APNs client certificate that you want Amazon
--   Pinpoint to use to communicate with the APNs sandbox environment.
aPNSSandboxChannelRequest_privateKey :: Lens' APNSSandboxChannelRequest (Maybe Text)

--   application.
aPNSSandboxChannelRequest_enabled :: Lens' APNSSandboxChannelRequest (Maybe Bool)

-- | The identifier that's assigned to your Apple developer account team.
--   This identifier is used for APNs tokens.
aPNSSandboxChannelRequest_teamId :: Lens' APNSSandboxChannelRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The bundle identifier that's assigned to your iOS app. This identifier
--   is used for APNs tokens.
aPNSSandboxChannelRequest_bundleId :: Lens' APNSSandboxChannelRequest (Maybe Text)

--   when authenticating with the APNs sandbox environment, key or
--   certificate.
aPNSSandboxChannelRequest_defaultAuthenticationMethod :: Lens' APNSSandboxChannelRequest (Maybe Text)

--   Amazon Pinpoint to communicate with the APNs sandbox environment by
--   using an APNs certificate.
aPNSSandboxChannelRequest_certificate :: Lens' APNSSandboxChannelRequest (Maybe Text)

--   want Amazon Pinpoint to communicate with the APNs sandbox environment
--   by using APNs tokens.
aPNSSandboxChannelRequest_tokenKeyId :: Lens' APNSSandboxChannelRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of the APNs (Apple
--   Push Notification service) sandbox channel for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAPNSSandboxChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data APNSSandboxChannelResponse
APNSSandboxChannelResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> APNSSandboxChannelResponse

-- | The date and time when the APNs sandbox channel was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'] :: APNSSandboxChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the APNs sandbox channel is enabled for the
--   application.
[$sel:enabled:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'] :: APNSSandboxChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether the APNs sandbox channel is configured to
--   communicate with APNs by using APNs tokens. To provide an
--   authentication key for APNs tokens, set the TokenKey property of the
--   channel.
[$sel:hasTokenKey:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'] :: APNSSandboxChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The default authentication method that Amazon Pinpoint uses to
--   authenticate with the APNs sandbox environment for this channel, key
--   or certificate.
[$sel:defaultAuthenticationMethod:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'] :: APNSSandboxChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the APNs sandbox channel is archived.
[$sel:isArchived:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'] :: APNSSandboxChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the APNs sandbox
--   channel applies to.
[$sel:applicationId:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'] :: APNSSandboxChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The current version of the APNs sandbox channel.
[$sel:version:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'] :: APNSSandboxChannelResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the APNs sandbox channel. This property
--   is retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:id:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'] :: APNSSandboxChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time when the APNs sandbox channel was enabled.
[$sel:creationDate:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'] :: APNSSandboxChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The user who last modified the APNs sandbox channel.
[$sel:lastModifiedBy:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'] :: APNSSandboxChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:hasCredential:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'] :: APNSSandboxChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For
--   the APNs sandbox channel, this value is APNS_SANDBOX.
[$sel:platform:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'] :: APNSSandboxChannelResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>APNSSandboxChannelResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date and time
--   when the APNs sandbox channel was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_enabled</a> - Specifies whether the APNs
--   sandbox channel is enabled for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasTokenKey:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_hasTokenKey</a> - Specifies whether the
--   APNs sandbox channel is configured to communicate with APNs by using
--   APNs tokens. To provide an authentication key for APNs tokens, set the
--   TokenKey property of the channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultAuthenticationMethod:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_defaultAuthenticationMethod</a> - The
--   default authentication method that Amazon Pinpoint uses to
--   authenticate with the APNs sandbox environment for this channel, key
--   or certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isArchived:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_isArchived</a> - Specifies whether the
--   APNs sandbox channel is archived.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the application that the APNs sandbox channel applies
--   to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_version</a> - The current version of the
--   APNs sandbox channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_id</a> - (Deprecated) An identifier for
--   the APNs sandbox channel. This property is retained only for backward
--   compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_creationDate</a> - The date and time
--   when the APNs sandbox channel was enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedBy:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_lastModifiedBy</a> - The user who last
--   modified the APNs sandbox channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasCredential:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_hasCredential</a> - (Not used) This
--   property is retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_platform</a> - The type of messaging or
--   notification platform for the channel. For the APNs sandbox channel,
--   this value is APNS_SANDBOX.
newAPNSSandboxChannelResponse :: Text -> APNSSandboxChannelResponse

-- | The date and time when the APNs sandbox channel was last modified.
aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' APNSSandboxChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the APNs sandbox channel is enabled for the
--   application.
aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_enabled :: Lens' APNSSandboxChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether the APNs sandbox channel is configured to
--   communicate with APNs by using APNs tokens. To provide an
--   authentication key for APNs tokens, set the TokenKey property of the
--   channel.
aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_hasTokenKey :: Lens' APNSSandboxChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The default authentication method that Amazon Pinpoint uses to
--   authenticate with the APNs sandbox environment for this channel, key
--   or certificate.
aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_defaultAuthenticationMethod :: Lens' APNSSandboxChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the APNs sandbox channel is archived.
aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_isArchived :: Lens' APNSSandboxChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the APNs sandbox
--   channel applies to.
aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_applicationId :: Lens' APNSSandboxChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The current version of the APNs sandbox channel.
aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_version :: Lens' APNSSandboxChannelResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the APNs sandbox channel. This property
--   is retained only for backward compatibility.
aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_id :: Lens' APNSSandboxChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when the APNs sandbox channel was enabled.
aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_creationDate :: Lens' APNSSandboxChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The user who last modified the APNs sandbox channel.
aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_lastModifiedBy :: Lens' APNSSandboxChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_hasCredential :: Lens' APNSSandboxChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For
--   the APNs sandbox channel, this value is APNS_SANDBOX.
aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_platform :: Lens' APNSSandboxChannelResponse Text

--   Pinpoint to use to communicate with APNs.

--   This identifier is used for APNs tokens.

-- | The bundle identifier that's assigned to your iOS app. This identifier
--   is used for APNs tokens.
[$sel:bundleId:APNSVoipChannelRequest'] :: APNSVoipChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The default authentication method that you want Amazon Pinpoint to use
--   when authenticating with APNs, key or certificate.
[$sel:defaultAuthenticationMethod:APNSVoipChannelRequest'] :: APNSVoipChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The APNs client certificate that you received from Apple, if you want
--   Amazon Pinpoint to communicate with APNs by using an APNs certificate.
[$sel:certificate:APNSVoipChannelRequest'] :: APNSVoipChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The key identifier that's assigned to your APNs signing key, if you
--   want Amazon Pinpoint to communicate with APNs by using APNs tokens.

--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date and
--   time when the APNs VoIP sandbox channel was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_enabled</a> - Specifies whether the
--   APNs VoIP sandbox channel is enabled for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasTokenKey:APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_hasTokenKey</a> - Specifies whether
--   the APNs VoIP sandbox channel is configured to communicate with APNs
--   by using APNs tokens. To provide an authentication key for APNs
--   tokens, set the TokenKey property of the channel.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultAuthenticationMethod:APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_defaultAuthenticationMethod</a> -
--   The default authentication method that Amazon Pinpoint uses to
--   authenticate with the APNs sandbox environment for this channel, key
--   or certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isArchived:APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_isArchived</a> - Specifies whether
--   the APNs VoIP sandbox channel is archived.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the application that the APNs VoIP sandbox channel
--   applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_version</a> - The current version of
--   the APNs VoIP sandbox channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_id</a> - (Deprecated) An identifier
--   for the APNs VoIP sandbox channel. This property is retained only for
--   backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_creationDate</a> - The date and time
--   when the APNs VoIP sandbox channel was enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedBy:APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_lastModifiedBy</a> - The user who
--   last modified the APNs VoIP sandbox channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasCredential:APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_hasCredential</a> - (Not used) This
--   property is retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_platform</a> - The type of messaging
--   or notification platform for the channel. For the APNs VoIP sandbox
--   channel, this value is APNS_VOIP_SANDBOX.
newAPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse :: Text -> APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse

-- | The date and time when the APNs VoIP sandbox channel was last
--   modified.
aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the APNs VoIP sandbox channel is enabled for the
--   application.
aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_enabled :: Lens' APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether the APNs VoIP sandbox channel is configured to
--   communicate with APNs by using APNs tokens. To provide an
--   authentication key for APNs tokens, set the TokenKey property of the
--   channel.
aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_hasTokenKey :: Lens' APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The default authentication method that Amazon Pinpoint uses to
--   authenticate with the APNs sandbox environment for this channel, key
--   or certificate.
aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_defaultAuthenticationMethod :: Lens' APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the APNs VoIP sandbox channel is archived.
aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_isArchived :: Lens' APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the APNs VoIP sandbox
--   channel applies to.
aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_applicationId :: Lens' APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The current version of the APNs VoIP sandbox channel.
aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_version :: Lens' APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the APNs VoIP sandbox channel. This
--   property is retained only for backward compatibility.
aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_id :: Lens' APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when the APNs VoIP sandbox channel was enabled.
aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_creationDate :: Lens' APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The user who last modified the APNs VoIP sandbox channel.
aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_lastModifiedBy :: Lens' APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_hasCredential :: Lens' APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For
--   the APNs VoIP sandbox channel, this value is APNS_VOIP_SANDBOX.
aPNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse_platform :: Lens' APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse Text

-- | Provides information about the activities that were performed by a
--   campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newActivitiesResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ActivitiesResponse
ActivitiesResponse' :: Maybe Text -> [ActivityResponse] -> ActivitiesResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
[$sel:nextToken:ActivitiesResponse'] :: ActivitiesResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of responses, one for each activity that was performed by the
--   campaign.
[$sel:item:ActivitiesResponse'] :: ActivitiesResponse -> [ActivityResponse]

-- | Create a value of <a>ActivitiesResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ActivitiesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activitiesResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use in a
--   subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated
--   response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:ActivitiesResponse'</a>, <a>activitiesResponse_item</a> -
--   An array of responses, one for each activity that was performed by the
--   campaign.
newActivitiesResponse :: ActivitiesResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
activitiesResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ActivitiesResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of responses, one for each activity that was performed by the
--   campaign.
activitiesResponse_item :: Lens' ActivitiesResponse [ActivityResponse]

-- | Specifies the configuration and other settings for an activity in a
--   journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newActivity</a> smart constructor.
data Activity
Activity' :: Maybe ConditionalSplitActivity -> Maybe EmailMessageActivity -> Maybe MultiConditionalSplitActivity -> Maybe ContactCenterActivity -> Maybe CustomMessageActivity -> Maybe WaitActivity -> Maybe RandomSplitActivity -> Maybe HoldoutActivity -> Maybe SMSMessageActivity -> Maybe PushMessageActivity -> Maybe Text -> Activity

-- | The settings for a yes/no split activity. This type of activity sends
--   participants down one of two paths in a journey, based on conditions
--   that you specify.
[$sel:conditionalSplit:Activity'] :: Activity -> Maybe ConditionalSplitActivity

-- | The settings for an email activity. This type of activity sends an
--   email message to participants.
[$sel:email:Activity'] :: Activity -> Maybe EmailMessageActivity

-- | The settings for a multivariate split activity. This type of activity
--   sends participants down one of as many as five paths (including a
--   default <i>Else</i> path) in a journey, based on conditions that you
--   specify.
[$sel:multiCondition:Activity'] :: Activity -> Maybe MultiConditionalSplitActivity

-- | The settings for a connect activity. This type of activity initiates a
--   contact center call to participants.
[$sel:contactCenter:Activity'] :: Activity -> Maybe ContactCenterActivity

-- | The settings for a custom message activity. This type of activity
--   calls an AWS Lambda function or web hook that sends messages to
--   participants.
[$sel:custom:Activity'] :: Activity -> Maybe CustomMessageActivity

-- | The settings for a wait activity. This type of activity waits for a
--   certain amount of time or until a specific date and time before moving
--   participants to the next activity in a journey.
[$sel:wait:Activity'] :: Activity -> Maybe WaitActivity

-- | The settings for a random split activity. This type of activity
--   randomly sends specified percentages of participants down one of as
--   many as five paths in a journey, based on conditions that you specify.
[$sel:randomSplit:Activity'] :: Activity -> Maybe RandomSplitActivity

-- | The settings for a holdout activity. This type of activity stops a
--   journey for a specified percentage of participants.
[$sel:holdout:Activity'] :: Activity -> Maybe HoldoutActivity

-- | The settings for an SMS activity. This type of activity sends a text
--   message to participants.
[$sel:sms:Activity'] :: Activity -> Maybe SMSMessageActivity

-- | The settings for a push notification activity. This type of activity
--   sends a push notification to participants.
[$sel:push:Activity'] :: Activity -> Maybe PushMessageActivity

-- | The custom description of the activity.
[$sel:description:Activity'] :: Activity -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Activity</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:conditionalSplit:Activity'</a>,
--   <a>activity_conditionalSplit</a> - The settings for a yes/no split
--   activity. This type of activity sends participants down one of two
--   paths in a journey, based on conditions that you specify.
--   
--   <a>$sel:email:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_email</a> - The settings for
--   an email activity. This type of activity sends an email message to
--   participants.
--   
--   <a>$sel:multiCondition:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_multiCondition</a> -
--   The settings for a multivariate split activity. This type of activity
--   sends participants down one of as many as five paths (including a
--   default <i>Else</i> path) in a journey, based on conditions that you
--   specify.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactCenter:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_contactCenter</a> -
--   The settings for a connect activity. This type of activity initiates a
--   contact center call to participants.
--   
--   <a>$sel:custom:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_custom</a> - The settings
--   for a custom message activity. This type of activity calls an AWS
--   Lambda function or web hook that sends messages to participants.
--   
--   <a>$sel:wait:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_wait</a> - The settings for a
--   wait activity. This type of activity waits for a certain amount of
--   time or until a specific date and time before moving participants to
--   the next activity in a journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:randomSplit:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_randomSplit</a> - The
--   settings for a random split activity. This type of activity randomly
--   sends specified percentages of participants down one of as many as
--   five paths in a journey, based on conditions that you specify.
--   
--   <a>$sel:holdout:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_holdout</a> - The settings
--   for a holdout activity. This type of activity stops a journey for a
--   specified percentage of participants.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sms:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_sms</a> - The settings for an
--   SMS activity. This type of activity sends a text message to
--   participants.
--   
--   <a>$sel:push:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_push</a> - The settings for a
--   push notification activity. This type of activity sends a push
--   notification to participants.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_description</a> - The
--   custom description of the activity.
newActivity :: Activity

-- | The settings for a yes/no split activity. This type of activity sends
--   participants down one of two paths in a journey, based on conditions
--   that you specify.
activity_conditionalSplit :: Lens' Activity (Maybe ConditionalSplitActivity)

-- | The settings for an email activity. This type of activity sends an
--   email message to participants.
activity_email :: Lens' Activity (Maybe EmailMessageActivity)

-- | The settings for a multivariate split activity. This type of activity
--   sends participants down one of as many as five paths (including a
--   default <i>Else</i> path) in a journey, based on conditions that you
--   specify.
activity_multiCondition :: Lens' Activity (Maybe MultiConditionalSplitActivity)

-- | The settings for a connect activity. This type of activity initiates a
--   contact center call to participants.
activity_contactCenter :: Lens' Activity (Maybe ContactCenterActivity)

-- | The settings for a custom message activity. This type of activity
--   calls an AWS Lambda function or web hook that sends messages to
--   participants.
activity_custom :: Lens' Activity (Maybe CustomMessageActivity)

-- | The settings for a wait activity. This type of activity waits for a
--   certain amount of time or until a specific date and time before moving
--   participants to the next activity in a journey.
activity_wait :: Lens' Activity (Maybe WaitActivity)

-- | The settings for a random split activity. This type of activity
--   randomly sends specified percentages of participants down one of as
--   many as five paths in a journey, based on conditions that you specify.
activity_randomSplit :: Lens' Activity (Maybe RandomSplitActivity)

-- | The settings for a holdout activity. This type of activity stops a
--   journey for a specified percentage of participants.
activity_holdout :: Lens' Activity (Maybe HoldoutActivity)

-- | The settings for an SMS activity. This type of activity sends a text
--   message to participants.
activity_sms :: Lens' Activity (Maybe SMSMessageActivity)

-- | The settings for a push notification activity. This type of activity
--   sends a push notification to participants.
activity_push :: Lens' Activity (Maybe PushMessageActivity)

-- | The custom description of the activity.
activity_description :: Lens' Activity (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides information about an activity that was performed by a
--   campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newActivityResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ActivityResponse
ActivityResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ActivityResponse

-- | The current status of the activity. Possible values are: PENDING,
--   INITIALIZING, RUNNING, PAUSED, CANCELLED, and COMPLETED.
[$sel:state:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The actual start time, in ISO 8601 format, of the activity.
[$sel:start:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of time zones that were completed.
[$sel:timezonesCompletedCount:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The total number of unique time zones that are in the segment for the
--   campaign.
[$sel:timezonesTotalCount:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies whether the activity succeeded. Possible values are SUCCESS
--   and FAIL.
[$sel:result:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the campaign treatment that the activity
--   applies to. A treatment is a variation of a campaign that's used for
--   A/B testing of a campaign.
[$sel:treatmentId:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of endpoints that the campaign successfully delivered
--   messages to.
[$sel:successfulEndpointCount:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The actual time, in ISO 8601 format, when the activity was marked
--   CANCELLED or COMPLETED.
[$sel:end:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of endpoints that the campaign attempted to deliver
--   messages to.
[$sel:totalEndpointCount:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The scheduled start time, in ISO 8601 format, for the activity.
[$sel:scheduledStart:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the campaign that the activity applies to.
[$sel:campaignId:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the activity.
[$sel:id:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the campaign applies
--   to.
[$sel:applicationId:ActivityResponse'] :: ActivityResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ActivityResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:ActivityResponse'</a>, <a>activityResponse_state</a> -
--   The current status of the activity. Possible values are: PENDING,
--   INITIALIZING, RUNNING, PAUSED, CANCELLED, and COMPLETED.
--   
--   <a>$sel:start:ActivityResponse'</a>, <a>activityResponse_start</a> -
--   The actual start time, in ISO 8601 format, of the activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timezonesCompletedCount:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_timezonesCompletedCount</a> - The total number of
--   time zones that were completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timezonesTotalCount:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_timezonesTotalCount</a> - The total number of
--   unique time zones that are in the segment for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:result:ActivityResponse'</a>, <a>activityResponse_result</a> -
--   Specifies whether the activity succeeded. Possible values are SUCCESS
--   and FAIL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatmentId:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_treatmentId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   campaign treatment that the activity applies to. A treatment is a
--   variation of a campaign that's used for A/B testing of a campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:successfulEndpointCount:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_successfulEndpointCount</a> - The total number of
--   endpoints that the campaign successfully delivered messages to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:end:ActivityResponse'</a>, <a>activityResponse_end</a> - The
--   actual time, in ISO 8601 format, when the activity was marked
--   CANCELLED or COMPLETED.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalEndpointCount:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_totalEndpointCount</a> - The total number of
--   endpoints that the campaign attempted to deliver messages to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduledStart:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_scheduledStart</a> - The scheduled start time, in
--   ISO 8601 format, for the activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:campaignId:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_campaignId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   campaign that the activity applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ActivityResponse'</a>, <a>activityResponse_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application that the campaign applies to.
newActivityResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ActivityResponse

-- | The current status of the activity. Possible values are: PENDING,
--   INITIALIZING, RUNNING, PAUSED, CANCELLED, and COMPLETED.
activityResponse_state :: Lens' ActivityResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The actual start time, in ISO 8601 format, of the activity.
activityResponse_start :: Lens' ActivityResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of time zones that were completed.
activityResponse_timezonesCompletedCount :: Lens' ActivityResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The total number of unique time zones that are in the segment for the
--   campaign.
activityResponse_timezonesTotalCount :: Lens' ActivityResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies whether the activity succeeded. Possible values are SUCCESS
--   and FAIL.
activityResponse_result :: Lens' ActivityResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the campaign treatment that the activity
--   applies to. A treatment is a variation of a campaign that's used for
--   A/B testing of a campaign.
activityResponse_treatmentId :: Lens' ActivityResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of endpoints that the campaign successfully delivered
--   messages to.
activityResponse_successfulEndpointCount :: Lens' ActivityResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The actual time, in ISO 8601 format, when the activity was marked
--   CANCELLED or COMPLETED.
activityResponse_end :: Lens' ActivityResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of endpoints that the campaign attempted to deliver
--   messages to.
activityResponse_totalEndpointCount :: Lens' ActivityResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The scheduled start time, in ISO 8601 format, for the activity.
activityResponse_scheduledStart :: Lens' ActivityResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the campaign that the activity applies to.
activityResponse_campaignId :: Lens' ActivityResponse Text

-- | The unique identifier for the activity.
activityResponse_id :: Lens' ActivityResponse Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the campaign applies
--   to.
activityResponse_applicationId :: Lens' ActivityResponse Text

-- | Specifies address-based configuration settings for a message that's
--   sent directly to an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAddressConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data AddressConfiguration
AddressConfiguration' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ChannelType -> AddressConfiguration

-- | A map of the message variables to merge with the variables specified
--   by properties of the DefaultMessage object. The variables specified in
--   this map take precedence over all other variables.
[$sel:substitutions:AddressConfiguration'] :: AddressConfiguration -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | The message title to use instead of the default message title. This
--   value overrides the default message title.
[$sel:titleOverride:AddressConfiguration'] :: AddressConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that maps custom attributes to attributes for the address
--   and is attached to the message. Attribute names are case sensitive.
--   
--   For a push notification, this payload is added to the data.pinpoint
--   object. For an email or text message, this payload is added to
--   email/SMS delivery receipt event attributes.
[$sel:context:AddressConfiguration'] :: AddressConfiguration -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the message.
--   If specified, this value overrides all other values for the message.
[$sel:rawContent:AddressConfiguration'] :: AddressConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The message body to use instead of the default message body. This
--   value overrides the default message body.
[$sel:bodyOverride:AddressConfiguration'] :: AddressConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The channel to use when sending the message.
[$sel:channelType:AddressConfiguration'] :: AddressConfiguration -> Maybe ChannelType

-- | Create a value of <a>AddressConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:AddressConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>addressConfiguration_substitutions</a> - A map of the message
--   variables to merge with the variables specified by properties of the
--   DefaultMessage object. The variables specified in this map take
--   precedence over all other variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:titleOverride:AddressConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>addressConfiguration_titleOverride</a> - The message title to use
--   instead of the default message title. This value overrides the default
--   message title.
--   
--   <a>$sel:context:AddressConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>addressConfiguration_context</a> - An object that maps custom
--   attributes to attributes for the address and is attached to the
--   message. Attribute names are case sensitive.
--   
--   For a push notification, this payload is added to the data.pinpoint
--   object. For an email or text message, this payload is added to
--   email/SMS delivery receipt event attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawContent:AddressConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>addressConfiguration_rawContent</a> - The raw, JSON-formatted
--   string to use as the payload for the message. If specified, this value
--   overrides all other values for the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bodyOverride:AddressConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>addressConfiguration_bodyOverride</a> - The message body to use
--   instead of the default message body. This value overrides the default
--   message body.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelType:AddressConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>addressConfiguration_channelType</a> - The channel to use when
--   sending the message.
newAddressConfiguration :: AddressConfiguration

-- | A map of the message variables to merge with the variables specified
--   by properties of the DefaultMessage object. The variables specified in
--   this map take precedence over all other variables.
addressConfiguration_substitutions :: Lens' AddressConfiguration (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | The message title to use instead of the default message title. This
--   value overrides the default message title.
addressConfiguration_titleOverride :: Lens' AddressConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that maps custom attributes to attributes for the address
--   and is attached to the message. Attribute names are case sensitive.
--   
--   For a push notification, this payload is added to the data.pinpoint
--   object. For an email or text message, this payload is added to
--   email/SMS delivery receipt event attributes.
addressConfiguration_context :: Lens' AddressConfiguration (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the message.
--   If specified, this value overrides all other values for the message.
addressConfiguration_rawContent :: Lens' AddressConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The message body to use instead of the default message body. This
--   value overrides the default message body.
addressConfiguration_bodyOverride :: Lens' AddressConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The channel to use when sending the message.
addressConfiguration_channelType :: Lens' AddressConfiguration (Maybe ChannelType)

-- | Specifies channel-specific content and settings for a message template
--   that can be used in push notifications that are sent through the ADM
--   (Amazon Device Messaging), Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push), or GCM (Firebase
--   Cloud Messaging, formerly Google Cloud Messaging) channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAndroidPushNotificationTemplate</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AndroidPushNotificationTemplate
AndroidPushNotificationTemplate' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AndroidPushNotificationTemplate

-- | The URL of the large icon image to display in the content view of a
--   push notification that's based on the message template.
[$sel:imageIconUrl:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'] :: AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for a push
--   notification that's based on the message template. If specified, this
--   value overrides all other content for the message template.
[$sel:rawContent:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'] :: AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL of the small icon image to display in the status bar and the
--   content view of a push notification that's based on the message
--   template.
[$sel:smallImageIconUrl:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'] :: AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The message body to use in a push notification that's based on the
--   message template.
[$sel:body:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'] :: AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message
--   template and the value of the Action property is URL.
[$sel:url:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'] :: AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The sound to play when a recipient receives a push notification that's
--   based on the message template. You can use the default stream or
--   specify the file name of a sound resource that's bundled in your app.
--   On an Android platform, the sound file must reside in /res/raw/.
[$sel:sound:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'] :: AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The action to occur if a recipient taps a push notification that's
--   based on the message template. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of
--   the Android platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:action:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'] :: AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Action

-- | The URL of an image to display in a push notification that's based on
--   the message template.
[$sel:imageUrl:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'] :: AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The title to use in a push notification that's based on the message
--   template. This title appears above the notification message on a
--   recipient's device.
[$sel:title:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'] :: AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AndroidPushNotificationTemplate</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   overrides all other content for the message template.
--

--   
--   <a>$sel:body:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,

-- | Provides the results of a query that retrieved the data for a standard
--   metric that applies to an application, and provides information about
--   that query.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse
ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse' :: Maybe Text -> BaseKpiResult -> Text -> POSIX -> POSIX -> Text -> ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null for the
--   Application Metrics resource because the resource returns all results
--   in a single page.
[$sel:nextToken:ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of objects that contains the results of the query. Each
--   object contains the value for the metric and metadata about that
--   value.
[$sel:kpiResult:ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse -> BaseKpiResult

-- | The name of the metric, also referred to as a /key performance
--   indicator (KPI)/, that the data was retrieved for. This value
--   describes the associated metric and consists of two or more terms,
--   which are comprised of lowercase alphanumeric characters, separated by
--   a hyphen. For a list of possible values, see the <a>Amazon Pinpoint
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:kpiName:ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse -> Text

-- | The last date and time of the date range that was used to filter the
--   query results, in extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is
--   inclusive.
[$sel:endTime:ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse -> POSIX

-- | The first date and time of the date range that was used to filter the
--   query results, in extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is
--   inclusive.
[$sel:startTime:ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse -> POSIX

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the metric applies to.
[$sel:applicationId:ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>applicationDateRangeKpiResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use
--   in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated
--   response. This value is null for the Application Metrics resource
--   because the resource returns all results in a single page.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kpiResult:ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>applicationDateRangeKpiResponse_kpiResult</a> - An array of objects
--   that contains the results of the query. Each object contains the value
--   for the metric and metadata about that value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kpiName:ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>applicationDateRangeKpiResponse_kpiName</a> - The name of the
--   metric, also referred to as a /key performance indicator (KPI)/, that
--   the data was retrieved for. This value describes the associated metric
--   and consists of two or more terms, which are comprised of lowercase
--   alphanumeric characters, separated by a hyphen. For a list of possible
--   values, see the <a>Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>applicationDateRangeKpiResponse_endTime</a> - The last date and
--   time of the date range that was used to filter the query results, in
--   extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is inclusive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>applicationDateRangeKpiResponse_startTime</a> - The first date and
--   time of the date range that was used to filter the query results, in
--   extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is inclusive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>applicationDateRangeKpiResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the application that the metric applies to.
newApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse :: BaseKpiResult -> Text -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> Text -> ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null for the
--   Application Metrics resource because the resource returns all results
--   in a single page.
applicationDateRangeKpiResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of objects that contains the results of the query. Each
--   object contains the value for the metric and metadata about that
--   value.
applicationDateRangeKpiResponse_kpiResult :: Lens' ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse BaseKpiResult

-- | The name of the metric, also referred to as a /key performance
--   indicator (KPI)/, that the data was retrieved for. This value
--   describes the associated metric and consists of two or more terms,
--   which are comprised of lowercase alphanumeric characters, separated by
--   a hyphen. For a list of possible values, see the <a>Amazon Pinpoint
--   Developer Guide</a>.
applicationDateRangeKpiResponse_kpiName :: Lens' ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse Text

--   query results, in extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is
--   inclusive.
applicationDateRangeKpiResponse_endTime :: Lens' ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse UTCTime

--   inclusive.

-- | Provides information about an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newApplicationResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ApplicationResponse
ApplicationResponse' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ApplicationResponse

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags
--   that are associated with the application. Each tag consists of a
--   required tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:ApplicationResponse'] :: ApplicationResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is
--   displayed as the <b>Project ID</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
[$sel:id:ApplicationResponse'] :: ApplicationResponse -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application.
[$sel:arn:ApplicationResponse'] :: ApplicationResponse -> Text

-- | The display name of the application. This name is displayed as the
--   <b>Project name</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
[$sel:name:ApplicationResponse'] :: ApplicationResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ApplicationResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:ApplicationResponse'</a>, <a>applicationResponse_tags</a>
--   - A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags
--   that are associated with the application. Each tag consists of a
--   required tag key and an associated tag value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ApplicationResponse'</a>, <a>applicationResponse_id</a> -
--   The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is
--   displayed as the <b>Project ID</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:ApplicationResponse'</a>, <a>applicationResponse_arn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ApplicationResponse'</a>, <a>applicationResponse_name</a>
--   - The display name of the application. This name is displayed as the
--   <b>Project name</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
newApplicationResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ApplicationResponse

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags
--   that are associated with the application. Each tag consists of a
--   required tag key and an associated tag value.
applicationResponse_tags :: Lens' ApplicationResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is
--   displayed as the <b>Project ID</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
applicationResponse_id :: Lens' ApplicationResponse Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application.
applicationResponse_arn :: Lens' ApplicationResponse Text

-- | The display name of the application. This name is displayed as the
--   <b>Project name</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
applicationResponse_name :: Lens' ApplicationResponse Text

-- | Provides information about an application, including the default
--   settings for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newApplicationSettingsResource</a> smart constructor.
data ApplicationSettingsResource
ApplicationSettingsResource' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe CampaignLimits -> Maybe QuietTime -> Maybe CampaignHook -> Text -> ApplicationSettingsResource

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the application's settings
--   were last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:ApplicationSettingsResource'] :: ApplicationSettingsResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The default sending limits for campaigns in the application.
[$sel:limits:ApplicationSettingsResource'] :: ApplicationSettingsResource -> Maybe CampaignLimits

-- | The default quiet time for campaigns in the application. Quiet time is
--   a specific time range when messages aren't sent to endpoints, if all
--   the following conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set
--   to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the endpoint will
--   receive messages from a campaign or journey, even if quiet time is
--   enabled.
[$sel:quietTime:ApplicationSettingsResource'] :: ApplicationSettingsResource -> Maybe QuietTime

-- | The settings for the AWS Lambda function to invoke by default as a
--   code hook for campaigns in the application. You can use this hook to
--   customize segments that are used by campaigns in the application.
[$sel:campaignHook:ApplicationSettingsResource'] :: ApplicationSettingsResource -> Maybe CampaignHook

-- | The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is
--   displayed as the <b>Project ID</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
[$sel:applicationId:ApplicationSettingsResource'] :: ApplicationSettingsResource -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ApplicationSettingsResource</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:ApplicationSettingsResource'</a>,
--   <a>applicationSettingsResource_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date and
--   time, in ISO 8601 format, when the application's settings were last
--   modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limits:ApplicationSettingsResource'</a>,
--   <a>applicationSettingsResource_limits</a> - The default sending limits
--   for campaigns in the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quietTime:ApplicationSettingsResource'</a>,
--   <a>applicationSettingsResource_quietTime</a> - The default quiet time
--   for campaigns in the application. Quiet time is a specific time range
--   when messages aren't sent to endpoints, if all the following
--   conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set
--   to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the endpoint will
--   receive messages from a campaign or journey, even if quiet time is
--   enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:campaignHook:ApplicationSettingsResource'</a>,
--   <a>applicationSettingsResource_campaignHook</a> - The settings for the
--   AWS Lambda function to invoke by default as a code hook for campaigns
--   in the application. You can use this hook to customize segments that
--   are used by campaigns in the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:ApplicationSettingsResource'</a>,
--   <a>applicationSettingsResource_applicationId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the application. This identifier is displayed as the
--   <b>Project ID</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
newApplicationSettingsResource :: Text -> ApplicationSettingsResource

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the application's settings
--   were last modified.
applicationSettingsResource_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' ApplicationSettingsResource (Maybe Text)

-- | The default sending limits for campaigns in the application.
applicationSettingsResource_limits :: Lens' ApplicationSettingsResource (Maybe CampaignLimits)

-- | The default quiet time for campaigns in the application. Quiet time is
--   a specific time range when messages aren't sent to endpoints, if all
--   the following conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set
--   to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the endpoint will
--   receive messages from a campaign or journey, even if quiet time is
--   enabled.
applicationSettingsResource_quietTime :: Lens' ApplicationSettingsResource (Maybe QuietTime)

-- | The settings for the AWS Lambda function to invoke by default as a
--   code hook for campaigns in the application. You can use this hook to
--   customize segments that are used by campaigns in the application.
applicationSettingsResource_campaignHook :: Lens' ApplicationSettingsResource (Maybe CampaignHook)

-- | The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is
--   displayed as the <b>Project ID</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
applicationSettingsResource_applicationId :: Lens' ApplicationSettingsResource Text

-- | Provides information about all of your applications.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newApplicationsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ApplicationsResponse
ApplicationsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [ApplicationResponse] -> ApplicationsResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
[$sel:nextToken:ApplicationsResponse'] :: ApplicationsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of responses, one for each application that was returned.
[$sel:item:ApplicationsResponse'] :: ApplicationsResponse -> Maybe [ApplicationResponse]

-- | Create a value of <a>ApplicationsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ApplicationsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>applicationsResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use in a
--   subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated
--   response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:ApplicationsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>applicationsResponse_item</a> - An array of responses, one for each
--   application that was returned.
newApplicationsResponse :: ApplicationsResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
applicationsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ApplicationsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of responses, one for each application that was returned.
applicationsResponse_item :: Lens' ApplicationsResponse (Maybe [ApplicationResponse])

-- | Specifies attribute-based criteria for including or excluding
--   endpoints from a segment.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttributeDimension</a> smart constructor.
data AttributeDimension
AttributeDimension' :: Maybe AttributeType -> [Text] -> AttributeDimension

-- | The type of segment dimension to use. Valid values are:
--   
--   INCLUSIVE - endpoints that have attributes matching the values are
--   included in the segment.
--   
--   EXCLUSIVE - endpoints that have attributes matching the values are
--   excluded in the segment.
--   
--   CONTAINS - endpoints that have attributes' substrings match the values
--   are included in the segment.
--   
--   BEFORE - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes
--   before the value are included in the segment.
--   
--   AFTER - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes after
--   the value are included in the segment.
--   
--   ON - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT dates on the value
--   are included in the segment. Time is ignored in this comparison.
--   
--   BETWEEN - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes
--   between the values are included in the segment.
[$sel:attributeType:AttributeDimension'] :: AttributeDimension -> Maybe AttributeType

-- | The criteria values to use for the segment dimension. Depending on the
--   value of the AttributeType property, endpoints are included or
--   excluded from the segment if their attribute values match the criteria
--   values.
[$sel:values:AttributeDimension'] :: AttributeDimension -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>AttributeDimension</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeType:AttributeDimension'</a>,
--   <a>attributeDimension_attributeType</a> - The type of segment
--   dimension to use. Valid values are:
--   
--   INCLUSIVE - endpoints that have attributes matching the values are
--   included in the segment.
--   
--   EXCLUSIVE - endpoints that have attributes matching the values are
--   excluded in the segment.
--   
--   CONTAINS - endpoints that have attributes' substrings match the values
--   are included in the segment.
--   
--   BEFORE - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes
--   before the value are included in the segment.
--   
--   AFTER - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes after
--   the value are included in the segment.
--   
--   ON - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT dates on the value
--   are included in the segment. Time is ignored in this comparison.
--   
--   BETWEEN - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes
--   between the values are included in the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:AttributeDimension'</a>,
--   <a>attributeDimension_values</a> - The criteria values to use for the
--   segment dimension. Depending on the value of the AttributeType
--   property, endpoints are included or excluded from the segment if their
--   attribute values match the criteria values.
newAttributeDimension :: AttributeDimension

-- | The type of segment dimension to use. Valid values are:
--   
--   INCLUSIVE - endpoints that have attributes matching the values are
--   included in the segment.
--   
--   EXCLUSIVE - endpoints that have attributes matching the values are
--   excluded in the segment.
--   
--   CONTAINS - endpoints that have attributes' substrings match the values
--   are included in the segment.
--   
--   BEFORE - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes
--   before the value are included in the segment.
--   
--   AFTER - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes after
--   the value are included in the segment.
--   
--   ON - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT dates on the value
--   are included in the segment. Time is ignored in this comparison.
--   
--   BETWEEN - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes
--   between the values are included in the segment.
attributeDimension_attributeType :: Lens' AttributeDimension (Maybe AttributeType)

-- | The criteria values to use for the segment dimension. Depending on the
--   value of the AttributeType property, endpoints are included or
--   excluded from the segment if their attribute values match the criteria
--   values.
attributeDimension_values :: Lens' AttributeDimension [Text]

-- | Provides information about the type and the names of attributes that
--   were removed from all the endpoints that are associated with an
--   application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttributesResource</a> smart constructor.
data AttributesResource
AttributesResource' :: Maybe [Text] -> Text -> Text -> AttributesResource

-- | An array that specifies the names of the attributes that were removed
--   from the endpoints.
[$sel:attributes:AttributesResource'] :: AttributesResource -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The type of attribute or attributes that were removed from the
--   endpoints. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>endpoint-custom-attributes - Custom attributes that describe
--   endpoints.</li>
--   <li>endpoint-metric-attributes - Custom metrics that your app reports
--   to Amazon Pinpoint for endpoints.</li>
--   <li>endpoint-user-attributes - Custom attributes that describe
--   users.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:attributeType:AttributesResource'] :: AttributesResource -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application.
[$sel:applicationId:AttributesResource'] :: AttributesResource -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AttributesResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:AttributesResource'</a>,
--   <a>attributesResource_attributes</a> - An array that specifies the
--   names of the attributes that were removed from the endpoints.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeType:AttributesResource'</a>,
--   <a>attributesResource_attributeType</a> - The type of attribute or
--   attributes that were removed from the endpoints. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>endpoint-custom-attributes - Custom attributes that describe
--   endpoints.</li>
--   <li>endpoint-metric-attributes - Custom metrics that your app reports
--   to Amazon Pinpoint for endpoints.</li>
--   <li>endpoint-user-attributes - Custom attributes that describe
--   users.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:AttributesResource'</a>,
--   <a>attributesResource_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the application.
newAttributesResource :: Text -> Text -> AttributesResource

-- | An array that specifies the names of the attributes that were removed
--   from the endpoints.
attributesResource_attributes :: Lens' AttributesResource (Maybe [Text])

-- | The type of attribute or attributes that were removed from the
--   endpoints. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>endpoint-custom-attributes - Custom attributes that describe
--   endpoints.</li>
--   <li>endpoint-metric-attributes - Custom metrics that your app reports
--   to Amazon Pinpoint for endpoints.</li>
--   <li>endpoint-user-attributes - Custom attributes that describe
--   users.</li>
--   </ul>
attributesResource_attributeType :: Lens' AttributesResource Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application.
attributesResource_applicationId :: Lens' AttributesResource Text

-- | Specifies the status and settings of the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push)
--   channel for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBaiduChannelRequest</a> smart constructor.
data BaiduChannelRequest
BaiduChannelRequest' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> Text -> BaiduChannelRequest

-- | Specifies whether to enable the Baidu channel for the application.
[$sel:enabled:BaiduChannelRequest'] :: BaiduChannelRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | The secret key that you received from the Baidu Cloud Push service to
--   communicate with the service.
[$sel:secretKey:BaiduChannelRequest'] :: BaiduChannelRequest -> Text

-- | The API key that you received from the Baidu Cloud Push service to
--   communicate with the service.
[$sel:apiKey:BaiduChannelRequest'] :: BaiduChannelRequest -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BaiduChannelRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:BaiduChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelRequest_enabled</a> - Specifies whether to enable the
--   Baidu channel for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretKey:BaiduChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelRequest_secretKey</a> - The secret key that you
--   received from the Baidu Cloud Push service to communicate with the
--   service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:apiKey:BaiduChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelRequest_apiKey</a> - The API key that you received from
--   the Baidu Cloud Push service to communicate with the service.
newBaiduChannelRequest :: Text -> Text -> BaiduChannelRequest

-- | Specifies whether to enable the Baidu channel for the application.
baiduChannelRequest_enabled :: Lens' BaiduChannelRequest (Maybe Bool)

-- | The secret key that you received from the Baidu Cloud Push service to
--   communicate with the service.
baiduChannelRequest_secretKey :: Lens' BaiduChannelRequest Text

-- | The API key that you received from the Baidu Cloud Push service to
--   communicate with the service.
baiduChannelRequest_apiKey :: Lens' BaiduChannelRequest Text

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of the Baidu (Baidu
--   Cloud Push) channel for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBaiduChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data BaiduChannelResponse
BaiduChannelResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> Text -> BaiduChannelResponse

-- | The date and time when the Baidu channel was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:BaiduChannelResponse'] :: BaiduChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the Baidu channel is enabled for the application.
[$sel:enabled:BaiduChannelResponse'] :: BaiduChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether the Baidu channel is archived.
[$sel:isArchived:BaiduChannelResponse'] :: BaiduChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the Baidu channel
--   applies to.
[$sel:applicationId:BaiduChannelResponse'] :: BaiduChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The current version of the Baidu channel.
[$sel:version:BaiduChannelResponse'] :: BaiduChannelResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the Baidu channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:id:BaiduChannelResponse'] :: BaiduChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time when the Baidu channel was enabled.
[$sel:creationDate:BaiduChannelResponse'] :: BaiduChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The user who last modified the Baidu channel.
[$sel:lastModifiedBy:BaiduChannelResponse'] :: BaiduChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:hasCredential:BaiduChannelResponse'] :: BaiduChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The API key that you received from the Baidu Cloud Push service to
--   communicate with the service.
[$sel:credential:BaiduChannelResponse'] :: BaiduChannelResponse -> Text

-- | The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For
--   the Baidu channel, this value is BAIDU.
[$sel:platform:BaiduChannelResponse'] :: BaiduChannelResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BaiduChannelResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   the Baidu channel was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_enabled</a> - Specifies whether the Baidu
--   channel is enabled for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isArchived:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_isArchived</a> - Specifies whether the Baidu
--   channel is archived.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the application that the Baidu channel applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_version</a> - The current version of the Baidu
--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>, <a>baiduChannelResponse_id</a> -
--   (Deprecated) An identifier for the Baidu channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_creationDate</a> - The date and time when the
--   Baidu channel was enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedBy:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_lastModifiedBy</a> - The user who last
--   modified the Baidu channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasCredential:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_hasCredential</a> - (Not used) This property
--   is retained only for backward compatibility.
--

--   from the Baidu Cloud Push service to communicate with the service.

--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_platform</a> - The type of messaging or
--   notification platform for the channel. For the Baidu channel, this
--   value is BAIDU.
newBaiduChannelResponse :: Text -> Text -> BaiduChannelResponse

baiduChannelResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' BaiduChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the Baidu channel is enabled for the application.
baiduChannelResponse_enabled :: Lens' BaiduChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether the Baidu channel is archived.
baiduChannelResponse_isArchived :: Lens' BaiduChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

--   applies to.
baiduChannelResponse_applicationId :: Lens' BaiduChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

baiduChannelResponse_version :: Lens' BaiduChannelResponse (Maybe Int)

--   retained only for backward compatibility.

--   the Baidu channel, this value is BAIDU.
