-- | Specifies the settings for a one-time message that's sent directly to
--   an endpoint through the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push) channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBaiduMessage</a> smart constructor.
data BaiduMessage
BaiduMessage' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> BaiduMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the notification message. You
--   can override the default variables with individual address variables.
[$sel:substitutions:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification,
--   which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's
--   device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as
--   updating an app's configuration or supporting phone home
--   functionality.
[$sel:silentPush:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Bool

-- | The URL of the large icon image to display in the content view of the
--   push notification.
[$sel:imageIconUrl:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the
--   notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other
--   content for the message.
[$sel:rawContent:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The JSON data payload to use for the push notification, if the
--   notification is a silent push notification. This payload is added to
--   the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.
[$sel:data':BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The URL of the small icon image to display in the status bar and the
--   content view of the push notification.
[$sel:smallImageIconUrl:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The body of the notification message.
[$sel:body:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, that the Baidu Cloud Push service
--   should store the message if the recipient's device is offline. The
--   default value and maximum supported time is 604,800 seconds (7 days).
[$sel:timeToLive:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Int

-- | The URL to open in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action
--   property is URL.
[$sel:url:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The sound to play when the recipient receives the push notification.
--   You can use the default stream or specify the file name of a sound
--   resource that's bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound
--   file must reside in /res/raw/.
[$sel:sound:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The action to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of
--   the Android platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:action:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Action

-- | The URL of an image to display in the push notification.
[$sel:imageUrl:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The title to display above the notification message on the recipient's
--   device.
[$sel:title:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The icon image name of the asset saved in your app.
[$sel:iconReference:BaiduMessage'] :: BaiduMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BaiduMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:BaiduMessage'</a>,
--   <a>baiduMessage_substitutions</a> - The default message variables to
--   use in the notification message. You can override the default
--   variables with individual address variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:silentPush:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_silentPush</a> -
--   Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification,
--   which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's
--   device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as
--   updating an app's configuration or supporting phone home
--   functionality.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageIconUrl:BaiduMessage'</a>,
--   <a>baiduMessage_imageIconUrl</a> - The URL of the large icon image to
--   display in the content view of the push notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawContent:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_rawContent</a> -
--   The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the
--   notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other
--   content for the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_data</a> - The JSON
--   data payload to use for the push notification, if the notification is
--   a silent push notification. This payload is added to the
--   data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:smallImageIconUrl:BaiduMessage'</a>,
--   <a>baiduMessage_smallImageIconUrl</a> - The URL of the small icon
--   image to display in the status bar and the content view of the push
--   notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_body</a> - The body of
--   the notification message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeToLive:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_timeToLive</a> -
--   The amount of time, in seconds, that the Baidu Cloud Push service
--   should store the message if the recipient's device is offline. The
--   default value and maximum supported time is 604,800 seconds (7 days).
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_url</a> - The URL to
--   open in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps
--   the push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sound:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_sound</a> - The sound
--   to play when the recipient receives the push notification. You can use
--   the default stream or specify the file name of a sound resource that's
--   bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound file must
--   reside in /res/raw/.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_action</a> - The
--   action to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of
--   the Android platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageUrl:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_imageUrl</a> - The
--   URL of an image to display in the push notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_title</a> - The title
--   to display above the notification message on the recipient's device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iconReference:BaiduMessage'</a>,
--   <a>baiduMessage_iconReference</a> - The icon image name of the asset
--   saved in your app.
newBaiduMessage :: BaiduMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the notification message. You
--   can override the default variables with individual address variables.
baiduMessage_substitutions :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification,
--   which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's
--   device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as
--   updating an app's configuration or supporting phone home
--   functionality.
baiduMessage_silentPush :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Bool)

-- | The URL of the large icon image to display in the content view of the
--   push notification.
baiduMessage_imageIconUrl :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the
--   notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other
--   content for the message.
baiduMessage_rawContent :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The JSON data payload to use for the push notification, if the
--   notification is a silent push notification. This payload is added to
--   the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.
baiduMessage_data :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The URL of the small icon image to display in the status bar and the
--   content view of the push notification.
baiduMessage_smallImageIconUrl :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The body of the notification message.
baiduMessage_body :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, that the Baidu Cloud Push service
--   should store the message if the recipient's device is offline. The
--   default value and maximum supported time is 604,800 seconds (7 days).
baiduMessage_timeToLive :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Int)

--   recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action
--   property is URL.
baiduMessage_url :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Text)

--   file must reside in /res/raw/.
baiduMessage_sound :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The action to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of
--   the Android platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
baiduMessage_action :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Action)

baiduMessage_imageUrl :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Text)

--   device.
baiduMessage_title :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Text)

baiduMessage_iconReference :: Lens' BaiduMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides the results of a query that retrieved the data for a standard
--   metric that applies to an application, campaign, or journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBaseKpiResult</a> smart constructor.
data BaseKpiResult
BaseKpiResult' :: [ResultRow] -> BaseKpiResult

-- | An array of objects that provides the results of a query that
--   retrieved the data for a standard metric that applies to an
--   application, campaign, or journey.
[$sel:rows:BaseKpiResult'] :: BaseKpiResult -> [ResultRow]

-- | Create a value of <a>BaseKpiResult</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:rows:BaseKpiResult'</a>, <a>baseKpiResult_rows</a> - An array
--   of objects that provides the results of a query that retrieved the
--   data for a standard metric that applies to an application, campaign,
--   or journey.
newBaseKpiResult :: BaseKpiResult

-- | An array of objects that provides the results of a query that
--   retrieved the data for a standard metric that applies to an
--   application, campaign, or journey.
baseKpiResult_rows :: Lens' BaseKpiResult [ResultRow]

-- | Specifies the contents of a message that's sent through a custom
--   channel to recipients of a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignCustomMessage</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignCustomMessage
CampaignCustomMessage' :: Maybe Text -> CampaignCustomMessage

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the message.
--   The maximum size is 5 KB.
[$sel:data':CampaignCustomMessage'] :: CampaignCustomMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignCustomMessage</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':CampaignCustomMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignCustomMessage_data</a> - The raw, JSON-formatted string to
--   use as the payload for the message. The maximum size is 5 KB.
newCampaignCustomMessage :: CampaignCustomMessage

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the message.
--   The maximum size is 5 KB.
campaignCustomMessage_data :: Lens' CampaignCustomMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides the results of a query that retrieved the data for a standard
--   metric that applies to a campaign, and provides information about that
--   query.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignDateRangeKpiResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse
CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse' :: Maybe Text -> BaseKpiResult -> Text -> POSIX -> Text -> POSIX -> Text -> CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null for the Campaign
--   Metrics resource because the resource returns all results in a single
--   page.
[$sel:nextToken:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of objects that contains the results of the query. Each
--   object contains the value for the metric and metadata about that
--   value.
[$sel:kpiResult:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse -> BaseKpiResult

-- | The name of the metric, also referred to as a /key performance
--   indicator (KPI)/, that the data was retrieved for. This value
--   describes the associated metric and consists of two or more terms,
--   which are comprised of lowercase alphanumeric characters, separated by
--   a hyphen. For a list of possible values, see the <a>Amazon Pinpoint
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:kpiName:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse -> Text

-- | The last date and time of the date range that was used to filter the
--   query results, in extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is
--   inclusive.
[$sel:endTime:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse -> POSIX

-- | The unique identifier for the campaign that the metric applies to.
[$sel:campaignId:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse -> Text

-- | The first date and time of the date range that was used to filter the
--   query results, in extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is
--   inclusive.
[$sel:startTime:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse -> POSIX

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the metric applies to.
[$sel:applicationId:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignDateRangeKpiResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use in a
--   subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated
--   response. This value is null for the Campaign Metrics resource because
--   the resource returns all results in a single page.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kpiResult:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignDateRangeKpiResponse_kpiResult</a> - An array of objects
--   that contains the results of the query. Each object contains the value
--   for the metric and metadata about that value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kpiName:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignDateRangeKpiResponse_kpiName</a> - The name of the metric,
--   also referred to as a /key performance indicator (KPI)/, that the data
--   was retrieved for. This value describes the associated metric and
--   consists of two or more terms, which are comprised of lowercase
--   alphanumeric characters, separated by a hyphen. For a list of possible
--   values, see the <a>Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignDateRangeKpiResponse_endTime</a> - The last date and time
--   of the date range that was used to filter the query results, in
--   extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is inclusive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:campaignId:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignDateRangeKpiResponse_campaignId</a> - The unique identifier
--   for the campaign that the metric applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignDateRangeKpiResponse_startTime</a> - The first date and
--   time of the date range that was used to filter the query results, in
--   extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is inclusive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignDateRangeKpiResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the application that the metric applies to.
newCampaignDateRangeKpiResponse :: BaseKpiResult -> Text -> UTCTime -> Text -> UTCTime -> Text -> CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse

--   results in a paginated response. This value is null for the Campaign
--   Metrics resource because the resource returns all results in a single
--   page.
campaignDateRangeKpiResponse_nextToken :: Lens' CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse (Maybe Text)

campaignDateRangeKpiResponse_endTime :: Lens' CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse UTCTime

-- | Specifies the content and "From" address for an email message that's
--   sent to recipients of a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignEmailMessage</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignEmailMessage
CampaignEmailMessage' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CampaignEmailMessage

-- | The body of the email for recipients whose email clients don't render
--   HTML content.
[$sel:body:CampaignEmailMessage'] :: CampaignEmailMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The verified email address to send the email from. The default address
--   is the FromAddress specified for the email channel for the
--   application.
[$sel:fromAddress:CampaignEmailMessage'] :: CampaignEmailMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The body of the email, in HTML format, for recipients whose email
--   clients render HTML content.
[$sel:htmlBody:CampaignEmailMessage'] :: CampaignEmailMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The subject line, or title, of the email.
[$sel:title:CampaignEmailMessage'] :: CampaignEmailMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignEmailMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:CampaignEmailMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignEmailMessage_body</a> - The body of the email for
--   recipients whose email clients don't render HTML content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromAddress:CampaignEmailMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignEmailMessage_fromAddress</a> - The verified email address
--   to send the email from. The default address is the FromAddress
--   specified for the email channel for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:htmlBody:CampaignEmailMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignEmailMessage_htmlBody</a> - The body of the email, in HTML
--   format, for recipients whose email clients render HTML content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:CampaignEmailMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignEmailMessage_title</a> - The subject line, or title, of the
--   email.
newCampaignEmailMessage :: CampaignEmailMessage

-- | The body of the email for recipients whose email clients don't render
--   HTML content.
campaignEmailMessage_body :: Lens' CampaignEmailMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The verified email address to send the email from. The default address
--   is the FromAddress specified for the email channel for the
--   application.
campaignEmailMessage_fromAddress :: Lens' CampaignEmailMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The body of the email, in HTML format, for recipients whose email
--   clients render HTML content.
campaignEmailMessage_htmlBody :: Lens' CampaignEmailMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The subject line, or title, of the email.
campaignEmailMessage_title :: Lens' CampaignEmailMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the settings for events that cause a campaign to be sent.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignEventFilter</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignEventFilter
CampaignEventFilter' :: FilterType -> EventDimensions -> CampaignEventFilter

-- | The type of event that causes the campaign to be sent. Valid values
--   are: SYSTEM, sends the campaign when a system event occurs; and,
--   ENDPOINT, sends the campaign when an endpoint event (Events resource)
--   occurs.
[$sel:filterType:CampaignEventFilter'] :: CampaignEventFilter -> FilterType

-- | The dimension settings of the event filter for the campaign.
[$sel:dimensions:CampaignEventFilter'] :: CampaignEventFilter -> EventDimensions

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignEventFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filterType:CampaignEventFilter'</a>,
--   <a>campaignEventFilter_filterType</a> - The type of event that causes
--   the campaign to be sent. Valid values are: SYSTEM, sends the campaign
--   when a system event occurs; and, ENDPOINT, sends the campaign when an
--   endpoint event (Events resource) occurs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:CampaignEventFilter'</a>,
--   <a>campaignEventFilter_dimensions</a> - The dimension settings of the
--   event filter for the campaign.
newCampaignEventFilter :: FilterType -> EventDimensions -> CampaignEventFilter

-- | The type of event that causes the campaign to be sent. Valid values
--   are: SYSTEM, sends the campaign when a system event occurs; and,
--   ENDPOINT, sends the campaign when an endpoint event (Events resource)
--   occurs.
campaignEventFilter_filterType :: Lens' CampaignEventFilter FilterType

-- | The dimension settings of the event filter for the campaign.
campaignEventFilter_dimensions :: Lens' CampaignEventFilter EventDimensions

-- | Specifies settings for invoking an AWS Lambda function that customizes
--   a segment for a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignHook</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignHook
CampaignHook' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Mode -> Maybe Text -> CampaignHook

-- | The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function that
--   Amazon Pinpoint invokes to customize a segment for a campaign.
[$sel:lambdaFunctionName:CampaignHook'] :: CampaignHook -> Maybe Text

-- | The mode that Amazon Pinpoint uses to invoke the AWS Lambda function.
--   Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>FILTER - Invoke the function to customize the segment that's used
--   by a campaign.</li>
--   <li>DELIVERY - (Deprecated) Previously, invoked the function to send a
--   campaign through a custom channel. This functionality is not supported
--   anymore. To send a campaign through a custom channel, use the
--   CustomDeliveryConfiguration and CampaignCustomMessage objects of the
--   campaign.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:mode:CampaignHook'] :: CampaignHook -> Maybe Mode

-- | The web URL that Amazon Pinpoint calls to invoke the AWS Lambda
--   function over HTTPS.
[$sel:webUrl:CampaignHook'] :: CampaignHook -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignHook</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lambdaFunctionName:CampaignHook'</a>,
--   <a>campaignHook_lambdaFunctionName</a> - The name or Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function that Amazon Pinpoint invokes to
--   customize a segment for a campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mode:CampaignHook'</a>, <a>campaignHook_mode</a> - The mode
--   that Amazon Pinpoint uses to invoke the AWS Lambda function. Possible
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>FILTER - Invoke the function to customize the segment that's used
--   by a campaign.</li>
--   <li>DELIVERY - (Deprecated) Previously, invoked the function to send a
--   campaign through a custom channel. This functionality is not supported
--   anymore. To send a campaign through a custom channel, use the
--   CustomDeliveryConfiguration and CampaignCustomMessage objects of the
--   campaign.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:webUrl:CampaignHook'</a>, <a>campaignHook_webUrl</a> - The web
--   URL that Amazon Pinpoint calls to invoke the AWS Lambda function over
--   HTTPS.
newCampaignHook :: CampaignHook

-- | The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function that
--   Amazon Pinpoint invokes to customize a segment for a campaign.
campaignHook_lambdaFunctionName :: Lens' CampaignHook (Maybe Text)

-- | The mode that Amazon Pinpoint uses to invoke the AWS Lambda function.
--   Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>FILTER - Invoke the function to customize the segment that's used
--   by a campaign.</li>
--   <li>DELIVERY - (Deprecated) Previously, invoked the function to send a
--   campaign through a custom channel. This functionality is not supported
--   anymore. To send a campaign through a custom channel, use the
--   CustomDeliveryConfiguration and CampaignCustomMessage objects of the
--   campaign.</li>
--   </ul>
campaignHook_mode :: Lens' CampaignHook (Maybe Mode)

-- | The web URL that Amazon Pinpoint calls to invoke the AWS Lambda
--   function over HTTPS.
campaignHook_webUrl :: Lens' CampaignHook (Maybe Text)

data CampaignInAppMessage

[$sel:layout:CampaignInAppMessage'] :: CampaignInAppMessage -> Maybe Layout

--   message.
[$sel:body:CampaignInAppMessage'] :: CampaignInAppMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | In-app message content.
[$sel:content:CampaignInAppMessage'] :: CampaignInAppMessage -> Maybe [InAppMessageContent]

[$sel:customConfig:CampaignInAppMessage'] :: CampaignInAppMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

--   notification, the email body or the text message.

--

newCampaignInAppMessage :: CampaignInAppMessage

campaignInAppMessage_customConfig :: Lens' CampaignInAppMessage (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | For a campaign, specifies limits on the messages that the campaign can
--   send. For an application, specifies the default limits for messages
--   that campaigns in the application can send.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignLimits</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignLimits
CampaignLimits' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> CampaignLimits

-- | The maximum number of messages that a campaign can send each second.
--   For an application, this value specifies the default limit for the
--   number of messages that campaigns can send each second. The minimum
--   value is 50. The maximum value is 20,000.
[$sel:messagesPerSecond:CampaignLimits'] :: CampaignLimits -> Maybe Int

-- | The maximum number of messages that a campaign can send to a single
--   endpoint during a 24-hour period. For an application, this value
--   specifies the default limit for the number of messages that campaigns
--   and journeys can send to a single endpoint during a 24-hour period.
--   The maximum value is 100.
[$sel:daily:CampaignLimits'] :: CampaignLimits -> Maybe Int

-- | The maximum number of messages that a campaign can send to a single
--   endpoint during the course of the campaign. If a campaign recurs, this
--   setting applies to all runs of the campaign. The maximum value is 100.
[$sel:total:CampaignLimits'] :: CampaignLimits -> Maybe Int

-- | The maximum total number of messages that the campaign can send per
--   user session.
[$sel:session:CampaignLimits'] :: CampaignLimits -> Maybe Int

-- | The maximum amount of time, in seconds, that a campaign can attempt to
--   deliver a message after the scheduled start time for the campaign. The
--   minimum value is 60 seconds.
[$sel:maximumDuration:CampaignLimits'] :: CampaignLimits -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignLimits</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:messagesPerSecond:CampaignLimits'</a>,
--   <a>campaignLimits_messagesPerSecond</a> - The maximum number of
--   messages that a campaign can send each second. For an application,
--   this value specifies the default limit for the number of messages that
--   campaigns can send each second. The minimum value is 50. The maximum
--   value is 20,000.
--   
--   <a>$sel:daily:CampaignLimits'</a>, <a>campaignLimits_daily</a> - The
--   maximum number of messages that a campaign can send to a single
--   endpoint during a 24-hour period. For an application, this value
--   specifies the default limit for the number of messages that campaigns
--   and journeys can send to a single endpoint during a 24-hour period.
--   The maximum value is 100.
--   
--   <a>$sel:total:CampaignLimits'</a>, <a>campaignLimits_total</a> - The
--   maximum number of messages that a campaign can send to a single
--   endpoint during the course of the campaign. If a campaign recurs, this
--   setting applies to all runs of the campaign. The maximum value is 100.
--   
--   <a>$sel:session:CampaignLimits'</a>, <a>campaignLimits_session</a> -
--   The maximum total number of messages that the campaign can send per
--   user session.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumDuration:CampaignLimits'</a>,
--   <a>campaignLimits_maximumDuration</a> - The maximum amount of time, in
--   seconds, that a campaign can attempt to deliver a message after the
--   scheduled start time for the campaign. The minimum value is 60
--   seconds.
newCampaignLimits :: CampaignLimits

-- | The maximum number of messages that a campaign can send each second.
--   For an application, this value specifies the default limit for the
--   number of messages that campaigns can send each second. The minimum
--   value is 50. The maximum value is 20,000.
campaignLimits_messagesPerSecond :: Lens' CampaignLimits (Maybe Int)

-- | The maximum number of messages that a campaign can send to a single
--   endpoint during a 24-hour period. For an application, this value
--   specifies the default limit for the number of messages that campaigns
--   and journeys can send to a single endpoint during a 24-hour period.
--   The maximum value is 100.
campaignLimits_daily :: Lens' CampaignLimits (Maybe Int)

-- | The maximum number of messages that a campaign can send to a single
--   endpoint during the course of the campaign. If a campaign recurs, this
--   setting applies to all runs of the campaign. The maximum value is 100.
campaignLimits_total :: Lens' CampaignLimits (Maybe Int)

-- | The maximum total number of messages that the campaign can send per
--   user session.
campaignLimits_session :: Lens' CampaignLimits (Maybe Int)

-- | The maximum amount of time, in seconds, that a campaign can attempt to
--   deliver a message after the scheduled start time for the campaign. The
--   minimum value is 60 seconds.
campaignLimits_maximumDuration :: Lens' CampaignLimits (Maybe Int)

-- | Provides information about the status, configuration, and other
--   settings for a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignResponse
CampaignResponse' :: Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration -> Maybe CampaignState -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Schedule -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration -> Maybe CampaignHook -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CampaignLimits -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe CampaignState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MessageConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [TreatmentResource] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CampaignResponse

-- | The delivery configuration settings for sending the campaign through a
--   custom channel.
[$sel:customDeliveryConfiguration:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration

-- | The current status of the campaign.
[$sel:state:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe CampaignState

-- | Defines the priority of the campaign, used to decide the order of
--   messages displayed to user if there are multiple messages scheduled to
--   be displayed at the same moment.
[$sel:priority:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The schedule settings for the campaign.
[$sel:schedule:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe Schedule

-- | The message template that’s used for the campaign.
[$sel:templateConfiguration:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration

-- | The settings for the AWS Lambda function to use as a code hook for the
--   campaign. You can use this hook to customize the segment that's used
--   by the campaign.
[$sel:hook:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe CampaignHook

-- | The custom name of the default treatment for the campaign, if the
--   campaign has multiple treatments. A <i>treatment</i> is a variation of
--   a campaign that's used for A/B testing.
[$sel:treatmentName:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The messaging limits for the campaign.
[$sel:limits:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe CampaignLimits

-- | Specifies whether the campaign is paused. A paused campaign doesn't
--   run unless you resume it by changing this value to false.
[$sel:isPaused:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The current status of the campaign's default treatment. This value
--   exists only for campaigns that have more than one treatment.
[$sel:defaultState:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe CampaignState

-- | The name of the campaign.
[$sel:name:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The version number of the campaign.
[$sel:version:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The allocated percentage of users (segment members) who shouldn't
--   receive messages from the campaign.
[$sel:holdoutPercent:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The custom description of the default treatment for the campaign.
[$sel:treatmentDescription:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The message configuration settings for the campaign.
[$sel:messageConfiguration:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe MessageConfiguration

-- | The custom description of the campaign.
[$sel:description:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of responses, one for each treatment that you defined for the
--   campaign, in addition to the default treatment.
[$sel:additionalTreatments:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe [TreatmentResource]

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags
--   that are associated with the campaign. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the campaign was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the campaign was created.
[$sel:creationDate:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the segment that's associated with the
--   campaign.
[$sel:segmentId:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Text

-- | The version number of the segment that's associated with the campaign.
[$sel:segmentVersion:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Int

-- | The unique identifier for the campaign.
[$sel:id:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the campaign.
[$sel:arn:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the campaign applies
--   to.
[$sel:applicationId:CampaignResponse'] :: CampaignResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:customDeliveryConfiguration:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_customDeliveryConfiguration</a> - The delivery
--   configuration settings for sending the campaign through a custom
--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_state</a> -
--   The current status of the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:priority:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_priority</a> - Defines the priority of the
--   campaign, used to decide the order of messages displayed to user if
--   there are multiple messages scheduled to be displayed at the same
--   moment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schedule:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_schedule</a> - The schedule settings for the
--   campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateConfiguration:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_templateConfiguration</a> - The message template
--   that’s used for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hook:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_hook</a> - The
--   settings for the AWS Lambda function to use as a code hook for the
--   campaign. You can use this hook to customize the segment that's used
--   by the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatmentName:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_treatmentName</a> - The custom name of the default
--   treatment for the campaign, if the campaign has multiple treatments. A
--   <i>treatment</i> is a variation of a campaign that's used for A/B
--   testing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limits:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_limits</a> -
--   The messaging limits for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isPaused:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_isPaused</a> - Specifies whether the campaign is
--   paused. A paused campaign doesn't run unless you resume it by changing
--   this value to false.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultState:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_defaultState</a> - The current status of the
--   campaign's default treatment. This value exists only for campaigns
--   that have more than one treatment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_name</a> - The
--   name of the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_version</a>
--   - The version number of the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:holdoutPercent:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_holdoutPercent</a> - The allocated percentage of
--   users (segment members) who shouldn't receive messages from the
--   campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatmentDescription:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_treatmentDescription</a> - The custom description
--   of the default treatment for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfiguration:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_messageConfiguration</a> - The message
--   configuration settings for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_description</a> - The custom description of the
--   campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalTreatments:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_additionalTreatments</a> - An array of responses,
--   one for each treatment that you defined for the campaign, in addition
--   to the default treatment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_tags</a> - A
--   string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags that
--   are associated with the campaign. Each tag consists of a required tag
--   key and an associated tag value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the campaign was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601 format,
--   when the campaign was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentId:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_segmentId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   segment that's associated with the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentVersion:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_segmentVersion</a> - The version number of the
--   segment that's associated with the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application that the campaign applies to.
newCampaignResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CampaignResponse

-- | The delivery configuration settings for sending the campaign through a
--   custom channel.
campaignResponse_customDeliveryConfiguration :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration)

-- | The current status of the campaign.
campaignResponse_state :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe CampaignState)

-- | Defines the priority of the campaign, used to decide the order of
--   messages displayed to user if there are multiple messages scheduled to
--   be displayed at the same moment.
campaignResponse_priority :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The schedule settings for the campaign.
campaignResponse_schedule :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe Schedule)

-- | The message template that’s used for the campaign.
campaignResponse_templateConfiguration :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe TemplateConfiguration)

-- | The settings for the AWS Lambda function to use as a code hook for the
--   campaign. You can use this hook to customize the segment that's used
--   by the campaign.
campaignResponse_hook :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe CampaignHook)

-- | The custom name of the default treatment for the campaign, if the
--   campaign has multiple treatments. A <i>treatment</i> is a variation of
--   a campaign that's used for A/B testing.
campaignResponse_treatmentName :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The messaging limits for the campaign.
campaignResponse_limits :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe CampaignLimits)

-- | Specifies whether the campaign is paused. A paused campaign doesn't
--   run unless you resume it by changing this value to false.
campaignResponse_isPaused :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The current status of the campaign's default treatment. This value
--   exists only for campaigns that have more than one treatment.
campaignResponse_defaultState :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe CampaignState)

-- | The name of the campaign.
campaignResponse_name :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The version number of the campaign.
campaignResponse_version :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The allocated percentage of users (segment members) who shouldn't
--   receive messages from the campaign.
campaignResponse_holdoutPercent :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The custom description of the default treatment for the campaign.
campaignResponse_treatmentDescription :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The message configuration settings for the campaign.
campaignResponse_messageConfiguration :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe MessageConfiguration)

-- | The custom description of the campaign.
campaignResponse_description :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of responses, one for each treatment that you defined for the
--   campaign, in addition to the default treatment.
campaignResponse_additionalTreatments :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe [TreatmentResource])

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags
--   that are associated with the campaign. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
campaignResponse_tags :: Lens' CampaignResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the campaign was last modified.
campaignResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' CampaignResponse Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the campaign was created.
campaignResponse_creationDate :: Lens' CampaignResponse Text

-- | The unique identifier for the segment that's associated with the
--   campaign.
campaignResponse_segmentId :: Lens' CampaignResponse Text

-- | The version number of the segment that's associated with the campaign.
campaignResponse_segmentVersion :: Lens' CampaignResponse Int

-- | The unique identifier for the campaign.
campaignResponse_id :: Lens' CampaignResponse Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the campaign.
campaignResponse_arn :: Lens' CampaignResponse Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the campaign applies
--   to.
campaignResponse_applicationId :: Lens' CampaignResponse Text

-- | Specifies the content and settings for an SMS message that's sent to
--   recipients of a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignSmsMessage</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignSmsMessage
CampaignSmsMessage' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MessageType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CampaignSmsMessage

-- | The long code to send the SMS message from. This value should be one
--   of the dedicated long codes that's assigned to your AWS account.
--   Although it isn't required, we recommend that you specify the long
--   code using an E.164 format to ensure prompt and accurate delivery of
--   the message. For example, +12065550100.
[$sel:originationNumber:CampaignSmsMessage'] :: CampaignSmsMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The template ID received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in
--   your country.
[$sel:templateId:CampaignSmsMessage'] :: CampaignSmsMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The body of the SMS message.
[$sel:body:CampaignSmsMessage'] :: CampaignSmsMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The SMS message type. Valid values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages
--   that are critical or time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and
--   PROMOTIONAL (for messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive,
--   such as marketing messages).
[$sel:messageType:CampaignSmsMessage'] :: CampaignSmsMessage -> Maybe MessageType

-- | The sender ID to display on recipients' devices when they receive the
--   SMS message.
[$sel:senderId:CampaignSmsMessage'] :: CampaignSmsMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The entity ID or Principal Entity (PE) id received from the regulatory
--   body for sending SMS in your country.
[$sel:entityId:CampaignSmsMessage'] :: CampaignSmsMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignSmsMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:originationNumber:CampaignSmsMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignSmsMessage_originationNumber</a> - The long code to send
--   the SMS message from. This value should be one of the dedicated long
--   codes that's assigned to your AWS account. Although it isn't required,
--   we recommend that you specify the long code using an E.164 format to
--   ensure prompt and accurate delivery of the message. For example,
--   +12065550100.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateId:CampaignSmsMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignSmsMessage_templateId</a> - The template ID received from
--   the regulatory body for sending SMS in your country.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:CampaignSmsMessage'</a>, <a>campaignSmsMessage_body</a> -
--   The body of the SMS message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageType:CampaignSmsMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignSmsMessage_messageType</a> - The SMS message type. Valid
--   values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages that are critical or
--   time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and PROMOTIONAL (for
--   messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive, such as marketing
--   messages).
--   
--   <a>$sel:senderId:CampaignSmsMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignSmsMessage_senderId</a> - The sender ID to display on
--   recipients' devices when they receive the SMS message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entityId:CampaignSmsMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignSmsMessage_entityId</a> - The entity ID or Principal Entity
--   (PE) id received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in your
--   country.
newCampaignSmsMessage :: CampaignSmsMessage

-- | The long code to send the SMS message from. This value should be one
--   of the dedicated long codes that's assigned to your AWS account.
--   Although it isn't required, we recommend that you specify the long
--   code using an E.164 format to ensure prompt and accurate delivery of
--   the message. For example, +12065550100.
campaignSmsMessage_originationNumber :: Lens' CampaignSmsMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The template ID received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in
--   your country.
campaignSmsMessage_templateId :: Lens' CampaignSmsMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The body of the SMS message.
campaignSmsMessage_body :: Lens' CampaignSmsMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The SMS message type. Valid values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages
--   that are critical or time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and
--   PROMOTIONAL (for messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive,
--   such as marketing messages).
campaignSmsMessage_messageType :: Lens' CampaignSmsMessage (Maybe MessageType)

-- | The sender ID to display on recipients' devices when they receive the
--   SMS message.
campaignSmsMessage_senderId :: Lens' CampaignSmsMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The entity ID or Principal Entity (PE) id received from the regulatory
--   body for sending SMS in your country.
campaignSmsMessage_entityId :: Lens' CampaignSmsMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides information about the status of a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignState</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignState
CampaignState' :: Maybe CampaignStatus -> CampaignState

-- | The current status of the campaign, or the current status of a
--   treatment that belongs to an A/B test campaign.
--   
--   If a campaign uses A/B testing, the campaign has a status of COMPLETED
--   only if all campaign treatments have a status of COMPLETED. If you
--   delete the segment that's associated with a campaign, the campaign
--   fails and has a status of DELETED.
[$sel:campaignStatus:CampaignState'] :: CampaignState -> Maybe CampaignStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignState</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:campaignStatus:CampaignState'</a>,
--   <a>campaignState_campaignStatus</a> - The current status of the
--   campaign, or the current status of a treatment that belongs to an A/B
--   test campaign.
--   
--   If a campaign uses A/B testing, the campaign has a status of COMPLETED
--   only if all campaign treatments have a status of COMPLETED. If you
--   delete the segment that's associated with a campaign, the campaign
--   fails and has a status of DELETED.
newCampaignState :: CampaignState

-- | The current status of the campaign, or the current status of a
--   treatment that belongs to an A/B test campaign.
--   
--   If a campaign uses A/B testing, the campaign has a status of COMPLETED
--   only if all campaign treatments have a status of COMPLETED. If you
--   delete the segment that's associated with a campaign, the campaign
--   fails and has a status of DELETED.
campaignState_campaignStatus :: Lens' CampaignState (Maybe CampaignStatus)

-- | Provides information about the configuration and other settings for
--   all the campaigns that are associated with an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignsResponse
CampaignsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> [CampaignResponse] -> CampaignsResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
[$sel:nextToken:CampaignsResponse'] :: CampaignsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of responses, one for each campaign that's associated with
--   the application.
[$sel:item:CampaignsResponse'] :: CampaignsResponse -> [CampaignResponse]

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:CampaignsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignsResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use in a subsequent
--   request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This
--   value is null if there are no additional pages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:CampaignsResponse'</a>, <a>campaignsResponse_item</a> -
--   An array of responses, one for each campaign that's associated with
--   the application.
newCampaignsResponse :: CampaignsResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
campaignsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' CampaignsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of responses, one for each campaign that's associated with
--   the application.
campaignsResponse_item :: Lens' CampaignsResponse [CampaignResponse]

-- | Provides information about the general settings and status of a
--   channel for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ChannelResponse
ChannelResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> ChannelResponse

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the channel was last
--   modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:ChannelResponse'] :: ChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the channel is enabled for the application.
[$sel:enabled:ChannelResponse'] :: ChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether the channel is archived.
[$sel:isArchived:ChannelResponse'] :: ChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The unique identifier for the application.
[$sel:applicationId:ChannelResponse'] :: ChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The current version of the channel.
[$sel:version:ChannelResponse'] :: ChannelResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the channel. This property is retained
--   only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:id:ChannelResponse'] :: ChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the channel was enabled.
[$sel:creationDate:ChannelResponse'] :: ChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The user who last modified the channel.
[$sel:lastModifiedBy:ChannelResponse'] :: ChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:hasCredential:ChannelResponse'] :: ChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>ChannelResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:ChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>channelResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date and time, in ISO
--   8601 format, when the channel was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:ChannelResponse'</a>, <a>channelResponse_enabled</a> -
--   Specifies whether the channel is enabled for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isArchived:ChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>channelResponse_isArchived</a> - Specifies whether the channel is
--   archived.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:ChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>channelResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:ChannelResponse'</a>, <a>channelResponse_version</a> -
--   The current version of the channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ChannelResponse'</a>, <a>channelResponse_id</a> -
--   (Deprecated) An identifier for the channel. This property is retained
--   only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:ChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>channelResponse_creationDate</a> - The date and time, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the channel was enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedBy:ChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>channelResponse_lastModifiedBy</a> - The user who last modified the
--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasCredential:ChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>channelResponse_hasCredential</a> - (Not used) This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
newChannelResponse :: ChannelResponse

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the channel was last
--   modified.
channelResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' ChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the channel is enabled for the application.
channelResponse_enabled :: Lens' ChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether the channel is archived.
channelResponse_isArchived :: Lens' ChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The unique identifier for the application.
channelResponse_applicationId :: Lens' ChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The current version of the channel.
channelResponse_version :: Lens' ChannelResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the channel. This property is retained
--   only for backward compatibility.
channelResponse_id :: Lens' ChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the channel was enabled.
channelResponse_creationDate :: Lens' ChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The user who last modified the channel.
channelResponse_lastModifiedBy :: Lens' ChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
channelResponse_hasCredential :: Lens' ChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | Provides information about the general settings and status of all
--   channels for an application, including channels that aren't enabled
--   for the application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newChannelsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ChannelsResponse
ChannelsResponse' :: HashMap Text ChannelResponse -> ChannelsResponse

-- | A map that contains a multipart response for each channel. For each
--   item in this object, the ChannelType is the key and the Channel is the
--   value.
[$sel:channels:ChannelsResponse'] :: ChannelsResponse -> HashMap Text ChannelResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>ChannelsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:channels:ChannelsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>channelsResponse_channels</a> - A map that contains a multipart
--   response for each channel. For each item in this object, the
--   ChannelType is the key and the Channel is the value.
newChannelsResponse :: ChannelsResponse

-- | A map that contains a multipart response for each channel. For each
--   item in this object, the ChannelType is the key and the Channel is the
--   value.
channelsResponse_channels :: Lens' ChannelsResponse (HashMap Text ChannelResponse)

-- | Specifies the conditions to evaluate for an activity in a journey, and
--   how to evaluate those conditions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCondition</a> smart constructor.
data Condition
Condition' :: Maybe Operator -> Maybe [SimpleCondition] -> Condition

-- | Specifies how to handle multiple conditions for the activity. For
--   example, if you specify two conditions for an activity, whether both
--   or only one of the conditions must be met for the activity to be
--   performed.
[$sel:operator:Condition'] :: Condition -> Maybe Operator

-- | The conditions to evaluate for the activity.
[$sel:conditions:Condition'] :: Condition -> Maybe [SimpleCondition]

-- | Create a value of <a>Condition</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:operator:Condition'</a>, <a>condition_operator</a> - Specifies
--   how to handle multiple conditions for the activity. For example, if
--   you specify two conditions for an activity, whether both or only one
--   of the conditions must be met for the activity to be performed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:conditions:Condition'</a>, <a>condition_conditions</a> - The
--   conditions to evaluate for the activity.
newCondition :: Condition

-- | Specifies how to handle multiple conditions for the activity. For
--   example, if you specify two conditions for an activity, whether both
--   or only one of the conditions must be met for the activity to be
--   performed.
condition_operator :: Lens' Condition (Maybe Operator)

-- | The conditions to evaluate for the activity.
condition_conditions :: Lens' Condition (Maybe [SimpleCondition])

-- | Specifies the settings for a yes/no split activity in a journey. This
--   type of activity sends participants down one of two paths in a
--   journey, based on conditions that you specify.
--   
--   To create yes/no split activities that send participants down
--   different paths based on push notification events (such as Open or
--   Received events), your mobile app has to specify the User ID and
--   Endpoint ID values. For more information, see <a>Integrating Amazon
--   Pinpoint with your application</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint Developer
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newConditionalSplitActivity</a> smart constructor.
data ConditionalSplitActivity
ConditionalSplitActivity' :: Maybe WaitTime -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Condition -> ConditionalSplitActivity

-- | The amount of time to wait before determining whether the conditions
--   are met, or the date and time when Amazon Pinpoint determines whether
--   the conditions are met.
[$sel:evaluationWaitTime:ConditionalSplitActivity'] :: ConditionalSplitActivity -> Maybe WaitTime

-- | The unique identifier for the activity to perform if the conditions
--   are met.
[$sel:trueActivity:ConditionalSplitActivity'] :: ConditionalSplitActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the activity to perform if the conditions
--   aren't met.
[$sel:falseActivity:ConditionalSplitActivity'] :: ConditionalSplitActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The conditions that define the paths for the activity, and the
--   relationship between the conditions.
[$sel:condition:ConditionalSplitActivity'] :: ConditionalSplitActivity -> Maybe Condition

-- | Create a value of <a>ConditionalSplitActivity</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:evaluationWaitTime:ConditionalSplitActivity'</a>,
--   <a>conditionalSplitActivity_evaluationWaitTime</a> - The amount of
--   time to wait before determining whether the conditions are met, or the
--   date and time when Amazon Pinpoint determines whether the conditions
--   are met.
--   
--   <a>$sel:trueActivity:ConditionalSplitActivity'</a>,
--   <a>conditionalSplitActivity_trueActivity</a> - The unique identifier
--   for the activity to perform if the conditions are met.
--   
--   <a>$sel:falseActivity:ConditionalSplitActivity'</a>,
--   <a>conditionalSplitActivity_falseActivity</a> - The unique identifier
--   for the activity to perform if the conditions aren't met.
--   
--   <a>$sel:condition:ConditionalSplitActivity'</a>,
--   <a>conditionalSplitActivity_condition</a> - The conditions that define
--   the paths for the activity, and the relationship between the
--   conditions.
newConditionalSplitActivity :: ConditionalSplitActivity

-- | The amount of time to wait before determining whether the conditions
--   are met, or the date and time when Amazon Pinpoint determines whether
--   the conditions are met.
conditionalSplitActivity_evaluationWaitTime :: Lens' ConditionalSplitActivity (Maybe WaitTime)

-- | The unique identifier for the activity to perform if the conditions
--   are met.
conditionalSplitActivity_trueActivity :: Lens' ConditionalSplitActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the activity to perform if the conditions
--   aren't met.
conditionalSplitActivity_falseActivity :: Lens' ConditionalSplitActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | The conditions that define the paths for the activity, and the
--   relationship between the conditions.
conditionalSplitActivity_condition :: Lens' ConditionalSplitActivity (Maybe Condition)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newContactCenterActivity</a> smart constructor.
data ContactCenterActivity
ContactCenterActivity' :: Maybe Text -> ContactCenterActivity

--   activity.
contactCenterActivity_nextActivity :: Lens' ContactCenterActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the display name of an application and the tags to associate
--   with the application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateApplicationRequest</a> smart constructor.
data CreateApplicationRequest
CreateApplicationRequest' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> CreateApplicationRequest

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the application. Each tag consists of a required tag
--   key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:CreateApplicationRequest'] :: CreateApplicationRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The display name of the application. This name is displayed as the
--   <b>Project name</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
[$sel:name:CreateApplicationRequest'] :: CreateApplicationRequest -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateApplicationRequest</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateApplicationRequest'</a>,
--   <a>createApplicationRequest_tags</a> - A string-to-string map of
--   key-value pairs that defines the tags to associate with the
--   application. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated
--   tag value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateApplicationRequest'</a>,
--   <a>createApplicationRequest_name</a> - The display name of the
--   application. This name is displayed as the <b>Project name</b> on the
--   Amazon Pinpoint console.
newCreateApplicationRequest :: Text -> CreateApplicationRequest

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the application. Each tag consists of a required tag
--   key and an associated tag value.
createApplicationRequest_tags :: Lens' CreateApplicationRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The display name of the application. This name is displayed as the
--   <b>Project name</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
createApplicationRequest_name :: Lens' CreateApplicationRequest Text

-- | Specifies Amazon Pinpoint configuration settings for retrieving and
--   processing recommendation data from a recommender model.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateRecommenderConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateRecommenderConfiguration
CreateRecommenderConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Text -> Text -> CreateRecommenderConfiguration

-- | The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function to
--   invoke for additional processing of recommendation data that's
--   retrieved from the recommender model.
[$sel:recommendationTransformerUri:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: CreateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | A custom display name for the standard endpoint or user attribute
--   (RecommendationItems) that temporarily stores recommended items for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This value is required if the
--   configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda function
--   (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data.
--   
--   This name appears in the <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template
--   editor on the Amazon Pinpoint console. The name can contain up to 25
--   characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-). These restrictions don't apply to
--   attribute values.
[$sel:recommendationsDisplayName:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: CreateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of Amazon Pinpoint ID to associate with unique user IDs in
--   the recommender model. This value enables the model to use attribute
--   and event data that’s specific to a particular endpoint or user in an
--   Amazon Pinpoint application. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PINPOINT_ENDPOINT_ID - Associate each user in the model with a
--   particular endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based
--   on endpoint IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. This is the default value.</li>
--   <li>PINPOINT_USER_ID - Associate each user in the model with a
--   particular user and endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is
--   correlated based on user IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. If you specify this
--   value, an endpoint definition in Amazon Pinpoint has to specify both a
--   user ID (UserId) and an endpoint ID. Otherwise, messages won’t be sent
--   to the user's endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:recommendationProviderIdType:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: CreateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | A map of key-value pairs that defines 1-10 custom endpoint or user
--   attributes, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. Each of these attributes
--   temporarily stores a recommended item that's retrieved from the
--   recommender model and sent to an AWS Lambda function for additional
--   processing. Each attribute can be used as a message variable in a
--   message template.
--   
--   In the map, the key is the name of a custom attribute and the value is
--   a custom display name for that attribute. The display name appears in
--   the <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template editor on the Amazon
--   Pinpoint console. The following restrictions apply to these names:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>An attribute name must start with a letter or number and it can
--   contain up to 50 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Attribute names are case sensitive
--   and must be unique.</li>
--   <li>An attribute display name must start with a letter or number and
--   it can contain up to 25 characters. The characters can be letters,
--   numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This object is required if the configuration invokes an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to process recommendation
--   data. Otherwise, don't include this object in your request.
[$sel:attributes:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: CreateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | A custom name of the configuration for the recommender model. The name
--   must start with a letter or number and it can contain up to 128
--   characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-).
[$sel:name:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: CreateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | A custom description of the configuration for the recommender model.
--   The description can contain up to 128 characters. The characters can
--   be letters, numbers, spaces, or the following symbols: _ ; () , ‐.
[$sel:description:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: CreateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of recommended items to retrieve from the model for each
--   endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This number determines how many
--   recommended items are available for use in message variables. The
--   minimum value is 1. The maximum value is 5. The default value is 5.
--   
--   To use multiple recommended items and custom attributes with message
--   variables, you have to use an AWS Lambda function
--   (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data.
[$sel:recommendationsPerMessage:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: CreateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender model to retrieve
--   recommendation data from. This value must match the ARN of an Amazon
--   Personalize campaign.
[$sel:recommendationProviderUri:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: CreateRecommenderConfiguration -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to retrieve
--   recommendation data from the recommender model.
[$sel:recommendationProviderRoleArn:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: CreateRecommenderConfiguration -> Text

CreateTemplateMessageBody' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CreateTemplateMessageBody

--   created.

--   message template.
