-- | Specifies the delivery configuration settings for sending a campaign
--   or campaign treatment through a custom channel. This object is
--   required if you use the CampaignCustomMessage object to define the
--   message to send for the campaign or campaign treatment.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomDeliveryConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data CustomDeliveryConfiguration
CustomDeliveryConfiguration' :: Maybe [EndpointTypesElement] -> Text -> CustomDeliveryConfiguration

-- | The types of endpoints to send the campaign or treatment to. Each
--   valid value maps to a type of channel that you can associate with an
--   endpoint by using the ChannelType property of an endpoint.
[$sel:endpointTypes:CustomDeliveryConfiguration'] :: CustomDeliveryConfiguration -> Maybe [EndpointTypesElement]

-- | The destination to send the campaign or treatment to. This value can
--   be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Lambda function
--   to invoke to handle delivery of the campaign or treatment.</li>
--   <li>The URL for a web application or service that supports HTTPS and
--   can receive the message. The URL has to be a full URL, including the
--   HTTPS protocol.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:deliveryUri:CustomDeliveryConfiguration'] :: CustomDeliveryConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CustomDeliveryConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointTypes:CustomDeliveryConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>customDeliveryConfiguration_endpointTypes</a> - The types of
--   endpoints to send the campaign or treatment to. Each valid value maps
--   to a type of channel that you can associate with an endpoint by using
--   the ChannelType property of an endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryUri:CustomDeliveryConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>customDeliveryConfiguration_deliveryUri</a> - The destination to
--   send the campaign or treatment to. This value can be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Lambda function
--   to invoke to handle delivery of the campaign or treatment.</li>
--   <li>The URL for a web application or service that supports HTTPS and
--   can receive the message. The URL has to be a full URL, including the
--   HTTPS protocol.</li>
--   </ul>
newCustomDeliveryConfiguration :: Text -> CustomDeliveryConfiguration

-- | The types of endpoints to send the campaign or treatment to. Each
--   valid value maps to a type of channel that you can associate with an
--   endpoint by using the ChannelType property of an endpoint.
customDeliveryConfiguration_endpointTypes :: Lens' CustomDeliveryConfiguration (Maybe [EndpointTypesElement])

-- | The destination to send the campaign or treatment to. This value can
--   be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Lambda function
--   to invoke to handle delivery of the campaign or treatment.</li>
--   <li>The URL for a web application or service that supports HTTPS and
--   can receive the message. The URL has to be a full URL, including the
--   HTTPS protocol.</li>
--   </ul>
customDeliveryConfiguration_deliveryUri :: Lens' CustomDeliveryConfiguration Text

-- | The settings for a custom message activity. This type of activity
--   calls an AWS Lambda function or web hook that sends messages to
--   participants.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomMessageActivity</a> smart constructor.
data CustomMessageActivity
CustomMessageActivity' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [EndpointTypesElement] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe JourneyCustomMessage -> CustomMessageActivity

-- | The name of the custom message template to use for the message. If
--   specified, this value must match the name of an existing message
--   template.
[$sel:templateName:CustomMessageActivity'] :: CustomMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the message template to use
--   for the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier
--   for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and
--   version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions
--   resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
[$sel:templateVersion:CustomMessageActivity'] :: CustomMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The types of endpoints to send the custom message to. Each valid value
--   maps to a type of channel that you can associate with an endpoint by
--   using the ChannelType property of an endpoint.
[$sel:endpointTypes:CustomMessageActivity'] :: CustomMessageActivity -> Maybe [EndpointTypesElement]

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after Amazon
--   Pinpoint calls the AWS Lambda function or web hook.
[$sel:nextActivity:CustomMessageActivity'] :: CustomMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The destination to send the campaign or treatment to. This value can
--   be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Lambda function
--   to invoke to handle delivery of the campaign or treatment.</li>
--   <li>The URL for a web application or service that supports HTTPS and
--   can receive the message. The URL has to be a full URL, including the
--   HTTPS protocol.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:deliveryUri:CustomMessageActivity'] :: CustomMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the message data included in a custom channel message that's
--   sent to participants in a journey.
[$sel:messageConfig:CustomMessageActivity'] :: CustomMessageActivity -> Maybe JourneyCustomMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>CustomMessageActivity</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:CustomMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>customMessageActivity_templateName</a> - The name of the custom
--   message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must
--   match the name of an existing message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateVersion:CustomMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>customMessageActivity_templateVersion</a> - The unique identifier
--   for the version of the message template to use for the message. If
--   specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing
--   template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version
--   identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointTypes:CustomMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>customMessageActivity_endpointTypes</a> - The types of endpoints to
--   send the custom message to. Each valid value maps to a type of channel
--   that you can associate with an endpoint by using the ChannelType

--   <a>customMessageActivity_nextActivity</a> - The unique identifier for

--   Lambda function or web hook.

--   HTTPS protocol.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfig:CustomMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>customMessageActivity_messageConfig</a> - Specifies the message
--   data included in a custom channel message that's sent to participants
--   in a journey.
newCustomMessageActivity :: CustomMessageActivity

-- | The name of the custom message template to use for the message. If
--   specified, this value must match the name of an existing message
--   template.
customMessageActivity_templateName :: Lens' CustomMessageActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the message template to use

--   for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and
--   version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions

--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently

customMessageActivity_templateVersion :: Lens' CustomMessageActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after Amazon

-- | The destination to send the campaign or treatment to. This value can
--   be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Lambda function
--   to invoke to handle delivery of the campaign or treatment.</li>
--   <li>The URL for a web application or service that supports HTTPS and
--   can receive the message. The URL has to be a full URL, including the
--   HTTPS protocol.</li>
--   </ul>
customMessageActivity_deliveryUri :: Lens' CustomMessageActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the message data included in a custom channel message that's
--   sent to participants in a journey.
customMessageActivity_messageConfig :: Lens' CustomMessageActivity (Maybe JourneyCustomMessage)

-- | Default button configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDefaultButtonConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data DefaultButtonConfiguration
DefaultButtonConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> ButtonAction -> Text -> DefaultButtonConfiguration

-- | Button destination.
[$sel:link:DefaultButtonConfiguration'] :: DefaultButtonConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The background color of the button.
[$sel:backgroundColor:DefaultButtonConfiguration'] :: DefaultButtonConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The border radius of the button.
[$sel:borderRadius:DefaultButtonConfiguration'] :: DefaultButtonConfiguration -> Maybe Int

-- | The text color of the button.
[$sel:textColor:DefaultButtonConfiguration'] :: DefaultButtonConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Action triggered by the button.
[$sel:buttonAction:DefaultButtonConfiguration'] :: DefaultButtonConfiguration -> ButtonAction

-- | Button text.
[$sel:text:DefaultButtonConfiguration'] :: DefaultButtonConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DefaultButtonConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:link:DefaultButtonConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>defaultButtonConfiguration_link</a> - Button destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backgroundColor:DefaultButtonConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>defaultButtonConfiguration_backgroundColor</a> - The background
--   color of the button.
--   
--   <a>$sel:borderRadius:DefaultButtonConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>defaultButtonConfiguration_borderRadius</a> - The border radius of
--   the button.
--   
--   <a>$sel:textColor:DefaultButtonConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>defaultButtonConfiguration_textColor</a> - The text color of the
--   button.
--   
--   <a>$sel:buttonAction:DefaultButtonConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>defaultButtonConfiguration_buttonAction</a> - Action triggered by
--   the button.
--   
--   <a>$sel:text:DefaultButtonConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>defaultButtonConfiguration_text</a> - Button text.
newDefaultButtonConfiguration :: ButtonAction -> Text -> DefaultButtonConfiguration

-- | Button destination.
defaultButtonConfiguration_link :: Lens' DefaultButtonConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The background color of the button.
defaultButtonConfiguration_backgroundColor :: Lens' DefaultButtonConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The border radius of the button.
defaultButtonConfiguration_borderRadius :: Lens' DefaultButtonConfiguration (Maybe Int)

-- | The text color of the button.
defaultButtonConfiguration_textColor :: Lens' DefaultButtonConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Action triggered by the button.
defaultButtonConfiguration_buttonAction :: Lens' DefaultButtonConfiguration ButtonAction

-- | Button text.
defaultButtonConfiguration_text :: Lens' DefaultButtonConfiguration Text

-- | Specifies the default message for all channels.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDefaultMessage</a> smart constructor.
data DefaultMessage
DefaultMessage' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> DefaultMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the message. You can override
--   these default variables with individual address variables.
[$sel:substitutions:DefaultMessage'] :: DefaultMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | The default body of the message.
[$sel:body:DefaultMessage'] :: DefaultMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DefaultMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:DefaultMessage'</a>,
--   <a>defaultMessage_substitutions</a> - The default message variables to
--   use in the message. You can override these default variables with
--   individual address variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:DefaultMessage'</a>, <a>defaultMessage_body</a> - The
--   default body of the message.
newDefaultMessage :: DefaultMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the message. You can override
--   these default variables with individual address variables.
defaultMessage_substitutions :: Lens' DefaultMessage (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | The default body of the message.
defaultMessage_body :: Lens' DefaultMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the default settings and content for a push notification
--   that's sent directly to an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDefaultPushNotificationMessage</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DefaultPushNotificationMessage
DefaultPushNotificationMessage' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Text -> DefaultPushNotificationMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the notification message. You
--   can override the default variables with individual address variables.
[$sel:substitutions:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'] :: DefaultPushNotificationMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | Specifies whether the default notification is a silent push
--   notification, which is a push notification that doesn't display on a
--   recipient's device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases
--   such as updating an app's configuration or delivering messages to an
--   in-app notification center.
[$sel:silentPush:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'] :: DefaultPushNotificationMessage -> Maybe Bool

-- | The JSON data payload to use for the default push notification, if the
--   notification is a silent push notification. This payload is added to
--   the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.
[$sel:data':DefaultPushNotificationMessage'] :: DefaultPushNotificationMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The default body of the notification message.
[$sel:body:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'] :: DefaultPushNotificationMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The default URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action
--   property is URL.
[$sel:url:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'] :: DefaultPushNotificationMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The default action to occur if a recipient taps the push notification.
--   Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   the iOS and Android platforms.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:action:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'] :: DefaultPushNotificationMessage -> Maybe Action

-- | The default title to display above the notification message on a
--   recipient's device.
[$sel:title:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'] :: DefaultPushNotificationMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DefaultPushNotificationMessage</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationMessage_substitutions</a> - The default
--   message variables to use in the notification message. You can override
--   the default variables with individual address variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:silentPush:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationMessage_silentPush</a> - Specifies whether
--   the default notification is a silent push notification, which is a
--   push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's device. Silent
--   push notifications can be used for cases such as updating an app's
--   configuration or delivering messages to an in-app notification center.
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':DefaultPushNotificationMessage'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationMessage_data</a> - The JSON data payload to
--   use for the default push notification, if the notification is a silent
--   push notification. This payload is added to the data.pinpoint.jsonBody
--   object of the notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationMessage_body</a> - The default body of the
--   notification message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationMessage_url</a> - The default URL to open in
--   a recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push
--   notification and the value of the Action property is URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationMessage_action</a> - The default action to
--   occur if a recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   the iOS and Android platforms.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationMessage_title</a> - The default title to
--   display above the notification message on a recipient's device.
newDefaultPushNotificationMessage :: DefaultPushNotificationMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the notification message. You
--   can override the default variables with individual address variables.
defaultPushNotificationMessage_substitutions :: Lens' DefaultPushNotificationMessage (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | Specifies whether the default notification is a silent push
--   notification, which is a push notification that doesn't display on a
--   recipient's device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases
--   such as updating an app's configuration or delivering messages to an
--   in-app notification center.
defaultPushNotificationMessage_silentPush :: Lens' DefaultPushNotificationMessage (Maybe Bool)

-- | The JSON data payload to use for the default push notification, if the
--   notification is a silent push notification. This payload is added to
--   the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.
defaultPushNotificationMessage_data :: Lens' DefaultPushNotificationMessage (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The default body of the notification message.
defaultPushNotificationMessage_body :: Lens' DefaultPushNotificationMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The default URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action
--   property is URL.
defaultPushNotificationMessage_url :: Lens' DefaultPushNotificationMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The default action to occur if a recipient taps the push notification.
--   Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   the iOS and Android platforms.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
defaultPushNotificationMessage_action :: Lens' DefaultPushNotificationMessage (Maybe Action)

-- | The default title to display above the notification message on a
--   recipient's device.
defaultPushNotificationMessage_title :: Lens' DefaultPushNotificationMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the default settings and content for a message template that
--   can be used in messages that are sent through a push notification
--   channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDefaultPushNotificationTemplate</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DefaultPushNotificationTemplate
DefaultPushNotificationTemplate' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Text -> DefaultPushNotificationTemplate

-- | The message body to use in push notifications that are based on the
--   message template.
[$sel:body:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'] :: DefaultPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message
--   template and the value of the Action property is URL.
[$sel:url:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'] :: DefaultPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The sound to play when a recipient receives a push notification that's
--   based on the message template. You can use the default stream or
--   specify the file name of a sound resource that's bundled in your app.
--   On an Android platform, the sound file must reside in /res/raw/.
--   
--   For an iOS platform, this value is the key for the name of a sound
--   file in your app's main bundle or the Library/Sounds folder in your
--   app's data container. If the sound file can't be found or you specify
--   default for the value, the system plays the default alert sound.
[$sel:sound:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'] :: DefaultPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The action to occur if a recipient taps a push notification that's
--   based on the message template. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   the iOS and Android platforms.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:action:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'] :: DefaultPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Action

-- | The title to use in push notifications that are based on the message
--   template. This title appears above the notification message on a
--   recipient's device.
[$sel:title:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'] :: DefaultPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DefaultPushNotificationTemplate</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationTemplate_body</a> - The message body to use
--   in push notifications that are based on the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationTemplate_url</a> - The URL to open in a
--   recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps a push
--   notification that's based on the message template and the value of the
--   Action property is URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sound:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationTemplate_sound</a> - The sound to play when
--   a recipient receives a push notification that's based on the message
--   template. You can use the default stream or specify the file name of a
--   sound resource that's bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the
--   sound file must reside in /res/raw/.
--   
--   For an iOS platform, this value is the key for the name of a sound
--   file in your app's main bundle or the Library/Sounds folder in your
--   app's data container. If the sound file can't be found or you specify
--   default for the value, the system plays the default alert sound.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationTemplate_action</a> - The action to occur if
--   a recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message
--   template. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   the iOS and Android platforms.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationTemplate_title</a> - The title to use in
--   push notifications that are based on the message template. This title
--   appears above the notification message on a recipient's device.
newDefaultPushNotificationTemplate :: DefaultPushNotificationTemplate

-- | The message body to use in push notifications that are based on the
--   message template.
defaultPushNotificationTemplate_body :: Lens' DefaultPushNotificationTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message
--   template and the value of the Action property is URL.
defaultPushNotificationTemplate_url :: Lens' DefaultPushNotificationTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The sound to play when a recipient receives a push notification that's
--   based on the message template. You can use the default stream or
--   specify the file name of a sound resource that's bundled in your app.
--   On an Android platform, the sound file must reside in /res/raw/.
--   
--   For an iOS platform, this value is the key for the name of a sound
--   file in your app's main bundle or the Library/Sounds folder in your
--   app's data container. If the sound file can't be found or you specify
--   default for the value, the system plays the default alert sound.
defaultPushNotificationTemplate_sound :: Lens' DefaultPushNotificationTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The action to occur if a recipient taps a push notification that's
--   based on the message template. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>

--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of

--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>

-- | The title to use in push notifications that are based on the message
--   template. This title appears above the notification message on a
--   recipient's device.
defaultPushNotificationTemplate_title :: Lens' DefaultPushNotificationTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the settings and content for the default message and any
--   default messages that you tailored for specific channels.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDirectMessageConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data DirectMessageConfiguration
DirectMessageConfiguration' :: Maybe APNSMessage -> Maybe GCMMessage -> Maybe DefaultMessage -> Maybe ADMMessage -> Maybe SMSMessage -> Maybe EmailMessage -> Maybe VoiceMessage -> Maybe BaiduMessage -> Maybe DefaultPushNotificationMessage -> DirectMessageConfiguration

-- | The default push notification message for the APNs (Apple Push
--   Notification service) channel. This message overrides the default push
--   notification message (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
[$sel:aPNSMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'] :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> Maybe APNSMessage

-- | The default push notification message for the GCM channel, which is
--   used to send notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM),
--   formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service. This message overrides
--   the default push notification message
--   (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
[$sel:gCMMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'] :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> Maybe GCMMessage

-- | The default message for all channels.
[$sel:defaultMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'] :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> Maybe DefaultMessage

-- | The default push notification message for the ADM (Amazon Device
--   Messaging) channel. This message overrides the default push
--   notification message (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
[$sel:aDMMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'] :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> Maybe ADMMessage

-- | The default message for the SMS channel. This message overrides the
--   default message (DefaultMessage).
[$sel:sMSMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'] :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> Maybe SMSMessage

-- | The default message for the email channel. This message overrides the
--   default message (DefaultMessage).
[$sel:emailMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'] :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> Maybe EmailMessage

-- | The default message for the voice channel. This message overrides the
--   default message (DefaultMessage).
[$sel:voiceMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'] :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> Maybe VoiceMessage

-- | The default push notification message for the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push)
--   channel. This message overrides the default push notification message
--   (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
[$sel:baiduMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'] :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> Maybe BaiduMessage

-- | The default push notification message for all push notification
--   channels.
[$sel:defaultPushNotificationMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'] :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> Maybe DefaultPushNotificationMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>DirectMessageConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:aPNSMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_aPNSMessage</a> - The default push
--   notification message for the APNs (Apple Push Notification service)
--   channel. This message overrides the default push notification message
--   (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
--   
--   <a>$sel:gCMMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_gCMMessage</a> - The default push
--   notification message for the GCM channel, which is used to send
--   notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly
--   Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service. This message overrides the
--   default push notification message (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_defaultMessage</a> - The default message
--   for all channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:aDMMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_aDMMessage</a> - The default push
--   notification message for the ADM (Amazon Device Messaging) channel.
--   This message overrides the default push notification message
--   (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
--   
--   <a>$sel:sMSMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_sMSMessage</a> - The default message for
--   the SMS channel. This message overrides the default message
--   (DefaultMessage).
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_emailMessage</a> - The default message
--   for the email channel. This message overrides the default message
--   (DefaultMessage).
--   
--   <a>$sel:voiceMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_voiceMessage</a> - The default message
--   for the voice channel. This message overrides the default message
--   (DefaultMessage).
--   
--   <a>$sel:baiduMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_baiduMessage</a> - The default push
--   notification message for the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push) channel. This
--   message overrides the default push notification message
--   (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultPushNotificationMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_defaultPushNotificationMessage</a> - The
--   default push notification message for all push notification channels.
newDirectMessageConfiguration :: DirectMessageConfiguration

-- | The default push notification message for the APNs (Apple Push
--   Notification service) channel. This message overrides the default push
--   notification message (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
directMessageConfiguration_aPNSMessage :: Lens' DirectMessageConfiguration (Maybe APNSMessage)

-- | The default push notification message for the GCM channel, which is
--   used to send notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM),
--   formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service. This message overrides
--   the default push notification message
--   (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
directMessageConfiguration_gCMMessage :: Lens' DirectMessageConfiguration (Maybe GCMMessage)

-- | The default message for all channels.
directMessageConfiguration_defaultMessage :: Lens' DirectMessageConfiguration (Maybe DefaultMessage)

-- | The default push notification message for the ADM (Amazon Device
--   Messaging) channel. This message overrides the default push
--   notification message (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
directMessageConfiguration_aDMMessage :: Lens' DirectMessageConfiguration (Maybe ADMMessage)

-- | The default message for the SMS channel. This message overrides the
--   default message (DefaultMessage).
directMessageConfiguration_sMSMessage :: Lens' DirectMessageConfiguration (Maybe SMSMessage)

-- | The default message for the email channel. This message overrides the
--   default message (DefaultMessage).
directMessageConfiguration_emailMessage :: Lens' DirectMessageConfiguration (Maybe EmailMessage)

-- | The default message for the voice channel. This message overrides the
--   default message (DefaultMessage).
directMessageConfiguration_voiceMessage :: Lens' DirectMessageConfiguration (Maybe VoiceMessage)

-- | The default push notification message for the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push)
--   channel. This message overrides the default push notification message
--   (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
directMessageConfiguration_baiduMessage :: Lens' DirectMessageConfiguration (Maybe BaiduMessage)

-- | The default push notification message for all push notification
--   channels.
directMessageConfiguration_defaultPushNotificationMessage :: Lens' DirectMessageConfiguration (Maybe DefaultPushNotificationMessage)

-- | Specifies the status and settings of the email channel for an
--   application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailChannelRequest</a> smart constructor.
data EmailChannelRequest
EmailChannelRequest' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> EmailChannelRequest

-- | Specifies whether to enable the email channel for the application.
[$sel:enabled:EmailChannelRequest'] :: EmailChannelRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | The <a>Amazon SES configuration set</a> that you want to apply to
--   messages that you send through the channel.
[$sel:configurationSet:EmailChannelRequest'] :: EmailChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that you
--   want Amazon Pinpoint to use when it submits email-related event data
--   for the channel.
[$sel:roleArn:EmailChannelRequest'] :: EmailChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The verified email address that you want to send email from when you
--   send email through the channel.
[$sel:fromAddress:EmailChannelRequest'] :: EmailChannelRequest -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the identity, verified with Amazon
--   Simple Email Service (Amazon SES), that you want to use when you send
--   email through the channel.
[$sel:identity:EmailChannelRequest'] :: EmailChannelRequest -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailChannelRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:EmailChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelRequest_enabled</a> - Specifies whether to enable the
--   email channel for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSet:EmailChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelRequest_configurationSet</a> - The <a>Amazon SES
--   configuration set</a> that you want to apply to messages that you send
--   through the channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:EmailChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelRequest_roleArn</a> - The ARN of the AWS Identity and
--   Access Management (IAM) role that you want Amazon Pinpoint to use when
--   it submits email-related event data for the channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromAddress:EmailChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelRequest_fromAddress</a> - The verified email address
--   that you want to send email from when you send email through the
--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identity:EmailChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelRequest_identity</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the identity, verified with Amazon Simple Email Service (Amazon
--   SES), that you want to use when you send email through the channel.
newEmailChannelRequest :: Text -> Text -> EmailChannelRequest

-- | Specifies whether to enable the email channel for the application.
emailChannelRequest_enabled :: Lens' EmailChannelRequest (Maybe Bool)

-- | The <a>Amazon SES configuration set</a> that you want to apply to
--   messages that you send through the channel.
emailChannelRequest_configurationSet :: Lens' EmailChannelRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that you
--   want Amazon Pinpoint to use when it submits email-related event data
--   for the channel.
emailChannelRequest_roleArn :: Lens' EmailChannelRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The verified email address that you want to send email from when you
--   send email through the channel.
emailChannelRequest_fromAddress :: Lens' EmailChannelRequest Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the identity, verified with Amazon
--   Simple Email Service (Amazon SES), that you want to use when you send
--   email through the channel.
emailChannelRequest_identity :: Lens' EmailChannelRequest Text

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of the email
--   channel for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data EmailChannelResponse
EmailChannelResponse' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Text -> EmailChannelResponse

-- | The maximum number of emails that can be sent through the channel each
--   second.
[$sel:messagesPerSecond:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the email channel was last
--   modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the email channel is enabled for the application.
[$sel:enabled:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The verified email address that email is sent from when you send email
--   through the channel.
[$sel:fromAddress:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the email channel is archived.
[$sel:isArchived:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the email channel
--   applies to.
[$sel:applicationId:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The current version of the email channel.
[$sel:version:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The <a>Amazon SES configuration set</a> that's applied to messages
--   that are sent through the channel.
[$sel:configurationSet:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the email channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:id:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the email channel was
--   enabled.
[$sel:creationDate:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The user who last modified the email channel.
[$sel:lastModifiedBy:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the identity, verified with Amazon
--   Simple Email Service (Amazon SES), that's used when you send email
--   through the channel.
[$sel:identity:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:hasCredential:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The ARN of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that
--   Amazon Pinpoint uses to submit email-related event data for the
--   channel.
[$sel:roleArn:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For
--   the email channel, this value is EMAIL.
[$sel:platform:EmailChannelResponse'] :: EmailChannelResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailChannelResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

-- | Specifies the default settings and content for a one-time email
--   message that's sent directly to an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailMessage</a> smart constructor.
data EmailMessage
EmailMessage' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RawEmail -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SimpleEmail -> Maybe [Text] -> EmailMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the email message. You can
--   override the default variables with individual address variables.
[$sel:substitutions:EmailMessage'] :: EmailMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | The body of the email message.
[$sel:body:EmailMessage'] :: EmailMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The verified email address to send the email message from. The default
--   value is the FromAddress specified for the email channel.
[$sel:fromAddress:EmailMessage'] :: EmailMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The email message, represented as a raw MIME message.
[$sel:rawEmail:EmailMessage'] :: EmailMessage -> Maybe RawEmail

-- | The email address to forward bounces and complaints to, if feedback
--   forwarding is enabled.
[$sel:feedbackForwardingAddress:EmailMessage'] :: EmailMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The email message, composed of a subject, a text part, and an HTML
--   part.
[$sel:simpleEmail:EmailMessage'] :: EmailMessage -> Maybe SimpleEmail

-- | The reply-to email address(es) for the email message. If a recipient
--   replies to the email, each reply-to address receives the reply.
[$sel:replyToAddresses:EmailMessage'] :: EmailMessage -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:EmailMessage'</a>,
--   <a>emailMessage_substitutions</a> - The default message variables to
--   use in the email message. You can override the default variables with
--   individual address variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:EmailMessage'</a>, <a>emailMessage_body</a> - The body of
--   the email message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromAddress:EmailMessage'</a>, <a>emailMessage_fromAddress</a>
--   - The verified email address to send the email message from. The
--   default value is the FromAddress specified for the email channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawEmail:EmailMessage'</a>, <a>emailMessage_rawEmail</a> - The
--   email message, represented as a raw MIME message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:feedbackForwardingAddress:EmailMessage'</a>,
--   <a>emailMessage_feedbackForwardingAddress</a> - The email address to
--   forward bounces and complaints to, if feedback forwarding is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:simpleEmail:EmailMessage'</a>, <a>emailMessage_simpleEmail</a>
--   - The email message, composed of a subject, a text part, and an HTML
--   part.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replyToAddresses:EmailMessage'</a>,
--   <a>emailMessage_replyToAddresses</a> - The reply-to email address(es)
--   for the email message. If a recipient replies to the email, each
--   reply-to address receives the reply.
newEmailMessage :: EmailMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the email message. You can
--   override the default variables with individual address variables.
emailMessage_substitutions :: Lens' EmailMessage (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | The body of the email message.
emailMessage_body :: Lens' EmailMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The verified email address to send the email message from. The default
--   value is the FromAddress specified for the email channel.
emailMessage_fromAddress :: Lens' EmailMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The email message, represented as a raw MIME message.
emailMessage_rawEmail :: Lens' EmailMessage (Maybe RawEmail)

-- | The email address to forward bounces and complaints to, if feedback
--   forwarding is enabled.
emailMessage_feedbackForwardingAddress :: Lens' EmailMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The email message, composed of a subject, a text part, and an HTML
--   part.
emailMessage_simpleEmail :: Lens' EmailMessage (Maybe SimpleEmail)

-- | The reply-to email address(es) for the email message. If a recipient
--   replies to the email, each reply-to address receives the reply.
emailMessage_replyToAddresses :: Lens' EmailMessage (Maybe [Text])

-- | Specifies the settings for an email activity in a journey. This type
--   of activity sends an email message to participants.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailMessageActivity</a> smart constructor.
data EmailMessageActivity
EmailMessageActivity' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe JourneyEmailMessage -> EmailMessageActivity

-- | The name of the email message template to use for the message. If
--   specified, this value must match the name of an existing message
--   template.
[$sel:templateName:EmailMessageActivity'] :: EmailMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the email template to use for
--   the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an
--   existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version
--   identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
[$sel:templateVersion:EmailMessageActivity'] :: EmailMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after the
--   message is sent.
[$sel:nextActivity:EmailMessageActivity'] :: EmailMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the sender address for an email message that's sent to
--   participants in the journey.
[$sel:messageConfig:EmailMessageActivity'] :: EmailMessageActivity -> Maybe JourneyEmailMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailMessageActivity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:EmailMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>emailMessageActivity_templateName</a> - The name of the email
--   message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must
--   match the name of an existing message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateVersion:EmailMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>emailMessageActivity_templateVersion</a> - The unique identifier
--   for the version of the email template to use for the message. If
--   specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing
--   template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version
--   identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextActivity:EmailMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>emailMessageActivity_nextActivity</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the next activity to perform, after the message is sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfig:EmailMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>emailMessageActivity_messageConfig</a> - Specifies the sender
--   address for an email message that's sent to participants in the
--   journey.
newEmailMessageActivity :: EmailMessageActivity

-- | The name of the email message template to use for the message. If
--   specified, this value must match the name of an existing message
--   template.
emailMessageActivity_templateName :: Lens' EmailMessageActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the email template to use for
--   the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an
--   existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version
--   identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
emailMessageActivity_templateVersion :: Lens' EmailMessageActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after the
--   message is sent.
emailMessageActivity_nextActivity :: Lens' EmailMessageActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the sender address for an email message that's sent to
--   participants in the journey.
emailMessageActivity_messageConfig :: Lens' EmailMessageActivity (Maybe JourneyEmailMessage)

-- | Specifies the content and settings for a message template that can be
--   used in messages that are sent through the email channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailTemplateRequest</a> smart constructor.
data EmailTemplateRequest
EmailTemplateRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> EmailTemplateRequest

-- | The subject line, or title, to use in email messages that are based on
--   the message template.
[$sel:subject:EmailTemplateRequest'] :: EmailTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The message body, in plain text format, to use in email messages that
--   are based on the message template. We recommend using plain text
--   format for email clients that don't render HTML content and clients
--   that are connected to high-latency networks, such as mobile devices.
[$sel:textPart:EmailTemplateRequest'] :: EmailTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A custom description of the message template.
[$sel:templateDescription:EmailTemplateRequest'] :: EmailTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A JSON object that specifies the default values to use for message
--   variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value
--   pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The
--   corresponding value defines the default value for that variable. When
--   you create a message that's based on the template, you can override
--   these defaults with message-specific and address-specific variables
--   and values.
[$sel:defaultSubstitutions:EmailTemplateRequest'] :: EmailTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The message body, in HTML format, to use in email messages that are
--   based on the message template. We recommend using HTML format for
--   email clients that render HTML content. You can include links,
--   formatted text, and more in an HTML message.
[$sel:htmlPart:EmailTemplateRequest'] :: EmailTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the recommender model to use for the message
--   template. Amazon Pinpoint uses this value to determine how to retrieve
--   and process data from a recommender model when it sends messages that
--   use the template, if the template contains message variables for
--   recommendation data.
[$sel:recommenderId:EmailTemplateRequest'] :: EmailTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:EmailTemplateRequest'] :: EmailTemplateRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailTemplateRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:EmailTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateRequest_subject</a> - The subject line, or title, to
--   use in email messages that are based on the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:textPart:EmailTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateRequest_textPart</a> - The message body, in plain text
--   format, to use in email messages that are based on the message
--   template. We recommend using plain text format for email clients that
--   don't render HTML content and clients that are connected to
--   high-latency networks, such as mobile devices.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:EmailTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateRequest_templateDescription</a> - A custom description
--   of the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubstitutions:EmailTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateRequest_defaultSubstitutions</a> - A JSON object that
--   specifies the default values to use for message variables in the
--   message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key
--   defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding value
--   defines the default value for that variable. When you create a message
--   that's based on the template, you can override these defaults with
--   message-specific and address-specific variables and values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:htmlPart:EmailTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateRequest_htmlPart</a> - The message body, in HTML
--   format, to use in email messages that are based on the message
--   template. We recommend using HTML format for email clients that render
--   HTML content. You can include links, formatted text, and more in an
--   HTML message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommenderId:EmailTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateRequest_recommenderId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the recommender model to use for the message template. Amazon Pinpoint
--   uses this value to determine how to retrieve and process data from a
--   recommender model when it sends messages that use the template, if the
--   template contains message variables for recommendation data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:EmailTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateRequest_tags</a> - A string-to-string map of key-value
--   pairs that defines the tags to associate with the message template.
--   Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.
newEmailTemplateRequest :: EmailTemplateRequest

-- | The subject line, or title, to use in email messages that are based on
--   the message template.
emailTemplateRequest_subject :: Lens' EmailTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The message body, in plain text format, to use in email messages that
--   are based on the message template. We recommend using plain text
--   format for email clients that don't render HTML content and clients
--   that are connected to high-latency networks, such as mobile devices.
emailTemplateRequest_textPart :: Lens' EmailTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A custom description of the message template.
emailTemplateRequest_templateDescription :: Lens' EmailTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A JSON object that specifies the default values to use for message
--   variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value
--   pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The
--   corresponding value defines the default value for that variable. When
--   you create a message that's based on the template, you can override
--   these defaults with message-specific and address-specific variables
--   and values.
emailTemplateRequest_defaultSubstitutions :: Lens' EmailTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The message body, in HTML format, to use in email messages that are
--   based on the message template. We recommend using HTML format for
--   email clients that render HTML content. You can include links,
--   formatted text, and more in an HTML message.
emailTemplateRequest_htmlPart :: Lens' EmailTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the recommender model to use for the message
--   template. Amazon Pinpoint uses this value to determine how to retrieve
--   and process data from a recommender model when it sends messages that
--   use the template, if the template contains message variables for
--   recommendation data.
emailTemplateRequest_recommenderId :: Lens' EmailTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
emailTemplateRequest_tags :: Lens' EmailTemplateRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | Provides information about the content and settings for a message
--   template that can be used in messages that are sent through the email
--   channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailTemplateResponse</a> smart constructor.
data EmailTemplateResponse
EmailTemplateResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> EmailTemplateResponse

-- | The subject line, or title, that's used in email messages that are
--   based on the message template.
[$sel:subject:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The message body, in plain text format, that's used in email messages
--   that are based on the message template.
[$sel:textPart:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the message template.
[$sel:arn:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The custom description of the message template.
[$sel:templateDescription:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for
--   message variables in the message template. This object is a set of
--   key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template.
--   The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable.
[$sel:defaultSubstitutions:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the
--   message template, or the version of the template that you specified by
--   using the version parameter in your request.
[$sel:version:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The message body, in HTML format, that's used in email messages that
--   are based on the message template.
[$sel:htmlPart:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the recommender model that's used by the
--   message template.
[$sel:recommenderId:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags
--   that are associated with the message template. Each tag consists of a
--   required tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was last
--   modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was created.
[$sel:creationDate:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The name of the message template.
[$sel:templateName:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The type of channel that the message template is designed for. For an
--   email template, this value is EMAIL.
[$sel:templateType:EmailTemplateResponse'] :: EmailTemplateResponse -> TemplateType

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailTemplateResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:EmailTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateResponse_subject</a> - The subject line, or title,
--   that's used in email messages that are based on the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:textPart:EmailTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateResponse_textPart</a> - The message body, in plain
--   text format, that's used in email messages that are based on the
--   message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:EmailTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateResponse_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:EmailTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateResponse_templateDescription</a> - The custom
--   description of the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubstitutions:EmailTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateResponse_defaultSubstitutions</a> - The JSON object
--   that specifies the default values that are used for message variables
--   in the message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each
--   key defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding
--   value defines the default value for that variable.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:EmailTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateResponse_version</a> - The unique identifier, as an
--   integer, for the active version of the message template, or the
--   version of the template that you specified by using the version
--   parameter in your request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:htmlPart:EmailTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateResponse_htmlPart</a> - The message body, in HTML
--   format, that's used in email messages that are based on the message
--   template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommenderId:EmailTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateResponse_recommenderId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the recommender model that's used by the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:EmailTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateResponse_tags</a> - A string-to-string map of
--   key-value pairs that identifies the tags that are associated with the
--   message template. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an
--   associated tag value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:EmailTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the message template was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:EmailTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the message template was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:EmailTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateResponse_templateName</a> - The name of the message
--   template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateType:EmailTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateResponse_templateType</a> - The type of channel that
--   the message template is designed for. For an email template, this
--   value is EMAIL.
newEmailTemplateResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> EmailTemplateResponse

-- | The subject line, or title, that's used in email messages that are
--   based on the message template.
emailTemplateResponse_subject :: Lens' EmailTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The message body, in plain text format, that's used in email messages
--   that are based on the message template.
emailTemplateResponse_textPart :: Lens' EmailTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the message template.
emailTemplateResponse_arn :: Lens' EmailTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The custom description of the message template.
emailTemplateResponse_templateDescription :: Lens' EmailTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for
--   message variables in the message template. This object is a set of
--   key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template.
--   The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable.
emailTemplateResponse_defaultSubstitutions :: Lens' EmailTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the
--   message template, or the version of the template that you specified by
--   using the version parameter in your request.
emailTemplateResponse_version :: Lens' EmailTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The message body, in HTML format, that's used in email messages that
--   are based on the message template.
emailTemplateResponse_htmlPart :: Lens' EmailTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the recommender model that's used by the
--   message template.
emailTemplateResponse_recommenderId :: Lens' EmailTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags
--   that are associated with the message template. Each tag consists of a
--   required tag key and an associated tag value.
emailTemplateResponse_tags :: Lens' EmailTemplateResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was last
--   modified.
emailTemplateResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' EmailTemplateResponse Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was created.
emailTemplateResponse_creationDate :: Lens' EmailTemplateResponse Text

-- | The name of the message template.
emailTemplateResponse_templateName :: Lens' EmailTemplateResponse Text

-- | The type of channel that the message template is designed for. For an
--   email template, this value is EMAIL.
emailTemplateResponse_templateType :: Lens' EmailTemplateResponse TemplateType

-- | Specifies an endpoint to create or update and the settings and
--   attributes to set or change for the endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointBatchItem</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointBatchItem
EndpointBatchItem' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Double) -> Maybe EndpointLocation -> Maybe EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EndpointUser -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ChannelType -> EndpointBatchItem

-- | The unique identifier for the request to create or update the
--   endpoint.
[$sel:requestId:EndpointBatchItem'] :: EndpointBatchItem -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint
--   for the endpoint.
[$sel:metrics:EndpointBatchItem'] :: EndpointBatchItem -> Maybe (HashMap Text Double)

-- | The geographic information for the endpoint.
[$sel:location:EndpointBatchItem'] :: EndpointBatchItem -> Maybe EndpointLocation

-- | The demographic information for the endpoint, such as the time zone
--   and platform.
[$sel:demographic:EndpointBatchItem'] :: EndpointBatchItem -> Maybe EndpointDemographic

-- | The destination address for messages or push notifications that you
--   send to the endpoint. The address varies by channel. For a
--   push-notification channel, use the token provided by the push
--   notification service, such as an Apple Push Notification service
--   (APNs) device token or a Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) registration
--   token. For the SMS channel, use a phone number in E.164 format, such
--   as +12065550100. For the email channel, use an email address.
[$sel:address:EndpointBatchItem'] :: EndpointBatchItem -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the endpoint was created
--   or updated.
[$sel:effectiveDate:EndpointBatchItem'] :: EndpointBatchItem -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more custom attributes that describe the user who's associated
--   with the endpoint.
[$sel:user:EndpointBatchItem'] :: EndpointBatchItem -> Maybe EndpointUser

-- | One or more custom attributes that describe the endpoint by
--   associating a name with an array of values. For example, the value of
--   a custom attribute named Interests might be: ["Science", "Music",
--   "Travel"]. You can use these attributes as filter criteria when you
--   create segments. Attribute names are case sensitive.
--   
--   An attribute name can contain up to 50 characters. An attribute value
--   can contain up to 100 characters. When you define the name of a custom
--   attribute, avoid using the following characters: number sign (#),
--   colon (:), question mark (?), backslash (\), and slash (/). The Amazon
--   Pinpoint console can't display attribute names that contain these
--   characters. This restriction doesn't apply to attribute values.
[$sel:attributes:EndpointBatchItem'] :: EndpointBatchItem -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | Specifies whether to send messages or push notifications to the
--   endpoint. Valid values are: ACTIVE, messages are sent to the endpoint;
--   and, INACTIVE, messages aren’t sent to the endpoint.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint automatically sets this value to ACTIVE when you
--   create an endpoint or update an existing endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint
--   automatically sets this value to INACTIVE if you update another
--   endpoint that has the same address specified by the Address property.
[$sel:endpointStatus:EndpointBatchItem'] :: EndpointBatchItem -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the user who's associated with the endpoint has
--   opted out of receiving messages and push notifications from you.
--   Possible values are: ALL, the user has opted out and doesn't want to
--   receive any messages or push notifications; and, NONE, the user hasn't
--   opted out and wants to receive all messages and push notifications.
[$sel:optOut:EndpointBatchItem'] :: EndpointBatchItem -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the endpoint in the context of the batch.
[$sel:id:EndpointBatchItem'] :: EndpointBatchItem -> Maybe Text

-- | The channel to use when sending messages or push notifications to the
--   endpoint.
[$sel:channelType:EndpointBatchItem'] :: EndpointBatchItem -> Maybe ChannelType

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointBatchItem</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

-- | Specifies demographic information about an endpoint, such as the
--   applicable time zone and platform.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointDemographic</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointDemographic
EndpointDemographic' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> EndpointDemographic

-- | The platform of the endpoint device, such as ios.
[$sel:platform:EndpointDemographic'] :: EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text

-- | The platform version of the endpoint device.
[$sel:platformVersion:EndpointDemographic'] :: EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text

-- | The locale of the endpoint, in the following format: the ISO 639-1
--   alpha-2 code, followed by an underscore (_), followed by an ISO 3166-1
--   alpha-2 value.
[$sel:locale:EndpointDemographic'] :: EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text

-- | The version of the app that's associated with the endpoint.
[$sel:appVersion:EndpointDemographic'] :: EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text

-- | The model name or number of the endpoint device, such as iPhone or
--   SM-G900F.
[$sel:model:EndpointDemographic'] :: EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text

-- | The manufacturer of the endpoint device, such as apple or samsung.
[$sel:make:EndpointDemographic'] :: EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text

-- | The model version of the endpoint device.
[$sel:modelVersion:EndpointDemographic'] :: EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text

-- | The time zone of the endpoint, specified as a tz database name value,
--   such as America/Los_Angeles.
[$sel:timezone:EndpointDemographic'] :: EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text

--   omitted.

-- | Provides the status code and message that result from processing data
--   for an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointItemResponse</a> smart constructor.

--   processing the endpoint data.
[$sel:message:EndpointItemResponse'] :: EndpointItemResponse -> Maybe Text

--   processing the endpoint data.
[$sel:statusCode:EndpointItemResponse'] :: EndpointItemResponse -> Maybe Int
