-- | Specifies geographic information about an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointLocation</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointLocation
EndpointLocation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> EndpointLocation

-- | The postal or ZIP code for the area where the endpoint is located.
[$sel:postalCode:EndpointLocation'] :: EndpointLocation -> Maybe Text

-- | The latitude coordinate of the endpoint location, rounded to one
--   decimal place.
[$sel:latitude:EndpointLocation'] :: EndpointLocation -> Maybe Double

-- | The two-character code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, for the country
--   or region where the endpoint is located. For example, US for the
--   United States.
[$sel:country:EndpointLocation'] :: EndpointLocation -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the city where the endpoint is located.
[$sel:city:EndpointLocation'] :: EndpointLocation -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the region where the endpoint is located. For locations in
--   the United States, this value is the name of a state.
[$sel:region:EndpointLocation'] :: EndpointLocation -> Maybe Text

-- | The longitude coordinate of the endpoint location, rounded to one
--   decimal place.
[$sel:longitude:EndpointLocation'] :: EndpointLocation -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointLocation</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:postalCode:EndpointLocation'</a>,
--   <a>endpointLocation_postalCode</a> - The postal or ZIP code for the
--   area where the endpoint is located.
--   
--   <a>$sel:latitude:EndpointLocation'</a>,
--   <a>endpointLocation_latitude</a> - The latitude coordinate of the
--   endpoint location, rounded to one decimal place.
--   
--   <a>$sel:country:EndpointLocation'</a>, <a>endpointLocation_country</a>
--   - The two-character code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, for the
--   country or region where the endpoint is located. For example, US for
--   the United States.
--   
--   <a>$sel:city:EndpointLocation'</a>, <a>endpointLocation_city</a> - The
--   name of the city where the endpoint is located.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:EndpointLocation'</a>, <a>endpointLocation_region</a> -
--   The name of the region where the endpoint is located. For locations in
--   the United States, this value is the name of a state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:longitude:EndpointLocation'</a>,
--   <a>endpointLocation_longitude</a> - The longitude coordinate of the
--   endpoint location, rounded to one decimal place.
newEndpointLocation :: EndpointLocation

-- | The postal or ZIP code for the area where the endpoint is located.
endpointLocation_postalCode :: Lens' EndpointLocation (Maybe Text)

-- | The latitude coordinate of the endpoint location, rounded to one
--   decimal place.
endpointLocation_latitude :: Lens' EndpointLocation (Maybe Double)

-- | The two-character code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, for the country
--   or region where the endpoint is located. For example, US for the
--   United States.
endpointLocation_country :: Lens' EndpointLocation (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the city where the endpoint is located.
endpointLocation_city :: Lens' EndpointLocation (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the region where the endpoint is located. For locations in
--   the United States, this value is the name of a state.
endpointLocation_region :: Lens' EndpointLocation (Maybe Text)

-- | The longitude coordinate of the endpoint location, rounded to one
--   decimal place.
endpointLocation_longitude :: Lens' EndpointLocation (Maybe Double)

-- | Provides information about the delivery status and results of sending
--   a message directly to an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointMessageResult</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointMessageResult
EndpointMessageResult' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DeliveryStatus -> Int -> EndpointMessageResult

-- | The endpoint address that the message was delivered to.
[$sel:address:EndpointMessageResult'] :: EndpointMessageResult -> Maybe Text

-- | The status message for delivering the message.
[$sel:statusMessage:EndpointMessageResult'] :: EndpointMessageResult -> Maybe Text

-- | For push notifications that are sent through the GCM channel,
--   specifies whether the endpoint's device registration token was updated
--   as part of delivering the message.
[$sel:updatedToken:EndpointMessageResult'] :: EndpointMessageResult -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the message that was sent.
[$sel:messageId:EndpointMessageResult'] :: EndpointMessageResult -> Maybe Text

-- | The delivery status of the message. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DUPLICATE - The endpoint address is a duplicate of another
--   endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message
--   again.</li>
--   <li>OPT_OUT - The user who's associated with the endpoint has opted
--   out of receiving messages from you. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to
--   send the message again.</li>
--   <li>PERMANENT_FAILURE - An error occurred when delivering the message
--   to the endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message
--   again.</li>
--   <li>SUCCESSFUL - The message was successfully delivered to the
--   endpoint.</li>
--   <li>TEMPORARY_FAILURE - A temporary error occurred. Amazon Pinpoint
--   won't attempt to send the message again.</li>
--   <li>THROTTLED - Amazon Pinpoint throttled the operation to send the
--   message to the endpoint.</li>
--   <li>TIMEOUT - The message couldn't be sent within the timeout
--   period.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN_FAILURE - An unknown error occurred.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:deliveryStatus:EndpointMessageResult'] :: EndpointMessageResult -> DeliveryStatus

-- | The downstream service status code for delivering the message.
[$sel:statusCode:EndpointMessageResult'] :: EndpointMessageResult -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointMessageResult</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:address:EndpointMessageResult'</a>,
--   <a>endpointMessageResult_address</a> - The endpoint address that the
--   message was delivered to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusMessage:EndpointMessageResult'</a>,
--   <a>endpointMessageResult_statusMessage</a> - The status message for
--   delivering the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:updatedToken:EndpointMessageResult'</a>,
--   <a>endpointMessageResult_updatedToken</a> - For push notifications
--   that are sent through the GCM channel, specifies whether the
--   endpoint's device registration token was updated as part of delivering
--   the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageId:EndpointMessageResult'</a>,
--   <a>endpointMessageResult_messageId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   message that was sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStatus:EndpointMessageResult'</a>,
--   <a>endpointMessageResult_deliveryStatus</a> - The delivery status of
--   the message. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DUPLICATE - The endpoint address is a duplicate of another
--   endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message
--   again.</li>
--   <li>OPT_OUT - The user who's associated with the endpoint has opted
--   out of receiving messages from you. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to
--   send the message again.</li>
--   <li>PERMANENT_FAILURE - An error occurred when delivering the message
--   to the endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message
--   again.</li>
--   <li>SUCCESSFUL - The message was successfully delivered to the
--   endpoint.</li>
--   <li>TEMPORARY_FAILURE - A temporary error occurred. Amazon Pinpoint
--   won't attempt to send the message again.</li>
--   <li>THROTTLED - Amazon Pinpoint throttled the operation to send the
--   message to the endpoint.</li>
--   <li>TIMEOUT - The message couldn't be sent within the timeout
--   period.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN_FAILURE - An unknown error occurred.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusCode:EndpointMessageResult'</a>,
--   <a>endpointMessageResult_statusCode</a> - The downstream service
--   status code for delivering the message.
newEndpointMessageResult :: DeliveryStatus -> Int -> EndpointMessageResult

-- | The endpoint address that the message was delivered to.
endpointMessageResult_address :: Lens' EndpointMessageResult (Maybe Text)

-- | The status message for delivering the message.
endpointMessageResult_statusMessage :: Lens' EndpointMessageResult (Maybe Text)

-- | For push notifications that are sent through the GCM channel,
--   specifies whether the endpoint's device registration token was updated
--   as part of delivering the message.
endpointMessageResult_updatedToken :: Lens' EndpointMessageResult (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the message that was sent.
endpointMessageResult_messageId :: Lens' EndpointMessageResult (Maybe Text)

-- | The delivery status of the message. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DUPLICATE - The endpoint address is a duplicate of another
--   endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message
--   again.</li>
--   <li>OPT_OUT - The user who's associated with the endpoint has opted
--   out of receiving messages from you. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to
--   send the message again.</li>
--   <li>PERMANENT_FAILURE - An error occurred when delivering the message
--   to the endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message
--   again.</li>
--   <li>SUCCESSFUL - The message was successfully delivered to the
--   endpoint.</li>
--   <li>TEMPORARY_FAILURE - A temporary error occurred. Amazon Pinpoint
--   won't attempt to send the message again.</li>
--   <li>THROTTLED - Amazon Pinpoint throttled the operation to send the
--   message to the endpoint.</li>
--   <li>TIMEOUT - The message couldn't be sent within the timeout
--   period.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN_FAILURE - An unknown error occurred.</li>
--   </ul>
endpointMessageResult_deliveryStatus :: Lens' EndpointMessageResult DeliveryStatus

-- | The downstream service status code for delivering the message.
endpointMessageResult_statusCode :: Lens' EndpointMessageResult Int

-- | Specifies the channel type and other settings for an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointRequest</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointRequest
EndpointRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Double) -> Maybe EndpointLocation -> Maybe EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EndpointUser -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ChannelType -> EndpointRequest

-- | The unique identifier for the most recent request to update the
--   endpoint.
[$sel:requestId:EndpointRequest'] :: EndpointRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint
--   for the endpoint.
[$sel:metrics:EndpointRequest'] :: EndpointRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Double)

-- | The geographic information for the endpoint.
[$sel:location:EndpointRequest'] :: EndpointRequest -> Maybe EndpointLocation

-- | The demographic information for the endpoint, such as the time zone
--   and platform.
[$sel:demographic:EndpointRequest'] :: EndpointRequest -> Maybe EndpointDemographic

-- | The destination address for messages or push notifications that you
--   send to the endpoint. The address varies by channel. For a
--   push-notification channel, use the token provided by the push
--   notification service, such as an Apple Push Notification service
--   (APNs) device token or a Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) registration
--   token. For the SMS channel, use a phone number in E.164 format, such
--   as +12065550100. For the email channel, use an email address.
[$sel:address:EndpointRequest'] :: EndpointRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the endpoint is updated.
[$sel:effectiveDate:EndpointRequest'] :: EndpointRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more custom attributes that describe the user who's associated
--   with the endpoint.
[$sel:user:EndpointRequest'] :: EndpointRequest -> Maybe EndpointUser

-- | One or more custom attributes that describe the endpoint by
--   associating a name with an array of values. For example, the value of
--   a custom attribute named Interests might be: ["Science", "Music",
--   "Travel"]. You can use these attributes as filter criteria when you
--   create segments. Attribute names are case sensitive.
--   
--   An attribute name can contain up to 50 characters. An attribute value
--   can contain up to 100 characters. When you define the name of a custom
--   attribute, avoid using the following characters: number sign (#),
--   colon (:), question mark (?), backslash (\), and slash (/). The Amazon
--   Pinpoint console can't display attribute names that contain these
--   characters. This restriction doesn't apply to attribute values.
[$sel:attributes:EndpointRequest'] :: EndpointRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | Specifies whether to send messages or push notifications to the
--   endpoint. Valid values are: ACTIVE, messages are sent to the endpoint;
--   and, INACTIVE, messages aren’t sent to the endpoint.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint automatically sets this value to ACTIVE when you
--   create an endpoint or update an existing endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint
--   automatically sets this value to INACTIVE if you update another
--   endpoint that has the same address specified by the Address property.
[$sel:endpointStatus:EndpointRequest'] :: EndpointRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the user who's associated with the endpoint has
--   opted out of receiving messages and push notifications from you.
--   Possible values are: ALL, the user has opted out and doesn't want to
--   receive any messages or push notifications; and, NONE, the user hasn't
--   opted out and wants to receive all messages and push notifications.
[$sel:optOut:EndpointRequest'] :: EndpointRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The channel to use when sending messages or push notifications to the
--   endpoint.
[$sel:channelType:EndpointRequest'] :: EndpointRequest -> Maybe ChannelType

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestId:EndpointRequest'</a>,
--   <a>endpointRequest_requestId</a> - The unique identifier for the most
--   recent request to update the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:EndpointRequest'</a>, <a>endpointRequest_metrics</a> -
--   One or more custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint
--   for the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:EndpointRequest'</a>, <a>endpointRequest_location</a>
--   - The geographic information for the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:demographic:EndpointRequest'</a>,
--   <a>endpointRequest_demographic</a> - The demographic information for
--   the endpoint, such as the time zone and platform.
--   
--   <a>$sel:address:EndpointRequest'</a>, <a>endpointRequest_address</a> -
--   The destination address for messages or push notifications that you
--   send to the endpoint. The address varies by channel. For a
--   push-notification channel, use the token provided by the push
--   notification service, such as an Apple Push Notification service
--   (APNs) device token or a Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) registration
--   token. For the SMS channel, use a phone number in E.164 format, such
--   as +12065550100. For the email channel, use an email address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:effectiveDate:EndpointRequest'</a>,
--   <a>endpointRequest_effectiveDate</a> - The date and time, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the endpoint is updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:user:EndpointRequest'</a>, <a>endpointRequest_user</a> - One
--   or more custom attributes that describe the user who's associated with
--   the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:EndpointRequest'</a>,
--   <a>endpointRequest_attributes</a> - One or more custom attributes that
--   describe the endpoint by associating a name with an array of values.
--   For example, the value of a custom attribute named Interests might be:
--   ["Science", "Music", "Travel"]. You can use these attributes as filter
--   criteria when you create segments. Attribute names are case sensitive.
--   
--   An attribute name can contain up to 50 characters. An attribute value
--   can contain up to 100 characters. When you define the name of a custom
--   attribute, avoid using the following characters: number sign (#),
--   colon (:), question mark (?), backslash (\), and slash (/). The Amazon
--   Pinpoint console can't display attribute names that contain these
--   characters. This restriction doesn't apply to attribute values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointStatus:EndpointRequest'</a>,
--   <a>endpointRequest_endpointStatus</a> - Specifies whether to send
--   messages or push notifications to the endpoint. Valid values are:
--   ACTIVE, messages are sent to the endpoint; and, INACTIVE, messages
--   aren’t sent to the endpoint.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint automatically sets this value to ACTIVE when you
--   create an endpoint or update an existing endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint
--   automatically sets this value to INACTIVE if you update another
--   endpoint that has the same address specified by the Address property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:optOut:EndpointRequest'</a>, <a>endpointRequest_optOut</a> -
--   Specifies whether the user who's associated with the endpoint has
--   opted out of receiving messages and push notifications from you.
--   Possible values are: ALL, the user has opted out and doesn't want to
--   receive any messages or push notifications; and, NONE, the user hasn't
--   opted out and wants to receive all messages and push notifications.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelType:EndpointRequest'</a>,
--   <a>endpointRequest_channelType</a> - The channel to use when sending
--   messages or push notifications to the endpoint.
newEndpointRequest :: EndpointRequest

-- | The unique identifier for the most recent request to update the
--   endpoint.
endpointRequest_requestId :: Lens' EndpointRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint
--   for the endpoint.
endpointRequest_metrics :: Lens' EndpointRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text Double))

-- | The geographic information for the endpoint.
endpointRequest_location :: Lens' EndpointRequest (Maybe EndpointLocation)

-- | The demographic information for the endpoint, such as the time zone
--   and platform.
endpointRequest_demographic :: Lens' EndpointRequest (Maybe EndpointDemographic)

-- | The destination address for messages or push notifications that you
--   send to the endpoint. The address varies by channel. For a
--   push-notification channel, use the token provided by the push
--   notification service, such as an Apple Push Notification service
--   (APNs) device token or a Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) registration
--   token. For the SMS channel, use a phone number in E.164 format, such
--   as +12065550100. For the email channel, use an email address.
endpointRequest_address :: Lens' EndpointRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the endpoint is updated.
endpointRequest_effectiveDate :: Lens' EndpointRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more custom attributes that describe the user who's associated
--   with the endpoint.
endpointRequest_user :: Lens' EndpointRequest (Maybe EndpointUser)

-- | One or more custom attributes that describe the endpoint by
--   associating a name with an array of values. For example, the value of
--   a custom attribute named Interests might be: ["Science", "Music",
--   "Travel"]. You can use these attributes as filter criteria when you
--   create segments. Attribute names are case sensitive.
--   
--   An attribute name can contain up to 50 characters. An attribute value
--   can contain up to 100 characters. When you define the name of a custom
--   attribute, avoid using the following characters: number sign (#),
--   colon (:), question mark (?), backslash (\), and slash (/). The Amazon
--   Pinpoint console can't display attribute names that contain these
--   characters. This restriction doesn't apply to attribute values.
endpointRequest_attributes :: Lens' EndpointRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | Specifies whether to send messages or push notifications to the
--   endpoint. Valid values are: ACTIVE, messages are sent to the endpoint;
--   and, INACTIVE, messages aren’t sent to the endpoint.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint automatically sets this value to ACTIVE when you
--   create an endpoint or update an existing endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint
--   automatically sets this value to INACTIVE if you update another
--   endpoint that has the same address specified by the Address property.
endpointRequest_endpointStatus :: Lens' EndpointRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the user who's associated with the endpoint has
--   opted out of receiving messages and push notifications from you.
--   Possible values are: ALL, the user has opted out and doesn't want to
--   receive any messages or push notifications; and, NONE, the user hasn't
--   opted out and wants to receive all messages and push notifications.
endpointRequest_optOut :: Lens' EndpointRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The channel to use when sending messages or push notifications to the
--   endpoint.
endpointRequest_channelType :: Lens' EndpointRequest (Maybe ChannelType)

-- | Provides information about the channel type and other settings for an
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointResponse</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointResponse
EndpointResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Double) -> Maybe EndpointLocation -> Maybe EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EndpointUser -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ChannelType -> EndpointResponse

-- | The unique identifier for the most recent request to update the
--   endpoint.
[$sel:requestId:EndpointResponse'] :: EndpointResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint
--   for the endpoint.
[$sel:metrics:EndpointResponse'] :: EndpointResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Double)

-- | The geographic information for the endpoint.
[$sel:location:EndpointResponse'] :: EndpointResponse -> Maybe EndpointLocation

-- | The demographic information for the endpoint, such as the time zone
--   and platform.
[$sel:demographic:EndpointResponse'] :: EndpointResponse -> Maybe EndpointDemographic

-- | A number from 0-99 that represents the cohort that the endpoint is
--   assigned to. Endpoints are grouped into cohorts randomly, and each
--   cohort contains approximately 1 percent of the endpoints for an
--   application. Amazon Pinpoint assigns cohorts to the holdout or
--   treatment allocations for campaigns.
[$sel:cohortId:EndpointResponse'] :: EndpointResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The destination address for messages or push notifications that you
--   send to the endpoint. The address varies by channel. For example, the
--   address for a push-notification channel is typically the token
--   provided by a push notification service, such as an Apple Push
--   Notification service (APNs) device token or a Firebase Cloud Messaging
--   (FCM) registration token. The address for the SMS channel is a phone
--   number in E.164 format, such as +12065550100. The address for the
--   email channel is an email address.
[$sel:address:EndpointResponse'] :: EndpointResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the endpoint was last
--   updated.
[$sel:effectiveDate:EndpointResponse'] :: EndpointResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more custom user attributes that your app reports to Amazon
--   Pinpoint for the user who's associated with the endpoint.
[$sel:user:EndpointResponse'] :: EndpointResponse -> Maybe EndpointUser

-- | The unique identifier for the application that's associated with the
--   endpoint.
[$sel:applicationId:EndpointResponse'] :: EndpointResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more custom attributes that describe the endpoint by
--   associating a name with an array of values. For example, the value of
--   a custom attribute named Interests might be: ["Science", "Music",
--   "Travel"]. You can use these attributes as filter criteria when you
--   create segments.
[$sel:attributes:EndpointResponse'] :: EndpointResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | Specifies whether messages or push notifications are sent to the
--   endpoint. Possible values are: ACTIVE, messages are sent to the
--   endpoint; and, INACTIVE, messages aren’t sent to the endpoint.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint automatically sets this value to ACTIVE when you
--   create an endpoint or update an existing endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint
--   automatically sets this value to INACTIVE if you update another
--   endpoint that has the same address specified by the Address property.
[$sel:endpointStatus:EndpointResponse'] :: EndpointResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the user who's associated with the endpoint has
--   opted out of receiving messages and push notifications from you.
--   Possible values are: ALL, the user has opted out and doesn't want to
--   receive any messages or push notifications; and, NONE, the user hasn't
--   opted out and wants to receive all messages and push notifications.
[$sel:optOut:EndpointResponse'] :: EndpointResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier that you assigned to the endpoint. The
--   identifier should be a globally unique identifier (GUID) to ensure
--   that it doesn't conflict with other endpoint identifiers that are
--   associated with the application.
[$sel:id:EndpointResponse'] :: EndpointResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the endpoint was created.
[$sel:creationDate:EndpointResponse'] :: EndpointResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The channel that's used when sending messages or push notifications to
--   the endpoint.
[$sel:channelType:EndpointResponse'] :: EndpointResponse -> Maybe ChannelType

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestId:EndpointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>endpointResponse_requestId</a> - The unique identifier for the most
--   recent request to update the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:EndpointResponse'</a>, <a>endpointResponse_metrics</a>
--   - One or more custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint
--   for the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:EndpointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>endpointResponse_location</a> - The geographic information for the
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:demographic:EndpointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>endpointResponse_demographic</a> - The demographic information for
--   the endpoint, such as the time zone and platform.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cohortId:EndpointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>endpointResponse_cohortId</a> - A number from 0-99 that represents
--   the cohort that the endpoint is assigned to. Endpoints are grouped
--   into cohorts randomly, and each cohort contains approximately 1
--   percent of the endpoints for an application. Amazon Pinpoint assigns
--   cohorts to the holdout or treatment allocations for campaigns.
--   
--   <a>$sel:address:EndpointResponse'</a>, <a>endpointResponse_address</a>
--   - The destination address for messages or push notifications that you
--   send to the endpoint. The address varies by channel. For example, the
--   address for a push-notification channel is typically the token
--   provided by a push notification service, such as an Apple Push
--   Notification service (APNs) device token or a Firebase Cloud Messaging
--   (FCM) registration token. The address for the SMS channel is a phone
--   number in E.164 format, such as +12065550100. The address for the
--   email channel is an email address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:effectiveDate:EndpointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>endpointResponse_effectiveDate</a> - The date and time, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the endpoint was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:user:EndpointResponse'</a>, <a>endpointResponse_user</a> - One

--   Pinpoint for the user who's associated with the endpoint.

--   application that's associated with the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:EndpointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>endpointResponse_attributes</a> - One or more custom attributes
--   that describe the endpoint by associating a name with an array of
--   values. For example, the value of a custom attribute named Interests
--   might be: ["Science", "Music", "Travel"]. You can use these attributes
--   as filter criteria when you create segments.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointStatus:EndpointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>endpointResponse_endpointStatus</a> - Specifies whether messages or
--   push notifications are sent to the endpoint. Possible values are:
--   ACTIVE, messages are sent to the endpoint; and, INACTIVE, messages
--   aren’t sent to the endpoint.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint automatically sets this value to ACTIVE when you
--   create an endpoint or update an existing endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint
--   automatically sets this value to INACTIVE if you update another
--   endpoint that has the same address specified by the Address property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:optOut:EndpointResponse'</a>, <a>endpointResponse_optOut</a> -
--   Specifies whether the user who's associated with the endpoint has
--   opted out of receiving messages and push notifications from you.
--   Possible values are: ALL, the user has opted out and doesn't want to
--   receive any messages or push notifications; and, NONE, the user hasn't
--   opted out and wants to receive all messages and push notifications.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:EndpointResponse'</a>, <a>endpointResponse_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier that you assigned to the endpoint. The identifier
--   should be a globally unique identifier (GUID) to ensure that it
--   doesn't conflict with other endpoint identifiers that are associated
--   with the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:EndpointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>endpointResponse_creationDate</a> - The date and time, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the endpoint was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelType:EndpointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>endpointResponse_channelType</a> - The channel that's used when
--   sending messages or push notifications to the endpoint.
newEndpointResponse :: EndpointResponse

-- | The unique identifier for the most recent request to update the
--   endpoint.
endpointResponse_requestId :: Lens' EndpointResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint
--   for the endpoint.

-- | The geographic information for the endpoint.

-- | The demographic information for the endpoint, such as the time zone
--   and platform.

endpointResponse_cohortId :: Lens' EndpointResponse (Maybe Text)

--   address for a push-notification channel is typically the token

--   (FCM) registration token. The address for the SMS channel is a phone
--   number in E.164 format, such as +12065550100. The address for the
--   email channel is an email address.
endpointResponse_address :: Lens' EndpointResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the endpoint was last
--   updated.
endpointResponse_effectiveDate :: Lens' EndpointResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more custom user attributes that your app reports to Amazon
--   Pinpoint for the user who's associated with the endpoint.
endpointResponse_user :: Lens' EndpointResponse (Maybe EndpointUser)

-- | The unique identifier for the application that's associated with the
--   endpoint.
endpointResponse_applicationId :: Lens' EndpointResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more custom attributes that describe the endpoint by
--   associating a name with an array of values. For example, the value of
--   a custom attribute named Interests might be: ["Science", "Music",
--   "Travel"]. You can use these attributes as filter criteria when you
--   create segments.
endpointResponse_attributes :: Lens' EndpointResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | Specifies whether messages or push notifications are sent to the
--   endpoint. Possible values are: ACTIVE, messages are sent to the
--   endpoint; and, INACTIVE, messages aren’t sent to the endpoint.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint automatically sets this value to ACTIVE when you
--   create an endpoint or update an existing endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint
--   automatically sets this value to INACTIVE if you update another
--   endpoint that has the same address specified by the Address property.
endpointResponse_endpointStatus :: Lens' EndpointResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the user who's associated with the endpoint has
--   opted out of receiving messages and push notifications from you.
--   Possible values are: ALL, the user has opted out and doesn't want to
--   receive any messages or push notifications; and, NONE, the user hasn't
--   opted out and wants to receive all messages and push notifications.
endpointResponse_optOut :: Lens' EndpointResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier that you assigned to the endpoint. The
--   identifier should be a globally unique identifier (GUID) to ensure
--   that it doesn't conflict with other endpoint identifiers that are
--   associated with the application.
endpointResponse_id :: Lens' EndpointResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the endpoint was created.
endpointResponse_creationDate :: Lens' EndpointResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The channel that's used when sending messages or push notifications to
--   the endpoint.
endpointResponse_channelType :: Lens' EndpointResponse (Maybe ChannelType)

-- | Specifies the content, including message variables and attributes, to
--   use in a message that's sent directly to an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointSendConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointSendConfiguration
EndpointSendConfiguration' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> EndpointSendConfiguration

-- | A map of the message variables to merge with the variables specified
--   for the default message (DefaultMessage.Substitutions). The variables
--   specified in this map take precedence over all other variables.
[$sel:substitutions:EndpointSendConfiguration'] :: EndpointSendConfiguration -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | The title or subject line of the message. If specified, this value
--   overrides the default message title or subject line.
[$sel:titleOverride:EndpointSendConfiguration'] :: EndpointSendConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | A map of custom attributes to attach to the message for the address.
--   Attribute names are case sensitive.
--   
--   For a push notification, this payload is added to the data.pinpoint
--   object. For an email or text message, this payload is added to
--   email/SMS delivery receipt event attributes.
[$sel:context:EndpointSendConfiguration'] :: EndpointSendConfiguration -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the message.
--   If specified, this value overrides all other values for the message.
[$sel:rawContent:EndpointSendConfiguration'] :: EndpointSendConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The body of the message. If specified, this value overrides the
--   default message body.
[$sel:bodyOverride:EndpointSendConfiguration'] :: EndpointSendConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:EndpointSendConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>endpointSendConfiguration_substitutions</a> - A map of the message
--   variables to merge with the variables specified for the default
--   message (DefaultMessage.Substitutions). The variables specified in
--   this map take precedence over all other variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:titleOverride:EndpointSendConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>endpointSendConfiguration_titleOverride</a> - The title or subject
--   line of the message. If specified, this value overrides the default
--   message title or subject line.
--   
--   <a>$sel:context:EndpointSendConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>endpointSendConfiguration_context</a> - A map of custom attributes
--   to attach to the message for the address. Attribute names are case
--   sensitive.
--   
--   For a push notification, this payload is added to the data.pinpoint
--   object. For an email or text message, this payload is added to
--   email/SMS delivery receipt event attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawContent:EndpointSendConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>endpointSendConfiguration_rawContent</a> - The raw, JSON-formatted
--   string to use as the payload for the message. If specified, this value
--   overrides all other values for the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bodyOverride:EndpointSendConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>endpointSendConfiguration_bodyOverride</a> - The body of the
--   message. If specified, this value overrides the default message body.
newEndpointSendConfiguration :: EndpointSendConfiguration

-- | A map of the message variables to merge with the variables specified
--   for the default message (DefaultMessage.Substitutions). The variables
--   specified in this map take precedence over all other variables.
endpointSendConfiguration_substitutions :: Lens' EndpointSendConfiguration (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | The title or subject line of the message. If specified, this value
--   overrides the default message title or subject line.
endpointSendConfiguration_titleOverride :: Lens' EndpointSendConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | A map of custom attributes to attach to the message for the address.
--   Attribute names are case sensitive.
--

--   object. For an email or text message, this payload is added to
--   email/SMS delivery receipt event attributes.
endpointSendConfiguration_context :: Lens' EndpointSendConfiguration (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

--   If specified, this value overrides all other values for the message.
endpointSendConfiguration_rawContent :: Lens' EndpointSendConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The body of the message. If specified, this value overrides the
--   default message body.
endpointSendConfiguration_bodyOverride :: Lens' EndpointSendConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies data for one or more attributes that describe the user who's
--   associated with an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointUser</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointUser
EndpointUser' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> EndpointUser

-- | One or more custom attributes that describe the user by associating a
--   name with an array of values. For example, the value of an attribute
--   named Interests might be: ["Science", "Music", "Travel"]. You can use
--   these attributes as filter criteria when you create segments.
--   Attribute names are case sensitive.
--   
--   An attribute name can contain up to 50 characters. An attribute value
--   can contain up to 100 characters. When you define the name of a custom
--   attribute, avoid using the following characters: number sign (#),
--   colon (:), question mark (?), backslash (\), and slash (/). The Amazon
--   Pinpoint console can't display attribute names that contain these
--   characters. This restriction doesn't apply to attribute values.
[$sel:userAttributes:EndpointUser'] :: EndpointUser -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | The unique identifier for the user.
[$sel:userId:EndpointUser'] :: EndpointUser -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointUser</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:userAttributes:EndpointUser'</a>,
--   <a>endpointUser_userAttributes</a> - One or more custom attributes
--   that describe the user by associating a name with an array of values.
--   For example, the value of an attribute named Interests might be:
--   ["Science", "Music", "Travel"]. You can use these attributes as filter
--   criteria when you create segments. Attribute names are case sensitive.
--   
--   An attribute name can contain up to 50 characters. An attribute value
--   can contain up to 100 characters. When you define the name of a custom
--   attribute, avoid using the following characters: number sign (#),
--   colon (:), question mark (?), backslash (\), and slash (/). The Amazon
--   Pinpoint console can't display attribute names that contain these
--   characters. This restriction doesn't apply to attribute values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userId:EndpointUser'</a>, <a>endpointUser_userId</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the user.
newEndpointUser :: EndpointUser

-- | One or more custom attributes that describe the user by associating a
--   name with an array of values. For example, the value of an attribute
--   named Interests might be: ["Science", "Music", "Travel"]. You can use
--   these attributes as filter criteria when you create segments.
--   Attribute names are case sensitive.
--   
--   An attribute name can contain up to 50 characters. An attribute value
--   can contain up to 100 characters. When you define the name of a custom
--   attribute, avoid using the following characters: number sign (#),
--   colon (:), question mark (?), backslash (\), and slash (/). The Amazon
--   Pinpoint console can't display attribute names that contain these
--   characters. This restriction doesn't apply to attribute values.
endpointUser_userAttributes :: Lens' EndpointUser (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | The unique identifier for the user.
endpointUser_userId :: Lens' EndpointUser (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides information about all the endpoints that are associated with
--   a user ID.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointsResponse

--   the user ID.
[$sel:item:EndpointsResponse'] :: EndpointsResponse -> [EndpointResponse]

--   fields.

--   An array of responses, one for each endpoint that's associated with
--   the user ID.
newEndpointsResponse :: EndpointsResponse

-- | An array of responses, one for each endpoint that's associated with
--   the user ID.
endpointsResponse_item :: Lens' EndpointsResponse [EndpointResponse]

-- | Specifies information about an event that reports data to Amazon
--   Pinpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEvent</a> smart constructor.
data Event
Event' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Double) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Session -> Text -> Text -> Event

-- | The version of the SDK that's running on the client device.
[$sel:clientSdkVersion:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more custom metrics that are associated with the event.
[$sel:metrics:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe (HashMap Text Double)

-- | The version number of the app that's recording the event.
[$sel:appVersionCode:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | The title of the app that's recording the event.
[$sel:appTitle:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | The package name of the app that's recording the event.
[$sel:appPackageName:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more custom attributes that are associated with the event.
[$sel:attributes:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The name of the SDK that's being used to record the event.
[$sel:sdkName:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the session in which the event occurred.
[$sel:session:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Session

-- | The name of the event.
[$sel:eventType:Event'] :: Event -> Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the event occurred.
[$sel:timestamp:Event'] :: Event -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Event</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientSdkVersion:Event'</a>, <a>event_clientSdkVersion</a> -
--   The version of the SDK that's running on the client device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:Event'</a>, <a>event_metrics</a> - One or more custom
--   metrics that are associated with the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appVersionCode:Event'</a>, <a>event_appVersionCode</a> - The
--   version number of the app that's recording the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appTitle:Event'</a>, <a>event_appTitle</a> - The title of the
--   app that's recording the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appPackageName:Event'</a>, <a>event_appPackageName</a> - The
--   package name of the app that's recording the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:Event'</a>, <a>event_attributes</a> - One or more
--   custom attributes that are associated with the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sdkName:Event'</a>, <a>event_sdkName</a> - The name of the SDK
--   that's being used to record the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:session:Event'</a>, <a>event_session</a> - Information about
--   the session in which the event occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventType:Event'</a>, <a>event_eventType</a> - The name of the
--   event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestamp:Event'</a>, <a>event_timestamp</a> - The date and
--   time, in ISO 8601 format, when the event occurred.
newEvent :: Text -> Text -> Event

-- | The version of the SDK that's running on the client device.
event_clientSdkVersion :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more custom metrics that are associated with the event.
event_metrics :: Lens' Event (Maybe (HashMap Text Double))

-- | The version number of the app that's recording the event.
event_appVersionCode :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | The title of the app that's recording the event.
event_appTitle :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | The package name of the app that's recording the event.
event_appPackageName :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more custom attributes that are associated with the event.
event_attributes :: Lens' Event (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The name of the SDK that's being used to record the event.
event_sdkName :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the session in which the event occurred.
event_session :: Lens' Event (Maybe Session)

-- | The name of the event.
event_eventType :: Lens' Event Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the event occurred.
event_timestamp :: Lens' Event Text

-- | Specifies the conditions to evaluate for an event that applies to an
--   activity in a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventCondition</a> smart constructor.
data EventCondition
EventCondition' :: Maybe EventDimensions -> Maybe Text -> EventCondition

-- | The dimensions for the event filter to use for the activity.
[$sel:dimensions:EventCondition'] :: EventCondition -> Maybe EventDimensions

-- | The message identifier (message_id) for the message to use when
--   determining whether message events meet the condition.
[$sel:messageActivity:EventCondition'] :: EventCondition -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EventCondition</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   to use for the activity.
--

--   <a>eventCondition_messageActivity</a> - The message identifier
--   (message_id) for the message to use when determining whether message
--   events meet the condition.
newEventCondition :: EventCondition

-- | The dimensions for the event filter to use for the activity.

-- | The message identifier (message_id) for the message to use when
--   determining whether message events meet the condition.
eventCondition_messageActivity :: Lens' EventCondition (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the dimensions for an event filter that determines when a
--   campaign is sent or a journey activity is performed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventDimensions</a> smart constructor.
data EventDimensions
EventDimensions' :: Maybe (HashMap Text MetricDimension) -> Maybe SetDimension -> Maybe (HashMap Text AttributeDimension) -> EventDimensions

-- | One or more custom metrics that your application reports to Amazon
--   Pinpoint. You can use these metrics as selection criteria when you
--   create an event filter.
[$sel:metrics:EventDimensions'] :: EventDimensions -> Maybe (HashMap Text MetricDimension)

-- | The name of the event that causes the campaign to be sent or the
--   journey activity to be performed. This can be a standard event that
--   Amazon Pinpoint generates, such as _email.delivered. For campaigns,
--   this can also be a custom event that's specific to your application.
--   For information about standard events, see <a>Streaming Amazon
--   Pinpoint Events</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:eventType:EventDimensions'] :: EventDimensions -> Maybe SetDimension

-- | One or more custom attributes that your application reports to Amazon
--   Pinpoint. You can use these attributes as selection criteria when you
--   create an event filter.
[$sel:attributes:EventDimensions'] :: EventDimensions -> Maybe (HashMap Text AttributeDimension)

-- | Create a value of <a>EventDimensions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:EventDimensions'</a>, <a>eventDimensions_metrics</a> -
--   One or more custom metrics that your application reports to Amazon
--   Pinpoint. You can use these metrics as selection criteria when you
--   create an event filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventType:EventDimensions'</a>,
--   <a>eventDimensions_eventType</a> - The name of the event that causes
--   the campaign to be sent or the journey activity to be performed. This
--   can be a standard event that Amazon Pinpoint generates, such as
--   _email.delivered. For campaigns, this can also be a custom event
--   that's specific to your application. For information about standard
--   events, see <a>Streaming Amazon Pinpoint Events</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Pinpoint Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:EventDimensions'</a>,
--   <a>eventDimensions_attributes</a> - One or more custom attributes that
--   your application reports to Amazon Pinpoint. You can use these
--   attributes as selection criteria when you create an event filter.
newEventDimensions :: EventDimensions

-- | One or more custom metrics that your application reports to Amazon
--   Pinpoint. You can use these metrics as selection criteria when you
--   create an event filter.
eventDimensions_metrics :: Lens' EventDimensions (Maybe (HashMap Text MetricDimension))

-- | The name of the event that causes the campaign to be sent or the
--   journey activity to be performed. This can be a standard event that
--   Amazon Pinpoint generates, such as _email.delivered. For campaigns,
--   this can also be a custom event that's specific to your application.
--   For information about standard events, see <a>Streaming Amazon
--   Pinpoint Events</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide</i>.
eventDimensions_eventType :: Lens' EventDimensions (Maybe SetDimension)

-- | One or more custom attributes that your application reports to Amazon
--   Pinpoint. You can use these attributes as selection criteria when you
--   create an event filter.
eventDimensions_attributes :: Lens' EventDimensions (Maybe (HashMap Text AttributeDimension))

-- | Specifies the settings for an event that causes a campaign to be sent
--   or a journey activity to be performed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventFilter</a> smart constructor.
data EventFilter
EventFilter' :: FilterType -> EventDimensions -> EventFilter

-- | The type of event that causes the campaign to be sent or the journey
--   activity to be performed. Valid values are: SYSTEM, sends the campaign
--   or performs the activity when a system event occurs; and, ENDPOINT,
--   sends the campaign or performs the activity when an endpoint event
--   (Events resource) occurs.
[$sel:filterType:EventFilter'] :: EventFilter -> FilterType

-- | The dimensions for the event filter to use for the campaign or the
--   journey activity.
[$sel:dimensions:EventFilter'] :: EventFilter -> EventDimensions

-- | Create a value of <a>EventFilter</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filterType:EventFilter'</a>, <a>eventFilter_filterType</a> -
--   The type of event that causes the campaign to be sent or the journey
--   activity to be performed. Valid values are: SYSTEM, sends the campaign
--   or performs the activity when a system event occurs; and, ENDPOINT,
--   sends the campaign or performs the activity when an endpoint event
--   (Events resource) occurs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:EventFilter'</a>, <a>eventFilter_dimensions</a> -
--   The dimensions for the event filter to use for the campaign or the
--   journey activity.
newEventFilter :: FilterType -> EventDimensions -> EventFilter

-- | The type of event that causes the campaign to be sent or the journey
--   activity to be performed. Valid values are: SYSTEM, sends the campaign
--   or performs the activity when a system event occurs; and, ENDPOINT,
--   sends the campaign or performs the activity when an endpoint event
--   (Events resource) occurs.
eventFilter_filterType :: Lens' EventFilter FilterType

-- | The dimensions for the event filter to use for the campaign or the
--   journey activity.
eventFilter_dimensions :: Lens' EventFilter EventDimensions

-- | Provides the status code and message that result from processing an

data EventItemResponse

--   processing the event. Possible values are: 202, for events that were
--   accepted; and, 400, for events that weren't valid.
[$sel:statusCode:EventItemResponse'] :: EventItemResponse -> Maybe Int

newEventItemResponse :: EventItemResponse
