-- | Specifies settings for publishing event data to an Amazon Kinesis data
--   stream or an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventStream</a> smart constructor.
data EventStream
EventStream' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> EventStream

-- | The IAM user who last modified the event stream.
[$sel:lastUpdatedBy:EventStream'] :: EventStream -> Maybe Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the event stream was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:EventStream'] :: EventStream -> Maybe Text

-- | (Deprecated) Your AWS account ID, which you assigned to an external ID
--   key in an IAM trust policy. Amazon Pinpoint previously used this value
--   to assume an IAM role when publishing event data, but we removed this
--   requirement. We don't recommend use of external IDs for IAM roles that
--   are assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.
[$sel:externalId:EventStream'] :: EventStream -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application to publish event data for.
[$sel:applicationId:EventStream'] :: EventStream -> Text

-- | The AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorizes
--   Amazon Pinpoint to publish event data to the stream in your AWS
--   account.
[$sel:roleArn:EventStream'] :: EventStream -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis data stream or
--   Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream to publish event data to.
--   
--   For a Kinesis data stream, the ARN format is:
--   arn:aws:kinesis:region:account-id:stream/stream_name
--   
--   For a Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream, the ARN format is:
--   arn:aws:firehose:region:account-id:deliverystream/stream_name
[$sel:destinationStreamArn:EventStream'] :: EventStream -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EventStream</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedBy:EventStream'</a>,
--   <a>eventStream_lastUpdatedBy</a> - The IAM user who last modified the
--   event stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:EventStream'</a>,
--   <a>eventStream_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601 format,
--   when the event stream was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:externalId:EventStream'</a>, <a>eventStream_externalId</a> -
--   (Deprecated) Your AWS account ID, which you assigned to an external ID
--   key in an IAM trust policy. Amazon Pinpoint previously used this value
--   to assume an IAM role when publishing event data, but we removed this
--   requirement. We don't recommend use of external IDs for IAM roles that
--   are assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:EventStream'</a>,
--   <a>eventStream_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application to publish event data for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:EventStream'</a>, <a>eventStream_roleArn</a> - The AWS
--   Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon
--   Pinpoint to publish event data to the stream in your AWS account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationStreamArn:EventStream'</a>,
--   <a>eventStream_destinationStreamArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis data stream or Amazon Kinesis Data
--   Firehose delivery stream to publish event data to.
--   
--   For a Kinesis data stream, the ARN format is:
--   arn:aws:kinesis:region:account-id:stream/stream_name
--   
--   For a Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream, the ARN format is:
--   arn:aws:firehose:region:account-id:deliverystream/stream_name
newEventStream :: Text -> Text -> Text -> EventStream

-- | The IAM user who last modified the event stream.
eventStream_lastUpdatedBy :: Lens' EventStream (Maybe Text)

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the event stream was last modified.
eventStream_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' EventStream (Maybe Text)

-- | (Deprecated) Your AWS account ID, which you assigned to an external ID
--   key in an IAM trust policy. Amazon Pinpoint previously used this value
--   to assume an IAM role when publishing event data, but we removed this
--   requirement. We don't recommend use of external IDs for IAM roles that
--   are assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.
eventStream_externalId :: Lens' EventStream (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the application to publish event data for.
eventStream_applicationId :: Lens' EventStream Text

-- | The AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorizes
--   Amazon Pinpoint to publish event data to the stream in your AWS
--   account.
eventStream_roleArn :: Lens' EventStream Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis data stream or
--   Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream to publish event data to.
--   
--   For a Kinesis data stream, the ARN format is:
--   arn:aws:kinesis:region:account-id:stream/stream_name
--   
--   For a Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream, the ARN format is:
--   arn:aws:firehose:region:account-id:deliverystream/stream_name
eventStream_destinationStreamArn :: Lens' EventStream Text

-- | Specifies a batch of endpoints and events to process.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventsBatch</a> smart constructor.
data EventsBatch
EventsBatch' :: PublicEndpoint -> HashMap Text Event -> EventsBatch

-- | A set of properties and attributes that are associated with the
--   endpoint.
[$sel:endpoint:EventsBatch'] :: EventsBatch -> PublicEndpoint

-- | A set of properties that are associated with the event.
[$sel:events:EventsBatch'] :: EventsBatch -> HashMap Text Event

-- | Create a value of <a>EventsBatch</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpoint:EventsBatch'</a>, <a>eventsBatch_endpoint</a> - A set
--   of properties and attributes that are associated with the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:events:EventsBatch'</a>, <a>eventsBatch_events</a> - A set of
--   properties that are associated with the event.
newEventsBatch :: PublicEndpoint -> EventsBatch

-- | A set of properties and attributes that are associated with the
--   endpoint.
eventsBatch_endpoint :: Lens' EventsBatch PublicEndpoint

-- | A set of properties that are associated with the event.
eventsBatch_events :: Lens' EventsBatch (HashMap Text Event)

-- | Specifies a batch of events to process.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventsRequest</a> smart constructor.
data EventsRequest
EventsRequest' :: HashMap Text EventsBatch -> EventsRequest

-- | The batch of events to process. For each item in a batch, the endpoint
--   ID acts as a key that has an EventsBatch object as its value.
[$sel:batchItem:EventsRequest'] :: EventsRequest -> HashMap Text EventsBatch

-- | Create a value of <a>EventsRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:batchItem:EventsRequest'</a>, <a>eventsRequest_batchItem</a> -
--   The batch of events to process. For each item in a batch, the endpoint
--   ID acts as a key that has an EventsBatch object as its value.
newEventsRequest :: EventsRequest

-- | The batch of events to process. For each item in a batch, the endpoint
--   ID acts as a key that has an EventsBatch object as its value.
eventsRequest_batchItem :: Lens' EventsRequest (HashMap Text EventsBatch)

-- | Provides information about endpoints and the events that they're
--   associated with.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data EventsResponse
EventsResponse' :: Maybe (HashMap Text ItemResponse) -> EventsResponse

-- | A map that contains a multipart response for each endpoint. For each
--   item in this object, the endpoint ID is the key and the item response
--   is the value. If no item response exists, the value can also be one of
--   the following: 202, the request was processed successfully; or 400,
--   the payload wasn't valid or required fields were missing.
[$sel:results:EventsResponse'] :: EventsResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text ItemResponse)

-- | Create a value of <a>EventsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:results:EventsResponse'</a>, <a>eventsResponse_results</a> - A
--   map that contains a multipart response for each endpoint. For each
--   item in this object, the endpoint ID is the key and the item response
--   is the value. If no item response exists, the value can also be one of
--   the following: 202, the request was processed successfully; or 400,
--   the payload wasn't valid or required fields were missing.
newEventsResponse :: EventsResponse

-- | A map that contains a multipart response for each endpoint. For each
--   item in this object, the endpoint ID is the key and the item response
--   is the value. If no item response exists, the value can also be one of
--   the following: 202, the request was processed successfully; or 400,
--   the payload wasn't valid or required fields were missing.
eventsResponse_results :: Lens' EventsResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text ItemResponse))

-- | Specifies the settings for a job that exports endpoint definitions to
--   an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExportJobRequest</a> smart constructor.
data ExportJobRequest
ExportJobRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Text -> Text -> ExportJobRequest

-- | The identifier for the segment to export endpoint definitions from. If
--   you don't specify this value, Amazon Pinpoint exports definitions for
--   all the endpoints that are associated with the application.
[$sel:segmentId:ExportJobRequest'] :: ExportJobRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The version of the segment to export endpoint definitions from, if
--   specified.
[$sel:segmentVersion:ExportJobRequest'] :: ExportJobRequest -> Maybe Int

-- | The URL of the location in an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon
--   S3) bucket where you want to export endpoint definitions to. This
--   location is typically a folder that contains multiple files. The URL
--   should be in the following format: s3://bucket-name/folder-name/.
[$sel:s3UrlPrefix:ExportJobRequest'] :: ExportJobRequest -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to access the
--   Amazon S3 location where you want to export endpoint definitions to.
[$sel:roleArn:ExportJobRequest'] :: ExportJobRequest -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ExportJobRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentId:ExportJobRequest'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobRequest_segmentId</a> - The identifier for the segment to
--   export endpoint definitions from. If you don't specify this value,
--   Amazon Pinpoint exports definitions for all the endpoints that are
--   associated with the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentVersion:ExportJobRequest'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobRequest_segmentVersion</a> - The version of the segment to
--   export endpoint definitions from, if specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3UrlPrefix:ExportJobRequest'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobRequest_s3UrlPrefix</a> - The URL of the location in an
--   Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket where you want to
--   export endpoint definitions to. This location is typically a folder
--   that contains multiple files. The URL should be in the following
--   format: s3://bucket-name/folder-name/.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:ExportJobRequest'</a>, <a>exportJobRequest_roleArn</a>
--   - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to access the
--   Amazon S3 location where you want to export endpoint definitions to.
newExportJobRequest :: Text -> Text -> ExportJobRequest

-- | The identifier for the segment to export endpoint definitions from. If
--   you don't specify this value, Amazon Pinpoint exports definitions for
--   all the endpoints that are associated with the application.
exportJobRequest_segmentId :: Lens' ExportJobRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The version of the segment to export endpoint definitions from, if
--   specified.
exportJobRequest_segmentVersion :: Lens' ExportJobRequest (Maybe Int)

-- | The URL of the location in an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon
--   S3) bucket where you want to export endpoint definitions to. This
--   location is typically a folder that contains multiple files. The URL
--   should be in the following format: s3://bucket-name/folder-name/.
exportJobRequest_s3UrlPrefix :: Lens' ExportJobRequest Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to access the
--   Amazon S3 location where you want to export endpoint definitions to.
exportJobRequest_roleArn :: Lens' ExportJobRequest Text

-- | Provides information about the resource settings for a job that
--   exports endpoint definitions to a file. The file can be added directly
--   to an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket by using the
--   Amazon Pinpoint API or downloaded directly to a computer by using the
--   Amazon Pinpoint console.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExportJobResource</a> smart constructor.
data ExportJobResource
ExportJobResource' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Text -> Text -> ExportJobResource

-- | The identifier for the segment that the endpoint definitions were
--   exported from. If this value isn't present, Amazon Pinpoint exported
--   definitions for all the endpoints that are associated with the
--   application.
[$sel:segmentId:ExportJobResource'] :: ExportJobResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The version of the segment that the endpoint definitions were exported
--   from.
[$sel:segmentVersion:ExportJobResource'] :: ExportJobResource -> Maybe Int

-- | The URL of the location in an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon
--   S3) bucket where the endpoint definitions were exported to. This
--   location is typically a folder that contains multiple files. The URL
--   should be in the following format: s3://bucket-name/folder-name/.
[$sel:s3UrlPrefix:ExportJobResource'] :: ExportJobResource -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorized Amazon Pinpoint to access the
--   Amazon S3 location where the endpoint definitions were exported to.
[$sel:roleArn:ExportJobResource'] :: ExportJobResource -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ExportJobResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentId:ExportJobResource'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResource_segmentId</a> - The identifier for the segment
--   that the endpoint definitions were exported from. If this value isn't
--   present, Amazon Pinpoint exported definitions for all the endpoints
--   that are associated with the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentVersion:ExportJobResource'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResource_segmentVersion</a> - The version of the segment
--   that the endpoint definitions were exported from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3UrlPrefix:ExportJobResource'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResource_s3UrlPrefix</a> - The URL of the location in an
--   Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket where the endpoint
--   definitions were exported to. This location is typically a folder that
--   contains multiple files. The URL should be in the following format:
--   s3://bucket-name/folder-name/.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:ExportJobResource'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResource_roleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorized
--   Amazon Pinpoint to access the Amazon S3 location where the endpoint
--   definitions were exported to.
newExportJobResource :: Text -> Text -> ExportJobResource

-- | The identifier for the segment that the endpoint definitions were
--   exported from. If this value isn't present, Amazon Pinpoint exported
--   definitions for all the endpoints that are associated with the
--   application.
exportJobResource_segmentId :: Lens' ExportJobResource (Maybe Text)

-- | The version of the segment that the endpoint definitions were exported
--   from.
exportJobResource_segmentVersion :: Lens' ExportJobResource (Maybe Int)

-- | The URL of the location in an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon
--   S3) bucket where the endpoint definitions were exported to. This
--   location is typically a folder that contains multiple files. The URL
--   should be in the following format: s3://bucket-name/folder-name/.
exportJobResource_s3UrlPrefix :: Lens' ExportJobResource Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorized Amazon Pinpoint to access the
--   Amazon S3 location where the endpoint definitions were exported to.
exportJobResource_roleArn :: Lens' ExportJobResource Text

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of a job that
--   exports endpoint definitions to a file. The file can be added directly
--   to an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket by using the
--   Amazon Pinpoint API or downloaded directly to a computer by using the
--   Amazon Pinpoint console.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExportJobResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ExportJobResponse
ExportJobResponse' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> JobStatus -> Text -> Text -> ExportJobResource -> Text -> Text -> ExportJobResponse

-- | The number of pieces that were processed successfully (completed) by
--   the export job, as of the time of the request.
[$sel:completedPieces:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of pieces that weren't processed successfully (failed) by
--   the export job, as of the time of the request.
[$sel:failedPieces:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The total number of endpoint definitions that were processed by the
--   export job.
[$sel:totalProcessed:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | An array of entries, one for each of the first 100 entries that
--   weren't processed successfully (failed) by the export job, if any.
[$sel:failures:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The total number of pieces that must be processed to complete the
--   export job. Each piece consists of an approximately equal portion of
--   the endpoint definitions that are part of the export job.
[$sel:totalPieces:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the export job was completed.
[$sel:completionDate:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of endpoint definitions that weren't processed
--   successfully (failed) by the export job, typically because an error,
--   such as a syntax error, occurred.
[$sel:totalFailures:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The status of the export job. The job status is FAILED if Amazon
--   Pinpoint wasn't able to process one or more pieces in the job.
[$sel:jobStatus:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> JobStatus

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the export job was created.
[$sel:creationDate:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> Text

-- | The job type. This value is EXPORT for export jobs.
[$sel:type':ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> Text

-- | The resource settings that apply to the export job.
[$sel:definition:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> ExportJobResource

-- | The unique identifier for the export job.
[$sel:id:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application that's associated with the
--   export job.
[$sel:applicationId:ExportJobResponse'] :: ExportJobResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ExportJobResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:completedPieces:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_completedPieces</a> - The number of pieces that
--   were processed successfully (completed) by the export job, as of the
--   time of the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failedPieces:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_failedPieces</a> - The number of pieces that
--   weren't processed successfully (failed) by the export job, as of the
--   time of the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalProcessed:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_totalProcessed</a> - The total number of endpoint
--   definitions that were processed by the export job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failures:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_failures</a> - An array of entries, one for each
--   of the first 100 entries that weren't processed successfully (failed)
--   by the export job, if any.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalPieces:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_totalPieces</a> - The total number of pieces that
--   must be processed to complete the export job. Each piece consists of
--   an approximately equal portion of the endpoint definitions that are
--   part of the export job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionDate:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_completionDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the export job was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalFailures:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_totalFailures</a> - The total number of endpoint
--   definitions that weren't processed successfully (failed) by the export
--   job, typically because an error, such as a syntax error, occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobStatus:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_jobStatus</a> - The status of the export job. The
--   job status is FAILED if Amazon Pinpoint wasn't able to process one or
--   more pieces in the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601 format,
--   when the export job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ExportJobResponse'</a>, <a>exportJobResponse_type</a> -
--   The job type. This value is EXPORT for export jobs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:definition:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_definition</a> - The resource settings that apply
--   to the export job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ExportJobResponse'</a>, <a>exportJobResponse_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the export job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application that's associated with the export job.
newExportJobResponse :: JobStatus -> Text -> Text -> ExportJobResource -> Text -> Text -> ExportJobResponse

-- | The number of pieces that were processed successfully (completed) by
--   the export job, as of the time of the request.
exportJobResponse_completedPieces :: Lens' ExportJobResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of pieces that weren't processed successfully (failed) by
--   the export job, as of the time of the request.
exportJobResponse_failedPieces :: Lens' ExportJobResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The total number of endpoint definitions that were processed by the
--   export job.
exportJobResponse_totalProcessed :: Lens' ExportJobResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | An array of entries, one for each of the first 100 entries that
--   weren't processed successfully (failed) by the export job, if any.
exportJobResponse_failures :: Lens' ExportJobResponse (Maybe [Text])

-- | The total number of pieces that must be processed to complete the
--   export job. Each piece consists of an approximately equal portion of
--   the endpoint definitions that are part of the export job.
exportJobResponse_totalPieces :: Lens' ExportJobResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the export job was completed.
exportJobResponse_completionDate :: Lens' ExportJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of endpoint definitions that weren't processed
--   successfully (failed) by the export job, typically because an error,
--   such as a syntax error, occurred.
exportJobResponse_totalFailures :: Lens' ExportJobResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The status of the export job. The job status is FAILED if Amazon
--   Pinpoint wasn't able to process one or more pieces in the job.
exportJobResponse_jobStatus :: Lens' ExportJobResponse JobStatus

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the export job was created.
exportJobResponse_creationDate :: Lens' ExportJobResponse Text

-- | The job type. This value is EXPORT for export jobs.
exportJobResponse_type :: Lens' ExportJobResponse Text

-- | The resource settings that apply to the export job.
exportJobResponse_definition :: Lens' ExportJobResponse ExportJobResource

-- | The unique identifier for the export job.
exportJobResponse_id :: Lens' ExportJobResponse Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application that's associated with the
--   export job.
exportJobResponse_applicationId :: Lens' ExportJobResponse Text

-- | Provides information about all the export jobs that are associated
--   with an application or segment. An export job is a job that exports
--   endpoint definitions to a file.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExportJobsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ExportJobsResponse
ExportJobsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> [ExportJobResponse] -> ExportJobsResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
[$sel:nextToken:ExportJobsResponse'] :: ExportJobsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of responses, one for each export job that's associated with
--   the application (Export Jobs resource) or segment (Segment Export Jobs
--   resource).
[$sel:item:ExportJobsResponse'] :: ExportJobsResponse -> [ExportJobResponse]

-- | Create a value of <a>ExportJobsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ExportJobsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobsResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use in a
--   subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated
--   response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:ExportJobsResponse'</a>, <a>exportJobsResponse_item</a> -
--   An array of responses, one for each export job that's associated with
--   the application (Export Jobs resource) or segment (Segment Export Jobs
--   resource).
newExportJobsResponse :: ExportJobsResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
exportJobsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ExportJobsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of responses, one for each export job that's associated with
--   the application (Export Jobs resource) or segment (Segment Export Jobs
--   resource).
exportJobsResponse_item :: Lens' ExportJobsResponse [ExportJobResponse]

-- | Specifies the status and settings of the GCM channel for an
--   application. This channel enables Amazon Pinpoint to send push
--   notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly
--   Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGCMChannelRequest</a> smart constructor.
data GCMChannelRequest
GCMChannelRequest' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> GCMChannelRequest

-- | Specifies whether to enable the GCM channel for the application.
[$sel:enabled:GCMChannelRequest'] :: GCMChannelRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Web API Key, also referred to as an <i>API_KEY</i> or <i>server
--   key</i>, that you received from Google to communicate with Google
--   services.
[$sel:apiKey:GCMChannelRequest'] :: GCMChannelRequest -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GCMChannelRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:GCMChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>gCMChannelRequest_enabled</a> - Specifies whether to enable the GCM
--   channel for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:apiKey:GCMChannelRequest'</a>, <a>gCMChannelRequest_apiKey</a>
--   - The Web API Key, also referred to as an <i>API_KEY</i> or <i>server
--   key</i>, that you received from Google to communicate with Google
--   services.
newGCMChannelRequest :: Text -> GCMChannelRequest

-- | Specifies whether to enable the GCM channel for the application.
gCMChannelRequest_enabled :: Lens' GCMChannelRequest (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Web API Key, also referred to as an <i>API_KEY</i> or <i>server
--   key</i>, that you received from Google to communicate with Google
--   services.
gCMChannelRequest_apiKey :: Lens' GCMChannelRequest Text

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of the GCM channel
--   for an application. The GCM channel enables Amazon Pinpoint to send
--   push notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM),
--   formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGCMChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GCMChannelResponse
GCMChannelResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> Text -> GCMChannelResponse

-- | The date and time when the GCM channel was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:GCMChannelResponse'] :: GCMChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the GCM channel is enabled for the application.
[$sel:enabled:GCMChannelResponse'] :: GCMChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether the GCM channel is archived.
[$sel:isArchived:GCMChannelResponse'] :: GCMChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the GCM channel applies
--   to.
[$sel:applicationId:GCMChannelResponse'] :: GCMChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The current version of the GCM channel.
[$sel:version:GCMChannelResponse'] :: GCMChannelResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the GCM channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:id:GCMChannelResponse'] :: GCMChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time when the GCM channel was enabled.
[$sel:creationDate:GCMChannelResponse'] :: GCMChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The user who last modified the GCM channel.
[$sel:lastModifiedBy:GCMChannelResponse'] :: GCMChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:hasCredential:GCMChannelResponse'] :: GCMChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Web API Key, also referred to as an <i>API_KEY</i> or <i>server
--   key</i>, that you received from Google to communicate with Google
--   services.
[$sel:credential:GCMChannelResponse'] :: GCMChannelResponse -> Text

-- | The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For
--   the GCM channel, this value is GCM.
[$sel:platform:GCMChannelResponse'] :: GCMChannelResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GCMChannelResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:GCMChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>gCMChannelResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date and time when
--   the GCM channel was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:GCMChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>gCMChannelResponse_enabled</a> - Specifies whether the GCM channel
--   is enabled for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isArchived:GCMChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>gCMChannelResponse_isArchived</a> - Specifies whether the GCM
--   channel is archived.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:GCMChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>gCMChannelResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the application that the GCM channel applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:GCMChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>gCMChannelResponse_version</a> - The current version of the GCM
--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:GCMChannelResponse'</a>, <a>gCMChannelResponse_id</a> -
--   (Deprecated) An identifier for the GCM channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:GCMChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>gCMChannelResponse_creationDate</a> - The date and time when the
--   GCM channel was enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedBy:GCMChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>gCMChannelResponse_lastModifiedBy</a> - The user who last modified
--   the GCM channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasCredential:GCMChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>gCMChannelResponse_hasCredential</a> - (Not used) This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:credential:GCMChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>gCMChannelResponse_credential</a> - The Web API Key, also referred
--   to as an <i>API_KEY</i> or <i>server key</i>, that you received from
--   Google to communicate with Google services.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:GCMChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>gCMChannelResponse_platform</a> - The type of messaging or
--   notification platform for the channel. For the GCM channel, this value
--   is GCM.
newGCMChannelResponse :: Text -> Text -> GCMChannelResponse

-- | The date and time when the GCM channel was last modified.
gCMChannelResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' GCMChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the GCM channel is enabled for the application.
gCMChannelResponse_enabled :: Lens' GCMChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether the GCM channel is archived.
gCMChannelResponse_isArchived :: Lens' GCMChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the GCM channel applies
--   to.
gCMChannelResponse_applicationId :: Lens' GCMChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The current version of the GCM channel.
gCMChannelResponse_version :: Lens' GCMChannelResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the GCM channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
gCMChannelResponse_id :: Lens' GCMChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when the GCM channel was enabled.
gCMChannelResponse_creationDate :: Lens' GCMChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The user who last modified the GCM channel.
gCMChannelResponse_lastModifiedBy :: Lens' GCMChannelResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
gCMChannelResponse_hasCredential :: Lens' GCMChannelResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Web API Key, also referred to as an <i>API_KEY</i> or <i>server
--   key</i>, that you received from Google to communicate with Google
--   services.
gCMChannelResponse_credential :: Lens' GCMChannelResponse Text

-- | The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For
--   the GCM channel, this value is GCM.
gCMChannelResponse_platform :: Lens' GCMChannelResponse Text

-- | Specifies the settings for a one-time message that's sent directly to
--   an endpoint through the GCM channel. The GCM channel enables Amazon
--   Pinpoint to send messages to the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM),
--   formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGCMMessage</a> smart constructor.
data GCMMessage
GCMMessage' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> GCMMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the notification message. You
--   can override the default variables with individual address variables.
[$sel:substitutions:GCMMessage'] :: GCMMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification,
--   which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's
--   device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as
--   updating an app's configuration or supporting phone home
--   functionality.
[$sel:silentPush:GCMMessage'] :: GCMMessage -> Maybe Bool

-- | The URL of the large icon image to display in the content view of the
--   push notification.
[$sel:imageIconUrl:GCMMessage'] :: GCMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | para&gt;normal - The notification might be delayed. Delivery is
--   optimized for battery usage on the recipient's device. Use this value
--   unless immediate delivery is required.
--   
--   /listitem&gt;
--   
--   high - The notification is sent immediately and might wake a sleeping
--   device.
--   
--   /para&gt;
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the FCM priority parameter
--   when it sends the notification message to FCM.
--   
--   The equivalent values for Apple Push Notification service (APNs) are
--   5, for normal, and 10, for high. If you specify an APNs value for this
--   property, Amazon Pinpoint accepts and converts the value to the
--   corresponding FCM value.
[$sel:priority:GCMMessage'] :: GCMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the
--   notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other
--   content for the message.
[$sel:rawContent:GCMMessage'] :: GCMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The JSON data payload to use for the push notification, if the
--   notification is a silent push notification. This payload is added to
--   the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.
[$sel:data':GCMMessage'] :: GCMMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The package name of the application where registration tokens must
--   match in order for the recipient to receive the message.
[$sel:restrictedPackageName:GCMMessage'] :: GCMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL of the small icon image to display in the status bar and the
--   content view of the push notification.
[$sel:smallImageIconUrl:GCMMessage'] :: GCMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The body of the notification message.
[$sel:body:GCMMessage'] :: GCMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, that FCM should store and attempt to
--   deliver the push notification, if the service is unable to deliver the
--   notification the first time. If you don't specify this value, FCM
--   defaults to the maximum value, which is 2,419,200 seconds (28 days).
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the FCM time_to_live parameter
--   when it sends the notification message to FCM.
[$sel:timeToLive:GCMMessage'] :: GCMMessage -> Maybe Int

-- | The URL to open in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action
--   property is URL.
[$sel:url:GCMMessage'] :: GCMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The sound to play when the recipient receives the push notification.
--   You can use the default stream or specify the file name of a sound
--   resource that's bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound
--   file must reside in /res/raw/.
[$sel:sound:GCMMessage'] :: GCMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The action to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of
--   the Android platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:action:GCMMessage'] :: GCMMessage -> Maybe Action

-- | An arbitrary string that identifies a group of messages that can be
--   collapsed to ensure that only the last message is sent when delivery
--   can resume. This helps avoid sending too many instances of the same
--   messages when the recipient's device comes online again or becomes
--   active.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the Firebase Cloud Messaging
--   (FCM) collapse_key parameter when it sends the notification message to
--   FCM.
[$sel:collapseKey:GCMMessage'] :: GCMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL of an image to display in the push notification.
[$sel:imageUrl:GCMMessage'] :: GCMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The title to display above the notification message on the recipient's
--   device.
[$sel:title:GCMMessage'] :: GCMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The icon image name of the asset saved in your app.
[$sel:iconReference:GCMMessage'] :: GCMMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GCMMessage</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_substitutions</a>
--   - The default message variables to use in the notification message.
--   You can override the default variables with individual address
--   variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:silentPush:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_silentPush</a> -
--   Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification,
--   which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's
--   device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as
--   updating an app's configuration or supporting phone home
--   functionality.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageIconUrl:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_imageIconUrl</a> -
--   The URL of the large icon image to display in the content view of the
--   push notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:priority:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_priority</a> -
--   para&gt;normal - The notification might be delayed. Delivery is
--   optimized for battery usage on the recipient's device. Use this value
--   unless immediate delivery is required.
--   
--   /listitem&gt;
--   
--   high - The notification is sent immediately and might wake a sleeping
--   device.
--   
--   /para&gt;
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the FCM priority parameter
--   when it sends the notification message to FCM.
--   
--   The equivalent values for Apple Push Notification service (APNs) are
--   5, for normal, and 10, for high. If you specify an APNs value for this
--   property, Amazon Pinpoint accepts and converts the value to the
--   corresponding FCM value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawContent:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_rawContent</a> - The
--   raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the notification
--   message. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the
--   message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_data</a> - The JSON data
--   payload to use for the push notification, if the notification is a
--   silent push notification. This payload is added to the
--   data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:restrictedPackageName:GCMMessage'</a>,
--   <a>gCMMessage_restrictedPackageName</a> - The package name of the
--   application where registration tokens must match in order for the
--   recipient to receive the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:smallImageIconUrl:GCMMessage'</a>,
--   <a>gCMMessage_smallImageIconUrl</a> - The URL of the small icon image
--   to display in the status bar and the content view of the push
--   notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_body</a> - The body of the
--   notification message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeToLive:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_timeToLive</a> - The
--   amount of time, in seconds, that FCM should store and attempt to
--   deliver the push notification, if the service is unable to deliver the
--   notification the first time. If you don't specify this value, FCM
--   defaults to the maximum value, which is 2,419,200 seconds (28 days).
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the FCM time_to_live parameter
--   when it sends the notification message to FCM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_url</a> - The URL to open
--   in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the
--   push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sound:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_sound</a> - The sound to
--   play when the recipient receives the push notification. You can use
--   the default stream or specify the file name of a sound resource that's
--   bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound file must
--   reside in /res/raw/.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_action</a> - The action
--   to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid values
--   are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of
--   the Android platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:collapseKey:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_collapseKey</a> -
--   An arbitrary string that identifies a group of messages that can be
--   collapsed to ensure that only the last message is sent when delivery
--   can resume. This helps avoid sending too many instances of the same
--   messages when the recipient's device comes online again or becomes
--   active.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the Firebase Cloud Messaging
--   (FCM) collapse_key parameter when it sends the notification message to
--   FCM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageUrl:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_imageUrl</a> - The URL
--   of an image to display in the push notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_title</a> - The title to
--   display above the notification message on the recipient's device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iconReference:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_iconReference</a>
--   - The icon image name of the asset saved in your app.
newGCMMessage :: GCMMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the notification message. You
--   can override the default variables with individual address variables.
gCMMessage_substitutions :: Lens' GCMMessage (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification,
--   which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's
--   device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as
--   updating an app's configuration or supporting phone home
--   functionality.
gCMMessage_silentPush :: Lens' GCMMessage (Maybe Bool)

-- | The URL of the large icon image to display in the content view of the
--   push notification.
gCMMessage_imageIconUrl :: Lens' GCMMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | para&gt;normal - The notification might be delayed. Delivery is
--   optimized for battery usage on the recipient's device. Use this value
--   unless immediate delivery is required.
--   
--   /listitem&gt;
--   
--   high - The notification is sent immediately and might wake a sleeping
--   device.
--   
--   /para&gt;
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the FCM priority parameter
--   when it sends the notification message to FCM.
--   
--   The equivalent values for Apple Push Notification service (APNs) are
--   5, for normal, and 10, for high. If you specify an APNs value for this
--   property, Amazon Pinpoint accepts and converts the value to the
--   corresponding FCM value.
gCMMessage_priority :: Lens' GCMMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the
--   notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other
--   content for the message.
gCMMessage_rawContent :: Lens' GCMMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The JSON data payload to use for the push notification, if the
--   notification is a silent push notification. This payload is added to
--   the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.
gCMMessage_data :: Lens' GCMMessage (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

--   match in order for the recipient to receive the message.
gCMMessage_restrictedPackageName :: Lens' GCMMessage (Maybe Text)

gCMMessage_smallImageIconUrl :: Lens' GCMMessage (Maybe Text)

gCMMessage_body :: Lens' GCMMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, that FCM should store and attempt to
--   deliver the push notification, if the service is unable to deliver the
--   notification the first time. If you don't specify this value, FCM
--   defaults to the maximum value, which is 2,419,200 seconds (28 days).
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the FCM time_to_live parameter
--   when it sends the notification message to FCM.
gCMMessage_timeToLive :: Lens' GCMMessage (Maybe Int)

-- | The URL to open in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action
--   property is URL.
gCMMessage_url :: Lens' GCMMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The sound to play when the recipient receives the push notification.
--   You can use the default stream or specify the file name of a sound
--   resource that's bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound
--   file must reside in /res/raw/.
gCMMessage_sound :: Lens' GCMMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The action to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>

--   interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of
--   the Android platform.</li>

gCMMessage_action :: Lens' GCMMessage (Maybe Action)

-- | An arbitrary string that identifies a group of messages that can be

--   can resume. This helps avoid sending too many instances of the same

--   active.

--   (FCM) collapse_key parameter when it sends the notification message to
--   FCM.
gCMMessage_collapseKey :: Lens' GCMMessage (Maybe Text)

gCMMessage_imageUrl :: Lens' GCMMessage (Maybe Text)

gCMMessage_title :: Lens' GCMMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the GPS coordinates of a location.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGPSCoordinates</a> smart constructor.
data GPSCoordinates
GPSCoordinates' :: Double -> Double -> GPSCoordinates

-- | The latitude coordinate of the location.
[$sel:latitude:GPSCoordinates'] :: GPSCoordinates -> Double

-- | The longitude coordinate of the location.
[$sel:longitude:GPSCoordinates'] :: GPSCoordinates -> Double

-- | Create a value of <a>GPSCoordinates</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:latitude:GPSCoordinates'</a>, <a>gPSCoordinates_latitude</a> -
--   The latitude coordinate of the location.
--   
--   <a>$sel:longitude:GPSCoordinates'</a>, <a>gPSCoordinates_longitude</a>
--   - The longitude coordinate of the location.
newGPSCoordinates :: Double -> Double -> GPSCoordinates

-- | The latitude coordinate of the location.
gPSCoordinates_latitude :: Lens' GPSCoordinates Double

-- | The longitude coordinate of the location.
gPSCoordinates_longitude :: Lens' GPSCoordinates Double

-- | Specifies GPS-based criteria for including or excluding endpoints from
--   a segment.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGPSPointDimension</a> smart constructor.
data GPSPointDimension
GPSPointDimension' :: Maybe Double -> GPSCoordinates -> GPSPointDimension

-- | The range, in kilometers, from the GPS coordinates.
[$sel:rangeInKilometers:GPSPointDimension'] :: GPSPointDimension -> Maybe Double

-- | The GPS coordinates to measure distance from.
[$sel:coordinates:GPSPointDimension'] :: GPSPointDimension -> GPSCoordinates

-- | Create a value of <a>GPSPointDimension</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:rangeInKilometers:GPSPointDimension'</a>,
--   <a>gPSPointDimension_rangeInKilometers</a> - The range, in kilometers,
--   from the GPS coordinates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:coordinates:GPSPointDimension'</a>,
--   <a>gPSPointDimension_coordinates</a> - The GPS coordinates to measure
--   distance from.
newGPSPointDimension :: GPSCoordinates -> GPSPointDimension

-- | The range, in kilometers, from the GPS coordinates.
gPSPointDimension_rangeInKilometers :: Lens' GPSPointDimension (Maybe Double)

-- | The GPS coordinates to measure distance from.
gPSPointDimension_coordinates :: Lens' GPSPointDimension GPSCoordinates

-- | Specifies the settings for a holdout activity in a journey. This type
--   of activity stops a journey for a specified percentage of
--   participants.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHoldoutActivity</a> smart constructor.
data HoldoutActivity
HoldoutActivity' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> HoldoutActivity

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after
--   performing the holdout activity.
[$sel:nextActivity:HoldoutActivity'] :: HoldoutActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The percentage of participants who shouldn't continue the journey.
--   
--   To determine which participants are held out, Amazon Pinpoint applies
--   a probability-based algorithm to the percentage that you specify.
--   Therefore, the actual percentage of participants who are held out may
--   not be equal to the percentage that you specify.
[$sel:percentage:HoldoutActivity'] :: HoldoutActivity -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>HoldoutActivity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextActivity:HoldoutActivity'</a>,
--   <a>holdoutActivity_nextActivity</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   next activity to perform, after performing the holdout activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:percentage:HoldoutActivity'</a>,
--   <a>holdoutActivity_percentage</a> - The percentage of participants who
--   shouldn't continue the journey.
--   
--   To determine which participants are held out, Amazon Pinpoint applies
--   a probability-based algorithm to the percentage that you specify.
--   Therefore, the actual percentage of participants who are held out may
--   not be equal to the percentage that you specify.
newHoldoutActivity :: Int -> HoldoutActivity

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after
--   performing the holdout activity.
holdoutActivity_nextActivity :: Lens' HoldoutActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | The percentage of participants who shouldn't continue the journey.
--   
--   To determine which participants are held out, Amazon Pinpoint applies
--   a probability-based algorithm to the percentage that you specify.
--   Therefore, the actual percentage of participants who are held out may
--   not be equal to the percentage that you specify.
holdoutActivity_percentage :: Lens' HoldoutActivity Int

-- | Specifies the settings for a job that imports endpoint definitions
--   from an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newImportJobRequest</a> smart constructor.
data ImportJobRequest
ImportJobRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DefinitionFormat -> Text -> Text -> ImportJobRequest

-- | A custom name for the segment that's created by the import job, if the
--   value of the DefineSegment property is true.
[$sel:segmentName:ImportJobRequest'] :: ImportJobRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether to create a segment that contains the endpoints,
--   when the endpoint definitions are imported.
[$sel:defineSegment:ImportJobRequest'] :: ImportJobRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether to register the endpoints with Amazon Pinpoint, when
--   the endpoint definitions are imported.
[$sel:registerEndpoints:ImportJobRequest'] :: ImportJobRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | (Deprecated) Your AWS account ID, which you assigned to an external ID
--   key in an IAM trust policy. Amazon Pinpoint previously used this value
--   to assume an IAM role when importing endpoint definitions, but we
--   removed this requirement. We don't recommend use of external IDs for
--   IAM roles that are assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.
[$sel:externalId:ImportJobRequest'] :: ImportJobRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier for the segment to update or add the imported endpoint
--   definitions to, if the import job is meant to update an existing
--   segment.
[$sel:segmentId:ImportJobRequest'] :: ImportJobRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The format of the files that contain the endpoint definitions to
--   import. Valid values are: CSV, for comma-separated values format; and,
--   JSON, for newline-delimited JSON format. If the Amazon S3 location
--   stores multiple files that use different formats, Amazon Pinpoint
--   imports data only from the files that use the specified format.
[$sel:format:ImportJobRequest'] :: ImportJobRequest -> DefinitionFormat

-- | The URL of the Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket that
--   contains the endpoint definitions to import. This location can be a
--   folder or a single file. If the location is a folder, Amazon Pinpoint
--   imports endpoint definitions from the files in this location,
--   including any subfolders that the folder contains.
--   
--   The URL should be in the following format:
--   s3://bucket-name/folder-name/file-name. The location can end with the
--   key for an individual object or a prefix that qualifies multiple
--   objects.
[$sel:s3Url:ImportJobRequest'] :: ImportJobRequest -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to access the
--   Amazon S3 location to import endpoint definitions from.
[$sel:roleArn:ImportJobRequest'] :: ImportJobRequest -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ImportJobRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentName:ImportJobRequest'</a>,
--   <a>importJobRequest_segmentName</a> - A custom name for the segment
--   that's created by the import job, if the value of the DefineSegment
--   property is true.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defineSegment:ImportJobRequest'</a>,
--   <a>importJobRequest_defineSegment</a> - Specifies whether to create a
--   segment that contains the endpoints, when the endpoint definitions are
--   imported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:registerEndpoints:ImportJobRequest'</a>,
--   <a>importJobRequest_registerEndpoints</a> - Specifies whether to
--   register the endpoints with Amazon Pinpoint, when the endpoint
--   definitions are imported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:externalId:ImportJobRequest'</a>,
--   <a>importJobRequest_externalId</a> - (Deprecated) Your AWS account ID,
--   which you assigned to an external ID key in an IAM trust policy.
--   Amazon Pinpoint previously used this value to assume an IAM role when
--   importing endpoint definitions, but we removed this requirement. We
--   don't recommend use of external IDs for IAM roles that are assumed by
--   Amazon Pinpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentId:ImportJobRequest'</a>,
--   <a>importJobRequest_segmentId</a> - The identifier for the segment to
--   update or add the imported endpoint definitions to, if the import job
--   is meant to update an existing segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:format:ImportJobRequest'</a>, <a>importJobRequest_format</a> -
--   The format of the files that contain the endpoint definitions to
--   import. Valid values are: CSV, for comma-separated values format; and,
--   JSON, for newline-delimited JSON format. If the Amazon S3 location
--   stores multiple files that use different formats, Amazon Pinpoint
--   imports data only from the files that use the specified format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Url:ImportJobRequest'</a>, <a>importJobRequest_s3Url</a> -
--   The URL of the Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket that
--   contains the endpoint definitions to import. This location can be a
--   folder or a single file. If the location is a folder, Amazon Pinpoint
--   imports endpoint definitions from the files in this location,
--   including any subfolders that the folder contains.
--   
--   The URL should be in the following format:
--   s3://bucket-name/folder-name/file-name. The location can end with the
--   key for an individual object or a prefix that qualifies multiple
--   objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:ImportJobRequest'</a>, <a>importJobRequest_roleArn</a>
--   - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to access the
--   Amazon S3 location to import endpoint definitions from.
newImportJobRequest :: DefinitionFormat -> Text -> Text -> ImportJobRequest

-- | A custom name for the segment that's created by the import job, if the
--   value of the DefineSegment property is true.
importJobRequest_segmentName :: Lens' ImportJobRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether to create a segment that contains the endpoints,
--   when the endpoint definitions are imported.
importJobRequest_defineSegment :: Lens' ImportJobRequest (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether to register the endpoints with Amazon Pinpoint, when
--   the endpoint definitions are imported.
importJobRequest_registerEndpoints :: Lens' ImportJobRequest (Maybe Bool)

-- | (Deprecated) Your AWS account ID, which you assigned to an external ID
--   key in an IAM trust policy. Amazon Pinpoint previously used this value
--   to assume an IAM role when importing endpoint definitions, but we
--   removed this requirement. We don't recommend use of external IDs for
--   IAM roles that are assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.
importJobRequest_externalId :: Lens' ImportJobRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier for the segment to update or add the imported endpoint
--   definitions to, if the import job is meant to update an existing
--   segment.
importJobRequest_segmentId :: Lens' ImportJobRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The format of the files that contain the endpoint definitions to
--   import. Valid values are: CSV, for comma-separated values format; and,
--   JSON, for newline-delimited JSON format. If the Amazon S3 location
--   stores multiple files that use different formats, Amazon Pinpoint
--   imports data only from the files that use the specified format.
importJobRequest_format :: Lens' ImportJobRequest DefinitionFormat

-- | The URL of the Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket that
--   contains the endpoint definitions to import. This location can be a
--   folder or a single file. If the location is a folder, Amazon Pinpoint
--   imports endpoint definitions from the files in this location,
--   including any subfolders that the folder contains.
--   
--   The URL should be in the following format:
--   s3://bucket-name/folder-name/file-name. The location can end with the
--   key for an individual object or a prefix that qualifies multiple
--   objects.
importJobRequest_s3Url :: Lens' ImportJobRequest Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to access the
--   Amazon S3 location to import endpoint definitions from.
importJobRequest_roleArn :: Lens' ImportJobRequest Text

-- | Provides information about the resource settings for a job that
--   imports endpoint definitions from one or more files. The files can be
--   stored in an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket or
--   uploaded directly from a computer by using the Amazon Pinpoint
--   console.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newImportJobResource</a> smart constructor.
data ImportJobResource
ImportJobResource' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DefinitionFormat -> Text -> Text -> ImportJobResource

-- | The custom name for the segment that's created by the import job, if
--   the value of the DefineSegment property is true.
[$sel:segmentName:ImportJobResource'] :: ImportJobResource -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the import job creates a segment that contains the
--   endpoints, when the endpoint definitions are imported.
[$sel:defineSegment:ImportJobResource'] :: ImportJobResource -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether the import job registers the endpoints with Amazon
--   Pinpoint, when the endpoint definitions are imported.
[$sel:registerEndpoints:ImportJobResource'] :: ImportJobResource -> Maybe Bool

-- | (Deprecated) Your AWS account ID, which you assigned to an external ID
--   key in an IAM trust policy. Amazon Pinpoint previously used this value
--   to assume an IAM role when importing endpoint definitions, but we
--   removed this requirement. We don't recommend use of external IDs for
--   IAM roles that are assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.
[$sel:externalId:ImportJobResource'] :: ImportJobResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier for the segment that the import job updates or adds
--   endpoint definitions to, if the import job updates an existing
--   segment.
[$sel:segmentId:ImportJobResource'] :: ImportJobResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The format of the files that contain the endpoint definitions to
--   import. Valid values are: CSV, for comma-separated values format; and,
--   JSON, for newline-delimited JSON format.
--   
--   If the files are stored in an Amazon S3 location and that location
--   contains multiple files that use different formats, Amazon Pinpoint
--   imports data only from the files that use the specified format.
[$sel:format:ImportJobResource'] :: ImportJobResource -> DefinitionFormat

-- | The URL of the Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket that
--   contains the endpoint definitions to import. This location can be a
--   folder or a single file. If the location is a folder, Amazon Pinpoint
--   imports endpoint definitions from the files in this location,
--   including any subfolders that the folder contains.
--   
--   The URL should be in the following format:
--   s3://bucket-name/folder-name/file-name. The location can end with the
--   key for an individual object or a prefix that qualifies multiple
--   objects.
[$sel:s3Url:ImportJobResource'] :: ImportJobResource -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to access the
--   Amazon S3 location to import endpoint definitions from.
[$sel:roleArn:ImportJobResource'] :: ImportJobResource -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ImportJobResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   that the import job updates or adds endpoint definitions to, if the
--   import job updates an existing segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:format:ImportJobResource'</a>, <a>importJobResource_format</a>
--   - The format of the files that contain the endpoint definitions to
--   import. Valid values are: CSV, for comma-separated values format; and,
--   JSON, for newline-delimited JSON format.

--   Amazon Pinpoint to access the Amazon S3 location to import endpoint
--   definitions from.
newImportJobResource :: DefinitionFormat -> Text -> Text -> ImportJobResource

-- | The custom name for the segment that's created by the import job, if
--   the value of the DefineSegment property is true.
importJobResource_segmentName :: Lens' ImportJobResource (Maybe Text)

--   endpoints, when the endpoint definitions are imported.

--   Pinpoint, when the endpoint definitions are imported.
importJobResource_registerEndpoints :: Lens' ImportJobResource (Maybe Bool)

--   key in an IAM trust policy. Amazon Pinpoint previously used this value

--   removed this requirement. We don't recommend use of external IDs for
--   IAM roles that are assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.

--   endpoint definitions to, if the import job updates an existing
--   segment.
importJobResource_segmentId :: Lens' ImportJobResource (Maybe Text)

--   imports data only from the files that use the specified format.

-- | The URL of the Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket that
