--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to access the
--   Amazon S3 location to import endpoint definitions from.
importJobResource_roleArn :: Lens' ImportJobResource Text

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of a job that
--   imports endpoint definitions from one or more files. The files can be
--   stored in an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket or
--   uploaded directly from a computer by using the Amazon Pinpoint
--   console.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newImportJobResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ImportJobResponse
ImportJobResponse' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> JobStatus -> Text -> Text -> ImportJobResource -> Text -> Text -> ImportJobResponse

-- | The number of pieces that were processed successfully (completed) by
--   the import job, as of the time of the request.
[$sel:completedPieces:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of pieces that weren't processed successfully (failed) by
--   the import job, as of the time of the request.
[$sel:failedPieces:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The total number of endpoint definitions that were processed by the
--   import job.
[$sel:totalProcessed:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | An array of entries, one for each of the first 100 entries that
--   weren't processed successfully (failed) by the import job, if any.
[$sel:failures:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The total number of pieces that must be processed to complete the
--   import job. Each piece consists of an approximately equal portion of
--   the endpoint definitions that are part of the import job.
[$sel:totalPieces:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the import job was completed.
[$sel:completionDate:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of endpoint definitions that weren't processed
--   successfully (failed) by the import job, typically because an error,
--   such as a syntax error, occurred.
[$sel:totalFailures:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The status of the import job. The job status is FAILED if Amazon
--   Pinpoint wasn't able to process one or more pieces in the job.
[$sel:jobStatus:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> JobStatus

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the import job was created.
[$sel:creationDate:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> Text

-- | The job type. This value is IMPORT for import jobs.
[$sel:type':ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> Text

-- | The resource settings that apply to the import job.
[$sel:definition:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> ImportJobResource

-- | The unique identifier for the import job.
[$sel:id:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application that's associated with the
--   import job.
[$sel:applicationId:ImportJobResponse'] :: ImportJobResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ImportJobResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:completedPieces:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_completedPieces</a> - The number of pieces that
--   were processed successfully (completed) by the import job, as of the
--   time of the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failedPieces:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_failedPieces</a> - The number of pieces that
--   weren't processed successfully (failed) by the import job, as of the
--   time of the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalProcessed:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_totalProcessed</a> - The total number of endpoint
--   definitions that were processed by the import job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failures:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_failures</a> - An array of entries, one for each
--   of the first 100 entries that weren't processed successfully (failed)
--   by the import job, if any.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalPieces:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_totalPieces</a> - The total number of pieces that
--   must be processed to complete the import job. Each piece consists of
--   an approximately equal portion of the endpoint definitions that are
--   part of the import job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionDate:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_completionDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the import job was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalFailures:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_totalFailures</a> - The total number of endpoint
--   definitions that weren't processed successfully (failed) by the import
--   job, typically because an error, such as a syntax error, occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobStatus:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_jobStatus</a> - The status of the import job. The
--   job status is FAILED if Amazon Pinpoint wasn't able to process one or
--   more pieces in the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601 format,
--   when the import job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ImportJobResponse'</a>, <a>importJobResponse_type</a> -
--   The job type. This value is IMPORT for import jobs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:definition:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_definition</a> - The resource settings that apply
--   to the import job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ImportJobResponse'</a>, <a>importJobResponse_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the import job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application that's associated with the import job.
newImportJobResponse :: JobStatus -> Text -> Text -> ImportJobResource -> Text -> Text -> ImportJobResponse

-- | The number of pieces that were processed successfully (completed) by
--   the import job, as of the time of the request.
importJobResponse_completedPieces :: Lens' ImportJobResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of pieces that weren't processed successfully (failed) by
--   the import job, as of the time of the request.
importJobResponse_failedPieces :: Lens' ImportJobResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The total number of endpoint definitions that were processed by the
--   import job.
importJobResponse_totalProcessed :: Lens' ImportJobResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | An array of entries, one for each of the first 100 entries that
--   weren't processed successfully (failed) by the import job, if any.
importJobResponse_failures :: Lens' ImportJobResponse (Maybe [Text])

-- | The total number of pieces that must be processed to complete the
--   import job. Each piece consists of an approximately equal portion of
--   the endpoint definitions that are part of the import job.
importJobResponse_totalPieces :: Lens' ImportJobResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the import job was completed.
importJobResponse_completionDate :: Lens' ImportJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of endpoint definitions that weren't processed
--   successfully (failed) by the import job, typically because an error,
--   such as a syntax error, occurred.
importJobResponse_totalFailures :: Lens' ImportJobResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The status of the import job. The job status is FAILED if Amazon
--   Pinpoint wasn't able to process one or more pieces in the job.
importJobResponse_jobStatus :: Lens' ImportJobResponse JobStatus

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the import job was created.
importJobResponse_creationDate :: Lens' ImportJobResponse Text

-- | The job type. This value is IMPORT for import jobs.
importJobResponse_type :: Lens' ImportJobResponse Text

-- | The resource settings that apply to the import job.
importJobResponse_definition :: Lens' ImportJobResponse ImportJobResource

-- | The unique identifier for the import job.
importJobResponse_id :: Lens' ImportJobResponse Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application that's associated with the
--   import job.
importJobResponse_applicationId :: Lens' ImportJobResponse Text

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of all the import
--   jobs that are associated with an application or segment. An import job
--   is a job that imports endpoint definitions from one or more files.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newImportJobsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ImportJobsResponse
ImportJobsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> [ImportJobResponse] -> ImportJobsResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
[$sel:nextToken:ImportJobsResponse'] :: ImportJobsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of responses, one for each import job that's associated with
--   the application (Import Jobs resource) or segment (Segment Import Jobs
--   resource).
[$sel:item:ImportJobsResponse'] :: ImportJobsResponse -> [ImportJobResponse]

-- | Create a value of <a>ImportJobsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ImportJobsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobsResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use in a
--   subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated
--   response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:ImportJobsResponse'</a>, <a>importJobsResponse_item</a> -
--   An array of responses, one for each import job that's associated with
--   the application (Import Jobs resource) or segment (Segment Import Jobs
--   resource).
newImportJobsResponse :: ImportJobsResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
importJobsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ImportJobsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of responses, one for each import job that's associated with
--   the application (Import Jobs resource) or segment (Segment Import Jobs
--   resource).
importJobsResponse_item :: Lens' ImportJobsResponse [ImportJobResponse]

-- | Schedule of the campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInAppCampaignSchedule</a> smart constructor.
data InAppCampaignSchedule
InAppCampaignSchedule' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe QuietTime -> Maybe CampaignEventFilter -> InAppCampaignSchedule

-- | The scheduled time after which the in-app message should not be shown.
--   Timestamp is in ISO 8601 format.
[$sel:endDate:InAppCampaignSchedule'] :: InAppCampaignSchedule -> Maybe Text

-- | Time during which the in-app message should not be shown to the user.
[$sel:quietTime:InAppCampaignSchedule'] :: InAppCampaignSchedule -> Maybe QuietTime

-- | The event filter the SDK has to use to show the in-app message in the
--   application.
[$sel:eventFilter:InAppCampaignSchedule'] :: InAppCampaignSchedule -> Maybe CampaignEventFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>InAppCampaignSchedule</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endDate:InAppCampaignSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>inAppCampaignSchedule_endDate</a> - The scheduled time after which
--   the in-app message should not be shown. Timestamp is in ISO 8601
--   format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quietTime:InAppCampaignSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>inAppCampaignSchedule_quietTime</a> - Time during which the in-app
--   message should not be shown to the user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventFilter:InAppCampaignSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>inAppCampaignSchedule_eventFilter</a> - The event filter the SDK
--   has to use to show the in-app message in the application.
newInAppCampaignSchedule :: InAppCampaignSchedule

-- | The scheduled time after which the in-app message should not be shown.
--   Timestamp is in ISO 8601 format.
inAppCampaignSchedule_endDate :: Lens' InAppCampaignSchedule (Maybe Text)

-- | Time during which the in-app message should not be shown to the user.
inAppCampaignSchedule_quietTime :: Lens' InAppCampaignSchedule (Maybe QuietTime)

-- | The event filter the SDK has to use to show the in-app message in the
--   application.
inAppCampaignSchedule_eventFilter :: Lens' InAppCampaignSchedule (Maybe CampaignEventFilter)

-- | Provides all fields required for building an in-app message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInAppMessage</a> smart constructor.
data InAppMessage
InAppMessage' :: Maybe Layout -> Maybe [InAppMessageContent] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> InAppMessage

-- | The layout of the message.
[$sel:layout:InAppMessage'] :: InAppMessage -> Maybe Layout

-- | In-app message content.
[$sel:content:InAppMessage'] :: InAppMessage -> Maybe [InAppMessageContent]

-- | Custom config to be sent to SDK.
[$sel:customConfig:InAppMessage'] :: InAppMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>InAppMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   In-app message content.

-- | Targeted in-app message campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInAppMessageCampaign</a> smart constructor.
data InAppMessageCampaign
InAppMessageCampaign' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe InAppCampaignSchedule -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InAppMessage -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> InAppMessageCampaign

-- | Session cap which controls the number of times an in-app message can
--   be shown to the endpoint during an application session.
[$sel:sessionCap:InAppMessageCampaign'] :: InAppMessageCampaign -> Maybe Int

-- | Priority of the in-app message.
[$sel:priority:InAppMessageCampaign'] :: InAppMessageCampaign -> Maybe Int

-- | Schedule of the campaign.
[$sel:schedule:InAppMessageCampaign'] :: InAppMessageCampaign -> Maybe InAppCampaignSchedule

-- | Campaign id of the corresponding campaign.
[$sel:campaignId:InAppMessageCampaign'] :: InAppMessageCampaign -> Maybe Text

-- | Treatment id of the campaign.
[$sel:treatmentId:InAppMessageCampaign'] :: InAppMessageCampaign -> Maybe Text

-- | In-app message content with all fields required for rendering an
--   in-app message.
[$sel:inAppMessage:InAppMessageCampaign'] :: InAppMessageCampaign -> Maybe InAppMessage

-- | Total cap which controls the number of times an in-app message can be
--   shown to the endpoint.
[$sel:totalCap:InAppMessageCampaign'] :: InAppMessageCampaign -> Maybe Int

-- | Daily cap which controls the number of times any in-app messages can
--   be shown to the endpoint during a day.
[$sel:dailyCap:InAppMessageCampaign'] :: InAppMessageCampaign -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>InAppMessageCampaign</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sessionCap:InAppMessageCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>inAppMessageCampaign_sessionCap</a> - Session cap which controls
--   the number of times an in-app message can be shown to the endpoint
--   during an application session.
--   
--   <a>$sel:priority:InAppMessageCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>inAppMessageCampaign_priority</a> - Priority of the in-app message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schedule:InAppMessageCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>inAppMessageCampaign_schedule</a> - Schedule of the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:campaignId:InAppMessageCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>inAppMessageCampaign_campaignId</a> - Campaign id of the
--   corresponding campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatmentId:InAppMessageCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>inAppMessageCampaign_treatmentId</a> - Treatment id of the
--   campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inAppMessage:InAppMessageCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>inAppMessageCampaign_inAppMessage</a> - In-app message content with
--   all fields required for rendering an in-app message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalCap:InAppMessageCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>inAppMessageCampaign_totalCap</a> - Total cap which controls the
--   number of times an in-app message can be shown to the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dailyCap:InAppMessageCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>inAppMessageCampaign_dailyCap</a> - Daily cap which controls the
--   number of times any in-app messages can be shown to the endpoint
--   during a day.
newInAppMessageCampaign :: InAppMessageCampaign

-- | Session cap which controls the number of times an in-app message can
--   be shown to the endpoint during an application session.

-- | InApp Template Request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInAppTemplateRequest</a> smart constructor.
data InAppTemplateRequest
InAppTemplateRequest' :: Maybe Layout -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InAppMessageContent] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> InAppTemplateRequest

-- | The layout of the message.
[$sel:layout:InAppTemplateRequest'] :: InAppTemplateRequest -> Maybe Layout

-- | The description of the template.
[$sel:templateDescription:InAppTemplateRequest'] :: InAppTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The content of the message, can include up to 5 modals. Each modal
--   must contain a message, a header, and background color. ImageUrl and
--   buttons are optional.
[$sel:content:InAppTemplateRequest'] :: InAppTemplateRequest -> Maybe [InAppMessageContent]

-- | Custom config to be sent to client.
[$sel:customConfig:InAppTemplateRequest'] :: InAppTemplateRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:InAppTemplateRequest'] :: InAppTemplateRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>InAppTemplateRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:layout:InAppTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateRequest_layout</a> - The layout of the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:InAppTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateRequest_templateDescription</a> - The description of
--   the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:InAppTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateRequest_content</a> - The content of the message, can
--   include up to 5 modals. Each modal must contain a message, a header,
--   and background color. ImageUrl and buttons are optional.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customConfig:InAppTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateRequest_customConfig</a> - Custom config to be sent to
--   client.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:InAppTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateRequest_tags</a> - A string-to-string map of key-value
--   pairs that defines the tags to associate with the message template.
--   Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.
newInAppTemplateRequest :: InAppTemplateRequest

-- | The layout of the message.
inAppTemplateRequest_layout :: Lens' InAppTemplateRequest (Maybe Layout)

-- | The description of the template.
inAppTemplateRequest_templateDescription :: Lens' InAppTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

--   must contain a message, a header, and background color. ImageUrl and
--   buttons are optional.

inAppTemplateRequest_customConfig :: Lens' InAppTemplateRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
inAppTemplateRequest_tags :: Lens' InAppTemplateRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInAppTemplateResponse</a> smart constructor.
data InAppTemplateResponse
InAppTemplateResponse' :: Maybe Layout -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InAppMessageContent] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> InAppTemplateResponse

-- | The layout of the message.
[$sel:layout:InAppTemplateResponse'] :: InAppTemplateResponse -> Maybe Layout

--   must contain a message, a header, and background color. ImageUrl and
--   buttons are optional.

--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:InAppTemplateResponse'] :: InAppTemplateResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The last modified date of the template.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:InAppTemplateResponse'] :: InAppTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The creation date of the template.
[$sel:creationDate:InAppTemplateResponse'] :: InAppTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The name of the template.
[$sel:templateName:InAppTemplateResponse'] :: InAppTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The type of the template.
[$sel:templateType:InAppTemplateResponse'] :: InAppTemplateResponse -> TemplateType

-- | Create a value of <a>InAppTemplateResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

-- | Provides information about the results of a request to create or
--   update an endpoint that's associated with an event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newItemResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ItemResponse
ItemResponse' :: Maybe EndpointItemResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text EventItemResponse) -> ItemResponse

-- | The response that was received after the endpoint data was accepted.
[$sel:endpointItemResponse:ItemResponse'] :: ItemResponse -> Maybe EndpointItemResponse

-- | A multipart response object that contains a key and a value for each
--   event in the request. In each object, the event ID is the key and an
--   EventItemResponse object is the value.
[$sel:eventsItemResponse:ItemResponse'] :: ItemResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text EventItemResponse)

-- | Create a value of <a>ItemResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointItemResponse:ItemResponse'</a>,
--   <a>itemResponse_endpointItemResponse</a> - The response that was
--   received after the endpoint data was accepted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventsItemResponse:ItemResponse'</a>,
--   <a>itemResponse_eventsItemResponse</a> - A multipart response object
--   that contains a key and a value for each event in the request. In each
--   object, the event ID is the key and an EventItemResponse object is the
--   value.
newItemResponse :: ItemResponse

-- | The response that was received after the endpoint data was accepted.
itemResponse_endpointItemResponse :: Lens' ItemResponse (Maybe EndpointItemResponse)

-- | A multipart response object that contains a key and a value for each
--   event in the request. In each object, the event ID is the key and an
--   EventItemResponse object is the value.
itemResponse_eventsItemResponse :: Lens' ItemResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text EventItemResponse))

-- | The channel-specific configurations for the journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneyChannelSettings</a> smart constructor.
data JourneyChannelSettings
JourneyChannelSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> JourneyChannelSettings

[$sel:connectCampaignArn:JourneyChannelSettings'] :: JourneyChannelSettings -> Maybe Text

--   APIs for dialing.

--   
--   <a>$sel:connectCampaignArn:JourneyChannelSettings'</a>,
--   <a>journeyChannelSettings_connectCampaignArn</a> - Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the Connect Campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectCampaignExecutionRoleArn:JourneyChannelSettings'</a>,
--   <a>journeyChannelSettings_connectCampaignExecutionRoleArn</a> - IAM
--   role ARN to be assumed when invoking Connect campaign execution APIs
--   for dialing.
newJourneyChannelSettings :: JourneyChannelSettings

-- | Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Connect Campaign.
journeyChannelSettings_connectCampaignArn :: Lens' JourneyChannelSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | IAM role ARN to be assumed when invoking Connect campaign execution
--   APIs for dialing.
journeyChannelSettings_connectCampaignExecutionRoleArn :: Lens' JourneyChannelSettings (Maybe Text)

--   results in a paginated response. This value is null for the Journey
--   Engagement Metrics resource because the resource returns all results
--   in a single page.

--   object contains the value for the metric and metadata about that
--   value.

-- | The name of the metric, also referred to as a /key performance
--   indicator (KPI)/, that the data was retrieved for. This value
--   describes the associated metric and consists of two or more terms,
--   which are comprised of lowercase alphanumeric characters, separated by
--   a hyphen. For a list of possible values, see the <a>Amazon Pinpoint
--   Developer Guide</a>.

--   query results, in extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is
--   inclusive.
[$sel:endTime:JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse'] :: JourneyDateRangeKpiResponse -> POSIX

--   query results, in extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is
--   inclusive.

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the metric applies to.

-- | Provides the results of a query that retrieved the data for a standard
--   execution metric that applies to a journey activity, and provides
--   information about that query.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse
JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse' :: HashMap Text Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse

-- | A JSON object that contains the results of the query. The results vary
--   depending on the type of activity (ActivityType). For information
--   about the structure and contents of the results, see the <a>Amazon
--   Pinpoint Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:metrics:JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse'] :: JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse -> HashMap Text Text

-- | The unique identifier for the journey that the metric applies to.
[$sel:journeyId:JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse'] :: JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse -> Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when Amazon Pinpoint last
--   evaluated the execution status of the activity and updated the data
--   for the metric.
[$sel:lastEvaluatedTime:JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse'] :: JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the activity that the metric applies to.
[$sel:journeyActivityId:JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse'] :: JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse -> Text

-- | The type of activity that the metric applies to. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>CONDITIONAL_SPLIT - For a yes/no split activity, which is an
--   activity that sends participants down one of two paths in a
--   journey.</li>
--   <li>HOLDOUT - For a holdout activity, which is an activity that stops
--   a journey for a specified percentage of participants.</li>
--   <li>MESSAGE - For an email activity, which is an activity that sends
--   an email message to participants.</li>
--   <li>MULTI_CONDITIONAL_SPLIT - For a multivariate split activity, which
--   is an activity that sends participants down one of as many as five
--   paths in a journey.</li>
--   <li>RANDOM_SPLIT - For a random split activity, which is an activity
--   that sends specified percentages of participants down one of as many
--   as five paths in a journey.</li>
--   <li>WAIT - For a wait activity, which is an activity that waits for a
--   certain amount of time or until a specific date and time before moving
--   participants to the next activity in a journey.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:activityType:JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse'] :: JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the metric applies to.
[$sel:applicationId:JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse'] :: JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse_metrics</a> - A JSON object
--   that contains the results of the query. The results vary depending on
--   the type of activity (ActivityType). For information about the
--   structure and contents of the results, see the <a>Amazon Pinpoint
--   Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:journeyId:JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse_journeyId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the journey that the metric applies to.
--

--   <a>$sel:lastEvaluatedTime:JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse_lastEvaluatedTime</a> - The
--   date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when Amazon Pinpoint last evaluated
--   the execution status of the activity and updated the data for the
--   metric.
--

-- | Specifies limits on the messages that a journey can send and the
--   number of times participants can enter a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneyLimits</a> smart constructor.
data JourneyLimits
JourneyLimits' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> JourneyLimits

-- | The maximum number of messages that the journey can send each second.
[$sel:messagesPerSecond:JourneyLimits'] :: JourneyLimits -> Maybe Int

-- | The maximum number of times that a participant can enter the journey.
--   The maximum value is 100. To allow participants to enter the journey
--   an unlimited number of times, set this value to 0.
[$sel:endpointReentryCap:JourneyLimits'] :: JourneyLimits -> Maybe Int

-- | Minimum time that must pass before an endpoint can re-enter a given
--   journey. The duration should use an ISO 8601 format, such as PT1H.
[$sel:endpointReentryInterval:JourneyLimits'] :: JourneyLimits -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of messages that the journey can send to a single
--   participant during a 24-hour period. The maximum value is 100.
[$sel:dailyCap:JourneyLimits'] :: JourneyLimits -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneyLimits</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:messagesPerSecond:JourneyLimits'</a>,
--   <a>journeyLimits_messagesPerSecond</a> - The maximum number of
--   messages that the journey can send each second.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointReentryCap:JourneyLimits'</a>,
--   <a>journeyLimits_endpointReentryCap</a> - The maximum number of times
--   that a participant can enter the journey. The maximum value is 100. To
--   allow participants to enter the journey an unlimited number of times,
--   set this value to 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointReentryInterval:JourneyLimits'</a>,
--   <a>journeyLimits_endpointReentryInterval</a> - Minimum time that must
--   pass before an endpoint can re-enter a given journey. The duration
--   should use an ISO 8601 format, such as PT1H.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dailyCap:JourneyLimits'</a>, <a>journeyLimits_dailyCap</a> -
--   The maximum number of messages that the journey can send to a single
--   participant during a 24-hour period. The maximum value is 100.
newJourneyLimits :: JourneyLimits

-- | The maximum number of messages that the journey can send each second.
journeyLimits_messagesPerSecond :: Lens' JourneyLimits (Maybe Int)

-- | The maximum number of times that a participant can enter the journey.
--   The maximum value is 100. To allow participants to enter the journey
--   an unlimited number of times, set this value to 0.
journeyLimits_endpointReentryCap :: Lens' JourneyLimits (Maybe Int)

-- | Minimum time that must pass before an endpoint can re-enter a given
--   journey. The duration should use an ISO 8601 format, such as PT1H.
journeyLimits_endpointReentryInterval :: Lens' JourneyLimits (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of messages that the journey can send to a single
--   participant during a 24-hour period. The maximum value is 100.
journeyLimits_dailyCap :: Lens' JourneyLimits (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies the message configuration for a push notification that's
--   sent to participants in a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneyPushMessage</a> smart constructor.
data JourneyPushMessage
JourneyPushMessage' :: Maybe Text -> JourneyPushMessage

-- | The number of seconds that the push notification service should keep
--   the message, if the service is unable to deliver the notification the
--   first time. This value is converted to an expiration value when it's
--   sent to a push-notification service. If this value is 0, the service
--   treats the notification as if it expires immediately and the service
--   doesn't store or try to deliver the notification again.
--   
--   This value doesn't apply to messages that are sent through the Amazon
--   Device Messaging (ADM) service.
[$sel:timeToLive:JourneyPushMessage'] :: JourneyPushMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneyPushMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeToLive:JourneyPushMessage'</a>,
--   <a>journeyPushMessage_timeToLive</a> - The number of seconds that the
--   push notification service should keep the message, if the service is
--   unable to deliver the notification the first time. This value is
--   converted to an expiration value when it's sent to a push-notification
--   service. If this value is 0, the service treats the notification as if
--   it expires immediately and the service doesn't store or try to deliver
--   the notification again.
--   
--   This value doesn't apply to messages that are sent through the Amazon
--   Device Messaging (ADM) service.
newJourneyPushMessage :: JourneyPushMessage

-- | The number of seconds that the push notification service should keep
--   the message, if the service is unable to deliver the notification the
--   first time. This value is converted to an expiration value when it's
--   sent to a push-notification service. If this value is 0, the service
--   treats the notification as if it expires immediately and the service
--   doesn't store or try to deliver the notification again.
--   
--   This value doesn't apply to messages that are sent through the Amazon
--   Device Messaging (ADM) service.
journeyPushMessage_timeToLive :: Lens' JourneyPushMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides information about the status, configuration, and other
--   settings for a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneyResponse</a> smart constructor.
data JourneyResponse
JourneyResponse' :: Maybe State -> Maybe Text -> Maybe JourneySchedule -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe (HashMap Text Activity) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe JourneyLimits -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe QuietTime -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StartCondition -> Maybe JourneyChannelSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> JourneyResponse

-- | The current status of the journey. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DRAFT - The journey is being developed and hasn't been published
--   yet.</li>
--   <li>ACTIVE - The journey has been developed and published. Depending
--   on the journey's schedule, the journey may currently be running or
--   scheduled to start running at a later time. If a journey's status is
--   ACTIVE, you can't add, change, or remove activities from it.</li>
--   <li>COMPLETED - The journey has been published and has finished
--   running. All participants have entered the journey and no participants
--   are waiting to complete the journey or any activities in the
--   journey.</li>
--   <li>CANCELLED - The journey has been stopped. If a journey's status is
--   CANCELLED, you can't add, change, or remove activities or segment
--   settings from the journey.</li>
--   <li>CLOSED - The journey has been published and has started running.
--   It may have also passed its scheduled end time, or passed its
--   scheduled start time and a refresh frequency hasn't been specified for
--   it. If a journey's status is CLOSED, you can't add participants to it,
--   and no existing participants can enter the journey for the first time.
--   However, any existing participants who are currently waiting to start
--   an activity may continue the journey.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:state:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe State

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The schedule settings for the journey.
[$sel:schedule:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe JourneySchedule

-- | Specifies whether the journey's scheduled start and end times use each
--   participant's local time. If this value is true, the schedule uses
--   each participant's local time.
[$sel:localTime:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | A map that contains a set of Activity objects, one object for each
--   activity in the journey. For each Activity object, the key is the
--   unique identifier (string) for an activity and the value is the
--   settings for the activity.
[$sel:activities:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Activity)

-- | Specifies whether a journey should be refreshed on segment update.
[$sel:refreshOnSegmentUpdate:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The messaging and entry limits for the journey.
[$sel:limits:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe JourneyLimits

-- | Specifies whether endpoints in quiet hours should enter a wait till
--   the end of their quiet hours.
[$sel:waitForQuietTime:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The quiet time settings for the journey. Quiet time is a specific time
--   range when a journey doesn't send messages to participants, if all the
--   following conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint for the
--   participant is set to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the participant's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   journey.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the participant's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   journey.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the participant will
--   receive messages from the journey, even if quiet time is enabled.
[$sel:quietTime:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe QuietTime

-- | The unique identifier for the first activity in the journey.
[$sel:startActivity:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey was created.
[$sel:creationDate:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The segment that defines which users are participants in the journey.
[$sel:startCondition:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe StartCondition

-- | The channel-specific configurations for the journey.
[$sel:journeyChannelSettings:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe JourneyChannelSettings

-- | The frequency with which Amazon Pinpoint evaluates segment and event
--   data for the journey, as a duration in ISO 8601 format.
[$sel:refreshFrequency:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | This object is not used or supported.
[$sel:tags:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The name of the journey.
[$sel:name:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the journey.
[$sel:id:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the journey applies to.
[$sel:applicationId:JourneyResponse'] :: JourneyResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneyResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:JourneyResponse'</a>, <a>journeyResponse_state</a> - The
--   current status of the journey. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DRAFT - The journey is being developed and hasn't been published
--   yet.</li>
--   <li>ACTIVE - The journey has been developed and published. Depending
--   on the journey's schedule, the journey may currently be running or
--   scheduled to start running at a later time. If a journey's status is
--   ACTIVE, you can't add, change, or remove activities from it.</li>
--   <li>COMPLETED - The journey has been published and has finished
--   running. All participants have entered the journey and no participants
--   are waiting to complete the journey or any activities in the
--   journey.</li>
--   <li>CANCELLED - The journey has been stopped. If a journey's status is
--   CANCELLED, you can't add, change, or remove activities or segment
--   settings from the journey.</li>
--   <li>CLOSED - The journey has been published and has started running.
--   It may have also passed its scheduled end time, or passed its
--   scheduled start time and a refresh frequency hasn't been specified for
--   it. If a journey's status is CLOSED, you can't add participants to it,
--   and no existing participants can enter the journey for the first time.
--   However, any existing participants who are currently waiting to start
--   an activity may continue the journey.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the journey was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schedule:JourneyResponse'</a>, <a>journeyResponse_schedule</a>
--   - The schedule settings for the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:localTime:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_localTime</a> - Specifies whether the journey's
--   scheduled start and end times use each participant's local time. If
--   this value is true, the schedule uses each participant's local time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activities:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_activities</a> - A map that contains a set of
--   Activity objects, one object for each activity in the journey. For
--   each Activity object, the key is the unique identifier (string) for an
--   activity and the value is the settings for the activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:refreshOnSegmentUpdate:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_refreshOnSegmentUpdate</a> - Specifies whether a
--   journey should be refreshed on segment update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limits:JourneyResponse'</a>, <a>journeyResponse_limits</a> -
--   The messaging and entry limits for the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:waitForQuietTime:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_waitForQuietTime</a> - Specifies whether endpoints
--   in quiet hours should enter a wait till the end of their quiet hours.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quietTime:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_quietTime</a> - The quiet time settings for the
--   journey. Quiet time is a specific time range when a journey doesn't
--   send messages to participants, if all the following conditions are
--   met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint for the
--   participant is set to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the participant's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   journey.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the participant's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   journey.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the participant will
--   receive messages from the journey, even if quiet time is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startActivity:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_startActivity</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   first activity in the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601 format,
--   when the journey was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startCondition:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_startCondition</a> - The segment that defines which
--   users are participants in the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:journeyChannelSettings:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_journeyChannelSettings</a> - The channel-specific
--   configurations for the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:refreshFrequency:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_refreshFrequency</a> - The frequency with which
--   Amazon Pinpoint evaluates segment and event data for the journey, as a
--   duration in ISO 8601 format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:JourneyResponse'</a>, <a>journeyResponse_tags</a> - This
--   object is not used or supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:JourneyResponse'</a>, <a>journeyResponse_name</a> - The
--   name of the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:JourneyResponse'</a>, <a>journeyResponse_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application that the journey applies to.
newJourneyResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> JourneyResponse

-- | The current status of the journey. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DRAFT - The journey is being developed and hasn't been published
--   yet.</li>
--   <li>ACTIVE - The journey has been developed and published. Depending
--   on the journey's schedule, the journey may currently be running or
--   scheduled to start running at a later time. If a journey's status is
--   ACTIVE, you can't add, change, or remove activities from it.</li>
--   <li>COMPLETED - The journey has been published and has finished
--   running. All participants have entered the journey and no participants
--   are waiting to complete the journey or any activities in the
--   journey.</li>
--   <li>CANCELLED - The journey has been stopped. If a journey's status is
--   CANCELLED, you can't add, change, or remove activities or segment
--   settings from the journey.</li>
--   <li>CLOSED - The journey has been published and has started running.
--   It may have also passed its scheduled end time, or passed its
--   scheduled start time and a refresh frequency hasn't been specified for
--   it. If a journey's status is CLOSED, you can't add participants to it,
--   and no existing participants can enter the journey for the first time.
--   However, any existing participants who are currently waiting to start
--   an activity may continue the journey.</li>
--   </ul>
journeyResponse_state :: Lens' JourneyResponse (Maybe State)
