-- | Specifies the sender ID and message type for an SMS message that's
--   sent to participants in a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneySMSMessage</a> smart constructor.
data JourneySMSMessage
JourneySMSMessage' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MessageType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> JourneySMSMessage

-- | The long code to send the SMS message from. This value should be one
--   of the dedicated long codes that's assigned to your AWS account.
--   Although it isn't required, we recommend that you specify the long
--   code using an E.164 format to ensure prompt and accurate delivery of
--   the message. For example, +12065550100.
[$sel:originationNumber:JourneySMSMessage'] :: JourneySMSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The template ID received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in
--   your country.
[$sel:templateId:JourneySMSMessage'] :: JourneySMSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The SMS message type. Valid values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages
--   that are critical or time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and
--   PROMOTIONAL (for messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive,
--   such as marketing messages).
[$sel:messageType:JourneySMSMessage'] :: JourneySMSMessage -> Maybe MessageType

-- | The sender ID to display as the sender of the message on a recipient's
--   device. Support for sender IDs varies by country or region. For more
--   information, see <a>Supported Countries and Regions</a> in the Amazon
--   Pinpoint User Guide.
[$sel:senderId:JourneySMSMessage'] :: JourneySMSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The entity ID or Principal Entity (PE) id received from the regulatory
--   body for sending SMS in your country.
[$sel:entityId:JourneySMSMessage'] :: JourneySMSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneySMSMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:originationNumber:JourneySMSMessage'</a>,
--   <a>journeySMSMessage_originationNumber</a> - The long code to send the
--   SMS message from. This value should be one of the dedicated long codes
--   that's assigned to your AWS account. Although it isn't required, we
--   recommend that you specify the long code using an E.164 format to
--   ensure prompt and accurate delivery of the message. For example,
--   +12065550100.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateId:JourneySMSMessage'</a>,
--   <a>journeySMSMessage_templateId</a> - The template ID received from
--   the regulatory body for sending SMS in your country.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageType:JourneySMSMessage'</a>,
--   <a>journeySMSMessage_messageType</a> - The SMS message type. Valid
--   values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages that are critical or
--   time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and PROMOTIONAL (for
--   messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive, such as marketing
--   messages).
--   
--   <a>$sel:senderId:JourneySMSMessage'</a>,
--   <a>journeySMSMessage_senderId</a> - The sender ID to display as the
--   sender of the message on a recipient's device. Support for sender IDs
--   varies by country or region. For more information, see <a>Supported
--   Countries and Regions</a> in the Amazon Pinpoint User Guide.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entityId:JourneySMSMessage'</a>,
--   <a>journeySMSMessage_entityId</a> - The entity ID or Principal Entity
--   (PE) id received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in your
--   country.
newJourneySMSMessage :: JourneySMSMessage

-- | The long code to send the SMS message from. This value should be one
--   of the dedicated long codes that's assigned to your AWS account.
--   Although it isn't required, we recommend that you specify the long
--   code using an E.164 format to ensure prompt and accurate delivery of
--   the message. For example, +12065550100.
journeySMSMessage_originationNumber :: Lens' JourneySMSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The template ID received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in
--   your country.
journeySMSMessage_templateId :: Lens' JourneySMSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The SMS message type. Valid values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages
--   that are critical or time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and
--   PROMOTIONAL (for messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive,
--   such as marketing messages).
journeySMSMessage_messageType :: Lens' JourneySMSMessage (Maybe MessageType)

-- | The sender ID to display as the sender of the message on a recipient's
--   device. Support for sender IDs varies by country or region. For more
--   information, see <a>Supported Countries and Regions</a> in the Amazon
--   Pinpoint User Guide.
journeySMSMessage_senderId :: Lens' JourneySMSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The entity ID or Principal Entity (PE) id received from the regulatory
--   body for sending SMS in your country.
journeySMSMessage_entityId :: Lens' JourneySMSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the schedule settings for a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneySchedule</a> smart constructor.
data JourneySchedule
JourneySchedule' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> JourneySchedule

-- | The scheduled time, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey began or will
--   begin.
[$sel:startTime:JourneySchedule'] :: JourneySchedule -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The scheduled time, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey ended or will
--   end.
[$sel:endTime:JourneySchedule'] :: JourneySchedule -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The starting UTC offset for the journey schedule, if the value of the
--   journey's LocalTime property is true. Valid values are: UTC, UTC+01,
--   UTC+02, UTC+03, UTC+03:30, UTC+04, UTC+04:30, UTC+05, UTC+05:30,
--   UTC+05:45, UTC+06, UTC+06:30, UTC+07, UTC+08, UTC+08:45, UTC+09,
--   UTC+09:30, UTC+10, UTC+10:30, UTC+11, UTC+12, UTC+12:45, UTC+13,
--   UTC+13:45, UTC-02, UTC-02:30, UTC-03, UTC-03:30, UTC-04, UTC-05,
--   UTC-06, UTC-07, UTC-08, UTC-09, UTC-09:30, UTC-10, and UTC-11.
[$sel:timezone:JourneySchedule'] :: JourneySchedule -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneySchedule</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:JourneySchedule'</a>,
--   <a>journeySchedule_startTime</a> - The scheduled time, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the journey began or will begin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:JourneySchedule'</a>, <a>journeySchedule_endTime</a> -
--   The scheduled time, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey ended or will
--   end.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timezone:JourneySchedule'</a>, <a>journeySchedule_timezone</a>
--   - The starting UTC offset for the journey schedule, if the value of
--   the journey's LocalTime property is true. Valid values are: UTC,
--   UTC+01, UTC+02, UTC+03, UTC+03:30, UTC+04, UTC+04:30, UTC+05,
--   UTC+05:30, UTC+05:45, UTC+06, UTC+06:30, UTC+07, UTC+08, UTC+08:45,
--   UTC+09, UTC+09:30, UTC+10, UTC+10:30, UTC+11, UTC+12, UTC+12:45,
--   UTC+13, UTC+13:45, UTC-02, UTC-02:30, UTC-03, UTC-03:30, UTC-04,
--   UTC-05, UTC-06, UTC-07, UTC-08, UTC-09, UTC-09:30, UTC-10, and UTC-11.
newJourneySchedule :: JourneySchedule

-- | The scheduled time, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey began or will
--   begin.
journeySchedule_startTime :: Lens' JourneySchedule (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The scheduled time, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey ended or will
--   end.
journeySchedule_endTime :: Lens' JourneySchedule (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The starting UTC offset for the journey schedule, if the value of the
--   journey's LocalTime property is true. Valid values are: UTC, UTC+01,
--   UTC+02, UTC+03, UTC+03:30, UTC+04, UTC+04:30, UTC+05, UTC+05:30,
--   UTC+05:45, UTC+06, UTC+06:30, UTC+07, UTC+08, UTC+08:45, UTC+09,
--   UTC+09:30, UTC+10, UTC+10:30, UTC+11, UTC+12, UTC+12:45, UTC+13,
--   UTC+13:45, UTC-02, UTC-02:30, UTC-03, UTC-03:30, UTC-04, UTC-05,
--   UTC-06, UTC-07, UTC-08, UTC-09, UTC-09:30, UTC-10, and UTC-11.
journeySchedule_timezone :: Lens' JourneySchedule (Maybe Text)

-- | Changes the status of a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneyStateRequest</a> smart constructor.
data JourneyStateRequest
JourneyStateRequest' :: Maybe State -> JourneyStateRequest

-- | The status of the journey. Currently, Supported values are ACTIVE,
--   PAUSED, and CANCELLED
--   
--   If you cancel a journey, Amazon Pinpoint continues to perform
--   activities that are currently in progress, until those activities are
--   complete. Amazon Pinpoint also continues to collect and aggregate
--   analytics data for those activities, until they are complete, and any
--   activities that were complete when you cancelled the journey.
--   
--   After you cancel a journey, you can't add, change, or remove any
--   activities from the journey. In addition, Amazon Pinpoint stops
--   evaluating the journey and doesn't perform any activities that haven't
--   started.
--   
--   When the journey is paused, Amazon Pinpoint continues to perform
--   activities that are currently in progress, until those activities are
--   complete. Endpoints will stop entering journeys when the journey is
--   paused and will resume entering the journey after the journey is
--   resumed. For wait activities, wait time is paused when the journey is
--   paused. Currently, PAUSED only supports journeys with a segment
--   refresh interval.
[$sel:state:JourneyStateRequest'] :: JourneyStateRequest -> Maybe State

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneyStateRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:JourneyStateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>journeyStateRequest_state</a> - The status of the journey.
--   Currently, Supported values are ACTIVE, PAUSED, and CANCELLED
--   
--   If you cancel a journey, Amazon Pinpoint continues to perform
--   activities that are currently in progress, until those activities are
--   complete. Amazon Pinpoint also continues to collect and aggregate
--   analytics data for those activities, until they are complete, and any
--   activities that were complete when you cancelled the journey.
--   
--   After you cancel a journey, you can't add, change, or remove any
--   activities from the journey. In addition, Amazon Pinpoint stops
--   evaluating the journey and doesn't perform any activities that haven't
--   started.
--   
--   When the journey is paused, Amazon Pinpoint continues to perform
--   activities that are currently in progress, until those activities are
--   complete. Endpoints will stop entering journeys when the journey is
--   paused and will resume entering the journey after the journey is
--   resumed. For wait activities, wait time is paused when the journey is
--   paused. Currently, PAUSED only supports journeys with a segment
--   refresh interval.
newJourneyStateRequest :: JourneyStateRequest

-- | The status of the journey. Currently, Supported values are ACTIVE,
--   PAUSED, and CANCELLED
--   
--   If you cancel a journey, Amazon Pinpoint continues to perform
--   activities that are currently in progress, until those activities are
--   complete. Amazon Pinpoint also continues to collect and aggregate
--   analytics data for those activities, until they are complete, and any
--   activities that were complete when you cancelled the journey.
--   
--   After you cancel a journey, you can't add, change, or remove any
--   activities from the journey. In addition, Amazon Pinpoint stops
--   evaluating the journey and doesn't perform any activities that haven't
--   started.
--   
--   When the journey is paused, Amazon Pinpoint continues to perform
--   activities that are currently in progress, until those activities are
--   complete. Endpoints will stop entering journeys when the journey is
--   paused and will resume entering the journey after the journey is
--   resumed. For wait activities, wait time is paused when the journey is
--   paused. Currently, PAUSED only supports journeys with a segment
--   refresh interval.
journeyStateRequest_state :: Lens' JourneyStateRequest (Maybe State)

-- | Provides information about the status, configuration, and other
--   settings for all the journeys that are associated with an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneysResponse</a> smart constructor.
data JourneysResponse
JourneysResponse' :: Maybe Text -> [JourneyResponse] -> JourneysResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
[$sel:nextToken:JourneysResponse'] :: JourneysResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of responses, one for each journey that's associated with the
--   application.
[$sel:item:JourneysResponse'] :: JourneysResponse -> [JourneyResponse]

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneysResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:JourneysResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeysResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use in a subsequent
--   request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This
--   value is null if there are no additional pages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:JourneysResponse'</a>, <a>journeysResponse_item</a> - An
--   array of responses, one for each journey that's associated with the
--   application.
newJourneysResponse :: JourneysResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
journeysResponse_nextToken :: Lens' JourneysResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of responses, one for each journey that's associated with the
--   application.
journeysResponse_item :: Lens' JourneysResponse [JourneyResponse]

-- | Provides information about all the recommender model configurations
--   that are associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse
ListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> [RecommenderConfigurationResponse] -> ListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
[$sel:nextToken:ListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse'] :: ListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of responses, one for each recommender model configuration
--   that's associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account.
[$sel:item:ListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse'] :: ListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse -> [RecommenderConfigurationResponse]

-- | Create a value of <a>ListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listRecommenderConfigurationsResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to
--   use in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a
--   paginated response. This value is null if there are no additional
--   pages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:ListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listRecommenderConfigurationsResponse_item</a> - An array of
--   responses, one for each recommender model configuration that's
--   associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account.
newListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse :: ListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
listRecommenderConfigurationsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of responses, one for each recommender model configuration
--   that's associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account.
listRecommenderConfigurationsResponse_item :: Lens' ListRecommenderConfigurationsResponse [RecommenderConfigurationResponse]

-- | Specifies the content and settings for a push notification that's sent
--   to recipients of a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessage</a> smart constructor.
data Message
Message' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Message

-- | Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification,
--   which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's
--   device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as
--   updating an app's configuration, displaying messages in an in-app
--   message center, or supporting phone home functionality.
[$sel:silentPush:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Bool

-- | The URL of the image to display as the push-notification icon, such as
--   the icon for the app.
[$sel:imageIconUrl:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Text

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the
--   notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other
--   content for the message.
[$sel:rawContent:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Text

-- | The body of the notification message. The maximum number of characters
--   is 200.
[$sel:body:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of seconds that the push-notification service should keep
--   the message, if the service is unable to deliver the notification the
--   first time. This value is converted to an expiration value when it's
--   sent to a push-notification service. If this value is 0, the service
--   treats the notification as if it expires immediately and the service
--   doesn't store or try to deliver the notification again.
--   
--   This value doesn't apply to messages that are sent through the Amazon
--   Device Messaging (ADM) service.
[$sel:timeToLive:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Int

-- | The URL of the image to display as the small, push-notification icon,
--   such as a small version of the icon for the app.
[$sel:imageSmallIconUrl:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Text

-- | The JSON payload to use for a silent push notification.
[$sel:jsonBody:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action
--   property is URL.
[$sel:url:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Text

-- | The action to occur if a recipient taps the push notification. Valid
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   iOS and Android.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:action:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Action

-- | The URL of an image to display in the push notification.
[$sel:imageUrl:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL of the image or video to display in the push notification.
[$sel:mediaUrl:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Text

-- | The title to display above the notification message on a recipient's
--   device.
[$sel:title:Message'] :: Message -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Message</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:silentPush:Message'</a>, <a>message_silentPush</a> - Specifies
--   whether the notification is a silent push notification, which is a
--   push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's device. Silent
--   push notifications can be used for cases such as updating an app's
--   configuration, displaying messages in an in-app message center, or
--   supporting phone home functionality.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageIconUrl:Message'</a>, <a>message_imageIconUrl</a> - The
--   URL of the image to display as the push-notification icon, such as the
--   icon for the app.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawContent:Message'</a>, <a>message_rawContent</a> - The raw,
--   JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the notification
--   message. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the
--   message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:Message'</a>, <a>message_body</a> - The body of the
--   notification message. The maximum number of characters is 200.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeToLive:Message'</a>, <a>message_timeToLive</a> - The
--   number of seconds that the push-notification service should keep the
--   message, if the service is unable to deliver the notification the
--   first time. This value is converted to an expiration value when it's
--   sent to a push-notification service. If this value is 0, the service
--   treats the notification as if it expires immediately and the service
--   doesn't store or try to deliver the notification again.
--   
--   This value doesn't apply to messages that are sent through the Amazon
--   Device Messaging (ADM) service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageSmallIconUrl:Message'</a>,
--   <a>message_imageSmallIconUrl</a> - The URL of the image to display as
--   the small, push-notification icon, such as a small version of the icon
--   for the app.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jsonBody:Message'</a>, <a>message_jsonBody</a> - The JSON
--   payload to use for a silent push notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:Message'</a>, <a>message_url</a> - The URL to open in a
--   recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push
--   notification and the value of the Action property is URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:Message'</a>, <a>message_action</a> - The action to
--   occur if a recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   iOS and Android.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageUrl:Message'</a>, <a>message_imageUrl</a> - The URL of an
--   image to display in the push notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaUrl:Message'</a>, <a>message_mediaUrl</a> - The URL of
--   the image or video to display in the push notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:Message'</a>, <a>message_title</a> - The title to
--   display above the notification message on a recipient's device.
newMessage :: Message

-- | Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification,
--   which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's
--   device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as
--   updating an app's configuration, displaying messages in an in-app
--   message center, or supporting phone home functionality.
message_silentPush :: Lens' Message (Maybe Bool)

-- | The URL of the image to display as the push-notification icon, such as
--   the icon for the app.
message_imageIconUrl :: Lens' Message (Maybe Text)

-- | The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the
--   notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other
--   content for the message.
message_rawContent :: Lens' Message (Maybe Text)

-- | The body of the notification message. The maximum number of characters
--   is 200.
message_body :: Lens' Message (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of seconds that the push-notification service should keep
--   the message, if the service is unable to deliver the notification the
--   first time. This value is converted to an expiration value when it's
--   sent to a push-notification service. If this value is 0, the service
--   treats the notification as if it expires immediately and the service
--   doesn't store or try to deliver the notification again.
--   
--   This value doesn't apply to messages that are sent through the Amazon
--   Device Messaging (ADM) service.
message_timeToLive :: Lens' Message (Maybe Int)

-- | The URL of the image to display as the small, push-notification icon,
--   such as a small version of the icon for the app.
message_imageSmallIconUrl :: Lens' Message (Maybe Text)

-- | The JSON payload to use for a silent push notification.
message_jsonBody :: Lens' Message (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a
--   recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action
--   property is URL.
message_url :: Lens' Message (Maybe Text)

-- | The action to occur if a recipient taps the push notification. Valid
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   iOS and Android.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
message_action :: Lens' Message (Maybe Action)

-- | The URL of an image to display in the push notification.
message_imageUrl :: Lens' Message (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL of the image or video to display in the push notification.
message_mediaUrl :: Lens' Message (Maybe Text)

-- | The title to display above the notification message on a recipient's
--   device.
message_title :: Lens' Message (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides information about an API request or response.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessageBody</a> smart constructor.
data MessageBody
MessageBody' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> MessageBody

-- | The unique identifier for the request or response.
[$sel:requestID:MessageBody'] :: MessageBody -> Maybe Text

-- | The message that's returned from the API.
[$sel:message:MessageBody'] :: MessageBody -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MessageBody</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestID:MessageBody'</a>, <a>messageBody_requestID</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the request or response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:MessageBody'</a>, <a>messageBody_message</a> - The
--   message that's returned from the API.
newMessageBody :: MessageBody

-- | The unique identifier for the request or response.
messageBody_requestID :: Lens' MessageBody (Maybe Text)

-- | The message that's returned from the API.
messageBody_message :: Lens' MessageBody (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the message configuration settings for a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessageConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data MessageConfiguration
MessageConfiguration' :: Maybe Message -> Maybe Message -> Maybe Message -> Maybe CampaignCustomMessage -> Maybe Message -> Maybe CampaignSmsMessage -> Maybe CampaignEmailMessage -> Maybe CampaignInAppMessage -> Maybe Message -> MessageConfiguration

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the APNs (Apple Push
--   Notification service) channel. If specified, this message overrides
--   the default message.
[$sel:aPNSMessage:MessageConfiguration'] :: MessageConfiguration -> Maybe Message

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the GCM channel, which
--   enables Amazon Pinpoint to send push notifications through the
--   Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM),
--   service. If specified, this message overrides the default message.
[$sel:gCMMessage:MessageConfiguration'] :: MessageConfiguration -> Maybe Message

-- | The default message that the campaign sends through all the channels
--   that are configured for the campaign.
[$sel:defaultMessage:MessageConfiguration'] :: MessageConfiguration -> Maybe Message

-- | The message that the campaign sends through a custom channel, as
--   specified by the delivery configuration (CustomDeliveryConfiguration)
--   settings for the campaign. If specified, this message overrides the
--   default message.
[$sel:customMessage:MessageConfiguration'] :: MessageConfiguration -> Maybe CampaignCustomMessage

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the ADM (Amazon Device
--   Messaging) channel. If specified, this message overrides the default
--   message.
[$sel:aDMMessage:MessageConfiguration'] :: MessageConfiguration -> Maybe Message

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the SMS channel. If
--   specified, this message overrides the default message.
[$sel:sMSMessage:MessageConfiguration'] :: MessageConfiguration -> Maybe CampaignSmsMessage

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the email channel. If
--   specified, this message overrides the default message.
[$sel:emailMessage:MessageConfiguration'] :: MessageConfiguration -> Maybe CampaignEmailMessage

-- | The in-app message configuration.
[$sel:inAppMessage:MessageConfiguration'] :: MessageConfiguration -> Maybe CampaignInAppMessage

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the Baidu (Baidu Cloud
--   Push) channel. If specified, this message overrides the default
--   message.
[$sel:baiduMessage:MessageConfiguration'] :: MessageConfiguration -> Maybe Message

-- | Create a value of <a>MessageConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:aPNSMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_aPNSMessage</a> - The message that the
--   campaign sends through the APNs (Apple Push Notification service)
--   channel. If specified, this message overrides the default message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gCMMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_gCMMessage</a> - The message that the campaign
--   sends through the GCM channel, which enables Amazon Pinpoint to send
--   push notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM),
--   formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service. If specified, this
--   message overrides the default message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_defaultMessage</a> - The default message that
--   the campaign sends through all the channels that are configured for
--   the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_customMessage</a> - The message that the
--   campaign sends through a custom channel, as specified by the delivery
--   configuration (CustomDeliveryConfiguration) settings for the campaign.
--   If specified, this message overrides the default message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:aDMMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_aDMMessage</a> - The message that the campaign
--   sends through the ADM (Amazon Device Messaging) channel. If specified,
--   this message overrides the default message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sMSMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_sMSMessage</a> - The message that the campaign
--   sends through the SMS channel. If specified, this message overrides
--   the default message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_emailMessage</a> - The message that the
--   campaign sends through the email channel. If specified, this message
--   overrides the default message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inAppMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_inAppMessage</a> - The in-app message
--   configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:baiduMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_baiduMessage</a> - The message that the
--   campaign sends through the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push) channel. If
--   specified, this message overrides the default message.
newMessageConfiguration :: MessageConfiguration

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the APNs (Apple Push
--   Notification service) channel. If specified, this message overrides
--   the default message.
messageConfiguration_aPNSMessage :: Lens' MessageConfiguration (Maybe Message)

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the GCM channel, which
--   enables Amazon Pinpoint to send push notifications through the
--   Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM),
--   service. If specified, this message overrides the default message.
messageConfiguration_gCMMessage :: Lens' MessageConfiguration (Maybe Message)

-- | The default message that the campaign sends through all the channels
--   that are configured for the campaign.
messageConfiguration_defaultMessage :: Lens' MessageConfiguration (Maybe Message)

-- | The message that the campaign sends through a custom channel, as
--   specified by the delivery configuration (CustomDeliveryConfiguration)
--   settings for the campaign. If specified, this message overrides the
--   default message.
messageConfiguration_customMessage :: Lens' MessageConfiguration (Maybe CampaignCustomMessage)

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the ADM (Amazon Device
--   Messaging) channel. If specified, this message overrides the default
--   message.
messageConfiguration_aDMMessage :: Lens' MessageConfiguration (Maybe Message)

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the SMS channel. If
--   specified, this message overrides the default message.
messageConfiguration_sMSMessage :: Lens' MessageConfiguration (Maybe CampaignSmsMessage)

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the email channel. If
--   specified, this message overrides the default message.
messageConfiguration_emailMessage :: Lens' MessageConfiguration (Maybe CampaignEmailMessage)

-- | The in-app message configuration.
messageConfiguration_inAppMessage :: Lens' MessageConfiguration (Maybe CampaignInAppMessage)

-- | The message that the campaign sends through the Baidu (Baidu Cloud
--   Push) channel. If specified, this message overrides the default
--   message.
messageConfiguration_baiduMessage :: Lens' MessageConfiguration (Maybe Message)

-- | Specifies the configuration and other settings for a message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessageRequest</a> smart constructor.
data MessageRequest
MessageRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text AddressConfiguration) -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration -> Maybe (HashMap Text EndpointSendConfiguration) -> DirectMessageConfiguration -> MessageRequest

-- | The unique identifier for tracing the message. This identifier is
--   visible to message recipients.
[$sel:traceId:MessageRequest'] :: MessageRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A map of custom attributes to attach to the message. For a push
--   notification, this payload is added to the data.pinpoint object. For
--   an email or text message, this payload is added to email/SMS delivery
--   receipt event attributes.
[$sel:context:MessageRequest'] :: MessageRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | A map of key-value pairs, where each key is an address and each value
--   is an <a>AddressConfiguration</a> object. An address can be a push
--   notification token, a phone number, or an email address. You can use
--   an <a>AddressConfiguration</a> object to tailor the message for an
--   address by specifying settings such as content overrides and message
--   variables.
[$sel:addresses:MessageRequest'] :: MessageRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text AddressConfiguration)

-- | The message template to use for the message.
[$sel:templateConfiguration:MessageRequest'] :: MessageRequest -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration

-- | A map of key-value pairs, where each key is an endpoint ID and each
--   value is an <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> object. You can use an
--   <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> object to tailor the message for an
--   endpoint by specifying settings such as content overrides and message
--   variables.
[$sel:endpoints:MessageRequest'] :: MessageRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text EndpointSendConfiguration)

-- | The settings and content for the default message and any default
--   messages that you defined for specific channels.
[$sel:messageConfiguration:MessageRequest'] :: MessageRequest -> DirectMessageConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>MessageRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:traceId:MessageRequest'</a>, <a>messageRequest_traceId</a> -
--   The unique identifier for tracing the message. This identifier is
--   visible to message recipients.
--   
--   <a>$sel:context:MessageRequest'</a>, <a>messageRequest_context</a> - A
--   map of custom attributes to attach to the message. For a push
--   notification, this payload is added to the data.pinpoint object. For
--   an email or text message, this payload is added to email/SMS delivery
--   receipt event attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:addresses:MessageRequest'</a>, <a>messageRequest_addresses</a>
--   - A map of key-value pairs, where each key is an address and each
--   value is an <a>AddressConfiguration</a> object. An address can be a
--   push notification token, a phone number, or an email address. You can
--   use an <a>AddressConfiguration</a> object to tailor the message for an
--   address by specifying settings such as content overrides and message
--   variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateConfiguration:MessageRequest'</a>,
--   <a>messageRequest_templateConfiguration</a> - The message template to
--   use for the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpoints:MessageRequest'</a>, <a>messageRequest_endpoints</a>
--   - A map of key-value pairs, where each key is an endpoint ID and each
--   value is an <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> object. You can use an
--   <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> object to tailor the message for an
--   endpoint by specifying settings such as content overrides and message
--   variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfiguration:MessageRequest'</a>,
--   <a>messageRequest_messageConfiguration</a> - The settings and content
--   for the default message and any default messages that you defined for
--   specific channels.
newMessageRequest :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> MessageRequest

-- | The unique identifier for tracing the message. This identifier is
--   visible to message recipients.
messageRequest_traceId :: Lens' MessageRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A map of custom attributes to attach to the message. For a push
--   notification, this payload is added to the data.pinpoint object. For
--   an email or text message, this payload is added to email/SMS delivery
--   receipt event attributes.
messageRequest_context :: Lens' MessageRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | A map of key-value pairs, where each key is an address and each value
--   is an <a>AddressConfiguration</a> object. An address can be a push
--   notification token, a phone number, or an email address. You can use
--   an <a>AddressConfiguration</a> object to tailor the message for an
--   address by specifying settings such as content overrides and message
--   variables.
messageRequest_addresses :: Lens' MessageRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text AddressConfiguration))

-- | The message template to use for the message.
messageRequest_templateConfiguration :: Lens' MessageRequest (Maybe TemplateConfiguration)

-- | A map of key-value pairs, where each key is an endpoint ID and each
--   value is an <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> object. You can use an
--   <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> object to tailor the message for an
--   endpoint by specifying settings such as content overrides and message
--   variables.
messageRequest_endpoints :: Lens' MessageRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text EndpointSendConfiguration))

-- | The settings and content for the default message and any default
--   messages that you defined for specific channels.
messageRequest_messageConfiguration :: Lens' MessageRequest DirectMessageConfiguration

-- | Provides information about the results of a request to send a message
--   to an endpoint address.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessageResponse</a> smart constructor.
data MessageResponse
MessageResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text MessageResult) -> Maybe (HashMap Text EndpointMessageResult) -> Text -> MessageResponse

-- | The identifier for the original request that the message was delivered
--   for.
[$sel:requestId:MessageResponse'] :: MessageResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A map that contains a multipart response for each address (email
--   address, phone number, or push notification token) that the message
--   was sent to. In the map, the address is the key and the result is the
--   value.
[$sel:result:MessageResponse'] :: MessageResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text MessageResult)

-- | A map that contains a multipart response for each address that the
--   message was sent to. In the map, the endpoint ID is the key and the
--   result is the value.
[$sel:endpointResult:MessageResponse'] :: MessageResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text EndpointMessageResult)

-- | The unique identifier for the application that was used to send the
--   message.
[$sel:applicationId:MessageResponse'] :: MessageResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MessageResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestId:MessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>messageResponse_requestId</a> - The identifier for the original
--   request that the message was delivered for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:result:MessageResponse'</a>, <a>messageResponse_result</a> - A
--   map that contains a multipart response for each address (email
--   address, phone number, or push notification token) that the message
--   was sent to. In the map, the address is the key and the result is the
--   value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointResult:MessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>messageResponse_endpointResult</a> - A map that contains a
--   multipart response for each address that the message was sent to. In
--   the map, the endpoint ID is the key and the result is the value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:MessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>messageResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application that was used to send the message.
newMessageResponse :: Text -> MessageResponse

-- | The identifier for the original request that the message was delivered
--   for.
messageResponse_requestId :: Lens' MessageResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A map that contains a multipart response for each address (email
--   address, phone number, or push notification token) that the message
--   was sent to. In the map, the address is the key and the result is the
--   value.
messageResponse_result :: Lens' MessageResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text MessageResult))

-- | A map that contains a multipart response for each address that the
--   message was sent to. In the map, the endpoint ID is the key and the
--   result is the value.
messageResponse_endpointResult :: Lens' MessageResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text EndpointMessageResult))

-- | The unique identifier for the application that was used to send the
--   message.
messageResponse_applicationId :: Lens' MessageResponse Text

-- | Provides information about the results of sending a message directly
--   to an endpoint address.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessageResult</a> smart constructor.
data MessageResult
MessageResult' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DeliveryStatus -> Int -> MessageResult

-- | The status message for delivering the message.
[$sel:statusMessage:MessageResult'] :: MessageResult -> Maybe Text

-- | For push notifications that are sent through the GCM channel,
--   specifies whether the endpoint's device registration token was updated
--   as part of delivering the message.
[$sel:updatedToken:MessageResult'] :: MessageResult -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the message that was sent.
[$sel:messageId:MessageResult'] :: MessageResult -> Maybe Text

-- | The delivery status of the message. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DUPLICATE - The endpoint address is a duplicate of another
--   endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message
--   again.</li>
--   <li>OPT_OUT - The user who's associated with the endpoint address has
--   opted out of receiving messages from you. Amazon Pinpoint won't
--   attempt to send the message again.</li>
--   <li>PERMANENT_FAILURE - An error occurred when delivering the message
--   to the endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the
--   message again.</li>
--   <li>SUCCESSFUL - The message was successfully delivered to the
--   endpoint address.</li>
--   <li>TEMPORARY_FAILURE - A temporary error occurred. Amazon Pinpoint
--   won't attempt to send the message again.</li>
--   <li>THROTTLED - Amazon Pinpoint throttled the operation to send the
--   message to the endpoint address.</li>
--   <li>TIMEOUT - The message couldn't be sent within the timeout
--   period.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN_FAILURE - An unknown error occurred.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:deliveryStatus:MessageResult'] :: MessageResult -> DeliveryStatus

-- | The downstream service status code for delivering the message.
[$sel:statusCode:MessageResult'] :: MessageResult -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>MessageResult</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusMessage:MessageResult'</a>,
--   <a>messageResult_statusMessage</a> - The status message for delivering
--   the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:updatedToken:MessageResult'</a>,
--   <a>messageResult_updatedToken</a> - For push notifications that are
--   sent through the GCM channel, specifies whether the endpoint's device
--   registration token was updated as part of delivering the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageId:MessageResult'</a>, <a>messageResult_messageId</a> -
--   The unique identifier for the message that was sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStatus:MessageResult'</a>,
--   <a>messageResult_deliveryStatus</a> - The delivery status of the
--   message. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DUPLICATE - The endpoint address is a duplicate of another
--   endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message
--   again.</li>
--   <li>OPT_OUT - The user who's associated with the endpoint address has
--   opted out of receiving messages from you. Amazon Pinpoint won't
--   attempt to send the message again.</li>
--   <li>PERMANENT_FAILURE - An error occurred when delivering the message
--   to the endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the
--   message again.</li>
--   <li>SUCCESSFUL - The message was successfully delivered to the
--   endpoint address.</li>
--   <li>TEMPORARY_FAILURE - A temporary error occurred. Amazon Pinpoint
--   won't attempt to send the message again.</li>
--   <li>THROTTLED - Amazon Pinpoint throttled the operation to send the
--   message to the endpoint address.</li>
--   <li>TIMEOUT - The message couldn't be sent within the timeout
--   period.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN_FAILURE - An unknown error occurred.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusCode:MessageResult'</a>, <a>messageResult_statusCode</a>
--   - The downstream service status code for delivering the message.
newMessageResult :: DeliveryStatus -> Int -> MessageResult

-- | The status message for delivering the message.
messageResult_statusMessage :: Lens' MessageResult (Maybe Text)

-- | For push notifications that are sent through the GCM channel,
--   specifies whether the endpoint's device registration token was updated
--   as part of delivering the message.
messageResult_updatedToken :: Lens' MessageResult (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the message that was sent.
messageResult_messageId :: Lens' MessageResult (Maybe Text)

-- | The delivery status of the message. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DUPLICATE - The endpoint address is a duplicate of another
--   endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message
--   again.</li>
--   <li>OPT_OUT - The user who's associated with the endpoint address has
--   opted out of receiving messages from you. Amazon Pinpoint won't
--   attempt to send the message again.</li>
--   <li>PERMANENT_FAILURE - An error occurred when delivering the message
--   to the endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the
--   message again.</li>
--   <li>SUCCESSFUL - The message was successfully delivered to the
--   endpoint address.</li>
--   <li>TEMPORARY_FAILURE - A temporary error occurred. Amazon Pinpoint
--   won't attempt to send the message again.</li>
--   <li>THROTTLED - Amazon Pinpoint throttled the operation to send the
--   message to the endpoint address.</li>
--   <li>TIMEOUT - The message couldn't be sent within the timeout
--   period.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN_FAILURE - An unknown error occurred.</li>
--   </ul>
messageResult_deliveryStatus :: Lens' MessageResult DeliveryStatus

-- | The downstream service status code for delivering the message.
messageResult_statusCode :: Lens' MessageResult Int

-- | Specifies metric-based criteria for including or excluding endpoints
--   from a segment. These criteria derive from custom metrics that you
--   define for endpoints.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricDimension</a> smart constructor.
data MetricDimension
MetricDimension' :: Text -> Double -> MetricDimension

-- | The operator to use when comparing metric values. Valid values are:
--   GREATER_THAN, LESS_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL,
--   and EQUAL.
[$sel:comparisonOperator:MetricDimension'] :: MetricDimension -> Text

-- | The value to compare.
[$sel:value:MetricDimension'] :: MetricDimension -> Double

-- | Create a value of <a>MetricDimension</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparisonOperator:MetricDimension'</a>,
--   <a>metricDimension_comparisonOperator</a> - The operator to use when
--   comparing metric values. Valid values are: GREATER_THAN, LESS_THAN,
--   GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL, and EQUAL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:MetricDimension'</a>, <a>metricDimension_value</a> - The
--   value to compare.
newMetricDimension :: Text -> Double -> MetricDimension

-- | The operator to use when comparing metric values. Valid values are:
--   GREATER_THAN, LESS_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL,
--   and EQUAL.
metricDimension_comparisonOperator :: Lens' MetricDimension Text

-- | The value to compare.
metricDimension_value :: Lens' MetricDimension Double

-- | Specifies a condition to evaluate for an activity path in a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMultiConditionalBranch</a> smart constructor.
data MultiConditionalBranch
MultiConditionalBranch' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe SimpleCondition -> MultiConditionalBranch

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after
--   completing the activity for the path.
[$sel:nextActivity:MultiConditionalBranch'] :: MultiConditionalBranch -> Maybe Text

-- | The condition to evaluate for the activity path.
[$sel:condition:MultiConditionalBranch'] :: MultiConditionalBranch -> Maybe SimpleCondition

-- | Create a value of <a>MultiConditionalBranch</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextActivity:MultiConditionalBranch'</a>,
--   <a>multiConditionalBranch_nextActivity</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the next activity to perform, after completing the activity for the
--   path.
--   
--   <a>$sel:condition:MultiConditionalBranch'</a>,
--   <a>multiConditionalBranch_condition</a> - The condition to evaluate
--   for the activity path.
newMultiConditionalBranch :: MultiConditionalBranch

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after
--   completing the activity for the path.
multiConditionalBranch_nextActivity :: Lens' MultiConditionalBranch (Maybe Text)

-- | The condition to evaluate for the activity path.
multiConditionalBranch_condition :: Lens' MultiConditionalBranch (Maybe SimpleCondition)

-- | Specifies the settings for a multivariate split activity in a journey.
--   This type of activity sends participants down one of as many as five
--   paths (including a default <i>Else</i> path) in a journey, based on
--   conditions that you specify.
--   
--   To create multivariate split activities that send participants down
--   different paths based on push notification events (such as Open or
--   Received events), your mobile app has to specify the User ID and
--   Endpoint ID values. For more information, see <a>Integrating Amazon
--   Pinpoint with your application</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint Developer
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMultiConditionalSplitActivity</a> smart constructor.
data MultiConditionalSplitActivity
MultiConditionalSplitActivity' :: Maybe [MultiConditionalBranch] -> Maybe WaitTime -> Maybe Text -> MultiConditionalSplitActivity

-- | The paths for the activity, including the conditions for entering each
--   path and the activity to perform for each path.
[$sel:branches:MultiConditionalSplitActivity'] :: MultiConditionalSplitActivity -> Maybe [MultiConditionalBranch]

-- | The amount of time to wait or the date and time when Amazon Pinpoint
--   determines whether the conditions are met.
[$sel:evaluationWaitTime:MultiConditionalSplitActivity'] :: MultiConditionalSplitActivity -> Maybe WaitTime

-- | The unique identifier for the activity to perform for participants who
--   don't meet any of the conditions specified for other paths in the
--   activity.
[$sel:defaultActivity:MultiConditionalSplitActivity'] :: MultiConditionalSplitActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MultiConditionalSplitActivity</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:branches:MultiConditionalSplitActivity'</a>,
--   <a>multiConditionalSplitActivity_branches</a> - The paths for the
--   activity, including the conditions for entering each path and the
--   activity to perform for each path.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evaluationWaitTime:MultiConditionalSplitActivity'</a>,
--   <a>multiConditionalSplitActivity_evaluationWaitTime</a> - The amount
--   of time to wait or the date and time when Amazon Pinpoint determines
--   whether the conditions are met.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultActivity:MultiConditionalSplitActivity'</a>,
--   <a>multiConditionalSplitActivity_defaultActivity</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the activity to perform for participants who don't meet
--   any of the conditions specified for other paths in the activity.
newMultiConditionalSplitActivity :: MultiConditionalSplitActivity

-- | The paths for the activity, including the conditions for entering each
--   path and the activity to perform for each path.
multiConditionalSplitActivity_branches :: Lens' MultiConditionalSplitActivity (Maybe [MultiConditionalBranch])

-- | The amount of time to wait or the date and time when Amazon Pinpoint
--   determines whether the conditions are met.
multiConditionalSplitActivity_evaluationWaitTime :: Lens' MultiConditionalSplitActivity (Maybe WaitTime)

-- | The unique identifier for the activity to perform for participants who
--   don't meet any of the conditions specified for other paths in the
--   activity.
multiConditionalSplitActivity_defaultActivity :: Lens' MultiConditionalSplitActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies a phone number to validate and retrieve information about.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNumberValidateRequest</a> smart constructor.
data NumberValidateRequest
NumberValidateRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NumberValidateRequest

-- | The two-character code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, for the country
--   or region where the phone number was originally registered.
[$sel:isoCountryCode:NumberValidateRequest'] :: NumberValidateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The phone number to retrieve information about. The phone number that
--   you provide should include a valid numeric country code. Otherwise,
--   the operation might result in an error.
[$sel:phoneNumber:NumberValidateRequest'] :: NumberValidateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>NumberValidateRequest</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:isoCountryCode:NumberValidateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateRequest_isoCountryCode</a> - The two-character code,
--   in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, for the country or region where the
--   phone number was originally registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneNumber:NumberValidateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateRequest_phoneNumber</a> - The phone number to
--   retrieve information about. The phone number that you provide should
--   include a valid numeric country code. Otherwise, the operation might
--   result in an error.
newNumberValidateRequest :: NumberValidateRequest

-- | The two-character code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, for the country
--   or region where the phone number was originally registered.
numberValidateRequest_isoCountryCode :: Lens' NumberValidateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The phone number to retrieve information about. The phone number that
--   you provide should include a valid numeric country code. Otherwise,
--   the operation might result in an error.
numberValidateRequest_phoneNumber :: Lens' NumberValidateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides information about a phone number.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNumberValidateResponse</a> smart constructor.
data NumberValidateResponse
NumberValidateResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NumberValidateResponse

-- | The carrier or service provider that the phone number is currently
--   registered with. In some countries and regions, this value may be the
--   carrier or service provider that the phone number was originally
--   registered with.
[$sel:carrier:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the county where the phone number was originally
--   registered.
[$sel:county:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the country or region where the phone number was
--   originally registered.
[$sel:country:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The numeric code for the country or region where the phone number was
--   originally registered.
[$sel:countryCodeNumeric:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The postal or ZIP code for the location where the phone number was
--   originally registered.
[$sel:zipCode:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The phone number that was sent in the request body.
[$sel:originalPhoneNumber:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The phone type, represented by an integer. Valid values are: 0
--   (mobile), 1 (landline), 2 (VoIP), 3 (invalid), 4 (other), and 5
--   (prepaid).
[$sel:phoneTypeCode:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The description of the phone type. Valid values are: MOBILE, LANDLINE,
--   VOIP, INVALID, PREPAID, and OTHER.
[$sel:phoneType:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the city where the phone number was originally registered.
[$sel:city:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The two-character code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, for the country
--   or region where the phone number was originally registered.
[$sel:countryCodeIso2:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The time zone for the location where the phone number was originally
--   registered.
[$sel:timezone:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The two-character code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, that was sent in
--   the request body.
[$sel:originalCountryCodeIso2:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The cleansed phone number, in the format for the location where the
--   phone number was originally registered.
[$sel:cleansedPhoneNumberNational:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The cleansed phone number, in E.164 format, for the location where the
--   phone number was originally registered.
[$sel:cleansedPhoneNumberE164:NumberValidateResponse'] :: NumberValidateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>NumberValidateResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:carrier:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_carrier</a> - The carrier or service
--   provider that the phone number is currently registered with. In some
--   countries and regions, this value may be the carrier or service
--   provider that the phone number was originally registered with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:county:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,

--   the phone number was originally registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:country:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_country</a> - The name of the country or
--   region where the phone number was originally registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:countryCodeNumeric:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,

--   for the country or region where the phone number was originally
--   registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:zipCode:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,

--

--   
--   <a>$sel:originalCountryCodeIso2:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_originalCountryCodeIso2</a> - The
--   two-character code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, that was sent in the
--   request body.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cleansedPhoneNumberNational:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_cleansedPhoneNumberNational</a> - The
--   cleansed phone number, in the format for the location where the phone

--   phone number, in E.164 format, for the location where the phone number
--   was originally registered.
newNumberValidateResponse :: NumberValidateResponse

--   registered with. In some countries and regions, this value may be the
--   carrier or service provider that the phone number was originally
--   registered with.

--   registered.

--   originally registered.

--   or region where the phone number was originally registered.

-- | Override button configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOverrideButtonConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data OverrideButtonConfiguration
OverrideButtonConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> ButtonAction -> OverrideButtonConfiguration

-- | Button destination.
[$sel:link:OverrideButtonConfiguration'] :: OverrideButtonConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Action triggered by the button.
[$sel:buttonAction:OverrideButtonConfiguration'] :: OverrideButtonConfiguration -> ButtonAction

-- | Create a value of <a>OverrideButtonConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:link:OverrideButtonConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>overrideButtonConfiguration_link</a> - Button destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:buttonAction:OverrideButtonConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>overrideButtonConfiguration_buttonAction</a> - Action triggered by
--   the button.
newOverrideButtonConfiguration :: ButtonAction -> OverrideButtonConfiguration

-- | Button destination.
overrideButtonConfiguration_link :: Lens' OverrideButtonConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Action triggered by the button.
overrideButtonConfiguration_buttonAction :: Lens' OverrideButtonConfiguration ButtonAction

-- | Specifies the properties and attributes of an endpoint that's
--   associated with an event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPublicEndpoint</a> smart constructor.
data PublicEndpoint
PublicEndpoint' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Double) -> Maybe EndpointLocation -> Maybe EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EndpointUser -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ChannelType -> PublicEndpoint

-- | A unique identifier that's generated each time the endpoint is
--   updated.
[$sel:requestId:PublicEndpoint'] :: PublicEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint
--   for the endpoint.
[$sel:metrics:PublicEndpoint'] :: PublicEndpoint -> Maybe (HashMap Text Double)

-- | The geographic information for the endpoint.
[$sel:location:PublicEndpoint'] :: PublicEndpoint -> Maybe EndpointLocation

-- | The demographic information for the endpoint, such as the time zone
--   and platform.
[$sel:demographic:PublicEndpoint'] :: PublicEndpoint -> Maybe EndpointDemographic

-- | The unique identifier for the recipient, such as a device token, email
--   address, or mobile phone number.
[$sel:address:PublicEndpoint'] :: PublicEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the endpoint was last
--   updated.
[$sel:effectiveDate:PublicEndpoint'] :: PublicEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more custom user attributes that your app reports to Amazon
--   Pinpoint for the user who's associated with the endpoint.
[$sel:user:PublicEndpoint'] :: PublicEndpoint -> Maybe EndpointUser

-- | One or more custom attributes that describe the endpoint by
--   associating a name with an array of values. You can use these
--   attributes as filter criteria when you create segments.
[$sel:attributes:PublicEndpoint'] :: PublicEndpoint -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | Specifies whether to send messages or push notifications to the
--   endpoint. Valid values are: ACTIVE, messages are sent to the endpoint;
--   and, INACTIVE, messages aren’t sent to the endpoint.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint automatically sets this value to ACTIVE when you
--   create an endpoint or update an existing endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint
--   automatically sets this value to INACTIVE if you update another
--   endpoint that has the same address specified by the Address property.
[$sel:endpointStatus:PublicEndpoint'] :: PublicEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the user who's associated with the endpoint has
--   opted out of receiving messages and push notifications from you.
--   Possible values are: ALL, the user has opted out and doesn't want to
--   receive any messages or push notifications; and, NONE, the user hasn't
--   opted out and wants to receive all messages and push notifications.
[$sel:optOut:PublicEndpoint'] :: PublicEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The channel that's used when sending messages or push notifications to
--   the endpoint.
[$sel:channelType:PublicEndpoint'] :: PublicEndpoint -> Maybe ChannelType

-- | Create a value of <a>PublicEndpoint</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding

--   The unique identifier for the recipient, such as a device token, email
--   address, or mobile phone number.

--   format, when the endpoint was last updated.

--   segments.

--   <a>$sel:endpointStatus:PublicEndpoint'</a>,

--   opted out and wants to receive all messages and push notifications.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelType:PublicEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>publicEndpoint_channelType</a> - The channel that's used when
--   sending messages or push notifications to the endpoint.
newPublicEndpoint :: PublicEndpoint

-- | A unique identifier that's generated each time the endpoint is
--   updated.
publicEndpoint_requestId :: Lens' PublicEndpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint
--   for the endpoint.
publicEndpoint_metrics :: Lens' PublicEndpoint (Maybe (HashMap Text Double))

publicEndpoint_location :: Lens' PublicEndpoint (Maybe EndpointLocation)

--   and platform.
publicEndpoint_demographic :: Lens' PublicEndpoint (Maybe EndpointDemographic)

-- | The unique identifier for the recipient, such as a device token, email
--   address, or mobile phone number.
publicEndpoint_address :: Lens' PublicEndpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the endpoint was last
--   updated.
publicEndpoint_effectiveDate :: Lens' PublicEndpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more custom user attributes that your app reports to Amazon
--   Pinpoint for the user who's associated with the endpoint.
publicEndpoint_user :: Lens' PublicEndpoint (Maybe EndpointUser)

--   associating a name with an array of values. You can use these
--   attributes as filter criteria when you create segments.
publicEndpoint_attributes :: Lens' PublicEndpoint (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | Specifies the settings for a push notification activity in a journey.
--   This type of activity sends a push notification to participants.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPushMessageActivity</a> smart constructor.
data PushMessageActivity
PushMessageActivity' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe JourneyPushMessage -> PushMessageActivity

-- | The name of the push notification template to use for the message. If
--   specified, this value must match the name of an existing message
--   template.
[$sel:templateName:PushMessageActivity'] :: PushMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the push notification
--   template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match
--   the identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of
--   versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template
--   Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
[$sel:templateVersion:PushMessageActivity'] :: PushMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after the
--   message is sent.
[$sel:nextActivity:PushMessageActivity'] :: PushMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the time to live (TTL) value for push notifications that are
--   sent to participants in a journey.
[$sel:messageConfig:PushMessageActivity'] :: PushMessageActivity -> Maybe JourneyPushMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>PushMessageActivity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:PushMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>pushMessageActivity_templateName</a> - The name of the push
--   notification template to use for the message. If specified, this value
--   must match the name of an existing message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateVersion:PushMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>pushMessageActivity_templateVersion</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the version of the push notification template to use for the message.
--   If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing
--   template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version
--   identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextActivity:PushMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>pushMessageActivity_nextActivity</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the next activity to perform, after the message is sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfig:PushMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>pushMessageActivity_messageConfig</a> - Specifies the time to live
--   (TTL) value for push notifications that are sent to participants in a
--   journey.
newPushMessageActivity :: PushMessageActivity

-- | The name of the push notification template to use for the message. If
--   specified, this value must match the name of an existing message
--   template.
pushMessageActivity_templateName :: Lens' PushMessageActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the push notification
--   template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match
--   the identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of
--   versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template
--   Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>

--   message is sent.
pushMessageActivity_nextActivity :: Lens' PushMessageActivity (Maybe Text)
