--   sent to participants in a journey.
pushMessageActivity_messageConfig :: Lens' PushMessageActivity (Maybe JourneyPushMessage)

-- | Specifies the content and settings for a message template that can be
--   used in messages that are sent through a push notification channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPushNotificationTemplateRequest</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PushNotificationTemplateRequest
PushNotificationTemplateRequest' :: Maybe DefaultPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe APNSPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> PushNotificationTemplateRequest

-- | The default message template to use for push notification channels.
[$sel:default':PushNotificationTemplateRequest'] :: PushNotificationTemplateRequest -> Maybe DefaultPushNotificationTemplate

-- | A custom description of the message template.
[$sel:templateDescription:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'] :: PushNotificationTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The message template to use for the GCM channel, which is used to send
--   notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly
--   Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service. This message template overrides
--   the default template for push notification channels
--   (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
[$sel:gcm:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'] :: PushNotificationTemplateRequest -> Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate

-- | The message template to use for the APNs (Apple Push Notification
--   service) channel. This message template overrides the default template
--   for push notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
[$sel:apns:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'] :: PushNotificationTemplateRequest -> Maybe APNSPushNotificationTemplate

-- | A JSON object that specifies the default values to use for message
--   variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value
--   pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The
--   corresponding value defines the default value for that variable. When
--   you create a message that's based on the template, you can override
--   these defaults with message-specific and address-specific variables
--   and values.
[$sel:defaultSubstitutions:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'] :: PushNotificationTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The message template to use for the ADM (Amazon Device Messaging)
--   channel. This message template overrides the default template for push
--   notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
[$sel:adm:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'] :: PushNotificationTemplateRequest -> Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate

-- | The message template to use for the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push) channel.
--   This message template overrides the default template for push
--   notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
[$sel:baidu:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'] :: PushNotificationTemplateRequest -> Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate

-- | The unique identifier for the recommender model to use for the message
--   template. Amazon Pinpoint uses this value to determine how to retrieve
--   and process data from a recommender model when it sends messages that
--   use the template, if the template contains message variables for
--   recommendation data.
[$sel:recommenderId:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'] :: PushNotificationTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:PushNotificationTemplateRequest'] :: PushNotificationTemplateRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>PushNotificationTemplateRequest</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   template that can be used in messages that are sent through a push
--   notification channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPushNotificationTemplateResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PushNotificationTemplateResponse
PushNotificationTemplateResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe DefaultPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe APNSPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> Text -> PushNotificationTemplateResponse

--   channels.
[$sel:default':PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Maybe DefaultPushNotificationTemplate

-- | The custom description of the message template.
[$sel:templateDescription:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

--   send notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM),
--   formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service. This message template
--   overrides the default template for push notification channels
--   (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
[$sel:gcm:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate

--   service) channel. This message template overrides the default template
--   for push notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).

--   key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template.
--   The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable.
[$sel:defaultSubstitutions:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

--   message template, or the version of the template that you specified by
--   using the version parameter in your request.
[$sel:version:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

[$sel:adm:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate

--   message template.
[$sel:recommenderId:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

--   required tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

--   modified.

[$sel:creationDate:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The type of channel that the message template is designed for. For a
--   push notification template, this value is PUSH.
[$sel:templateType:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> TemplateType

-- | The name of the message template.
[$sel:templateName:PushNotificationTemplateResponse'] :: PushNotificationTemplateResponse -> Text

--   template.

-- | The default message template that's used for push notification
--   channels.
pushNotificationTemplateResponse_default :: Lens' PushNotificationTemplateResponse (Maybe DefaultPushNotificationTemplate)

-- | The custom description of the message template.
pushNotificationTemplateResponse_templateDescription :: Lens' PushNotificationTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The message template that's used for the GCM channel, which is used to
--   send notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM),
--   formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service. This message template
--   overrides the default template for push notification channels
--   (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
pushNotificationTemplateResponse_gcm :: Lens' PushNotificationTemplateResponse (Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate)

-- | The message template that's used for the APNs (Apple Push Notification
--   service) channel. This message template overrides the default template
--   for push notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
pushNotificationTemplateResponse_apns :: Lens' PushNotificationTemplateResponse (Maybe APNSPushNotificationTemplate)

-- | The JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for
--   message variables in the message template. This object is a set of
--   key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template.
--   The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable.
pushNotificationTemplateResponse_defaultSubstitutions :: Lens' PushNotificationTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the
--   message template, or the version of the template that you specified by
--   using the version parameter in your request.
pushNotificationTemplateResponse_version :: Lens' PushNotificationTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The message template that's used for the ADM (Amazon Device Messaging)
--   channel. This message template overrides the default template for push
--   notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
pushNotificationTemplateResponse_adm :: Lens' PushNotificationTemplateResponse (Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate)

-- | The message template that's used for the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push)
--   channel. This message template overrides the default template for push
--   notification channels (DefaultPushNotificationTemplate).
pushNotificationTemplateResponse_baidu :: Lens' PushNotificationTemplateResponse (Maybe AndroidPushNotificationTemplate)

-- | The unique identifier for the recommender model that's used by the
--   message template.
pushNotificationTemplateResponse_recommenderId :: Lens' PushNotificationTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags
--   that are associated with the message template. Each tag consists of a
--   required tag key and an associated tag value.
pushNotificationTemplateResponse_tags :: Lens' PushNotificationTemplateResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was last
--   modified.
pushNotificationTemplateResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' PushNotificationTemplateResponse Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was created.
pushNotificationTemplateResponse_creationDate :: Lens' PushNotificationTemplateResponse Text

-- | The type of channel that the message template is designed for. For a
--   push notification template, this value is PUSH.
pushNotificationTemplateResponse_templateType :: Lens' PushNotificationTemplateResponse TemplateType

-- | The name of the message template.
pushNotificationTemplateResponse_templateName :: Lens' PushNotificationTemplateResponse Text

-- | Specifies the start and end times that define a time range when
--   messages aren't sent to endpoints.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newQuietTime</a> smart constructor.
data QuietTime
QuietTime' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> QuietTime

-- | The specific time when quiet time begins. This value has to use
--   24-hour notation and be in HH:MM format, where HH is the hour (with a
--   leading zero, if applicable) and MM is the minutes. For example, use
--   02:30 to represent 2:30 AM, or 14:30 to represent 2:30 PM.
[$sel:start:QuietTime'] :: QuietTime -> Maybe Text

-- | The specific time when quiet time ends. This value has to use 24-hour
--   notation and be in HH:MM format, where HH is the hour (with a leading
--   zero, if applicable) and MM is the minutes. For example, use 02:30 to
--   represent 2:30 AM, or 14:30 to represent 2:30 PM.
[$sel:end:QuietTime'] :: QuietTime -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>QuietTime</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:start:QuietTime'</a>, <a>quietTime_start</a> - The specific
--   time when quiet time begins. This value has to use 24-hour notation
--   and be in HH:MM format, where HH is the hour (with a leading zero, if
--   applicable) and MM is the minutes. For example, use 02:30 to represent
--   2:30 AM, or 14:30 to represent 2:30 PM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:end:QuietTime'</a>, <a>quietTime_end</a> - The specific time
--   when quiet time ends. This value has to use 24-hour notation and be in
--   HH:MM format, where HH is the hour (with a leading zero, if
--   applicable) and MM is the minutes. For example, use 02:30 to represent
--   2:30 AM, or 14:30 to represent 2:30 PM.
newQuietTime :: QuietTime

-- | The specific time when quiet time begins. This value has to use
--   24-hour notation and be in HH:MM format, where HH is the hour (with a
--   leading zero, if applicable) and MM is the minutes. For example, use
--   02:30 to represent 2:30 AM, or 14:30 to represent 2:30 PM.
quietTime_start :: Lens' QuietTime (Maybe Text)

-- | The specific time when quiet time ends. This value has to use 24-hour
--   notation and be in HH:MM format, where HH is the hour (with a leading
--   zero, if applicable) and MM is the minutes. For example, use 02:30 to
--   represent 2:30 AM, or 14:30 to represent 2:30 PM.
quietTime_end :: Lens' QuietTime (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the settings for a random split activity in a journey. This
--   type of activity randomly sends specified percentages of participants
--   down one of as many as five paths in a journey, based on conditions
--   that you specify.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRandomSplitActivity</a> smart constructor.
data RandomSplitActivity
RandomSplitActivity' :: Maybe [RandomSplitEntry] -> RandomSplitActivity

-- | The paths for the activity, including the percentage of participants
--   to enter each path and the activity to perform for each path.
[$sel:branches:RandomSplitActivity'] :: RandomSplitActivity -> Maybe [RandomSplitEntry]

-- | Create a value of <a>RandomSplitActivity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:branches:RandomSplitActivity'</a>,
--   <a>randomSplitActivity_branches</a> - The paths for the activity,
--   including the percentage of participants to enter each path and the
--   activity to perform for each path.
newRandomSplitActivity :: RandomSplitActivity

-- | The paths for the activity, including the percentage of participants
--   to enter each path and the activity to perform for each path.
randomSplitActivity_branches :: Lens' RandomSplitActivity (Maybe [RandomSplitEntry])

-- | Specifies the settings for a path in a random split activity in a
--   journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRandomSplitEntry</a> smart constructor.
data RandomSplitEntry
RandomSplitEntry' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> RandomSplitEntry

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after
--   completing the activity for the path.
[$sel:nextActivity:RandomSplitEntry'] :: RandomSplitEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The percentage of participants to send down the activity path.
--   
--   To determine which participants are sent down each path, Amazon
--   Pinpoint applies a probability-based algorithm to the percentages that
--   you specify for the paths. Therefore, the actual percentage of
--   participants who are sent down a path may not be equal to the
--   percentage that you specify.
[$sel:percentage:RandomSplitEntry'] :: RandomSplitEntry -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>RandomSplitEntry</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextActivity:RandomSplitEntry'</a>,
--   <a>randomSplitEntry_nextActivity</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   next activity to perform, after completing the activity for the path.
--   
--   <a>$sel:percentage:RandomSplitEntry'</a>,
--   <a>randomSplitEntry_percentage</a> - The percentage of participants to
--   send down the activity path.
--   
--   To determine which participants are sent down each path, Amazon
--   Pinpoint applies a probability-based algorithm to the percentages that
--   you specify for the paths. Therefore, the actual percentage of
--   participants who are sent down a path may not be equal to the
--   percentage that you specify.
newRandomSplitEntry :: RandomSplitEntry

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after
--   completing the activity for the path.
randomSplitEntry_nextActivity :: Lens' RandomSplitEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The percentage of participants to send down the activity path.
--   
--   To determine which participants are sent down each path, Amazon
--   Pinpoint applies a probability-based algorithm to the percentages that
--   you specify for the paths. Therefore, the actual percentage of
--   participants who are sent down a path may not be equal to the
--   percentage that you specify.
randomSplitEntry_percentage :: Lens' RandomSplitEntry (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies the contents of an email message, represented as a raw MIME
--   message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRawEmail</a> smart constructor.
data RawEmail
RawEmail' :: Maybe Base64 -> RawEmail

-- | The email message, represented as a raw MIME message. The entire
--   message must be base64 encoded.
[$sel:data':RawEmail'] :: RawEmail -> Maybe Base64

-- | Create a value of <a>RawEmail</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':RawEmail'</a>, <a>rawEmail_data</a> - The email message,
--   represented as a raw MIME message. The entire message must be base64
--   encoded.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes
--   and decodes Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will encode to
--   Base64 representation during -- serialisation, and decode from Base64
--   representation during deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts
--   and returns only raw unencoded data.
newRawEmail :: RawEmail

-- | The email message, represented as a raw MIME message. The entire
--   message must be base64 encoded.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt>
--   automatically encodes and decodes Base64 data. -- The underlying
--   isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation during --
--   serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw
--   unencoded data.
rawEmail_data :: Lens' RawEmail (Maybe ByteString)

-- | Specifies criteria for including or excluding endpoints from a segment
--   based on how recently an endpoint was active.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecencyDimension</a> smart constructor.
data RecencyDimension
RecencyDimension' :: Duration -> RecencyType -> RecencyDimension

-- | The duration to use when determining whether an endpoint is active or
--   inactive.
[$sel:duration:RecencyDimension'] :: RecencyDimension -> Duration

-- | The type of recency dimension to use for the segment. Valid values
--   are: ACTIVE, endpoints that were active within the specified duration
--   are included in the segment; and, INACTIVE, endpoints that weren't
--   active within the specified duration are included in the segment.
[$sel:recencyType:RecencyDimension'] :: RecencyDimension -> RecencyType

-- | Create a value of <a>RecencyDimension</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:duration:RecencyDimension'</a>,
--   <a>recencyDimension_duration</a> - The duration to use when
--   determining whether an endpoint is active or inactive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recencyType:RecencyDimension'</a>,
--   <a>recencyDimension_recencyType</a> - The type of recency dimension to
--   use for the segment. Valid values are: ACTIVE, endpoints that were
--   active within the specified duration are included in the segment; and,
--   INACTIVE, endpoints that weren't active within the specified duration
--   are included in the segment.
newRecencyDimension :: Duration -> RecencyType -> RecencyDimension

-- | The duration to use when determining whether an endpoint is active or
--   inactive.
recencyDimension_duration :: Lens' RecencyDimension Duration

-- | The type of recency dimension to use for the segment. Valid values
--   are: ACTIVE, endpoints that were active within the specified duration
--   are included in the segment; and, INACTIVE, endpoints that weren't
--   active within the specified duration are included in the segment.
recencyDimension_recencyType :: Lens' RecencyDimension RecencyType

-- | Provides information about Amazon Pinpoint configuration settings for
--   retrieving and processing data from a recommender model.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecommenderConfigurationResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data RecommenderConfigurationResponse
RecommenderConfigurationResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> RecommenderConfigurationResponse

-- | The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function that
--   Amazon Pinpoint invokes to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data that it retrieves from the recommender model.
[$sel:recommendationTransformerUri:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The custom display name for the standard endpoint or user attribute
--   (RecommendationItems) that temporarily stores recommended items for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This name appears in the
--   <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template editor on the Amazon Pinpoint
--   console.
--   
--   This value is null if the configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional
--   processing of recommendation data.
[$sel:recommendationsDisplayName:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of Amazon Pinpoint ID that's associated with unique user IDs
--   in the recommender model. This value enables the model to use
--   attribute and event data that’s specific to a particular endpoint or
--   user in an Amazon Pinpoint application. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PINPOINT_ENDPOINT_ID - Each user in the model is associated with a
--   particular endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based
--   on endpoint IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. This is the default value.</li>
--   <li>PINPOINT_USER_ID - Each user in the model is associated with a
--   particular user and endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is
--   correlated based on user IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. If this value is
--   specified, an endpoint definition in Amazon Pinpoint has to specify
--   both a user ID (UserId) and an endpoint ID. Otherwise, messages won’t
--   be sent to the user's endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:recommendationProviderIdType:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A map that defines 1-10 custom endpoint or user attributes, depending
--   on the value for the RecommendationProviderIdType property. Each of
--   these attributes temporarily stores a recommended item that's
--   retrieved from the recommender model and sent to an AWS Lambda
--   function for additional processing. Each attribute can be used as a
--   message variable in a message template.
--   
--   This value is null if the configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional
--   processing of recommendation data.
[$sel:attributes:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The custom name of the configuration for the recommender model.
[$sel:name:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The custom description of the configuration for the recommender model.
[$sel:description:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of recommended items that are retrieved from the model for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This number determines how many
--   recommended items are available for use in message variables.
[$sel:recommendationsPerMessage:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender model that Amazon
--   Pinpoint retrieves the recommendation data from. This value is the ARN
--   of an Amazon Personalize campaign.
[$sel:recommendationProviderUri:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Text

-- | The date, in extended ISO 8601 format, when the configuration for the
--   recommender model was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Text

-- | The date, in extended ISO 8601 format, when the configuration was
--   created for the recommender model.
[$sel:creationDate:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to retrieve
--   recommendation data from the recommender model.
[$sel:recommendationProviderRoleArn:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the recommender model configuration.
[$sel:id:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'] :: RecommenderConfigurationResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RecommenderConfigurationResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationTransformerUri:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationTransformerUri</a> -
--   The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function that
--   Amazon Pinpoint invokes to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data that it retrieves from the recommender model.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationsDisplayName:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationsDisplayName</a> -
--   The custom display name for the standard endpoint or user attribute
--   (RecommendationItems) that temporarily stores recommended items for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This name appears in the
--   <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template editor on the Amazon Pinpoint
--   console.
--   
--   This value is null if the configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional
--   processing of recommendation data.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationProviderIdType:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationProviderIdType</a> -
--   The type of Amazon Pinpoint ID that's associated with unique user IDs
--   in the recommender model. This value enables the model to use
--   attribute and event data that’s specific to a particular endpoint or
--   user in an Amazon Pinpoint application. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PINPOINT_ENDPOINT_ID - Each user in the model is associated with a
--   particular endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based
--   on endpoint IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. This is the default value.</li>
--   <li>PINPOINT_USER_ID - Each user in the model is associated with a
--   particular user and endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is
--   correlated based on user IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. If this value is
--   specified, an endpoint definition in Amazon Pinpoint has to specify
--   both a user ID (UserId) and an endpoint ID. Otherwise, messages won’t
--   be sent to the user's endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_attributes</a> - A map that
--   defines 1-10 custom endpoint or user attributes, depending on the
--   value for the RecommendationProviderIdType property. Each of these
--   attributes temporarily stores a recommended item that's retrieved from
--   the recommender model and sent to an AWS Lambda function for
--   additional processing. Each attribute can be used as a message
--   variable in a message template.
--   
--   This value is null if the configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional
--   processing of recommendation data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_name</a> - The custom name of the
--   configuration for the recommender model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_description</a> - The custom
--   description of the configuration for the recommender model.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationsPerMessage:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationsPerMessage</a> -
--   The number of recommended items that are retrieved from the model for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This number determines how many
--   recommended items are available for use in message variables.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationProviderUri:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationProviderUri</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender model that Amazon
--   Pinpoint retrieves the recommendation data from. This value is the ARN
--   of an Amazon Personalize campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date,
--   in extended ISO 8601 format, when the configuration for the
--   recommender model was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in
--   extended ISO 8601 format, when the configuration was created for the
--   recommender model.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationProviderRoleArn:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationProviderRoleArn</a>
--   - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to retrieve
--   recommendation data from the recommender model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_id</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the recommender model configuration.
newRecommenderConfigurationResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> RecommenderConfigurationResponse

-- | The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function that
--   Amazon Pinpoint invokes to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data that it retrieves from the recommender model.
recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationTransformerUri :: Lens' RecommenderConfigurationResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The custom display name for the standard endpoint or user attribute
--   (RecommendationItems) that temporarily stores recommended items for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This name appears in the
--   <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template editor on the Amazon Pinpoint
--   console.
--   
--   This value is null if the configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional
--   processing of recommendation data.
recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationsDisplayName :: Lens' RecommenderConfigurationResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of Amazon Pinpoint ID that's associated with unique user IDs
--   in the recommender model. This value enables the model to use
--   attribute and event data that’s specific to a particular endpoint or
--   user in an Amazon Pinpoint application. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PINPOINT_ENDPOINT_ID - Each user in the model is associated with a

--   be sent to the user's endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationProviderIdType :: Lens' RecommenderConfigurationResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A map that defines 1-10 custom endpoint or user attributes, depending

-- | Provides the results of a query that retrieved the data for a standard
--   metric that applies to an application, campaign, or journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResultRow</a> smart constructor.
data ResultRow
ResultRow' :: [ResultRowValue] -> [ResultRowValue] -> ResultRow

-- | An array of objects that defines the field and field values that were
--   used to group data in a result set that contains multiple results.
--   This value is null if the data in a result set isn’t grouped.
[$sel:groupedBys:ResultRow'] :: ResultRow -> [ResultRowValue]

-- | An array of objects that provides pre-aggregated values for a standard
--   metric that applies to an application, campaign, or journey.
[$sel:values:ResultRow'] :: ResultRow -> [ResultRowValue]

-- | Create a value of <a>ResultRow</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupedBys:ResultRow'</a>, <a>resultRow_groupedBys</a> - An
--   array of objects that defines the field and field values that were
--   used to group data in a result set that contains multiple results.
--   This value is null if the data in a result set isn’t grouped.
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:ResultRow'</a>, <a>resultRow_values</a> - An array of
--   objects that provides pre-aggregated values for a standard metric that
--   applies to an application, campaign, or journey.
newResultRow :: ResultRow

-- | An array of objects that defines the field and field values that were
--   used to group data in a result set that contains multiple results.
--   This value is null if the data in a result set isn’t grouped.
resultRow_groupedBys :: Lens' ResultRow [ResultRowValue]

-- | An array of objects that provides pre-aggregated values for a standard
--   metric that applies to an application, campaign, or journey.
resultRow_values :: Lens' ResultRow [ResultRowValue]

-- | Provides a single value and metadata about that value as part of an
--   array of query results for a standard metric that applies to an
--   application, campaign, or journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResultRowValue</a> smart constructor.
data ResultRowValue
ResultRowValue' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ResultRowValue

-- | The data type of the value specified by the Value property.
[$sel:type':ResultRowValue'] :: ResultRowValue -> Text

-- | In a Values object, the value for the metric that the query retrieved
--   data for. In a GroupedBys object, the value for the field that was
--   used to group data in a result set that contains multiple results
--   (Values objects).
[$sel:value:ResultRowValue'] :: ResultRowValue -> Text

-- | The friendly name of the metric whose value is specified by the Value
--   property.
[$sel:key:ResultRowValue'] :: ResultRowValue -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ResultRowValue</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ResultRowValue'</a>, <a>resultRowValue_type</a> - The
--   data type of the value specified by the Value property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:ResultRowValue'</a>, <a>resultRowValue_value</a> - In a
--   Values object, the value for the metric that the query retrieved data
--   for. In a GroupedBys object, the value for the field that was used to
--   group data in a result set that contains multiple results (Values
--   objects).
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:ResultRowValue'</a>, <a>resultRowValue_key</a> - The
--   friendly name of the metric whose value is specified by the Value
--   property.
newResultRowValue :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ResultRowValue

-- | The data type of the value specified by the Value property.
resultRowValue_type :: Lens' ResultRowValue Text

-- | In a Values object, the value for the metric that the query retrieved
--   data for. In a GroupedBys object, the value for the field that was
--   used to group data in a result set that contains multiple results
--   (Values objects).
resultRowValue_value :: Lens' ResultRowValue Text

-- | The friendly name of the metric whose value is specified by the Value
--   property.
resultRowValue_key :: Lens' ResultRowValue Text

-- | Specifies the status and settings of the SMS channel for an
--   application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSMSChannelRequest</a> smart constructor.
data SMSChannelRequest
SMSChannelRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> SMSChannelRequest

-- | The registered short code that you want to use when you send messages
--   through the SMS channel.
[$sel:shortCode:SMSChannelRequest'] :: SMSChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether to enable the SMS channel for the application.
[$sel:enabled:SMSChannelRequest'] :: SMSChannelRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | The identity that you want to display on recipients' devices when they
--   receive messages from the SMS channel.
[$sel:senderId:SMSChannelRequest'] :: SMSChannelRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SMSChannelRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   you want to use when you send messages through the SMS channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:SMSChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelRequest_enabled</a> - Specifies whether to enable the SMS
--   channel for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:senderId:SMSChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelRequest_senderId</a> - The identity that you want to
--   display on recipients' devices when they receive messages from the SMS
--   channel.
newSMSChannelRequest :: SMSChannelRequest

-- | The registered short code that you want to use when you send messages
--   through the SMS channel.
sMSChannelRequest_shortCode :: Lens' SMSChannelRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether to enable the SMS channel for the application.
sMSChannelRequest_enabled :: Lens' SMSChannelRequest (Maybe Bool)

-- | The identity that you want to display on recipients' devices when they
--   receive messages from the SMS channel.
sMSChannelRequest_senderId :: Lens' SMSChannelRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of the SMS channel
--   for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSMSChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SMSChannelResponse
SMSChannelResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> SMSChannelResponse

-- | The registered short code to use when you send messages through the
--   SMS channel.
[$sel:shortCode:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the SMS channel was last
--   modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the SMS channel is enabled for the application.
[$sel:enabled:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The identity that displays on recipients' devices when they receive
--   messages from the SMS channel.
[$sel:senderId:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of transactional messages that you can send through
--   the SMS channel each second.
[$sel:transactionalMessagesPerSecond:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The maximum number of promotional messages that you can send through
--   the SMS channel each second.
[$sel:promotionalMessagesPerSecond:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies whether the SMS channel is archived.
[$sel:isArchived:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the SMS channel applies
--   to.
[$sel:applicationId:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The current version of the SMS channel.
[$sel:version:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the SMS channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:id:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the SMS channel was
--   enabled.
[$sel:creationDate:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The user who last modified the SMS channel.
[$sel:lastModifiedBy:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:hasCredential:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For
--   the SMS channel, this value is SMS.
[$sel:platform:SMSChannelResponse'] :: SMSChannelResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SMSChannelResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   8601 format, when the SMS channel was last modified.

--   channel each second.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isArchived:SMSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_isArchived</a> - Specifies whether the SMS
--   channel is archived.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:SMSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the application that the SMS channel applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:SMSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_version</a> - The current version of the SMS
--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:SMSChannelResponse'</a>, <a>sMSChannelResponse_id</a> -

--   8601 format, when the SMS channel was enabled.

--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_lastModifiedBy</a> - The user who last modified
--   the SMS channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasCredential:SMSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_hasCredential</a> - (Not used) This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
--

--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_platform</a> - The type of messaging or
--   notification platform for the channel. For the SMS channel, this value

--   SMS channel.

--   the SMS channel each second.

--   the SMS channel each second.

-- | Specifies the default settings for a one-time SMS message that's sent
--   directly to an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSMSMessage</a> smart constructor.
data SMSMessage
SMSMessage' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MessageType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> SMSMessage

-- | The message variables to use in the SMS message. You can override the
--   default variables with individual address variables.
[$sel:substitutions:SMSMessage'] :: SMSMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | The number to send the SMS message from. This value should be one of
--   the dedicated long or short codes that's assigned to your AWS account.
--   If you don't specify a long or short code, Amazon Pinpoint assigns a
--   random long code to the SMS message and sends the message from that
--   code.
[$sel:originationNumber:SMSMessage'] :: SMSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The template ID received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in
--   your country.
[$sel:templateId:SMSMessage'] :: SMSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The body of the SMS message.
[$sel:body:SMSMessage'] :: SMSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The SMS message type. Valid values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages
--   that are critical or time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and
--   PROMOTIONAL (for messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive,
--   such as marketing messages).
[$sel:messageType:SMSMessage'] :: SMSMessage -> Maybe MessageType

-- | The sender ID to display as the sender of the message on a recipient's
--   device. Support for sender IDs varies by country or region.
[$sel:senderId:SMSMessage'] :: SMSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | This field is reserved for future use.
[$sel:mediaUrl:SMSMessage'] :: SMSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The entity ID or Principal Entity (PE) id received from the regulatory
--   body for sending SMS in your country.
[$sel:entityId:SMSMessage'] :: SMSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The SMS program name that you provided to AWS Support when you
--   requested your dedicated number.
[$sel:keyword:SMSMessage'] :: SMSMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SMSMessage</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_substitutions</a>
--   - The message variables to use in the SMS message. You can override
--   the default variables with individual address variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:originationNumber:SMSMessage'</a>,
--   <a>sMSMessage_originationNumber</a> - The number to send the SMS
--   message from. This value should be one of the dedicated long or short
--   codes that's assigned to your AWS account. If you don't specify a long
--   or short code, Amazon Pinpoint assigns a random long code to the SMS
--   message and sends the message from that code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateId:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_templateId</a> - The
--   template ID received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in your
--   country.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_body</a> - The body of the
--   SMS message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageType:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_messageType</a> -
--   The SMS message type. Valid values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages
--   that are critical or time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and
--   PROMOTIONAL (for messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive,
--   such as marketing messages).
--   
--   <a>$sel:senderId:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_senderId</a> - The
--   sender ID to display as the sender of the message on a recipient's
--   device. Support for sender IDs varies by country or region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaUrl:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_mediaUrl</a> - This
--   field is reserved for future use.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entityId:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_entityId</a> - The
--   entity ID or Principal Entity (PE) id received from the regulatory
--   body for sending SMS in your country.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyword:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_keyword</a> - The SMS
--   program name that you provided to AWS Support when you requested your
--   dedicated number.
newSMSMessage :: SMSMessage

-- | The message variables to use in the SMS message. You can override the
--   default variables with individual address variables.
sMSMessage_substitutions :: Lens' SMSMessage (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | The number to send the SMS message from. This value should be one of
--   the dedicated long or short codes that's assigned to your AWS account.
--   If you don't specify a long or short code, Amazon Pinpoint assigns a
--   random long code to the SMS message and sends the message from that
--   code.
sMSMessage_originationNumber :: Lens' SMSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The template ID received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in
--   your country.
sMSMessage_templateId :: Lens' SMSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The body of the SMS message.
sMSMessage_body :: Lens' SMSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The SMS message type. Valid values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages
--   that are critical or time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and
--   PROMOTIONAL (for messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive,
--   such as marketing messages).
sMSMessage_messageType :: Lens' SMSMessage (Maybe MessageType)

-- | The sender ID to display as the sender of the message on a recipient's
--   device. Support for sender IDs varies by country or region.
sMSMessage_senderId :: Lens' SMSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | This field is reserved for future use.
sMSMessage_mediaUrl :: Lens' SMSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The entity ID or Principal Entity (PE) id received from the regulatory
--   body for sending SMS in your country.
sMSMessage_entityId :: Lens' SMSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The SMS program name that you provided to AWS Support when you
--   requested your dedicated number.
sMSMessage_keyword :: Lens' SMSMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the settings for an SMS activity in a journey. This type of
--   activity sends a text message to participants.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSMSMessageActivity</a> smart constructor.
data SMSMessageActivity
SMSMessageActivity' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe JourneySMSMessage -> SMSMessageActivity

-- | The name of the SMS message template to use for the message. If
--   specified, this value must match the name of an existing message
--   template.
[$sel:templateName:SMSMessageActivity'] :: SMSMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the SMS template to use for
--   the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an
--   existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version
--   identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
[$sel:templateVersion:SMSMessageActivity'] :: SMSMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after the
--   message is sent.
[$sel:nextActivity:SMSMessageActivity'] :: SMSMessageActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the sender ID and message type for an SMS message that's
--   sent to participants in a journey.
[$sel:messageConfig:SMSMessageActivity'] :: SMSMessageActivity -> Maybe JourneySMSMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>SMSMessageActivity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:SMSMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>sMSMessageActivity_templateName</a> - The name of the SMS message
--   template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match
--   the name of an existing message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateVersion:SMSMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>sMSMessageActivity_templateVersion</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the version of the SMS template to use for the message. If specified,
--   this value must match the identifier for an existing template version.
--   To retrieve a list of versions and version identifiers for a template,
--   use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextActivity:SMSMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>sMSMessageActivity_nextActivity</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   next activity to perform, after the message is sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfig:SMSMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>sMSMessageActivity_messageConfig</a> - Specifies the sender ID and
--   message type for an SMS message that's sent to participants in a
--   journey.
newSMSMessageActivity :: SMSMessageActivity

-- | The name of the SMS message template to use for the message. If
--   specified, this value must match the name of an existing message
--   template.
sMSMessageActivity_templateName :: Lens' SMSMessageActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the SMS template to use for
--   the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an
--   existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version
--   identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
sMSMessageActivity_templateVersion :: Lens' SMSMessageActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after the
--   message is sent.
sMSMessageActivity_nextActivity :: Lens' SMSMessageActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the sender ID and message type for an SMS message that's
--   sent to participants in a journey.
sMSMessageActivity_messageConfig :: Lens' SMSMessageActivity (Maybe JourneySMSMessage)

-- | Specifies the content and settings for a message template that can be
--   used in text messages that are sent through the SMS channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSMSTemplateRequest</a> smart constructor.
data SMSTemplateRequest
SMSTemplateRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> SMSTemplateRequest

-- | The message body to use in text messages that are based on the message
--   template.
[$sel:body:SMSTemplateRequest'] :: SMSTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A custom description of the message template.
[$sel:templateDescription:SMSTemplateRequest'] :: SMSTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A JSON object that specifies the default values to use for message
--   variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value
--   pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The
--   corresponding value defines the default value for that variable. When
--   you create a message that's based on the template, you can override
--   these defaults with message-specific and address-specific variables
--   and values.
[$sel:defaultSubstitutions:SMSTemplateRequest'] :: SMSTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the recommender model to use for the message
--   template. Amazon Pinpoint uses this value to determine how to retrieve
--   and process data from a recommender model when it sends messages that
--   use the template, if the template contains message variables for
--   recommendation data.
[$sel:recommenderId:SMSTemplateRequest'] :: SMSTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:SMSTemplateRequest'] :: SMSTemplateRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>SMSTemplateRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:SMSTemplateRequest'</a>, <a>sMSTemplateRequest_body</a> -
--   The message body to use in text messages that are based on the message
--   template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:SMSTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sMSTemplateRequest_templateDescription</a> - A custom description
--   of the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubstitutions:SMSTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sMSTemplateRequest_defaultSubstitutions</a> - A JSON object that
--   specifies the default values to use for message variables in the
--   message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key
--   defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding value
--   defines the default value for that variable. When you create a message
--   that's based on the template, you can override these defaults with
--   message-specific and address-specific variables and values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommenderId:SMSTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sMSTemplateRequest_recommenderId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the recommender model to use for the message template. Amazon Pinpoint
--   uses this value to determine how to retrieve and process data from a
--   recommender model when it sends messages that use the template, if the
--   template contains message variables for recommendation data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:SMSTemplateRequest'</a>, <a>sMSTemplateRequest_tags</a> -
--   A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
newSMSTemplateRequest :: SMSTemplateRequest

-- | The message body to use in text messages that are based on the message
--   template.
sMSTemplateRequest_body :: Lens' SMSTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A custom description of the message template.
sMSTemplateRequest_templateDescription :: Lens' SMSTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A JSON object that specifies the default values to use for message
--   variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value
--   pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The
--   corresponding value defines the default value for that variable. When
--   you create a message that's based on the template, you can override
--   these defaults with message-specific and address-specific variables
--   and values.
sMSTemplateRequest_defaultSubstitutions :: Lens' SMSTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the recommender model to use for the message
--   template. Amazon Pinpoint uses this value to determine how to retrieve
--   and process data from a recommender model when it sends messages that
--   use the template, if the template contains message variables for
--   recommendation data.
sMSTemplateRequest_recommenderId :: Lens' SMSTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
sMSTemplateRequest_tags :: Lens' SMSTemplateRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | Provides information about the content and settings for a message
--   template that can be used in text messages that are sent through the
--   SMS channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSMSTemplateResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SMSTemplateResponse
SMSTemplateResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> SMSTemplateResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the message template.
[$sel:arn:SMSTemplateResponse'] :: SMSTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The message body that's used in text messages that are based on the
--   message template.
[$sel:body:SMSTemplateResponse'] :: SMSTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The custom description of the message template.
[$sel:templateDescription:SMSTemplateResponse'] :: SMSTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for
--   message variables in the message template. This object is a set of
--   key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template.
--   The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable.
[$sel:defaultSubstitutions:SMSTemplateResponse'] :: SMSTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the
--   message template, or the version of the template that you specified by
--   using the version parameter in your request.
[$sel:version:SMSTemplateResponse'] :: SMSTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the recommender model that's used by the
--   message template.
[$sel:recommenderId:SMSTemplateResponse'] :: SMSTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags
--   that are associated with the message template. Each tag consists of a
--   required tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:SMSTemplateResponse'] :: SMSTemplateResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was last
--   modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:SMSTemplateResponse'] :: SMSTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was created.
[$sel:creationDate:SMSTemplateResponse'] :: SMSTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The name of the message template.
[$sel:templateName:SMSTemplateResponse'] :: SMSTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The type of channel that the message template is designed for. For an
--   SMS template, this value is SMS.
[$sel:templateType:SMSTemplateResponse'] :: SMSTemplateResponse -> TemplateType

-- | Create a value of <a>SMSTemplateResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   description of the message template.

--   key defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding
--   value defines the default value for that variable.

--   integer, for the active version of the message template, or the
--   version of the template that you specified by using the version
--   parameter in your request.

--   <a>$sel:recommenderId:SMSTemplateResponse'</a>,

--   the recommender model that's used by the message template.

--   template.

--   message template is designed for. For an SMS template, this value is

-- | Specifies the schedule settings for a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSchedule</a> smart constructor.
data Schedule
Schedule' :: Maybe Frequency -> Maybe QuietTime -> Maybe CampaignEventFilter -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Schedule

-- | Specifies how often the campaign is sent or whether the campaign is
--   sent in response to a specific event.
[$sel:frequency:Schedule'] :: Schedule -> Maybe Frequency

-- | The default quiet time for the campaign. Quiet time is a specific time
--   range when a campaign doesn't send messages to endpoints, if all the
--   following conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set
--   to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   campaign.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   campaign.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the endpoint will
--   receive messages from the campaign, even if quiet time is enabled.
[$sel:quietTime:Schedule'] :: Schedule -> Maybe QuietTime

-- | The type of event that causes the campaign to be sent, if the value of
--   the Frequency property is EVENT.
[$sel:eventFilter:Schedule'] :: Schedule -> Maybe CampaignEventFilter

-- | Specifies whether the start and end times for the campaign schedule
--   use each recipient's local time. To base the schedule on each
--   recipient's local time, set this value to true.
[$sel:isLocalTime:Schedule'] :: Schedule -> Maybe Bool

-- | The scheduled time, in ISO 8601 format, when the campaign ended or
--   will end.
[$sel:endTime:Schedule'] :: Schedule -> Maybe Text

-- | The starting UTC offset for the campaign schedule, if the value of the
--   IsLocalTime property is true. Valid values are: UTC, UTC+01, UTC+02,
--   UTC+03, UTC+03:30, UTC+04, UTC+04:30, UTC+05, UTC+05:30, UTC+05:45,
--   UTC+06, UTC+06:30, UTC+07, UTC+08, UTC+09, UTC+09:30, UTC+10,
--   UTC+10:30, UTC+11, UTC+12, UTC+13, UTC-02, UTC-03, UTC-04, UTC-05,
--   UTC-06, UTC-07, UTC-08, UTC-09, UTC-10, and UTC-11.
[$sel:timezone:Schedule'] :: Schedule -> Maybe Text

-- | The scheduled time when the campaign began or will begin. Valid values
--   are: IMMEDIATE, to start the campaign immediately; or, a specific time
--   in ISO 8601 format.
[$sel:startTime:Schedule'] :: Schedule -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Schedule</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:frequency:Schedule'</a>, <a>schedule_frequency</a> - Specifies
--   how often the campaign is sent or whether the campaign is sent in
--   response to a specific event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quietTime:Schedule'</a>, <a>schedule_quietTime</a> - The
--   default quiet time for the campaign. Quiet time is a specific time
--   range when a campaign doesn't send messages to endpoints, if all the
--   following conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set
--   to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   campaign.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   campaign.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the endpoint will
--   receive messages from the campaign, even if quiet time is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventFilter:Schedule'</a>, <a>schedule_eventFilter</a> - The
--   type of event that causes the campaign to be sent, if the value of the
--   Frequency property is EVENT.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isLocalTime:Schedule'</a>, <a>schedule_isLocalTime</a> -
--   Specifies whether the start and end times for the campaign schedule
--   use each recipient's local time. To base the schedule on each
--   recipient's local time, set this value to true.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:Schedule'</a>, <a>schedule_endTime</a> - The scheduled
--   time, in ISO 8601 format, when the campaign ended or will end.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timezone:Schedule'</a>, <a>schedule_timezone</a> - The
--   starting UTC offset for the campaign schedule, if the value of the
--   IsLocalTime property is true. Valid values are: UTC, UTC+01, UTC+02,
--   UTC+03, UTC+03:30, UTC+04, UTC+04:30, UTC+05, UTC+05:30, UTC+05:45,
--   UTC+06, UTC+06:30, UTC+07, UTC+08, UTC+09, UTC+09:30, UTC+10,
--   UTC+10:30, UTC+11, UTC+12, UTC+13, UTC-02, UTC-03, UTC-04, UTC-05,
--   UTC-06, UTC-07, UTC-08, UTC-09, UTC-10, and UTC-11.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:Schedule'</a>, <a>schedule_startTime</a> - The
--   scheduled time when the campaign began or will begin. Valid values
--   are: IMMEDIATE, to start the campaign immediately; or, a specific time
--   in ISO 8601 format.
newSchedule :: Text -> Schedule

-- | Specifies how often the campaign is sent or whether the campaign is
--   sent in response to a specific event.
schedule_frequency :: Lens' Schedule (Maybe Frequency)

-- | The default quiet time for the campaign. Quiet time is a specific time
--   range when a campaign doesn't send messages to endpoints, if all the
--   following conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set
--   to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   campaign.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   campaign.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the endpoint will
--   receive messages from the campaign, even if quiet time is enabled.
schedule_quietTime :: Lens' Schedule (Maybe QuietTime)

-- | The type of event that causes the campaign to be sent, if the value of
--   the Frequency property is EVENT.
schedule_eventFilter :: Lens' Schedule (Maybe CampaignEventFilter)

-- | Specifies whether the start and end times for the campaign schedule
--   use each recipient's local time. To base the schedule on each
--   recipient's local time, set this value to true.
schedule_isLocalTime :: Lens' Schedule (Maybe Bool)

-- | The scheduled time, in ISO 8601 format, when the campaign ended or
--   will end.
schedule_endTime :: Lens' Schedule (Maybe Text)

-- | The starting UTC offset for the campaign schedule, if the value of the
--   IsLocalTime property is true. Valid values are: UTC, UTC+01, UTC+02,
--   UTC+03, UTC+03:30, UTC+04, UTC+04:30, UTC+05, UTC+05:30, UTC+05:45,
--   UTC+06, UTC+06:30, UTC+07, UTC+08, UTC+09, UTC+09:30, UTC+10,
--   UTC+10:30, UTC+11, UTC+12, UTC+13, UTC-02, UTC-03, UTC-04, UTC-05,
--   UTC-06, UTC-07, UTC-08, UTC-09, UTC-10, and UTC-11.
schedule_timezone :: Lens' Schedule (Maybe Text)

-- | The scheduled time when the campaign began or will begin. Valid values
--   are: IMMEDIATE, to start the campaign immediately; or, a specific time
--   in ISO 8601 format.
schedule_startTime :: Lens' Schedule Text

-- | Specifies dimension settings for including or excluding endpoints from
--   a segment based on how recently an endpoint was active.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSegmentBehaviors</a> smart constructor.
data SegmentBehaviors
SegmentBehaviors' :: Maybe RecencyDimension -> SegmentBehaviors

-- | The dimension settings that are based on how recently an endpoint was
--   active.
[$sel:recency:SegmentBehaviors'] :: SegmentBehaviors -> Maybe RecencyDimension

-- | Create a value of <a>SegmentBehaviors</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   - The dimension settings that are based on how recently an endpoint
--   was active.
newSegmentBehaviors :: SegmentBehaviors

-- | The dimension settings that are based on how recently an endpoint was
--   active.
segmentBehaviors_recency :: Lens' SegmentBehaviors (Maybe RecencyDimension)

-- | Specifies the dimension settings for a segment.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSegmentDimensions</a> smart constructor.
data SegmentDimensions
SegmentDimensions' :: Maybe (HashMap Text MetricDimension) -> Maybe SegmentLocation -> Maybe SegmentDemographics -> Maybe (HashMap Text AttributeDimension) -> Maybe SegmentBehaviors -> Maybe (HashMap Text AttributeDimension) -> SegmentDimensions

-- | One or more custom metrics to use as criteria for the segment.
[$sel:metrics:SegmentDimensions'] :: SegmentDimensions -> Maybe (HashMap Text MetricDimension)

-- | The location-based criteria, such as region or GPS coordinates, for
--   the segment.
[$sel:location:SegmentDimensions'] :: SegmentDimensions -> Maybe SegmentLocation

-- | The demographic-based criteria, such as device platform, for the
--   segment.
[$sel:demographic:SegmentDimensions'] :: SegmentDimensions -> Maybe SegmentDemographics

-- | One or more custom user attributes to use as criteria for the segment.
[$sel:userAttributes:SegmentDimensions'] :: SegmentDimensions -> Maybe (HashMap Text AttributeDimension)

-- | The behavior-based criteria, such as how recently users have used your
--   app, for the segment.
[$sel:behavior:SegmentDimensions'] :: SegmentDimensions -> Maybe SegmentBehaviors

-- | One or more custom attributes to use as criteria for the segment.
[$sel:attributes:SegmentDimensions'] :: SegmentDimensions -> Maybe (HashMap Text AttributeDimension)

-- | Create a value of <a>SegmentDimensions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   as criteria for the segment.

--   as region or GPS coordinates, for the segment.

--   such as device platform, for the segment.

--   attributes to use as criteria for the segment.

--   the segment.
