-- | Specifies the base segments and dimensions for a segment, and the
--   relationships between these base segments and dimensions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSegmentGroup</a> smart constructor.
data SegmentGroup
SegmentGroup' :: Maybe [SegmentReference] -> Maybe SourceType -> Maybe Type -> Maybe [SegmentDimensions] -> SegmentGroup

-- | The base segment to build the segment on. A base segment, also
--   referred to as a <i>source segment</i>, defines the initial population
--   of endpoints for a segment. When you add dimensions to a segment,
--   Amazon Pinpoint filters the base segment by using the dimensions that
--   you specify.
--   
--   You can specify more than one dimensional segment or only one imported
--   segment. If you specify an imported segment, the Amazon Pinpoint
--   console displays a segment size estimate that indicates the size of
--   the imported segment without any filters applied to it.
[$sel:sourceSegments:SegmentGroup'] :: SegmentGroup -> Maybe [SegmentReference]

-- | Specifies how to handle multiple base segments for the segment. For
--   example, if you specify three base segments for the segment, whether
--   the resulting segment is based on all, any, or none of the base
--   segments.
[$sel:sourceType:SegmentGroup'] :: SegmentGroup -> Maybe SourceType

-- | Specifies how to handle multiple dimensions for the segment. For
--   example, if you specify three dimensions for the segment, whether the
--   resulting segment includes endpoints that match all, any, or none of
--   the dimensions.
[$sel:type':SegmentGroup'] :: SegmentGroup -> Maybe Type

-- | An array that defines the dimensions for the segment.
[$sel:dimensions:SegmentGroup'] :: SegmentGroup -> Maybe [SegmentDimensions]

-- | Create a value of <a>SegmentGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceSegments:SegmentGroup'</a>,
--   <a>segmentGroup_sourceSegments</a> - The base segment to build the
--   segment on. A base segment, also referred to as a <i>source
--   segment</i>, defines the initial population of endpoints for a
--   segment. When you add dimensions to a segment, Amazon Pinpoint filters
--   the base segment by using the dimensions that you specify.
--   
--   You can specify more than one dimensional segment or only one imported
--   segment. If you specify an imported segment, the Amazon Pinpoint
--   console displays a segment size estimate that indicates the size of
--   the imported segment without any filters applied to it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceType:SegmentGroup'</a>, <a>segmentGroup_sourceType</a> -
--   Specifies how to handle multiple base segments for the segment. For
--   example, if you specify three base segments for the segment, whether
--   the resulting segment is based on all, any, or none of the base
--   segments.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':SegmentGroup'</a>, <a>segmentGroup_type</a> - Specifies
--   how to handle multiple dimensions for the segment. For example, if you
--   specify three dimensions for the segment, whether the resulting
--   segment includes endpoints that match all, any, or none of the
--   dimensions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:SegmentGroup'</a>, <a>segmentGroup_dimensions</a> -
--   An array that defines the dimensions for the segment.
newSegmentGroup :: SegmentGroup

-- | The base segment to build the segment on. A base segment, also
--   referred to as a <i>source segment</i>, defines the initial population
--   of endpoints for a segment. When you add dimensions to a segment,
--   Amazon Pinpoint filters the base segment by using the dimensions that
--   you specify.
--   
--   You can specify more than one dimensional segment or only one imported
--   segment. If you specify an imported segment, the Amazon Pinpoint
--   console displays a segment size estimate that indicates the size of
--   the imported segment without any filters applied to it.
segmentGroup_sourceSegments :: Lens' SegmentGroup (Maybe [SegmentReference])

-- | Specifies how to handle multiple base segments for the segment. For
--   example, if you specify three base segments for the segment, whether
--   the resulting segment is based on all, any, or none of the base
--   segments.
segmentGroup_sourceType :: Lens' SegmentGroup (Maybe SourceType)

-- | Specifies how to handle multiple dimensions for the segment. For
--   example, if you specify three dimensions for the segment, whether the
--   resulting segment includes endpoints that match all, any, or none of
--   the dimensions.
segmentGroup_type :: Lens' SegmentGroup (Maybe Type)

-- | An array that defines the dimensions for the segment.
segmentGroup_dimensions :: Lens' SegmentGroup (Maybe [SegmentDimensions])

-- | Specifies the settings that define the relationships between segment
--   groups for a segment.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSegmentGroupList</a> smart constructor.
data SegmentGroupList
SegmentGroupList' :: Maybe Include -> Maybe [SegmentGroup] -> SegmentGroupList

-- | Specifies how to handle multiple segment groups for the segment. For
--   example, if the segment includes three segment groups, whether the
--   resulting segment includes endpoints that match all, any, or none of
--   the segment groups.
[$sel:include:SegmentGroupList'] :: SegmentGroupList -> Maybe Include

-- | An array that defines the set of segment criteria to evaluate when
--   handling segment groups for the segment.
[$sel:groups:SegmentGroupList'] :: SegmentGroupList -> Maybe [SegmentGroup]

-- | Create a value of <a>SegmentGroupList</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:include:SegmentGroupList'</a>, <a>segmentGroupList_include</a>
--   - Specifies how to handle multiple segment groups for the segment. For
--   example, if the segment includes three segment groups, whether the
--   resulting segment includes endpoints that match all, any, or none of
--   the segment groups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groups:SegmentGroupList'</a>, <a>segmentGroupList_groups</a> -
--   An array that defines the set of segment criteria to evaluate when
--   handling segment groups for the segment.
newSegmentGroupList :: SegmentGroupList

-- | Specifies how to handle multiple segment groups for the segment. For
--   example, if the segment includes three segment groups, whether the
--   resulting segment includes endpoints that match all, any, or none of
--   the segment groups.
segmentGroupList_include :: Lens' SegmentGroupList (Maybe Include)

-- | An array that defines the set of segment criteria to evaluate when
--   handling segment groups for the segment.
segmentGroupList_groups :: Lens' SegmentGroupList (Maybe [SegmentGroup])

-- | Provides information about the import job that created a segment. An
--   import job is a job that creates a user segment by importing endpoint
--   definitions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSegmentImportResource</a> smart constructor.
data SegmentImportResource
SegmentImportResource' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Int) -> DefinitionFormat -> Text -> Int -> Text -> Text -> SegmentImportResource

-- | The number of channel types in the endpoint definitions that were
--   imported to create the segment.
[$sel:channelCounts:SegmentImportResource'] :: SegmentImportResource -> Maybe (HashMap Text Int)

-- | The format of the files that were imported to create the segment.
--   Valid values are: CSV, for comma-separated values format; and, JSON,
--   for newline-delimited JSON format.
[$sel:format:SegmentImportResource'] :: SegmentImportResource -> DefinitionFormat

-- | The URL of the Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket that
--   the endpoint definitions were imported from to create the segment.
[$sel:s3Url:SegmentImportResource'] :: SegmentImportResource -> Text

-- | The number of endpoint definitions that were imported successfully to
--   create the segment.
[$sel:size:SegmentImportResource'] :: SegmentImportResource -> Int

-- | (Deprecated) Your AWS account ID, which you assigned to an external ID
--   key in an IAM trust policy. Amazon Pinpoint previously used this value
--   to assume an IAM role when importing endpoint definitions, but we
--   removed this requirement. We don't recommend use of external IDs for
--   IAM roles that are assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.
[$sel:externalId:SegmentImportResource'] :: SegmentImportResource -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorized Amazon Pinpoint to access the
--   Amazon S3 location to import endpoint definitions from.
[$sel:roleArn:SegmentImportResource'] :: SegmentImportResource -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SegmentImportResource</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>segmentImportResource_channelCounts</a> - The number of channel
--   types in the endpoint definitions that were imported to create the
--   segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:format:SegmentImportResource'</a>,
--   <a>segmentImportResource_format</a> - The format of the files that
--   were imported to create the segment. Valid values are: CSV, for
--   comma-separated values format; and, JSON, for newline-delimited JSON
--   format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Url:SegmentImportResource'</a>,

--   Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket that the endpoint definitions were
--   imported from to create the segment.

--   <a>segmentImportResource_size</a> - The number of endpoint definitions
--   that were imported successfully to create the segment.

--   <a>segmentImportResource_externalId</a> - (Deprecated) Your AWS
--   account ID, which you assigned to an external ID key in an IAM trust
--   policy. Amazon Pinpoint previously used this value to assume an IAM

--   requirement. We don't recommend use of external IDs for IAM roles that

--   of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorized

--   definitions from.
newSegmentImportResource :: DefinitionFormat -> Text -> Int -> Text -> Text -> SegmentImportResource

segmentImportResource_channelCounts :: Lens' SegmentImportResource (Maybe (HashMap Text Int))

--   for newline-delimited JSON format.

--   create the segment.

--   IAM roles that are assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.

-- | Provides information about the configuration, dimension, and other
--   settings for a segment.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSegmentResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SegmentResponse
SegmentResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe SegmentGroupList -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe SegmentImportResource -> Maybe SegmentDimensions -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> SegmentType -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> SegmentResponse

-- | The date and time when the segment was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of one or more segment groups that apply to the segment. Each
--   segment group consists of zero or more base segments and the
--   dimensions that are applied to those base segments.
[$sel:segmentGroups:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> Maybe SegmentGroupList

-- | The name of the segment.
[$sel:name:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The version number of the segment.
[$sel:version:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The settings for the import job that's associated with the segment.
[$sel:importDefinition:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> Maybe SegmentImportResource

-- | The dimension settings for the segment.
[$sel:dimensions:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> Maybe SegmentDimensions

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags
--   that are associated with the segment. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The segment type. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DIMENSIONAL - A dynamic segment, which is a segment that uses
--   selection criteria that you specify and is based on endpoint data
--   that's reported by your app. Dynamic segments can change over
--   time.</li>
--   <li>IMPORT - A static segment, which is a segment that uses selection
--   criteria that you specify and is based on endpoint definitions that
--   you import from a file. Imported segments are static; they don't
--   change over time.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:segmentType:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> SegmentType

-- | The date and time when the segment was created.
[$sel:creationDate:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the segment.
[$sel:id:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the segment.
[$sel:arn:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the segment is
--   associated with.
[$sel:applicationId:SegmentResponse'] :: SegmentResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SegmentResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:SegmentResponse'</a>,

--   segment was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentGroups:SegmentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>segmentResponse_segmentGroups</a> - A list of one or more segment
--   groups that apply to the segment. Each segment group consists of zero
--   or more base segments and the dimensions that are applied to those
--   base segments.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:SegmentResponse'</a>, <a>segmentResponse_name</a> - The
--   name of the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:SegmentResponse'</a>, <a>segmentResponse_version</a> -
--   The version number of the segment.
--

--   job that's associated with the segment.

--   segment.
--

--

--   <a>segmentResponse_segmentType</a> - The segment type. Valid values
--   are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DIMENSIONAL - A dynamic segment, which is a segment that uses
--   selection criteria that you specify and is based on endpoint data

--   time.</li>
--   <li>IMPORT - A static segment, which is a segment that uses selection

--   <a>segmentResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the

--   segment group consists of zero or more base segments and the
--   dimensions that are applied to those base segments.

--   that are associated with the segment. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
segmentResponse_tags :: Lens' SegmentResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The segment type. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>

--   selection criteria that you specify and is based on endpoint data
--   that's reported by your app. Dynamic segments can change over
--   time.</li>
--   <li>IMPORT - A static segment, which is a segment that uses selection
--   criteria that you specify and is based on endpoint definitions that

--   associated with.

-- | Provides information about all the segments that are associated with
--   an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSegmentsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SegmentsResponse
SegmentsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> [SegmentResponse] -> SegmentsResponse

-- | The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of
--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
[$sel:nextToken:SegmentsResponse'] :: SegmentsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of responses, one for each segment that's associated with the
--   application (Segments resource) or each version of a segment that's
--   associated with the application (Segment Versions resource).
[$sel:item:SegmentsResponse'] :: SegmentsResponse -> [SegmentResponse]

-- | Create a value of <a>SegmentsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This
--   value is null if there are no additional pages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:SegmentsResponse'</a>, <a>segmentsResponse_item</a> - An
--   array of responses, one for each segment that's associated with the
--   application (Segments resource) or each version of a segment that's
--   associated with the application (Segment Versions resource).
newSegmentsResponse :: SegmentsResponse

--   results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no
--   additional pages.
segmentsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' SegmentsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of responses, one for each segment that's associated with the
--   application (Segments resource) or each version of a segment that's
--   associated with the application (Segment Versions resource).
segmentsResponse_item :: Lens' SegmentsResponse [SegmentResponse]

-- | Specifies the configuration and other settings for a message to send
--   to all the endpoints that are associated with a list of users.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSendUsersMessageRequest</a> smart constructor.
data SendUsersMessageRequest
SendUsersMessageRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration -> DirectMessageConfiguration -> HashMap Text EndpointSendConfiguration -> SendUsersMessageRequest

-- | The unique identifier for tracing the message. This identifier is
--   visible to message recipients.
[$sel:traceId:SendUsersMessageRequest'] :: SendUsersMessageRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A map of custom attribute-value pairs. For a push notification, Amazon
--   Pinpoint adds these attributes to the data.pinpoint object in the body
--   of the notification payload. Amazon Pinpoint also provides these
--   attributes in the events that it generates for users-messages
--   deliveries.
[$sel:context:SendUsersMessageRequest'] :: SendUsersMessageRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The message template to use for the message.
[$sel:templateConfiguration:SendUsersMessageRequest'] :: SendUsersMessageRequest -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration

-- | The settings and content for the default message and any default
--   messages that you defined for specific channels.
[$sel:messageConfiguration:SendUsersMessageRequest'] :: SendUsersMessageRequest -> DirectMessageConfiguration

-- | A map that associates user IDs with <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a>
--   objects. You can use an <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> object to
--   tailor the message for a user by specifying settings such as content
--   overrides and message variables.
[$sel:users:SendUsersMessageRequest'] :: SendUsersMessageRequest -> HashMap Text EndpointSendConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>SendUsersMessageRequest</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:traceId:SendUsersMessageRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sendUsersMessageRequest_traceId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   tracing the message. This identifier is visible to message recipients.
--   
--   <a>$sel:context:SendUsersMessageRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sendUsersMessageRequest_context</a> - A map of custom
--   attribute-value pairs. For a push notification, Amazon Pinpoint adds
--   these attributes to the data.pinpoint object in the body of the
--   notification payload. Amazon Pinpoint also provides these attributes
--   in the events that it generates for users-messages deliveries.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateConfiguration:SendUsersMessageRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sendUsersMessageRequest_templateConfiguration</a> - The message
--   template to use for the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfiguration:SendUsersMessageRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sendUsersMessageRequest_messageConfiguration</a> - The settings and
--   content for the default message and any default messages that you
--   defined for specific channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:users:SendUsersMessageRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sendUsersMessageRequest_users</a> - A map that associates user IDs
--   with <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> objects. You can use an
--   <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> object to tailor the message for a
--   user by specifying settings such as content overrides and message
--   variables.
newSendUsersMessageRequest :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> SendUsersMessageRequest

--   visible to message recipients.
sendUsersMessageRequest_traceId :: Lens' SendUsersMessageRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A map of custom attribute-value pairs. For a push notification, Amazon
--   Pinpoint adds these attributes to the data.pinpoint object in the body
--   of the notification payload. Amazon Pinpoint also provides these
--   attributes in the events that it generates for users-messages
--   deliveries.
sendUsersMessageRequest_context :: Lens' SendUsersMessageRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

--   messages that you defined for specific channels.

--   tailor the message for a user by specifying settings such as content
--   overrides and message variables.
sendUsersMessageRequest_users :: Lens' SendUsersMessageRequest (HashMap Text EndpointSendConfiguration)

-- | Provides information about which users and endpoints a message was
--   sent to.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSendUsersMessageResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SendUsersMessageResponse
SendUsersMessageResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text (HashMap Text EndpointMessageResult)) -> Text -> SendUsersMessageResponse

-- | The unique identifier that was assigned to the message request.
[$sel:requestId:SendUsersMessageResponse'] :: SendUsersMessageResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that indicates which endpoints the message was sent to, for
--   each user. The object lists user IDs and, for each user ID, provides
--   the endpoint IDs that the message was sent to. For each endpoint ID,
--   it provides an EndpointMessageResult object.
[$sel:result:SendUsersMessageResponse'] :: SendUsersMessageResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text (HashMap Text EndpointMessageResult))

-- | The unique identifier for the application that was used to send the
--   message.
[$sel:applicationId:SendUsersMessageResponse'] :: SendUsersMessageResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SendUsersMessageResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestId:SendUsersMessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sendUsersMessageResponse_requestId</a> - The unique identifier that
--   was assigned to the message request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:result:SendUsersMessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sendUsersMessageResponse_result</a> - An object that indicates
--   which endpoints the message was sent to, for each user. The object
--   lists user IDs and, for each user ID, provides the endpoint IDs that
--   the message was sent to. For each endpoint ID, it provides an
--   EndpointMessageResult object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:SendUsersMessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sendUsersMessageResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier
--   for the application that was used to send the message.
newSendUsersMessageResponse :: Text -> SendUsersMessageResponse

-- | The unique identifier that was assigned to the message request.
sendUsersMessageResponse_requestId :: Lens' SendUsersMessageResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that indicates which endpoints the message was sent to, for
--   each user. The object lists user IDs and, for each user ID, provides
--   the endpoint IDs that the message was sent to. For each endpoint ID,
--   it provides an EndpointMessageResult object.
sendUsersMessageResponse_result :: Lens' SendUsersMessageResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text (HashMap Text EndpointMessageResult)))

-- | The unique identifier for the application that was used to send the
--   message.
sendUsersMessageResponse_applicationId :: Lens' SendUsersMessageResponse Text

-- | Provides information about a session.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSession</a> smart constructor.
data Session
Session' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Text -> Text -> Session

-- | The date and time when the session ended.
[$sel:stopTimestamp:Session'] :: Session -> Maybe Text

-- | The duration of the session, in milliseconds.
[$sel:duration:Session'] :: Session -> Maybe Int

-- | The date and time when the session began.
[$sel:startTimestamp:Session'] :: Session -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the session.
[$sel:id:Session'] :: Session -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Session</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stopTimestamp:Session'</a>, <a>session_stopTimestamp</a> - The
--   date and time when the session ended.
--   
--   <a>$sel:duration:Session'</a>, <a>session_duration</a> - The duration
--   of the session, in milliseconds.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTimestamp:Session'</a>, <a>session_startTimestamp</a> -
--   The date and time when the session began.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Session'</a>, <a>session_id</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the session.
newSession :: Text -> Text -> Session

-- | The date and time when the session ended.
session_stopTimestamp :: Lens' Session (Maybe Text)

-- | The duration of the session, in milliseconds.
session_duration :: Lens' Session (Maybe Int)

-- | The date and time when the session began.
session_startTimestamp :: Lens' Session Text

-- | The unique identifier for the session.
session_id :: Lens' Session Text

-- | Specifies the dimension type and values for a segment dimension.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSetDimension</a> smart constructor.
data SetDimension
SetDimension' :: Maybe DimensionType -> [Text] -> SetDimension

-- | The type of segment dimension to use. Valid values are: INCLUSIVE,
--   endpoints that match the criteria are included in the segment; and,
--   EXCLUSIVE, endpoints that match the criteria are excluded from the
--   segment.
[$sel:dimensionType:SetDimension'] :: SetDimension -> Maybe DimensionType

-- | The criteria values to use for the segment dimension. Depending on the
--   value of the DimensionType property, endpoints are included or
--   excluded from the segment if their values match the criteria values.
[$sel:values:SetDimension'] :: SetDimension -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>SetDimension</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionType:SetDimension'</a>,
--   <a>setDimension_dimensionType</a> - The type of segment dimension to
--   use. Valid values are: INCLUSIVE, endpoints that match the criteria
--   are included in the segment; and, EXCLUSIVE, endpoints that match the
--   criteria are excluded from the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:SetDimension'</a>, <a>setDimension_values</a> - The
--   criteria values to use for the segment dimension. Depending on the
--   value of the DimensionType property, endpoints are included or
--   excluded from the segment if their values match the criteria values.
newSetDimension :: SetDimension

-- | The type of segment dimension to use. Valid values are: INCLUSIVE,
--   endpoints that match the criteria are included in the segment; and,
--   EXCLUSIVE, endpoints that match the criteria are excluded from the
--   segment.
setDimension_dimensionType :: Lens' SetDimension (Maybe DimensionType)

-- | The criteria values to use for the segment dimension. Depending on the
--   value of the DimensionType property, endpoints are included or
--   excluded from the segment if their values match the criteria values.
setDimension_values :: Lens' SetDimension [Text]

-- | Specifies a condition to evaluate for an activity in a journey.

data SimpleCondition

--   activity.
[$sel:segmentDimensions:SimpleCondition'] :: SimpleCondition -> Maybe SegmentDimensions

--   activity.

--   event that's associated with the activity.

-- | Specifies the contents of an email message, composed of a subject, a
--   text part, and an HTML part.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSimpleEmail</a> smart constructor.
data SimpleEmail
SimpleEmail' :: Maybe SimpleEmailPart -> Maybe SimpleEmailPart -> Maybe SimpleEmailPart -> SimpleEmail

-- | The subject line, or title, of the email.
[$sel:subject:SimpleEmail'] :: SimpleEmail -> Maybe SimpleEmailPart

-- | The body of the email message, in plain text format. We recommend
--   using plain text format for email clients that don't render HTML
--   content and clients that are connected to high-latency networks, such
--   as mobile devices.
[$sel:textPart:SimpleEmail'] :: SimpleEmail -> Maybe SimpleEmailPart

-- | The body of the email message, in HTML format. We recommend using HTML
--   format for email clients that render HTML content. You can include
--   links, formatted text, and more in an HTML message.
[$sel:htmlPart:SimpleEmail'] :: SimpleEmail -> Maybe SimpleEmailPart

-- | Create a value of <a>SimpleEmail</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:SimpleEmail'</a>, <a>simpleEmail_subject</a> - The
--   subject line, or title, of the email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:textPart:SimpleEmail'</a>, <a>simpleEmail_textPart</a> - The
--   body of the email message, in plain text format. We recommend using
--   plain text format for email clients that don't render HTML content and
--   clients that are connected to high-latency networks, such as mobile
--   devices.
--   
--   <a>$sel:htmlPart:SimpleEmail'</a>, <a>simpleEmail_htmlPart</a> - The
--   body of the email message, in HTML format. We recommend using HTML
--   format for email clients that render HTML content. You can include
--   links, formatted text, and more in an HTML message.
newSimpleEmail :: SimpleEmail

-- | The subject line, or title, of the email.
simpleEmail_subject :: Lens' SimpleEmail (Maybe SimpleEmailPart)

-- | The body of the email message, in plain text format. We recommend
--   using plain text format for email clients that don't render HTML
--   content and clients that are connected to high-latency networks, such
--   as mobile devices.
simpleEmail_textPart :: Lens' SimpleEmail (Maybe SimpleEmailPart)

-- | The body of the email message, in HTML format. We recommend using HTML
--   format for email clients that render HTML content. You can include
--   links, formatted text, and more in an HTML message.
simpleEmail_htmlPart :: Lens' SimpleEmail (Maybe SimpleEmailPart)

--   textual email data and the applicable character set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSimpleEmailPart</a> smart constructor.
data SimpleEmailPart

--   The applicable character set for the message content.

simpleEmailPart_data :: Lens' SimpleEmailPart (Maybe Text)

-- | The applicable character set for the message content.
simpleEmailPart_charset :: Lens' SimpleEmailPart (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the tags (keys and values) for an application, campaign,
--   message template, or segment.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTagsModel</a> smart constructor.
data TagsModel
TagsModel' :: HashMap Text Text -> TagsModel

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags for an
--   application, campaign, message template, or segment. Each of these
--   resources can have a maximum of 50 tags.
--   
--   Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.
--   The maximum length of a tag key is 128 characters. The maximum length
--   of a tag value is 256 characters.
[$sel:tags:TagsModel'] :: TagsModel -> HashMap Text Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TagsModel</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:TagsModel'</a>, <a>tagsModel_tags</a> - A
--   string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags for an
--   application, campaign, message template, or segment. Each of these
--   resources can have a maximum of 50 tags.
--   
--   Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.
--   The maximum length of a tag key is 128 characters. The maximum length
--   of a tag value is 256 characters.
newTagsModel :: TagsModel

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags for an
--   application, campaign, message template, or segment. Each of these
--   resources can have a maximum of 50 tags.
--   
--   Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.
--   The maximum length of a tag key is 128 characters. The maximum length
--   of a tag value is 256 characters.
tagsModel_tags :: Lens' TagsModel (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Specifies the name and version of the message template to use for the
--   message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemplate</a> smart constructor.
data Template
Template' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Template

-- | The name of the message template to use for the message. If specified,
--   this value must match the name of an existing message template.
[$sel:name:Template'] :: Template -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the message template to use
--   for the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier
--   for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and
--   version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions
--   resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
[$sel:version:Template'] :: Template -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Template</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Template'</a>, <a>template_name</a> - The name of the
--   message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must
--   match the name of an existing message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:Template'</a>, <a>template_version</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the version of the message template to use for the
--   message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an
--   existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version
--   identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
newTemplate :: Template

-- | The name of the message template to use for the message. If specified,
--   this value must match the name of an existing message template.
template_name :: Lens' Template (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the message template to use
--   for the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier
--   for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and
--   version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions
--   resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
template_version :: Lens' Template (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies which version of a message template to use as the active
--   version of the template.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemplateActiveVersionRequest</a> smart constructor.
data TemplateActiveVersionRequest
TemplateActiveVersionRequest' :: Maybe Text -> TemplateActiveVersionRequest

-- | The version of the message template to use as the active version of
--   the template. Valid values are: latest, for the most recent version of
--   the template; or, the unique identifier for any existing version of
--   the template. If you specify an identifier, the value must match the
--   identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of
--   versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template
--   Versions resource.
[$sel:version:TemplateActiveVersionRequest'] :: TemplateActiveVersionRequest -> Maybe Text

--   optional fields omitted.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>templateActiveVersionRequest_version</a> - The version of the
--   message template to use as the active version of the template. Valid
--   values are: latest, for the most recent version of the template; or,
--   the unique identifier for any existing version of the template. If you
--   specify an identifier, the value must match the identifier for an
--   existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version
--   identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
newTemplateActiveVersionRequest :: TemplateActiveVersionRequest

-- | The version of the message template to use as the active version of
--   the template. Valid values are: latest, for the most recent version of
--   the template; or, the unique identifier for any existing version of
--   the template. If you specify an identifier, the value must match the
--   identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of
--   versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template
--   Versions resource.
templateActiveVersionRequest_version :: Lens' TemplateActiveVersionRequest (Maybe Text)

--   for the message. This object isn't supported for campaigns.

--   template to use for the message.

newTemplateConfiguration :: TemplateConfiguration

templateConfiguration_emailTemplate :: Lens' TemplateConfiguration (Maybe Template)

-- | Provides information about a message template that's associated with
--   your Amazon Pinpoint account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemplateResponse</a> smart constructor.
data TemplateResponse
TemplateResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> TemplateResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the message template. This value
--   isn't included in a TemplateResponse object. To retrieve the ARN of a
--   template, use the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate,
--   or GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that
--   you want to retrieve the ARN for.
[$sel:arn:TemplateResponse'] :: TemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The custom description of the message template. This value isn't
--   included in a TemplateResponse object. To retrieve the description of
--   a template, use the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate,
--   or GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that
--   you want to retrieve the description for.
[$sel:templateDescription:TemplateResponse'] :: TemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for
--   message variables in the message template. This object isn't included
--   in a TemplateResponse object. To retrieve this object for a template,
--   use the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate, or
--   GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that you
--   want to retrieve the object for.
[$sel:defaultSubstitutions:TemplateResponse'] :: TemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the
--   message template.
[$sel:version:TemplateResponse'] :: TemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags that are associated
--   with the message template. This object isn't included in a
--   TemplateResponse object. To retrieve this object for a template, use
--   the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate, or
--   GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that you
--   want to retrieve the object for.
[$sel:tags:TemplateResponse'] :: TemplateResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was last
--   modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:TemplateResponse'] :: TemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was created.
[$sel:creationDate:TemplateResponse'] :: TemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The name of the message template.
[$sel:templateName:TemplateResponse'] :: TemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The type of channel that the message template is designed for.
--   Possible values are: EMAIL, PUSH, SMS, and VOICE.
[$sel:templateType:TemplateResponse'] :: TemplateResponse -> TemplateType

-- | Create a value of <a>TemplateResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:TemplateResponse'</a>, <a>templateResponse_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the message template. This value isn't
--   included in a TemplateResponse object. To retrieve the ARN of a
--   template, use the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate,
--   or GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that
--   you want to retrieve the ARN for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:TemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateResponse_templateDescription</a> - The custom description
--   of the message template. This value isn't included in a
--   TemplateResponse object. To retrieve the description of a template,
--   use the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate, or
--   GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that you
--   want to retrieve the description for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubstitutions:TemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateResponse_defaultSubstitutions</a> - The JSON object that
--   specifies the default values that are used for message variables in
--   the message template. This object isn't included in a TemplateResponse
--   object. To retrieve this object for a template, use the
--   GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate, or GetVoiceTemplate
--   operation, depending on the type of template that you want to retrieve
--   the object for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:TemplateResponse'</a>, <a>templateResponse_version</a>
--   - The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the
--   message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:TemplateResponse'</a>, <a>templateResponse_tags</a> - A
--   map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags that are associated
--   with the message template. This object isn't included in a
--   TemplateResponse object. To retrieve this object for a template, use
--   the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate, or
--   GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that you
--   want to retrieve the object for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:TemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the message template was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:TemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601 format,
--   when the message template was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:TemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateResponse_templateName</a> - The name of the message
--   template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateType:TemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateResponse_templateType</a> - The type of channel that the
--   message template is designed for. Possible values are: EMAIL, PUSH,
--   SMS, and VOICE.
newTemplateResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> TemplateResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the message template. This value
--   isn't included in a TemplateResponse object. To retrieve the ARN of a
--   template, use the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate,
--   or GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that
--   you want to retrieve the ARN for.
templateResponse_arn :: Lens' TemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The custom description of the message template. This value isn't
--   included in a TemplateResponse object. To retrieve the description of
--   a template, use the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate,
--   or GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that
--   you want to retrieve the description for.
templateResponse_templateDescription :: Lens' TemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for
--   message variables in the message template. This object isn't included
--   in a TemplateResponse object. To retrieve this object for a template,
--   use the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate, or
--   GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that you
--   want to retrieve the object for.
templateResponse_defaultSubstitutions :: Lens' TemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the
--   message template.
templateResponse_version :: Lens' TemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags that are associated
--   with the message template. This object isn't included in a
--   TemplateResponse object. To retrieve this object for a template, use
--   the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate, or
--   GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that you
--   want to retrieve the object for.
templateResponse_tags :: Lens' TemplateResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was last
--   modified.
templateResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' TemplateResponse Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was created.
templateResponse_creationDate :: Lens' TemplateResponse Text

-- | The name of the message template.
templateResponse_templateName :: Lens' TemplateResponse Text

-- | The type of channel that the message template is designed for.
--   Possible values are: EMAIL, PUSH, SMS, and VOICE.
templateResponse_templateType :: Lens' TemplateResponse TemplateType

-- | Provides information about a specific version of a message template.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemplateVersionResponse</a> smart constructor.
data TemplateVersionResponse
TemplateVersionResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateVersionResponse

-- | The custom description of the version of the message template.
[$sel:templateDescription:TemplateVersionResponse'] :: TemplateVersionResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for
--   message variables in the version of the message template. This object
--   is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in
--   the template. The corresponding value defines the default value for
--   that variable.
[$sel:defaultSubstitutions:TemplateVersionResponse'] :: TemplateVersionResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the message template. This
--   value is an integer that Amazon Pinpoint automatically increments and
--   assigns to each new version of a template.
[$sel:version:TemplateVersionResponse'] :: TemplateVersionResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the version of the message template
--   was last modified.

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the version of the message template
--   was created.

-- | The name of the message template.
[$sel:templateName:TemplateVersionResponse'] :: TemplateVersionResponse -> Text

-- | The type of channel that the message template is designed for.
--   Possible values are: EMAIL, PUSH, SMS, and VOICE.
[$sel:templateType:TemplateVersionResponse'] :: TemplateVersionResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TemplateVersionResponse</a> with all optional

-- | Specifies the settings for a campaign treatment. A <i>treatment</i> is
--   a variation of a campaign that's used for A/B testing of a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTreatmentResource</a> smart constructor.
data TreatmentResource
TreatmentResource' :: Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration -> Maybe CampaignState -> Maybe Schedule -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MessageConfiguration -> Text -> Int -> TreatmentResource

-- | The delivery configuration settings for sending the treatment through
--   a custom channel. This object is required if the MessageConfiguration
--   object for the treatment specifies a CustomMessage object.
[$sel:customDeliveryConfiguration:TreatmentResource'] :: TreatmentResource -> Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration

-- | The current status of the treatment.
[$sel:state:TreatmentResource'] :: TreatmentResource -> Maybe CampaignState

-- | The schedule settings for the treatment.
[$sel:schedule:TreatmentResource'] :: TreatmentResource -> Maybe Schedule

-- | The message template to use for the treatment.
[$sel:templateConfiguration:TreatmentResource'] :: TreatmentResource -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration

-- | The custom name of the treatment.
[$sel:treatmentName:TreatmentResource'] :: TreatmentResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The custom description of the treatment.
[$sel:treatmentDescription:TreatmentResource'] :: TreatmentResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The message configuration settings for the treatment.
[$sel:messageConfiguration:TreatmentResource'] :: TreatmentResource -> Maybe MessageConfiguration

-- | The unique identifier for the treatment.
[$sel:id:TreatmentResource'] :: TreatmentResource -> Text

-- | The allocated percentage of users (segment members) that the treatment
--   is sent to.
[$sel:sizePercent:TreatmentResource'] :: TreatmentResource -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>TreatmentResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   for the treatment specifies a CustomMessage object.

--   The current status of the treatment.

--   treatment.

--   <a>treatmentResource_templateConfiguration</a> - The message template
--   to use for the treatment.

--   <a>$sel:treatmentName:TreatmentResource'</a>,
--   <a>treatmentResource_treatmentName</a> - The custom name of the

--   of the treatment.

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateAttributesRequest</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateAttributesRequest

-- | An array of the attributes to remove from all the endpoints that are
--   associated with the application. The array can specify the complete,
--   exact name of each attribute to remove or it can specify a glob
--   pattern that an attribute name must match in order for the attribute
--   to be removed.
[$sel:blacklist:UpdateAttributesRequest'] :: UpdateAttributesRequest -> Maybe [Text]

--   attribute to remove or it can specify a glob pattern that an attribute
--   name must match in order for the attribute to be removed.
newUpdateAttributesRequest :: UpdateAttributesRequest

--   associated with the application. The array can specify the complete,
--   exact name of each attribute to remove or it can specify a glob
--   pattern that an attribute name must match in order for the attribute
--   to be removed.
updateAttributesRequest_blacklist :: Lens' UpdateAttributesRequest (Maybe [Text])

-- | Specifies Amazon Pinpoint configuration settings for retrieving and
--   processing recommendation data from a recommender model.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateRecommenderConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateRecommenderConfiguration
UpdateRecommenderConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Text -> Text -> UpdateRecommenderConfiguration

-- | The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function to
--   invoke for additional processing of recommendation data that's
--   retrieved from the recommender model.
[$sel:recommendationTransformerUri:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: UpdateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | A custom display name for the standard endpoint or user attribute
--   (RecommendationItems) that temporarily stores recommended items for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This value is required if the
--   configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda function
--   (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data.
--   
--   This name appears in the <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template
--   editor on the Amazon Pinpoint console. The name can contain up to 25
--   characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-). These restrictions don't apply to
--   attribute values.
[$sel:recommendationsDisplayName:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: UpdateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of Amazon Pinpoint ID to associate with unique user IDs in
--   the recommender model. This value enables the model to use attribute
--   and event data that’s specific to a particular endpoint or user in an
--   Amazon Pinpoint application. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PINPOINT_ENDPOINT_ID - Associate each user in the model with a
--   particular endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based
--   on endpoint IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. This is the default value.</li>
--   <li>PINPOINT_USER_ID - Associate each user in the model with a
--   particular user and endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is
--   correlated based on user IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. If you specify this
--   value, an endpoint definition in Amazon Pinpoint has to specify both a
--   user ID (UserId) and an endpoint ID. Otherwise, messages won’t be sent
--   to the user's endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:recommendationProviderIdType:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: UpdateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | A map of key-value pairs that defines 1-10 custom endpoint or user
--   attributes, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. Each of these attributes
--   temporarily stores a recommended item that's retrieved from the
--   recommender model and sent to an AWS Lambda function for additional
--   processing. Each attribute can be used as a message variable in a
--   message template.
--   
--   In the map, the key is the name of a custom attribute and the value is
--   a custom display name for that attribute. The display name appears in
--   the <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template editor on the Amazon
--   Pinpoint console. The following restrictions apply to these names:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>An attribute name must start with a letter or number and it can
--   contain up to 50 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Attribute names are case sensitive
--   and must be unique.</li>
--   <li>An attribute display name must start with a letter or number and
--   it can contain up to 25 characters. The characters can be letters,
--   numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This object is required if the configuration invokes an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to process recommendation
--   data. Otherwise, don't include this object in your request.
[$sel:attributes:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: UpdateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | A custom name of the configuration for the recommender model. The name
--   must start with a letter or number and it can contain up to 128
--   characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-).
[$sel:name:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: UpdateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | A custom description of the configuration for the recommender model.
--   The description can contain up to 128 characters. The characters can
--   be letters, numbers, spaces, or the following symbols: _ ; () , ‐.
[$sel:description:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: UpdateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of recommended items to retrieve from the model for each
--   endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This number determines how many
--   recommended items are available for use in message variables. The
--   minimum value is 1. The maximum value is 5. The default value is 5.
--   
--   To use multiple recommended items and custom attributes with message
--   variables, you have to use an AWS Lambda function
--   (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data.
[$sel:recommendationsPerMessage:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: UpdateRecommenderConfiguration -> Maybe Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender model to retrieve
--   recommendation data from. This value must match the ARN of an Amazon
--   Personalize campaign.
[$sel:recommendationProviderUri:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: UpdateRecommenderConfiguration -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to retrieve
--   recommendation data from the recommender model.
[$sel:recommendationProviderRoleArn:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'] :: UpdateRecommenderConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateRecommenderConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationTransformerUri:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationTransformerUri</a> -
--   The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function to
--   invoke for additional processing of recommendation data that's
--   retrieved from the recommender model.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationsDisplayName:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationsDisplayName</a> - A
--   custom display name for the standard endpoint or user attribute
--   (RecommendationItems) that temporarily stores recommended items for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This value is required if the
--   configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda function
--   (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data.
--   
--   This name appears in the <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template
--   editor on the Amazon Pinpoint console. The name can contain up to 25
--   characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-). These restrictions don't apply to
--   attribute values.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationProviderIdType:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationProviderIdType</a> -
--   The type of Amazon Pinpoint ID to associate with unique user IDs in
--   the recommender model. This value enables the model to use attribute
--   and event data that’s specific to a particular endpoint or user in an
--   Amazon Pinpoint application. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PINPOINT_ENDPOINT_ID - Associate each user in the model with a
--   particular endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based
--   on endpoint IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. This is the default value.</li>
--   <li>PINPOINT_USER_ID - Associate each user in the model with a
--   particular user and endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is
--   correlated based on user IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. If you specify this
--   value, an endpoint definition in Amazon Pinpoint has to specify both a
--   user ID (UserId) and an endpoint ID. Otherwise, messages won’t be sent
--   to the user's endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_attributes</a> - A map of key-value
--   pairs that defines 1-10 custom endpoint or user attributes, depending
--   on the value for the RecommendationProviderIdType property. Each of
--   these attributes temporarily stores a recommended item that's
--   retrieved from the recommender model and sent to an AWS Lambda
--   function for additional processing. Each attribute can be used as a
--   message variable in a message template.
--   
--   In the map, the key is the name of a custom attribute and the value is
--   a custom display name for that attribute. The display name appears in
--   the <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template editor on the Amazon
--   Pinpoint console. The following restrictions apply to these names:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>An attribute name must start with a letter or number and it can
--   contain up to 50 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Attribute names are case sensitive
--   and must be unique.</li>
--   <li>An attribute display name must start with a letter or number and
--   it can contain up to 25 characters. The characters can be letters,
--   numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This object is required if the configuration invokes an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to process recommendation
--   data. Otherwise, don't include this object in your request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_name</a> - A custom name of the
--   configuration for the recommender model. The name must start with a
--   letter or number and it can contain up to 128 characters. The
--   characters can be letters, numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or
--   hyphens (-).
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_description</a> - A custom
--   description of the configuration for the recommender model. The
--   description can contain up to 128 characters. The characters can be
--   letters, numbers, spaces, or the following symbols: _ ; () , ‐.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationsPerMessage:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationsPerMessage</a> - The
--   number of recommended items to retrieve from the model for each
--   endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This number determines how many
--   recommended items are available for use in message variables. The
--   minimum value is 1. The maximum value is 5. The default value is 5.
--   
--   To use multiple recommended items and custom attributes with message
--   variables, you have to use an AWS Lambda function
--   (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationProviderUri:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationProviderUri</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender model to retrieve
--   recommendation data from. This value must match the ARN of an Amazon
--   Personalize campaign.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationProviderRoleArn:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationProviderRoleArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to retrieve
--   recommendation data from the recommender model.
newUpdateRecommenderConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> UpdateRecommenderConfiguration

-- | The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function to
--   invoke for additional processing of recommendation data that's
--   retrieved from the recommender model.
updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationTransformerUri :: Lens' UpdateRecommenderConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | A custom display name for the standard endpoint or user attribute
--   (RecommendationItems) that temporarily stores recommended items for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This value is required if the
--   configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda function
--   (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data.
--   
--   This name appears in the <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template
--   editor on the Amazon Pinpoint console. The name can contain up to 25
--   characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-). These restrictions don't apply to
--   attribute values.
updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationsDisplayName :: Lens' UpdateRecommenderConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of Amazon Pinpoint ID to associate with unique user IDs in
--   the recommender model. This value enables the model to use attribute
--   and event data that’s specific to a particular endpoint or user in an
--   Amazon Pinpoint application. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PINPOINT_ENDPOINT_ID - Associate each user in the model with a
--   particular endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based
--   on endpoint IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. This is the default value.</li>
--   <li>PINPOINT_USER_ID - Associate each user in the model with a
--   particular user and endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is
--   correlated based on user IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. If you specify this
--   value, an endpoint definition in Amazon Pinpoint has to specify both a
--   user ID (UserId) and an endpoint ID. Otherwise, messages won’t be sent
--   to the user's endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationProviderIdType :: Lens' UpdateRecommenderConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | A map of key-value pairs that defines 1-10 custom endpoint or user
--   attributes, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. Each of these attributes
--   temporarily stores a recommended item that's retrieved from the
--   recommender model and sent to an AWS Lambda function for additional
--   processing. Each attribute can be used as a message variable in a
--   message template.
--   
--   In the map, the key is the name of a custom attribute and the value is
--   a custom display name for that attribute. The display name appears in
--   the <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template editor on the Amazon
--   Pinpoint console. The following restrictions apply to these names:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>An attribute name must start with a letter or number and it can
--   contain up to 50 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Attribute names are case sensitive
--   and must be unique.</li>
--   <li>An attribute display name must start with a letter or number and
--   it can contain up to 25 characters. The characters can be letters,
--   numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This object is required if the configuration invokes an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to process recommendation
--   data. Otherwise, don't include this object in your request.
updateRecommenderConfiguration_attributes :: Lens' UpdateRecommenderConfiguration (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | A custom name of the configuration for the recommender model. The name
--   must start with a letter or number and it can contain up to 128
--   characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-).
updateRecommenderConfiguration_name :: Lens' UpdateRecommenderConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | A custom description of the configuration for the recommender model.
--   The description can contain up to 128 characters. The characters can
--   be letters, numbers, spaces, or the following symbols: _ ; () , ‐.
updateRecommenderConfiguration_description :: Lens' UpdateRecommenderConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of recommended items to retrieve from the model for each
--   endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This number determines how many
--   recommended items are available for use in message variables. The
--   minimum value is 1. The maximum value is 5. The default value is 5.
--   
--   To use multiple recommended items and custom attributes with message
--   variables, you have to use an AWS Lambda function
--   (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data.
updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationsPerMessage :: Lens' UpdateRecommenderConfiguration (Maybe Int)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender model to retrieve
--   recommendation data from. This value must match the ARN of an Amazon
--   Personalize campaign.
updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationProviderUri :: Lens' UpdateRecommenderConfiguration Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to retrieve
--   recommendation data from the recommender model.
updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationProviderRoleArn :: Lens' UpdateRecommenderConfiguration Text

-- | Specifies the status and settings of the voice channel for an
--   application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVoiceChannelRequest</a> smart constructor.
data VoiceChannelRequest
VoiceChannelRequest' :: Maybe Bool -> VoiceChannelRequest

-- | Specifies whether to enable the voice channel for the application.
[$sel:enabled:VoiceChannelRequest'] :: VoiceChannelRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>VoiceChannelRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   voice channel for the application.

voiceChannelRequest_enabled :: Lens' VoiceChannelRequest (Maybe Bool)

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of the voice
--   channel for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVoiceChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data VoiceChannelResponse
VoiceChannelResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> VoiceChannelResponse

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the voice channel was last
--   modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:VoiceChannelResponse'] :: VoiceChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the voice channel is enabled for the application.
[$sel:enabled:VoiceChannelResponse'] :: VoiceChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether the voice channel is archived.
[$sel:isArchived:VoiceChannelResponse'] :: VoiceChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The unique identifier for the application that the voice channel
--   applies to.
[$sel:applicationId:VoiceChannelResponse'] :: VoiceChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The current version of the voice channel.
[$sel:version:VoiceChannelResponse'] :: VoiceChannelResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | (Deprecated) An identifier for the voice channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:id:VoiceChannelResponse'] :: VoiceChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the voice channel was
--   enabled.
[$sel:creationDate:VoiceChannelResponse'] :: VoiceChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The user who last modified the voice channel.
[$sel:lastModifiedBy:VoiceChannelResponse'] :: VoiceChannelResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.
[$sel:hasCredential:VoiceChannelResponse'] :: VoiceChannelResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For
--   the voice channel, this value is VOICE.
[$sel:platform:VoiceChannelResponse'] :: VoiceChannelResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>VoiceChannelResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   8601 format, when the voice channel was enabled.

--   modified the voice channel.

--   is retained only for backward compatibility.
