-- | Specifies the settings for a one-time voice message that's sent
--   directly to an endpoint through the voice channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVoiceMessage</a> smart constructor.
data VoiceMessage
VoiceMessage' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> VoiceMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the voice message. You can
--   override the default variables with individual address variables.
[$sel:substitutions:VoiceMessage'] :: VoiceMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | The code for the language to use when synthesizing the text of the
--   message script. For a list of supported languages and the code for
--   each one, see the <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:languageCode:VoiceMessage'] :: VoiceMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The long code to send the voice message from. This value should be one
--   of the dedicated long codes that's assigned to your AWS account.
--   Although it isn't required, we recommend that you specify the long
--   code in E.164 format, for example +12065550100, to ensure prompt and
--   accurate delivery of the message.
[$sel:originationNumber:VoiceMessage'] :: VoiceMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The text of the script to use for the voice message.
[$sel:body:VoiceMessage'] :: VoiceMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the voice to use when delivering the message. For a list
--   of supported voices, see the <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:voiceId:VoiceMessage'] :: VoiceMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>VoiceMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:VoiceMessage'</a>,
--   <a>voiceMessage_substitutions</a> - The default message variables to
--   use in the voice message. You can override the default variables with
--   individual address variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:VoiceMessage'</a>,
--   <a>voiceMessage_languageCode</a> - The code for the language to use
--   when synthesizing the text of the message script. For a list of
--   supported languages and the code for each one, see the <a>Amazon Polly
--   Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:originationNumber:VoiceMessage'</a>,
--   <a>voiceMessage_originationNumber</a> - The long code to send the
--   voice message from. This value should be one of the dedicated long
--   codes that's assigned to your AWS account. Although it isn't required,
--   we recommend that you specify the long code in E.164 format, for
--   example +12065550100, to ensure prompt and accurate delivery of the
--   message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:VoiceMessage'</a>, <a>voiceMessage_body</a> - The text of
--   the script to use for the voice message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:voiceId:VoiceMessage'</a>, <a>voiceMessage_voiceId</a> - The
--   name of the voice to use when delivering the message. For a list of
--   supported voices, see the <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
newVoiceMessage :: VoiceMessage

-- | The default message variables to use in the voice message. You can
--   override the default variables with individual address variables.
voiceMessage_substitutions :: Lens' VoiceMessage (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | The code for the language to use when synthesizing the text of the
--   message script. For a list of supported languages and the code for
--   each one, see the <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
voiceMessage_languageCode :: Lens' VoiceMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The long code to send the voice message from. This value should be one
--   of the dedicated long codes that's assigned to your AWS account.
--   Although it isn't required, we recommend that you specify the long
--   code in E.164 format, for example +12065550100, to ensure prompt and
--   accurate delivery of the message.
voiceMessage_originationNumber :: Lens' VoiceMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The text of the script to use for the voice message.
voiceMessage_body :: Lens' VoiceMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the voice to use when delivering the message. For a list
--   of supported voices, see the <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
voiceMessage_voiceId :: Lens' VoiceMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the content and settings for a message template that can be
--   used in messages that are sent through the voice channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVoiceTemplateRequest</a> smart constructor.
data VoiceTemplateRequest
VoiceTemplateRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> VoiceTemplateRequest

-- | The code for the language to use when synthesizing the text of the
--   script in messages that are based on the message template. For a list
--   of supported languages and the code for each one, see the <a>Amazon
--   Polly Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:languageCode:VoiceTemplateRequest'] :: VoiceTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The text of the script to use in messages that are based on the
--   message template, in plain text format.
[$sel:body:VoiceTemplateRequest'] :: VoiceTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A custom description of the message template.
[$sel:templateDescription:VoiceTemplateRequest'] :: VoiceTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A JSON object that specifies the default values to use for message
--   variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value
--   pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The
--   corresponding value defines the default value for that variable. When
--   you create a message that's based on the template, you can override
--   these defaults with message-specific and address-specific variables
--   and values.
[$sel:defaultSubstitutions:VoiceTemplateRequest'] :: VoiceTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the voice to use when delivering messages that are based
--   on the message template. For a list of supported voices, see the
--   <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:voiceId:VoiceTemplateRequest'] :: VoiceTemplateRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:VoiceTemplateRequest'] :: VoiceTemplateRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>VoiceTemplateRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:VoiceTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateRequest_languageCode</a> - The code for the language
--   to use when synthesizing the text of the script in messages that are
--   based on the message template. For a list of supported languages and
--   the code for each one, see the <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:VoiceTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateRequest_body</a> - The text of the script to use in
--   messages that are based on the message template, in plain text format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:VoiceTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateRequest_templateDescription</a> - A custom description
--   of the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubstitutions:VoiceTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateRequest_defaultSubstitutions</a> - A JSON object that
--   specifies the default values to use for message variables in the
--   message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key
--   defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding value
--   defines the default value for that variable. When you create a message
--   that's based on the template, you can override these defaults with
--   message-specific and address-specific variables and values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:voiceId:VoiceTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateRequest_voiceId</a> - The name of the voice to use
--   when delivering messages that are based on the message template. For a
--   list of supported voices, see the <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:VoiceTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateRequest_tags</a> - A string-to-string map of key-value
--   pairs that defines the tags to associate with the message template.
--   Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.
newVoiceTemplateRequest :: VoiceTemplateRequest

-- | The code for the language to use when synthesizing the text of the
--   script in messages that are based on the message template. For a list
--   of supported languages and the code for each one, see the <a>Amazon
--   Polly Developer Guide</a>.
voiceTemplateRequest_languageCode :: Lens' VoiceTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The text of the script to use in messages that are based on the
--   message template, in plain text format.
voiceTemplateRequest_body :: Lens' VoiceTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A custom description of the message template.
voiceTemplateRequest_templateDescription :: Lens' VoiceTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A JSON object that specifies the default values to use for message
--   variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value
--   pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The
--   corresponding value defines the default value for that variable. When
--   you create a message that's based on the template, you can override
--   these defaults with message-specific and address-specific variables
--   and values.
voiceTemplateRequest_defaultSubstitutions :: Lens' VoiceTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the voice to use when delivering messages that are based
--   on the message template. For a list of supported voices, see the
--   <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
voiceTemplateRequest_voiceId :: Lens' VoiceTemplateRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
voiceTemplateRequest_tags :: Lens' VoiceTemplateRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | Provides information about the content and settings for a message
--   template that can be used in messages that are sent through the voice
--   channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVoiceTemplateResponse</a> smart constructor.
data VoiceTemplateResponse
VoiceTemplateResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> VoiceTemplateResponse

-- | The code for the language that's used when synthesizing the text of
--   the script in messages that are based on the message template. For a
--   list of supported languages and the code for each one, see the
--   <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:languageCode:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the message template.
[$sel:arn:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The text of the script that's used in messages that are based on the
--   message template, in plain text format.
[$sel:body:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The custom description of the message template.
[$sel:templateDescription:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for
--   message variables in the message template. This object is a set of
--   key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template.
--   The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable.
[$sel:defaultSubstitutions:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the
--   message template, or the version of the template that you specified by
--   using the version parameter in your request.
[$sel:version:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the voice that's used when delivering messages that are
--   based on the message template. For a list of supported voices, see the
--   <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:voiceId:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags
--   that are associated with the message template. Each tag consists of a
--   required tag key and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was last
--   modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was created.
[$sel:creationDate:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The name of the message template.
[$sel:templateName:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | The type of channel that the message template is designed for. For a
--   voice template, this value is VOICE.
[$sel:templateType:VoiceTemplateResponse'] :: VoiceTemplateResponse -> TemplateType

-- | Create a value of <a>VoiceTemplateResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   that's used when synthesizing the text of the script in messages that
--   are based on the message template. For a list of supported languages
--   and the code for each one, see the <a>Amazon Polly Developer
--   Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_body</a> - The text of the script that's used
--   in messages that are based on the message template, in plain text
--   format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_templateDescription</a> - The custom
--   description of the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubstitutions:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_defaultSubstitutions</a> - The JSON object
--   that specifies the default values that are used for message variables
--   in the message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each
--   key defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding
--   value defines the default value for that variable.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_version</a> - The unique identifier, as an
--   integer, for the active version of the message template, or the
--   version of the template that you specified by using the version
--   parameter in your request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:voiceId:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_voiceId</a> - The name of the voice that's
--   used when delivering messages that are based on the message template.
--   For a list of supported voices, see the <a>Amazon Polly Developer
--   Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_tags</a> - A string-to-string map of
--   key-value pairs that identifies the tags that are associated with the
--   message template. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an
--   associated tag value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the message template was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the message template was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_templateName</a> - The name of the message
--   template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateType:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_templateType</a> - The type of channel that
--   the message template is designed for. For a voice template, this value
--   is VOICE.
newVoiceTemplateResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> VoiceTemplateResponse

-- | The code for the language that's used when synthesizing the text of
--   the script in messages that are based on the message template. For a
--   list of supported languages and the code for each one, see the
--   <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
voiceTemplateResponse_languageCode :: Lens' VoiceTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

voiceTemplateResponse_arn :: Lens' VoiceTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The text of the script that's used in messages that are based on the
--   message template, in plain text format.
voiceTemplateResponse_body :: Lens' VoiceTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The custom description of the message template.
voiceTemplateResponse_templateDescription :: Lens' VoiceTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for
--   message variables in the message template. This object is a set of
--   key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template.
--   The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable.
voiceTemplateResponse_defaultSubstitutions :: Lens' VoiceTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the
--   message template, or the version of the template that you specified by
--   using the version parameter in your request.
voiceTemplateResponse_version :: Lens' VoiceTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

--   based on the message template. For a list of supported voices, see the
--   <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
voiceTemplateResponse_voiceId :: Lens' VoiceTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

--   that are associated with the message template. Each tag consists of a
--   required tag key and an associated tag value.
voiceTemplateResponse_tags :: Lens' VoiceTemplateResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

--   modified.

voiceTemplateResponse_creationDate :: Lens' VoiceTemplateResponse Text

voiceTemplateResponse_templateName :: Lens' VoiceTemplateResponse Text

-- | The type of channel that the message template is designed for. For a
--   voice template, this value is VOICE.
voiceTemplateResponse_templateType :: Lens' VoiceTemplateResponse TemplateType

-- | Specifies the settings for a wait activity in a journey. This type of
--   activity waits for a certain amount of time or until a specific date
--   and time before moving participants to the next activity in a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWaitActivity</a> smart constructor.
data WaitActivity
WaitActivity' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe WaitTime -> WaitActivity

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after
--   performing the wait activity.
[$sel:nextActivity:WaitActivity'] :: WaitActivity -> Maybe Text

-- | The amount of time to wait or the date and time when the activity
--   moves participants to the next activity in the journey.
[$sel:waitTime:WaitActivity'] :: WaitActivity -> Maybe WaitTime

-- | Create a value of <a>WaitActivity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextActivity:WaitActivity'</a>,
--   <a>waitActivity_nextActivity</a> - The unique identifier for the next
--   activity to perform, after performing the wait activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:waitTime:WaitActivity'</a>, <a>waitActivity_waitTime</a> - The
--   amount of time to wait or the date and time when the activity moves
--   participants to the next activity in the journey.
newWaitActivity :: WaitActivity

-- | The unique identifier for the next activity to perform, after
--   performing the wait activity.
waitActivity_nextActivity :: Lens' WaitActivity (Maybe Text)

-- | The amount of time to wait or the date and time when the activity
--   moves participants to the next activity in the journey.
waitActivity_waitTime :: Lens' WaitActivity (Maybe WaitTime)

-- | Specifies a duration or a date and time that indicates when Amazon
--   Pinpoint determines whether an activity's conditions have been met or
--   an activity moves participants to the next activity in a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWaitTime</a> smart constructor.
data WaitTime
WaitTime' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> WaitTime

-- | The amount of time to wait, as a duration in ISO 8601 format, before
--   determining whether the activity's conditions have been met or moving
--   participants to the next activity in the journey.
[$sel:waitFor:WaitTime'] :: WaitTime -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when Amazon Pinpoint determines
--   whether the activity's conditions have been met or the activity moves
--   participants to the next activity in the journey.
[$sel:waitUntil:WaitTime'] :: WaitTime -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>WaitTime</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--

--   time to wait, as a duration in ISO 8601 format, before determining
--   whether the activity's conditions have been met or moving participants
--   to the next activity in the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:waitUntil:WaitTime'</a>, <a>waitTime_waitUntil</a> - The date
--   and time, in ISO 8601 format, when Amazon Pinpoint determines whether
--   the activity's conditions have been met or the activity moves
--   participants to the next activity in the journey.
newWaitTime :: WaitTime

--   determining whether the activity's conditions have been met or moving
--   participants to the next activity in the journey.
waitTime_waitFor :: Lens' WaitTime (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when Amazon Pinpoint determines
--   whether the activity's conditions have been met or the activity moves
--   participants to the next activity in the journey.
waitTime_waitUntil :: Lens' WaitTime (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the default settings for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWriteApplicationSettingsRequest</a> smart
--   constructor.
data WriteApplicationSettingsRequest
WriteApplicationSettingsRequest' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe CampaignLimits -> Maybe QuietTime -> Maybe CampaignHook -> WriteApplicationSettingsRequest
[$sel:eventTaggingEnabled:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'] :: WriteApplicationSettingsRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether to enable application-related alarms in Amazon
--   CloudWatch.
[$sel:cloudWatchMetricsEnabled:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'] :: WriteApplicationSettingsRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | The default sending limits for campaigns in the application. To
--   override these limits and define custom limits for a specific campaign
--   or journey, use the Campaign resource or the Journey resource,
--   respectively.
[$sel:limits:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'] :: WriteApplicationSettingsRequest -> Maybe CampaignLimits

-- | The default quiet time for campaigns in the application. Quiet time is
--   a specific time range when messages aren't sent to endpoints, if all
--   the following conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set
--   to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the endpoint will
--   receive messages from a campaign or journey, even if quiet time is
--   enabled.
--   
--   To override the default quiet time settings for a specific campaign or
--   journey, use the Campaign resource or the Journey resource to define a
--   custom quiet time for the campaign or journey.
[$sel:quietTime:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'] :: WriteApplicationSettingsRequest -> Maybe QuietTime

-- | The settings for the AWS Lambda function to invoke by default as a
--   code hook for campaigns in the application. You can use this hook to
--   customize segments that are used by campaigns in the application.
--   
--   To override these settings and define custom settings for a specific
--   campaign, use the CampaignHook object of the Campaign resource.
[$sel:campaignHook:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'] :: WriteApplicationSettingsRequest -> Maybe CampaignHook

-- | Create a value of <a>WriteApplicationSettingsRequest</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTaggingEnabled:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeApplicationSettingsRequest_eventTaggingEnabled</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchMetricsEnabled:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeApplicationSettingsRequest_cloudWatchMetricsEnabled</a> -
--   Specifies whether to enable application-related alarms in Amazon
--   CloudWatch.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limits:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeApplicationSettingsRequest_limits</a> - The default sending
--   limits for campaigns in the application. To override these limits and
--   define custom limits for a specific campaign or journey, use the
--   Campaign resource or the Journey resource, respectively.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quietTime:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeApplicationSettingsRequest_quietTime</a> - The default quiet
--   time for campaigns in the application. Quiet time is a specific time
--   range when messages aren't sent to endpoints, if all the following
--   conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set
--   to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the endpoint will
--   receive messages from a campaign or journey, even if quiet time is
--   enabled.
--   
--   To override the default quiet time settings for a specific campaign or
--   journey, use the Campaign resource or the Journey resource to define a
--   custom quiet time for the campaign or journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:campaignHook:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeApplicationSettingsRequest_campaignHook</a> - The settings for
--   the AWS Lambda function to invoke by default as a code hook for
--   campaigns in the application. You can use this hook to customize
--   segments that are used by campaigns in the application.
--   
--   To override these settings and define custom settings for a specific
--   campaign, use the CampaignHook object of the Campaign resource.
newWriteApplicationSettingsRequest :: WriteApplicationSettingsRequest

--   CloudWatch.

--   override these limits and define custom limits for a specific campaign
--   or journey, use the Campaign resource or the Journey resource,
--   respectively.

--   the following conditions are met:
--

-- | Specifies the configuration and other settings for a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWriteCampaignRequest</a> smart constructor.
data WriteCampaignRequest
WriteCampaignRequest' :: Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Schedule -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration -> Maybe CampaignHook -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CampaignLimits -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MessageConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [WriteTreatmentResource] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Int -> WriteCampaignRequest

-- | The delivery configuration settings for sending the campaign through a
--   custom channel. This object is required if the MessageConfiguration
--   object for the campaign specifies a CustomMessage object.
[$sel:customDeliveryConfiguration:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration

-- | Defines the priority of the campaign, used to decide the order of
--   messages displayed to user if there are multiple messages scheduled to
--   be displayed at the same moment.
[$sel:priority:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe Int

-- | The schedule settings for the campaign.
[$sel:schedule:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe Schedule

-- | The message template to use for the campaign.
[$sel:templateConfiguration:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration

-- | The settings for the AWS Lambda function to invoke as a code hook for
--   the campaign. You can use this hook to customize the segment that's
--   used by the campaign.
[$sel:hook:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe CampaignHook

-- | A custom name of the default treatment for the campaign, if the
--   campaign has multiple treatments. A <i>treatment</i> is a variation of
--   a campaign that's used for A/B testing.
[$sel:treatmentName:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The messaging limits for the campaign.
[$sel:limits:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe CampaignLimits

-- | Specifies whether to pause the campaign. A paused campaign doesn't run
--   unless you resume it by changing this value to false.
[$sel:isPaused:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | A custom name for the campaign.
[$sel:name:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The allocated percentage of users (segment members) who shouldn't
--   receive messages from the campaign.
[$sel:holdoutPercent:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe Int

-- | A custom description of the default treatment for the campaign.
[$sel:treatmentDescription:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The message configuration settings for the campaign.
[$sel:messageConfiguration:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe MessageConfiguration

-- | A custom description of the campaign.
[$sel:description:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the segment to associate with the campaign.
[$sel:segmentId:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of requests that defines additional treatments for the
--   campaign, in addition to the default treatment for the campaign.
[$sel:additionalTreatments:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe [WriteTreatmentResource]

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the campaign. Each tag consists of a required tag key
--   and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The version of the segment to associate with the campaign.
[$sel:segmentVersion:WriteCampaignRequest'] :: WriteCampaignRequest -> Maybe Int

--   omitted.

-- | Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an event stream to publish
--   events to and the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role to use
--   when publishing those events.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWriteEventStream</a> smart constructor.
data WriteEventStream
WriteEventStream' :: Text -> Text -> WriteEventStream

-- | The AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorizes
--   Amazon Pinpoint to publish event data to the stream in your AWS
--   account.
[$sel:roleArn:WriteEventStream'] :: WriteEventStream -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis data stream or
--   Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream that you want to publish
--   event data to.
--   
--   For a Kinesis data stream, the ARN format is:
--   arn:aws:kinesis:region:account-id:stream/stream_name
--   
--   For a Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream, the ARN format is:
--   arn:aws:firehose:region:account-id:deliverystream/stream_name
[$sel:destinationStreamArn:WriteEventStream'] :: WriteEventStream -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>WriteEventStream</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:WriteEventStream'</a>, <a>writeEventStream_roleArn</a>
--   - The AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorizes
--   Amazon Pinpoint to publish event data to the stream in your AWS
--   account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationStreamArn:WriteEventStream'</a>,
--   <a>writeEventStream_destinationStreamArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis data stream or Amazon Kinesis Data
--   Firehose delivery stream that you want to publish event data to.
--   
--   For a Kinesis data stream, the ARN format is:
--   arn:aws:kinesis:region:account-id:stream/stream_name
--   
--   For a Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream, the ARN format is:
--   arn:aws:firehose:region:account-id:deliverystream/stream_name
newWriteEventStream :: Text -> Text -> WriteEventStream

-- | The AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorizes
--   Amazon Pinpoint to publish event data to the stream in your AWS
--   account.
writeEventStream_roleArn :: Lens' WriteEventStream Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis data stream or
--   Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream that you want to publish
--   event data to.
--   
--   For a Kinesis data stream, the ARN format is:
--   arn:aws:kinesis:region:account-id:stream/stream_name
--   
--   For a Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream, the ARN format is:
--   arn:aws:firehose:region:account-id:deliverystream/stream_name
writeEventStream_destinationStreamArn :: Lens' WriteEventStream Text

-- | Specifies the configuration and other settings for a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWriteJourneyRequest</a> smart constructor.
data WriteJourneyRequest
WriteJourneyRequest' :: Maybe State -> Maybe Text -> Maybe JourneySchedule -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe (HashMap Text Activity) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe JourneyLimits -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe QuietTime -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StartCondition -> Maybe Text -> Text -> WriteJourneyRequest

-- | The status of the journey. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DRAFT - Saves the journey and doesn't publish it.</li>
--   <li>ACTIVE - Saves and publishes the journey. Depending on the
--   journey's schedule, the journey starts running immediately or at the
--   scheduled start time. If a journey's status is ACTIVE, you can't add,
--   change, or remove activities from it.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   PAUSED, CANCELLED, COMPLETED, and CLOSED states are not supported in
--   requests to create or update a journey. To cancel, pause, or resume a
--   journey, use the Journey State resource.
[$sel:state:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe State

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The schedule settings for the journey.
[$sel:schedule:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe JourneySchedule

-- | Specifies whether the journey's scheduled start and end times use each
--   participant's local time. To base the schedule on each participant's
--   local time, set this value to true.
[$sel:localTime:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | A map that contains a set of Activity objects, one object for each
--   activity in the journey. For each Activity object, the key is the
--   unique identifier (string) for an activity and the value is the
--   settings for the activity. An activity identifier can contain a
--   maximum of 100 characters. The characters must be alphanumeric
--   characters.
[$sel:activities:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Activity)

-- | Specifies whether a journey should be refreshed on segment update.
[$sel:refreshOnSegmentUpdate:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | The messaging and entry limits for the journey.
[$sel:limits:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe JourneyLimits

-- | Specifies whether endpoints in quiet hours should enter a wait till
--   the end of their quiet hours.
[$sel:waitForQuietTime:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe Bool

-- | The quiet time settings for the journey. Quiet time is a specific time
--   range when a journey doesn't send messages to participants, if all the
--   following conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint for the
--   participant is set to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the participant's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   journey.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the participant's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   journey.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the participant will
--   receive messages from the journey, even if quiet time is enabled.
[$sel:quietTime:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe QuietTime

-- | The unique identifier for the first activity in the journey. The
--   identifier for this activity can contain a maximum of 128 characters.
--   The characters must be alphanumeric characters.
[$sel:startActivity:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey was created.
[$sel:creationDate:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The segment that defines which users are participants in the journey.
[$sel:startCondition:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe StartCondition

-- | The frequency with which Amazon Pinpoint evaluates segment and event
--   data for the journey, as a duration in ISO 8601 format.
[$sel:refreshFrequency:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the journey. A journey name can contain a maximum of 150
--   characters. The characters can be alphanumeric characters or symbols,
--   such as underscores (_) or hyphens (-). A journey name can't contain
--   any spaces.
[$sel:name:WriteJourneyRequest'] :: WriteJourneyRequest -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>WriteJourneyRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_state</a> - The status of the journey. Valid
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DRAFT - Saves the journey and doesn't publish it.</li>
--   <li>ACTIVE - Saves and publishes the journey. Depending on the
--   journey's schedule, the journey starts running immediately or at the
--   scheduled start time. If a journey's status is ACTIVE, you can't add,
--   change, or remove activities from it.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   PAUSED, CANCELLED, COMPLETED, and CLOSED states are not supported in
--   requests to create or update a journey. To cancel, pause, or resume a
--   journey, use the Journey State resource.
--

--   characters. The characters can be alphanumeric characters or symbols,

--   any spaces.
newWriteJourneyRequest :: Text -> WriteJourneyRequest

-- | Specifies the configuration, dimension, and other settings for a
--   segment. A WriteSegmentRequest object can include a Dimensions object
--   or a SegmentGroups object, but not both.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWriteSegmentRequest</a> smart constructor.
data WriteSegmentRequest
WriteSegmentRequest' :: Maybe SegmentGroupList -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SegmentDimensions -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> WriteSegmentRequest

-- | The segment group to use and the dimensions to apply to the group's
--   base segments in order to build the segment. A segment group can
--   consist of zero or more base segments. Your request can include only
--   one segment group.
[$sel:segmentGroups:WriteSegmentRequest'] :: WriteSegmentRequest -> Maybe SegmentGroupList

-- | The name of the segment.
[$sel:name:WriteSegmentRequest'] :: WriteSegmentRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The criteria that define the dimensions for the segment.
[$sel:dimensions:WriteSegmentRequest'] :: WriteSegmentRequest -> Maybe SegmentDimensions

-- | A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the segment. Each tag consists of a required tag key
--   and an associated tag value.
[$sel:tags:WriteSegmentRequest'] :: WriteSegmentRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>WriteSegmentRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   segments. Your request can include only one segment group.

-- | Specifies the settings for a campaign treatment. A <i>treatment</i> is
--   a variation of a campaign that's used for A/B testing of a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWriteTreatmentResource</a> smart constructor.
data WriteTreatmentResource
WriteTreatmentResource' :: Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration -> Maybe Schedule -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MessageConfiguration -> Int -> WriteTreatmentResource

-- | The delivery configuration settings for sending the treatment through
--   a custom channel. This object is required if the MessageConfiguration
--   object for the treatment specifies a CustomMessage object.
[$sel:customDeliveryConfiguration:WriteTreatmentResource'] :: WriteTreatmentResource -> Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration

-- | The schedule settings for the treatment.
[$sel:schedule:WriteTreatmentResource'] :: WriteTreatmentResource -> Maybe Schedule

-- | The message template to use for the treatment.
[$sel:templateConfiguration:WriteTreatmentResource'] :: WriteTreatmentResource -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration

-- | A custom name for the treatment.
[$sel:treatmentName:WriteTreatmentResource'] :: WriteTreatmentResource -> Maybe Text

-- | A custom description of the treatment.
[$sel:treatmentDescription:WriteTreatmentResource'] :: WriteTreatmentResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The message configuration settings for the treatment.
[$sel:messageConfiguration:WriteTreatmentResource'] :: WriteTreatmentResource -> Maybe MessageConfiguration

-- | The allocated percentage of users (segment members) to send the
--   treatment to.
[$sel:sizePercent:WriteTreatmentResource'] :: WriteTreatmentResource -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>WriteTreatmentResource</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--

-- | Creates and sends a message to a list of users.
module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.SendUsersMessages

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSendUsersMessages</a> smart constructor.
data SendUsersMessages
SendUsersMessages' :: Text -> SendUsersMessageRequest -> SendUsersMessages

--   displayed as the <b>Project ID</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
[$sel:applicationId:SendUsersMessages'] :: SendUsersMessages -> Text

--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   application. This identifier is displayed as the <b>Project ID</b> on
--   the Amazon Pinpoint console.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendUsersMessageRequest:SendUsersMessages'</a>,
--   <a>sendUsersMessages_sendUsersMessageRequest</a> - Undocumented
--   member.

-- | Removes one or more attributes, of the same attribute type, from all
--   the endpoints that are associated with an application.
module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.RemoveAttributes

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newRemoveAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data RemoveAttributes
RemoveAttributes' :: Text -> Text -> UpdateAttributesRequest -> RemoveAttributes

-- | The type of attribute or attributes to remove. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>endpoint-custom-attributes - Custom attributes that describe
--   endpoints, such as the date when an associated user opted in or out of
--   receiving communications from you through a specific type of
--   channel.</li>
--   <li>endpoint-metric-attributes - Custom metrics that your app reports
--   to Amazon Pinpoint for endpoints, such as the number of app sessions
--   or the number of items left in a cart.</li>
--   <li>endpoint-user-attributes - Custom attributes that describe users,
--   such as first name, last name, and age.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:attributeType:RemoveAttributes'] :: RemoveAttributes -> Text

--   displayed as the <b>Project ID</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.

-- | Retrieves information about all the message templates that are
--   associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account.
module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.ListTemplates

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListTemplates</a> smart constructor.
data ListTemplates
ListTemplates' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ListTemplates

-- | The type of message template to include in the results. Valid values
--   are: EMAIL, PUSH, SMS, and VOICE. To include all types of templates in
--   the results, don't include this parameter in your request.
[$sel:templateType:ListTemplates'] :: ListTemplates -> Maybe Text

-- | The substring to match in the names of the message templates to
--   include in the results. If you specify this value, Amazon Pinpoint
--   returns only those templates whose names begin with the value that you
--   specify.
[$sel:prefix:ListTemplates'] :: ListTemplates -> Maybe Text

-- | The string that specifies which page of results to return in a
--   paginated response. This parameter is not supported for application,
--   campaign, and journey metrics.
[$sel:nextToken:ListTemplates'] :: ListTemplates -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of items to include in each page of a paginated
--   response. This parameter is not supported for application, campaign,
--   and journey metrics.
[$sel:pageSize:ListTemplates'] :: ListTemplates -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListTemplates</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateType:ListTemplates'</a>,
--   <a>listTemplates_templateType</a> - The type of message template to
--   include in the results. Valid values are: EMAIL, PUSH, SMS, and VOICE.
--   To include all types of templates in the results, don't include this
--   parameter in your request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:ListTemplates'</a>, <a>listTemplates_prefix</a> - The
--   substring to match in the names of the message templates to include in
--   the results. If you specify this value, Amazon Pinpoint returns only
--   those templates whose names begin with the value that you specify.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListTemplates'</a>, <a>listTemplates_nextToken</a> -
--   The string that specifies which page of results to return in a
--   paginated response. This parameter is not supported for application,
--   campaign, and journey metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageSize:ListTemplates'</a>, <a>listTemplates_pageSize</a> -
--   The maximum number of items to include in each page of a paginated
--   response. This parameter is not supported for application, campaign,
--   and journey metrics.
newListTemplates :: ListTemplates

-- | The type of message template to include in the results. Valid values
--   are: EMAIL, PUSH, SMS, and VOICE. To include all types of templates in
--   the results, don't include this parameter in your request.
listTemplates_templateType :: Lens' ListTemplates (Maybe Text)

-- | The substring to match in the names of the message templates to
--   include in the results. If you specify this value, Amazon Pinpoint
--   returns only those templates whose names begin with the value that you
--   specify.
listTemplates_prefix :: Lens' ListTemplates (Maybe Text)

-- | The string that specifies which page of results to return in a
--   paginated response. This parameter is not supported for application,
--   campaign, and journey metrics.
listTemplates_nextToken :: Lens' ListTemplates (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of items to include in each page of a paginated
--   response. This parameter is not supported for application, campaign,
--   and journey metrics.
listTemplates_pageSize :: Lens' ListTemplates (Maybe Text)

-- | Retrieves the content and settings of a message template for messages
--   that are sent through the voice channel.
module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.GetVoiceTemplate

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetVoiceTemplate</a> smart constructor.
data GetVoiceTemplate
GetVoiceTemplate' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> GetVoiceTemplate

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the message template to
--   update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers
--   and other information for all the versions of a template, use the
--   Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing
--   template version. If specified for an update operation, this value
--   must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the
--   template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don't
--   occur.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint does
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For a get operation, retrieves information about the active
--   version of the template.</li>
--   <li>For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the
--   latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version
--   parameter isn't used or is set to false.</li>
--   <li>For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all
--   versions of the template.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:version:GetVoiceTemplate'] :: GetVoiceTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the message template. A template name must start with an
--   alphanumeric character and can contain a maximum of 128 characters.
--   The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or
--   hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.
[$sel:templateName:GetVoiceTemplate'] :: GetVoiceTemplate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetVoiceTemplate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

-- | Retrieves the content and settings of a message template for messages
--   that are sent through the SMS channel.
module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.GetSmsTemplate

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetSmsTemplate</a> smart constructor.
data GetSmsTemplate
GetSmsTemplate' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> GetSmsTemplate

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the message template to
--   update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers
--   and other information for all the versions of a template, use the
--   Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing
--   template version. If specified for an update operation, this value
--   must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the
--   template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don't
--   occur.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint does
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For a get operation, retrieves information about the active
--   version of the template.</li>
--   <li>For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the
--   latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version
--   parameter isn't used or is set to false.</li>
--   <li>For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all
--   versions of the template.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:version:GetSmsTemplate'] :: GetSmsTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the message template. A template name must start with an
--   alphanumeric character and can contain a maximum of 128 characters.
--   The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or
--   hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.
[$sel:templateName:GetSmsTemplate'] :: GetSmsTemplate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetSmsTemplate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers

--   template version. If specified for an update operation, this value

-- | Retrieves the content and settings of a message template for messages
--   that are sent through a push notification channel.
module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.GetPushTemplate

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetPushTemplate</a> smart constructor.
data GetPushTemplate
GetPushTemplate' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> GetPushTemplate

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the message template to
--   update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers
--   and other information for all the versions of a template, use the
--   Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing
--   template version. If specified for an update operation, this value
--   must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the
--   template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don't
--   occur.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint does
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For a get operation, retrieves information about the active
--   version of the template.</li>
--   <li>For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the
--   latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version
--   parameter isn't used or is set to false.</li>
--   <li>For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all
--   versions of the template.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:version:GetPushTemplate'] :: GetPushTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the message template. A template name must start with an
--   alphanumeric character and can contain a maximum of 128 characters.
--   The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or
--   hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.
[$sel:templateName:GetPushTemplate'] :: GetPushTemplate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetPushTemplate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:GetPushTemplate'</a>, <a>getPushTemplate_version</a> -
--   The unique identifier for the version of the message template to
--   update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers
--   and other information for all the versions of a template, use the
--   Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing
--   template version. If specified for an update operation, this value
--   must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the
--   template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don't
--   occur.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint does
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For a get operation, retrieves information about the active
--   version of the template.</li>
--   <li>For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the
--   latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version
--   parameter isn't used or is set to false.</li>
--   <li>For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all
--   versions of the template.</li>
--   </ul>

--   <a>$sel:templateName:GetPushTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>getPushTemplate_templateName</a> - The name of the message
--   template. A template name must start with an alphanumeric character
--   and can contain a maximum of 128 characters. The characters can be
--   alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Template
--   names are case sensitive.
newGetPushTemplate :: Text -> GetPushTemplate

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the message template to
--   update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers
--   and other information for all the versions of a template, use the
--   Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing
--   template version. If specified for an update operation, this value
--   must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the
--   template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don't
--   occur.

--   the following:
--

--   <li>For a get operation, retrieves information about the active
--   version of the template.</li>
--   <li>For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the
--   latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version
--   parameter isn't used or is set to false.</li>
--   <li>For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all
--   versions of the template.</li>
--   </ul>
getPushTemplate_version :: Lens' GetPushTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | Retrieves (queries) pre-aggregated data for a standard engagement
--   metric that applies to a journey.
module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.GetJourneyDateRangeKpi

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetJourneyDateRangeKpi</a> smart constructor.
data GetJourneyDateRangeKpi
GetJourneyDateRangeKpi' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> GetJourneyDateRangeKpi

-- | The first date and time to retrieve data for, as part of an inclusive
--   date range that filters the query results. This value should be in
--   extended ISO 8601 format and use Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), for
--   example: 2019-07-19T20:00:00Z for 8:00 PM UTC July 19, 2019. This
--   value should also be fewer than 90 days from the current day.
[$sel:startTime:GetJourneyDateRangeKpi'] :: GetJourneyDateRangeKpi -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The string that specifies which page of results to return in a

-- | Retrieves the content and settings of a message template for messages
--   sent through the in-app channel.
module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.GetInAppTemplate

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetInAppTemplate</a> smart constructor.
data GetInAppTemplate
GetInAppTemplate' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> GetInAppTemplate

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the message template to
--   update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers
--   and other information for all the versions of a template, use the
--   Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing
--   template version. If specified for an update operation, this value
--   must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the
--   template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don't
--   occur.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint does
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For a get operation, retrieves information about the active
--   version of the template.</li>
--   <li>For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the
--   latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version
--   parameter isn't used or is set to false.</li>
--   <li>For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all
--   versions of the template.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:version:GetInAppTemplate'] :: GetInAppTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the message template. A template name must start with an
--   alphanumeric character and can contain a maximum of 128 characters.
--   The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or
--   hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.
[$sel:templateName:GetInAppTemplate'] :: GetInAppTemplate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetInAppTemplate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

-- | Retrieves the content and settings of a message template for messages
--   that are sent through the email channel.
module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.GetEmailTemplate

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetEmailTemplate</a> smart constructor.
data GetEmailTemplate
GetEmailTemplate' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> GetEmailTemplate

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the message template to
--   update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers
--   and other information for all the versions of a template, use the
--   Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing
--   template version. If specified for an update operation, this value
--   must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the
--   template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don't
--   occur.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint does
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For a get operation, retrieves information about the active
--   version of the template.</li>
--   <li>For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the
--   latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version
--   parameter isn't used or is set to false.</li>
--   <li>For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all
--   versions of the template.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:version:GetEmailTemplate'] :: GetEmailTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the message template. A template name must start with an
--   alphanumeric character and can contain a maximum of 128 characters.
--   The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or
--   hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.
[$sel:templateName:GetEmailTemplate'] :: GetEmailTemplate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetEmailTemplate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   template version. If specified for an update operation, this value

--   applies to a campaign.

data GetCampaignDateRangeKpi
GetCampaignDateRangeKpi' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> GetCampaignDateRangeKpi

-- | The first date and time to retrieve data for, as part of an inclusive
--   date range that filters the query results. This value should be in
--   extended ISO 8601 format and use Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), for
--   example: 2019-07-19T20:00:00Z for 8:00 PM UTC July 19, 2019. This
--   value should also be fewer than 90 days from the current day.
[$sel:startTime:GetCampaignDateRangeKpi'] :: GetCampaignDateRangeKpi -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The string that specifies which page of results to return in a
--   paginated response. This parameter is not supported for application,
--   campaign, and journey metrics.
[$sel:nextToken:GetCampaignDateRangeKpi'] :: GetCampaignDateRangeKpi -> Maybe Text

-- | The last date and time to retrieve data for, as part of an inclusive
--   date range that filters the query results. This value should be in
--   extended ISO 8601 format and use Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), for
--   example: 2019-07-26T20:00:00Z for 8:00 PM UTC July 26, 2019.

--   response. This parameter is not supported for application, campaign,
--   and journey metrics.

-- | The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is
--   displayed as the <b>Project ID</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.

-- | The name of the metric, also referred to as a /key performance
--   indicator (KPI)/, to retrieve data for. This value describes the
--   associated metric and consists of two or more terms, which are
--   comprised of lowercase alphanumeric characters, separated by a hyphen.
--   Examples are email-open-rate and successful-delivery-rate. For a list
--   of valid values, see the <a>Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:kpiName:GetCampaignDateRangeKpi'] :: GetCampaignDateRangeKpi -> Text

--   applies to an application.
module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.GetApplicationDateRangeKpi

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetApplicationDateRangeKpi</a> smart constructor.
data GetApplicationDateRangeKpi
GetApplicationDateRangeKpi' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> GetApplicationDateRangeKpi

-- | The first date and time to retrieve data for, as part of an inclusive
--   date range that filters the query results. This value should be in
--   extended ISO 8601 format and use Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), for
--   example: 2019-07-19T20:00:00Z for 8:00 PM UTC July 19, 2019. This
--   value should also be fewer than 90 days from the current day.
[$sel:startTime:GetApplicationDateRangeKpi'] :: GetApplicationDateRangeKpi -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The string that specifies which page of results to return in a
--   paginated response. This parameter is not supported for application,
--   campaign, and journey metrics.
[$sel:nextToken:GetApplicationDateRangeKpi'] :: GetApplicationDateRangeKpi -> Maybe Text

-- | The last date and time to retrieve data for, as part of an inclusive
--   date range that filters the query results. This value should be in
--   extended ISO 8601 format and use Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), for
--   example: 2019-07-26T20:00:00Z for 8:00 PM UTC July 26, 2019.
[$sel:endTime:GetApplicationDateRangeKpi'] :: GetApplicationDateRangeKpi -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The maximum number of items to include in each page of a paginated
--   response. This parameter is not supported for application, campaign,
--   and journey metrics.
[$sel:pageSize:GetApplicationDateRangeKpi'] :: GetApplicationDateRangeKpi -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is
--   displayed as the <b>Project ID</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
[$sel:applicationId:GetApplicationDateRangeKpi'] :: GetApplicationDateRangeKpi -> Text

-- | The name of the metric, also referred to as a /key performance
--   indicator (KPI)/, to retrieve data for. This value describes the
--   associated metric and consists of two or more terms, which are
--   comprised of lowercase alphanumeric characters, separated by a hyphen.
--   Examples are email-open-rate and successful-delivery-rate. For a list
--   of valid values, see the <a>Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:kpiName:GetApplicationDateRangeKpi'] :: GetApplicationDateRangeKpi -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetApplicationDateRangeKpi</a> with all optional

--   to retrieve data for, as part of an inclusive date range that filters
--   the query results. This value should be in extended ISO 8601 format
--   and use Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), for example:
--   2019-07-19T20:00:00Z for 8:00 PM UTC July 19, 2019. This value should

-- | Deletes a message template for messages that were sent through the
--   voice channel.
module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.DeleteVoiceTemplate

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteVoiceTemplate</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteVoiceTemplate
DeleteVoiceTemplate' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> DeleteVoiceTemplate

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the message template to
--   update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers
--   and other information for all the versions of a template, use the
--   Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing
--   template version. If specified for an update operation, this value
--   must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the
--   template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don't
--   occur.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint does
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For a get operation, retrieves information about the active
--   version of the template.</li>
--   <li>For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the
--   latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version
--   parameter isn't used or is set to false.</li>
--   <li>For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all
--   versions of the template.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:version:DeleteVoiceTemplate'] :: DeleteVoiceTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the message template. A template name must start with an
--   alphanumeric character and can contain a maximum of 128 characters.
--   The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or
--   hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.
[$sel:templateName:DeleteVoiceTemplate'] :: DeleteVoiceTemplate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteVoiceTemplate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:DeleteVoiceTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>deleteVoiceTemplate_version</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   version of the message template to update, retrieve information about,
--   or delete. To retrieve identifiers and other information for all the
--   versions of a template, use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing
--   template version. If specified for an update operation, this value
--   must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the
--   template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don't
--   occur.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint does
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For a get operation, retrieves information about the active
--   version of the template.</li>
--   <li>For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the
--   latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version
--   parameter isn't used or is set to false.</li>
--   <li>For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all
--   versions of the template.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:DeleteVoiceTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>deleteVoiceTemplate_templateName</a> - The name of the message
--   template. A template name must start with an alphanumeric character
--   and can contain a maximum of 128 characters. The characters can be
--   alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Template
--   names are case sensitive.
newDeleteVoiceTemplate :: Text -> DeleteVoiceTemplate

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the message template to
--   update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers
--   and other information for all the versions of a template, use the
--   Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing
--   template version. If specified for an update operation, this value
--   must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the
--   template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don't
--   occur.

--   If you don't specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint does

--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For a get operation, retrieves information about the active
--   version of the template.</li>
--   <li>For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the
--   latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version
--   parameter isn't used or is set to false.</li>
--   <li>For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all
--   versions of the template.</li>
--   </ul>
deleteVoiceTemplate_version :: Lens' DeleteVoiceTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the message template. A template name must start with an
--   alphanumeric character and can contain a maximum of 128 characters.
--   The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or
--   hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.
deleteVoiceTemplate_templateName :: Lens' DeleteVoiceTemplate Text

-- | Deletes a message template for messages that were sent through the SMS
--   channel.
module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.DeleteSmsTemplate

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteSmsTemplate</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteSmsTemplate
DeleteSmsTemplate' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> DeleteSmsTemplate

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the message template to
--   update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers
--   and other information for all the versions of a template, use the
--   Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing
--   template version. If specified for an update operation, this value
--   must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the
--   template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don't
--   occur.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint does
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For a get operation, retrieves information about the active
--   version of the template.</li>
--   <li>For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the
--   latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version
--   parameter isn't used or is set to false.</li>
--   <li>For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all
--   versions of the template.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:version:DeleteSmsTemplate'] :: DeleteSmsTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the message template. A template name must start with an
--   alphanumeric character and can contain a maximum of 128 characters.
--   The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or
--   hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.
[$sel:templateName:DeleteSmsTemplate'] :: DeleteSmsTemplate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteSmsTemplate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the

-- | Deletes a message template for messages that were sent through a push
--   notification channel.
module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.DeletePushTemplate

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeletePushTemplate</a> smart constructor.
data DeletePushTemplate
DeletePushTemplate' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> DeletePushTemplate

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the message template to
--   update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers
--   and other information for all the versions of a template, use the
--   Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing
--   template version. If specified for an update operation, this value
--   must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the
--   template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don't
--   occur.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint does
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For a get operation, retrieves information about the active
--   version of the template.</li>
--   <li>For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the
--   latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version
--   parameter isn't used or is set to false.</li>
--   <li>For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all
--   versions of the template.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:version:DeletePushTemplate'] :: DeletePushTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the message template. A template name must start with an
--   alphanumeric character and can contain a maximum of 128 characters.
--   The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or
--   hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.

-- | Deletes a message template for messages that were sent through the
--   email channel.
module Network.AWS.Pinpoint.DeleteEmailTemplate

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteEmailTemplate</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteEmailTemplate
DeleteEmailTemplate' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> DeleteEmailTemplate

-- | The unique identifier for the version of the message template to
--   update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers
--   and other information for all the versions of a template, use the
--   Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing
--   template version. If specified for an update operation, this value
--   must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the
--   template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don't
--   occur.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint does
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For a get operation, retrieves information about the active
--   version of the template.</li>
--   <li>For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the
--   latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version
--   parameter isn't used or is set to false.</li>
--   <li>For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all
--   versions of the template.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:version:DeleteEmailTemplate'] :: DeleteEmailTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the message template. A template name must start with an
--   alphanumeric character and can contain a maximum of 128 characters.
--   The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or
--   hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.
[$sel:templateName:DeleteEmailTemplate'] :: DeleteEmailTemplate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteEmailTemplate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   or delete. To retrieve identifiers and other information for all the
--   versions of a template, use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing
--   template version. If specified for an update operation, this value
--   must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the
--   template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don't
--   occur.
