--   <a>aPNSChannelResponse_lastModifiedBy</a> - The user who last modified
--   the APNs channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasCredential:APNSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSChannelResponse_hasCredential</a> - (Not used) This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:APNSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSChannelResponse_platform</a> - The type of messaging or
--   notification platform for the channel. For the APNs channel, this
--   value is APNS.
newAPNSChannelResponse :: Text -> APNSChannelResponse

-- | Specifies the settings for a one-time message that's sent directly to
--   an endpoint through the APNs (Apple Push Notification service)
--   channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAPNSMessage</a> smart constructor.
data APNSMessage
APNSMessage' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> APNSMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>APNSMessage</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:APNSMessage'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSMessage_substitutions</a> - The default message variables to
--   use in the notification message. You can override these default
--   variables with individual address variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:silentPush:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_silentPush</a> -
--   Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification. A
--   silent (or background) push notification isn't displayed on
--   recipients' devices. You can use silent push notifications to make
--   small updates to your app, or to display messages in an in-app message
--   center.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint uses this property to determine the correct value for
--   the apns-push-type request header when it sends the notification
--   message to APNs. If you specify a value of true for this property,
--   Amazon Pinpoint sets the value for the apns-push-type header field to
--   background.
--   
--   If you specify the raw content of an APNs push notification, the
--   message payload has to include the content-available key. For silent
--   (background) notifications, set the value of content-available to 1.
--   Additionally, the message payload for a silent notification can't
--   include the alert, badge, or sound keys. For more information, see
--   <a>Generating a Remote Notification</a> and <a>Pushing Background
--   Updates to Your App</a> on the Apple Developer website.
--   
--   Apple has indicated that they will throttle "excessive" background
--   notifications based on current traffic volumes. To prevent your
--   notifications being throttled, Apple recommends that you send no more
--   than 3 silent push notifications to each recipient per hour.
--   
--   <a>$sel:aPNSPushType:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_aPNSPushType</a>
--   - The type of push notification to send. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>alert - For a standard notification that's displayed on
--   recipients' devices and prompts a recipient to interact with the
--   notification.</li>
--   <li>background - For a silent notification that delivers content in
--   the background and isn't displayed on recipients' devices.</li>
--   <li>complication - For a notification that contains update information
--   for an app’s complication timeline.</li>
--   <li>fileprovider - For a notification that signals changes to a File
--   Provider extension.</li>
--   <li>mdm - For a notification that tells managed devices to contact the
--   MDM server.</li>
--   <li>voip - For a notification that provides information about an
--   incoming VoIP call.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-push-type request
--   header when it sends the notification message to APNs. If you don't
--   specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint sets the value to
--   alert or background automatically, based on the value that you specify
--   for the SilentPush or RawContent property of the message.
--   
--   For more information about the apns-push-type request header, see
--   <a>Sending Notification Requests to APNs</a> on the Apple Developer
--   website.
--   
--   <a>$sel:priority:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_priority</a> -
--   para&gt;5 - Low priority, the notification might be delayed, delivered
--   as part of a group, or throttled.
--   
--   /listitem&gt;
--   
--   10 - High priority, the notification is sent immediately. This is the
--   default value. A high priority notification should trigger an alert,
--   play a sound, or badge your app's icon on the recipient's device.
--   
--   /para&gt;
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-priority request
--   header when it sends the notification message to APNs.
--   
--   The equivalent values for Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly
--   Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), are normal, for 5, and high, for 10. If
--   you specify an FCM value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint accepts
--   and converts the value to the corresponding APNs value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawContent:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_rawContent</a> -
--   The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the
--   notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other
--   content for the message.
--   
--   If you specify the raw content of an APNs push notification, the
--   message payload has to include the content-available key. The value of
--   the content-available key has to be an integer, and can only be 0 or
--   1. If you're sending a standard notification, set the value of
--   content-available to 0. If you're sending a silent (background)
--   notification, set the value of content-available to 1. Additionally,
--   silent notification payloads can't include the alert, badge, or sound
--   keys. For more information, see <a>Generating a Remote
--   Notification</a> and <a>Pushing Background Updates to Your App</a> on
--   the Apple Developer website.
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_data</a> - The JSON
--   payload to use for a silent push notification. This payload is added
--   to the data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_body</a> - The body of
--   the notification message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:category:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_category</a> - The
--   key that indicates the notification type for the push notification.
--   This key is a value that's defined by the identifier property of one
--   of your app's registered categories.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeToLive:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_timeToLive</a> -
--   The amount of time, in seconds, that APNs should store and attempt to
--   deliver the push notification, if the service is unable to deliver the
--   notification the first time. If this value is 0, APNs treats the
--   notification as if it expires immediately and the service doesn't
--   store or try to deliver the notification again.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-expiration request
--   header when it sends the notification message to APNs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_url</a> - The URL to open
--   in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the
--   push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sound:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_sound</a> - The key for
--   the sound to play when the recipient receives the push notification.
--   The value for this key is the name of a sound file in your app's main
--   bundle or the Library/Sounds folder in your app's data container. If
--   the sound file can't be found or you specify default for the value,
--   the system plays the default alert sound.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_action</a> - The
--   action to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   the iOS platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaUrl:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_mediaUrl</a> - The
--   URL of an image or video to display in the push notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:preferredAuthenticationMethod:APNSMessage'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSMessage_preferredAuthenticationMethod</a> - The authentication
--   method that you want Amazon Pinpoint to use when authenticating with
--   APNs, CERTIFICATE or TOKEN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:badge:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_badge</a> - The key
--   that indicates whether and how to modify the badge of your app's icon
--   when the recipient receives the push notification. If this key isn't
--   included in the dictionary, the badge doesn't change. To remove the
--   badge, set this value to 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_title</a> - The title
--   to display above the notification message on the recipient's device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:threadId:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_threadId</a> - The
--   key that represents your app-specific identifier for grouping
--   notifications. If you provide a Notification Content app extension,
--   you can use this value to group your notifications together.
--   
--   <a>$sel:collapseId:APNSMessage'</a>, <a>aPNSMessage_collapseId</a> -
--   An arbitrary identifier that, if assigned to multiple messages, APNs
--   uses to coalesce the messages into a single push notification instead
--   of delivering each message individually. This value can't exceed 64
--   bytes.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the apns-collapse-id request
--   header when it sends the notification message to APNs.
newAPNSMessage :: APNSMessage

-- | Specifies channel-specific content and settings for a message template
--   that can be used in push notifications that are sent through the APNs
--   (Apple Push Notification service) channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAPNSPushNotificationTemplate</a> smart constructor.
data APNSPushNotificationTemplate
APNSPushNotificationTemplate' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> APNSPushNotificationTemplate

-- | Create a value of <a>APNSPushNotificationTemplate</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawContent:APNSPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSPushNotificationTemplate_rawContent</a> - The raw,
--   JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for push notifications
--   that are based on the message template. If specified, this value
--   overrides all other content for the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:APNSPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSPushNotificationTemplate_body</a> - The message body to use in
--   push notifications that are based on the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:APNSPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSPushNotificationTemplate_url</a> - The URL to open in the
--   recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps a push
--   notification that's based on the message template and the value of the
--   Action property is URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sound:APNSPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSPushNotificationTemplate_sound</a> - The key for the sound to
--   play when the recipient receives a push notification that's based on
--   the message template. The value for this key is the name of a sound
--   file in your app's main bundle or the Library/Sounds folder in your
--   app's data container. If the sound file can't be found or you specify
--   default for the value, the system plays the default alert sound.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:APNSPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSPushNotificationTemplate_action</a> - The action to occur if a
--   recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message
--   template. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   the iOS platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaUrl:APNSPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSPushNotificationTemplate_mediaUrl</a> - The URL of an image or
--   video to display in push notifications that are based on the message
--   template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:APNSPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSPushNotificationTemplate_title</a> - The title to use in push
--   notifications that are based on the message template. This title
--   appears above the notification message on a recipient's device.
newAPNSPushNotificationTemplate :: APNSPushNotificationTemplate

--   that's assigned to your iOS app. This identifier is used for APNs
--   tokens.
--

--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelRequest_defaultAuthenticationMethod</a> - The
--   default authentication method that you want Amazon Pinpoint to use
--   when authenticating with the APNs sandbox environment, key or
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificate:APNSSandboxChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelRequest_certificate</a> - The APNs client
--   certificate that you received from Apple, if you want Amazon Pinpoint
--   to communicate with the APNs sandbox environment by using an APNs
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tokenKeyId:APNSSandboxChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelRequest_tokenKeyId</a> - The key identifier
--   that's assigned to your APNs signing key, if you want Amazon Pinpoint
--   to communicate with the APNs sandbox environment by using APNs tokens.
newAPNSSandboxChannelRequest :: APNSSandboxChannelRequest

--   when the APNs sandbox channel was enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedBy:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_lastModifiedBy</a> - The user who last
--   modified the APNs sandbox channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasCredential:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_hasCredential</a> - (Not used) This
--   property is retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:APNSSandboxChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>aPNSSandboxChannelResponse_platform</a> - The type of messaging or
--   notification platform for the channel. For the APNs sandbox channel,
--   this value is APNS_SANDBOX.
newAPNSSandboxChannelResponse :: Text -> APNSSandboxChannelResponse

-- | Provides information about the activities that were performed by a
--   campaign.

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newActivitiesResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ActivitiesResponse

--   omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>activitiesResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use in a
--   subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated
--   response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:ActivitiesResponse'</a>, <a>activitiesResponse_item</a> -
--   An array of responses, one for each activity that was performed by the
--   campaign.
newActivitiesResponse :: ActivitiesResponse

-- | Specifies the configuration and other settings for an activity in a
--   journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newActivity</a> smart constructor.
data Activity
Activity' :: Maybe ConditionalSplitActivity -> Maybe EmailMessageActivity -> Maybe MultiConditionalSplitActivity -> Maybe ContactCenterActivity -> Maybe CustomMessageActivity -> Maybe WaitActivity -> Maybe RandomSplitActivity -> Maybe HoldoutActivity -> Maybe SMSMessageActivity -> Maybe PushMessageActivity -> Maybe Text -> Activity

-- | Create a value of <a>Activity</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:conditionalSplit:Activity'</a>,
--   <a>activity_conditionalSplit</a> - The settings for a yes/no split
--   activity. This type of activity sends participants down one of two
--   paths in a journey, based on conditions that you specify.
--   
--   <a>$sel:email:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_email</a> - The settings for
--   an email activity. This type of activity sends an email message to
--   participants.
--   
--   <a>$sel:multiCondition:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_multiCondition</a> -
--   The settings for a multivariate split activity. This type of activity
--   sends participants down one of as many as five paths (including a
--   default <i>Else</i> path) in a journey, based on conditions that you
--   specify.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactCenter:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_contactCenter</a> -
--   The settings for a connect activity. This type of activity initiates a
--   contact center call to participants.
--   
--   <a>$sel:custom:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_custom</a> - The settings
--   for a custom message activity. This type of activity calls an AWS
--   Lambda function or web hook that sends messages to participants.
--   
--   <a>$sel:wait:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_wait</a> - The settings for a
--   wait activity. This type of activity waits for a certain amount of
--   time or until a specific date and time before moving participants to
--   the next activity in a journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:randomSplit:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_randomSplit</a> - The
--   settings for a random split activity. This type of activity randomly
--   sends specified percentages of participants down one of as many as
--   five paths in a journey, based on conditions that you specify.
--   
--   <a>$sel:holdout:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_holdout</a> - The settings
--   for a holdout activity. This type of activity stops a journey for a
--   specified percentage of participants.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sms:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_sms</a> - The settings for an
--   SMS activity. This type of activity sends a text message to
--   participants.
--   
--   <a>$sel:push:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_push</a> - The settings for a
--   push notification activity. This type of activity sends a push
--   notification to participants.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Activity'</a>, <a>activity_description</a> - The
--   custom description of the activity.
newActivity :: Activity

-- | Provides information about an activity that was performed by a
--   campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newActivityResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ActivityResponse
ActivityResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ActivityResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>ActivityResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:ActivityResponse'</a>, <a>activityResponse_state</a> -
--   The current status of the activity. Possible values are: PENDING,
--   INITIALIZING, RUNNING, PAUSED, CANCELLED, and COMPLETED.
--   
--   <a>$sel:start:ActivityResponse'</a>, <a>activityResponse_start</a> -
--   The actual start time, in ISO 8601 format, of the activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timezonesCompletedCount:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_timezonesCompletedCount</a> - The total number of
--   time zones that were completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timezonesTotalCount:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_timezonesTotalCount</a> - The total number of
--   unique time zones that are in the segment for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:result:ActivityResponse'</a>, <a>activityResponse_result</a> -
--   Specifies whether the activity succeeded. Possible values are SUCCESS
--   and FAIL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatmentId:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_treatmentId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   campaign treatment that the activity applies to. A treatment is a
--   variation of a campaign that's used for A/B testing of a campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:successfulEndpointCount:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_successfulEndpointCount</a> - The total number of
--   endpoints that the campaign successfully delivered messages to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:end:ActivityResponse'</a>, <a>activityResponse_end</a> - The
--   actual time, in ISO 8601 format, when the activity was marked
--   CANCELLED or COMPLETED.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalEndpointCount:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_totalEndpointCount</a> - The total number of
--   endpoints that the campaign attempted to deliver messages to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduledStart:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_scheduledStart</a> - The scheduled start time, in
--   ISO 8601 format, for the activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:campaignId:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_campaignId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   campaign that the activity applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ActivityResponse'</a>, <a>activityResponse_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:ActivityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activityResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application that the campaign applies to.
newActivityResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ActivityResponse

-- | Specifies address-based configuration settings for a message that's
--   sent directly to an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAddressConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data AddressConfiguration
AddressConfiguration' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ChannelType -> AddressConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>AddressConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:AddressConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>addressConfiguration_substitutions</a> - A map of the message
--   variables to merge with the variables specified by properties of the
--   DefaultMessage object. The variables specified in this map take
--   precedence over all other variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:titleOverride:AddressConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>addressConfiguration_titleOverride</a> - The message title to use
--   instead of the default message title. This value overrides the default
--   message title.
--   
--   <a>$sel:context:AddressConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>addressConfiguration_context</a> - An object that maps custom
--   attributes to attributes for the address and is attached to the
--   message. Attribute names are case sensitive.
--   
--   For a push notification, this payload is added to the data.pinpoint
--   object. For an email or text message, this payload is added to
--   email/SMS delivery receipt event attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawContent:AddressConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>addressConfiguration_rawContent</a> - The raw, JSON-formatted
--   string to use as the payload for the message. If specified, this value
--   overrides all other values for the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bodyOverride:AddressConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>addressConfiguration_bodyOverride</a> - The message body to use
--   instead of the default message body. This value overrides the default
--   message body.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelType:AddressConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>addressConfiguration_channelType</a> - The channel to use when
--   sending the message.
newAddressConfiguration :: AddressConfiguration

-- | Specifies channel-specific content and settings for a message template
--   that can be used in push notifications that are sent through the ADM
--   (Amazon Device Messaging), Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push), or GCM (Firebase
--   Cloud Messaging, formerly Google Cloud Messaging) channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAndroidPushNotificationTemplate</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AndroidPushNotificationTemplate
AndroidPushNotificationTemplate' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AndroidPushNotificationTemplate

-- | Create a value of <a>AndroidPushNotificationTemplate</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageIconUrl:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>androidPushNotificationTemplate_imageIconUrl</a> - The URL of the
--   large icon image to display in the content view of a push notification
--   that's based on the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawContent:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>androidPushNotificationTemplate_rawContent</a> - The raw,
--   JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for a push notification
--   that's based on the message template. If specified, this value
--   overrides all other content for the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:smallImageIconUrl:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>androidPushNotificationTemplate_smallImageIconUrl</a> - The URL of
--   the small icon image to display in the status bar and the content view
--   of a push notification that's based on the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>androidPushNotificationTemplate_body</a> - The message body to use
--   in a push notification that's based on the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>androidPushNotificationTemplate_url</a> - The URL to open in a
--   recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps a push
--   notification that's based on the message template and the value of the
--   Action property is URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sound:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>androidPushNotificationTemplate_sound</a> - The sound to play when
--   a recipient receives a push notification that's based on the message
--   template. You can use the default stream or specify the file name of a
--   sound resource that's bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the
--   sound file must reside in /res/raw/.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>androidPushNotificationTemplate_action</a> - The action to occur if
--   a recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message
--   template. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of
--   the Android platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageUrl:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>androidPushNotificationTemplate_imageUrl</a> - The URL of an image
--   to display in a push notification that's based on the message
--   template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:AndroidPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>androidPushNotificationTemplate_title</a> - The title to use in a
--   push notification that's based on the message template. This title
--   appears above the notification message on a recipient's device.
newAndroidPushNotificationTemplate :: AndroidPushNotificationTemplate

-- | Provides the results of a query that retrieved the data for a standard
--   metric that applies to an application, and provides information about
--   that query.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse
ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse' :: Maybe Text -> BaseKpiResult -> Text -> POSIX -> POSIX -> Text -> ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>applicationDateRangeKpiResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use
--   in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated
--   response. This value is null for the Application Metrics resource
--   because the resource returns all results in a single page.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kpiResult:ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>applicationDateRangeKpiResponse_kpiResult</a> - An array of objects
--   that contains the results of the query. Each object contains the value
--   for the metric and metadata about that value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kpiName:ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>applicationDateRangeKpiResponse_kpiName</a> - The name of the
--   metric, also referred to as a /key performance indicator (KPI)/, that
--   the data was retrieved for. This value describes the associated metric
--   and consists of two or more terms, which are comprised of lowercase
--   alphanumeric characters, separated by a hyphen. For a list of possible
--   values, see the <a>Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>applicationDateRangeKpiResponse_endTime</a> - The last date and
--   time of the date range that was used to filter the query results, in
--   extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is inclusive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>applicationDateRangeKpiResponse_startTime</a> - The first date and
--   time of the date range that was used to filter the query results, in
--   extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is inclusive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>applicationDateRangeKpiResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the application that the metric applies to.
newApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse :: BaseKpiResult -> Text -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> Text -> ApplicationDateRangeKpiResponse

-- | Provides information about an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newApplicationResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ApplicationResponse
ApplicationResponse' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ApplicationResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>ApplicationResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:ApplicationResponse'</a>, <a>applicationResponse_tags</a>
--   - A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags
--   that are associated with the application. Each tag consists of a
--   required tag key and an associated tag value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ApplicationResponse'</a>, <a>applicationResponse_id</a> -
--   The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is
--   displayed as the <b>Project ID</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:ApplicationResponse'</a>, <a>applicationResponse_arn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ApplicationResponse'</a>, <a>applicationResponse_name</a>
--   - The display name of the application. This name is displayed as the
--   <b>Project name</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
newApplicationResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ApplicationResponse

-- | Provides information about an application, including the default
--   settings for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newApplicationSettingsResource</a> smart constructor.
data ApplicationSettingsResource
ApplicationSettingsResource' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe CampaignLimits -> Maybe QuietTime -> Maybe CampaignHook -> Text -> ApplicationSettingsResource

-- | Create a value of <a>ApplicationSettingsResource</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:ApplicationSettingsResource'</a>,
--   <a>applicationSettingsResource_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date and
--   time, in ISO 8601 format, when the application's settings were last
--   modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limits:ApplicationSettingsResource'</a>,
--   <a>applicationSettingsResource_limits</a> - The default sending limits
--   for campaigns in the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quietTime:ApplicationSettingsResource'</a>,
--   <a>applicationSettingsResource_quietTime</a> - The default quiet time
--   for campaigns in the application. Quiet time is a specific time range
--   when messages aren't sent to endpoints, if all the following
--   conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set
--   to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the endpoint will
--   receive messages from a campaign or journey, even if quiet time is
--   enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:campaignHook:ApplicationSettingsResource'</a>,
--   <a>applicationSettingsResource_campaignHook</a> - The settings for the
--   AWS Lambda function to invoke by default as a code hook for campaigns
--   in the application. You can use this hook to customize segments that
--   are used by campaigns in the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:ApplicationSettingsResource'</a>,
--   <a>applicationSettingsResource_applicationId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the application. This identifier is displayed as the
--   <b>Project ID</b> on the Amazon Pinpoint console.
newApplicationSettingsResource :: Text -> ApplicationSettingsResource

-- | Provides information about all of your applications.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newApplicationsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ApplicationsResponse
ApplicationsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [ApplicationResponse] -> ApplicationsResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>ApplicationsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ApplicationsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>applicationsResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use in a
--   subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated
--   response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:ApplicationsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>applicationsResponse_item</a> - An array of responses, one for each
--   application that was returned.
newApplicationsResponse :: ApplicationsResponse

-- | Specifies attribute-based criteria for including or excluding
--   endpoints from a segment.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttributeDimension</a> smart constructor.
data AttributeDimension
AttributeDimension' :: Maybe AttributeType -> [Text] -> AttributeDimension

-- | Create a value of <a>AttributeDimension</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeType:AttributeDimension'</a>,
--   <a>attributeDimension_attributeType</a> - The type of segment
--   dimension to use. Valid values are:
--   
--   INCLUSIVE - endpoints that have attributes matching the values are
--   included in the segment.
--   
--   EXCLUSIVE - endpoints that have attributes matching the values are
--   excluded in the segment.
--   
--   CONTAINS - endpoints that have attributes' substrings match the values
--   are included in the segment.
--   
--   BEFORE - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes
--   before the value are included in the segment.
--   
--   AFTER - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes after
--   the value are included in the segment.
--   
--   ON - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT dates on the value
--   are included in the segment. Time is ignored in this comparison.
--   
--   BETWEEN - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes
--   between the values are included in the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:AttributeDimension'</a>,
--   <a>attributeDimension_values</a> - The criteria values to use for the
--   segment dimension. Depending on the value of the AttributeType
--   property, endpoints are included or excluded from the segment if their
--   attribute values match the criteria values.
newAttributeDimension :: AttributeDimension

-- | Provides information about the type and the names of attributes that
--   were removed from all the endpoints that are associated with an
--   application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttributesResource</a> smart constructor.
data AttributesResource
AttributesResource' :: Maybe [Text] -> Text -> Text -> AttributesResource

-- | Create a value of <a>AttributesResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:AttributesResource'</a>,
--   <a>attributesResource_attributes</a> - An array that specifies the
--   names of the attributes that were removed from the endpoints.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeType:AttributesResource'</a>,
--   <a>attributesResource_attributeType</a> - The type of attribute or
--   attributes that were removed from the endpoints. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>endpoint-custom-attributes - Custom attributes that describe
--   endpoints.</li>
--   <li>endpoint-metric-attributes - Custom metrics that your app reports
--   to Amazon Pinpoint for endpoints.</li>
--   <li>endpoint-user-attributes - Custom attributes that describe
--   users.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:AttributesResource'</a>,
--   <a>attributesResource_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the application.
newAttributesResource :: Text -> Text -> AttributesResource

--   omitted.

--

--   <a>baiduChannelRequest_secretKey</a> - The secret key that you
--   received from the Baidu Cloud Push service to communicate with the
--   service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:apiKey:BaiduChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelRequest_apiKey</a> - The API key that you received from
--   the Baidu Cloud Push service to communicate with the service.
newBaiduChannelRequest :: Text -> Text -> BaiduChannelRequest

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of the Baidu (Baidu
--   Cloud Push) channel for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBaiduChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data BaiduChannelResponse
BaiduChannelResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> Text -> BaiduChannelResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>BaiduChannelResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date and time when
--   the Baidu channel was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_enabled</a> - Specifies whether the Baidu
--   channel is enabled for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isArchived:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_isArchived</a> - Specifies whether the Baidu
--   channel is archived.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the application that the Baidu channel applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_version</a> - The current version of the Baidu

--   
--   <a>$sel:id:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>, <a>baiduChannelResponse_id</a> -
--   (Deprecated) An identifier for the Baidu channel. This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_creationDate</a> - The date and time when the
--   Baidu channel was enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedBy:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_lastModifiedBy</a> - The user who last
--   modified the Baidu channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasCredential:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_hasCredential</a> - (Not used) This property
--   is retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:credential:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_credential</a> - The API key that you received
--   from the Baidu Cloud Push service to communicate with the service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:BaiduChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>baiduChannelResponse_platform</a> - The type of messaging or
--   notification platform for the channel. For the Baidu channel, this
--   value is BAIDU.
newBaiduChannelResponse :: Text -> Text -> BaiduChannelResponse

-- | Specifies the settings for a one-time message that's sent directly to
--   an endpoint through the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push) channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBaiduMessage</a> smart constructor.
data BaiduMessage
BaiduMessage' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> BaiduMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>BaiduMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:BaiduMessage'</a>,
--   <a>baiduMessage_substitutions</a> - The default message variables to
--   use in the notification message. You can override the default
--   variables with individual address variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:silentPush:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_silentPush</a> -
--   Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification,
--   which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's
--   device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as
--   updating an app's configuration or supporting phone home
--   functionality.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageIconUrl:BaiduMessage'</a>,
--   <a>baiduMessage_imageIconUrl</a> - The URL of the large icon image to
--   display in the content view of the push notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawContent:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_rawContent</a> -
--   The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the
--   notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other
--   content for the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_data</a> - The JSON
--   data payload to use for the push notification, if the notification is
--   a silent push notification. This payload is added to the
--   data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:smallImageIconUrl:BaiduMessage'</a>,
--   <a>baiduMessage_smallImageIconUrl</a> - The URL of the small icon
--   image to display in the status bar and the content view of the push
--   notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_body</a> - The body of
--   the notification message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeToLive:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_timeToLive</a> -
--   The amount of time, in seconds, that the Baidu Cloud Push service
--   should store the message if the recipient's device is offline. The
--   default value and maximum supported time is 604,800 seconds (7 days).
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_url</a> - The URL to
--   open in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps
--   the push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sound:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_sound</a> - The sound
--   to play when the recipient receives the push notification. You can use
--   the default stream or specify the file name of a sound resource that's
--   bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound file must
--   reside in /res/raw/.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_action</a> - The
--   action to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of
--   the Android platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageUrl:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_imageUrl</a> - The
--   URL of an image to display in the push notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:BaiduMessage'</a>, <a>baiduMessage_title</a> - The title
--   to display above the notification message on the recipient's device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iconReference:BaiduMessage'</a>,
--   <a>baiduMessage_iconReference</a> - The icon image name of the asset
--   saved in your app.
newBaiduMessage :: BaiduMessage

--   or journey.
newBaseKpiResult :: BaseKpiResult

-- | Provides the results of a query that retrieved the data for a standard
--   metric that applies to a campaign, and provides information about that

data CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignDateRangeKpiResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use in a
--   subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated
--   response. This value is null for the Campaign Metrics resource because
--   the resource returns all results in a single page.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kpiResult:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignDateRangeKpiResponse_kpiResult</a> - An array of objects
--   that contains the results of the query. Each object contains the value
--   for the metric and metadata about that value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kpiName:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignDateRangeKpiResponse_kpiName</a> - The name of the metric,
--   also referred to as a /key performance indicator (KPI)/, that the data
--   was retrieved for. This value describes the associated metric and
--   consists of two or more terms, which are comprised of lowercase
--   alphanumeric characters, separated by a hyphen. For a list of possible
--   values, see the <a>Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignDateRangeKpiResponse_endTime</a> - The last date and time
--   of the date range that was used to filter the query results, in
--   extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is inclusive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:campaignId:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignDateRangeKpiResponse_campaignId</a> - The unique identifier
--   for the campaign that the metric applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignDateRangeKpiResponse_startTime</a> - The first date and
--   time of the date range that was used to filter the query results, in
--   extended ISO 8601 format. The date range is inclusive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignDateRangeKpiResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the application that the metric applies to.
newCampaignDateRangeKpiResponse :: BaseKpiResult -> Text -> UTCTime -> Text -> UTCTime -> Text -> CampaignDateRangeKpiResponse

-- | Specifies settings for invoking an AWS Lambda function that customizes
--   a segment for a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignHook</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignHook
CampaignHook' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Mode -> Maybe Text -> CampaignHook

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignHook</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lambdaFunctionName:CampaignHook'</a>,
--   <a>campaignHook_lambdaFunctionName</a> - The name or Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function that Amazon Pinpoint invokes to
--   customize a segment for a campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mode:CampaignHook'</a>, <a>campaignHook_mode</a> - The mode
--   that Amazon Pinpoint uses to invoke the AWS Lambda function. Possible
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>FILTER - Invoke the function to customize the segment that's used
--   by a campaign.</li>
--   <li>DELIVERY - (Deprecated) Previously, invoked the function to send a
--   campaign through a custom channel. This functionality is not supported
--   anymore. To send a campaign through a custom channel, use the
--   CustomDeliveryConfiguration and CampaignCustomMessage objects of the
--   campaign.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:webUrl:CampaignHook'</a>, <a>campaignHook_webUrl</a> - The web
--   URL that Amazon Pinpoint calls to invoke the AWS Lambda function over
--   HTTPS.
newCampaignHook :: CampaignHook

-- | For a campaign, specifies limits on the messages that the campaign can
--   send. For an application, specifies the default limits for messages
--   that campaigns in the application can send.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignLimits</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignLimits
CampaignLimits' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> CampaignLimits

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignLimits</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:messagesPerSecond:CampaignLimits'</a>,
--   <a>campaignLimits_messagesPerSecond</a> - The maximum number of
--   messages that a campaign can send each second. For an application,
--   this value specifies the default limit for the number of messages that
--   campaigns can send each second. The minimum value is 50. The maximum
--   value is 20,000.
--   
--   <a>$sel:daily:CampaignLimits'</a>, <a>campaignLimits_daily</a> - The
--   maximum number of messages that a campaign can send to a single
--   endpoint during a 24-hour period. For an application, this value
--   specifies the default limit for the number of messages that campaigns
--   and journeys can send to a single endpoint during a 24-hour period.
--   The maximum value is 100.
--   
--   <a>$sel:total:CampaignLimits'</a>, <a>campaignLimits_total</a> - The
--   maximum number of messages that a campaign can send to a single
--   endpoint during the course of the campaign. If a campaign recurs, this
--   setting applies to all runs of the campaign. The maximum value is 100.
--   
--   <a>$sel:session:CampaignLimits'</a>, <a>campaignLimits_session</a> -
--   The maximum total number of messages that the campaign can send per
--   user session.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumDuration:CampaignLimits'</a>,
--   <a>campaignLimits_maximumDuration</a> - The maximum amount of time, in
--   seconds, that a campaign can attempt to deliver a message after the
--   scheduled start time for the campaign. The minimum value is 60
--   seconds.
newCampaignLimits :: CampaignLimits

-- | Provides information about the status, configuration, and other
--   settings for a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignResponse
CampaignResponse' :: Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration -> Maybe CampaignState -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Schedule -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration -> Maybe CampaignHook -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CampaignLimits -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe CampaignState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MessageConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [TreatmentResource] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CampaignResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:customDeliveryConfiguration:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_customDeliveryConfiguration</a> - The delivery
--   configuration settings for sending the campaign through a custom
--   channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_state</a> -
--   The current status of the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:priority:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_priority</a> - Defines the priority of the
--   campaign, used to decide the order of messages displayed to user if
--   there are multiple messages scheduled to be displayed at the same
--   moment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schedule:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_schedule</a> - The schedule settings for the
--   campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateConfiguration:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_templateConfiguration</a> - The message template
--   that’s used for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hook:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_hook</a> - The
--   settings for the AWS Lambda function to use as a code hook for the
--   campaign. You can use this hook to customize the segment that's used
--   by the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatmentName:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_treatmentName</a> - The custom name of the default
--   treatment for the campaign, if the campaign has multiple treatments. A
--   <i>treatment</i> is a variation of a campaign that's used for A/B
--   testing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limits:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_limits</a> -
--   The messaging limits for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isPaused:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_isPaused</a> - Specifies whether the campaign is
--   paused. A paused campaign doesn't run unless you resume it by changing
--   this value to false.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultState:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_defaultState</a> - The current status of the
--   campaign's default treatment. This value exists only for campaigns
--   that have more than one treatment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_name</a> - The
--   name of the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_version</a>
--   - The version number of the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:holdoutPercent:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_holdoutPercent</a> - The allocated percentage of
--   users (segment members) who shouldn't receive messages from the
--   campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatmentDescription:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_treatmentDescription</a> - The custom description
--   of the default treatment for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfiguration:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_messageConfiguration</a> - The message
--   configuration settings for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_description</a> - The custom description of the
--   campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalTreatments:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_additionalTreatments</a> - An array of responses,
--   one for each treatment that you defined for the campaign, in addition
--   to the default treatment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_tags</a> - A
--   string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags that
--   are associated with the campaign. Each tag consists of a required tag
--   key and an associated tag value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the campaign was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601 format,
--   when the campaign was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentId:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_segmentId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   segment that's associated with the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentVersion:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_segmentVersion</a> - The version number of the
--   segment that's associated with the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:CampaignResponse'</a>, <a>campaignResponse_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:CampaignResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application that the campaign applies to.
newCampaignResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CampaignResponse

-- | Specifies the content and settings for an SMS message that's sent to
--   recipients of a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignSmsMessage</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignSmsMessage
CampaignSmsMessage' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MessageType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CampaignSmsMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignSmsMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:originationNumber:CampaignSmsMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignSmsMessage_originationNumber</a> - The long code to send
--   the SMS message from. This value should be one of the dedicated long
--   codes that's assigned to your AWS account. Although it isn't required,
--   we recommend that you specify the long code using an E.164 format to
--   ensure prompt and accurate delivery of the message. For example,
--   +12065550100.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateId:CampaignSmsMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignSmsMessage_templateId</a> - The template ID received from
--   the regulatory body for sending SMS in your country.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:CampaignSmsMessage'</a>, <a>campaignSmsMessage_body</a> -
--   The body of the SMS message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageType:CampaignSmsMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignSmsMessage_messageType</a> - The SMS message type. Valid
--   values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages that are critical or
--   time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and PROMOTIONAL (for
--   messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive, such as marketing
--   messages).
--   
--   <a>$sel:senderId:CampaignSmsMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignSmsMessage_senderId</a> - The sender ID to display on
--   recipients' devices when they receive the SMS message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entityId:CampaignSmsMessage'</a>,
--   <a>campaignSmsMessage_entityId</a> - The entity ID or Principal Entity
--   (PE) id received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in your
--   country.
newCampaignSmsMessage :: CampaignSmsMessage

-- | Provides information about the status of a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignState</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignState
CampaignState' :: Maybe CampaignStatus -> CampaignState

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignState</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:campaignStatus:CampaignState'</a>,
--   <a>campaignState_campaignStatus</a> - The current status of the
--   campaign, or the current status of a treatment that belongs to an A/B
--   test campaign.
--   
--   If a campaign uses A/B testing, the campaign has a status of COMPLETED
--   only if all campaign treatments have a status of COMPLETED. If you
--   delete the segment that's associated with a campaign, the campaign
--   fails and has a status of DELETED.
newCampaignState :: CampaignState

-- | Provides information about the configuration and other settings for
--   all the campaigns that are associated with an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCampaignsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CampaignsResponse
CampaignsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> [CampaignResponse] -> CampaignsResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>CampaignsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:CampaignsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>campaignsResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use in a subsequent
--   request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This
--   value is null if there are no additional pages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:CampaignsResponse'</a>, <a>campaignsResponse_item</a> -
--   An array of responses, one for each campaign that's associated with
--   the application.
newCampaignsResponse :: CampaignsResponse

-- | Provides information about the general settings and status of a

data ChannelResponse

newChannelResponse :: ChannelResponse

-- | Specifies the settings for a yes/no split activity in a journey. This

--   journey, based on conditions that you specify.

--   different paths based on push notification events (such as Open or
--   Received events), your mobile app has to specify the User ID and
--   Endpoint ID values. For more information, see <a>Integrating Amazon
--   Pinpoint with your application</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint Developer
--   Guide</i>.

--   are met.

-- | Specifies Amazon Pinpoint configuration settings for retrieving and
--   processing recommendation data from a recommender model.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateRecommenderConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateRecommenderConfiguration
CreateRecommenderConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Text -> Text -> CreateRecommenderConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateRecommenderConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationTransformerUri:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationTransformerUri</a> -
--   The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function to
--   invoke for additional processing of recommendation data that's
--   retrieved from the recommender model.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationsDisplayName:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationsDisplayName</a> - A
--   custom display name for the standard endpoint or user attribute
--   (RecommendationItems) that temporarily stores recommended items for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This value is required if the
--   configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda function
--   (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data.
--   
--   This name appears in the <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template
--   editor on the Amazon Pinpoint console. The name can contain up to 25
--   characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-). These restrictions don't apply to
--   attribute values.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationProviderIdType:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationProviderIdType</a> -
--   The type of Amazon Pinpoint ID to associate with unique user IDs in
--   the recommender model. This value enables the model to use attribute
--   and event data that’s specific to a particular endpoint or user in an
--   Amazon Pinpoint application. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PINPOINT_ENDPOINT_ID - Associate each user in the model with a
--   particular endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based
--   on endpoint IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. This is the default value.</li>
--   <li>PINPOINT_USER_ID - Associate each user in the model with a
--   particular user and endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is
--   correlated based on user IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. If you specify this
--   value, an endpoint definition in Amazon Pinpoint has to specify both a
--   user ID (UserId) and an endpoint ID. Otherwise, messages won’t be sent
--   to the user's endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createRecommenderConfiguration_attributes</a> - A map of key-value
--   pairs that defines 1-10 custom endpoint or user attributes, depending
--   on the value for the RecommendationProviderIdType property. Each of
--   these attributes temporarily stores a recommended item that's
--   retrieved from the recommender model and sent to an AWS Lambda
--   function for additional processing. Each attribute can be used as a
--   message variable in a message template.
--   
--   In the map, the key is the name of a custom attribute and the value is
--   a custom display name for that attribute. The display name appears in
--   the <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template editor on the Amazon
--   Pinpoint console. The following restrictions apply to these names:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>An attribute name must start with a letter or number and it can
--   contain up to 50 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Attribute names are case sensitive
--   and must be unique.</li>
--   <li>An attribute display name must start with a letter or number and
--   it can contain up to 25 characters. The characters can be letters,
--   numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This object is required if the configuration invokes an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to process recommendation
--   data. Otherwise, don't include this object in your request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createRecommenderConfiguration_name</a> - A custom name of the
--   configuration for the recommender model. The name must start with a
--   letter or number and it can contain up to 128 characters. The
--   characters can be letters, numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or
--   hyphens (-).
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createRecommenderConfiguration_description</a> - A custom
--   description of the configuration for the recommender model. The
--   description can contain up to 128 characters. The characters can be
--   letters, numbers, spaces, or the following symbols: _ ; () , ‐.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationsPerMessage:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationsPerMessage</a> - The
--   number of recommended items to retrieve from the model for each
--   endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This number determines how many
--   recommended items are available for use in message variables. The
--   minimum value is 1. The maximum value is 5. The default value is 5.
--   
--   To use multiple recommended items and custom attributes with message
--   variables, you have to use an AWS Lambda function
--   (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationProviderUri:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationProviderUri</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender model to retrieve
--   recommendation data from. This value must match the ARN of an Amazon
--   Personalize campaign.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationProviderRoleArn:CreateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>createRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationProviderRoleArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to retrieve
--   recommendation data from the recommender model.
newCreateRecommenderConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> CreateRecommenderConfiguration

--   fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must
--   match the name of an existing message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateVersion:CustomMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>customMessageActivity_templateVersion</a> - The unique identifier
--   for the version of the message template to use for the message. If
--   specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing
--   template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version
--   identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointTypes:CustomMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>customMessageActivity_endpointTypes</a> - The types of endpoints to
--   send the custom message to. Each valid value maps to a type of channel
--   that you can associate with an endpoint by using the ChannelType
--   property of an endpoint.

--   the next activity to perform, after Amazon Pinpoint calls the AWS
--   Lambda function or web hook.
--

--   campaign or treatment to. This value can be one of the following:
--

--   to invoke to handle delivery of the campaign or treatment.</li>

newCustomMessageActivity :: CustomMessageActivity
