-- | Specifies the default settings and content for a push notification
--   that's sent directly to an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDefaultPushNotificationMessage</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DefaultPushNotificationMessage
DefaultPushNotificationMessage' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Text -> DefaultPushNotificationMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>DefaultPushNotificationMessage</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationMessage_substitutions</a> - The default
--   message variables to use in the notification message. You can override
--   the default variables with individual address variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:silentPush:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationMessage_silentPush</a> - Specifies whether
--   the default notification is a silent push notification, which is a
--   push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's device. Silent
--   push notifications can be used for cases such as updating an app's
--   configuration or delivering messages to an in-app notification center.
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':DefaultPushNotificationMessage'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationMessage_data</a> - The JSON data payload to
--   use for the default push notification, if the notification is a silent
--   push notification. This payload is added to the data.pinpoint.jsonBody
--   object of the notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationMessage_body</a> - The default body of the
--   notification message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationMessage_url</a> - The default URL to open in
--   a recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push
--   notification and the value of the Action property is URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationMessage_action</a> - The default action to
--   occur if a recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   the iOS and Android platforms.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:DefaultPushNotificationMessage'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationMessage_title</a> - The default title to
--   display above the notification message on a recipient's device.
newDefaultPushNotificationMessage :: DefaultPushNotificationMessage

-- | Specifies the default settings and content for a message template that
--   can be used in messages that are sent through a push notification
--   channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDefaultPushNotificationTemplate</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DefaultPushNotificationTemplate
DefaultPushNotificationTemplate' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Text -> DefaultPushNotificationTemplate

-- | Create a value of <a>DefaultPushNotificationTemplate</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationTemplate_body</a> - The message body to use
--   in push notifications that are based on the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationTemplate_url</a> - The URL to open in a
--   recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps a push
--   notification that's based on the message template and the value of the
--   Action property is URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sound:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationTemplate_sound</a> - The sound to play when
--   a recipient receives a push notification that's based on the message
--   template. You can use the default stream or specify the file name of a
--   sound resource that's bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the
--   sound file must reside in /res/raw/.
--   
--   For an iOS platform, this value is the key for the name of a sound
--   file in your app's main bundle or the Library/Sounds folder in your
--   app's data container. If the sound file can't be found or you specify
--   default for the value, the system plays the default alert sound.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationTemplate_action</a> - The action to occur if
--   a recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message
--   template. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   the iOS and Android platforms.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:DefaultPushNotificationTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>defaultPushNotificationTemplate_title</a> - The title to use in
--   push notifications that are based on the message template. This title
--   appears above the notification message on a recipient's device.
newDefaultPushNotificationTemplate :: DefaultPushNotificationTemplate

-- | Specifies the settings and content for the default message and any
--   default messages that you tailored for specific channels.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDirectMessageConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data DirectMessageConfiguration
DirectMessageConfiguration' :: Maybe APNSMessage -> Maybe GCMMessage -> Maybe DefaultMessage -> Maybe ADMMessage -> Maybe SMSMessage -> Maybe EmailMessage -> Maybe VoiceMessage -> Maybe BaiduMessage -> Maybe DefaultPushNotificationMessage -> DirectMessageConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>DirectMessageConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:aPNSMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_aPNSMessage</a> - The default push
--   notification message for the APNs (Apple Push Notification service)
--   channel. This message overrides the default push notification message
--   (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
--   
--   <a>$sel:gCMMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_gCMMessage</a> - The default push
--   notification message for the GCM channel, which is used to send
--   notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly
--   Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service. This message overrides the
--   default push notification message (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_defaultMessage</a> - The default message
--   for all channels.
--   
--   <a>$sel:aDMMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_aDMMessage</a> - The default push
--   notification message for the ADM (Amazon Device Messaging) channel.
--   This message overrides the default push notification message
--   (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
--   
--   <a>$sel:sMSMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_sMSMessage</a> - The default message for
--   the SMS channel. This message overrides the default message
--   (DefaultMessage).
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_emailMessage</a> - The default message
--   for the email channel. This message overrides the default message
--   (DefaultMessage).
--   
--   <a>$sel:voiceMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_voiceMessage</a> - The default message
--   for the voice channel. This message overrides the default message
--   (DefaultMessage).
--   
--   <a>$sel:baiduMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_baiduMessage</a> - The default push
--   notification message for the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push) channel. This
--   message overrides the default push notification message
--   (DefaultPushNotificationMessage).
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultPushNotificationMessage:DirectMessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>directMessageConfiguration_defaultPushNotificationMessage</a> - The
--   default push notification message for all push notification channels.
newDirectMessageConfiguration :: DirectMessageConfiguration

--   application.

data EmailChannelRequest

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailChannelRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   email channel for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSet:EmailChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelRequest_configurationSet</a> - The <a>Amazon SES
--   configuration set</a> that you want to apply to messages that you send
--   through the channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:EmailChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelRequest_roleArn</a> - The ARN of the AWS Identity and
--   Access Management (IAM) role that you want Amazon Pinpoint to use when
--   it submits email-related event data for the channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromAddress:EmailChannelRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelRequest_fromAddress</a> - The verified email address
--   that you want to send email from when you send email through the
--   channel.
--

--   <a>emailChannelRequest_identity</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the identity, verified with Amazon Simple Email Service (Amazon
--   SES), that you want to use when you send email through the channel.
newEmailChannelRequest :: Text -> Text -> EmailChannelRequest

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of the email
--   channel for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data EmailChannelResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailChannelResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   SES), that's used when you send email through the channel.

--   <a>emailChannelResponse_hasCredential</a> - (Not used) This property
--   is retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:EmailChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelResponse_roleArn</a> - The ARN of the AWS Identity and
--   Access Management (IAM) role that Amazon Pinpoint uses to submit
--   email-related event data for the channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:EmailChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailChannelResponse_platform</a> - The type of messaging or
--   notification platform for the channel. For the email channel, this
--   value is EMAIL.
newEmailChannelResponse :: Text -> EmailChannelResponse

-- | Specifies the default settings and content for a one-time email
--   message that's sent directly to an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailMessage</a> smart constructor.
data EmailMessage
EmailMessage' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RawEmail -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SimpleEmail -> Maybe [Text] -> EmailMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:EmailMessage'</a>,
--   <a>emailMessage_substitutions</a> - The default message variables to
--   use in the email message. You can override the default variables with
--   individual address variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:EmailMessage'</a>, <a>emailMessage_body</a> - The body of
--   the email message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromAddress:EmailMessage'</a>, <a>emailMessage_fromAddress</a>
--   - The verified email address to send the email message from. The
--   default value is the FromAddress specified for the email channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawEmail:EmailMessage'</a>, <a>emailMessage_rawEmail</a> - The
--   email message, represented as a raw MIME message.
--

--   <a>emailMessage_feedbackForwardingAddress</a> - The email address to
--   forward bounces and complaints to, if feedback forwarding is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:simpleEmail:EmailMessage'</a>, <a>emailMessage_simpleEmail</a>
--   - The email message, composed of a subject, a text part, and an HTML
--   part.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replyToAddresses:EmailMessage'</a>,
--   <a>emailMessage_replyToAddresses</a> - The reply-to email address(es)
--   for the email message. If a recipient replies to the email, each
--   reply-to address receives the reply.
newEmailMessage :: EmailMessage

-- | Specifies the settings for an email activity in a journey. This type
--   of activity sends an email message to participants.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailMessageActivity</a> smart constructor.
data EmailMessageActivity
EmailMessageActivity' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe JourneyEmailMessage -> EmailMessageActivity

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailMessageActivity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:EmailMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>emailMessageActivity_templateName</a> - The name of the email
--   message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must
--   match the name of an existing message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateVersion:EmailMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>emailMessageActivity_templateVersion</a> - The unique identifier
--   for the version of the email template to use for the message. If
--   specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing
--   template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version
--   identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextActivity:EmailMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>emailMessageActivity_nextActivity</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the next activity to perform, after the message is sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfig:EmailMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>emailMessageActivity_messageConfig</a> - Specifies the sender
--   address for an email message that's sent to participants in the
--   journey.
newEmailMessageActivity :: EmailMessageActivity

-- | Specifies the content and settings for a message template that can be
--   used in messages that are sent through the email channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailTemplateRequest</a> smart constructor.
data EmailTemplateRequest
EmailTemplateRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> EmailTemplateRequest

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailTemplateRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:EmailTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateRequest_subject</a> - The subject line, or title, to
--   use in email messages that are based on the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:textPart:EmailTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateRequest_textPart</a> - The message body, in plain text
--   format, to use in email messages that are based on the message
--   template. We recommend using plain text format for email clients that
--   don't render HTML content and clients that are connected to
--   high-latency networks, such as mobile devices.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:EmailTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateRequest_templateDescription</a> - A custom description
--   of the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubstitutions:EmailTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateRequest_defaultSubstitutions</a> - A JSON object that
--   specifies the default values to use for message variables in the
--   message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key
--   defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding value
--   defines the default value for that variable. When you create a message
--   that's based on the template, you can override these defaults with
--   message-specific and address-specific variables and values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:htmlPart:EmailTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateRequest_htmlPart</a> - The message body, in HTML
--   format, to use in email messages that are based on the message
--   template. We recommend using HTML format for email clients that render
--   HTML content. You can include links, formatted text, and more in an
--   HTML message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommenderId:EmailTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateRequest_recommenderId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the recommender model to use for the message template. Amazon Pinpoint
--   uses this value to determine how to retrieve and process data from a
--   recommender model when it sends messages that use the template, if the
--   template contains message variables for recommendation data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:EmailTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateRequest_tags</a> - A string-to-string map of key-value
--   pairs that defines the tags to associate with the message template.
--   Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.
newEmailTemplateRequest :: EmailTemplateRequest

-- | Provides information about the content and settings for a message

--   channel.

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailTemplateResponse</a> with all optional

--   parameter in your request.

--   associated tag value.

--   format, when the message template was last modified.

--   format, when the message template was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:EmailTemplateResponse'</a>,

--   template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateType:EmailTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateResponse_templateType</a> - The type of channel that
--   the message template is designed for. For an email template, this
--   value is EMAIL.
newEmailTemplateResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> EmailTemplateResponse

-- | Specifies an endpoint to create or update and the settings and
--   attributes to set or change for the endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointBatchItem</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointBatchItem
EndpointBatchItem' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Double) -> Maybe EndpointLocation -> Maybe EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EndpointUser -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ChannelType -> EndpointBatchItem

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointBatchItem</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestId:EndpointBatchItem'</a>,
--   <a>endpointBatchItem_requestId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   request to create or update the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:EndpointBatchItem'</a>,
--   <a>endpointBatchItem_metrics</a> - One or more custom metrics that
--   your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint for the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:EndpointBatchItem'</a>,
--   <a>endpointBatchItem_location</a> - The geographic information for the
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:demographic:EndpointBatchItem'</a>,
--   <a>endpointBatchItem_demographic</a> - The demographic information for
--   the endpoint, such as the time zone and platform.
--   
--   <a>$sel:address:EndpointBatchItem'</a>,
--   <a>endpointBatchItem_address</a> - The destination address for
--   messages or push notifications that you send to the endpoint. The
--   address varies by channel. For a push-notification channel, use the
--   token provided by the push notification service, such as an Apple Push
--   Notification service (APNs) device token or a Firebase Cloud Messaging
--   (FCM) registration token. For the SMS channel, use a phone number in
--   E.164 format, such as +12065550100. For the email channel, use an
--   email address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:effectiveDate:EndpointBatchItem'</a>,
--   <a>endpointBatchItem_effectiveDate</a> - The date and time, in ISO
--   8601 format, when the endpoint was created or updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:user:EndpointBatchItem'</a>, <a>endpointBatchItem_user</a> -
--   One or more custom attributes that describe the user who's associated
--   with the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:EndpointBatchItem'</a>,
--   <a>endpointBatchItem_attributes</a> - One or more custom attributes
--   that describe the endpoint by associating a name with an array of
--   values. For example, the value of a custom attribute named Interests
--   might be: ["Science", "Music", "Travel"]. You can use these attributes
--   as filter criteria when you create segments. Attribute names are case
--   sensitive.
--   
--   An attribute name can contain up to 50 characters. An attribute value
--   can contain up to 100 characters. When you define the name of a custom
--   attribute, avoid using the following characters: number sign (#),
--   colon (:), question mark (?), backslash (\), and slash (/). The Amazon
--   Pinpoint console can't display attribute names that contain these
--   characters. This restriction doesn't apply to attribute values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointStatus:EndpointBatchItem'</a>,
--   <a>endpointBatchItem_endpointStatus</a> - Specifies whether to send
--   messages or push notifications to the endpoint. Valid values are:
--   ACTIVE, messages are sent to the endpoint; and, INACTIVE, messages
--   aren’t sent to the endpoint.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint automatically sets this value to ACTIVE when you
--   create an endpoint or update an existing endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint
--   automatically sets this value to INACTIVE if you update another
--   endpoint that has the same address specified by the Address property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:optOut:EndpointBatchItem'</a>, <a>endpointBatchItem_optOut</a>
--   - Specifies whether the user who's associated with the endpoint has
--   opted out of receiving messages and push notifications from you.
--   Possible values are: ALL, the user has opted out and doesn't want to
--   receive any messages or push notifications; and, NONE, the user hasn't
--   opted out and wants to receive all messages and push notifications.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:EndpointBatchItem'</a>, <a>endpointBatchItem_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the endpoint in the context of the batch.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelType:EndpointBatchItem'</a>,
--   <a>endpointBatchItem_channelType</a> - The channel to use when sending
--   messages or push notifications to the endpoint.
newEndpointBatchItem :: EndpointBatchItem

-- | Specifies a batch of endpoints to create or update and the settings
--   and attributes to set or change for each endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointBatchRequest</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointBatchRequest
EndpointBatchRequest' :: [EndpointBatchItem] -> EndpointBatchRequest

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointBatchRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:EndpointBatchRequest'</a>,
--   <a>endpointBatchRequest_item</a> - An array that defines the endpoints
--   to create or update and, for each endpoint, the property values to set
--   or change. An array can contain a maximum of 100 items.
newEndpointBatchRequest :: EndpointBatchRequest

-- | Specifies demographic information about an endpoint, such as the
--   applicable time zone and platform.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointDemographic</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointDemographic
EndpointDemographic' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> EndpointDemographic

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointDemographic</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:EndpointDemographic'</a>,
--   <a>endpointDemographic_platform</a> - The platform of the endpoint
--   device, such as ios.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platformVersion:EndpointDemographic'</a>,
--   <a>endpointDemographic_platformVersion</a> - The platform version of
--   the endpoint device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:locale:EndpointDemographic'</a>,
--   <a>endpointDemographic_locale</a> - The locale of the endpoint, in the
--   following format: the ISO 639-1 alpha-2 code, followed by an
--   underscore (_), followed by an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appVersion:EndpointDemographic'</a>,
--   <a>endpointDemographic_appVersion</a> - The version of the app that's
--   associated with the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:model:EndpointDemographic'</a>,
--   <a>endpointDemographic_model</a> - The model name or number of the
--   endpoint device, such as iPhone or SM-G900F.
--   
--   <a>$sel:make:EndpointDemographic'</a>, <a>endpointDemographic_make</a>
--   - The manufacturer of the endpoint device, such as apple or samsung.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modelVersion:EndpointDemographic'</a>,
--   <a>endpointDemographic_modelVersion</a> - The model version of the
--   endpoint device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timezone:EndpointDemographic'</a>,
--   <a>endpointDemographic_timezone</a> - The time zone of the endpoint,
--   specified as a tz database name value, such as America/Los_Angeles.
newEndpointDemographic :: EndpointDemographic

-- | Provides the status code and message that result from processing data
--   for an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointItemResponse</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointItemResponse
EndpointItemResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> EndpointItemResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointItemResponse</a> with all optional fields

newEndpointItemResponse :: EndpointItemResponse

-- | Specifies geographic information about an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointLocation</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointLocation
EndpointLocation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> EndpointLocation

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointLocation</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:postalCode:EndpointLocation'</a>,
--   <a>endpointLocation_postalCode</a> - The postal or ZIP code for the
--   area where the endpoint is located.
--   
--   <a>$sel:latitude:EndpointLocation'</a>,
--   <a>endpointLocation_latitude</a> - The latitude coordinate of the
--   endpoint location, rounded to one decimal place.
--   
--   <a>$sel:country:EndpointLocation'</a>, <a>endpointLocation_country</a>
--   - The two-character code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, for the
--   country or region where the endpoint is located. For example, US for
--   the United States.
--   
--   <a>$sel:city:EndpointLocation'</a>, <a>endpointLocation_city</a> - The
--   name of the city where the endpoint is located.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:EndpointLocation'</a>, <a>endpointLocation_region</a> -
--   The name of the region where the endpoint is located. For locations in
--   the United States, this value is the name of a state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:longitude:EndpointLocation'</a>,
--   <a>endpointLocation_longitude</a> - The longitude coordinate of the
--   endpoint location, rounded to one decimal place.
newEndpointLocation :: EndpointLocation

-- | Provides information about the delivery status and results of sending
--   a message directly to an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointMessageResult</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointMessageResult
EndpointMessageResult' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DeliveryStatus -> Int -> EndpointMessageResult

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointMessageResult</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:address:EndpointMessageResult'</a>,
--   <a>endpointMessageResult_address</a> - The endpoint address that the
--   message was delivered to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusMessage:EndpointMessageResult'</a>,
--   <a>endpointMessageResult_statusMessage</a> - The status message for
--   delivering the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:updatedToken:EndpointMessageResult'</a>,
--   <a>endpointMessageResult_updatedToken</a> - For push notifications
--   that are sent through the GCM channel, specifies whether the
--   endpoint's device registration token was updated as part of delivering
--   the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageId:EndpointMessageResult'</a>,
--   <a>endpointMessageResult_messageId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   message that was sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStatus:EndpointMessageResult'</a>,
--   <a>endpointMessageResult_deliveryStatus</a> - The delivery status of
--   the message. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DUPLICATE - The endpoint address is a duplicate of another
--   endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message
--   again.</li>
--   <li>OPT_OUT - The user who's associated with the endpoint has opted
--   out of receiving messages from you. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to
--   send the message again.</li>
--   <li>PERMANENT_FAILURE - An error occurred when delivering the message
--   to the endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message
--   again.</li>
--   <li>SUCCESSFUL - The message was successfully delivered to the
--   endpoint.</li>
--   <li>TEMPORARY_FAILURE - A temporary error occurred. Amazon Pinpoint
--   won't attempt to send the message again.</li>
--   <li>THROTTLED - Amazon Pinpoint throttled the operation to send the
--   message to the endpoint.</li>
--   <li>TIMEOUT - The message couldn't be sent within the timeout
--   period.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN_FAILURE - An unknown error occurred.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusCode:EndpointMessageResult'</a>,
--   <a>endpointMessageResult_statusCode</a> - The downstream service
--   status code for delivering the message.
newEndpointMessageResult :: DeliveryStatus -> Int -> EndpointMessageResult

-- | Specifies the channel type and other settings for an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointRequest</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointRequest
EndpointRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Double) -> Maybe EndpointLocation -> Maybe EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EndpointUser -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ChannelType -> EndpointRequest

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestId:EndpointRequest'</a>,
--   <a>endpointRequest_requestId</a> - The unique identifier for the most
--   recent request to update the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:EndpointRequest'</a>, <a>endpointRequest_metrics</a> -
--   One or more custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint
--   for the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:EndpointRequest'</a>, <a>endpointRequest_location</a>
--   - The geographic information for the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:demographic:EndpointRequest'</a>,
--   <a>endpointRequest_demographic</a> - The demographic information for
--   the endpoint, such as the time zone and platform.
--   
--   <a>$sel:address:EndpointRequest'</a>, <a>endpointRequest_address</a> -
--   The destination address for messages or push notifications that you
--   send to the endpoint. The address varies by channel. For a
--   push-notification channel, use the token provided by the push
--   notification service, such as an Apple Push Notification service
--   (APNs) device token or a Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) registration
--   token. For the SMS channel, use a phone number in E.164 format, such
--   as +12065550100. For the email channel, use an email address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:effectiveDate:EndpointRequest'</a>,
--   <a>endpointRequest_effectiveDate</a> - The date and time, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the endpoint is updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:user:EndpointRequest'</a>, <a>endpointRequest_user</a> - One
--   or more custom attributes that describe the user who's associated with
--   the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:EndpointRequest'</a>,
--   <a>endpointRequest_attributes</a> - One or more custom attributes that
--   describe the endpoint by associating a name with an array of values.
--   For example, the value of a custom attribute named Interests might be:
--   ["Science", "Music", "Travel"]. You can use these attributes as filter
--   criteria when you create segments. Attribute names are case sensitive.
--   
--   An attribute name can contain up to 50 characters. An attribute value
--   can contain up to 100 characters. When you define the name of a custom
--   attribute, avoid using the following characters: number sign (#),
--   colon (:), question mark (?), backslash (\), and slash (/). The Amazon
--   Pinpoint console can't display attribute names that contain these
--   characters. This restriction doesn't apply to attribute values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointStatus:EndpointRequest'</a>,
--   <a>endpointRequest_endpointStatus</a> - Specifies whether to send
--   messages or push notifications to the endpoint. Valid values are:
--   ACTIVE, messages are sent to the endpoint; and, INACTIVE, messages
--   aren’t sent to the endpoint.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint automatically sets this value to ACTIVE when you
--   create an endpoint or update an existing endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint
--   automatically sets this value to INACTIVE if you update another
--   endpoint that has the same address specified by the Address property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:optOut:EndpointRequest'</a>, <a>endpointRequest_optOut</a> -
--   Specifies whether the user who's associated with the endpoint has
--   opted out of receiving messages and push notifications from you.
--   Possible values are: ALL, the user has opted out and doesn't want to
--   receive any messages or push notifications; and, NONE, the user hasn't
--   opted out and wants to receive all messages and push notifications.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelType:EndpointRequest'</a>,
--   <a>endpointRequest_channelType</a> - The channel to use when sending
--   messages or push notifications to the endpoint.
newEndpointRequest :: EndpointRequest

-- | Provides information about the channel type and other settings for an
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointResponse</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointResponse
EndpointResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Double) -> Maybe EndpointLocation -> Maybe EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EndpointUser -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ChannelType -> EndpointResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestId:EndpointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>endpointResponse_requestId</a> - The unique identifier for the most
--   recent request to update the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:EndpointResponse'</a>, <a>endpointResponse_metrics</a>
--   - One or more custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint
--   for the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:EndpointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>endpointResponse_location</a> - The geographic information for the
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:demographic:EndpointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>endpointResponse_demographic</a> - The demographic information for
--   the endpoint, such as the time zone and platform.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cohortId:EndpointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>endpointResponse_cohortId</a> - A number from 0-99 that represents
--   the cohort that the endpoint is assigned to. Endpoints are grouped
--   into cohorts randomly, and each cohort contains approximately 1
--   percent of the endpoints for an application. Amazon Pinpoint assigns
--   cohorts to the holdout or treatment allocations for campaigns.
--   
--   <a>$sel:address:EndpointResponse'</a>, <a>endpointResponse_address</a>
--   - The destination address for messages or push notifications that you
--   send to the endpoint. The address varies by channel. For example, the
--   address for a push-notification channel is typically the token
--   provided by a push notification service, such as an Apple Push
--   Notification service (APNs) device token or a Firebase Cloud Messaging
--   (FCM) registration token. The address for the SMS channel is a phone
--   number in E.164 format, such as +12065550100. The address for the
--   email channel is an email address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:effectiveDate:EndpointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>endpointResponse_effectiveDate</a> - The date and time, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the endpoint was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:user:EndpointResponse'</a>, <a>endpointResponse_user</a> - One
--   or more custom user attributes that your app reports to Amazon
--   Pinpoint for the user who's associated with the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:EndpointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>endpointResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application that's associated with the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:EndpointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>endpointResponse_attributes</a> - One or more custom attributes
--   that describe the endpoint by associating a name with an array of
--   values. For example, the value of a custom attribute named Interests
--   might be: ["Science", "Music", "Travel"]. You can use these attributes
--   as filter criteria when you create segments.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointStatus:EndpointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>endpointResponse_endpointStatus</a> - Specifies whether messages or
--   push notifications are sent to the endpoint. Possible values are:
--   ACTIVE, messages are sent to the endpoint; and, INACTIVE, messages
--   aren’t sent to the endpoint.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint automatically sets this value to ACTIVE when you
--   create an endpoint or update an existing endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint
--   automatically sets this value to INACTIVE if you update another
--   endpoint that has the same address specified by the Address property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:optOut:EndpointResponse'</a>, <a>endpointResponse_optOut</a> -
--   Specifies whether the user who's associated with the endpoint has
--   opted out of receiving messages and push notifications from you.
--   Possible values are: ALL, the user has opted out and doesn't want to
--   receive any messages or push notifications; and, NONE, the user hasn't
--   opted out and wants to receive all messages and push notifications.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:EndpointResponse'</a>, <a>endpointResponse_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier that you assigned to the endpoint. The identifier
--   should be a globally unique identifier (GUID) to ensure that it
--   doesn't conflict with other endpoint identifiers that are associated
--   with the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:EndpointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>endpointResponse_creationDate</a> - The date and time, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the endpoint was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelType:EndpointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>endpointResponse_channelType</a> - The channel that's used when
--   sending messages or push notifications to the endpoint.
newEndpointResponse :: EndpointResponse

-- | Specifies the content, including message variables and attributes, to
--   use in a message that's sent directly to an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointSendConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointSendConfiguration
EndpointSendConfiguration' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> EndpointSendConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:EndpointSendConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>endpointSendConfiguration_substitutions</a> - A map of the message
--   variables to merge with the variables specified for the default
--   message (DefaultMessage.Substitutions). The variables specified in
--   this map take precedence over all other variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:titleOverride:EndpointSendConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>endpointSendConfiguration_titleOverride</a> - The title or subject
--   line of the message. If specified, this value overrides the default
--   message title or subject line.
--   
--   <a>$sel:context:EndpointSendConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>endpointSendConfiguration_context</a> - A map of custom attributes
--   to attach to the message for the address. Attribute names are case
--   sensitive.
--   
--   For a push notification, this payload is added to the data.pinpoint
--   object. For an email or text message, this payload is added to
--   email/SMS delivery receipt event attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawContent:EndpointSendConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>endpointSendConfiguration_rawContent</a> - The raw, JSON-formatted
--   string to use as the payload for the message. If specified, this value
--   overrides all other values for the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bodyOverride:EndpointSendConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>endpointSendConfiguration_bodyOverride</a> - The body of the
--   message. If specified, this value overrides the default message body.
newEndpointSendConfiguration :: EndpointSendConfiguration

--   attribute, avoid using the following characters: number sign (#),

-- | Specifies information about an event that reports data to Amazon
--   Pinpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEvent</a> smart constructor.
data Event
Event' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Double) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Session -> Text -> Text -> Event

-- | Create a value of <a>Event</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientSdkVersion:Event'</a>, <a>event_clientSdkVersion</a> -
--   The version of the SDK that's running on the client device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:Event'</a>, <a>event_metrics</a> - One or more custom
--   metrics that are associated with the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appVersionCode:Event'</a>, <a>event_appVersionCode</a> - The
--   version number of the app that's recording the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appTitle:Event'</a>, <a>event_appTitle</a> - The title of the
--   app that's recording the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appPackageName:Event'</a>, <a>event_appPackageName</a> - The
--   package name of the app that's recording the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:Event'</a>, <a>event_attributes</a> - One or more
--   custom attributes that are associated with the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sdkName:Event'</a>, <a>event_sdkName</a> - The name of the SDK
--   that's being used to record the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:session:Event'</a>, <a>event_session</a> - Information about
--   the session in which the event occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventType:Event'</a>, <a>event_eventType</a> - The name of the
--   event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestamp:Event'</a>, <a>event_timestamp</a> - The date and
--   time, in ISO 8601 format, when the event occurred.
newEvent :: Text -> Text -> Event

-- | Specifies the conditions to evaluate for an event that applies to an
--   activity in a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventCondition</a> smart constructor.
data EventCondition
EventCondition' :: Maybe EventDimensions -> Maybe Text -> EventCondition

-- | Create a value of <a>EventCondition</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:EventCondition'</a>,
--   <a>eventCondition_dimensions</a> - The dimensions for the event filter
--   to use for the activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageActivity:EventCondition'</a>,
--   <a>eventCondition_messageActivity</a> - The message identifier
--   (message_id) for the message to use when determining whether message
--   events meet the condition.
newEventCondition :: EventCondition

-- | Specifies the dimensions for an event filter that determines when a
--   campaign is sent or a journey activity is performed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventDimensions</a> smart constructor.
data EventDimensions
EventDimensions' :: Maybe (HashMap Text MetricDimension) -> Maybe SetDimension -> Maybe (HashMap Text AttributeDimension) -> EventDimensions

-- | Create a value of <a>EventDimensions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:EventDimensions'</a>, <a>eventDimensions_metrics</a> -
--   One or more custom metrics that your application reports to Amazon
--   Pinpoint. You can use these metrics as selection criteria when you
--   create an event filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventType:EventDimensions'</a>,
--   <a>eventDimensions_eventType</a> - The name of the event that causes
--   the campaign to be sent or the journey activity to be performed. This
--   can be a standard event that Amazon Pinpoint generates, such as
--   _email.delivered. For campaigns, this can also be a custom event
--   that's specific to your application. For information about standard
--   events, see <a>Streaming Amazon Pinpoint Events</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Pinpoint Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:EventDimensions'</a>,
--   <a>eventDimensions_attributes</a> - One or more custom attributes that
--   your application reports to Amazon Pinpoint. You can use these
--   attributes as selection criteria when you create an event filter.
newEventDimensions :: EventDimensions

-- | Specifies the settings for an event that causes a campaign to be sent
--   or a journey activity to be performed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventFilter</a> smart constructor.
data EventFilter
EventFilter' :: FilterType -> EventDimensions -> EventFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>EventFilter</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filterType:EventFilter'</a>, <a>eventFilter_filterType</a> -
--   The type of event that causes the campaign to be sent or the journey
--   activity to be performed. Valid values are: SYSTEM, sends the campaign
--   or performs the activity when a system event occurs; and, ENDPOINT,
--   sends the campaign or performs the activity when an endpoint event
--   (Events resource) occurs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:EventFilter'</a>, <a>eventFilter_dimensions</a> -
--   The dimensions for the event filter to use for the campaign or the
--   journey activity.
newEventFilter :: FilterType -> EventDimensions -> EventFilter

-- | Provides the status code and message that result from processing an
--   event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventItemResponse</a> smart constructor.
data EventItemResponse
EventItemResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> EventItemResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>EventItemResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:EventItemResponse'</a>,
--   <a>eventItemResponse_message</a> - A custom message that's returned in
--   the response as a result of processing the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusCode:EventItemResponse'</a>,
--   <a>eventItemResponse_statusCode</a> - The status code that's returned
--   in the response as a result of processing the event. Possible values
--   are: 202, for events that were accepted; and, 400, for events that
--   weren't valid.
newEventItemResponse :: EventItemResponse

-- | Specifies the settings for an event that causes a journey activity to

newEventStartCondition :: EventStartCondition

-- | Specifies settings for publishing event data to an Amazon Kinesis data
--   stream or an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventStream</a> smart constructor.
data EventStream
EventStream' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> EventStream

-- | Create a value of <a>EventStream</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedBy:EventStream'</a>,
--   <a>eventStream_lastUpdatedBy</a> - The IAM user who last modified the
--   event stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:EventStream'</a>,
--   <a>eventStream_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601 format,
--   when the event stream was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:externalId:EventStream'</a>, <a>eventStream_externalId</a> -
--   (Deprecated) Your AWS account ID, which you assigned to an external ID
--   key in an IAM trust policy. Amazon Pinpoint previously used this value
--   to assume an IAM role when publishing event data, but we removed this
--   requirement. We don't recommend use of external IDs for IAM roles that
--   are assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:EventStream'</a>,
--   <a>eventStream_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application to publish event data for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:EventStream'</a>, <a>eventStream_roleArn</a> - The AWS
--   Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon
--   Pinpoint to publish event data to the stream in your AWS account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationStreamArn:EventStream'</a>,
--   <a>eventStream_destinationStreamArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis data stream or Amazon Kinesis Data
--   Firehose delivery stream to publish event data to.
--   
--   For a Kinesis data stream, the ARN format is:
--   arn:aws:kinesis:region:account-id:stream/stream_name
--   
--   For a Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream, the ARN format is:
--   arn:aws:firehose:region:account-id:deliverystream/stream_name
newEventStream :: Text -> Text -> Text -> EventStream

--   properties that are associated with the event.
newEventsBatch :: PublicEndpoint -> EventsBatch

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventsRequest</a> smart constructor.

--   ID acts as a key that has an EventsBatch object as its value.
newEventsRequest :: EventsRequest

--   associated with.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data EventsResponse

--   map that contains a multipart response for each endpoint. For each
--   item in this object, the endpoint ID is the key and the item response
--   is the value. If no item response exists, the value can also be one of
--   the following: 202, the request was processed successfully; or 400,
--   the payload wasn't valid or required fields were missing.
newEventsResponse :: EventsResponse

-- | Specifies the settings for a job that exports endpoint definitions to

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExportJobRequest</a> smart constructor.
data ExportJobRequest

-- | Create a value of <a>ExportJobRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   <a>exportJobRequest_segmentId</a> - The identifier for the segment to
--   export endpoint definitions from. If you don't specify this value,
--   Amazon Pinpoint exports definitions for all the endpoints that are
--   associated with the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentVersion:ExportJobRequest'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobRequest_segmentVersion</a> - The version of the segment to
--   export endpoint definitions from, if specified.

--   <a>exportJobRequest_s3UrlPrefix</a> - The URL of the location in an
--   Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket where you want to
--   export endpoint definitions to. This location is typically a folder
--   that contains multiple files. The URL should be in the following
--   format: s3://bucket-name/folder-name/.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:ExportJobRequest'</a>, <a>exportJobRequest_roleArn</a>
--   - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to access the
--   Amazon S3 location where you want to export endpoint definitions to.
newExportJobRequest :: Text -> Text -> ExportJobRequest

-- | Provides information about the resource settings for a job that
--   exports endpoint definitions to a file. The file can be added directly
--   to an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket by using the
--   Amazon Pinpoint API or downloaded directly to a computer by using the
--   Amazon Pinpoint console.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExportJobResource</a> smart constructor.
data ExportJobResource

-- | Create a value of <a>ExportJobResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   that the endpoint definitions were exported from. If this value isn't
--   present, Amazon Pinpoint exported definitions for all the endpoints
--   that are associated with the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentVersion:ExportJobResource'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResource_segmentVersion</a> - The version of the segment
--   that the endpoint definitions were exported from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3UrlPrefix:ExportJobResource'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResource_s3UrlPrefix</a> - The URL of the location in an
--   Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket where the endpoint
--   definitions were exported to. This location is typically a folder that
--   contains multiple files. The URL should be in the following format:
--   s3://bucket-name/folder-name/.

--   <a>exportJobResource_roleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of

--   Amazon Pinpoint to access the Amazon S3 location where the endpoint
--   definitions were exported to.
newExportJobResource :: Text -> Text -> ExportJobResource

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of a job that
--   exports endpoint definitions to a file. The file can be added directly
--   to an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket by using the
--   Amazon Pinpoint API or downloaded directly to a computer by using the
--   Amazon Pinpoint console.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExportJobResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ExportJobResponse
ExportJobResponse' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> JobStatus -> Text -> Text -> ExportJobResource -> Text -> Text -> ExportJobResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>ExportJobResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:completedPieces:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_completedPieces</a> - The number of pieces that
--   were processed successfully (completed) by the export job, as of the
--   time of the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failedPieces:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_failedPieces</a> - The number of pieces that
--   weren't processed successfully (failed) by the export job, as of the
--   time of the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalProcessed:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_totalProcessed</a> - The total number of endpoint
--   definitions that were processed by the export job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failures:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_failures</a> - An array of entries, one for each
--   of the first 100 entries that weren't processed successfully (failed)
--   by the export job, if any.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalPieces:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_totalPieces</a> - The total number of pieces that
--   must be processed to complete the export job. Each piece consists of
--   an approximately equal portion of the endpoint definitions that are
--   part of the export job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionDate:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_completionDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the export job was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalFailures:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_totalFailures</a> - The total number of endpoint
--   definitions that weren't processed successfully (failed) by the export
--   job, typically because an error, such as a syntax error, occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobStatus:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_jobStatus</a> - The status of the export job. The
--   job status is FAILED if Amazon Pinpoint wasn't able to process one or
--   more pieces in the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601 format,
--   when the export job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ExportJobResponse'</a>, <a>exportJobResponse_type</a> -
--   The job type. This value is EXPORT for export jobs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:definition:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_definition</a> - The resource settings that apply
--   to the export job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ExportJobResponse'</a>, <a>exportJobResponse_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the export job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:ExportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportJobResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application that's associated with the export job.
newExportJobResponse :: JobStatus -> Text -> Text -> ExportJobResource -> Text -> Text -> ExportJobResponse

newExportJobsResponse :: ExportJobsResponse

-- | Specifies the status and settings of the GCM channel for an

--   Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGCMChannelRequest</a> smart constructor.
data GCMChannelRequest

--   omitted.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   channel for the application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:apiKey:GCMChannelRequest'</a>, <a>gCMChannelRequest_apiKey</a>
--   - The Web API Key, also referred to as an <i>API_KEY</i> or <i>server
--   key</i>, that you received from Google to communicate with Google
--   services.
newGCMChannelRequest :: Text -> GCMChannelRequest

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of the GCM channel
--   for an application. The GCM channel enables Amazon Pinpoint to send
--   push notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM),

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGCMChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GCMChannelResponse
