--   Google to communicate with Google services.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:GCMChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>gCMChannelResponse_platform</a> - The type of messaging or
--   notification platform for the channel. For the GCM channel, this value
--   is GCM.
newGCMChannelResponse :: Text -> Text -> GCMChannelResponse

-- | Specifies the settings for a one-time message that's sent directly to
--   an endpoint through the GCM channel. The GCM channel enables Amazon
--   Pinpoint to send messages to the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM),
--   formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGCMMessage</a> smart constructor.
data GCMMessage
GCMMessage' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> GCMMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>GCMMessage</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_substitutions</a>
--   - The default message variables to use in the notification message.
--   You can override the default variables with individual address
--   variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:silentPush:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_silentPush</a> -
--   Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification,
--   which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's
--   device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as
--   updating an app's configuration or supporting phone home
--   functionality.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageIconUrl:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_imageIconUrl</a> -
--   The URL of the large icon image to display in the content view of the
--   push notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:priority:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_priority</a> -
--   para&gt;normal - The notification might be delayed. Delivery is
--   optimized for battery usage on the recipient's device. Use this value
--   unless immediate delivery is required.
--   
--   /listitem&gt;
--   
--   high - The notification is sent immediately and might wake a sleeping
--   device.
--   
--   /para&gt;
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the FCM priority parameter
--   when it sends the notification message to FCM.
--   
--   The equivalent values for Apple Push Notification service (APNs) are
--   5, for normal, and 10, for high. If you specify an APNs value for this
--   property, Amazon Pinpoint accepts and converts the value to the
--   corresponding FCM value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawContent:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_rawContent</a> - The
--   raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the notification
--   message. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the
--   message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_data</a> - The JSON data
--   payload to use for the push notification, if the notification is a
--   silent push notification. This payload is added to the
--   data.pinpoint.jsonBody object of the notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:restrictedPackageName:GCMMessage'</a>,
--   <a>gCMMessage_restrictedPackageName</a> - The package name of the
--   application where registration tokens must match in order for the
--   recipient to receive the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:smallImageIconUrl:GCMMessage'</a>,
--   <a>gCMMessage_smallImageIconUrl</a> - The URL of the small icon image
--   to display in the status bar and the content view of the push
--   notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_body</a> - The body of the
--   notification message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeToLive:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_timeToLive</a> - The
--   amount of time, in seconds, that FCM should store and attempt to
--   deliver the push notification, if the service is unable to deliver the
--   notification the first time. If you don't specify this value, FCM
--   defaults to the maximum value, which is 2,419,200 seconds (28 days).
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the FCM time_to_live parameter
--   when it sends the notification message to FCM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_url</a> - The URL to open
--   in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the
--   push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sound:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_sound</a> - The sound to
--   play when the recipient receives the push notification. You can use
--   the default stream or specify the file name of a sound resource that's
--   bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound file must
--   reside in /res/raw/.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_action</a> - The action
--   to occur if the recipient taps the push notification. Valid values
--   are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of
--   the Android platform.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:collapseKey:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_collapseKey</a> -
--   An arbitrary string that identifies a group of messages that can be
--   collapsed to ensure that only the last message is sent when delivery
--   can resume. This helps avoid sending too many instances of the same
--   messages when the recipient's device comes online again or becomes
--   active.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint specifies this value in the Firebase Cloud Messaging
--   (FCM) collapse_key parameter when it sends the notification message to
--   FCM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageUrl:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_imageUrl</a> - The URL
--   of an image to display in the push notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_title</a> - The title to
--   display above the notification message on the recipient's device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iconReference:GCMMessage'</a>, <a>gCMMessage_iconReference</a>
--   - The icon image name of the asset saved in your app.
newGCMMessage :: GCMMessage

-- | Specifies the GPS coordinates of a location.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGPSCoordinates</a> smart constructor.
data GPSCoordinates
GPSCoordinates' :: Double -> Double -> GPSCoordinates

-- | Create a value of <a>GPSCoordinates</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:latitude:GPSCoordinates'</a>, <a>gPSCoordinates_latitude</a> -
--   The latitude coordinate of the location.
--   
--   <a>$sel:longitude:GPSCoordinates'</a>, <a>gPSCoordinates_longitude</a>
--   - The longitude coordinate of the location.
newGPSCoordinates :: Double -> Double -> GPSCoordinates

-- | Specifies GPS-based criteria for including or excluding endpoints from
--   a segment.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGPSPointDimension</a> smart constructor.
data GPSPointDimension
GPSPointDimension' :: Maybe Double -> GPSCoordinates -> GPSPointDimension

-- | Create a value of <a>GPSPointDimension</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:rangeInKilometers:GPSPointDimension'</a>,
--   <a>gPSPointDimension_rangeInKilometers</a> - The range, in kilometers,
--   from the GPS coordinates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:coordinates:GPSPointDimension'</a>,
--   <a>gPSPointDimension_coordinates</a> - The GPS coordinates to measure
--   distance from.
newGPSPointDimension :: GPSCoordinates -> GPSPointDimension

-- | Specifies the settings for a holdout activity in a journey. This type
--   of activity stops a journey for a specified percentage of
--   participants.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHoldoutActivity</a> smart constructor.
data HoldoutActivity
HoldoutActivity' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> HoldoutActivity

-- | Create a value of <a>HoldoutActivity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextActivity:HoldoutActivity'</a>,
--   <a>holdoutActivity_nextActivity</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   next activity to perform, after performing the holdout activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:percentage:HoldoutActivity'</a>,
--   <a>holdoutActivity_percentage</a> - The percentage of participants who
--   shouldn't continue the journey.
--   
--   To determine which participants are held out, Amazon Pinpoint applies
--   a probability-based algorithm to the percentage that you specify.
--   Therefore, the actual percentage of participants who are held out may
--   not be equal to the percentage that you specify.
newHoldoutActivity :: Int -> HoldoutActivity

-- | Specifies the settings for a job that imports endpoint definitions
--   from an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newImportJobRequest</a> smart constructor.
data ImportJobRequest
ImportJobRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DefinitionFormat -> Text -> Text -> ImportJobRequest

-- | Create a value of <a>ImportJobRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentName:ImportJobRequest'</a>,
--   <a>importJobRequest_segmentName</a> - A custom name for the segment
--   that's created by the import job, if the value of the DefineSegment
--   property is true.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defineSegment:ImportJobRequest'</a>,
--   <a>importJobRequest_defineSegment</a> - Specifies whether to create a
--   segment that contains the endpoints, when the endpoint definitions are
--   imported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:registerEndpoints:ImportJobRequest'</a>,
--   <a>importJobRequest_registerEndpoints</a> - Specifies whether to
--   register the endpoints with Amazon Pinpoint, when the endpoint
--   definitions are imported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:externalId:ImportJobRequest'</a>,
--   <a>importJobRequest_externalId</a> - (Deprecated) Your AWS account ID,
--   which you assigned to an external ID key in an IAM trust policy.
--   Amazon Pinpoint previously used this value to assume an IAM role when
--   importing endpoint definitions, but we removed this requirement. We
--   don't recommend use of external IDs for IAM roles that are assumed by
--   Amazon Pinpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentId:ImportJobRequest'</a>,
--   <a>importJobRequest_segmentId</a> - The identifier for the segment to
--   update or add the imported endpoint definitions to, if the import job
--   is meant to update an existing segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:format:ImportJobRequest'</a>, <a>importJobRequest_format</a> -
--   The format of the files that contain the endpoint definitions to
--   import. Valid values are: CSV, for comma-separated values format; and,
--   JSON, for newline-delimited JSON format. If the Amazon S3 location
--   stores multiple files that use different formats, Amazon Pinpoint
--   imports data only from the files that use the specified format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Url:ImportJobRequest'</a>, <a>importJobRequest_s3Url</a> -
--   The URL of the Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket that
--   contains the endpoint definitions to import. This location can be a
--   folder or a single file. If the location is a folder, Amazon Pinpoint
--   imports endpoint definitions from the files in this location,
--   including any subfolders that the folder contains.
--   
--   The URL should be in the following format:
--   s3://bucket-name/folder-name/file-name. The location can end with the
--   key for an individual object or a prefix that qualifies multiple
--   objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:ImportJobRequest'</a>, <a>importJobRequest_roleArn</a>
--   - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to access the
--   Amazon S3 location to import endpoint definitions from.
newImportJobRequest :: DefinitionFormat -> Text -> Text -> ImportJobRequest

-- | Provides information about the resource settings for a job that
--   imports endpoint definitions from one or more files. The files can be
--   stored in an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket or
--   uploaded directly from a computer by using the Amazon Pinpoint
--   console.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newImportJobResource</a> smart constructor.
data ImportJobResource
ImportJobResource' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DefinitionFormat -> Text -> Text -> ImportJobResource

-- | Create a value of <a>ImportJobResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentName:ImportJobResource'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResource_segmentName</a> - The custom name for the segment
--   that's created by the import job, if the value of the DefineSegment
--   property is true.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defineSegment:ImportJobResource'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResource_defineSegment</a> - Specifies whether the import
--   job creates a segment that contains the endpoints, when the endpoint
--   definitions are imported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:registerEndpoints:ImportJobResource'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResource_registerEndpoints</a> - Specifies whether the
--   import job registers the endpoints with Amazon Pinpoint, when the
--   endpoint definitions are imported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:externalId:ImportJobResource'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResource_externalId</a> - (Deprecated) Your AWS account
--   ID, which you assigned to an external ID key in an IAM trust policy.
--   Amazon Pinpoint previously used this value to assume an IAM role when
--   importing endpoint definitions, but we removed this requirement. We
--   don't recommend use of external IDs for IAM roles that are assumed by
--   Amazon Pinpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentId:ImportJobResource'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResource_segmentId</a> - The identifier for the segment
--   that the import job updates or adds endpoint definitions to, if the
--   import job updates an existing segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:format:ImportJobResource'</a>, <a>importJobResource_format</a>
--   - The format of the files that contain the endpoint definitions to
--   import. Valid values are: CSV, for comma-separated values format; and,
--   JSON, for newline-delimited JSON format.
--   
--   If the files are stored in an Amazon S3 location and that location
--   contains multiple files that use different formats, Amazon Pinpoint
--   imports data only from the files that use the specified format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Url:ImportJobResource'</a>, <a>importJobResource_s3Url</a> -
--   The URL of the Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket that
--   contains the endpoint definitions to import. This location can be a
--   folder or a single file. If the location is a folder, Amazon Pinpoint
--   imports endpoint definitions from the files in this location,
--   including any subfolders that the folder contains.
--   
--   The URL should be in the following format:
--   s3://bucket-name/folder-name/file-name. The location can end with the
--   key for an individual object or a prefix that qualifies multiple
--   objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:ImportJobResource'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResource_roleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorizes
--   Amazon Pinpoint to access the Amazon S3 location to import endpoint
--   definitions from.
newImportJobResource :: DefinitionFormat -> Text -> Text -> ImportJobResource

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of a job that
--   imports endpoint definitions from one or more files. The files can be
--   stored in an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket or
--   uploaded directly from a computer by using the Amazon Pinpoint
--   console.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newImportJobResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ImportJobResponse
ImportJobResponse' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> JobStatus -> Text -> Text -> ImportJobResource -> Text -> Text -> ImportJobResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>ImportJobResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:completedPieces:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_completedPieces</a> - The number of pieces that
--   were processed successfully (completed) by the import job, as of the
--   time of the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failedPieces:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_failedPieces</a> - The number of pieces that
--   weren't processed successfully (failed) by the import job, as of the
--   time of the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalProcessed:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_totalProcessed</a> - The total number of endpoint
--   definitions that were processed by the import job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failures:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_failures</a> - An array of entries, one for each
--   of the first 100 entries that weren't processed successfully (failed)
--   by the import job, if any.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalPieces:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_totalPieces</a> - The total number of pieces that
--   must be processed to complete the import job. Each piece consists of
--   an approximately equal portion of the endpoint definitions that are
--   part of the import job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionDate:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_completionDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the import job was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalFailures:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_totalFailures</a> - The total number of endpoint
--   definitions that weren't processed successfully (failed) by the import
--   job, typically because an error, such as a syntax error, occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobStatus:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_jobStatus</a> - The status of the import job. The
--   job status is FAILED if Amazon Pinpoint wasn't able to process one or
--   more pieces in the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601 format,
--   when the import job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ImportJobResponse'</a>, <a>importJobResponse_type</a> -
--   The job type. This value is IMPORT for import jobs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:definition:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_definition</a> - The resource settings that apply
--   to the import job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ImportJobResponse'</a>, <a>importJobResponse_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the import job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:ImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application that's associated with the import job.
newImportJobResponse :: JobStatus -> Text -> Text -> ImportJobResource -> Text -> Text -> ImportJobResponse

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of all the import
--   jobs that are associated with an application or segment. An import job
--   is a job that imports endpoint definitions from one or more files.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newImportJobsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ImportJobsResponse
ImportJobsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> [ImportJobResponse] -> ImportJobsResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>ImportJobsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ImportJobsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>importJobsResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use in a
--   subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated
--   response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:ImportJobsResponse'</a>, <a>importJobsResponse_item</a> -
--   An array of responses, one for each import job that's associated with
--   the application (Import Jobs resource) or segment (Segment Import Jobs
--   resource).
newImportJobsResponse :: ImportJobsResponse

--   the template.

--   <a>inAppTemplateRequest_content</a> - The content of the message, can
--   include up to 5 modals. Each modal must contain a message, a header,
--   and background color. ImageUrl and buttons are optional.

-- | In-App Template Response.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInAppTemplateResponse</a> smart constructor.
data InAppTemplateResponse
InAppTemplateResponse' :: Maybe Layout -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InAppMessageContent] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> InAppTemplateResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>InAppTemplateResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>inAppTemplateResponse_templateDescription</a> - The description of
--   the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:InAppTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateResponse_content</a> - The content of the message, can
--   include up to 5 modals. Each modal must contain a message, a header,
--   and background color. ImageUrl and buttons are optional.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customConfig:InAppTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateResponse_customConfig</a> - Custom config to be sent
--   to client.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:InAppTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateResponse_version</a> - The version id of the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:InAppTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateResponse_tags</a> - A string-to-string map of
--   key-value pairs that defines the tags to associate with the message
--   template. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated
--   tag value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:InAppTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The last modified date
--   of the template.

--   <a>$sel:creationDate:InAppTemplateResponse'</a>,

--   template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:InAppTemplateResponse'</a>,

--   
--   <a>$sel:templateType:InAppTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>inAppTemplateResponse_templateType</a> - The type of the template.
newInAppTemplateResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> InAppTemplateResponse

-- | Provides the results of a query that retrieved the data for a standard
--   execution metric that applies to a journey activity, and provides
--   information about that query.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse
JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse' :: HashMap Text Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse_metrics</a> - A JSON object
--   that contains the results of the query. The results vary depending on
--   the type of activity (ActivityType). For information about the
--   structure and contents of the results, see the <a>Amazon Pinpoint
--   Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:journeyId:JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse_journeyId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the journey that the metric applies to.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastEvaluatedTime:JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse_lastEvaluatedTime</a> - The
--   date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when Amazon Pinpoint last evaluated
--   the execution status of the activity and updated the data for the
--   metric.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:journeyActivityId:JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse_journeyActivityId</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the activity that the metric applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activityType:JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse_activityType</a> - The type
--   of activity that the metric applies to. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>CONDITIONAL_SPLIT - For a yes/no split activity, which is an
--   activity that sends participants down one of two paths in a
--   journey.</li>
--   <li>HOLDOUT - For a holdout activity, which is an activity that stops
--   a journey for a specified percentage of participants.</li>
--   <li>MESSAGE - For an email activity, which is an activity that sends
--   an email message to participants.</li>
--   <li>MULTI_CONDITIONAL_SPLIT - For a multivariate split activity, which
--   is an activity that sends participants down one of as many as five
--   paths in a journey.</li>
--   <li>RANDOM_SPLIT - For a random split activity, which is an activity
--   that sends specified percentages of participants down one of as many
--   as five paths in a journey.</li>
--   <li>WAIT - For a wait activity, which is an activity that waits for a
--   certain amount of time or until a specific date and time before moving
--   participants to the next activity in a journey.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse_applicationId</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the application that the metric applies to.
newJourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> JourneyExecutionActivityMetricsResponse

-- | Specifies limits on the messages that a journey can send and the
--   number of times participants can enter a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneyLimits</a> smart constructor.
data JourneyLimits
JourneyLimits' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> JourneyLimits

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneyLimits</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:messagesPerSecond:JourneyLimits'</a>,
--   <a>journeyLimits_messagesPerSecond</a> - The maximum number of
--   messages that the journey can send each second.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointReentryCap:JourneyLimits'</a>,
--   <a>journeyLimits_endpointReentryCap</a> - The maximum number of times
--   that a participant can enter the journey. The maximum value is 100. To
--   allow participants to enter the journey an unlimited number of times,
--   set this value to 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointReentryInterval:JourneyLimits'</a>,
--   <a>journeyLimits_endpointReentryInterval</a> - Minimum time that must
--   pass before an endpoint can re-enter a given journey. The duration
--   should use an ISO 8601 format, such as PT1H.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dailyCap:JourneyLimits'</a>, <a>journeyLimits_dailyCap</a> -
--   The maximum number of messages that the journey can send to a single
--   participant during a 24-hour period. The maximum value is 100.
newJourneyLimits :: JourneyLimits

-- | Specifies the message configuration for a push notification that's
--   sent to participants in a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneyPushMessage</a> smart constructor.
data JourneyPushMessage
JourneyPushMessage' :: Maybe Text -> JourneyPushMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneyPushMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeToLive:JourneyPushMessage'</a>,
--   <a>journeyPushMessage_timeToLive</a> - The number of seconds that the
--   push notification service should keep the message, if the service is
--   unable to deliver the notification the first time. This value is
--   converted to an expiration value when it's sent to a push-notification
--   service. If this value is 0, the service treats the notification as if
--   it expires immediately and the service doesn't store or try to deliver
--   the notification again.
--   
--   This value doesn't apply to messages that are sent through the Amazon
--   Device Messaging (ADM) service.
newJourneyPushMessage :: JourneyPushMessage

-- | Provides information about the status, configuration, and other
--   settings for a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneyResponse</a> smart constructor.
data JourneyResponse
JourneyResponse' :: Maybe State -> Maybe Text -> Maybe JourneySchedule -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe (HashMap Text Activity) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe JourneyLimits -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe QuietTime -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StartCondition -> Maybe JourneyChannelSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> JourneyResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneyResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:JourneyResponse'</a>, <a>journeyResponse_state</a> - The
--   current status of the journey. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DRAFT - The journey is being developed and hasn't been published
--   yet.</li>
--   <li>ACTIVE - The journey has been developed and published. Depending
--   on the journey's schedule, the journey may currently be running or
--   scheduled to start running at a later time. If a journey's status is
--   ACTIVE, you can't add, change, or remove activities from it.</li>
--   <li>COMPLETED - The journey has been published and has finished
--   running. All participants have entered the journey and no participants
--   are waiting to complete the journey or any activities in the
--   journey.</li>
--   <li>CANCELLED - The journey has been stopped. If a journey's status is
--   CANCELLED, you can't add, change, or remove activities or segment
--   settings from the journey.</li>
--   <li>CLOSED - The journey has been published and has started running.
--   It may have also passed its scheduled end time, or passed its
--   scheduled start time and a refresh frequency hasn't been specified for
--   it. If a journey's status is CLOSED, you can't add participants to it,
--   and no existing participants can enter the journey for the first time.
--   However, any existing participants who are currently waiting to start
--   an activity may continue the journey.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the journey was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schedule:JourneyResponse'</a>, <a>journeyResponse_schedule</a>
--   - The schedule settings for the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:localTime:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_localTime</a> - Specifies whether the journey's
--   scheduled start and end times use each participant's local time. If
--   this value is true, the schedule uses each participant's local time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activities:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_activities</a> - A map that contains a set of
--   Activity objects, one object for each activity in the journey. For
--   each Activity object, the key is the unique identifier (string) for an
--   activity and the value is the settings for the activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:refreshOnSegmentUpdate:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_refreshOnSegmentUpdate</a> - Specifies whether a
--   journey should be refreshed on segment update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limits:JourneyResponse'</a>, <a>journeyResponse_limits</a> -
--   The messaging and entry limits for the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:waitForQuietTime:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_waitForQuietTime</a> - Specifies whether endpoints
--   in quiet hours should enter a wait till the end of their quiet hours.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quietTime:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_quietTime</a> - The quiet time settings for the
--   journey. Quiet time is a specific time range when a journey doesn't
--   send messages to participants, if all the following conditions are
--   met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint for the
--   participant is set to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the participant's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   journey.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the participant's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   journey.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the participant will
--   receive messages from the journey, even if quiet time is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startActivity:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_startActivity</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   first activity in the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601 format,
--   when the journey was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startCondition:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_startCondition</a> - The segment that defines which
--   users are participants in the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:journeyChannelSettings:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_journeyChannelSettings</a> - The channel-specific
--   configurations for the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:refreshFrequency:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_refreshFrequency</a> - The frequency with which
--   Amazon Pinpoint evaluates segment and event data for the journey, as a
--   duration in ISO 8601 format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:JourneyResponse'</a>, <a>journeyResponse_tags</a> - This
--   object is not used or supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:JourneyResponse'</a>, <a>journeyResponse_name</a> - The
--   name of the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:JourneyResponse'</a>, <a>journeyResponse_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:JourneyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeyResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application that the journey applies to.
newJourneyResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> JourneyResponse

-- | Specifies the sender ID and message type for an SMS message that's
--   sent to participants in a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneySMSMessage</a> smart constructor.
data JourneySMSMessage
JourneySMSMessage' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MessageType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> JourneySMSMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneySMSMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:originationNumber:JourneySMSMessage'</a>,
--   <a>journeySMSMessage_originationNumber</a> - The long code to send the
--   SMS message from. This value should be one of the dedicated long codes
--   that's assigned to your AWS account. Although it isn't required, we
--   recommend that you specify the long code using an E.164 format to
--   ensure prompt and accurate delivery of the message. For example,
--   +12065550100.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateId:JourneySMSMessage'</a>,
--   <a>journeySMSMessage_templateId</a> - The template ID received from
--   the regulatory body for sending SMS in your country.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageType:JourneySMSMessage'</a>,
--   <a>journeySMSMessage_messageType</a> - The SMS message type. Valid
--   values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages that are critical or
--   time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and PROMOTIONAL (for
--   messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive, such as marketing
--   messages).
--   
--   <a>$sel:senderId:JourneySMSMessage'</a>,
--   <a>journeySMSMessage_senderId</a> - The sender ID to display as the
--   sender of the message on a recipient's device. Support for sender IDs
--   varies by country or region. For more information, see <a>Supported
--   Countries and Regions</a> in the Amazon Pinpoint User Guide.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entityId:JourneySMSMessage'</a>,
--   <a>journeySMSMessage_entityId</a> - The entity ID or Principal Entity
--   (PE) id received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in your
--   country.
newJourneySMSMessage :: JourneySMSMessage

-- | Specifies the schedule settings for a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneySchedule</a> smart constructor.
data JourneySchedule
JourneySchedule' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> JourneySchedule

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneySchedule</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:JourneySchedule'</a>,
--   <a>journeySchedule_startTime</a> - The scheduled time, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the journey began or will begin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:JourneySchedule'</a>, <a>journeySchedule_endTime</a> -
--   The scheduled time, in ISO 8601 format, when the journey ended or will
--   end.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timezone:JourneySchedule'</a>, <a>journeySchedule_timezone</a>
--   - The starting UTC offset for the journey schedule, if the value of
--   the journey's LocalTime property is true. Valid values are: UTC,
--   UTC+01, UTC+02, UTC+03, UTC+03:30, UTC+04, UTC+04:30, UTC+05,
--   UTC+05:30, UTC+05:45, UTC+06, UTC+06:30, UTC+07, UTC+08, UTC+08:45,
--   UTC+09, UTC+09:30, UTC+10, UTC+10:30, UTC+11, UTC+12, UTC+12:45,
--   UTC+13, UTC+13:45, UTC-02, UTC-02:30, UTC-03, UTC-03:30, UTC-04,
--   UTC-05, UTC-06, UTC-07, UTC-08, UTC-09, UTC-09:30, UTC-10, and UTC-11.
newJourneySchedule :: JourneySchedule

-- | Changes the status of a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneyStateRequest</a> smart constructor.
data JourneyStateRequest
JourneyStateRequest' :: Maybe State -> JourneyStateRequest

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneyStateRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:JourneyStateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>journeyStateRequest_state</a> - The status of the journey.
--   Currently, Supported values are ACTIVE, PAUSED, and CANCELLED
--   
--   If you cancel a journey, Amazon Pinpoint continues to perform
--   activities that are currently in progress, until those activities are
--   complete. Amazon Pinpoint also continues to collect and aggregate
--   analytics data for those activities, until they are complete, and any
--   activities that were complete when you cancelled the journey.
--   
--   After you cancel a journey, you can't add, change, or remove any
--   activities from the journey. In addition, Amazon Pinpoint stops
--   evaluating the journey and doesn't perform any activities that haven't
--   started.
--   
--   When the journey is paused, Amazon Pinpoint continues to perform
--   activities that are currently in progress, until those activities are
--   complete. Endpoints will stop entering journeys when the journey is
--   paused and will resume entering the journey after the journey is
--   resumed. For wait activities, wait time is paused when the journey is
--   paused. Currently, PAUSED only supports journeys with a segment
--   refresh interval.
newJourneyStateRequest :: JourneyStateRequest

-- | Provides information about the status, configuration, and other
--   settings for all the journeys that are associated with an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJourneysResponse</a> smart constructor.
data JourneysResponse
JourneysResponse' :: Maybe Text -> [JourneyResponse] -> JourneysResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>JourneysResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:JourneysResponse'</a>,
--   <a>journeysResponse_nextToken</a> - The string to use in a subsequent
--   request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This
--   value is null if there are no additional pages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:item:JourneysResponse'</a>, <a>journeysResponse_item</a> - An
--   array of responses, one for each journey that's associated with the
--   application.
newJourneysResponse :: JourneysResponse

-- | Specifies the content and settings for a push notification that's sent
--   to recipients of a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessage</a> smart constructor.
data Message
Message' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Message

-- | Create a value of <a>Message</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:silentPush:Message'</a>, <a>message_silentPush</a> - Specifies
--   whether the notification is a silent push notification, which is a
--   push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's device. Silent
--   push notifications can be used for cases such as updating an app's
--   configuration, displaying messages in an in-app message center, or
--   supporting phone home functionality.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageIconUrl:Message'</a>, <a>message_imageIconUrl</a> - The
--   URL of the image to display as the push-notification icon, such as the
--   icon for the app.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawContent:Message'</a>, <a>message_rawContent</a> - The raw,
--   JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the notification
--   message. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the
--   message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:Message'</a>, <a>message_body</a> - The body of the
--   notification message. The maximum number of characters is 200.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeToLive:Message'</a>, <a>message_timeToLive</a> - The
--   number of seconds that the push-notification service should keep the
--   message, if the service is unable to deliver the notification the
--   first time. This value is converted to an expiration value when it's
--   sent to a push-notification service. If this value is 0, the service
--   treats the notification as if it expires immediately and the service
--   doesn't store or try to deliver the notification again.
--   
--   This value doesn't apply to messages that are sent through the Amazon
--   Device Messaging (ADM) service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageSmallIconUrl:Message'</a>,
--   <a>message_imageSmallIconUrl</a> - The URL of the image to display as
--   the small, push-notification icon, such as a small version of the icon
--   for the app.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jsonBody:Message'</a>, <a>message_jsonBody</a> - The JSON
--   payload to use for a silent push notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:Message'</a>, <a>message_url</a> - The URL to open in a
--   recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push
--   notification and the value of the Action property is URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:Message'</a>, <a>message_action</a> - The action to
--   occur if a recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it
--   was sent to the background. This is the default action.</li>
--   <li>DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user
--   interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of
--   iOS and Android.</li>
--   <li>URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens
--   and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageUrl:Message'</a>, <a>message_imageUrl</a> - The URL of an
--   image to display in the push notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaUrl:Message'</a>, <a>message_mediaUrl</a> - The URL of
--   the image or video to display in the push notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:Message'</a>, <a>message_title</a> - The title to
--   display above the notification message on a recipient's device.
newMessage :: Message

-- | Provides information about an API request or response.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessageBody</a> smart constructor.
data MessageBody
MessageBody' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> MessageBody

-- | Create a value of <a>MessageBody</a> with all optional fields omitted.

--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>$sel:requestID:MessageBody'</a>, <a>messageBody_requestID</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the request or response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:MessageBody'</a>, <a>messageBody_message</a> - The
--   message that's returned from the API.
newMessageBody :: MessageBody

-- | Specifies the message configuration settings for a campaign.
--

data MessageConfiguration
MessageConfiguration' :: Maybe Message -> Maybe Message -> Maybe Message -> Maybe CampaignCustomMessage -> Maybe Message -> Maybe CampaignSmsMessage -> Maybe CampaignEmailMessage -> Maybe CampaignInAppMessage -> Maybe Message -> MessageConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>MessageConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>messageConfiguration_aPNSMessage</a> - The message that the
--   campaign sends through the APNs (Apple Push Notification service)
--   channel. If specified, this message overrides the default message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gCMMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_gCMMessage</a> - The message that the campaign
--   sends through the GCM channel, which enables Amazon Pinpoint to send
--   push notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM),
--   formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service. If specified, this
--   message overrides the default message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,

--   the campaign sends through all the channels that are configured for
--   the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_customMessage</a> - The message that the
--   campaign sends through a custom channel, as specified by the delivery
--   configuration (CustomDeliveryConfiguration) settings for the campaign.
--   If specified, this message overrides the default message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:aDMMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_aDMMessage</a> - The message that the campaign
--   sends through the ADM (Amazon Device Messaging) channel. If specified,
--   this message overrides the default message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sMSMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_sMSMessage</a> - The message that the campaign
--   sends through the SMS channel. If specified, this message overrides
--   the default message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_emailMessage</a> - The message that the
--   campaign sends through the email channel. If specified, this message
--   overrides the default message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inAppMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_inAppMessage</a> - The in-app message
--   configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:baiduMessage:MessageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>messageConfiguration_baiduMessage</a> - The message that the
--   campaign sends through the Baidu (Baidu Cloud Push) channel. If
--   specified, this message overrides the default message.
newMessageConfiguration :: MessageConfiguration

-- | Specifies the configuration and other settings for a message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessageRequest</a> smart constructor.
data MessageRequest
MessageRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text AddressConfiguration) -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration -> Maybe (HashMap Text EndpointSendConfiguration) -> DirectMessageConfiguration -> MessageRequest

-- | Create a value of <a>MessageRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:traceId:MessageRequest'</a>, <a>messageRequest_traceId</a> -
--   The unique identifier for tracing the message. This identifier is
--   visible to message recipients.
--   
--   <a>$sel:context:MessageRequest'</a>, <a>messageRequest_context</a> - A
--   map of custom attributes to attach to the message. For a push
--   notification, this payload is added to the data.pinpoint object. For
--   an email or text message, this payload is added to email/SMS delivery
--   receipt event attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:addresses:MessageRequest'</a>, <a>messageRequest_addresses</a>
--   - A map of key-value pairs, where each key is an address and each
--   value is an <a>AddressConfiguration</a> object. An address can be a
--   push notification token, a phone number, or an email address. You can
--   use an <a>AddressConfiguration</a> object to tailor the message for an
--   address by specifying settings such as content overrides and message
--   variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateConfiguration:MessageRequest'</a>,
--   <a>messageRequest_templateConfiguration</a> - The message template to
--   use for the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpoints:MessageRequest'</a>, <a>messageRequest_endpoints</a>
--   - A map of key-value pairs, where each key is an endpoint ID and each
--   value is an <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> object. You can use an
--   <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> object to tailor the message for an
--   endpoint by specifying settings such as content overrides and message
--   variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfiguration:MessageRequest'</a>,
--   <a>messageRequest_messageConfiguration</a> - The settings and content
--   for the default message and any default messages that you defined for
--   specific channels.
newMessageRequest :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> MessageRequest

-- | Provides information about the results of a request to send a message
--   to an endpoint address.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessageResponse</a> smart constructor.
data MessageResponse
MessageResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text MessageResult) -> Maybe (HashMap Text EndpointMessageResult) -> Text -> MessageResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>MessageResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestId:MessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>messageResponse_requestId</a> - The identifier for the original
--   request that the message was delivered for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:result:MessageResponse'</a>, <a>messageResponse_result</a> - A
--   map that contains a multipart response for each address (email
--   address, phone number, or push notification token) that the message
--   was sent to. In the map, the address is the key and the result is the
--   value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointResult:MessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>messageResponse_endpointResult</a> - A map that contains a
--   multipart response for each address that the message was sent to. In
--   the map, the endpoint ID is the key and the result is the value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:MessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>messageResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application that was used to send the message.
newMessageResponse :: Text -> MessageResponse

-- | Provides information about the results of sending a message directly
--   to an endpoint address.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessageResult</a> smart constructor.
data MessageResult
MessageResult' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DeliveryStatus -> Int -> MessageResult

-- | Create a value of <a>MessageResult</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusMessage:MessageResult'</a>,
--   <a>messageResult_statusMessage</a> - The status message for delivering
--   the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:updatedToken:MessageResult'</a>,
--   <a>messageResult_updatedToken</a> - For push notifications that are
--   sent through the GCM channel, specifies whether the endpoint's device
--   registration token was updated as part of delivering the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageId:MessageResult'</a>, <a>messageResult_messageId</a> -
--   The unique identifier for the message that was sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStatus:MessageResult'</a>,
--   <a>messageResult_deliveryStatus</a> - The delivery status of the
--   message. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DUPLICATE - The endpoint address is a duplicate of another
--   endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message
--   again.</li>
--   <li>OPT_OUT - The user who's associated with the endpoint address has
--   opted out of receiving messages from you. Amazon Pinpoint won't
--   attempt to send the message again.</li>
--   <li>PERMANENT_FAILURE - An error occurred when delivering the message
--   to the endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the
--   message again.</li>
--   <li>SUCCESSFUL - The message was successfully delivered to the
--   endpoint address.</li>
--   <li>TEMPORARY_FAILURE - A temporary error occurred. Amazon Pinpoint
--   won't attempt to send the message again.</li>
--   <li>THROTTLED - Amazon Pinpoint throttled the operation to send the
--   message to the endpoint address.</li>
--   <li>TIMEOUT - The message couldn't be sent within the timeout
--   period.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN_FAILURE - An unknown error occurred.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusCode:MessageResult'</a>, <a>messageResult_statusCode</a>
--   - The downstream service status code for delivering the message.
newMessageResult :: DeliveryStatus -> Int -> MessageResult

data MetricDimension

--   GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL, and EQUAL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:MetricDimension'</a>, <a>metricDimension_value</a> - The
--   value to compare.
newMetricDimension :: Text -> Double -> MetricDimension

-- | Specifies the settings for a multivariate split activity in a journey.
--   This type of activity sends participants down one of as many as five
--   paths (including a default <i>Else</i> path) in a journey, based on
--   conditions that you specify.
--   
--   To create multivariate split activities that send participants down
--   different paths based on push notification events (such as Open or
--   Received events), your mobile app has to specify the User ID and
--   Endpoint ID values. For more information, see <a>Integrating Amazon
--   Pinpoint with your application</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint Developer
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMultiConditionalSplitActivity</a> smart constructor.
data MultiConditionalSplitActivity
MultiConditionalSplitActivity' :: Maybe [MultiConditionalBranch] -> Maybe WaitTime -> Maybe Text -> MultiConditionalSplitActivity

-- | Create a value of <a>MultiConditionalSplitActivity</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:branches:MultiConditionalSplitActivity'</a>,
--   <a>multiConditionalSplitActivity_branches</a> - The paths for the
--   activity, including the conditions for entering each path and the
--   activity to perform for each path.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evaluationWaitTime:MultiConditionalSplitActivity'</a>,
--   <a>multiConditionalSplitActivity_evaluationWaitTime</a> - The amount
--   of time to wait or the date and time when Amazon Pinpoint determines
--   whether the conditions are met.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultActivity:MultiConditionalSplitActivity'</a>,
--   <a>multiConditionalSplitActivity_defaultActivity</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the activity to perform for participants who don't meet
--   any of the conditions specified for other paths in the activity.
newMultiConditionalSplitActivity :: MultiConditionalSplitActivity

-- | Specifies a phone number to validate and retrieve information about.

-- | Provides information about a phone number.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNumberValidateResponse</a> smart constructor.
data NumberValidateResponse
NumberValidateResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NumberValidateResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>NumberValidateResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:carrier:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_carrier</a> - The carrier or service
--   provider that the phone number is currently registered with. In some
--   countries and regions, this value may be the carrier or service
--   provider that the phone number was originally registered with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:county:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_county</a> - The name of the county where
--   the phone number was originally registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:country:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_country</a> - The name of the country or
--   region where the phone number was originally registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:countryCodeNumeric:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_countryCodeNumeric</a> - The numeric code
--   for the country or region where the phone number was originally
--   registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:zipCode:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_zipCode</a> - The postal or ZIP code for the
--   location where the phone number was originally registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:originalPhoneNumber:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_originalPhoneNumber</a> - The phone number
--   that was sent in the request body.
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneTypeCode:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_phoneTypeCode</a> - The phone type,
--   represented by an integer. Valid values are: 0 (mobile), 1 (landline),
--   2 (VoIP), 3 (invalid), 4 (other), and 5 (prepaid).
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneType:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_phoneType</a> - The description of the phone
--   type. Valid values are: MOBILE, LANDLINE, VOIP, INVALID, PREPAID, and
--   OTHER.
--   
--   <a>$sel:city:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_city</a> - The name of the city where the
--   phone number was originally registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:countryCodeIso2:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_countryCodeIso2</a> - The two-character
--   code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, for the country or region where
--   the phone number was originally registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timezone:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_timezone</a> - The time zone for the
--   location where the phone number was originally registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:originalCountryCodeIso2:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_originalCountryCodeIso2</a> - The
--   two-character code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, that was sent in the
--   request body.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cleansedPhoneNumberNational:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_cleansedPhoneNumberNational</a> - The
--   cleansed phone number, in the format for the location where the phone
--   number was originally registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cleansedPhoneNumberE164:NumberValidateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>numberValidateResponse_cleansedPhoneNumberE164</a> - The cleansed
--   phone number, in E.164 format, for the location where the phone number
--   was originally registered.
newNumberValidateResponse :: NumberValidateResponse

-- | Specifies the properties and attributes of an endpoint that's
--   associated with an event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPublicEndpoint</a> smart constructor.
data PublicEndpoint
PublicEndpoint' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Double) -> Maybe EndpointLocation -> Maybe EndpointDemographic -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EndpointUser -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ChannelType -> PublicEndpoint

-- | Create a value of <a>PublicEndpoint</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestId:PublicEndpoint'</a>, <a>publicEndpoint_requestId</a>
--   - A unique identifier that's generated each time the endpoint is
--   updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:PublicEndpoint'</a>, <a>publicEndpoint_metrics</a> -
--   One or more custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint
--   for the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:PublicEndpoint'</a>, <a>publicEndpoint_location</a> -
--   The geographic information for the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:demographic:PublicEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>publicEndpoint_demographic</a> - The demographic information for
--   the endpoint, such as the time zone and platform.
--   
--   <a>$sel:address:PublicEndpoint'</a>, <a>publicEndpoint_address</a> -
--   The unique identifier for the recipient, such as a device token, email
--   address, or mobile phone number.
--   
--   <a>$sel:effectiveDate:PublicEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>publicEndpoint_effectiveDate</a> - The date and time, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the endpoint was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:user:PublicEndpoint'</a>, <a>publicEndpoint_user</a> - One or
--   more custom user attributes that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint
--   for the user who's associated with the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:PublicEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>publicEndpoint_attributes</a> - One or more custom attributes that
--   describe the endpoint by associating a name with an array of values.
--   You can use these attributes as filter criteria when you create
--   segments.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointStatus:PublicEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>publicEndpoint_endpointStatus</a> - Specifies whether to send
--   messages or push notifications to the endpoint. Valid values are:
--   ACTIVE, messages are sent to the endpoint; and, INACTIVE, messages
--   aren’t sent to the endpoint.
--   
--   Amazon Pinpoint automatically sets this value to ACTIVE when you
--   create an endpoint or update an existing endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint
--   automatically sets this value to INACTIVE if you update another
--   endpoint that has the same address specified by the Address property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:optOut:PublicEndpoint'</a>, <a>publicEndpoint_optOut</a> -
--   Specifies whether the user who's associated with the endpoint has
--   opted out of receiving messages and push notifications from you.
--   Possible values are: ALL, the user has opted out and doesn't want to
--   receive any messages or push notifications; and, NONE, the user hasn't
--   opted out and wants to receive all messages and push notifications.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelType:PublicEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>publicEndpoint_channelType</a> - The channel that's used when
--   sending messages or push notifications to the endpoint.
newPublicEndpoint :: PublicEndpoint

-- | Specifies the settings for a push notification activity in a journey.
--   This type of activity sends a push notification to participants.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPushMessageActivity</a> smart constructor.
data PushMessageActivity
PushMessageActivity' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe JourneyPushMessage -> PushMessageActivity

-- | Create a value of <a>PushMessageActivity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:PushMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>pushMessageActivity_templateName</a> - The name of the push
--   notification template to use for the message. If specified, this value
--   must match the name of an existing message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateVersion:PushMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>pushMessageActivity_templateVersion</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the version of the push notification template to use for the message.
--   If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing
--   template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version
--   identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextActivity:PushMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>pushMessageActivity_nextActivity</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the next activity to perform, after the message is sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfig:PushMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>pushMessageActivity_messageConfig</a> - Specifies the time to live
--   (TTL) value for push notifications that are sent to participants in a
--   journey.
newPushMessageActivity :: PushMessageActivity

--   of key-value pairs that defines the tags to associate with the message
--   template. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated
--   tag value.
newPushNotificationTemplateRequest :: PushNotificationTemplateRequest

-- | Specifies the start and end times that define a time range when
--   messages aren't sent to endpoints.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newQuietTime</a> smart constructor.
data QuietTime
QuietTime' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> QuietTime

-- | Create a value of <a>QuietTime</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:start:QuietTime'</a>, <a>quietTime_start</a> - The specific
--   time when quiet time begins. This value has to use 24-hour notation
--   and be in HH:MM format, where HH is the hour (with a leading zero, if
--   applicable) and MM is the minutes. For example, use 02:30 to represent
--   2:30 AM, or 14:30 to represent 2:30 PM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:end:QuietTime'</a>, <a>quietTime_end</a> - The specific time
--   when quiet time ends. This value has to use 24-hour notation and be in
--   HH:MM format, where HH is the hour (with a leading zero, if
--   applicable) and MM is the minutes. For example, use 02:30 to represent
--   2:30 AM, or 14:30 to represent 2:30 PM.
newQuietTime :: QuietTime

-- | Specifies the settings for a random split activity in a journey. This

--   journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRandomSplitEntry</a> smart constructor.
data RandomSplitEntry
RandomSplitEntry' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> RandomSplitEntry

-- | Create a value of <a>RandomSplitEntry</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   next activity to perform, after completing the activity for the path.
--   
--   <a>$sel:percentage:RandomSplitEntry'</a>,
--   <a>randomSplitEntry_percentage</a> - The percentage of participants to
--   send down the activity path.
--   
--   To determine which participants are sent down each path, Amazon
--   Pinpoint applies a probability-based algorithm to the percentages that
--   you specify for the paths. Therefore, the actual percentage of
--   participants who are sent down a path may not be equal to the
--   percentage that you specify.
newRandomSplitEntry :: RandomSplitEntry
