-- | Specifies criteria for including or excluding endpoints from a segment
--   based on how recently an endpoint was active.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecencyDimension</a> smart constructor.
data RecencyDimension
RecencyDimension' :: Duration -> RecencyType -> RecencyDimension

-- | Create a value of <a>RecencyDimension</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:duration:RecencyDimension'</a>,
--   <a>recencyDimension_duration</a> - The duration to use when
--   determining whether an endpoint is active or inactive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recencyType:RecencyDimension'</a>,
--   <a>recencyDimension_recencyType</a> - The type of recency dimension to
--   use for the segment. Valid values are: ACTIVE, endpoints that were
--   active within the specified duration are included in the segment; and,
--   INACTIVE, endpoints that weren't active within the specified duration
--   are included in the segment.
newRecencyDimension :: Duration -> RecencyType -> RecencyDimension

-- | Provides information about Amazon Pinpoint configuration settings for
--   retrieving and processing data from a recommender model.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecommenderConfigurationResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data RecommenderConfigurationResponse
RecommenderConfigurationResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> RecommenderConfigurationResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>RecommenderConfigurationResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationTransformerUri:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationTransformerUri</a> -
--   The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function that
--   Amazon Pinpoint invokes to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data that it retrieves from the recommender model.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationsDisplayName:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationsDisplayName</a> -
--   The custom display name for the standard endpoint or user attribute
--   (RecommendationItems) that temporarily stores recommended items for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This name appears in the
--   <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template editor on the Amazon Pinpoint
--   console.
--   
--   This value is null if the configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional
--   processing of recommendation data.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationProviderIdType:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationProviderIdType</a> -
--   The type of Amazon Pinpoint ID that's associated with unique user IDs
--   in the recommender model. This value enables the model to use
--   attribute and event data that’s specific to a particular endpoint or
--   user in an Amazon Pinpoint application. Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PINPOINT_ENDPOINT_ID - Each user in the model is associated with a
--   particular endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based
--   on endpoint IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. This is the default value.</li>
--   <li>PINPOINT_USER_ID - Each user in the model is associated with a
--   particular user and endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is
--   correlated based on user IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. If this value is
--   specified, an endpoint definition in Amazon Pinpoint has to specify
--   both a user ID (UserId) and an endpoint ID. Otherwise, messages won’t
--   be sent to the user's endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_attributes</a> - A map that
--   defines 1-10 custom endpoint or user attributes, depending on the
--   value for the RecommendationProviderIdType property. Each of these
--   attributes temporarily stores a recommended item that's retrieved from
--   the recommender model and sent to an AWS Lambda function for
--   additional processing. Each attribute can be used as a message
--   variable in a message template.
--   
--   This value is null if the configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional
--   processing of recommendation data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_name</a> - The custom name of the
--   configuration for the recommender model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_description</a> - The custom
--   description of the configuration for the recommender model.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationsPerMessage:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationsPerMessage</a> -
--   The number of recommended items that are retrieved from the model for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This number determines how many
--   recommended items are available for use in message variables.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationProviderUri:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationProviderUri</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender model that Amazon
--   Pinpoint retrieves the recommendation data from. This value is the ARN
--   of an Amazon Personalize campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date,
--   in extended ISO 8601 format, when the configuration for the
--   recommender model was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in
--   extended ISO 8601 format, when the configuration was created for the
--   recommender model.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationProviderRoleArn:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_recommendationProviderRoleArn</a>
--   - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to retrieve
--   recommendation data from the recommender model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:RecommenderConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>recommenderConfigurationResponse_id</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the recommender model configuration.
newRecommenderConfigurationResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> RecommenderConfigurationResponse

-- | Provides the results of a query that retrieved the data for a standard
--   metric that applies to an application, campaign, or journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResultRow</a> smart constructor.
data ResultRow
ResultRow' :: [ResultRowValue] -> [ResultRowValue] -> ResultRow

-- | Create a value of <a>ResultRow</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupedBys:ResultRow'</a>, <a>resultRow_groupedBys</a> - An
--   array of objects that defines the field and field values that were
--   used to group data in a result set that contains multiple results.
--   This value is null if the data in a result set isn’t grouped.
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:ResultRow'</a>, <a>resultRow_values</a> - An array of
--   objects that provides pre-aggregated values for a standard metric that
--   applies to an application, campaign, or journey.
newResultRow :: ResultRow

-- | Provides a single value and metadata about that value as part of an
--   array of query results for a standard metric that applies to an
--   application, campaign, or journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResultRowValue</a> smart constructor.
data ResultRowValue
ResultRowValue' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ResultRowValue

-- | Create a value of <a>ResultRowValue</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ResultRowValue'</a>, <a>resultRowValue_type</a> - The
--   data type of the value specified by the Value property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:ResultRowValue'</a>, <a>resultRowValue_value</a> - In a
--   Values object, the value for the metric that the query retrieved data
--   for. In a GroupedBys object, the value for the field that was used to
--   group data in a result set that contains multiple results (Values
--   objects).
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:ResultRowValue'</a>, <a>resultRowValue_key</a> - The
--   friendly name of the metric whose value is specified by the Value
--   property.
newResultRowValue :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ResultRowValue

--   display on recipients' devices when they receive messages from the SMS

-- | Provides information about the status and settings of the SMS channel
--   for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSMSChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SMSChannelResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>SMSChannelResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   when you send messages through the SMS channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:SMSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date and time, in ISO
--   8601 format, when the SMS channel was last modified.

--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_enabled</a> - Specifies whether the SMS channel
--   is enabled for the application.

--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_senderId</a> - The identity that displays on

--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_promotionalMessagesPerSecond</a> - The maximum
--   number of promotional messages that you can send through the SMS
--   channel each second.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isArchived:SMSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_isArchived</a> - Specifies whether the SMS
--   channel is archived.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:SMSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the application that the SMS channel applies to.
--

--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_version</a> - The current version of the SMS

--   retained only for backward compatibility.
--

--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_creationDate</a> - The date and time, in ISO
--   8601 format, when the SMS channel was enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedBy:SMSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_lastModifiedBy</a> - The user who last modified
--   the SMS channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasCredential:SMSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_hasCredential</a> - (Not used) This property is
--   retained only for backward compatibility.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:SMSChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSChannelResponse_platform</a> - The type of messaging or
--   notification platform for the channel. For the SMS channel, this value
--   is SMS.
newSMSChannelResponse :: Text -> SMSChannelResponse

-- | Specifies the default settings for a one-time SMS message that's sent
--   directly to an endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSMSMessage</a> smart constructor.
data SMSMessage
SMSMessage' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MessageType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> SMSMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>SMSMessage</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_substitutions</a>
--   - The message variables to use in the SMS message. You can override
--   the default variables with individual address variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:originationNumber:SMSMessage'</a>,
--   <a>sMSMessage_originationNumber</a> - The number to send the SMS
--   message from. This value should be one of the dedicated long or short
--   codes that's assigned to your AWS account. If you don't specify a long
--   or short code, Amazon Pinpoint assigns a random long code to the SMS
--   message and sends the message from that code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateId:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_templateId</a> - The
--   template ID received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in your
--   country.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_body</a> - The body of the
--   SMS message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageType:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_messageType</a> -
--   The SMS message type. Valid values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages
--   that are critical or time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and
--   PROMOTIONAL (for messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive,
--   such as marketing messages).
--   
--   <a>$sel:senderId:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_senderId</a> - The
--   sender ID to display as the sender of the message on a recipient's
--   device. Support for sender IDs varies by country or region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaUrl:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_mediaUrl</a> - This
--   field is reserved for future use.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entityId:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_entityId</a> - The
--   entity ID or Principal Entity (PE) id received from the regulatory
--   body for sending SMS in your country.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyword:SMSMessage'</a>, <a>sMSMessage_keyword</a> - The SMS
--   program name that you provided to AWS Support when you requested your
--   dedicated number.
newSMSMessage :: SMSMessage

-- | Specifies the settings for an SMS activity in a journey. This type of
--   activity sends a text message to participants.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSMSMessageActivity</a> smart constructor.
data SMSMessageActivity
SMSMessageActivity' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe JourneySMSMessage -> SMSMessageActivity

-- | Create a value of <a>SMSMessageActivity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:SMSMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>sMSMessageActivity_templateName</a> - The name of the SMS message
--   template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match
--   the name of an existing message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateVersion:SMSMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>sMSMessageActivity_templateVersion</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the version of the SMS template to use for the message. If specified,
--   this value must match the identifier for an existing template version.
--   To retrieve a list of versions and version identifiers for a template,
--   use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextActivity:SMSMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>sMSMessageActivity_nextActivity</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   next activity to perform, after the message is sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfig:SMSMessageActivity'</a>,
--   <a>sMSMessageActivity_messageConfig</a> - Specifies the sender ID and
--   message type for an SMS message that's sent to participants in a
--   journey.
newSMSMessageActivity :: SMSMessageActivity

-- | Specifies the content and settings for a message template that can be
--   used in text messages that are sent through the SMS channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSMSTemplateRequest</a> smart constructor.
data SMSTemplateRequest
SMSTemplateRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> SMSTemplateRequest

-- | Create a value of <a>SMSTemplateRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:SMSTemplateRequest'</a>, <a>sMSTemplateRequest_body</a> -
--   The message body to use in text messages that are based on the message
--   template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:SMSTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sMSTemplateRequest_templateDescription</a> - A custom description
--   of the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubstitutions:SMSTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sMSTemplateRequest_defaultSubstitutions</a> - A JSON object that
--   specifies the default values to use for message variables in the
--   message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key
--   defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding value
--   defines the default value for that variable. When you create a message
--   that's based on the template, you can override these defaults with
--   message-specific and address-specific variables and values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommenderId:SMSTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sMSTemplateRequest_recommenderId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the recommender model to use for the message template. Amazon Pinpoint
--   uses this value to determine how to retrieve and process data from a
--   recommender model when it sends messages that use the template, if the
--   template contains message variables for recommendation data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:SMSTemplateRequest'</a>, <a>sMSTemplateRequest_tags</a> -
--   A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags to
--   associate with the message template. Each tag consists of a required
--   tag key and an associated tag value.
newSMSTemplateRequest :: SMSTemplateRequest

-- | Provides information about the content and settings for a message
--   template that can be used in text messages that are sent through the
--   SMS channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSMSTemplateResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SMSTemplateResponse
SMSTemplateResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> SMSTemplateResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>SMSTemplateResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   - The message body that's used in text messages that are based on the
--   message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:SMSTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSTemplateResponse_templateDescription</a> - The custom
--   description of the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubstitutions:SMSTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSTemplateResponse_defaultSubstitutions</a> - The JSON object that
--   specifies the default values that are used for message variables in
--   the message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each
--   key defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding
--   value defines the default value for that variable.
--

--   <a>sMSTemplateResponse_version</a> - The unique identifier, as an
--   integer, for the active version of the message template, or the
--   version of the template that you specified by using the version
--   parameter in your request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommenderId:SMSTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSTemplateResponse_recommenderId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the recommender model that's used by the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:SMSTemplateResponse'</a>, <a>sMSTemplateResponse_tags</a>
--   - A string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags
--   that are associated with the message template. Each tag consists of a
--   required tag key and an associated tag value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:SMSTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSTemplateResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the message template was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:SMSTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSTemplateResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the message template was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:SMSTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSTemplateResponse_templateName</a> - The name of the message
--   template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateType:SMSTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sMSTemplateResponse_templateType</a> - The type of channel that the
--   message template is designed for. For an SMS template, this value is
--   SMS.
newSMSTemplateResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> SMSTemplateResponse

-- | Specifies the schedule settings for a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSchedule</a> smart constructor.
data Schedule
Schedule' :: Maybe Frequency -> Maybe QuietTime -> Maybe CampaignEventFilter -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Schedule

-- | Create a value of <a>Schedule</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:frequency:Schedule'</a>, <a>schedule_frequency</a> - Specifies
--   how often the campaign is sent or whether the campaign is sent in
--   response to a specific event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quietTime:Schedule'</a>, <a>schedule_quietTime</a> - The
--   default quiet time for the campaign. Quiet time is a specific time
--   range when a campaign doesn't send messages to endpoints, if all the
--   following conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set
--   to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   campaign.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   campaign.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the endpoint will
--   receive messages from the campaign, even if quiet time is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventFilter:Schedule'</a>, <a>schedule_eventFilter</a> - The
--   type of event that causes the campaign to be sent, if the value of the
--   Frequency property is EVENT.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isLocalTime:Schedule'</a>, <a>schedule_isLocalTime</a> -
--   Specifies whether the start and end times for the campaign schedule
--   use each recipient's local time. To base the schedule on each
--   recipient's local time, set this value to true.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:Schedule'</a>, <a>schedule_endTime</a> - The scheduled
--   time, in ISO 8601 format, when the campaign ended or will end.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timezone:Schedule'</a>, <a>schedule_timezone</a> - The
--   starting UTC offset for the campaign schedule, if the value of the
--   IsLocalTime property is true. Valid values are: UTC, UTC+01, UTC+02,
--   UTC+03, UTC+03:30, UTC+04, UTC+04:30, UTC+05, UTC+05:30, UTC+05:45,
--   UTC+06, UTC+06:30, UTC+07, UTC+08, UTC+09, UTC+09:30, UTC+10,
--   UTC+10:30, UTC+11, UTC+12, UTC+13, UTC-02, UTC-03, UTC-04, UTC-05,
--   UTC-06, UTC-07, UTC-08, UTC-09, UTC-10, and UTC-11.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:Schedule'</a>, <a>schedule_startTime</a> - The
--   scheduled time when the campaign began or will begin. Valid values
--   are: IMMEDIATE, to start the campaign immediately; or, a specific time
--   in ISO 8601 format.
newSchedule :: Text -> Schedule

--   was active.
newSegmentBehaviors :: SegmentBehaviors

-- | Specifies the dimension settings for a segment.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSegmentDimensions</a> smart constructor.
data SegmentDimensions
SegmentDimensions' :: Maybe (HashMap Text MetricDimension) -> Maybe SegmentLocation -> Maybe SegmentDemographics -> Maybe (HashMap Text AttributeDimension) -> Maybe SegmentBehaviors -> Maybe (HashMap Text AttributeDimension) -> SegmentDimensions

-- | Create a value of <a>SegmentDimensions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:SegmentDimensions'</a>,
--   <a>segmentDimensions_metrics</a> - One or more custom metrics to use
--   as criteria for the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:SegmentDimensions'</a>,
--   <a>segmentDimensions_location</a> - The location-based criteria, such
--   as region or GPS coordinates, for the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:demographic:SegmentDimensions'</a>,
--   <a>segmentDimensions_demographic</a> - The demographic-based criteria,
--   such as device platform, for the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userAttributes:SegmentDimensions'</a>,
--   <a>segmentDimensions_userAttributes</a> - One or more custom user
--   attributes to use as criteria for the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:behavior:SegmentDimensions'</a>,
--   <a>segmentDimensions_behavior</a> - The behavior-based criteria, such
--   as how recently users have used your app, for the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:SegmentDimensions'</a>,
--   <a>segmentDimensions_attributes</a> - One or more custom attributes to
--   use as criteria for the segment.
newSegmentDimensions :: SegmentDimensions

-- | Specifies the base segments and dimensions for a segment, and the
--   relationships between these base segments and dimensions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSegmentGroup</a> smart constructor.
data SegmentGroup
SegmentGroup' :: Maybe [SegmentReference] -> Maybe SourceType -> Maybe Type -> Maybe [SegmentDimensions] -> SegmentGroup

-- | Create a value of <a>SegmentGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceSegments:SegmentGroup'</a>,
--   <a>segmentGroup_sourceSegments</a> - The base segment to build the
--   segment on. A base segment, also referred to as a <i>source
--   segment</i>, defines the initial population of endpoints for a
--   segment. When you add dimensions to a segment, Amazon Pinpoint filters
--   the base segment by using the dimensions that you specify.
--   
--   You can specify more than one dimensional segment or only one imported
--   segment. If you specify an imported segment, the Amazon Pinpoint
--   console displays a segment size estimate that indicates the size of
--   the imported segment without any filters applied to it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceType:SegmentGroup'</a>, <a>segmentGroup_sourceType</a> -
--   Specifies how to handle multiple base segments for the segment. For
--   example, if you specify three base segments for the segment, whether
--   the resulting segment is based on all, any, or none of the base
--   segments.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':SegmentGroup'</a>, <a>segmentGroup_type</a> - Specifies
--   how to handle multiple dimensions for the segment. For example, if you
--   specify three dimensions for the segment, whether the resulting
--   segment includes endpoints that match all, any, or none of the
--   dimensions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:SegmentGroup'</a>, <a>segmentGroup_dimensions</a> -
--   An array that defines the dimensions for the segment.
newSegmentGroup :: SegmentGroup

-- | Specifies the settings that define the relationships between segment
--   groups for a segment.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSegmentGroupList</a> smart constructor.
data SegmentGroupList
SegmentGroupList' :: Maybe Include -> Maybe [SegmentGroup] -> SegmentGroupList

-- | Create a value of <a>SegmentGroupList</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:include:SegmentGroupList'</a>, <a>segmentGroupList_include</a>

--   example, if the segment includes three segment groups, whether the
--   resulting segment includes endpoints that match all, any, or none of
--   the segment groups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groups:SegmentGroupList'</a>, <a>segmentGroupList_groups</a> -
--   An array that defines the set of segment criteria to evaluate when
--   handling segment groups for the segment.
newSegmentGroupList :: SegmentGroupList

-- | Provides information about the import job that created a segment. An
--   import job is a job that creates a user segment by importing endpoint
--   definitions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSegmentImportResource</a> smart constructor.
data SegmentImportResource
SegmentImportResource' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Int) -> DefinitionFormat -> Text -> Int -> Text -> Text -> SegmentImportResource

-- | Create a value of <a>SegmentImportResource</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelCounts:SegmentImportResource'</a>,
--   <a>segmentImportResource_channelCounts</a> - The number of channel
--   types in the endpoint definitions that were imported to create the
--   segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:format:SegmentImportResource'</a>,
--   <a>segmentImportResource_format</a> - The format of the files that
--   were imported to create the segment. Valid values are: CSV, for
--   comma-separated values format; and, JSON, for newline-delimited JSON
--   format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Url:SegmentImportResource'</a>,
--   <a>segmentImportResource_s3Url</a> - The URL of the Amazon Simple
--   Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket that the endpoint definitions were
--   imported from to create the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:size:SegmentImportResource'</a>,
--   <a>segmentImportResource_size</a> - The number of endpoint definitions
--   that were imported successfully to create the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:externalId:SegmentImportResource'</a>,
--   <a>segmentImportResource_externalId</a> - (Deprecated) Your AWS
--   account ID, which you assigned to an external ID key in an IAM trust
--   policy. Amazon Pinpoint previously used this value to assume an IAM
--   role when importing endpoint definitions, but we removed this
--   requirement. We don't recommend use of external IDs for IAM roles that
--   are assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:SegmentImportResource'</a>,
--   <a>segmentImportResource_roleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that authorized
--   Amazon Pinpoint to access the Amazon S3 location to import endpoint
--   definitions from.
newSegmentImportResource :: DefinitionFormat -> Text -> Int -> Text -> Text -> SegmentImportResource

-- | Provides information about the configuration, dimension, and other
--   settings for a segment.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSegmentResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SegmentResponse
SegmentResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe SegmentGroupList -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe SegmentImportResource -> Maybe SegmentDimensions -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> SegmentType -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> SegmentResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>SegmentResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:SegmentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>segmentResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date and time when the
--   segment was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentGroups:SegmentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>segmentResponse_segmentGroups</a> - A list of one or more segment
--   groups that apply to the segment. Each segment group consists of zero
--   or more base segments and the dimensions that are applied to those
--   base segments.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:SegmentResponse'</a>, <a>segmentResponse_name</a> - The
--   name of the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:SegmentResponse'</a>, <a>segmentResponse_version</a> -
--   The version number of the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:importDefinition:SegmentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>segmentResponse_importDefinition</a> - The settings for the import
--   job that's associated with the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:SegmentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>segmentResponse_dimensions</a> - The dimension settings for the
--   segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:SegmentResponse'</a>, <a>segmentResponse_tags</a> - A
--   string-to-string map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags that
--   are associated with the segment. Each tag consists of a required tag
--   key and an associated tag value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentType:SegmentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>segmentResponse_segmentType</a> - The segment type. Valid values
--   are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DIMENSIONAL - A dynamic segment, which is a segment that uses
--   selection criteria that you specify and is based on endpoint data
--   that's reported by your app. Dynamic segments can change over
--   time.</li>
--   <li>IMPORT - A static segment, which is a segment that uses selection
--   criteria that you specify and is based on endpoint definitions that
--   you import from a file. Imported segments are static; they don't
--   change over time.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:SegmentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>segmentResponse_creationDate</a> - The date and time when the
--   segment was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:SegmentResponse'</a>, <a>segmentResponse_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:SegmentResponse'</a>, <a>segmentResponse_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the segment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationId:SegmentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>segmentResponse_applicationId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   application that the segment is associated with.
newSegmentResponse :: SegmentType -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> SegmentResponse

-- | Specifies the configuration and other settings for a message to send

data SendUsersMessageRequest

-- | Create a value of <a>SendUsersMessageRequest</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

--   tracing the message. This identifier is visible to message recipients.
--

--   <a>sendUsersMessageRequest_context</a> - A map of custom
--   attribute-value pairs. For a push notification, Amazon Pinpoint adds
--   these attributes to the data.pinpoint object in the body of the
--   notification payload. Amazon Pinpoint also provides these attributes
--   in the events that it generates for users-messages deliveries.

--   with <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> objects. You can use an
--   <a>EndpointSendConfiguration</a> object to tailor the message for a
--   user by specifying settings such as content overrides and message
--   variables.
newSendUsersMessageRequest :: DirectMessageConfiguration -> SendUsersMessageRequest

--   which endpoints the message was sent to, for each user. The object
--   lists user IDs and, for each user ID, provides the endpoint IDs that
--   the message was sent to. For each endpoint ID, it provides an
--   EndpointMessageResult object.

--   <a>setDimension_dimensionType</a> - The type of segment dimension to

--   are included in the segment; and, EXCLUSIVE, endpoints that match the
--   criteria are excluded from the segment.

--   criteria values to use for the segment dimension. Depending on the
--   value of the DimensionType property, endpoints are included or
--   excluded from the segment if their values match the criteria values.

-- | Specifies the contents of an email message, composed of a subject, a

data SimpleEmail

-- | Create a value of <a>SimpleEmail</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   subject line, or title, of the email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:textPart:SimpleEmail'</a>, <a>simpleEmail_textPart</a> - The
--   body of the email message, in plain text format. We recommend using
--   plain text format for email clients that don't render HTML content and
--   clients that are connected to high-latency networks, such as mobile
--   devices.
--   
--   <a>$sel:htmlPart:SimpleEmail'</a>, <a>simpleEmail_htmlPart</a> - The
--   body of the email message, in HTML format. We recommend using HTML
--   format for email clients that render HTML content. You can include
--   links, formatted text, and more in an HTML message.
newSimpleEmail :: SimpleEmail

data TagsModel

--

--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:TagsModel'</a>, <a>tagsModel_tags</a> - A
--   string-to-string map of key-value pairs that defines the tags for an
--   application, campaign, message template, or segment. Each of these
--   resources can have a maximum of 50 tags.
--   
--   Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.
--   The maximum length of a tag key is 128 characters. The maximum length
--   of a tag value is 256 characters.
newTagsModel :: TagsModel

-- | Specifies the name and version of the message template to use for the
--   message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemplate</a> smart constructor.
data Template
Template' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Template

-- | Create a value of <a>Template</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Template'</a>, <a>template_name</a> - The name of the
--   message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must
--   match the name of an existing message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:Template'</a>, <a>template_version</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the version of the message template to use for the
--   message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an
--   existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version
--   identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for this property, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   the <i>active version</i> of the template. The <i>active version</i>
--   is typically the version of a template that's been most recently
--   reviewed and approved for use, depending on your workflow. It isn't
--   necessarily the latest version of a template.
newTemplate :: Template

-- | Specifies which version of a message template to use as the active
--   version of the template.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemplateActiveVersionRequest</a> smart constructor.
data TemplateActiveVersionRequest
TemplateActiveVersionRequest' :: Maybe Text -> TemplateActiveVersionRequest

-- | Create a value of <a>TemplateActiveVersionRequest</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:TemplateActiveVersionRequest'</a>,
--   <a>templateActiveVersionRequest_version</a> - The version of the
--   message template to use as the active version of the template. Valid
--   values are: latest, for the most recent version of the template; or,
--   the unique identifier for any existing version of the template. If you
--   specify an identifier, the value must match the identifier for an
--   existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version
--   identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.
newTemplateActiveVersionRequest :: TemplateActiveVersionRequest

-- | Specifies the message template to use for the message, for each type
--   of channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemplateConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data TemplateConfiguration
TemplateConfiguration' :: Maybe Template -> Maybe Template -> Maybe Template -> Maybe Template -> TemplateConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>TemplateConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sMSTemplate:TemplateConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>templateConfiguration_sMSTemplate</a> - The SMS template to use for
--   the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:voiceTemplate:TemplateConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>templateConfiguration_voiceTemplate</a> - The voice template to use
--   for the message. This object isn't supported for campaigns.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pushTemplate:TemplateConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>templateConfiguration_pushTemplate</a> - The push notification
--   template to use for the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailTemplate:TemplateConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>templateConfiguration_emailTemplate</a> - The email template to use
--   for the message.
newTemplateConfiguration :: TemplateConfiguration

-- | Provides information about a message template that's associated with
--   your Amazon Pinpoint account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemplateResponse</a> smart constructor.
data TemplateResponse
TemplateResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> TemplateResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>TemplateResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:TemplateResponse'</a>, <a>templateResponse_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the message template. This value isn't
--   included in a TemplateResponse object. To retrieve the ARN of a
--   template, use the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate,
--   or GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that
--   you want to retrieve the ARN for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:TemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateResponse_templateDescription</a> - The custom description
--   of the message template. This value isn't included in a
--   TemplateResponse object. To retrieve the description of a template,
--   use the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate, or
--   GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that you
--   want to retrieve the description for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubstitutions:TemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateResponse_defaultSubstitutions</a> - The JSON object that
--   specifies the default values that are used for message variables in
--   the message template. This object isn't included in a TemplateResponse
--   object. To retrieve this object for a template, use the
--   GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate, or GetVoiceTemplate
--   operation, depending on the type of template that you want to retrieve
--   the object for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:TemplateResponse'</a>, <a>templateResponse_version</a>
--   - The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the
--   message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:TemplateResponse'</a>, <a>templateResponse_tags</a> - A
--   map of key-value pairs that identifies the tags that are associated
--   with the message template. This object isn't included in a
--   TemplateResponse object. To retrieve this object for a template, use
--   the GetEmailTemplate, GetPushTemplate, GetSmsTemplate, or
--   GetVoiceTemplate operation, depending on the type of template that you
--   want to retrieve the object for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:TemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the message template was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:TemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601 format,
--   when the message template was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:TemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateResponse_templateName</a> - The name of the message
--   template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateType:TemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>templateResponse_templateType</a> - The type of channel that the
--   message template is designed for. Possible values are: EMAIL, PUSH,
--   SMS, and VOICE.
newTemplateResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> TemplateResponse

-- | Specifies Amazon Pinpoint configuration settings for retrieving and
--   processing recommendation data from a recommender model.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateRecommenderConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateRecommenderConfiguration
UpdateRecommenderConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Text -> Text -> UpdateRecommenderConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateRecommenderConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationTransformerUri:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationTransformerUri</a> -
--   The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function to
--   invoke for additional processing of recommendation data that's
--   retrieved from the recommender model.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationsDisplayName:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationsDisplayName</a> - A
--   custom display name for the standard endpoint or user attribute
--   (RecommendationItems) that temporarily stores recommended items for
--   each endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This value is required if the
--   configuration doesn't invoke an AWS Lambda function
--   (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data.
--   
--   This name appears in the <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template
--   editor on the Amazon Pinpoint console. The name can contain up to 25
--   characters. The characters can be letters, numbers, spaces,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-). These restrictions don't apply to
--   attribute values.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationProviderIdType:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationProviderIdType</a> -
--   The type of Amazon Pinpoint ID to associate with unique user IDs in
--   the recommender model. This value enables the model to use attribute
--   and event data that’s specific to a particular endpoint or user in an
--   Amazon Pinpoint application. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PINPOINT_ENDPOINT_ID - Associate each user in the model with a
--   particular endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is correlated based
--   on endpoint IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. This is the default value.</li>
--   <li>PINPOINT_USER_ID - Associate each user in the model with a
--   particular user and endpoint in Amazon Pinpoint. The data is
--   correlated based on user IDs in Amazon Pinpoint. If you specify this
--   value, an endpoint definition in Amazon Pinpoint has to specify both a
--   user ID (UserId) and an endpoint ID. Otherwise, messages won’t be sent
--   to the user's endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_attributes</a> - A map of key-value
--   pairs that defines 1-10 custom endpoint or user attributes, depending
--   on the value for the RecommendationProviderIdType property. Each of
--   these attributes temporarily stores a recommended item that's
--   retrieved from the recommender model and sent to an AWS Lambda
--   function for additional processing. Each attribute can be used as a
--   message variable in a message template.
--   
--   In the map, the key is the name of a custom attribute and the value is
--   a custom display name for that attribute. The display name appears in
--   the <b>Attribute finder</b> of the template editor on the Amazon
--   Pinpoint console. The following restrictions apply to these names:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>An attribute name must start with a letter or number and it can
--   contain up to 50 characters. The characters can be letters, numbers,
--   underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Attribute names are case sensitive
--   and must be unique.</li>
--   <li>An attribute display name must start with a letter or number and
--   it can contain up to 25 characters. The characters can be letters,
--   numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This object is required if the configuration invokes an AWS Lambda
--   function (RecommendationTransformerUri) to process recommendation
--   data. Otherwise, don't include this object in your request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_name</a> - A custom name of the
--   configuration for the recommender model. The name must start with a
--   letter or number and it can contain up to 128 characters. The
--   characters can be letters, numbers, spaces, underscores (_), or
--   hyphens (-).
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_description</a> - A custom
--   description of the configuration for the recommender model. The
--   description can contain up to 128 characters. The characters can be
--   letters, numbers, spaces, or the following symbols: _ ; () , ‐.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationsPerMessage:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationsPerMessage</a> - The
--   number of recommended items to retrieve from the model for each
--   endpoint or user, depending on the value for the
--   RecommendationProviderIdType property. This number determines how many
--   recommended items are available for use in message variables. The
--   minimum value is 1. The maximum value is 5. The default value is 5.
--   
--   To use multiple recommended items and custom attributes with message
--   variables, you have to use an AWS Lambda function
--   (RecommendationTransformerUri) to perform additional processing of
--   recommendation data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationProviderUri:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationProviderUri</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender model to retrieve
--   recommendation data from. This value must match the ARN of an Amazon
--   Personalize campaign.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationProviderRoleArn:UpdateRecommenderConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecommenderConfiguration_recommendationProviderRoleArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to retrieve
--   recommendation data from the recommender model.
newUpdateRecommenderConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> UpdateRecommenderConfiguration

-- | Specifies the settings for a one-time voice message that's sent
--   directly to an endpoint through the voice channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVoiceMessage</a> smart constructor.
data VoiceMessage
VoiceMessage' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> VoiceMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>VoiceMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:substitutions:VoiceMessage'</a>,
--   <a>voiceMessage_substitutions</a> - The default message variables to
--   use in the voice message. You can override the default variables with
--   individual address variables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:VoiceMessage'</a>,
--   <a>voiceMessage_languageCode</a> - The code for the language to use
--   when synthesizing the text of the message script. For a list of
--   supported languages and the code for each one, see the <a>Amazon Polly
--   Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:originationNumber:VoiceMessage'</a>,
--   <a>voiceMessage_originationNumber</a> - The long code to send the
--   voice message from. This value should be one of the dedicated long
--   codes that's assigned to your AWS account. Although it isn't required,
--   we recommend that you specify the long code in E.164 format, for
--   example +12065550100, to ensure prompt and accurate delivery of the
--   message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:VoiceMessage'</a>, <a>voiceMessage_body</a> - The text of
--   the script to use for the voice message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:voiceId:VoiceMessage'</a>, <a>voiceMessage_voiceId</a> - The
--   name of the voice to use when delivering the message. For a list of
--   supported voices, see the <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
newVoiceMessage :: VoiceMessage

--   used in messages that are sent through the voice channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVoiceTemplateRequest</a> smart constructor.
data VoiceTemplateRequest
VoiceTemplateRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> VoiceTemplateRequest

-- | Create a value of <a>VoiceTemplateRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:VoiceTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateRequest_languageCode</a> - The code for the language
--   to use when synthesizing the text of the script in messages that are
--   based on the message template. For a list of supported languages and
--   the code for each one, see the <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:VoiceTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateRequest_body</a> - The text of the script to use in
--   messages that are based on the message template, in plain text format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:VoiceTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateRequest_templateDescription</a> - A custom description
--   of the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubstitutions:VoiceTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateRequest_defaultSubstitutions</a> - A JSON object that
--   specifies the default values to use for message variables in the
--   message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key
--   defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding value
--   defines the default value for that variable. When you create a message
--   that's based on the template, you can override these defaults with
--   message-specific and address-specific variables and values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:voiceId:VoiceTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateRequest_voiceId</a> - The name of the voice to use
--   when delivering messages that are based on the message template. For a
--   list of supported voices, see the <a>Amazon Polly Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:VoiceTemplateRequest'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateRequest_tags</a> - A string-to-string map of key-value
--   pairs that defines the tags to associate with the message template.
--   Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.
newVoiceTemplateRequest :: VoiceTemplateRequest

-- | Provides information about the content and settings for a message
--   template that can be used in messages that are sent through the voice
--   channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVoiceTemplateResponse</a> smart constructor.
data VoiceTemplateResponse
VoiceTemplateResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> VoiceTemplateResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>VoiceTemplateResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_languageCode</a> - The code for the language
--   that's used when synthesizing the text of the script in messages that
--   are based on the message template. For a list of supported languages
--   and the code for each one, see the <a>Amazon Polly Developer
--   Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_body</a> - The text of the script that's used
--   in messages that are based on the message template, in plain text
--   format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_templateDescription</a> - The custom
--   description of the message template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubstitutions:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_defaultSubstitutions</a> - The JSON object
--   that specifies the default values that are used for message variables
--   in the message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each
--   key defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding
--   value defines the default value for that variable.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_version</a> - The unique identifier, as an
--   integer, for the active version of the message template, or the
--   version of the template that you specified by using the version
--   parameter in your request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:voiceId:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_voiceId</a> - The name of the voice that's
--   used when delivering messages that are based on the message template.
--   For a list of supported voices, see the <a>Amazon Polly Developer
--   Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_tags</a> - A string-to-string map of
--   key-value pairs that identifies the tags that are associated with the
--   message template. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an
--   associated tag value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the message template was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_creationDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the message template was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_templateName</a> - The name of the message
--   template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateType:VoiceTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>voiceTemplateResponse_templateType</a> - The type of channel that
--   the message template is designed for. For a voice template, this value
--   is VOICE.
newVoiceTemplateResponse :: Text -> Text -> Text -> TemplateType -> VoiceTemplateResponse

-- | Specifies the settings for a wait activity in a journey. This type of
--   activity waits for a certain amount of time or until a specific date
--   and time before moving participants to the next activity in a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWaitActivity</a> smart constructor.
data WaitActivity
WaitActivity' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe WaitTime -> WaitActivity

-- | Create a value of <a>WaitActivity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextActivity:WaitActivity'</a>,
--   <a>waitActivity_nextActivity</a> - The unique identifier for the next
--   activity to perform, after performing the wait activity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:waitTime:WaitActivity'</a>, <a>waitActivity_waitTime</a> - The
--   amount of time to wait or the date and time when the activity moves
--   participants to the next activity in the journey.
newWaitActivity :: WaitActivity

-- | Specifies a duration or a date and time that indicates when Amazon
--   Pinpoint determines whether an activity's conditions have been met or
--   an activity moves participants to the next activity in a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWaitTime</a> smart constructor.
data WaitTime
WaitTime' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> WaitTime

-- | Create a value of <a>WaitTime</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:waitFor:WaitTime'</a>, <a>waitTime_waitFor</a> - The amount of
--   time to wait, as a duration in ISO 8601 format, before determining
--   whether the activity's conditions have been met or moving participants
--   to the next activity in the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:waitUntil:WaitTime'</a>, <a>waitTime_waitUntil</a> - The date
--   and time, in ISO 8601 format, when Amazon Pinpoint determines whether
--   the activity's conditions have been met or the activity moves
--   participants to the next activity in the journey.
newWaitTime :: WaitTime

-- | Specifies the default settings for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWriteApplicationSettingsRequest</a> smart
--   constructor.
data WriteApplicationSettingsRequest
WriteApplicationSettingsRequest' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe CampaignLimits -> Maybe QuietTime -> Maybe CampaignHook -> WriteApplicationSettingsRequest

-- | Create a value of <a>WriteApplicationSettingsRequest</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTaggingEnabled:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeApplicationSettingsRequest_eventTaggingEnabled</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchMetricsEnabled:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeApplicationSettingsRequest_cloudWatchMetricsEnabled</a> -
--   Specifies whether to enable application-related alarms in Amazon
--   CloudWatch.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limits:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeApplicationSettingsRequest_limits</a> - The default sending
--   limits for campaigns in the application. To override these limits and
--   define custom limits for a specific campaign or journey, use the
--   Campaign resource or the Journey resource, respectively.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quietTime:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeApplicationSettingsRequest_quietTime</a> - The default quiet
--   time for campaigns in the application. Quiet time is a specific time
--   range when messages aren't sent to endpoints, if all the following
--   conditions are met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set
--   to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   <li>The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   application (or a campaign or journey that has custom quiet time
--   settings).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the endpoint will
--   receive messages from a campaign or journey, even if quiet time is
--   enabled.
--   
--   To override the default quiet time settings for a specific campaign or
--   journey, use the Campaign resource or the Journey resource to define a
--   custom quiet time for the campaign or journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:campaignHook:WriteApplicationSettingsRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeApplicationSettingsRequest_campaignHook</a> - The settings for
--   the AWS Lambda function to invoke by default as a code hook for
--   campaigns in the application. You can use this hook to customize
--   segments that are used by campaigns in the application.
--   
--   To override these settings and define custom settings for a specific
--   campaign, use the CampaignHook object of the Campaign resource.
newWriteApplicationSettingsRequest :: WriteApplicationSettingsRequest

-- | Specifies the configuration and other settings for a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWriteCampaignRequest</a> smart constructor.
data WriteCampaignRequest
WriteCampaignRequest' :: Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Schedule -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration -> Maybe CampaignHook -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CampaignLimits -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MessageConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [WriteTreatmentResource] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Int -> WriteCampaignRequest

-- | Create a value of <a>WriteCampaignRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:customDeliveryConfiguration:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_customDeliveryConfiguration</a> - The delivery
--   configuration settings for sending the campaign through a custom
--   channel. This object is required if the MessageConfiguration object
--   for the campaign specifies a CustomMessage object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:priority:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_priority</a> - Defines the priority of the
--   campaign, used to decide the order of messages displayed to user if
--   there are multiple messages scheduled to be displayed at the same
--   moment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schedule:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_schedule</a> - The schedule settings for the
--   campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateConfiguration:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_templateConfiguration</a> - The message
--   template to use for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hook:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_hook</a> - The settings for the AWS Lambda
--   function to invoke as a code hook for the campaign. You can use this
--   hook to customize the segment that's used by the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatmentName:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_treatmentName</a> - A custom name of the
--   default treatment for the campaign, if the campaign has multiple
--   treatments. A <i>treatment</i> is a variation of a campaign that's
--   used for A/B testing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limits:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_limits</a> - The messaging limits for the
--   campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isPaused:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_isPaused</a> - Specifies whether to pause the
--   campaign. A paused campaign doesn't run unless you resume it by
--   changing this value to false.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_name</a> - A custom name for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:holdoutPercent:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_holdoutPercent</a> - The allocated percentage
--   of users (segment members) who shouldn't receive messages from the
--   campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatmentDescription:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_treatmentDescription</a> - A custom
--   description of the default treatment for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfiguration:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_messageConfiguration</a> - The message
--   configuration settings for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_description</a> - A custom description of the
--   campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentId:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_segmentId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   segment to associate with the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalTreatments:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_additionalTreatments</a> - An array of
--   requests that defines additional treatments for the campaign, in
--   addition to the default treatment for the campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_tags</a> - A string-to-string map of key-value
--   pairs that defines the tags to associate with the campaign. Each tag
--   consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:segmentVersion:WriteCampaignRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeCampaignRequest_segmentVersion</a> - The version of the
--   segment to associate with the campaign.
newWriteCampaignRequest :: WriteCampaignRequest

-- | Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an event stream to publish

data WriteEventStream

-- | Create a value of <a>WriteEventStream</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>$sel:roleArn:WriteEventStream'</a>, <a>writeEventStream_roleArn</a>

--   Amazon Pinpoint to publish event data to the stream in your AWS
--   account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationStreamArn:WriteEventStream'</a>,
--   <a>writeEventStream_destinationStreamArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis data stream or Amazon Kinesis Data
--   Firehose delivery stream that you want to publish event data to.
--   
--   For a Kinesis data stream, the ARN format is:
--   arn:aws:kinesis:region:account-id:stream/stream_name
--   
--   For a Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream, the ARN format is:
--   arn:aws:firehose:region:account-id:deliverystream/stream_name
newWriteEventStream :: Text -> Text -> WriteEventStream

-- | Specifies the configuration and other settings for a journey.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWriteJourneyRequest</a> smart constructor.
data WriteJourneyRequest
WriteJourneyRequest' :: Maybe State -> Maybe Text -> Maybe JourneySchedule -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe (HashMap Text Activity) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe JourneyLimits -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe QuietTime -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StartCondition -> Maybe Text -> Text -> WriteJourneyRequest

-- | Create a value of <a>WriteJourneyRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_state</a> - The status of the journey. Valid
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DRAFT - Saves the journey and doesn't publish it.</li>
--   <li>ACTIVE - Saves and publishes the journey. Depending on the
--   journey's schedule, the journey starts running immediately or at the
--   scheduled start time. If a journey's status is ACTIVE, you can't add,
--   change, or remove activities from it.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   PAUSED, CANCELLED, COMPLETED, and CLOSED states are not supported in
--   requests to create or update a journey. To cancel, pause, or resume a
--   journey, use the Journey State resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the journey was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schedule:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_schedule</a> - The schedule settings for the
--   journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:localTime:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_localTime</a> - Specifies whether the journey's
--   scheduled start and end times use each participant's local time. To
--   base the schedule on each participant's local time, set this value to
--   true.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activities:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_activities</a> - A map that contains a set of
--   Activity objects, one object for each activity in the journey. For
--   each Activity object, the key is the unique identifier (string) for an
--   activity and the value is the settings for the activity. An activity
--   identifier can contain a maximum of 100 characters. The characters
--   must be alphanumeric characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:refreshOnSegmentUpdate:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_refreshOnSegmentUpdate</a> - Specifies whether
--   a journey should be refreshed on segment update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limits:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_limits</a> - The messaging and entry limits for
--   the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:waitForQuietTime:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_waitForQuietTime</a> - Specifies whether
--   endpoints in quiet hours should enter a wait till the end of their
--   quiet hours.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quietTime:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_quietTime</a> - The quiet time settings for the
--   journey. Quiet time is a specific time range when a journey doesn't
--   send messages to participants, if all the following conditions are
--   met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint for the
--   participant is set to a valid value.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the participant's time zone is later than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the
--   journey.</li>
--   <li>The current time in the participant's time zone is earlier than or
--   equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the
--   journey.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If any of the preceding conditions isn't met, the participant will
--   receive messages from the journey, even if quiet time is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startActivity:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_startActivity</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the first activity in the journey. The identifier for this activity
--   can contain a maximum of 128 characters. The characters must be
--   alphanumeric characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_creationDate</a> - The date, in ISO 8601
--   format, when the journey was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startCondition:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_startCondition</a> - The segment that defines
--   which users are participants in the journey.
--   
--   <a>$sel:refreshFrequency:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>,
--   <a>writeJourneyRequest_refreshFrequency</a> - The frequency with which
--   Amazon Pinpoint evaluates segment and event data for the journey, as a
--   duration in ISO 8601 format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:WriteJourneyRequest'</a>, <a>writeJourneyRequest_name</a>
--   - The name of the journey. A journey name can contain a maximum of 150
--   characters. The characters can be alphanumeric characters or symbols,
--   such as underscores (_) or hyphens (-). A journey name can't contain
--   any spaces.
newWriteJourneyRequest :: Text -> WriteJourneyRequest

-- | Specifies the configuration, dimension, and other settings for a
--   segment. A WriteSegmentRequest object can include a Dimensions object
--   or a SegmentGroups object, but not both.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWriteSegmentRequest</a> smart constructor.
data WriteSegmentRequest

--   and the dimensions to apply to the group's base segments in order to
--   build the segment. A segment group can consist of zero or more base
--   segments. Your request can include only one segment group.

--   associate with the segment. Each tag consists of a required tag key
--   and an associated tag value.
newWriteSegmentRequest :: WriteSegmentRequest

-- | Specifies the settings for a campaign treatment. A <i>treatment</i> is
--   a variation of a campaign that's used for A/B testing of a campaign.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWriteTreatmentResource</a> smart constructor.
data WriteTreatmentResource
WriteTreatmentResource' :: Maybe CustomDeliveryConfiguration -> Maybe Schedule -> Maybe TemplateConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MessageConfiguration -> Int -> WriteTreatmentResource

-- | Create a value of <a>WriteTreatmentResource</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:customDeliveryConfiguration:WriteTreatmentResource'</a>,
--   <a>writeTreatmentResource_customDeliveryConfiguration</a> - The
--   delivery configuration settings for sending the treatment through a
--   custom channel. This object is required if the MessageConfiguration
--   object for the treatment specifies a CustomMessage object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schedule:WriteTreatmentResource'</a>,
--   <a>writeTreatmentResource_schedule</a> - The schedule settings for the
--   treatment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateConfiguration:WriteTreatmentResource'</a>,
--   <a>writeTreatmentResource_templateConfiguration</a> - The message
--   template to use for the treatment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatmentName:WriteTreatmentResource'</a>,
--   <a>writeTreatmentResource_treatmentName</a> - A custom name for the
--   treatment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatmentDescription:WriteTreatmentResource'</a>,
--   <a>writeTreatmentResource_treatmentDescription</a> - A custom
--   description of the treatment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageConfiguration:WriteTreatmentResource'</a>,
--   <a>writeTreatmentResource_messageConfiguration</a> - The message
--   configuration settings for the treatment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizePercent:WriteTreatmentResource'</a>,
--   <a>writeTreatmentResource_sizePercent</a> - The allocated percentage
--   of users (segment members) to send the treatment to.
newWriteTreatmentResource :: Int -> WriteTreatmentResource
